verses.transliteration: Lākini al-rāsikhūna fī al-ʿilmi minhum wa al-muʾminūna yuʾminūna bi-mā unzila ilayka wa mā unzila min qablika, wa al-muqīmīna al-ṣalāh, wa al-muʾtūna al-zakāh wa al-muʾminūna bi-allāhi wa al-yawmi al-ākhiri ulāʾika sanuʾtīhim ajran ʿaẓīmā.

verses.eng: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
verses.arabic: إِنَّا أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ كَمَا أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ نُوحٍ وَالنَّبِيِّينَ مِن بَعْدِهِ ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَالْأَسْبَاطِ وَعِيسَىٰ وَأَيُّوبَ وَيُونُسَ وَهَارُونَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ ۚ وَآتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ زَبُورًا
verses.transliteration: Innā awḥaynā ilayka kamā awḥaynā ilā nūḥin wa al-nabiyyīna min baʿdih, wa awḥaynā ilā ibrāhīma wa ismāʿīla wa isḥāqa wa yaʿqūba wa al-asbāṭi wa ʿīsā wa ayyūba wa yūnusa wa hārūna wa sulaymān, wa ātaynā dāwūda zabūrā.

verses.eng: And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.
verses.arabic: وَرُسُلًا قَدْ قَصَصْنَاهُمْ عَلَيْكَ مِن قَبْلُ وَرُسُلًا لَّمْ نَقْصُصْهُمْ عَلَيْكَ ۚ وَكَلَّمَ اللَّهُ مُوسَىٰ تَكْلِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Wa rusulan qad qaṣaṣnāhum ʿalayka min qablu wa rusulan lam naqṣuṣʿhum ʿalayka, wa kallama allāhu mūsā taklīmā.

verses.eng: [We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: رُّسُلًا مُّبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ لِئَلَّا يَكُونَ لِلنَّاسِ عَلَى اللَّهِ حُجَّةٌ بَعْدَ الرُّسُلِ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Rusulan mubashirīna wa mundhirīna li-allā yakūna lil-nāsi ʿalā allāhi ḥujjatun baʿda al-rusul, wa kāna allāhu ʿazīzan ḥakīmā.

verses.eng: But Allah bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
verses.arabic: لَٰكِنِ اللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ بِمَا أَنزَلَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ أَنزَلَهُ بِعِلْمِهِ ۖ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ يَشْهَدُونَ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا
verses.transliteration: Lākini allāhu yashhadu bi-mā anzala ilayka, anzalahu bi-ʿilmih, wa al-malāʾikatu yashhadūn, wa kafā bi-allāhi shahīdā.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوا عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ قَدْ ضَلُّوا ضَلَالًا بَعِيدًا
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna kafarū wa ṣaddū ʿan sabīli allāhi qad ḍallū ḍalālan baʿīdā.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَظَلَمُوا لَمْ يَكُنِ اللَّهُ لِيَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ وَلَا لِيَهْدِيَهُمْ طَرِيقًا
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna kafarū wa ẓalamū lam yakuni allāhu li-yaghfira lahum wa lā li-yahdiyahum ṭarīqā.

verses.eng: Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا طَرِيقَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۚ وَكَانَ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Illā ṭarīqa jahannama khālidīna fīhā abadā, wa kāna dhālika ʿalā allāhi yasīrā.

verses.eng: O mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe; it is better for you. But if you disbelieve - then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ قَدْ جَاءَكُمُ الرَّسُولُ بِالْحَقِّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ فَآمِنُوا خَيْرًا لَّكُمْ ۚ وَإِن تَكْفُرُوا فَإِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā al-nāsu qad jāʾakumu al-rasūlu bi-al-ḥaqqi min rabbikum fa āminū khayran lakum, wa in takfurū fa inna lillāhi mā fī al-samāwāti wa al-arḍ, wa kāna allāhu ʿalīman ḥakīmā.

verses.eng: O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul [created at a command] from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
verses.arabic: يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لَا تَغْلُوا فِي دِينِكُمْ وَلَا تَقُولُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْحَقَّ ۚ إِنَّمَا الْمَسِيحُ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ وَكَلِمَتُهُ أَلْقَاهَا إِلَىٰ مَرْيَمَ وَرُوحٌ مِّنْهُ ۖ فَآمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ ۖ وَلَا تَقُولُوا ثَلَاثَةٌ ۚ انتَهُوا خَيْرًا لَّكُمْ ۚ إِنَّمَا اللَّهُ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ ۖ سُبْحَانَهُ أَن يَكُونَ لَهُ وَلَدٌ ۘ لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ وَكِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Yā ahla al-kitābi lā taghlū fī dīnikum wa lā taqūlū ʿalā allāhi illā al-ḥaqq, innamā al-masīḥu ʿīsā ib'nu maryama rasūlu allāhi wa kalimatuhū alqāhā ilā maryama wa rūḥun minhu, fa āminū bi-allāhi wa rusulih, wa lā taqūlū thalāthah, intahū khayran lakum, innamā allāhu ilāhun wāḥid, subḥānahu an yakūna lahu walad, lahu mā fī al-samāwāti wa mā fī al-arḍ, wa kafā bi-allāhi wakīlā.

verses.eng: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor would the angels near [to Him]. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.
verses.arabic: لَّن يَسْتَنكِفَ الْمَسِيحُ أَن يَكُونَ عَبْدًا لِّلَّهِ وَلَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَسْتَنكِفْ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِ وَيَسْتَكْبِرْ فَسَيَحْشُرُهُمْ إِلَيْهِ جَمِيعًا
verses.transliteration: Lan yastankifa al-masīḥu an yakūna ʿabdan lillāhi wa lā al-malāʾikatu al-muqarrabūn, wa man yastankif ʿan ʿibādatihī wa yastakbir fa sa-yaḥshuruhum ilayhi jamīʿā.

verses.eng: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who disdained and were arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَيُوَفِّيهِمْ أُجُورَهُمْ وَيَزِيدُهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِ ۖ وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ اسْتَنكَفُوا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا فَيُعَذِّبُهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا وَلَا يَجِدُونَ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَلِيًّا وَلَا نَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Fa ammā alladhīna āmanū wa ʿamilū al-ṣāliḥāti fa yuwaffīhim ujūrahum wa yazīduhum min faḍlih, wa ammā alladhīna istankafū wa istakbarū fa yuʿadhdhibuhum ʿadhāban alīmā, wa lā yajidūna lahum min dūni allāhi waliyyan wa lā naṣīrā.

verses.eng: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ قَدْ جَاءَكُم بُرْهَانٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَأَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ نُورًا مُّبِينًا
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā al-nāsu qad jāʾakum bur'hānun min rabbikum wa anzalnā ilaykum nūran mubīnā.

verses.eng: So those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him - He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path.
verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَاعْتَصَمُوا بِهِ فَسَيُدْخِلُهُمْ فِي رَحْمَةٍ مِّنْهُ وَفَضْلٍ وَيَهْدِيهِمْ إِلَيْهِ صِرَاطًا مُّسْتَقِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Fa ammā alladhīna āmanū bi-allāhi wa iʿtaṣamū bihī fa sa-yud'khiluhum fī raḥmatin minhu wa faḍlin wa yahdīhim ilayhi ṣirāṭan mustaqīmā.

verses.eng: They request from you a [legal] ruling. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]. If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child. But if there are two sisters [or more], they will have two-thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females. Allah makes clear to you [His law], lest you go astray. And Allah is Knowing of all things."
verses.arabic: يَسْتَفْتُونَكَ قُلِ اللَّهُ يُفْتِيكُمْ فِي الْكَلَالَةِ ۚ إِنِ امْرُؤٌ هَلَكَ لَيْسَ لَهُ وَلَدٌ وَلَهُ أُخْتٌ فَلَهَا نِصْفُ مَا تَرَكَ ۚ وَهُوَ يَرِثُهَا إِن لَّمْ يَكُن لَّهَا وَلَدٌ ۚ فَإِن كَانَتَا اثْنَتَيْنِ فَلَهُمَا الثُّلُثَانِ مِمَّا تَرَكَ ۚ وَإِن كَانُوا إِخْوَةً رِّجَالًا وَنِسَاءً فَلِلذَّكَرِ مِثْلُ حَظِّ الْأُنثَيَيْنِ ۗ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ أَن تَضِلُّوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yastaftūnaka quli allāhu yuftīkum fī al-kalālati, ini im'ru'un halaka laysa lahu waladun wa lahu ukhtun fa lahā niṣfu mā tarak, wa huwa yarithuhā in lam yakun lahā walad, fa in kānatā ith'natayni fa lahumā al-thuluthāni mimmā tarak, wa in kānū ikh'watan rijālan wa nisāʾan fa lil-dhakari mith'lu ḥaẓẓi al-unthayayn, yubayyinu allāhu lakum an taḍillū, wa allāhu bikulli shayʾin ʿalīm.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, fulfill [all] contracts. Lawful for you are the animals of grazing livestock except for that which is recited to you [in this Qur'an] - [being] not permitting the game while you are in the state of ihram. Indeed, Allah ordains what He intends.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَوْفُوا بِالْعُقُودِ ۚ أُحِلَّتْ لَكُم بَهِيمَةُ الْأَنْعَامِ إِلَّا مَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ غَيْرَ مُحِلِّي الصَّيْدِ وَأَنتُمْ حُرُمٌ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحْكُمُ مَا يُرِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū awfū bil-ʿuqūd, uḥillat lakum bahīmatu al-anʿāmi illā mā yutlā ʿalaykum ghayra muḥilli aṣ-ṣaydi wa antum ḥurum, inna Allāha yaḥkumu mā yurīd.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not violate the rites of Allah or [the sanctity of] the sacred month or [neglect the marking of] the sacrificial animals and garlanding [them] or [violate the safety of] those coming to the Sacred House seeking bounty from their Lord and [His] approval. But when you come out of ihram, then [you may] hunt. And do not let the hatred of a people for having obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram lead you to transgress. And cooperate in righteousness and piety, but do not cooperate in sin and aggression. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُحِلُّوا شَعَائِرَ اللَّهِ وَلَا الشَّهْرَ الْحَرَامَ وَلَا الْهَدْيَ وَلَا الْقَلَائِدَ وَلَا آمِّينَ الْبَيْتَ الْحَرَامَ يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَرِضْوَانًا ۚ وَإِذَا حَلَلْتُمْ فَاصْطَادُوا ۚ وَلَا يَجْرِمَنَّكُمْ شَنَآنُ قَوْمٍ أَن صَدُّوكُمْ عَنِ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ أَن تَعْتَدُوا ۘ وَتَعَاوَنُوا عَلَى الْبِرِّ وَالتَّقْوَىٰ ۖ وَلَا تَعَاوَنُوا عَلَى الْإِثْمِ وَالْعُدْوَانِ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tuḥillū shaʿāʾira Allāhi wa lā ash-shahra al-ḥarāma wa lā al-hadya wa lā al-qalāʾida wa lā āmmīna al-bayta al-ḥarāma yabtaghūna faḍlan min rabbihim wa riḍwānā, wa idhā ḥalaltum faṣṭādū, wa lā yajrimannakum shanāʾu qawmin an ṣaddūkum ʿani al-masjidi al-ḥarāmi an taʿtadū, wa taʿāwanū ʿalā al-birri wa at-taqwā, wa lā taʿāwanū ʿalā al-ithmi wa al-ʿudwān, wa attaqū Allāh, inna Allāha shadīdu al-ʿiqāb.

verses.eng: Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah, and [those animals] killed by strangling or by a violent blow or by a head-long fall or by the goring of horns, and those from which a wild animal has eaten, except what you [are able to] slaughter [before its death], and those which are sacrificed on stone altars, and [prohibited is] that you seek decision through divining arrows. That is grave disobedience. This day those who disbelieve have despaired of [defeating] your religion; so fear them not, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. But whoever is forced by severe hunger with no inclination to sin - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: حُرِّمَتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَيْتَةُ وَالدَّمُ وَلَحْمُ الْخِنزِيرِ وَمَا أُهِلَّ لِغَيْرِ اللَّهِ بِهِ وَالْمُنْخَنِقَةُ وَالْمَوْقُوذَةُ وَالْمُتَرَدِّيَةُ وَالنَّطِيحَةُ وَمَا أَكَلَ السَّبُعُ إِلَّا مَا ذَكَّيْتُمْ وَمَا ذُبِحَ عَلَى النُّصُبِ وَأَن تَسْتَقْسِمُوا بِالْأَزْلَامِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ فِسْقٌ ۗ الْيَوْمَ يَئِسَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن دِينِكُمْ فَلَا تَخْشَوْهُمْ وَاخْشَوْنِ ۚ الْيَوْمَ أَكْمَلْتُ لَكُمْ دِينَكُمْ وَأَتْمَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعْمَتِي وَرَضِيتُ لَكُمُ الْإِسْلَامَ دِينًا ۚ فَمَنِ اضْطُرَّ فِي مَخْمَصَةٍ غَيْرَ مُتَجَانِفٍ لِّإِثْمٍ ۙ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ḥurrimat ʿalaykumu al-maytatu wa ad-damu wa laḥmu al-khinzīri wa mā uhilla li-ghayri Allāhi bihi wa al-munkhaniqatu wa al-mawqūdhatu wa al-mutaraddiyatu wa an-naṭīḥatu wa mā akala as-sabuʿu illā mā dhakkaytum wa mā dhubiḥa ʿalā an-nuṣubi wa an tastaqsimū bil-azlām, dhālikum fisq, al-yawma yaʾisa alladhīna kafarū min dīnikum fa lā takhshawhum wa akhshawn, al-yawma akmaltu lakum dīnakum wa atmamtu ʿalaykum niʿmatī wa raḍītu lakumu al-islāma dīnā, fa mani ḍṭurra fī makhmaṣatin ghayra mutajānifin li-ithmin fa inna Allāha ghafūrun raḥīm.

verses.eng: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what has been made lawful for them. Say, "Lawful for you are [all] good foods and [game caught by] what you have trained of hunting animals which you train as Allah has taught you. So eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of Allah upon it, and fear Allah." Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
verses.arabic: يَسْأَلُونَكَ مَاذَا أُحِلَّ لَهُمْ ۖ قُلْ أُحِلَّ لَكُمُ الطَّيِّبَاتُ ۙ وَمَا عَلَّمْتُم مِّنَ الْجَوَارِحِ مُكَلِّبِينَ تُعَلِّمُونَهُنَّ مِمَّا عَلَّمَكُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ فَكُلُوا مِمَّا أَمْسَكْنَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
verses.transliteration: Yasʾalūnaka mādhā uḥilla lahum, qul uḥilla lakumu aṭ-ṭayyibātu wa mā ʿallamtum min al-jawāriḥi mukallibīna tuʿallimūnahunna mimmā ʿallamakumu Allāh, fa kulū mimmā amsakna ʿalaykum wa udhkurū isma Allāhi ʿalayhi wa attaqū Allāh, inna Allāha sarīʿu al-ḥisāb.

verses.eng: This day [all] good foods have been made lawful, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is lawful for you and your food is lawful for them. And [lawful in marriage are] chaste women from among the believers and chaste women from among those who were given the Scripture before you, when you have given them their due compensation, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse or taking [secret] lovers. And whoever denies the faith - his work has become worthless, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
verses.arabic: الْيَوْمَ أُحِلَّ لَكُمُ الطَّيِّبَاتُ ۖ وَطَعَامُ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ حِلٌّ لَّكُمْ وَطَعَامُكُمْ حِلٌّ لَّهُمْ ۖ وَالْمُحْصَنَاتُ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَالْمُحْصَنَاتُ مِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ إِذَا آتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ مُحْصِنِينَ غَيْرَ مُسَافِحِينَ وَلَا مُتَّخِذِي أَخْدَانٍ ۗ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِالْإِيمَانِ فَقَدْ حَبِطَ عَمَلُهُ وَهُوَ فِي الْآخِرَةِ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Al-yawma uḥilla lakumu aṭ-ṭayyibātu, wa ṭaʿāmu alladhīna ūtū al-kitāba ḥillun lakum wa ṭaʿāmukum ḥillun lahum, wa al-muḥṣanātu mina al-muʾmināti wa al-muḥṣanātu mina alladhīna ūtū al-kitāba min qablikum idhā ātaytumūhunna ujūrahunna muḥṣinīna ghayra musāfiḥīna wa lā muttakhidhī akhdān, wa man yakfur bi-al-īmāni fa qad ḥabiṭa ʿamaluhu wa huwa fī al-ākhirati mina al-khāsirīn.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, when you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. Allah does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِذَا قُمْتُمْ إِلَى الصَّلَاةِ فَاغْسِلُوا وُجُوهَكُمْ وَأَيْدِيَكُمْ إِلَى الْمَرَافِقِ وَامْسَحُوا بِرُءُوسِكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ إِلَى الْكَعْبَيْنِ ۚ وَإِن كُنتُمْ جُنُبًا فَاطَّهَّرُوا ۚ وَإِن كُنتُم مَّرْضَىٰ أَوْ عَلَىٰ سَفَرٍ أَوْ جَاءَ أَحَدٌ مِّنكُم مِّنَ الْغَائِطِ أَوْ لَامَسْتُمُ النِّسَاءَ فَلَمْ تَجِدُوا مَاءً فَتَيَمَّمُوا صَعِيدًا طَيِّبًا فَامْسَحُوا بِوُجُوهِكُمْ وَأَيْدِيكُم مِّنْهُ ۚ مَا يُرِيدُ اللَّهُ لِيَجْعَلَ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْ حَرَجٍ وَلَٰكِن يُرِيدُ لِيُطَهِّرَكُمْ وَلِيُتِمَّ نِعْمَتَهُ عَلَيْكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū idhā qumtum ilā aṣ-ṣalāti faghsilū wujūhakum wa aydiyakum ilā al-marāfiqi wa msaḥū bi-ruʾūsikum wa arjulakum ilā al-kaʿbayn, wa in kuntum junuban faṭṭahharū, wa in kuntum marḍā aw ʿalā safarin aw jāʾa aḥadun minkum mina al-ghāʾiṭi aw lāmastumu an-nisāʾa fa lam tajidū māʾan fa tayammamū ṣaʿīdan ṭayyiban fa msaḥū bi-wujūhikum wa aydīkum minhu, mā yurīdu Allāhu li-yajʿala ʿalaykum min ḥarajin wa lākin yurīdu li-yuṭahhirakum wa li-yutimma niʿmatahu ʿalaykum laʿallakum tashkurūn.

verses.eng: And remember the favor of Allah upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, "We hear and we obey"; and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَمِيثَاقَهُ الَّذِي وَاثَقَكُم بِهِ إِذْ قُلْتُمْ سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
verses.transliteration: Wa udhkurū niʿmata Allāhi ʿalaykum wa mīthāqahu alladhī wāthaqakum bihi idh qultum samiʿnā wa aṭaʿnā, wa attaqū Allāh, inna Allāha ʿalīmun bi-dhāti aṣ-ṣudūr.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا كُونُوا قَوَّامِينَ لِلَّهِ شُهَدَاءَ بِالْقِسْطِ ۖ وَلَا يَجْرِمَنَّكُمْ شَنَآنُ قَوْمٍ عَلَىٰ أَلَّا تَعْدِلُوا ۚ اعْدِلُوا هُوَ أَقْرَبُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū kūnū qawwāmīna lillāhi shuhadāʾa bil-qisṭ, wa lā yajrimannakum shanāʾu qawmin ʿalā allā taʿdilū, iʿdilū huwa aqrabu lil-taqwā, wa attaqū Allāh, inna Allāha khabīrun bimā taʿmalūn.

verses.eng: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds [that] for them there is forgiveness and great reward.
verses.arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ ۙ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Waʿada Allāhu alladhīna āmanū wa ʿamilū aṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum maghfiratun wa ajrun ʿaẓīm.

verses.eng: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna kafarū wa kadhdhabū bi-āyātinā ulāʾika aṣḥābu al-jaḥīm.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when a people determined to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ هَمَّ قَوْمٌ أَن يَبْسُطُوا إِلَيْكُمْ أَيْدِيَهُمْ فَكَفَّ أَيْدِيَهُمْ عَنكُمْ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū udhkurū niʿmata Allāhi ʿalaykum idh hamma qawmun an yabsuṭū ilaykum aydiyahum fa kaffa aydiyahum ʿankum, wa attaqū Allāh, wa ʿalā Allāhi fa l-yatawakkali al-muʾminūn.

verses.eng: And Allah had already taken a covenant from the Children of Israel, and We delegated from among them twelve leaders. And Allah said, "I am with you. If you establish prayer and give zakah and believe in My messengers and support them and loan Allah a goodly loan, I will surely remove from you your misdeeds and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever of you disbelieves after that has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way."
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذَ اللَّهُ مِيثَاقَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَبَعَثْنَا مِنْهُمُ اثْنَيْ عَشَرَ نَقِيبًا ۖ وَقَالَ اللَّهُ إِنِّي مَعَكُمْ ۖ لَئِنْ أَقَمْتُمُ الصَّلَاةَ وَآتَيْتُمُ الزَّكَاةَ وَآمَنتُم بِرُسُلِي وَعَزَّرْتُمُوهُمْ وَأَقْرَضْتُمُ اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا لَّأُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنكُمْ سَيِّئَاتِكُمْ وَلَأُدْخِلَنَّكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ فَمَن كَفَرَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ مِنكُمْ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ سَوَاءَ السَّبِيلِ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad akhadha Allāhu mīthāqa banī isrāʾīla wa baʿathnā minhum ithnay ʿashara naqībā, wa qāla Allāhu innī maʿakum, la-in aqamtumu aṣ-ṣalāta wa ātaytumu az-zakāta wa āmantum bi-rusulī wa ʿazzartumūhum wa aqraḍtumu Allāha qarḍan ḥasanan la-ukaffiranna ʿankum sayyiʾātikum wa la-udkhilannakum jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā al-anhār, fa man kafara baʿda dhālika minkum fa qad ḍalla sawāʾa as-sabīl.

verses.eng: So for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. But pardon them and overlook [their misdeeds]. Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
verses.arabic: فَبِمَا نَقْضِهِم مِّيثَاقَهُمْ لَعَنَّاهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَا قُلُوبَهُمْ قَاسِيَةً ۖ يُحَرِّفُونَ الْكَلِمَ عَن مَّوَاضِعِهِ ۙ وَنَسُوا حَظًّا مِّمَّا ذُكِّرُوا بِهِ ۚ وَلَا تَزَالُ تَطَّلِعُ عَلَىٰ خَائِنَةٍ مِّنْهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّنْهُمْ ۖ فَاعْفُ عَنْهُمْ وَاصْفَحْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa bi-mā naqḍihim mīthāqahum laʿannāhum wa jaʿalnā qulūbahum qāsiyah, yuḥarrifūna al-kalima ʿan mawāḍiʿih, wa nasū ḥaẓẓan mimmā dhukkirū bih, wa lā tazālu taṭṭaliʿu ʿalā khāʾinatin minhum illā qalīlan minhum, faʿfu ʿanhum wa ṣfaḥ, inna Allāha yuḥibbu al-muḥsinīn.

verses.eng: And from those who say, "We are Christians" We took their covenant; but they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded. So We caused among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. And Allah is going to inform them about what they used to do.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّا نَصَارَىٰ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَاقَهُمْ فَنَسُوا حَظًّا مِّمَّا ذُكِّرُوا بِهِ فَأَغْرَيْنَا بَيْنَهُمُ الْعَدَاوَةَ وَالْبَغْضَاءَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ وَسَوْفَ يُنَبِّئُهُمُ اللَّهُ بِمَا كَانُوا يَصْنَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina alladhīna qālū innā naṣārā akhadhnā mīthāqahum fa nasū ḥaẓẓan mimmā dhukkirū bih, fa aghraynā baynahumu al-ʿadāwata wa al-baghḍāʾa ilā yawmi al-qiyāmah, wa sawfa yunabbiʾuhumu Allāhu bimā kānū yaṣnaʿūn.

verses.eng: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger making clear to you much of what you used to conceal of the Scripture and overlooking much. There has come to you from Allah a light and a clear Book.
verses.arabic: يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ قَدْ جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولُنَا يُبَيِّنُ لَكُمْ كَثِيرًا مِّمَّا كُنتُمْ تُخْفُونَ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ وَيَعْفُو عَن كَثِيرٍ ۚ قَدْ جَاءَكُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ نُورٌ وَكِتَابٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ahla al-kitābi qad jāʾakum rasūlunā yubayyinu lakum kathīran mimmā kuntum tukhfūna mina al-kitābi wa yaʿfū ʿan kathīr, qad jāʾakum mina Allāhi nūrun wa kitābun mubīn.

verses.eng: By which Allah guides those who pursue His pleasure to the ways of peace and brings them out from darknesses into the light, by His permission, and guides them to a straight path.
verses.arabic: يَهْدِي بِهِ اللَّهُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ رِضْوَانَهُ سُبُلَ السَّلَامِ وَيُخْرِجُهُم مِّنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ بِإِذْنِهِ وَيَهْدِيهِمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Yahdī bihi Allāhu mani ittabaʿa riḍwānahu subula as-salāmi wa yukhrijuhum mina aẓ-ẓulumāti ilā an-nūri bi-idh'nih, wa yahdīhim ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm.

verses.eng: They have certainly disbelieved who say that Allah is Christ, the son of Mary. Say, "Then who could prevent Allah at all if He had intended to destroy Christ, the son of Mary, or his mother or everyone on the earth?" And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. He creates what He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: لَّقَدْ كَفَرَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْمَسِيحُ ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ ۚ قُلْ فَمَن يَمْلِكُ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا إِنْ أَرَادَ أَن يُهْلِكَ الْمَسِيحَ ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۚ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Laqad kafara alladhīna qālū inna Allāha huwa al-masīḥu ib'nu maryam, qul fa man yamliku mina Allāhi shayʾan in arāda an yuhlika al-masīḥa ib'na maryama wa ummahu wa man fī al-arḍi jamīʿā, wa lillāhi mulku as-samāwāti wa al-arḍi wa mā baynahumā, yakhluqu mā yashāʾ, wa Allāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīr.

verses.eng: But the Jews and the Christians say, "We are the children of Allah and His beloved." Say, "Then why does He punish you for your sins?" Rather, you are human beings from among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَتِ الْيَهُودُ وَالنَّصَارَىٰ نَحْنُ أَبْنَاءُ اللَّهِ وَأَحِبَّاؤُهُ ۚ قُلْ فَلِمَ يُعَذِّبُكُم بِذُنُوبِكُم ۖ بَلْ أَنتُم بَشَرٌ مِّمَّنْ خَلَقَ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālati al-yahūdu wa an-naṣārā naḥnu abnāʾu Allāhi wa aḥibbāʾuh, qul fa lima yuʿadhdhibukum bi-dhunūbikum, bal antum basharun mimman khalaq, yaghfiru li-man yashāʾu wa yuʿadhdhibu man yashāʾ, wa lillāhi mulku as-samāwāti wa al-arḍi wa mā baynahumā, wa ilayhi al-maṣīr.

verses.eng: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger to make clear to you [the religion] after a period [of suspension] of messengers, lest you say, "There came not to us any bringer of good tidings or a warner." But there has come to you a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And Allah is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ قَدْ جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولُنَا يُبَيِّنُ لَكُمْ عَلَىٰ فَتْرَةٍ مِّنَ الرُّسُلِ أَن تَقُولُوا مَا جَاءَنَا مِن بَشِيرٍ وَلَا نَذِيرٍ ۖ فَقَدْ جَاءَكُم بَشِيرٌ وَنَذِيرٌ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ahla al-kitābi qad jāʾakum rasūlunā yubayyinu lakum ʿalā fatratin mina ar-rusuli an taqūlū mā jāʾanā min bashīrin wa lā nadhīr, fa qad jāʾakum bashīrun wa nadhīr, wa Allāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīr.

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors and gave you that which He had not given anyone among the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ يَا قَوْمِ اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ جَعَلَ فِيكُمْ أَنبِيَاءَ وَجَعَلَكُم مُّلُوكًا وَآتَاكُم مَّا لَمْ يُؤْتِ أَحَدًا مِّنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idh qāla mūsā li-qawmihī yā qawmi udhkurū niʿmata Allāhi ʿalaykum idh jaʿala fīkum anbiyāʾa wa jaʿalakum mulūkan wa ātākum mā lam yuʾti aḥadan mina al-ʿālamīn.

verses.eng: O my people, enter the Holy Land which Allah has assigned to you and do not turn back [from fighting in Allah's cause], for then you will be returned as losers.
verses.arabic: يَا قَوْمِ ادْخُلُوا الْأَرْضَ الْمُقَدَّسَةَ الَّتِي كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ وَلَا تَرْتَدُّوا عَلَىٰ أَدْبَارِكُمْ فَتَنْقَلِبُوا خَاسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā qawmi ud'khulū al-arḍa al-muqaddasata allatī kataba Allāhu lakum walā tartaddū ʿalā adbārikum fatanqalibū khāsirīn

verses.eng: They said, 'O Moses, indeed within it is a people of tyrannical strength, and indeed, we will never enter it until they leave it. But if they leave it, then we will enter.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّ فِيهَا قَوْمًا جَبَّارِينَ وَإِنَّا لَنْ نَدْخُلَهَا حَتَّىٰ يَخْرُجُوا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ يَخْرُجُوا مِنْهَا فَإِنَّا دَاخِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Mūsā inna fīhā qawman jabbārīna wa-innā lan nadkhulahā ḥattā yakhrujū minhā fa-in yakhrujū minhā fa-innā dākhilūn

verses.eng: Said two men from those who feared [to disobey] upon whom Allah had bestowed favor, 'Enter upon them through the gate, for when you have entered it, you will be predominant. And upon Allah rely, if you should be believers.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَجُلَانِ مِنَ الَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمَا ادْخُلُوا عَلَيْهِمُ الْبَابَ فَإِذَا دَخَلْتُمُوهُ فَإِنَّكُمْ غَالِبُونَ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَتَوَكَّلُوا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rajulāni mina alladhīna yakhāfūna anʿama Allāhu ʿalayhimā ud'khulū ʿalayhimu al-bāba fa-idhā dakhaltumūhu fa-innakum ghālibūna ʿalā Allāhi fatawakkalū in kuntum mu'minīn

verses.eng: They said, 'O Moses, indeed we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are within it; so go, you and your Lord, and fight. Indeed, we are remaining right here.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَنْ نَدْخُلَهَا أَبَدًا مَا دَامُوا فِيهَا ۖ فَاذْهَبْ أَنْتَ وَرَبُّكَ فَقَاتِلَا إِنَّا هَاهُنَا قَاعِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Mūsā innā lan nadkhulahā abadan mā dāmū fīhā fadh'hab anta wa-rabbuka faqātilā innā hāhunā qāʿidūn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, 'My Lord, indeed I do not possess [control] except over myself and my brother, so part us from the defiantly disobedient people.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ إِلَّا نَفْسِي وَأَخِي ۖ فَافْرُقْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ الْقَوْمِ الْفَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi innī lā amliku illā nafsī wa-akhī fa-fruq baynanā wa-bayna al-qawmi al-fāsiqīn

verses.eng: Allah said, 'Then indeed, it is forbidden to them for forty years [in which] they will wander throughout the land. So do not grieve over the defiantly disobedient people.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّهَا مُحَرَّمَةٌ عَلَيْهِمْ ۛ أَرْبَعِينَ سَنَةً ۛ يَتِيهُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ فَلَا تَأْسَ عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْفَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa-innahā muḥarramatun ʿalayhim arbaʿīna sanatan yatīhūna fī al-arḍi falā tasa ʿalā al-qawmi al-fāsiqīn

verses.eng: And recite to them the story of Adam's two sons, in truth, when they both offered a sacrifice [to Allah], and it was accepted from one of them but was not accepted from the other. Said [the latter], 'I will surely kill you.' Said [the former], 'Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous [who fear Him].'
verses.arabic: وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ ابْنَيْ آدَمَ بِالْحَقِّ إِذْ قَرَّبَا قُرْبَانًا فَتُقُبِّلَ مِنْ أَحَدِهِمَا وَلَمْ يُتَقَبَّلْ مِنَ الْآخَرِ قَالَ لَأَقْتُلَنَّكَ ۖ قَالَ إِنَّمَا يَتَقَبَّلُ اللَّهُ مِنَ الْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-tlu ʿalayhim naba-a ib'nay Ādama bi-al-ḥaqqi idh qarrabā qurbānan fa-tuqubbila min aḥadihimā wa-lam yutaqabbal min al-ākhar qāla la-aqtulannaka qāla innamā yataqabbalu Allāhu mina al-muttaqīn

verses.eng: If you should raise your hand against me to kill me, I shall not raise my hand against you to kill you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: لَئِنْ بَسَطْتَ إِلَيَّ يَدَكَ لِتَقْتُلَنِي مَا أَنَا بِبَاسِطٍ يَدِيَ إِلَيْكَ لِأَقْتُلَكَ ۖ إِنِّي أَخَافُ اللَّهَ رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: La-in basatta ilayya yadaka li-taqtulanī mā anā bi-bāsiṭin yadiya ilayka li-aqtulaka innī akhāfu Allāha rabba al-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: Indeed I want you to obtain [thereby] my sin and your sin so you will be among the companions of the Fire. And that is the recompense of wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ تَبُوءَ بِإِثْمِي وَإِثْمِكَ فَتَكُونَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ النَّارِ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innī urīdu an tabū'a bi-ithmī wa-ithmika fatakūna min aṣḥābi al-nāri wa-dhālika jazā'u al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: So his soul permitted to him the murder of his brother, and he killed him and became among the losers.
verses.arabic: فَطَوَّعَتْ لَهُ نَفْسُهُ قَتْلَ أَخِيهِ فَقَتَلَهُ فَأَصْبَحَ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faṭawwaʿat lahu nafsuhu qatla akhīhi fa-qatalahu fa-aṣbaḥa mina al-khāsirīn

verses.eng: Then Allah sent a crow searching in the ground to show him how to hide the disgrace of his brother. He said, 'O woe to me! Have I failed to be like this crow and hide the body of my brother?' And he became of the regretful.
verses.arabic: فَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ غُرَابًا يَبْحَثُ فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيُرِيَهُ كَيْفَ يُوَارِي سَوْءَةَ أَخِيهِ ۚ قَالَ يَا وَيْلَتَا أَعَجَزْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِثْلَ هَٰذَا الْغُرَابِ فَأُوَارِيَ سَوْءَةَ أَخِي ۖ فَأَصْبَحَ مِنَ النَّادِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fabaʿatha Allāhu ghurāban yabḥathu fī al-arḍi li-yuriyahu kayfa yuwārī saw'ata akhīhi qāla yā waylatā aʿajaztu an akūna mithla hādhā al-ghurābi fa'uwāriya saw'ata akhī fa-aṣbaḥa mina al-nādimīn

verses.eng: Because of that, We decreed upon the Children of Israel that whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely. And whoever saves one - it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. And Our messengers had certainly come to them with clear proofs. Then indeed many of them, [even] after that, throughout the land, were transgressors.
verses.arabic: مِنْ أَجْلِ ذَٰلِكَ كَتَبْنَا عَلَىٰ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ أَنَّهُ مَنْ قَتَلَ نَفْسًا بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ أَوْ فَسَادٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَتَلَ النَّاسَ جَمِيعًا وَمَنْ أَحْيَاهَا فَكَأَنَّمَا أَحْيَا النَّاسَ جَمِيعًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُنَا بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ ثُمَّ إِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنْهُمْ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فِي الْأَرْضِ لَمُسْرِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Min ajli dhālika katabnā ʿalā banī Isrāīla annahu man qatala nafsan bi-ghayri nafsin aw fasādin fī al-arḍi fa-ka'annamā qatala al-nāsa jamīʿan wa-man aḥyāhā fa-ka'annamā aḥyā al-nāsa jamīʿan wa-la-qad jā'athum rusulunā bi-al-bayyināti thumma inna kathīran minhum baʿda dhālika fī al-arḍi la-mus'rifūn

verses.eng: Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth [to cause] corruption is none but that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the land. That is for them a disgrace in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment,
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَيَسْعَوْنَ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا أَنْ يُقَتَّلُوا أَوْ يُصَلَّبُوا أَوْ تُقَطَّعَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَرْجُلُهُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ أَوْ يُنْفَوْا مِنَ الْأَرْضِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لَهُمْ خِزْيٌ فِي الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Innamā jazā'u alladhīna yuḥāribūna Allāha wa-rasūlahu wa-yasʿawna fī al-arḍi fasādan an yuqattalū aw yuṣallabū aw tuqaṭṭaʿa aydīhim wa-arjuluhum min khilāfin aw yunfaw mina al-arḍi dhālika lahum khizyun fī al-dunyā wa-lahum fī al-ākhirati ʿadhābun ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: Except for those who return [repenting] before you apprehend them. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ تَابُوا مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ تَقْدِرُوا عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ فَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Illā alladhīna tābū min qabli an taqdirū ʿalayhim fa-iʿlamū anna Allāha ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means [of nearness] to Him and strive in His cause that you may succeed.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَابْتَغُوا إِلَيْهِ الْوَسِيلَةَ وَجَاهِدُوا فِي سَبِيلِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū ittaqū Allāha wa-ib'taghū ilayhi al-wasīlata wa-jāhidū fī sabīlihi laʿallakum tufliḥūn

verses.eng: Indeed, those who disbelieve - if they should have all that is in the earth and the like of it with it by which to ransom themselves from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and for them is a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ أَنَّ لَهُمْ مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا وَمِثْلَهُ مَعَهُ لِيَفْتَدُوا بِهِ مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ مَا تُقُبِّلَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna kafarū law anna lahum mā fī al-arḍi jamīʿan wa-mithlahu maʿahu li-yaftadū bihi min ʿadhābi yawmi al-qiyāmati mā tuqubbila minhum wa-lahum ʿadhābun alīm

verses.eng: They will wish to get out of the Fire, but never are they to emerge therefrom, and for them is an enduring punishment.
verses.arabic: يُرِيدُونَ أَنْ يَخْرُجُوا مِنَ النَّارِ وَمَا هُمْ بِخَارِجِينَ مِنْهَا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُقِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yurīdūna an yakhrujū mina al-nāri wa-mā hum bi-khārijīna minhā wa-lahum ʿadhābun muqīm

verses.eng: [As for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands in recompense for what they committed as a deterrent [punishment] from Allah. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَالسَّارِقُ وَالسَّارِقَةُ فَاقْطَعُوا أَيْدِيَهُمَا جَزَاءً بِمَا كَسَبَا نَكَالًا مِنَ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-al-sāriqu wa-al-sāriqatu fa-iq'ṭaʿū aydiyahumā jazā'an bi-mā kasabā nakālan mina Allāhi wa-Allāhu ʿazīzun ḥakīm

verses.eng: But whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, indeed, Allah will turn to him in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: فَمَنْ تَابَ مِنْ بَعْدِ ظُلْمِهِ وَأَصْلَحَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يَتُوبُ عَلَيْهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Faman tāba min baʿdi ẓulmihi wa-aṣlaḥa fa-inna Allāha yatūbu ʿalayhi inna Allāha ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَعْلَمْ أَنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يُعَذِّبُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَغْفِرُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Alam taʿlam anna Allāha lahu mulku al-samāwāti wa-al-arḍi yuʿadhibu man yashā'u wa-yaghfiru liman yashā'u wa-Allāhu ʿalā kulli shay'in qadīr

verses.eng: O Messenger, let them not grieve you who hasten into disbelief of those who say, 'We believe' with their mouths, but their hearts believe not, and from among the Jews - [they are] avid listeners to falsehood, listening to another people who have not come to you. They distort words beyond their [proper] usages, saying, 'If you are given this, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware.' But he for whom Allah intends fitnah - never will you possess [power to do] for him a thing against Allah. Those are the ones for whom Allah does not intend to purify their hearts. For them in this world is disgrace, and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الرَّسُولُ لَا يَحْزُنْكَ الَّذِينَ يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْكُفْرِ مِنَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِأَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَلَمْ تُؤْمِنْ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۛ وَمِنَ الَّذِينَ هَادُوا ۛ سَمَّاعُونَ لِلْكَذِبِ سَمَّاعُونَ لِقَوْمٍ آخَرِينَ لَمْ يَأْتُوكَ ۖ يُحَرِّفُونَ الْكَلِمَ مِنْ بَعْدِ مَوَاضِعِهِ ۖ يَقُولُونَ إِنْ أُوتِيتُمْ هَٰذَا فَخُذُوهُ وَإِنْ لَمْ تُؤْتَوْهُ فَاحْذَرُوا ۚ وَمَنْ يُرِدِ اللَّهُ فِتْنَتَهُ فَلَنْ تَمْلِكَ لَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَمْ يُرِدِ اللَّهُ أَنْ يُطَهِّرَ قُلُوبَهُمْ ۚ لَهُمْ فِي الدُّنْيَا خِزْيٌ ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā al-rasūlu lā yaḥzunka alladhīna yusāriʿūna fī al-kufri mina alladhīna qālū āmannā bi-afwāhihim wa-lam tu'min qulūbuhum wa-mina alladhīna hādū sammāʿūna lil-kadhibi sammāʿūna liqawmin ākharīna lam ya'tūka yuḥarrifūna al-kalima min baʿdi mawāḍiʿihi yaqūlūna in ūtītum hādhā fa-khudhūhu wa-in lam tu'tawhu fa-ḥdharū wa-man yuridi Allāhu fitnatahu fa-lan tamlika lahu mina Allāhi shay'an ulā'ika alladhīna lam yuridi Allāhu an yuṭahhira qulūbahum lahum fī al-dunyā khizyun wa-lahum fī al-ākhirati ʿadhābun ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: [They are] avid listeners to falsehood, devourers of [what is] unlawful. So if they come to you, [O Muhammad], judge between them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them - never will they harm you at all. And if you judge, judge between them with justice. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
verses.arabic: سَمَّاعُونَ لِلْكَذِبِ أَكَّالُونَ لِلسُّحْتِ ۚ فَإِنْ جَاءُوكَ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ أَوْ أَعْرِضْ عَنْهُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُعْرِضْ عَنْهُمْ فَلَنْ يَضُرُّوكَ شَيْئًا ۖ وَإِنْ حَكَمْتَ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ بِالْقِسْطِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُقْسِطِينَ
verses.transliteration: Sammāʿūna lil-kadhibi akkālūna lil-suḥti fa-in jā'ūka fa-ḥkum baynahum aw aʿriḍ ʿanhum wa-in tuʿriḍ ʿanhum fa-lan yaḍurrūka shay'an wa-in ḥakamta fa-ḥkum baynahum bi-al-qisṭi inna Allāha yuḥibbu al-muqsiṭīn

verses.eng: But how is it that they come to you for judgment while they have the Torah, in which is the judgment of Allah? Then they turn away, [even] after that; but those are not [in fact] believers.
verses.arabic: وَكَيْفَ يُحَكِّمُونَكَ وَعِنْدَهُمُ التَّوْرَاةُ فِيهَا حُكْمُ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّوْنَ مِنْ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا أُولَٰئِكَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-kayfa yuḥakkimūnaka wa-ʿindahumu al-Tawrātu fīhā ḥukmu Allāhi thumma yatawallawna min baʿdi dhālika wa-mā ulā'ika bi-al-mu'minīn

verses.eng: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which was guidance and light. The prophets who submitted [to Allah] judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars by that with which they were entrusted of the Scripture of Allah, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not exchange My verses for a small price. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّا أَنْزَلْنَا التَّوْرَاةَ فِيهَا هُدًى وَنُورٌ ۚ يَحْكُمُ بِهَا النَّبِيُّونَ الَّذِينَ أَسْلَمُوا لِلَّذِينَ هَادُوا وَالرَّبَّانِيُّونَ وَالْأَحْبَارُ بِمَا اسْتُحْفِظُوا مِنْ كِتَابِ اللَّهِ وَكَانُوا عَلَيْهِ شُهَدَاءَ ۚ فَلَا تَخْشَوُا النَّاسَ وَاخْشَوْنِ وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا بِآيَاتِي ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا ۚ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَحْكُمْ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innā anzalnā al-Tawrāta fīhā hudan wa-nūrun yaḥkumu bihā al-nabiyyūna alladhīna aslamū lil-ladhīna hādū wa-al-rabbāniyyūna wa-al-aḥbāru bi-mā ustuḥfiẓū min kitābi Allāhi wa-kānū ʿalayhi shuhadā'a falā takhshaw al-nāsa wa-akhshaw-ni wa-lā tashtarū bi-āyātī thamanan qalīlan wa-man lam yaḥkum bi-mā anzala Allāhu fa-ulā'ika humu al-kāfirūn

verses.eng: And We ordained for them therein a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds is legal retribution. But whoever gives [up his right as] charity, it is an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَكَتَبْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ فِيهَا أَنَّ النَّفْسَ بِالنَّفْسِ وَالْعَيْنَ بِالْعَيْنِ وَالْأَنْفَ بِالْأَنْفِ وَالْأُذُنَ بِالْأُذُنِ وَالسِّنَّ بِالسِّنِّ وَالْجُرُوحَ قِصَاصٌ ۚ فَمَنْ تَصَدَّقَ بِهِ فَهُوَ كَفَّارَةٌ لَهُ ۚ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَحْكُمْ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-katabnā ʿalayhim fīhā anna al-nafsa bi-al-nafsi wa-al-ʿayna bi-al-ʿayni wa-al-anfa bi-al-anfi wa-al-udhuna bi-al-udhuni wa-al-sinna bi-al-sinni wa-al-jurūḥa qiṣāṣun fa-man taṣaddaqa bihi fa-huwa kaffāratun lahu wa-man lam yaḥkum bi-mā anzala Allāhu fa-ulā'ika humu al-ẓālimūn

verses.eng: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming that which came before him in the Torah; and We gave him the Gospel, in which was guidance and light and confirming that which preceded it of the Torah as guidance and instruction for the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَقَفَّيْنَا عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ بِعِيسَى ابْنِ مَرْيَمَ مُصَدِّقًا لِمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ مِنَ التَّوْرَاةِ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْإِنْجِيلَ فِيهِ هُدًى وَنُورٌ وَمُصَدِّقًا لِمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ مِنَ التَّوْرَاةِ وَهُدًى وَمَوْعِظَةً لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-qaffaynā ʿalā āthārihim bi-ʿĪsā ibni Maryama muṣaddiqan li-mā bayna yadayhi mina al-Tawrāti wa-ātaynāhu al-Injīla fīhi hudan wa-nūrun wa-muṣaddiqan li-mā bayna yadayhi mina al-Tawrāti wa-hudan wa-mawʿiẓatan lil-muttaqīn

verses.eng: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allah has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَلْيَحْكُمْ أَهْلُ الْإِنْجِيلِ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَحْكُمْ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-l-yaḥkum ahlu al-Injīli bi-mā anzala Allāhu fīhi wa-man lam yaḥkum bi-mā anzala Allāhu fa-ulā'ika humu al-fāsiqūn

verses.eng: And We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming that which preceded it of the Scripture and as a criterion over it. So judge between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations away from what has come to you of the truth. To each of you We prescribed a law and a method. Had Allah willed, He would have made you one nation [united in religion], but [He intended] to test you in what He has given you; so race to [all that is] good. To Allah is your return all together, and He will [then] inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.
verses.arabic: وَأَنْزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ بِالْحَقِّ مُصَدِّقًا لِمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ وَمُهَيْمِنًا عَلَيْهِ ۖ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ ۖ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ عَمَّا جَاءَكَ مِنَ الْحَقِّ ۚ لِكُلٍّ جَعَلْنَا مِنْكُمْ شِرْعَةً وَمِنْهَاجًا ۚ وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَلَٰكِنْ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ فِي مَا آتَاكُمْ ۖ فَاسْتَبِقُوا الْخَيْرَاتِ ۚ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرْجِعُكُمْ جَمِيعًا فَيُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-anzalnā ilayka al-kitāba bi-al-ḥaqqi muṣaddiqan li-mā bayna yadayhi mina al-kitābi wa-muhayminan ʿalayhi fa-ḥkum baynahum bi-mā anzala Allāhu wa-lā tattabiʿ ahwā'ahum ʿammā jā'aka mina al-ḥaqqi li-kullin jaʿalnā minkum shirʿatan wa-minhājan wa-law shā'a Allāhu lajaʿalakum ummatan wāḥidatan wa-lākin li-yabluwakum fī mā ātākum fa-stabiqū al-khayrāti ilā Allāhi marjiʿukum jamīʿan fa-yunabbi'ukum bi-mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

verses.eng: And judge, [O Muhammad], between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations and beware of them, lest they tempt you away from some of what Allah has revealed to you. And if they turn away - then know that Allah only intends to afflict them with some of their [own] sins. And indeed, many among the people are defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَأَنِ احْكُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ بِمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ وَاحْذَرْهُمْ أَنْ يَفْتِنُوكَ عَنْ بَعْضِ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ إِلَيْكَ ۖ فَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَاعْلَمْ أَنَّمَا يُرِيدُ اللَّهُ أَنْ يُصِيبَهُمْ بِبَعْضِ ذُنُوبِهِمْ ۗ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنَ النَّاسِ لَفَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ini ḥkum baynahum bi-mā anzala Allāhu wa-lā tattabiʿ ahwā'ahum wa-ḥdharhum an yaftinūka ʿan baʿḍi mā anzala Allāhu ilayka fa-in tawallaw fa-iʿlam annamā yurīdu Allāhu an yuṣībahum bi-baʿḍi dhunūbihim wa-inna kathīran mina al-nāsi la-fāsiqūn

verses.eng: Then is it the judgment of [the time of] ignorance they desire? But who is better than Allah in judgment for a people who are certain [in faith].
verses.arabic: أَفَحُكْمَ الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ يَبْغُونَ ۚ وَمَنْ أَحْسَنُ مِنَ اللَّهِ حُكْمًا لِقَوْمٍ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afa-ḥukma al-jāhiliyyati yabghūn wa-man aḥsanu mina Allāhi ḥukman li-qawmin yūqinūn

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are [in fact] allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is [one] of them. Indeed, Allah guides not the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّخِذُوا الْيَهُودَ وَالنَّصَارَىٰ أَوْلِيَاءَ ۘ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَاءُ بَعْضٍ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّهُمْ مِنْكُمْ فَإِنَّهُ مِنْهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tattakhidhū al-yahūda wa-al-naṣārā awliyā'a baʿḍuhum awliyā'u baʿḍin wa-man yatawallahum minkum fa-innahu minhum inna Allāha lā yahdī al-qawma al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: So you see those in whose hearts is disease hastening into [association with] them, saying, 'We are afraid a misfortune may strike us.' But perhaps Allah will bring conquest or a decision from Him, and they will become, over what they have been concealing within themselves, regretful.
verses.arabic: فَتَرَى الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ يُسَارِعُونَ فِيهِمْ يَقُولُونَ نَخْشَىٰ أَنْ تُصِيبَنَا دَائِرَةٌ ۚ فَعَسَى اللَّهُ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ بِالْفَتْحِ أَوْ أَمْرٍ مِنْ عِنْدِهِ فَيُصْبِحُوا عَلَىٰ مَا أَسَرُّوا فِي أَنْفُسِهِمْ نَادِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fatarā alladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun yusāriʿūna fīhim yaqūlūna nakhshā an tuṣībanā dā'iratun fa-ʿasā Allāhu an ya'tiya bi-al-fatḥi aw amrin min ʿindihi fa-yuṣbiḥū ʿalā mā asarrū fī anfusihim nādimīn

verses.eng: And those who believe will say, 'Are these the ones who swore by Allah their strongest oaths that indeed they were with you?' Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers.
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَهَٰؤُلَاءِ الَّذِينَ أَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ ۙ إِنَّهُمْ لَمَعَكُمْ ۚ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَالُهُمْ فَأَصْبَحُوا خَاسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-yaqūlu alladhīna āmanū ahā'ulā'i alladhīna aqsamū bi-Allāhi jahda aymānihim innahum la-maʿakum ḥabiṭat aʿmāluhum fa-aṣbaḥū khāsirīn

verses.eng: O you who have believed, whoever of you should revert from his religion - Allah will bring forth [in place of them] a people He will love and who will love Him, [who are] humble toward the believers, powerful against the disbelievers; they strive in the cause of Allah and do not fear the blame of a critic. That is the favor of Allah; He bestows it upon whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَنْ يَرْتَدَّ مِنْكُمْ عَنْ دِينِهِ فَسَوْفَ يَأْتِي اللَّهُ بِقَوْمٍ يُحِبُّهُمْ وَيُحِبُّونَهُ أَذِلَّةٍ عَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ أَعِزَّةٍ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ يُجَاهِدُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَلَا يَخَافُونَ لَوْمَةَ لَائِمٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ اللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū man yartadda minkum ʿan dīnihi fa-sawfa ya'tī Allāhu bi-qawmin yuḥibbuhum wa-yuḥibbūnahu adhillatin ʿalā al-mu'minīna aʿizzatin ʿalā al-kāfirīna yujāhidūna fī sabīli Allāhi wa-lā yakhāfūna lawmata lā'imin dhālika faḍlu Allāhi yu'tīhi man yashā'u wa-Allāhu wāsiʿun ʿalīm

verses.eng: Your ally is none but Allah and [therefore] His Messenger and those who have believed - those who establish prayer and give zakah, and they bow [in worship].
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا وَلِيُّكُمُ اللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُمْ رَاكِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā waliyyukumu Allāhu wa-rasūluhu wa-alladhīna āmanū alladhīna yuqīmūna al-ṣalāta wa-yu'tūna al-zakāta wa-hum rākiʿūn

verses.eng: And whoever is an ally of Allah and His Messenger and those who have believed - indeed, the party of Allah - they will be the predominant.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا فَإِنَّ حِزْبَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-man yatawalla Allāha wa-rasūlahu wa-alladhīna āmanū fa-inna ḥizba Allāhi humu al-ghālibūn

verses.eng: O you who have believed, take not as allies those who take your religion in ridicule and amusement among the ones who were given the Scripture before you nor the disbelievers. And fear Allah, if you should [truly] be believers.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّخِذُوا الَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا دِينَكُمْ هُزُوًا وَلَعِبًا مِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ وَالْكُفَّارَ أَوْلِيَاءَ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tattakhidhū alladhīna ittakhadhū dīnakum huzuwan wa-laʿiban mina alladhīna ūtū al-kitāba min qablikum wa-al-kuffāra awliyā'a wa-ittaqū Allāha in kuntum mu'minīn

verses.eng: And when you call to prayer, they take it in ridicule and amusement. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا نَادَيْتُمْ إِلَى الصَّلَاةِ اتَّخَذُوهَا هُزُوًا وَلَعِبًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā nādaytum ilā al-ṣalāti ittakhadhūhā huzuwan wa-laʿiban dhālika bi-annahum qawmun lā yaʿqilūn

verses.eng: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except [for the fact] that we have believed in Allah and what was revealed to us and what was revealed before and because most of you are defiantly disobedient?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ هَلْ تَنْقِمُونَ مِنَّا إِلَّا أَنْ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْنَا وَمَا أُنْزِلَ مِنْ قَبْلُ وَأَنَّ أَكْثَرَكُمْ فَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul yā ahla al-kitābi hal tanqimūna minnā illā an āmannā bi-Allāhi wa-mā unzila ilaynā wa-mā unzila min qablu wa-anna aktharakum fāsiqūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that as penalty from Allah? [It is that of] those whom Allah has cursed and with whom He became angry and made of them apes and pigs and slaves of Taghut. Those are worse in position and further astray from the sound way.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِشَرٍّ مِنْ ذَٰلِكَ مَثُوبَةً عِنْدَ اللَّهِ ۚ مَنْ لَعَنَهُ اللَّهُ وَغَضِبَ عَلَيْهِ وَجَعَلَ مِنْهُمُ الْقِرَدَةَ وَالْخَنَازِيرَ وَعَبَدَ الطَّاغُوتَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ عَنْ سَوَاءِ السَّبِيلِ
verses.transliteration: Qul hal unabbi'ukum bi-sharrin min dhālika mathūbatan ʿinda Allāhi man laʿanahu Allāhu wa-ghaḍiba ʿalayhi wa-jaʿala minhumu al-qiradata wa-al-khanāzīra wa-ʿabada al-ṭāghūta ulā'ika sharrun makānan wa-aḍallu ʿan sawā'i al-sabīl

verses.eng: And when they come to you, they say, 'We believe.' But they have entered with disbelief [in their hearts], and they have certainly left with it. And Allah is most knowing of what they were concealing.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا جَاءُوكُمْ قَالُوا آمَنَّا وَقَدْ دَخَلُوا بِالْكُفْرِ وَهُمْ قَدْ خَرَجُوا بِهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْتُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā jā'ūkum qālū āmannā wa-qad dakhalū bi-al-kufri wa-hum qad kharajū bihi wa-Allāhu aʿlamu bi-mā kānū yaktumūn

verses.eng: And you see many of them hastening into sin and aggression and the devouring of [what is] unlawful. How wretched is what they have been doing.
verses.arabic: وَتَرَىٰ كَثِيرًا مِنْهُمْ يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْإِثْمِ وَالْعُدْوَانِ وَأَكْلِهِمُ السُّحْتَ ۚ لَبِئْسَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-tarā kathīran minhum yusāriʿūna fī al-ithmi wa-al-ʿudwāni wa-aklihimu al-suḥta la-bi'sa mā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: Why do the rabbis and religious scholars not forbid them from saying what is sinful and devouring what is unlawful? How wretched is what they have been crafting.
verses.arabic: لَوْلَا يَنْهَاهُمُ الرَّبَّانِيُّونَ وَالْأَحْبَارُ عَنْ قَوْلِهِمُ الْإِثْمَ وَأَكْلِهِمُ السُّحْتَ ۚ لَبِئْسَ مَا كَانُوا يَصْنَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lawlā yanhāhumu al-rabbāniyyūna wa-al-aḥbāru ʿan qawlihimu al-ith'ma wa-aklihimu al-suḥta la-bi'sa mā kānū yaṣnaʿūn

verses.eng: And the Jews say, 'The hand of Allah is chained.' Chained are their hands, and cursed are they for what they say. Rather, both His hands are extended; He spends however He wills. And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. And We have cast among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. Every time they kindled the fire of war [against you], Allah extinguished it. And they strive throughout the land to cause corruption, and Allah does not like corrupters.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَتِ الْيَهُودُ يَدُ اللَّهِ مَغْلُولَةٌ ۚ غُلَّتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَلُعِنُوا بِمَا قَالُوا ۘ بَلْ يَدَاهُ مَبْسُوطَتَانِ يُنْفِقُ كَيْفَ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَلَيَزِيدَنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنْهُمْ مَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِنْ رَبِّكَ طُغْيَانًا وَكُفْرًا ۚ وَأَلْقَيْنَا بَيْنَهُمُ الْعَدَاوَةَ وَالْبَغْضَاءَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ كُلَّمَا أَوْقَدُوا نَارًا لِلْحَرْبِ أَطْفَأَهَا اللَّهُ ۚ وَيَسْعَوْنَ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا ۚ وَاللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālati al-yahūdu yadu Allāhi maghlūlah ghullat aydīhim wa-luʿinū bi-mā qālū bal yadāhu mabsūṭatāni yunfiqu kayfa yashā'u wa-la-yazīdanna kathīran minhum mā unzila ilayka min rabbika ṭughyānan wa-kufran wa-alqaynā baynahumu al-ʿadāwata wa-al-baghḍā'a ilā yawmi al-qiyāmati kullamā awqadū nāran lil-ḥarbi aṭfa'ahā Allāhu wa-yasʿawna fī al-arḍi fasādan wa-Allāhu lā yuḥibbu al-mufsidīn

verses.eng: And if only the People of the Scripture had believed and feared Allah, We would have removed from them their sins and admitted them to Gardens of Pleasure.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ آمَنُوا وَاتَّقَوْا لَكَفَّرْنَا عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ وَلَأَدْخَلْنَاهُمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law anna ahla al-kitābi āmanū wa-ittaqaw la-kaffarnā ʿanhum sayyi'ātihim wa-la-adkhalnāhum jannāti al-naʿīm

verses.eng: And if only they had upheld [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have consumed [provision] from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them are a moderate community, but many of them - evil is that which they do.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ أَقَامُوا التَّوْرَاةَ وَالْإِنْجِيلَ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ لَأَكَلُوا مِنْ فَوْقِهِمْ وَمِنْ تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِهِمْ ۚ مِنْهُمْ أُمَةٌ مُقْتَصِدَةٌ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ مِنْهُمْ سَاءَ مَا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law annahum aqāmū al-Tawrāta wa-al-Injīla wa-mā unzila ilayhim min rabbihim la-akalū min fawqihim wa-min taḥti arjulihim minhum ummatun muqtaṣidatun wa-kathīrun minhum sā'a mā yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: O Messenger, announce that which has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الرَّسُولُ بَلِّغْ مَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَإِنْ لَمْ تَفْعَلْ فَمَا بَلَّغْتَ رِسَالَتَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْصِمُكَ مِنَ النَّاسِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā al-rasūlu balligh mā unzila ilayka min rabbika wa-in lam tafʿal fa-mā ballaghta risālatahu wa-Allāhu yaʿṣimuka mina al-nāsi inna Allāha lā yahdī al-qawma al-kāfirīn

verses.eng: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, you are [standing] on nothing until you uphold [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord.' And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. So do not grieve over the disbelieving people.
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لَسْتُمْ عَلَىٰ شَيْءٍ حَتَّىٰ تُقِيمُوا التَّوْرَاةَ وَالْإِنْجِيلَ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ ۗ وَلَيَزِيدَنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنْهُمْ مَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِنْ رَبِّكَ طُغْيَانًا وَكُفْرًا ۖ فَلَا تَأْسَ عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul yā ahla al-kitābi lastum ʿalā shay'in ḥattā tuqīmū al-Tawrāta wa-al-Injīla wa-mā unzila ilaykum min rabbikum wa-la-yazīdanna kathīran minhum mā unzila ilayka min rabbika ṭughyānan wa-kufran falā tasa ʿalā al-qawmi al-kāfirīn

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed, those who were Jews, and the Sabians and the Christians - any [of them] who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَالَّذِينَ هَادُوا وَالصَّابِئُونَ وَالنَّصَارَىٰ مَنْ آمَنَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna āmanū wa-alladhīna hādū wa-al-ṣābi'ūna wa-al-naṣārā man āmana bi-Allāhi wa-al-yawmi al-ākhiri wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan falā khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūn

verses.eng: We had already taken the covenant of the Children of Israel and had sent to them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a party [of messengers] they denied, and another party they killed.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَاقَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَأَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهِمْ رُسُلًا ۖ كُلَّمَا جَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ بِمَا لَا تَهْوَىٰ أَنْفُسُهُمْ فَرِيقًا كَذَّبُوا وَفَرِيقًا يَقْتُلُونَ
verses.transliteration: La-qad akhadhnā mīthāqa banī Isrāīla wa-arsalnā ilayhim rusulan kullamā jā'ahum rasūlun bi-mā lā tahwā anfusahum farīqan kadhabū wa-farīqan yaqtulūn

verses.eng: And they thought there would be no [resulting] punishment, so they became blind and deaf. Then Allah turned to them in forgiveness; then [again] many of them became blind and deaf. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
verses.arabic: وَحَسِبُوا أَلَّا تَكُونَ فِتْنَةٌ فَعَمُوا وَصَمُّوا ثُمَّ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ عَمُوا وَصَمُّوا كَثِيرٌ مِنْهُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ḥasibū allā takūna fitnatun fa-ʿamū wa-ṣammū thumma tāba Allāhu ʿalayhim thumma ʿamū wa-ṣammū kathīrun minhum wa-Allāhu baṣīrun bi-mā yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: They have certainly disbelieved who say, 'Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary' while the Messiah has said, 'O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.' Indeed, he who associates others with Allah - Allah has forbidden him Paradise, and his refuge is the Fire. And there are not for the wrongdoers any helpers.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ كَفَرَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْمَسِيحُ ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ ۖ وَقَالَ الْمَسِيحُ يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبَّكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ مَنْ يُشْرِكْ بِاللَّهِ فَقَدْ حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ الْجَنَّةَ وَمَأْوَاهُ النَّارُ ۖ وَمَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِنْ أَنْصَارٍ
verses.transliteration: La-qad kafara alladhīna qālū inna Allāha huwa al-Masīḥu ib'nu Maryama wa-qāla al-Masīḥu yā banī Isrāīla uʿbudū Allāha rabbī wa-rabbakum innahu man yush'rik bi-Allāhi fa-qad ḥarrama Allāhu ʿalayhi al-jannata wa-ma'wāhu al-nāru wa-mā li-l-ẓālimīna min anṣār

verses.eng: They have certainly disbelieved who say, 'Allah is the third of three.' And there is no god except one God. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ كَفَرَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ ثَالِثُ ثَلَاثَةٍ ۘ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ ۚ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَنْتَهُوا عَمَّا يَقُولُونَ لَيَمَسَّنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: La-qad kafara alladhīna qālū inna Allāha thālithu thalāthatin wa-mā min ilāhin illā ilāhun wāḥidun wa-in lam yantahū ʿammā yaqūlūna la-yamassanna alladhīna kafarū minhum ʿadhābun alīm

verses.eng: So will they not repent to Allah and seek His forgiveness? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: أَفَلَا يَتُوبُونَ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُونَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Afa-lā yatūbūna ilā Allāhi wa-yastaghfirūnahu wa-Allāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: The Messiah, son of Mary, was not but a messenger; [other] messengers have passed on before him. And his mother was a supporter of truth. They both used to eat food. Look how We make clear to them the signs; then look how they are deluded.
verses.arabic: مَا الْمَسِيحُ ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ إِلَّا رَسُولٌ ۖ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ الرُّسُلُ ۖ وَأُمُّهُ صِدِّيقَةٌ ۖ كَانَا يَأْكُلَانِ الطَّعَامَ ۗ انْظُرْ كَيْفَ نُبَيِّنُ لَهُمُ الْآيَاتِ ثُمَّ انْظُرْ أَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā al-Masīḥu ib'nu Maryama illā rasūlun qad khalat min qablihi al-rusulu wa-ummuhu ṣiddīqatun kānā ya'kulāni al-ṭaʿām unẓur kayfa nubayyinu lahumu al-āyāti thumma unẓur annā yu'fakūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Do you worship besides Allah that which holds for you no [power of] harm or benefit while it is Allah who is the Hearing, the Knowing?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَتَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا ۚ وَاللَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qul a-taʿbudūna min dūni Allāhi mā lā yamliku lakum ḍarran wa-lā nafʿan wa-Allāhu huwa al-samīʿu al-ʿalīm

verses.eng: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, do not exceed limits in your religion beyond the truth and do not follow the inclinations of a people who had gone astray before and misled many and have strayed from the soundness of the way.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لَا تَغْلُوا فِي دِينِكُمْ غَيْرَ الْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا أَهْوَاءَ قَوْمٍ قَدْ ضَلُّوا مِنْ قَبْلُ وَأَضَلُّوا كَثِيرًا وَضَلُّوا عَنْ سَوَاءِ السَّبِيلِ
verses.transliteration: Qul yā ahla al-kitābi lā taghlū fī dīnikum ghayra al-ḥaqqi wa-lā tattabiʿū ahwā'a qawmin qad ḍallū min qablu wa-aḍallū kathīran wa-ḍallū ʿan sawā'i al-sabīl

verses.eng: Cursed were those who disbelieved among the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and of Jesus, the son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.
verses.arabic: لُعِنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ عَلَىٰ لِسَانِ دَاوُودَ وَعِيسَى ابْنِ مَرْيَمَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوْا وَكَانُوا يَعْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Luʿina alladhīna kafarū min banī Isrāīla ʿalā lisāni Dāwūda wa-ʿĪsā ib'ni Maryama dhālika bi-mā ʿaṣaw wa-kānū yaʿtadūn

verses.eng: They used not to prevent one another from wrongdoing that they did. How wretched was that which they were doing.
verses.arabic: كَانُوا لَا يَتَنَاهَوْنَ عَنْ مُنْكَرٍ فَعَلُوهُ ۚ لَبِئْسَ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kānū lā yatanāhawna ʿan munkarin faʿalūhu, la-bi’sa mā kānū yafʿalūn

verses.eng: You see many of them allying with those who disbelieved. How wretched is that which they have put forth for themselves [in this world]—that Allah should be angry with them, and in the punishment they will abide eternally.
verses.arabic: تَرَىٰ كَثِيرًا مِنْهُمْ يَتَوَلَّوْنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ لَبِئْسَ مَا قَدَّمَتْ لَهُمْ أَنْفُسُهُمْ أَنْ سَخِطَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَفِي الْعَذَابِ هُمْ خَالِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Tarā kathīran minhum yatawallawna alladhīna kafarū, la-bi’sa mā qaddamat lahum anfusahum an sakhita Allāhu ʿalayhim, wa-fī al-ʿadhābi hum khālidūn

verses.eng: And if they had believed in Allah and the Prophet and in what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies; but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ كَانُوا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالنَّبِيِّ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مَا اتَّخَذُوهُمْ أَوْلِيَاءَ وَلَٰكِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنْهُمْ فَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law kānū yu'minūna bi-Allāhi wa-al-nabiyyi wa-mā unzila ilayhi mā ittakhadhūhum awliyā'a wa-lākinna kathīran minhum fāsiqūn

verses.eng: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the believers [to be] the Jews and those who associate others with Allah; and you will find the nearest of them in affection to the believers those who say, 'We are Christians.' That is because among them are priests and monks and because they are not arrogant.
verses.arabic: لَتَجِدَنَّ أَشَدَّ النَّاسِ عَدَاوَةً لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا الْيَهُودَ وَالَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا ۖ وَلَتَجِدَنَّ أَقْرَبَهُمْ مَوَدَّةً لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا الَّذِينَ قَالُوا إِنَّا نَصَارَىٰ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ مِنْهُمْ قِسِّيسِينَ وَرُهْبَانًا وَأَنَّهُمْ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: La-tajidanna ashadda al-nāsi ʿadāwatan lil-ladhīna āmanū al-yahūda wa-alladhīna ashrakū wa-la-tajidanna aqrabahum mawaddatan lil-ladhīna āmanū alladhīna qālū innā naṣārā dhālika bi-anna minhum qissīsīna wa-ruhbānan wa-annahum lā yastakbirūn

verses.eng: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the truth. They say, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so register us among the witnesses.'
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا سَمِعُوا مَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَى الرَّسُولِ تَرَىٰ أَعْيُنَهُمْ تَفِيضُ مِنَ الدَّمْعِ مِمَّا عَرَفُوا مِنَ الْحَقِّ ۖ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاكْتُبْنَا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā samiʿū mā unzila ilā al-rasūli tarā aʿyunahum tafīḍu mina al-damʿi mimmā ʿarafū mina al-ḥaqqi yaqūlūna rabbanā āmannā fa-uk'tubnā maʿa al-shāhidīn

verses.eng: And why should we not believe in Allah and what has come to us of the truth? And we aspire that our Lord will admit us [to Paradise] with the righteous people.
verses.arabic: وَمَا لَنَا لَا نُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَمَا جَاءَنَا مِنَ الْحَقِّ وَنَطْمَعُ أَنْ يُدْخِلَنَا رَبُّنَا مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-mā lanā lā nu'minu bi-Allāhi wa-mā jā'anā mina al-ḥaqqi wa-naṭmaʿu an yudkhilanā rabbunā maʿa al-qawmi al-ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: So Allah rewarded them for what they said with gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of doers of good.
verses.arabic: فَأَثَابَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِمَا قَالُوا جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-athābahumu Allāhu bi-mā qālū jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā al-anhāru khālidīna fīhā wa-dhālika jazā'u al-muḥsinīn

verses.eng: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - they are the companions of Hellfire.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna kafarū wa-kadhabū bi-āyātinā ulā'ika aṣḥābu al-jaḥīm

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allah has made lawful to you and do not transgress. Indeed, Allah does not like transgressors.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُحَرِّمُوا طَيِّبَاتِ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ وَلَا تَعْتَدُوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُعْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tuḥarrimū ṭayyibāti mā aḥalla Allāhu lakum wa-lā taʿtadū inna Allāha lā yuḥibbu al-muʿtadīn

verses.eng: And eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
verses.arabic: وَكُلُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ حَلَالًا طَيِّبًا ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ الَّذِي أَنْتُمْ بِهِ مُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-kulū mimmā razaqakumu Allāhu ḥalālan ṭayyiban wa-ittaqū Allāha alladhī antum bihi mu'minūn

verses.eng: Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for [breaking] what you intended of oaths. So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people from the average of that which you feed your [own] families or clothing them or the freeing of a slave. But whoever cannot find [or afford it] - then a fast of three days. That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn. But guard your oaths. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be grateful.
verses.arabic: لَا يُؤَاخِذُكُمُ اللَّهُ بِاللَّغْوِ فِي أَيْمَانِكُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ يُؤَاخِذُكُمْ بِمَا عَقَّدْتُمُ الْأَيْمَانَ ۖ فَكَفَّارَتُهُ إِطْعَامُ عَشَرَةِ مَسَاكِينَ مِنْ أَوْسَطِ مَا تُطْعِمُونَ أَهْلِيكُمْ أَوْ كِسْوَتُهُمْ أَوْ تَحْرِيرُ رَقَبَةٍ ۖ فَمَنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ فَصِيَامُ ثَلَاثَةِ أَيَّامٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ كَفَّارَةُ أَيْمَانِكُمْ إِذَا حَلَفْتُمْ ۚ وَاحْفَظُوا أَيْمَانَكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ آيَاتِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lā yu'ākhidhukumu Allāhu bi-al-laghwi fī aymānikum wa-lākin yu'ākhidhukum bi-mā ʿaqqadtumu al-aymāna fa-kaffāratuhu iṭ'āmu ʿasharati masākīna min awsaṭi mā tuṭ'imūna ahlīkum aw kiswatuhum aw taḥrīru raqabatin fa-man lam yajid fa-ṣiyāmu thalāthati ayyāmin dhālika kaffāratu aymānikum idhā ḥalaftum wa-ḥfaẓū aymānakum kadhālika yubayyinu Allāhu lakum āyātihi laʿallakum tashkurūn

verses.eng: O you who have believed, indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone altars [to other than Allah], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be successful.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنَّمَا الْخَمْرُ وَالْمَيْسِرُ وَالْأَنْصَابُ وَالْأَزْلَامُ رِجْسٌ مِنْ عَمَلِ الشَّيْطَانِ فَاجْتَنِبُوهُ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū innamā al-khamru wa-al-maysiru wa-al-anṣābu wa-al-azlāmu rijsun min ʿamali al-shayṭāni fa-ij'tanibūhu laʿallakum tufliḥūn

verses.eng: Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred through intoxicants and gambling and to avert you from the remembrance of Allah and from prayer. So will you not desist?
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا يُرِيدُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَنْ يُوقِعَ بَيْنَكُمُ الْعَدَاوَةَ وَالْبَغْضَاءَ فِي الْخَمْرِ وَالْمَيْسِرِ وَيَصُدَّكُمْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَعَنِ الصَّلَاةِ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنْتُمْ مُنْتَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā yurīdu al-shayṭānu an yūqiʿa baynakumu al-ʿadāwata wa-al-baghḍā'a fī al-khamri wa-al-maysiri wa-yaṣuddakum ʿan dhikri Allāhi wa-ʿani al-ṣalāti fa-hal antum muntahūn

verses.eng: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger and beware. And if you turn away - then know that upon Our Messenger is only [the responsibility for] clear notification.
verses.arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ وَاحْذَرُوا ۚ فَإِنْ تَوَلَّيْتُمْ فَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّمَا عَلَىٰ رَسُولِنَا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-aṭīʿū Allāha wa-aṭīʿū al-rasūla wa-ḥdharū fa-in tawallaytum fa-iʿlamū annamā ʿalā rasūlinā al-balāghu al-mubīn

verses.eng: There is not upon those who believe and do righteousness [any] blame concerning what they have eaten [in the past] if they [now] fear Allah and believe and do righteous deeds, and then fear Allah and believe, and then fear Allah and do good; and Allah loves the doers of good.
verses.arabic: لَيْسَ عَلَى الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ جُنَاحٌ فِيمَا طَعِمُوا إِذَا مَا اتَّقَوْا وَآمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ ثُمَّ اتَّقَوْا وَآمَنُوا ثُمَّ اتَّقَوْا وَأَحْسَنُوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ يُحِبُّ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Laysa ʿalā alladhīna āmanū wa-ʿamilū al-ṣāliḥāti junāḥun fīmā ṭaʿimū idhā mā ittaqaw wa-āmanū wa-ʿamilū al-ṣāliḥāti thumma ittaqaw wa-āmanū thumma ittaqaw wa-aḥsanū wa-Allāhu yuḥibbu al-muḥsinīn

verses.eng: O you who have believed, Allah will surely test you through something of the game that your hands and spears [can] reach, that Allah may make evident those who fear Him unseen. And whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَيَبْلُوَنَّكُمُ اللَّهُ بِشَيْءٍ مِنَ الصَّيْدِ تَنَالُهُ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَرِمَاحُكُمْ لِيَعْلَمَ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَخَافُهُ بِالْغَيْبِ ۚ فَمَنِ اعْتَدَىٰ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَلَهُ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū la-yabluwannakumu Allāhu bi-shay'in mina al-ṣaydi tanāluhu aydīkum wa-rimāḥukum li-yaʿlama Allāhu man yakhāfuhu bi-al-ghaybi fa-mani iʿtadā baʿda dhālika fa-lahu ʿadhābun alīm

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not kill game while you are in the state of iḥrām. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed, as judged by two just men among you, as an offering [to Allah] delivered to the Kaʿbah, or an expiation: the feeding of needy people or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his deed. Allah has pardoned what is past; but whoever returns, then Allah will take retribution from him. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَقْتُلُوا الصَّيْدَ وَأَنْتُمْ حُرُمٌ ۚ وَمَنْ قَتَلَهُ مِنْكُمْ مُتَعَمِّدًا فَجَزَاءٌ مِثْلُ مَا قَتَلَ مِنَ النَّعَمِ يَحْكُمُ بِهِ ذَوَا عَدْلٍ مِنْكُمْ هَدْيًا بَالِغَ الْكَعْبَةِ أَوْ كَفَّارَةٌ طَعَامُ مَسَاكِينَ أَوْ عَدْلُ ذَٰلِكَ صِيَامًا لِيَذُوقَ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِ ۗ عَفَا اللَّهُ عَمَّا سَلَفَ ۚ وَمَنْ عَادَ فَيَنْتَقِمُ اللَّهُ مِنْهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ ذُو انْتِقَامٍ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā taqtulū al-ṣayda wa-antum ḥurumun wa-man qatalahu minkum mutaʿammidan fa-jazā'un mithlu mā qatala mina al-naʿami yaḥkumu bihi dhawā ʿadlin minkum hadyan bāligha al-kaʿbati aw kaffāratun ṭaʿāmu masākīna aw ʿadlu dhālika ṣiyāman li-yadhūqa wabāla amrihi ʿafā Allāhu ʿammā salaf wa-man ʿāda fa-yantaqimu Allāhu minhu wa-Allāhu ʿazīzun dhū intiqām

verses.eng: Lawful to you is game from the sea and its food as provision for you and the travelers, but forbidden to you is game from the land as long as you are in the state of iḥrām. And fear Allah to whom you will be gathered.
verses.arabic: أُحِلَّ لَكُمْ صَيْدُ الْبَحْرِ وَطَعَامُهُ مَتَاعًا لَكُمْ وَلِلسَّيَّارَةِ ۖ وَحُرِّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ صَيْدُ الْبَرِّ مَا دُمْتُمْ حُرُمًا ۗ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ الَّذِي إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Uḥilla lakum ṣaydu al-baḥri wa-ṭaʿāmuhu matāʿan lakum wa-li-al-sayyārati wa-ḥurrima ʿalaykum ṣaydu al-barri mā dumtum ḥuruman wa-ittaqū Allāha alladhī ilayhi tuḥ'sharūn

verses.eng: Allah has made the Kaʿbah, the Sacred House, standing for the people and [has sanctified] the sacred months and the sacrificial animals and the garlands [by which they are identified]. That is so you may know that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth and that Allah is Knowing of all things.
verses.arabic: جَعَلَ اللَّهُ الْكَعْبَةَ الْبَيْتَ الْحَرَامَ قِيَامًا لِلنَّاسِ وَالشَّهْرَ الْحَرَامَ وَالْهَدْيَ وَالْقَلَائِدَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِتَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Jaʿala Allāhu al-kaʿbata al-bayta al-ḥarāma qiyāman lil-nāsi wa-al-shahra al-ḥarāma wa-al-hadya wa-al-qalā'ida dhālika li-taʿlamū anna Allāha yaʿlamu mā fī al-samāwāti wa-mā fī al-arḍi wa-anna Allāha bi-kulli shay'in ʿalīm

verses.eng: Know that Allah is severe in penalty and that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: اعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Iʿlamū anna Allāha shadīdu al-ʿiqābi wa-anna Allāha ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Not upon the Messenger is [responsibility] except [for] notification. And Allah knows whatever you reveal and whatever you conceal.
verses.arabic: مَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُبْدُونَ وَمَا تَكْتُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā ʿalā al-rasūli illā al-balāghu wa-Allāhu yaʿlamu mā tubdūna wa-mā taktumūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Not equal are the evil and the good, although the abundance of evil might impress you.' So fear Allah, O you of understanding, that you may be successful.
verses.arabic: قُلْ لَا يَسْتَوِي الْخَبِيثُ وَالطَّيِّبُ وَلَوْ أَعْجَبَكَ كَثْرَةُ الْخَبِيثِ ۚ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ يَا أُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul lā yastawī al-khabīthu wa-al-ṭayyibu wa-law aʿjabaka kathratu al-khabīthi fa-ittaqū Allāha yā ulī al-albābi laʿallakum tufliḥūn
