verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you. But if you ask about them while the Qur'an is being revealed, they will be shown to you. Allah has pardoned that which is past; and Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَسْأَلُوا عَنْ أَشْيَاءَ إِنْ تُبْدَ لَكُمْ تَسُؤْكُمْ وَإِنْ تَسْأَلُوا عَنْهَا حِينَ يُنَزَّلُ الْقُرْآنُ تُبْدَ لَكُمْ عَفَا اللَّهُ عَنْهَا وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ حَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tas'alū ʿan ashyāʾa in tubda lakum tasuʾkum wa-in tasʾalū ʿanhā ḥīna yunazzalu l-qurʾānu tubda lakum ʿafā Allāhu ʿanhā wa-llāhu ghafūrun ḥalīmun

verses.eng: A people asked such [questions] before you; then they became thereby disbelievers.
verses.arabic: قَدْ سَأَلَهَا قَوْمٌ مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ ثُمَّ أَصْبَحُوا بِهَا كَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qad saʾalahā qawmun min qablikum thumma aṣbaḥū bihā kāfirīna

verses.eng: Allah has not appointed [such innovations as] bahirah or sa'ibah or wasilah or ham. But those who disbelieve invent falsehood about Allah, and most of them do not reason.
verses.arabic: مَا جَعَلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ بَحِيرَةٍ وَلَا سَائِبَةٍ وَلَا وَصِيلَةٍ وَلَا حَامٍ وَلَٰكِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā jaʿala Allāhu min baḥīratin wa-lā sāʾibatin wa-lā waṣīlatin wa-lā ḥāmin wa-lākinna alladhīna kafarū yaftarūna ʿalā Allāhi l-kadhiba wa-aktharuhum lā yaʿqilūna

verses.eng: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,' they say, 'Sufficient for us is that upon which we found our fathers.' Even though their fathers knew nothing, nor were they guided?
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَعَالَوْا إِلَىٰ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ وَإِلَى الرَّسُولِ قَالُوا حَسْبُنَا مَا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهِ آبَاءَنَا أَوَلَوْ كَانَ آبَاؤُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā qīla lahum taʿālaw ilā mā anzala Allāhu wa-ilā l-rasūli qālū ḥasbunā mā wajadnā ʿalayhi ābāʾanā a-wa-law kāna ābāʾuhum lā yaʿlamūna shayʾan wa-lā yahtadūna

verses.eng: O you who have believed, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided. To Allah is your return all together; then He will inform you of what you used to do.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ مَنْ ضَلَّ إِذَا اهْتَدَيْتُمْ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرْجِعُكُمْ جَمِيعًا فَيُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū ʿalaykum anfusakum lā yaḍurrukum man ḍalla idhā ihtadaytum ilā Allāhi marjiʿukum jamīʿan fa-yunabbiʾukum bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

verses.eng: O you who have believed, testimony [should be taken] among you when death approaches one of you at the time of bequest - [that of] two just men from among you or two others from outside if you are traveling through the land and the disaster of death should strike you. Detain them after the prayer and let them both swear by Allah if you doubt [their testimony], [saying], 'We will not exchange it for a price, even if he should be a near relative, and we will not withhold the testimony of Allah. Indeed, we would then be among the sinful.'
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا شَهَادَةُ بَيْنِكُمْ إِذَا حَضَرَ أَحَدَكُمُ الْمَوْتُ حِينَ الْوَصِيَّةِ اثْنَانِ ذَوَا عَدْلٍ مِنْكُمْ أَوْ آخَرَانِ مِنْ غَيْرِكُمْ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ ضَرَبْتُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَأَصَابَتْكُمْ مُصِيبَةُ الْمَوْتِ تَحْبِسُونَهُمَا مِنْ بَعْدِ الصَّلَاةِ فَيُقْسِمَانِ بِاللَّهِ إِنِ ارْتَبْتُمْ لَا نَشْتَرِي بِهِ ثَمَنًا وَلَوْ كَانَ ذَا قُرْبَىٰ وَلَا نَكْتُمُ شَهَادَةَ اللَّهِ إِنَّا إِذًا لَمِنَ الْآثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū shahādatu baynikum idhā ḥaḍara aḥadakumu l-mawtu ḥīna l-waṣiyyati ithnāni dhawā ʿadlin minkum aw ākharāni min ghayrikum in antum ḍarabtum fī l-arḍi fa-aṣābatkum muṣībatu l-mawti taḥbisūnahumā min baʿdi l-ṣalāti fa-yuqsimāni bi-llāhi in irtabtum lā nashtarī bihi thamanan wa-law kāna dhā qurbā wa-lā naktumu shahādata Allāhi innā idhan la-mina l-āthimīna

verses.eng: But if it is found that those two were guilty of sin [by lying], let two others stand in their place [who are] foremost [in claim] from those who have a lawful right. And let them swear by Allah, 'Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed. Indeed, we would then be among the wrongdoers.'
verses.arabic: فَإِنْ عُثِرَ عَلَىٰ أَنَّهُمَا اسْتَحَقَّا إِثْمًا فَآخَرَانِ يَقُومَانِ مَقَامَهُمَا مِنَ الَّذِينَ اسْتَحَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَوْلَيَانِ فَيُقْسِمَانِ بِاللَّهِ لَشَهَادَتُنَا أَحَقُّ مِنْ شَهَادَتِهِمَا وَمَا اعْتَدَيْنَا إِنَّا إِذًا لَمِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in ʿuthira ʿalā annahumā istaḥaqqā ithman fa-ākharāni yaqūmāni maqāmahumā mina alladhīna istaḥaqqa ʿalayhimu l-awlayāni fa-yuqsimāni bi-llāhi la-shahādatunā aḥaqqu min shahādatihimā wa-mā iʿtadaynā innā idhan la-mina l-ẓālimīna

verses.eng: That is more likely that they will give testimony according to its [true] objective, or [at least] they would fear that [other] oaths might be taken after their oaths. And fear Allah and listen; and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ أَدْنَىٰ أَنْ يَأْتُوا بِالشَّهَادَةِ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهَا أَوْ يَخَافُوا أَنْ تُرَدَّ أَيْمَانٌ بَعْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَاسْمَعُوا وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الْفَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika adnā an yaʾtū bi-l-shahādati ʿalā wajhihā aw yakhāfū an turadda aymānun baʿda aymānihim wa-ttaqū Allāha wa-smaʿū wa-llāhu lā yahdī l-qawma l-fāsiqīna

verses.eng: On the Day when Allah will assemble the messengers and say, 'What was the response you received?' They will say, 'We have no knowledge. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen.'
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَجْمَعُ اللَّهُ الرُّسُلَ فَيَقُولُ مَاذَا أُجِبْتُمْ قَالُوا لَا عِلْمَ لَنَا إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ عَلَّامُ الْغُيُوبِ
verses.transliteration: Yawma yajmaʿu Allāhu l-rusula fa-yaqūlu mādhā ujibtum qālū lā ʿilma lanā innaka anta ʿallāmu l-ghuyūbi

verses.eng: [The Day] when Allah will say, 'O Jesus, Son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother when I supported you with the Pure Spirit and you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity; and when I taught you writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and when you designed from clay [what was] like the form of a bird with My permission, then you breathed into it, and it became a bird with My permission; and you healed the blind and the leper with My permission; and when you brought forth the dead with My permission; and when I restrained the Children of Israel from [killing] you when you came to them with clear proofs and those who disbelieved among them said, 'This is not but obvious magic.'
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ اللَّهُ يَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ اذْكُرْ نِعْمَتِي عَلَيْكَ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَتِكَ إِذْ أَيَّدْتُكَ بِرُوحِ الْقُدُسِ تُكَلِّمُ النَّاسَ فِي الْمَهْدِ وَكَهْلًا وَإِذْ عَلَّمْتُكَ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحِكْمَةَ وَالتَّوْرَاةَ وَالْإِنْجِيلَ وَإِذْ تَخْلُقُ مِنَ الطِّينِ كَهَيْئَةِ الطَّيْرِ بِإِذْنِي فَتَنْفُخُ فِيهَا فَتَكُونُ طَيْرًا بِإِذْنِي وَتُبْرِئُ الْأَكْمَهَ وَالْأَبْرَصَ بِإِذْنِي وَإِذْ تُخْرِجُ الْمَوْتَىٰ بِإِذْنِي وَإِذْ كَفَفْتُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ عَنْكَ إِذْ جِئْتَهُمْ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْهُمْ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla Allāhu yā ʿīsā bna maryama udhkur niʿmatī ʿalayka wa-ʿalā wālidatika idh ayyadtuka bi-rūḥi l-qudusi tukallimu l-nāsa fī l-mahdi wa-kahlan wa-idh ʿallamtuka l-kitāba wa-l-ḥikmata wa-l-tawrāta wa-l-injīla wa-idh takhluqu mina l-ṭīni ka-hayʾati l-ṭayri bi-idhnī fa-tanfukhu fīhā fa-takūnu ṭayran bi-idhnī wa-tubriʾu l-akmaha wa-l-abraṣa bi-idhnī wa-idh tukhriju l-mawtā bi-idhnī wa-idh kafaftu banī isrāʾīla ʿanka idh jiʾtahum bi-l-bayyināti fa-qāla alladhīna kafarū minhum in hādhā illā siḥrun mubīnun

verses.eng: And [remember] when I inspired to the disciples, 'Believe in Me and in My messenger Jesus.' They said, 'We have believed, so bear witness that indeed we are Muslims [in submission to Allah].'
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَوْحَيْتُ إِلَى الْحَوَارِيِّينَ أَنْ آمِنُوا بِي وَبِرَسُولِي قَالُوا آمَنَّا وَاشْهَدْ بِأَنَّنَا مُسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh awḥaytu ilā l-ḥawāriyyīna an āminū bī wa-bi-rasūlī qālū āmannā wa-shhad bi-annanā muslimūna

verses.eng: [And remember] when the disciples said, 'O Jesus, Son of Mary, can your Lord send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven?' [Jesus] said, 'Fear Allah, if you should be believers.'
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ الْحَوَارِيُّونَ يَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ هَلْ يَسْتَطِيعُ رَبُّكَ أَنْ يُنَزِّلَ عَلَيْنَا مَائِدَةً مِنَ السَّمَاءِ قَالَ اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla l-ḥawāriyyūna yā ʿīsā bna maryama hal yastaṭīʿu rabbuka an yunazzila ʿalaynā māʾidatan mina l-samāʾi qāla ittaqū Allāha in kuntum muʾminīna

verses.eng: They said, 'We wish to eat from it and let our hearts be reassured and know that you have been truthful to us and be among its witnesses.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا نُرِيدُ أَنْ نَأْكُلَ مِنْهَا وَتَطْمَئِنَّ قُلُوبُنَا وَنَعْلَمَ أَنْ قَدْ صَدَقْتَنَا وَنَكُونَ عَلَيْهَا مِنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū nurīdu an naʾkula minhā wa-taṭmaʾinna qulūbunā wa-naʿlama an qad ṣadaqtanā wa-nakūna ʿalayhā mina l-shāhidīna

verses.eng: Said Jesus, the son of Mary, 'O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us, and You are the best of providers.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا أَنْزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَائِدَةً مِنَ السَّمَاءِ تَكُونُ لَنَا عِيدًا لِأَوَّلِنَا وَآخِرِنَا وَآيَةً مِنْكَ وَارْزُقْنَا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ʿīsā bnu maryama Allāhumma rabbanā anzil ʿalaynā māʾidatan mina l-samāʾi takūnu lanā ʿīdan li-awwalinā wa-ākhirinā wa-āyatan minka wa-rzuqnā wa-anta khayru l-rāziqīna

verses.eng: Allah said, 'Indeed, I will send it down to you, but whoever disbelieves afterwards from among you - then indeed will I punish him with a punishment by which I have not punished anyone among the worlds.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ اللَّهُ إِنِّي مُنَزِّلُهَا عَلَيْكُمْ فَمَنْ يَكْفُرْ بَعْدُ مِنْكُمْ فَإِنِّي أُعَذِّبُهُ عَذَابًا لَا أُعَذِّبُهُ أَحَدًا مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla Allāhu innī munazziluhā ʿalaykum fa-man yakfur baʿdu minkum fa-innī uʿadhdhibuhu ʿadhāban lā uʿadhdhibuhu aḥadan mina l-ʿālamīna

verses.eng: And [beware the Day] when Allah will say, 'O Jesus, Son of Mary, did you say to the people, 'Take me and my mother as deities besides Allah?' He will say, 'Exalted are You! It was not for me to say that to which I have no right. If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is within myself, and I do not know what is within Yourself. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen.'
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ اللَّهُ يَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ أَأَنْتَ قُلْتَ لِلنَّاسِ اتَّخِذُونِي وَأُمِّيَ إِلَٰهَيْنِ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ قَالَ سُبْحَانَكَ مَا يَكُونُ لِي أَنْ أَقُولَ مَا لَيْسَ لِي بِحَقٍّ إِنْ كُنْتُ قُلْتُهُ فَقَدْ عَلِمْتَهُ تَعْلَمُ مَا فِي نَفْسِي وَلَا أَعْلَمُ مَا فِي نَفْسِكَ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ عَلَّامُ الْغُيُوبِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh qāla Allāhu yā ʿīsā bna maryama a-anta qulta li-l-nāsi ittakhidhūnī wa-ummiya ilāhayni min dūni Allāhi qāla subḥānaka mā yakūnu lī an aqūla mā laysa lī bi-ḥaqqin in kuntu qultuhu fa-qad ʿalimtahu taʿlamu mā fī nafsī wa-lā aʿlamu mā fī nafsika innaka anta ʿallāmu l-ghuyūbi

verses.eng: I said not to them except what You commanded me - to worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I was among them; but when You took me up, You were the Observer over them, and You are, over all things, Witness.
verses.arabic: مَا قُلْتُ لَهُمْ إِلَّا مَا أَمَرْتَنِي بِهِ أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبَّكُمْ وَكُنْتُ عَلَيْهِمْ شَهِيدًا مَا دُمْتُ فِيهِمْ فَلَمَّا تَوَفَّيْتَنِي كُنْتَ أَنْتَ الرَّقِيبَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَأَنْتَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Mā qultu lahum illā mā amartanī bihi ani uʿbudū Allāha rabbī wa-rabbakum wa-kuntu ʿalayhim shahīdan mā dumtu fīhim fa-lammā tawaffaytanī kunta anta l-raqība ʿalayhim wa-anta ʿalā kulli shayʾin shahīdun

verses.eng: If You should punish them - indeed they are Your servants; but if You forgive them - indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
verses.arabic: إِنْ تُعَذِّبْهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ عِبَادُكَ وَإِنْ تَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ فَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: In tuʿadhdhibhum fa-innahum ʿibāduka wa-in taghfir lahum fa-innaka anta l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

verses.eng: Allah will say, 'This is the Day when the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness.' For them are gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them, and they with Him. That is the great attainment.
verses.arabic: قَالَ اللَّهُ هَٰذَا يَوْمُ يَنْفَعُ الصَّادِقِينَ صِدْقُهُمْ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qāla Allāhu hādhā yawmu yanfaʿu l-ṣādiqīna ṣidquhum lahum jannātun tajrī min taḥtihā l-anhāru khālidīna fīhā abadan raḍiya Allāhu ʿanhum wa-raḍū ʿanhu dhālika l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīmu

verses.eng: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is within them. And He is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: لِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا فِيهِنَّ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Li-llāhi mulku l-samāwāti wa-l-arḍi wa-mā fīhinna wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

verses.eng: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darkness and the light. Then those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord.
verses.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَجَعَلَ الظُّلُمَاتِ وَالنُّورَ ۖ ثُمَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ يَعْدِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī khalaqa l-samāwāti wa-l-arḍa wa-jaʿala l-ẓulumāti wa-l-nūra thumma alladhīna kafarū birabbihim yaʿdilūna

verses.eng: It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term [for you]—a known term—and [then] He is the Knowing.
verses.arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ مِنْ طِينٍ ثُمَّ قَضَىٰ أَجَلًا ۖ وَأَجَلٌ مُسَمًّى عِنْدَهُ ۖ ثُمَّ أَنْتُمْ تَمْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa alladhī khalaqakum min ṭīnin thumma qaḍā ajalan wa-ajalun musamman ʿindahu thumma antum tamtarūna

verses.eng: And He is Allah, [the only deity] in the heavens and the earth. He knows your secrets and what you make public, and He knows that which you earn.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ اللَّهُ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَفِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ يَعْلَمُ سِرَّكُمْ وَجَهْرَكُمْ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-huwa Allāhu fī l-samāwāti wa-fī l-arḍi yaʿlamu sirrakum wa-jahrakum wa-yaʿlamu mā taksibūna

verses.eng: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away from it.
verses.arabic: وَمَا تَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ آيَةٍ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-mā taʾtīhim min āyatin min āyāti rabbihim illā kānū ʿanhā muʿriḍīna

verses.eng: For they had denied the truth when it came to them, but there is going to reach them the news of what they used to ridicule.
verses.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَأْتِيهِمْ أَنْبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-qad kadhdhabū bi-l-ḥaqqi lammā jāʾahum fa-sawfa yaʾtīhim anbāʾu mā kānū bihi yastahziʾūna

verses.eng: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them whom We had established upon the earth as We have not established you? And We sent [rain from] the sky upon them in showers and made rivers flow beneath them; then We destroyed them for their sins and brought forth after them a generation of others.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ مَكَّنَّاهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَا لَمْ نُمَكِّنْ لَكُمْ وَأَرْسَلْنَا السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْهِمْ مِدْرَارًا وَجَعَلْنَا الْأَنْهَارَ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهِمْ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَأَنْشَأْنَا مِنْ بَعْدِهِمْ قَرْنًا آخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: A-lam yaraw kam ahlaknā min qablihim min qarnin makkannāhum fī l-arḍi mā lam numakkin lakum wa-arsalnā l-samāʾa ʿalayhim midrāran wa-jaʿalnā l-anhāra tajrī min taḥtihim fa-ahlaknāhum bi-dhunūbihim wa-anshaʾnā min baʿdihim qarnan ākharīna

verses.eng: And even if We had sent down to you, [O Muhammad], a written scripture on a page and they touched it with their hands, the disbelievers would say, 'This is not but obvious magic.'
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ كِتَابًا فِي قِرْطَاسٍ فَلَمَسُوهُ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ لَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law nazzalnā ʿalayka kitāban fī qirṭāsin fa-lamasūhu bi-aydīhim la-qāla alladhīna kafarū in hādhā illā siḥrun mubīnun

verses.eng: And they say, 'Why was there not sent down to him an angel?' But if We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided, and they would not be reprieved.
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ ۖ وَلَوْ أَنْزَلْنَا مَلَكًا لَقُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ ثُمَّ لَا يُنْظَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālū lawlā unzila ʿalayhi malakun wa-law anzalnā malakan la-quḍiya l-amru thumma lā yunẓarūna

verses.eng: And if We had made him [i.e., the messenger] an angel, We would have made him [appear as] a man, and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves [i.e., confusion].
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ جَعَلْنَاهُ مَلَكًا لَجَعَلْنَاهُ رَجُلًا وَلَلَبَسْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مَا يَلْبِسُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law jaʿalnāhu malakan la-jaʿalnāhu rajulan wa-la-labasnā ʿalayhim mā yalbisūna

verses.eng: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by that which they used to ridicule.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدِ اسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِالَّذِينَ سَخِرُوا مِنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-la-qadi ustuhziʾa bi-rusulin min qablika fa-ḥāqa bi-lladhīna sakhirū minhum mā kānū bihi yastahziʾūna

verses.eng: Say, 'Travel through the land; then observe how was the end of the deniers.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ انْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul sīrū fī l-arḍi thumma unẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mukadhdhibīna

verses.eng: Say, 'To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth?' Say, 'To Allah.' He has decreed upon Himself mercy. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not believe.
verses.arabic: قُلْ لِمَنْ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ قُلْ لِلَّهِ ۖ كَتَبَ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ الرَّحْمَةَ ۚ لَيَجْمَعَنَّكُمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul li-man mā fī l-samāwāti wa-l-arḍi qul li-llāhi kataba ʿalā nafsihi l-raḥmata la-yajmaʿannakum ilā yawmi l-qiyāmati lā rayba fīhi alladhīna khasirū anfusahum fa-hum lā yuʾminūna

verses.eng: And to Him belongs that which reposes by night and by day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَلَهُ مَا سَكَنَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ ۚ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-lahu mā sakana fī l-layli wa-l-nahāri wa-huwa l-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

verses.eng: Say, 'Is it other than Allah I should take as a protector, Creator of the heavens and the earth, while it is He who feeds and is not fed?' Say, 'Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to Allah] and [was commanded], 'Do not be of the polytheists.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ أَتَّخِذُ وَلِيًّا فَاطِرِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَهُوَ يُطْعِمُ وَلَا يُطْعَمُ ۗ قُلْ إِنِّي أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَسْلَمَ ۖ وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul a-ghayra Allāhi attakhidhu waliyyan fāṭiri l-samāwāti wa-l-arḍi wa-huwa yuṭʿimu wa-lā yuṭʿamu qul innī umirtu an akūna awwala man aslama wa-lā takūnanna mina l-mushrikīna

verses.eng: Say, 'Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّي عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Qul innī akhāfu in ʿaṣaytu rabbī ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

verses.eng: Whoever is spared on that Day, He has certainly been merciful to him. And that is the clear attainment.
verses.arabic: مَنْ يُصْرَفْ عَنْهُ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَقَدْ رَحِمَهُ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Man yuṣraf ʿanhu yawmaʾidhin fa-qad raḥimahu wa-dhālika l-fawzu l-mubīnu

verses.eng: If Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ يَمْسَسْكَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ فَلَا كَاشِفَ لَهُ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ وَإِنْ يَمْسَسْكَ بِخَيْرٍ فَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yamsaska Allāhu bi-ḍurrin fa-lā kāshifa lahu illā huwa wa-in yamsaska bi-khayrin fa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

verses.eng: And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الْقَاهِرُ فَوْقَ عِبَادِهِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْخَبيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-huwa l-qāhiru fawqa ʿibādihi wa-huwa l-ḥakīmu l-khabīru

verses.eng: Say, 'What thing is greatest in testimony?' Say, 'Allah is witness between me and you. And this Qur'an was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you [truly] testify that with Allah there are other deities?' Say, 'I will not testify [to that].' Say, 'Indeed, He is but one God, and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him].'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَيُّ شَيْءٍ أَكْبَرُ شَهَادَةً ۖ قُلِ اللَّهُ ۖ شَهِيدٌ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَأُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنُ لِأُنْذِرَكُمْ بِهِ وَمَنْ بَلَغَ ۚ أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَشْهَدُونَ أَنَّ مَعَ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً أُخْرَىٰ ۚ قُلْ لَا أَشْهَدُ ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَا هُوَ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ وَإِنَّنِي بَرِيءٌ مِمَّا تُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ayyu shayʾin akbaru shahādatan quli Allāhu shahīdun baynī wa-baynakum wa-ūḥiya ilayya hādhā l-qurʾānu li-undhirakum bihi wa-man balagh a-innakum la-tashhadūna anna maʿa Allāhi ālihatan ukhrā qul lā ashhadu qul innamā huwa ilāhun wāḥidun wa-innanī barīʾun mimmā tushrikūna

verses.eng: Those to whom We gave the Scripture recognize him [i.e., the Prophet] as they recognize their [own] sons. Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter] do not believe.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ يَعْرِفُونَهُ كَمَا يَعْرِفُونَ أَبْنَاءَهُمُ ۘ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna ātaynāhumu l-kitāba yaʿrifūnahu kamā yaʿrifūna abnāʾahumu alladhīna khasirū anfusahum fa-hum lā yuʾminūna

verses.eng: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies His signs? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِآيَاتِهِ ۗ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-man aẓlamu mimani iftarā ʿalā Allāhi kadhiban aw kadhdhaba bi-āyātihi innahu lā yufliḥu l-ẓālimūna

verses.eng: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather them all then say to those who associated others with Allah, 'Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim?'
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ نَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا أَيْنَ شُرَكَاؤُكُمُ الَّذِينَ كُنْتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-yawma naḥshuruhum jamīʿan thumma naqūlu li-lladhīna ashrakū ayna shurakāʾukumu alladhīna kuntum tazʿumūna

verses.eng: Then their excuse will not be except to say, 'By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who associated.'
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لَمْ تَكُنْ فِتْنَتُهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا وَاللَّهِ رَبِّنَا مَا كُنَّا مُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma lam takun fitnatuhum illā an qālū wa-llāhi rabbinā mā kunnā mushrikīna

verses.eng: See how they will lie about themselves. And lost from them will be what they used to invent.
verses.arabic: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَذَبُوا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِهِمْ ۚ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Unẓur kayfa kadhabū ʿalā anfusihim wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūna

verses.eng: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. Even when they come to you arguing with you, those who disbelieve say, 'This is not but legends of the former peoples.'
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَسْتَمِعُ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَجَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَنْ يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِي آذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًا ۚ وَإِنْ يَرَوْا كُلَّ آيَةٍ لَا يُؤْمِنُوا بِهَا ۚ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءُوكَ يُجَادِلُونَكَ يَقُولُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-minhum man yastamiʿu ilayka wa-jaʿalnā ʿalā qulūbihim akinnatan an yafqahūhu wa-fī ādhānihim waqran wa-in yaraw kulla āyatin lā yuʾminū bihā ḥattā idhā jāʾūka yujādilūnaka yaqūlu alladhīna kafarū in hādhā illā asāṭīru l-awwalīna

verses.eng: And they prevent [others] from him and are [themselves] remote from him. And they do not destroy except themselves, but they perceive [it] not.
verses.arabic: وَهُمْ يَنْهَوْنَ عَنْهُ وَيَنْأَوْنَ عَنْهُ ۖ وَإِنْ يُهْلِكُونَ إِلَّا أَنْفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-hum yanhawna ʿanhu wa-yanʾawna ʿanhu wa-in yuhlikūna illā anfusahum wa-mā yashʿurūna

verses.eng: If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, 'Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers.'
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذْ وُقِفُوا عَلَى النَّارِ فَقَالُوا يَا لَيْتَنَا نُرَدُّ وَلَا نُكَذِّبَ بِآيَاتِ رَبِّنَا وَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law tarā idh wuqifū ʿalā l-nāri fa-qālū yā laytanā nuraddu wa-lā nukadhdhiba bi-āyāti rabbinā wa-nakūna mina l-muʾminīna

verses.eng: But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them. And even if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden; and indeed, they are liars.
verses.arabic: بَلْ بَدَا لَهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يُخْفُونَ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ وَلَوْ رُدُّوا لَعَادُوا لِمَا نُهُوا عَنْهُ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal badā lahum mā kānū yukhfūna min qablu wa-law ruddū la-ʿādū li-mā nuhū ʿanhu wa-innahum la-kādhibūna

verses.eng: And they say, 'There is none but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَبْعُوثِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālū in hiya illā ḥayātunā l-dunyā wa-mā naḥnu bi-mabʿūthīna

verses.eng: If you could but see when they will be made to stand before their Lord. He will say, 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord.' He will [then] say, 'So taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve.'
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذْ وُقِفُوا عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ قَالَ أَلَيْسَ هَٰذَا بِالْحَقِّ ۚ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّنَا ۚ قَالَ فَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-law tarā idh wuqifū ʿalā rabbihim qāla a-laysa hādhā bi-l-ḥaqqi qālū balā wa-rabbinā qāla fa-dhūqū l-ʿadhāba bi-mā kuntum takfurūna

verses.eng: They will have lost those who disbelieved that they will encounter Allah, until when the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly they will say, 'Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it,' while they bear their burdens on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
verses.arabic: قَدْ خَسِرَ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِلِقَاءِ اللَّهِ ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَتْهُمُ السَّاعَةُ بَغْتَةً قَالُوا يَا حَسْرَتَنَا عَلَىٰ مَا فَرَّطْنَا فِيهَا وَهُمْ يَحْمِلُونَ أَوْزَارَهُمْ عَلَىٰ ظُهُورِهِمْ ۚ أَلَا سَاءَ مَا يَزِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qad khasira alladhīna kadhabū biliqā'i Allāhi ḥattā idhā jā'at-humu l-sā'atu baghtatan qālū yā ḥasratanā 'alā mā farraṭnā fīhā wa-hum yaḥmilūna awzārahum 'alā ẓuhūrihim alā sā'a mā yazirūn

verses.eng: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah, so will you not reason?
verses.arabic: وَمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا إِلَّا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ ۖ وَلَلدَّارُ الْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā l-ḥayātu l-dunyā illā la'ibun wa lahwun wa la-dāru l-ākhiratu khayrun li-lladhīna yattaqūn afalā ta'qilūn

verses.eng: We know that you, [O Muhammad], are saddened by what they say. And indeed, they do not call you untruthful, but it is the verses of Allah that the wrongdoers reject.
verses.arabic: قَدْ نَعْلَمُ إِنَّهُ لَيَحْزُنُكَ الَّذِي يَقُولُونَ ۖ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَا يُكَذِّبُونَكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ يَجْحَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qad na'lamu innahu layaḥzunuka alladhī yaqūlūn fa-innahum lā yukadhibūnaka wa lākinna ẓ-ẓālimīna bi-āyāti Allāhi yajḥadūn

verses.eng: And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over [the effects of] denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words of Allah. And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كُذِّبَتْ رُسُلٌ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَصَبَرُوا عَلَىٰ مَا كُذِّبُوا وَأُوذُوا حَتَّىٰ أَتَاهُمْ نَصْرُنَا ۚ وَلَا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَكَ مِن نَّبَإِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad kudhibat rusulun min qablika fa-ṣabarū 'alā mā kudhibū wa ūdhū ḥattā atāhum naṣrunā wa lā mubaddila li-kalimāti Allāhi wa laqad jā'aka min naba'i l-mursalīn

verses.eng: And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign, [then do so]. But if Allah had willed, He would have united them upon guidance. So never be of the ignorant.
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيْكَ إِعْرَاضُهُمْ فَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَن تَبْتَغِيَ نَفَقًا فِي الْأَرْضِ أَوْ سُلَّمًا فِي السَّمَاءِ فَتَأْتِيَهُم بِآيَةٍ ۚ وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَمَعَهُمْ عَلَى الْهُدَىٰ ۚ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْجَاهِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in kāna kabura 'alayka i'rāḍuhum fa-ini staṭa'ta an tabtaghiya nafaqan fī l-arḍi aw sullaman fī s-samā'i fa-ta'tiyahum bi-āyatin wa law shā'a Allāhu la-jama'ahum 'alā l-hudā fa lā takūnanna mina l-jāhilīn

verses.eng: Only those who hear will respond. But the dead - Allah will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَسْتَجِيبُ الَّذِينَ يَسْمَعُونَ ۘ وَالْمَوْتَىٰ يَبْعَثُهُمُ اللَّهُ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā yastajību alladhīna yasma'ūn wa l-mawtā yab'athuhumu Allāhu thumma ilayhi yurja'ūn

verses.eng: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' Say, 'Indeed, Allah is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ آيَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۚ قُلْ إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَادِرٌ عَلَىٰ أَن يُنَزِّلَ آيَةً وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālū law lā nuzzila 'alayhi āyatun min rabbihi qul inna Allāha qādirun 'alā an yunazzila āyatan wa lākinna aktharahum lā ya'lamūn

verses.eng: And there is no creature on [or within] the earth or bird that flies with its wings except [that they are] communities like you. We have not neglected in the Register a thing. Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.
verses.arabic: وَمَا مِن دَابَّةٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا طَائِرٍ يَطِيرُ بِجَنَاحَيْهِ إِلَّا أُمَمٌ أَمْثَالُكُم ۚ مَّا فَرَّطْنَا فِي الْكِتَابِ مِن شَيْءٍ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يُحْشَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā min dābbatin fī l-arḍi wa lā ṭā'irin yaṭīru bijanāḥayhi illā umamun amthālukum mā farraṭnā fī l-kitābi min shay'in thumma ilā rabbihim yuḥsharūn

verses.eng: But those who deny Our verses are deaf and dumb within darknesses. Whomever Allah wills - He leaves astray; and whomever He wills - He puts him on a straight path.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا صُمٌّ وَبُكْمٌ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ ۗ مَن يَشَإِ اللَّهُ يُضْلِلْهُ وَمَن يَشَأْ يَجْعَلْهُ عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna kadhabū bi-āyātinā ṣummun wa bukmun fī ẓ-ẓulumāti man yasha'i Allāhu yuḍlilhu wa man yasha' yaj'alhu 'alā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

verses.eng: Say, 'Have you considered: if there should come to you the punishment of Allah or there should come to you the Hour, is it other than Allah you would invoke, if you should be truthful?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتَكُمْ إِنْ أَتَاكُمْ عَذَابُ اللَّهِ أَوْ أَتَتْكُمُ السَّاعَةُ أَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ تَدْعُونَ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul a-ra'aytakum in atākum 'adhābu Allāhi aw atatkumu s-sā'atu a-ghayra Allāhi tad'ūn in kuntum ṣādiqīn

verses.eng: No, it is Him [alone] you would invoke, and He would remove that for which you invoked Him if He willed, and you would forget what you associate [with Him].
verses.arabic: بَلْ إِيَّاهُ تَدْعُونَ فَيَكْشِفُ مَا تَدْعُونَ إِلَيْهِ إِن شَاءَ وَتَنسَوْنَ مَا تُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal iyyāhu tad'ūna fa-yakshifu mā tad'ūna ilayhi in shā'a wa tansawna mā tushrikūn

verses.eng: And We have certainly sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمَمٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُم بِالْبَأْسَاءِ وَالضَّرَّاءِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَضَرَّعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnā ilā umamin min qablika fa-akhadhnāhum bi-l-ba'sā'i wa ḍ-ḍarrā'i la'allahum yataḍarra'ūn

verses.eng: Then why, when Our punishment came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.
verses.arabic: فَلَوْلَا إِذْ جَاءَهُم بَأْسُنَا تَضَرَّعُوا وَلَٰكِن قَسَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-law lā idh jā'ahum ba'sunā taḍarra'ū wa lākin qasat qulūbuhum wa zayyana lahumu sh-shayṭānu mā kānū ya'malūn

verses.eng: So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were [then] in despair.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا نَسُوا مَا ذُكِّرُوا بِهِ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ أَبْوَابَ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا فَرِحُوا بِمَا أُوتُوا أَخَذْنَاهُم بَغْتَةً فَإِذَا هُم مُّبْلِسُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-lammā nasū mā dhukkirū bihi fataḥnā 'alayhim abwāba kulli shay'in ḥattā idhā fariḥū bimā ūtū akhadhnāhum baghtatan fa-idhā hum mublisūn

verses.eng: So the people that committed wrong were eliminated. And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: فَقُطِعَ دَابِرُ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ۚ وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-quṭi'a dābiru l-qawmi alladhīna ẓalamū wa l-ḥamdu lillāhi rabbi l-'ālamīn

verses.eng: Say, 'Have you considered: if Allah should take away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your hearts, which deity other than Allah could bring them [back] to you?' Look how We diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَخَذَ اللَّهُ سَمْعَكُمْ وَأَبْصَارَكُمْ وَخَتَمَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِكُم مَّنْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِهِ ۗ انظُرْ كَيْفَ نُصَرِّفُ الْآيَاتِ ثُمَّ هُمْ يَصْدِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum in akhadha Allāhu sam'akum wa abṣārakum wa khatama 'alā qulūbikum man ilāhun ghayru Allāhi ya'tīkum bihi unẓur kayfa nusarrifu l-āyāti thumma hum yaṣdifūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Have you considered: if the punishment of Allah should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتَكُمْ إِنْ أَتَاكُمْ عَذَابُ اللَّهِ بَغْتَةً أَوْ جَهْرَةً هَلْ يُهْلَكُ إِلَّا الْقَوْمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ara'aytakum in atākum 'adhābu Allāhi baghtatan aw jahratan hal yuhlaku illā l-qawmu ẓ-ẓālimūn

verses.eng: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. So whoever believes and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
verses.arabic: وَمَا نُرْسِلُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ ۖ فَمَنْ آمَنَ وَأَصْلَحَ فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā nursilu l-mursalīna illā mubashshirīna wa mundhirīna fa-man āmana wa aṣlaḥa fa-lā khawfun 'alayhim wa lā hum yaḥzanūn

verses.eng: But those who deny Our verses - the punishment will touch them for their defiant disobedience.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا يَمَسُّهُمُ الْعَذَابُ بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْسُقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna kadhabū bi-āyātinā yamassuhumu l-'adhābu bimā kānū yafsuqūn

verses.eng: Say, 'I do not tell you that I have the depositories [of provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me.' Say, 'Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Then will you not give thought?'
verses.arabic: قُل لَّا أَقُولُ لَكُمْ عِندِي خَزَائِنُ اللَّهِ وَلَا أَعْلَمُ الْغَيْبَ وَلَا أَقُولُ لَكُمْ إِنِّي مَلَكٌ ۖ إِنْ أَتَّبِعُ إِلَّا مَا يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ ۚ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِي الْأَعْمَىٰ وَالْبَصِيرُ ۚ أَفَلَا تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul lā aqūlu lakum 'indī khazā'inu Allāhi wa lā a'lamu l-ghayba wa lā aqūlu lakum innī malakun in attabi'u illā mā yūḥā ilayya qul hal yastawī l-a'mā wa l-baṣīr afalā tatafakkarūn

verses.eng: And warn by it [i.e., the Qur'an] those who fear that they will be gathered before their Lord - for them besides Him will be no protector and no intercessor - that they might become righteous.
verses.arabic: وَأَنذِرْ بِهِ الَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ أَن يُحْشَرُوا إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ ۙ لَيْسَ لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِ وَلِيٌّ وَلَا شَفِيعٌ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa andhir bihi alladhīna yakhāfūna an yuḥsharū ilā rabbihim laysa lahum min dūnihi waliyyun wa lā shafī'un la'allahum yattaqūn

verses.eng: And do not send away those who call upon their Lord morning and afternoon, seeking His countenance. Not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account. So were you to send them away, you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَطْرُدِ الَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِالْغَدَاةِ وَالْعَشِيِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَهُ ۖ مَا عَلَيْكَ مِنْ حِسَابِهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ وَمَا مِنْ حِسَابِكَ عَلَيْهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ فَتَطْرُدَهُمْ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taṭrudi alladhīna yad'ūna rabbahum bi-l-ghadāti wa l-'ashiyyi yurīdūna wajhahu mā 'alayka min ḥisābihim min shay'in wa mā min ḥisābika 'alayhim min shay'in fa-taṭrudahum fa-takūna mina ẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And thus We have tried some of them through others that they [i.e., the disbelievers] might say, 'Is it these whom Allah has favored among us?' Is not Allah most knowing of those who are grateful?
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ فَتَنَّا بَعْضَهُم بِبَعْضٍ لِّيَقُولُوا أَهَٰؤُلَاءِ مَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مِّن بَيْنِنَا ۗ أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِأَعْلَمَ بِالشَّاكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika fatannā ba'ḍahum bi-ba'ḍin li-yaqūlū a-hā'ulā'i manna Allāhu 'alayhim min bayninā a-laysa Allāhu bi-a'lama bi-sh-shākirīn

verses.eng: And when those come to you who believe in Our verses, say, 'Peace be upon you. Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy: that any of you who does wrong out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.'
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا جَاءَكَ الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِآيَاتِنَا فَقُلْ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ كَتَبَ رَبُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ الرَّحْمَةَ ۖ أَنَّهُ مَنْ عَمِلَ مِنكُمْ سُوءًا بِجَهَالَةٍ ثُمَّ تَابَ مِن بَعْدِهِ وَأَصْلَحَ فَأَنَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā jā'aka alladhīna yu'minūna bi-āyātinā fa-qul salāmun 'alaykum kataba rabbukum 'alā nafsihi r-raḥmata annahu man 'amila minkum sū'an bi-jahālatin thumma tāba min ba'dihi wa aṣlaḥa fa-annahu ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الْآيَاتِ وَلِتَسْتَبِينَ سَبِيلُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika nufaṣṣilu l-āyāti wa li-tastabīna sabīlu l-mujrimīn

verses.eng: Say, 'Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides Allah.' Say, 'I will not follow your desires, for I would then have gone astray, and I would not be of the [rightly] guided.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي نُهِيتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ الَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۚ قُل لَّا أَتَّبِعُ أَهْوَاءَكُمْ ۙ قَدْ ضَلَلْتُ إِذًا وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul innī nuhītu an a'budu alladhīna tad'ūna min dūni Allāhi qul lā attabi'u ahwā'akum qad ḍalaltu idhan wa mā anā mina l-muhtadīn

verses.eng: Say, 'Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have denied it. I do not have that which you are impatient for [i.e., the punishment]. The decision is only for Allah. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّي وَكَذَّبْتُم بِهِ ۚ مَا عِندِي مَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِهِ ۚ إِنِ الْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۖ يَقُصُّ الْحَقَّ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الْفَاصِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul innī 'alā bayyinatin min rabbī wa kadhdhabtum bihi mā 'indī mā tasta'jilūna bihi in al-ḥukmu illā lillāhi yaquṣṣu l-ḥaqqa wa huwa khayru l-fāṣilīn

verses.eng: Say, 'If I had that for which you are impatient, the matter would have been decided between me and you, but Allah is most knowing of the wrongdoers.'
verses.arabic: قُل لَّوْ أَنَّ عِندِي مَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِهِ لَقُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِالظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul law anna 'indī mā tasta'jilūna bihi la-quḍiya l-amru baynī wa baynakum wa Allāhu a'lamu bi-ẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record.
verses.arabic: وَعِندَهُ مَفَاتِحُ الْغَيْبِ لَا يَعْلَمُهَا إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِي الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ ۚ وَمَا تَسْقُطُ مِن وَرَقَةٍ إِلَّا يَعْلَمُهَا وَلَا حَبَّةٍ فِي ظُلُمَاتِ الْأَرْضِ وَلَا رَطْبٍ وَلَا يَابِسٍ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa 'indahu mafātīḥu l-ghaybi lā ya'lamuhā illā huwa wa ya'lamu mā fī l-barri wa l-baḥri wa mā tasquṭu min waraqatin illā ya'lamuhā wa lā ḥabbatin fī ẓulumāti l-arḍi wa lā raṭbin wa lā yābisin illā fī kitābin mubīn

verses.eng: And it is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein that a specified term may be fulfilled. Then to Him will be your return; then He will inform you about what you used to do.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي يَتَوَفَّاكُم بِاللَّيْلِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا جَرَحْتُم بِالنَّهَارِ ثُمَّ يَبْعَثُكُمْ فِيهِ لِيُقْضَىٰ أَجَلٌ مُّسَمًّى ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ مَرْجِعُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa alladhī yatawaffākum bi-l-layli wa ya'lamu mā jaraḥtum bi-n-nahāri thumma yab'athukum fīhi li-yuḍā ajalun musamman thumma ilayhi marji'ukum thumma yunabbi'ukum bi-mā kuntum ta'malūn

verses.eng: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him, and they do not fail [in their duties].
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الْقَاهِرُ فَوْقَ عِبَادِهِ ۖ وَيُرْسِلُ عَلَيْكُمْ حَفَظَةً حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَ أَحَدَكُمُ الْمَوْتُ تَوَفَّتْهُ رُسُلُنَا وَهُمْ لَا يُفَرِّطُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa al-qāhiru fawqa ʿibādihi wa yursilu ʿalaykum ḥafaẓatan ḥattā idhā jā'a aḥadakumu al-mawtu tawaffathu rusulunā wa hum lā yufarriṭūn

verses.eng: Then they [i.e., the souls] are returned to Allah, their true Lord. Unquestionably, His is the judgement, and He is the swiftest of accountants.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ رُدُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ مَوْلَاهُمُ الْحَقِّ ۚ أَلَا لَهُ الْحُكْمُ وَهُوَ أَسْرَعُ الْحَاسِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ruddū ilā Allāhi mawlāhumu al-ḥaqqi alā lahu al-ḥukmu wa huwa asraʿu al-ḥāsibīn

verses.eng: Say, 'Who rescues you from the darknesses of the land and sea [when] you call upon Him imploring [aloud] and privately, "If He should save us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the thankful."'
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَنْ يُنَجِّيكُمْ مِنْ ظُلُمَاتِ الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ تَدْعُونَهُ تَضَرُّعًا وَخُفْيَةً لَّئِنْ أَنجَانَا مِنْ هَٰذِهِ لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الشَّاكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul man yunajjīkum min ẓulumāti al-barri wa al-baḥri tadʿūnahu taḍarruʿan wa khufyatan la'in anjānā min hādhihi lanakūnanna mina al-shākirīn

verses.eng: Say, 'It is Allah who saves you from it and from every distress; then you [still] associate others with Him.'
verses.arabic: قُلِ اللَّهُ يُنَجِّيكُم مِّنْهَا وَمِن كُلِّ كَرْبٍ ثُمَّ أَنتُمْ تُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Quli Allāhu yunajjīkum minhā wa min kulli karbin thumma antum tushrikūn

verses.eng: Say, 'He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another.' Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.
verses.arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الْقَادِرُ عَلَىٰ أَن يَبْعَثَ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابًا مِّن فَوْقِكُمْ أَوْ مِن تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِكُمْ أَوْ يَلْبِسَكُمْ شِيَعًا وَيُذِيقَ بَعْضَكُم بَأْسَ بَعْضٍ ۗ انظُرْ كَيْفَ نُصَرِّفُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul huwa al-qādiru ʿalā an yabʿatha ʿalaykum ʿadhāban min fawqikum aw min taḥti arjulikum aw yalbisakum shiyaʿan wa yudhīqa baʿḍakum ba'sa baʿḍin unẓur kayfa nuṣarrifu al-āyāti laʿallahum yafqahūn

verses.eng: And your people have denied it [i.e., the Qur'an] while it is the truth. Say, 'I am not over you a manager.'
verses.arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِهِ قَوْمُكَ وَهُوَ الْحَقُّ ۚ قُل لَّسْتُ عَلَيْكُم بِوَكِيلٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhdhaba bihi qawmuka wa huwa al-ḥaqqu qul lastu ʿalaykum biwakīl

verses.eng: For every happening is a finality; and you are going to know.
verses.arabic: لِّكُلِّ نَبَإٍ مُّسْتَقَرٌّ ۚ وَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Likulli naba'in mustaqarrun wa sawfa taʿlamūn

verses.eng: And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ الَّذِينَ يَخُوضُونَ فِي آيَاتِنَا فَأَعْرِضْ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يَخُوضُوا فِي حَدِيثٍ غَيْرِهِ ۚ وَإِمَّا يُنسِيَنَّكَ الشَّيْطَانُ فَلَا تَقْعُدْ بَعْدَ الذِّكْرَىٰ مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā ra'ayta alladhīna yakhūḍūna fī āyātinā fa-aʿriḍ ʿanhum ḥattā yakhūḍū fī ḥadīthin ghayrihi wa immā yunsiyannaka al-shayṭānu falā taqʿud baʿda al-dhikrā maʿa al-qawmi al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And those who fear Allah are not accountable for them [i.e., the disbelievers] at all, but [only for] a reminder - that perhaps they will fear Him.
verses.arabic: وَمَا عَلَى الَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ مِنْ حِسَابِهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ وَلَٰكِن ذِكْرَىٰ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā ʿalā alladhīna yattaqūna min ḥisābihim min shay'in wa lākin dhikrā laʿallahum yattaqūn

verses.eng: And leave those who take their religion as amusement and diversion and whom the worldly life has deluded. But remind with it [i.e., the Qur'an] lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have other than Allah no protector and no intercessor. And if it should offer every compensation, it would not be taken from it. Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
verses.arabic: وَذَرِ الَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا دِينَهُمْ لَعِبًا وَلَهْوًا وَغَرَّتْهُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا ۚ وَذَكِّرْ بِهِ أَن تُبْسَلَ نَفْسٌ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَلِيٌّ وَلَا شَفِيعٌ وَإِن تَعْدِلْ كُلَّ عَدْلٍ لَّا يُؤْخَذْ مِنْهَا ۗ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ أُبْسِلُوا بِمَا كَسَبُوا ۖ لَهُمْ شَرَابٌ مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ وَعَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa dhari alladhīna ittakhadhū dīnahum laʿiban wa lahwān wa gharathumu al-ḥayātu al-dunyā wa dhakkir bihi an tubsala nafsun bi-mā kasabat laysa lahā min dūni Allāhi waliyyun wa lā shafīʿun wa in taʿdil kulla ʿadlin lā yu'khadh minhā ulā'ika alladhīna ubsilū bi-mā kasabū lahum sharābun min ḥamīmin wa ʿadhābun alīmun bi-mā kānū yakfurūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Shall we invoke instead of Allah that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be turned back on our heels after Allah has guided us? [We would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to guidance, [calling], 'Come to us.' Say, 'Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance; and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَنَدْعُو مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُنَا وَلَا يَضُرُّنَا وَنُرَدُّ عَلَىٰ أَعْقَابِنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَانَا اللَّهُ كَالَّذِي اسْتَهْوَتْهُ الشَّيَاطِينُ فِي الْأَرْضِ حَيْرَانَ لَهُ أَصْحَابٌ يَدْعُونَهُ إِلَى الْهُدَى ائْتِنَا ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ هُدَى اللَّهِ هُوَ الْهُدَىٰ ۖ وَأُمِرْنَا لِنُسْلِمَ لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul a-nadʿū min dūni Allāhi mā lā yanfaʿunā wa lā yaḍurrunā wa nuraddu ʿalā aʿqābinā baʿda idh hadānā Allāhu ka-alladhī istahwathu al-shayāṭīnu fī al-arḍi ḥayrāna lahu aṣḥābun yadʿūnahu ilā al-hudā i'tinā qul inna hudā Allāhi huwa al-hudā wa umirnā li-nuslima li-rabbi al-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: And to establish prayer and fear Him.' And it is He to whom you will be gathered.
verses.arabic: وَأَنْ أَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَاتَّقُوهُ ۚ وَهُوَ الَّذِي إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa an aqīmū al-ṣalāta wa attaqūhu wa huwa alladhī ilayhi tuḥsharūn

verses.eng: And it is He who created the heavens and earth in truth. And the day He says, 'Be,' and it is, His word is the truth. And His is the dominion [on] the Day the Horn is blown. Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ وَيَوْمَ يَقُولُ كُن فَيَكُونُ ۚ قَوْلُهُ الْحَقُّ ۚ وَلَهُ الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ ۚ وَهُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْخَبِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa alladhī khalaqa al-samāwāti wa al-arḍa bi-al-ḥaqqi wa yawma yaqūlu kun fa-yakūnu qawluhu al-ḥaqqu wa lahu al-mulku yawma yunfakhu fī al-ṣūri ʿālimu al-ghaybi wa al-shahādati wa huwa al-ḥakīmu al-khabīr

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error.'
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ لِأَبِيهِ آزَرَ أَتَتَّخِذُ أَصْنَامًا آلِهَةً ۖ إِنِّي أَرَاكَ وَقَوْمَكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa idh qāla Ibrāhīmu li-abīhi Āzara a-tattakhidhu aṣnāman ālihatan innī arāka wa qawmaka fī ḍalālin mubīn

verses.eng: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith].
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُرِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ مَلَكُوتَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلِيَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُوقِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika nurī Ibrāhīma malakūta al-samāwāti wa al-arḍi wa li-yakūna mina al-mūqinīn

verses.eng: When the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, 'This is my lord.' But when it set, he said, 'I like not those that disappear.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَنَّ عَلَيْهِ اللَّيْلُ رَأَىٰ كَوْكَبًا ۖ قَالَ هَٰذَا رَبِّي ۖ فَلَمَّا أَفَلَ قَالَ لَا أُحِبُّ الْآفِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā janna ʿalayhi al-laylu raʾā kawkaban qāla hādhā rabbī falammā afala qāla lā uḥibbu al-āfilīn

verses.eng: When he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my lord.' But when it set, he said, 'Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the misguided people.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَى الْقَمَرَ بَازِغًا قَالَ هَٰذَا رَبِّي ۖ فَلَمَّا أَفَلَ قَالَ لَئِن لَّمْ يَهْدِنِي رَبِّي لَأَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الضَّالِّينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā raʾā al-qamara bāzighan qāla hādhā rabbī falammā afala qāla la-in lam yahdinī rabbī la-akūnanna mina al-qawmi al-ḍāllīn

verses.eng: When he saw the sun rising, he said, 'This is my lord; this is greater.' But when it set, he said, 'O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allah.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَى الشَّمْسَ بَازِغَةً قَالَ هَٰذَا رَبِّي هَٰذَا أَكْبَرُ ۖ فَلَمَّا أَفَلَتْ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِّمَّا تُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā raʾā al-shamsa bāzighatan qāla hādhā rabbī hādhā akbaru falammā afalat qāla yā qawmi innī barīʾun mimmā tushrikūn

verses.eng: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allah.'
verses.arabic: إِنِّي وَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي فَطَرَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ حَنِيفًا ۖ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innī wajjahtu wajhiya lilladhī faṭara al-samāwāti wa-al-arḍa ḥanīfan wa-mā anā mina al-mushrikīn

verses.eng: And his people argued with him. He said, 'Do you argue with me concerning Allah while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed] unless my Lord should will something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge. Then will you not remember?'
verses.arabic: وَحَاجَّهُ قَوْمُهُ ۚ قَالَ أَتُحَاجُّونِّي فِي اللَّهِ وَقَدْ هَدَانِ ۚ وَلَا أَخَافُ مَا تُشْرِكُونَ بِهِ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ رَبِّي شَيْئًا ۗ وَسِعَ رَبِّي كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا ۗ أَفَلَا تَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ḥājjahu qawmuhu qāla a-tuḥājjūnī fī Allāhi wa-qad hadānī wa-lā akhāfu mā tushrikūna bihi illā an yashāʾa rabbī shayʾan wasiʿa rabbī kulla shayʾin ʿilman afalā tataḍakkarūn

verses.eng: And how should I fear what you associate while you do not fear that you have associated with Allah that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?'
verses.arabic: وَكَيْفَ أَخَافُ مَا أَشْرَكْتُمْ وَلَا تَخَافُونَ أَنَّكُمْ أَشْرَكْتُم بِاللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِ عَلَيْكُمْ سُلْطَانًا ۚ فَأَيُّ الْفَرِيقَيْنِ أَحَقُّ بِالْأَمْنِ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-kayfa akhāfu mā ashraktum wa-lā takhāfūna annakum ashraktum bi-llāhi mā lam yunazzil bihi ʿalaykum sul'ṭānan fa-ayyu al-farīqayni aḥaqqu bi-al-amni in kuntum taʿlamūn

verses.eng: They who believe and do not mix their belief with injustice - those will have security, and they are [rightly] guided.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَلَمْ يَلْبِسُوا إِيمَانَهُم بِظُلْمٍ أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الْأَمْنُ وَهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna āmanū wa-lam yalbisū īmānahum bi-ẓulmin ulāʾika lahumu al-amnu wa-hum muhtadūn

verses.eng: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ حُجَّتُنَا آتَيْنَاهَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ ۚ نَرْفَعُ دَرَجَاتٍ مَّن نَّشَاءُ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-tilka ḥujjatunā ātaynāhā Ibrāhīma ʿalā qawmihi narfaʿu darajātin man nashāʾu inna rabbaka ḥakīmun ʿalīmun

verses.eng: And We gave to him [i.e., Abraham] Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.
verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۚ كُلًّا هَدَيْنَا ۚ وَنُوحًا هَدَيْنَا مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِ دَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ وَأَيُّوبَ وَيُوسُفَ وَمُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-wahhabnā lahu Is'ḥāqa wa-Yaʿqūba kullan hadaynā wa-Nūḥan hadaynā min qablu wa-min dhurriyyatihi Dāwūda wa-Sulaymāna wa-Ayyūba wa-Yūsufa wa-Mūsā wa-Hārūna wa-kadhālika najzī al-muḥ'sinīn

verses.eng: And Zechariah and John and Jesus and Elias - and all were of the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَزَكَرِيَّا وَيَحْيَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَإِلْيَاسَ ۖ كُلٌّ مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-Zakariyyā wa-Yaḥyā wa-ʿĪsā wa-Ilyāsa kullun mina al-ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot - and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَيُونُسَ وَلُوطًا ۚ وَكُلًّا فَضَّلْنَا عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-Is'māʿīla wa-al-Yasaʿa wa-Yūnusa wa-Lūṭan wa-kullan faḍḍalnā ʿalā al-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: And [some] among their fathers and their descendants and their brothers - and We chose them and We guided them to a straight path.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آبَائِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّاتِهِمْ وَإِخْوَانِهِمْ ۖ وَاجْتَبَيْنَاهُمْ وَهَدَيْنَاهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa-min ābāʾihim wa-dhurriyyātihim wa-ikhwānihim wa-ijtabaynāhum wa-hadaynāhum ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

verses.eng: That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with Allah, then worthless for them would be whatever they were doing.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ هُدَى اللَّهِ يَهْدِي بِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ ۚ وَلَوْ أَشْرَكُوا لَحَبِطَ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika hudā Allāhi yahdī bihi man yashāʾu min ʿibādihi wa-law ashrakū laḥabiṭa ʿanhum mā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture and authority and prophethood. But if they [i.e., the disbelievers] deny it, then We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disbelievers.
verses.arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحُكْمَ وَالنُّبُوَّةَ ۚ فَإِن يَكْفُرْ بِهَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ فَقَدْ وَكَّلْنَا بِهَا قَوْمًا لَّيْسُوا بِهَا بِكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ulāʾika alladhīna ātaynāhumu al-kitāba wa-al-ḥuk'ma wa-al-nubuwwata fa-in yakfur bihā hāʾulāʾi fa-qad wakkalnā bihā qawman laysū bihā bikāfirīn

verses.eng: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, so from their guidance take an example. Say, 'I ask of you for it [i.e., this message] no payment. It is not but a reminder for the worlds.'
verses.arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ هَدَى اللَّهُ ۖ فَبِهُدَاهُمُ اقْتَدِهْ ۗ قُل لَّا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًا ۖ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ulāʾika alladhīna hadā Allāhu fa-bihudāhumu iqtadih qul lā asʾalukum ʿalayhi ajran in huwa illā dhik'rā lil-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: And they did not appraise Allah with true appraisal when they said, 'Allah did not reveal to a human being anything.' Say, 'Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought as light and guidance to the people?' You [Jews] make it into pages, disclosing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers.' Say, 'Allah [revealed it].' Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.
verses.arabic: وَمَا قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدْرِهِ إِذْ قَالُوا مَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ بَشَرٍ مِّن شَيْءٍ ۗ قُلْ مَنْ أَنزَلَ الْكِتَابَ الَّذِي جَاءَ بِهِ مُوسَىٰ نُورًا وَهُدًى لِّلنَّاسِ ۖ تَجْعَلُونَهُ قَرَاطِيسَ تُبْدُونَهَا وَتُخْفُونَ كَثِيرًا ۖ وَعُلِّمْتُم مَّا لَمْ تَعْلَمُوا أَنتُمْ وَلَا آبَاؤُكُمْ ۖ قُلِ اللَّهُ ۖ ثُمَّ ذَرْهُمْ فِي خَوْضِهِمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā qadarū Allāha ḥaqqa qadrihī idh qālū mā anzala Allāhu 'alā basharin min shay'in qul man anzala l-kitāba lladhī jā'a bihī Mūsā nūran wa hudan li-n-nāsi taj'alūnahu qarāṭīsa tubdūnahā wa tukhfūna kathīran wa 'ullimtum mā lam ta'lamū antum wa lā ābā'ukum quli Allāhu thumma dharhum fī khawḍihim yal'abūn

verses.eng: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed and confirming what was before it, that you may warn the Mother of Cities [i.e., Makkah] and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are maintaining their prayers.
verses.arabic: وَهَٰذَا كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ مُبَارَكٌ مُّصَدِّقُ الَّذِي بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَلِتُنذِرَ أُمَّ الْقُرَىٰ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا ۚ وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ ۖ وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa hādhā kitābun anzalnāhu mubārakun muṣaddiqu lladhī bayna yadayhi wa li-tundhira umma l-qurā wa man ḥawlahā wa lladhīna yu'minūna bi-l-ākhirati yu'minūna bihī wa hum 'alā ṣalātihim yuḥāfiẓūn

verses.eng: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or says, 'It has been inspired to me,' while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, 'I will reveal [something] like what Allah revealed.' And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels extend their hands, [saying], 'Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against Allah other than the truth and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant.'
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ قَالَ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ وَلَمْ يُوحَ إِلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ وَمَن قَالَ سَأُنزِلُ مِثْلَ مَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ ۗ وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذِ الظَّالِمُونَ فِي غَمَرَاتِ الْمَوْتِ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ بَاسِطُو أَيْدِيهِمْ أَخْرِجُوا أَنفُسَكُمُ ۖ الْيَوْمَ تُجْزَوْنَ عَذَابَ الْهُونِ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَقُولُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ غَيْرَ الْحَقِّ وَكُنتُمْ عَنْ آيَاتِهِ تَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa man aẓlamu mimani ftarā 'alā Allāhi kadhiban aw qāla ūḥiya ilayya wa lam yūḥa ilayhi shay'un wa man qāla sa-unzilu mithla mā anzala Allāhu wa law tarā idhi ẓ-ẓālimūna fī ghamarāti l-mawti wa l-malā'ikatu bāsiṭū aydīhim akhrijū anfusakumu l-yawma tujzawna 'adhāba l-hūni bi-mā kuntum taqūlūna 'alā Allāhi ghayra l-ḥaqqi wa kuntum 'an āyātihi tastakbirūn

verses.eng: And [it will be said], 'You have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you. And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed that they were among you associates [of Allah]. It has [all] been severed between you, and lost from you is what you used to claim.'
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جِئْتُمُونَا فُرَادَىٰ كَمَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ وَتَرَكْتُم مَّا خَوَّلْنَاكُمْ وَرَاءَ ظُهُورِكُمْ ۖ وَلَا نَرَىٰ مَعَكُمْ شُفَعَاءَكُمُ الَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُمْ أَنَّهُمْ فِيكُمْ شُرَكَاءُ ۚ لَقَد تَّقَطَّعَ بَيْنَكُمْ وَضَلَّ عَنكُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ji'tumūnā furādā kamā khalaqnākum awwala marratin wa taraktum mā khawwalnākum warā'a ẓuhūrikum wa lā narā ma'akum shufa'ā'akumu lladhīna za'amtum annahum fīkum shurakā'u laqad taqaṭṭa'a baynakum wa ḍalla 'ankum mā kuntum taz'umūn

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah is the cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is Allah; so how are you deluded?
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ فَالِقُ الْحَبِّ وَالنَّوَىٰ ۖ يُخْرِجُ الْحَيَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ وَمُخْرِجُ الْمَيِّتِ مِنَ الْحَيِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allāha fāliqu l-ḥabbi wa n-nawā yukhriju l-ḥayya mina l-mayyiti wa mukhriju l-mayyiti mina l-ḥayyi dhālikumu Allāhu fa annā tu'fakūn

verses.eng: [He is] the cleaver of daybreak and has made the night for rest and the sun and moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: فَالِقُ الْإِصْبَاحِ وَجَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ سَكَنًا وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ حُسْبَانًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Fāliqu l-iṣbāḥi wa ja'ala l-layla sakanan wa sh-shamsa wa l-qamara ḥusbānan dhālika taqdīru l-'azīzi l-'alīm

verses.eng: And it is He who placed for you the stars that you may be guided by them through the darknesses of the land and sea. We have detailed the signs for a people who know.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ النُّجُومَ لِتَهْتَدُوا بِهَا فِي ظُلُمَاتِ الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ ۗ قَدْ فَصَّلْنَا الْآيَاتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa lladhī ja'ala lakumu n-nujūma li-tahtadū bihā fī ẓulumāti l-barri wa l-baḥri qad faṣṣalnā l-āyāti li-qawmin ya'lamūn

verses.eng: And it is He who produced you from one soul and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage. We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنشَأَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَمُسْتَقَرٌّ وَمُسْتَوْدَعٌ ۗ قَدْ فَصَّلْنَا الْآيَاتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa lladhī ansha'akum min nafsin wāḥidatin fa-mustaqarrun wa mustawda'un qad faṣṣalnā l-āyāti li-qawmin yafqahūn

verses.eng: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We produce from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And [We produce] gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ نَبَاتَ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ فَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهُ خَضِرًا نُّخْرِجُ مِنْهُ حَبًّا مُّتَرَاكِبًا وَمِنَ النَّخْلِ مِن طَلْعِهَا قِنْوَانٌ دَانِيَةٌ وَجَنَّاتٍ مِّنْ أَعْنَابٍ وَالزَّيْتُونِ وَالرُّمَّانِ مُشْتَبِهًا وَغَيْرَ مُتَشَابِهٍ ۗ انظُرُوا إِلَىٰ ثَمَرِهِ إِذَا أَثْمَرَ وَيَنْعِهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكُمْ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa lladhī anzala mina s-samā'i mā'an fa-akhrajnā bihi nabāta kulli shay'in fa-akhrajnā minhu khaḍiran nukhriju minhu ḥabban mutarākiban wa mina n-nakhli min ṭal'ihā qinwānun dāniyatun wa jannātin min a'nābin wa z-zaytūni wa r-rummāni mushtabihan wa ghayra mutashābihin unẓurū ilā thamarihī idhā athmara wa yan'ihī inna fī dhālikum la-āyātin li-qawmin yu'minūn

verses.eng: But they have attributed to Allah partners - the jinn, while He has created them - and have fabricated for Him sons and daughters. Exalted is He and high above what they describe.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا لِلَّهِ شُرَكَاءَ الْجِنَّ وَخَلَقَهُمْ ۖ وَخَرَقُوا لَهُ بَنِينَ وَبَنَاتٍ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۖ سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'alū li-llāhi shurakā'a l-jinna wa khalaqahum wa kharaqū lahu banīna wa banātin bi-ghayri 'ilmin subḥānahu wa ta'ālā 'ammā yaṣifūn

verses.eng: [He is] Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He does not have a companion and He created all things? And He is, of all things, Knowing.
verses.arabic: بَدِيعُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لَهُ وَلَدٌ وَلَمْ تَكُن لَّهُ صَاحِبَةٌ ۖ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Badī'u s-samāwāti wa l-arḍi annā yakūnu lahu waladun wa lam takun lahu ṣāḥibatun wa khalaqa kulla shay'in wa huwa bi-kulli shay'in 'alīm

verses.eng: That is Allah, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ خَالِقُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ فَاعْبُدُوهُ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَكِيلٌ
verses.transliteration: Dhālikumu Allāhu rabbukum lā ilāha illā huwa khāliqu kulli shay'in fa-'budūhu wa huwa 'alā kulli shay'in wakīl

verses.eng: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted.
verses.arabic: لَّا تُدْرِكُهُ الْأَبْصَارُ وَهُوَ يُدْرِكُ الْأَبْصَارَ ۖ وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Lā tudrikuhu l-abṣāru wa huwa yudriku l-abṣāra wa huwa l-laṭīfu l-khabīr

verses.eng: There has come to you enlightenment from your Lord. So whoever will see does so for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever is blind [does harm] against it. And [say], 'I am not a guardian over you.'
verses.arabic: قَدْ جَاءَكُم بَصَائِرُ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَنْ أَبْصَرَ فَلِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ عَمِيَ فَعَلَيْهَا ۚ وَمَا أَنَا عَلَيْكُم بِحَفِيظٍ
verses.transliteration: Qad jā'akum baṣā'iru min rabbikum fa-man abṣara fa-li-nafsihī wa man 'amiya fa-'alayhā wa mā anā 'alaykum bi-ḥafīẓ

verses.eng: And thus do We diversify the verses so they [i.e., the disbelievers] will say, 'You have studied,' and so We may make the Qur'an clear for a people who know.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُصَرِّفُ الْآيَاتِ وَلِيَقُولُوا دَرَسْتَ وَلِنُبَيِّنَهُ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika nuṣarrifu l-āyāti wa li-yaqūlū darasta wa li-nubayyinahu li-qawmin ya'lamūn

verses.eng: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with Allah.
verses.arabic: اتَّبِعْ مَا أُوحِيَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ittabiʿ mā ūḥiya ilayka min rabbika lā ilāha illā huwa wa aʿriḍ ʿani l-mushrikīn

verses.eng: But if Allah had willed, they would not have associated. And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, nor are you a manager over them.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ مَا أَشْرَكُوا ۗ وَمَا جَعَلْنَاكَ عَلَيْهِمْ حَفِيظًا ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِوَكِيلٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa law shāʾa Allāhu mā ashrakū wa mā jaʿalnāka ʿalayhim ḥafīẓan wa mā anta ʿalayhim bi-wakīl

verses.eng: And do not insult those they invoke other than Allah, lest they insult Allah in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَسُبُّوا الَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَيَسُبُّوا اللَّهَ عَدْوًۢا بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ زَيَّنَّا لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ عَمَلَهُمْ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِم مَّرْجِعُهُمْ فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tasubbū alladhīna yadʿūna min dūni Allāhi fa-yasubbū Allāha ʿadwan bi-ghayri ʿilmin ka-dhālika zayyannā li-kulli ummatin ʿamalahum thumma ilā rabbihim marjiʿuhum fa-yunabbiʾuhum bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if a sign came to them, they would surely believe in it. Say, 'The signs are only with Allah.' And what will make you perceive that even if a sign came, they would not believe?
verses.arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِن جَاءَتْهُمْ آيَةٌ لَّيُؤْمِنُنَّ بِهَا ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْآيَاتُ عِندَ اللَّهِ ۖ وَمَا يُشْعِرُكُمْ أَنَّهَا إِذَا جَاءَتْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa aqsamū bi-llāhi jahda aymānihim la-in jāʾat-hum āyatun la-yuʾminunna bihā qul innamā l-āyātu ʿinda Allāhi wa mā yushʿirukum annahā idhā jāʾat lā yuʾminūn

verses.eng: And We will turn away their hearts and their eyes just as they refused to believe in it the first time. And We will leave them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
verses.arabic: وَنُقَلِّبُ أَفْئِدَتَهُمْ وَأَبْصَارَهُمْ كَمَا لَمْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِهِ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ وَنَذَرُهُمْ فِي طُغْيَانِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa nuqallibu afʾidatahum wa abṣārahum kamā lam yuʾminū bihī awwala marratin wa nadharuhum fī ṭughyānihim yaʿmahūn

verses.eng: And even if We had sent down to them the angels [with the message] and the dead spoke to them [of it] and We gathered together every [created] thing in front of them, they would not believe unless Allah should will. But most of them are ignorant.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّنَا نَزَّلْنَا إِلَيْهِمُ الْمَلَائِكَةَ وَكَلَّمَهُمُ الْمَوْتَىٰ وَحَشَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ قُبُلًا مَّا كَانُوا لِيُؤْمِنُوا إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَجْهَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law annanā nazzalnā ilayhimu l-malāʾikata wa kallamahumu l-mawtā wa ḥasharnā ʿalayhim kulla shayʾin qubulan mā kānū li-yuʾminū illā an yashāʾa Allāhu wa lākinna aktharahum yajhalūn

verses.eng: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا شَيَاطِينَ الْإِنسِ وَالْجِنِّ يُوحِي بَعْضُهُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ زُخْرُفَ الْقَوْلِ غُرُورًا ۚ وَلَوْ شَاءَ رَبُّكَ مَا فَعَلُوهُ ۖ فَذَرْهُمْ وَمَا يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika jaʿalnā li-kulli nabiyyin ʿaduwwan shayāṭīna l-insi wa l-jinni yūḥī baʿḍuhum ilā baʿḍin zukhrufa l-qawli ghurūran wa law shāʾa rabbuka mā faʿalūhu fa-dharhum wa mā yaftarūn

verses.eng: And [it is] so the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter will incline toward it and that they will be satisfied with it and that they will commit that which they are committing.
verses.arabic: وَلِتَصْغَىٰ إِلَيْهِ أَفْئِدَةُ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ وَلِيَرْضَوْهُ وَلِيَقْتَرِفُوا مَا هُم مُّقْتَرِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa li-taṣghā ilayhi afʾidatu alladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ākhirati wa li-yarḍawhu wa li-yaqtarifū mā hum muqtarifūn

verses.eng: Then is it other than Allah I should seek as judge while it is He who has revealed to you the Book explained in detail? And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture know that it is sent down from your Lord in truth, so never be among the doubters.
verses.arabic: أَفَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ أَبْتَغِي حَكَمًا وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنزَلَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْكِتَابَ مُفَصَّلًا ۚ وَالَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ يَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّهُ مُنَزَّلٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُمْتَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: A-fa-ghayra Allāhi abtaghī ḥakaman wa huwa alladhī anzala ilaykumu l-kitāba mufaṣṣalan wa alladhīna ātaynāhumu l-kitāba yaʿlamūna annahu munazzalun min rabbika bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-lā takūnanna mina l-mumtarīn

verses.eng: And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice. None can alter His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَتَمَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ صِدْقًا وَعَدْلًا ۚ لَّا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَاتِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa tammat kalimatu rabbika ṣidqan wa ʿadlan lā mubaddila li-kalimātihī wa huwa l-samīʿu l-ʿalīm

verses.eng: And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allah. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
verses.arabic: وَإِن تُطِعْ أَكْثَرَ مَن فِي الْأَرْضِ يُضِلُّوكَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَخْرُصُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in tuṭiʿ akthara man fī l-arḍi yuḍillūka ʿan sabīli Allāhi in yattabiʿūna illā l-ẓanna wa in hum illā yakhruṣūn

verses.eng: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ مَن يَضِلُّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ ۖ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna rabbaka huwa aʿlamu man yaḍillu ʿan sabīlihī wa huwa aʿlamu bi-l-muhtadīn

verses.eng: So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.
verses.arabic: فَكُلُوا مِمَّا ذُكِرَ اسْمُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ إِن كُنتُم بِآيَاتِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-kulū mimmā dhukira smu Allāhi ʿalayhi in kuntum bi-āyātihī muʾminīn

verses.eng: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled? And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
verses.arabic: وَمَا لَكُمْ أَلَّا تَأْكُلُوا مِمَّا ذُكِرَ اسْمُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ وَقَدْ فَصَّلَ لَكُم مَّا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ إِلَّا مَا اضْطُرِرْتُمْ إِلَيْهِ ۗ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا لَّيُضِلُّونَ بِأَهْوَائِهِم بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُعْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā lakum allā taʾkulū mimmā dhukira smu Allāhi ʿalayhi wa qad faṣṣala lakum mā ḥarrama ʿalaykum illā mā uḍṭurirtum ilayhi wa inna kathīran la-yuḍillūna bi-ahwāʾihim bi-ghayri ʿilmin inna rabbaka huwa aʿlamu bi-l-muʿtadīn

verses.eng: And leave what is apparent of sin and what is concealed thereof. Indeed, those who earn [blame for] sin will be recompensed for that which they used to commit.
verses.arabic: وَذَرُوا ظَاهِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَبَاطِنَهُ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَكْسِبُونَ الْإِثْمَ سَيُجْزَوْنَ بِمَا كَانُوا يَقْتَرِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa dharū ẓāhira l-ithmi wa bāṭinahū inna alladhīna yaksibūna l-ithma sa-yujzawna bi-mā kānū yaqtarifūn

verses.eng: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you. And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَأْكُلُوا مِمَّا لَمْ يُذْكَرِ اسْمُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ وَإِنَّهُ لَفِسْقٌ ۗ وَإِنَّ الشَّيَاطِينَ لَيُوحُونَ إِلَىٰ أَوْلِيَائِهِمْ لِيُجَادِلُوكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ أَطَعْتُمُوهُمْ إِنَّكُمْ لَمُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taʾkulū mimmā lam yudhkari smu Allāhi ʿalayhi wa innahu lafisqun wa inna sh-shayāṭīna la-yūḥūna ilā awliyāʾihim li-yujādilūkum wa in aṭaʿtumūhum innakum la-mushrikūn

verses.eng: Is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus it has been made pleasing to the disbelievers that which they were doing.
verses.arabic: أَوَمَن كَانَ مَيْتًا فَأَحْيَيْنَاهُ وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُ نُورًا يَمْشِي بِهِ فِي النَّاسِ كَمَن مَّثَلُهُ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ لَيْسَ بِخَارِجٍ مِّنْهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِلْكَافِرِينَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa man kāna maytan fa-aḥyaynāhu wa jaʿalnā lahu nūran yamshī bihi fī n-nāsi ka-man mathaluhu fī ẓ-ẓulumāti laysa bi-khārijin minhā kadhālika zuyyina li-l-kāfirīna mā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: And thus We have placed within every city great among its criminals to conspire therein. But they conspire not except against themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ أَكَابِرَ مُجْرِمِيهَا لِيَمْكُرُوا فِيهَا ۖ وَمَا يَمْكُرُونَ إِلَّا بِأَنفُسِهِمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika jaʿalnā fī kulli qaryatin akābira mujrimīhā li-yamkurū fīhā wa mā yamkurūna illā bi-anfusihim wa mā yashʿurūn

verses.eng: And when a sign comes to them, they say, 'Never will we believe until we are given like that which was given to the messengers of Allah.' Allah is most knowing of where He places His message. There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before Allah and severe punishment for what they used to conspire.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا جَاءَتْهُمْ آيَةٌ قَالُوا لَن نُّؤْمِنَ حَتَّىٰ نُؤْتَىٰ مِثْلَ مَا أُوتِيَ رُسُلُ اللَّهِ ۘ اللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ حَيْثُ يَجْعَلُ رِسَالَتَهُ ۗ سَيُصِيبُ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا صَغَارٌ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَعَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا كَانُوا يَمْكُرُونَ
