verses.transliteration: Wa idhā jāʾat-hum āyatun qālū lan nuʾmina ḥattā nuʾtā mithla mā ūtiya rusulu Allāhi Allāhu aʿlamu ḥaythu yajʿalu risālatahu sa-yuṣību alladhīna ajramū ṣaghārun ʿinda Allāhi wa ʿadhābun shadīdun bi-mā kānū yamkurūn

verses.eng: So whoever Allah wants to guide - He expands his breast to [contain] Islam; and whoever He wants to misguide - He makes his breast tight and constricted as though he were climbing into the sky. Thus does Allah place defilement upon those who do not believe.
verses.arabic: فَمَن يُرِدِ اللَّهُ أَن يَهْدِيَهُ يَشْرَحْ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ ۖ وَمَن يُرِدْ أَن يُضِلَّهُ يَجْعَلْ صَدْرَهُ ضَيِّقًا حَرَجًا كَأَنَّمَا يَصَّعَّدُ فِي السَّمَاءِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَجْعَلُ اللَّهُ الرِّجْسَ عَلَى الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-man yuridi Allāhu an yahdiyahu yashraḥ ṣadrahu li-l-islāmi wa man yurid an yuḍillahu yajʿal ṣadrahu ḍayyiqan ḥarajan ka-annamā yaṣṣaʿadu fī s-samāʾi kadhalika yajʿalu Allāhu r-rijsa ʿalā alladhīna lā yuʾminūn

verses.eng: And this is the path of your Lord, [leading] straight. We have detailed the verses for a people who remember.
verses.arabic: وَهَٰذَا صِرَاطُ رَبِّكَ مُسْتَقِيمًا ۗ قَدْ فَصَّلْنَا الْآيَاتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa hādhā ṣirāṭu rabbika mustaqīman qad faṣṣalnā l-āyāti li-qawmin yadhakkarūn

verses.eng: For them will be the Home of Peace with their Lord, and He will be their protecting friend because of what they used to do.
verses.arabic: لَهُمْ دَارُ السَّلَامِ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ ۖ وَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lahum dāru s-salāmi ʿinda rabbihim wa huwa waliyyuhum bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day when He will gather them together [and say], 'O company of jinn, you have [misled] many of mankind.' And their allies among mankind will say, 'Our Lord, some of us made use of others, and we have [now] reached our term, which You appointed for us.' He will say, 'The Fire is your residence, wherein you will abide eternally, except for what Allah wills. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.'
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًا يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ قَدِ اسْتَكْثَرْتُم مِّنَ الْإِنسِ ۖ وَقَالَ أَوْلِيَاؤُهُم مِّنَ الْإِنسِ رَبَّنَا اسْتَمْتَعَ بَعْضُنَا بِبَعْضٍ وَبَلَغْنَا أَجَلَنَا الَّذِي أَجَّلْتَ لَنَا ۚ قَالَ النَّارُ مَثْوَاكُمْ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma yaḥshuruhum jamīʿan yā maʿshara l-jinni qadi istakthartum mina l-insi wa qāla awliyāʾuhum mina l-insi rabbanā istamtaʿa baʿḍunā bi-baʿḍin wa balaghnā ajalana lladhī ajjalta lanā qāla n-nāru mathwākum khālidīna fīhā illā mā shāʾa Allāhu inna rabbaka ḥakīmun ʿalīm

verses.eng: And thus will We make some of the wrongdoers allies of others for what they used to earn.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُوَلِّي بَعْضَ الظَّالِمِينَ بَعْضًا بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika nuwallī baʿḍa ẓ-ẓālimīna baʿḍan bi-mā kānū yaksibūn

verses.eng: O company of jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among you, relating to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours? They will say, 'We bear witness against ourselves.' And the worldly life had deluded them, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
verses.arabic: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ رُسُلٌ مِّنكُمْ يَقُصُّونَ عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتِي وَيُنذِرُونَكُمْ لِقَاءَ يَوْمِكُمْ هَٰذَا ۚ قَالُوا شَهِدْنَا عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِنَا ۖ وَغَرَّتْهُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا وَشَهِدُوا عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِهِمْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا كَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā maʿshara l-jinni wa l-insi a-lam yaʾtikum rusulun minkum yaquṣṣūna ʿalaykum āyātī wa yundhirūnakum liqāʾa yawmikum hādhā qālū shahidnā ʿalā anfusinā wa gharathumu l-ḥayātu d-dunyā wa shahidū ʿalā anfusihim annahum kānū kāfirīn

verses.eng: That is because your Lord would not destroy the cities for wrongdoing while their people were unaware.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ أَن لَّمْ يَكُن رَّبُّكَ مُهْلِكَ الْقُرَىٰ بِظُلْمٍ وَأَهْلُهَا غَافِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika an lam yakun rabbuka muhliku l-qurā bi-ẓulmin wa ahluhā ghāfilūn

verses.eng: And for all are degrees from what they have done. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do.
verses.arabic: وَلِكُلٍّ دَرَجَاتٌ مِّمَّا عَمِلُوا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa li-kullin darajātun mimmā ʿamilū wa mā rabbuka bi-ghāfilin ʿammā yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: And your Lord is the Free of need, the possessor of mercy. If He wills, He can do away with you and give succession after you to whomever He wills, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.
verses.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ الْغَنِيُّ ذُو الرَّحْمَةِ ۚ إِن يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَسْتَخْلِفْ مِن بَعْدِكُم مَّا يَشَاءُ كَمَا أَنشَأَكُم مِّن ذُرِّيَّةِ قَوْمٍ آخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa rabbuka l-ghaniyyu dhū r-raḥmati in yashaʾ yudhhibkum wa yastakhlif min baʿdikum mā yashāʾu kamā anshaʾakum min dhurriyyati qawmin ākharīn

verses.eng: Indeed, what you are promised is coming, and you will not cause failure [to Allah].
verses.arabic: إِنَّ مَا تُوعَدُونَ لَآتٍ ۖ وَمَا أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna mā tūʿadūna la-ātin wa mā antum bi-muʿjizīn

verses.eng: Say, 'O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working. And you are going to know who will have succession in the home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَا قَوْمِ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّي عَامِلٌ ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ مَن تَكُونُ لَهُ عَاقِبَةُ الدَّارِ ۗ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul yā qawmi iʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum innī ʿāmilun fa-sawfa taʿlamūna man takūnu lahu ʿāqibatu d-dāri innahu lā yufliḥu ẓ-ẓālimūn

verses.eng: And they assign to Allah from that which He created of crops and livestock a share and say, 'This is for Allah,' by their claim, 'and this is for our partners [associated with Him].' But what is for their 'partners' does not reach Allah, while what is for Allah - this reaches their 'partners.' Evil is that which they rule.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا لِلَّهِ مِمَّا ذَرَأَ مِنَ الْحَرْثِ وَالْأَنْعَامِ نَصِيبًا فَقَالُوا هَٰذَا لِلَّهِ بِزَعْمِهِمْ وَهَٰذَا لِشُرَكَائِنَا ۖ فَمَا كَانَ لِشُرَكَائِهِمْ فَلَا يَصِلُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ لِلَّهِ فَهُوَ يَصِلُ إِلَىٰ شُرَكَائِهِمْ ۗ سَاءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'alū lillāhi mimmā dhara'a mina l-ḥarthi wa l-an'āmi naṣīban fa-qālū hādhā lillāhi bi-za'mihim wa hādhā li-shurakā'inā fa-mā kāna li-shurakā'ihim fa-lā yaṣilu ilā llāhi wa mā kāna lillāhi fa-huwa yaṣilu ilā shurakā'ihim sā'a mā yaḥkumūn

verses.eng: And likewise, to many of the polytheists their partners have made [to seem] pleasing the killing of their children in order to bring about their destruction and to cover them with confusion in their religion. And if Allah had willed, they would not have done so. So leave them and that which they invent.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ زَيَّنَ لِكَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ قَتْلَ أَوْلَادِهِمْ شُرَكَاؤُهُمْ لِيُرْدُوهُمْ وَلِيَلْبِسُوا عَلَيْهِمْ دِينَهُمْ ۖ وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ مَا فَعَلُوهُ ۖ فَذَرْهُمْ وَمَا يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika zayyana li-kathīrin mina l-mushrikīna qatla awlādihim shurakā'uhum li-yurdūhum wa li-yalbisū 'alayhim dīnahum wa law shā'a llāhu mā fa'alūhu fa-dharhum wa mā yaftarūn

verses.eng: And they say, 'These animals and crops are forbidden; no one may eat them except whom we will,' by their claim. And there are those [camels] whose backs are forbidden [by them] and those upon which the name of Allah is not mentioned - [all of this] an invention of untruth about Him. He will punish them for what they were inventing.
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا هَٰذِهِ أَنْعَامٌ وَحَرْثٌ حِجْرٌ لَّا يَطْعَمُهَا إِلَّا مَن نَّشَاءُ بِزَعْمِهِمْ وَأَنْعَامٌ حُرِّمَتْ ظُهُورُهَا وَأَنْعَامٌ لَّا يَذْكُرُونَ اسْمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهَا افْتِرَاءً عَلَيْهِ ۚ سَيَجْزِيهِم بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālū hādhihi an'āmun wa ḥarthun ḥijrun lā yaṭ'amu-hā illā man nashā'u bi-za'mihim wa an'āmun ḥurrimat ẓuhūru-hā wa an'āmun lā yadhkurūna sma llāhi 'alay-hā ftirā'an 'alayhi sa-yajzīhim bi-mā kānū yaftarūn

verses.eng: And they say, 'What is in the bellies of these animals is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our females. But if it is [born] dead, then all of them have shares therein.' He will punish them for their description. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا مَا فِي بُطُونِ هَٰذِهِ الْأَنْعَامِ خَالِصَةٌ لِّذُكُورِنَا وَمُحَرَّمٌ عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِنَا ۖ وَإِن يَكُن مَّيْتَةً فَهُمْ فِيهِ شُرَكَاءُ ۚ سَيَجْزِيهِمْ وَصْفَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālū mā fī buṭūni hādhihi l-an'āmi khāliṣatun li-dhukūri-nā wa muḥarramun 'alā azwāji-nā wa in yakun maytatan fa-hum fīhi shurakā'u sa-yajzīhim waṣfahum innahu ḥakīmun 'alīm

verses.eng: Those will have lost who killed their children in foolishness without knowledge and prohibited what Allah had provided for them, inventing untruth about Allah. They have gone astray and were not [rightly] guided.
verses.arabic: قَدْ خَسِرَ الَّذِينَ قَتَلُوا أَوْلَادَهُمْ سَفَهًا بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَحَرَّمُوا مَا رَزَقَهُمُ اللَّهُ افْتِرَاءً عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ قَدْ ضَلُّوا وَمَا كَانُوا مُهْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qad khasira lladhīna qatalū awlādahum safahan bi-ghayri 'ilmin wa ḥarramū mā razaqa-humu llāhu ftirā'an 'alā llāhi qad ḍallū wa mā kānū muhtadīn

verses.eng: And it is He who produces gardens, trellised and untrellised, and palm trees and crops of different [kinds of] food and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of [each of] its fruit when it yields and give its due [zakah] on the day of its harvest. And be not excessive. Indeed, He does not like those who commit excess.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنشَأَ جَنَّاتٍ مَّعْرُوشَاتٍ وَغَيْرَ مَعْرُوشَاتٍ وَالنَّخْلَ وَالزَّرْعَ مُخْتَلِفًا أُكُلُهُ وَالزَّيْتُونَ وَالرُّمَّانَ مُتَشَابِهًا وَغَيْرَ مُتَشَابِهٍ ۚ كُلُوا مِن ثَمَرِهِ إِذَا أَثْمَرَ وَآتُوا حَقَّهُ يَوْمَ حَصَادِهِ ۖ وَلَا تُسْرِفُوا ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa lladhī ansha'a jannātin ma'rūshātin wa ghayra ma'rūshātin wa n-nakhla wa z-zar'a mukhtalifan ukulu-hu wa z-zaytūna wa r-rummāna mutashābihan wa ghayra mutashābihin kulū min thamari-hi idhā athmara wa ātū ḥaqqa-hu yawma ḥaṣādihi wa lā tus'rifū innahu lā yuḥibbu l-mus'rifīn

verses.eng: And of the grazing livestock are carriers [of burdens] and those [too] small. Eat of what Allah has provided for you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ الْأَنْعَامِ حَمُولَةً وَفَرْشًا ۚ كُلُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا خُطُوَاتِ الشَّيْطَانِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina l-an'āmi ḥamūlatan wa farshā kulū mimmā razaqa-kumu llāhu wa lā tattabi'ū khuṭuwāti sh-shayṭāni innahu la-kum 'aduwwun mubīn

verses.eng: Eight pairs - of the sheep, two and of the goats, two. Say, 'Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you should be truthful.'
verses.arabic: ثَمَانِيَةَ أَزْوَاجٍ ۖ مِّنَ الضَّأْنِ اثْنَيْنِ وَمِنَ الْمَعْزِ اثْنَيْنِ ۗ قُلْ آلذَّكَرَيْنِ حَرَّمَ أَمِ الْأُنثَيَيْنِ أَمَّا اشْتَمَلَتْ عَلَيْهِ أَرْحَامُ الْأُنثَيَيْنِ ۖ نَبِّئُونِي بِعِلْمٍ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thamāniyata azwājin mina ḍ-ḍa'ni ithnayni wa mina l-ma'zi ithnayni qul ā-dh-dhakaraẓni ḥarrama am al-unthayayni ammā shtamalat 'alayhi arḥāmu l-unthayayni nabbī'ūnī bi-'ilmin in kuntum ṣādiqīn

verses.eng: And of the camels, two and of the cattle, two. Say, 'Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when Allah charged you with this? Then who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah to mislead the people by [something] other than knowledge? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.'
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ الْإِبِلِ اثْنَيْنِ وَمِنَ الْبَقَرِ اثْنَيْنِ ۗ قُلْ آلذَّكَرَيْنِ حَرَّمَ أَمِ الْأُنثَيَيْنِ أَمَّا اشْتَمَلَتْ عَلَيْهِ أَرْحَامُ الْأُنثَيَيْنِ ۖ أَمْ كُنتُمْ شُهَدَاءَ إِذْ وَصَّاكُمُ اللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا ۚ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا لِّيُضِلَّ النَّاسَ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina l-ibili ithnayni wa mina l-baqari ithnayni qul ā-dh-dhakaraẓni ḥarrama am al-unthayayni ammā shtamalat 'alayhi arḥāmu l-unthayayni am kuntum shuhadā'a idh waṣṣā-kumu llāhu bi-hādhā fa-man aẓlamu mimani ftarā 'alā llāhi kadhiban li-yuḍilla n-nāsa bi-ghayri 'ilmin inna llāha lā yahdī l-qawma ẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: Say, 'I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or it be [that slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful.'
verses.arabic: قُل لَّا أَجِدُ فِي مَا أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ مُحَرَّمًا عَلَىٰ طَاعِمٍ يَطْعَمُهُ إِلَّا أَن يَكُونَ مَيْتَةً أَوْ دَمًا مَّسْفُوحًا أَوْ لَحْمَ خِنزِيرٍ فَإِنَّهُ رِجْسٌ أَوْ فِسْقًا أُهِلَّ لِغَيْرِ اللَّهِ بِهِ ۚ فَمَنِ اضْطُرَّ غَيْرَ بَاغٍ وَلَا عَادٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qul lā ajidu fī mā ūḥiya ilayya muḥarraman 'alā ṭā'imin yaṭ'amu-hu illā an yakūna maytatan aw daman masfūḥan aw laḥma khinzīrin fa-innahu rijsun aw fisqan uhilla li-ghayri llāhi bihi fa-mani ḍṭurra ghayra bāghin wa lā 'ādin fa-inna rabbaka ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: And to those who are Jews We prohibited every animal of uncloven hoof; and of the cattle and the sheep We prohibited to them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or the entrails or what is joined with bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are truthful.
verses.arabic: وَعَلَى الَّذِينَ هَادُوا حَرَّمْنَا كُلَّ ذِي ظُفُرٍ ۖ وَمِنَ الْبَقَرِ وَالْغَنَمِ حَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ شُحُومَهُمَا إِلَّا مَا حَمَلَتْ ظُهُورُهُمَا أَوِ الْحَوَايَا أَوْ مَا اخْتَلَطَ بِعَظْمٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ جَزَيْنَاهُم بِبَغْيِهِمْ ۖ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa 'alā lladhīna hādū ḥarramnā kulla dhī ẓufurin wa mina l-baqari wa l-ghanami ḥarramnā 'alayhim shuḥūma-humā illā mā ḥamalat ẓuhūru-humā awi l-ḥawāyā aw mā khtalaṭa bi-'aẓmin dhālika jazaynāhum bi-baghyihim wa innā la-ṣādiqūn

verses.eng: So if they deny you, [O Muhammad], say, 'Your Lord is the possessor of vast mercy; but His punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals.'
verses.arabic: فَإِن كَذَّبُوكَ فَقُل رَّبُّكُمْ ذُو رَحْمَةٍ وَاسِعَةٍ وَلَا يُرَدُّ بَأْسُهُ عَنِ الْقَوْمِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in kadhdhabū-ka fa-qul rabbukum dhū raḥmatin wāsi'atin wa lā yuraddu ba'su-hu 'ani l-qawmi l-mujrimīn

verses.eng: Those who associated [others with Allah] will say, 'If Allah had willed, we would not have associated [anything] and neither would our fathers, nor would we have prohibited anything.' Likewise did those before deny until they tasted Our punishment. Say, 'Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but falsifying.'
verses.arabic: سَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا لَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ مَا أَشْرَكْنَا وَلَا آبَاؤُنَا وَلَا حَرَّمْنَا مِن شَيْءٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ ذَاقُوا بَأْسَنَا ۗ قُلْ هَلْ عِندَكُم مِّنْ عِلْمٍ فَتُخْرِجُوهُ لَنَا ۖ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَإِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا تَخْرُصُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sayaqūlu lladhīna ashrakū law shā'a llāhu mā ashraknā wa lā ābā'unā wa lā ḥarramnā min shay'in kadhalika kadhdhaba lladhīna min qabli-him ḥattā dhāqū ba'sanā qul hal 'inda-kum min 'ilmin fa-tukhrijū-hu lanā in tattabi'ūna illā ẓ-ẓanna wa in antum illā takhruṣūn

verses.eng: Say, 'With Allah is the far-reaching argument. If He had willed, He would have guided you all.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ فَلِلَّهِ الْحُجَّةُ الْبَالِغَةُ ۖ فَلَوْ شَاءَ لَهَدَاكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul fa-li-llāhi l-ḥujjatu l-bālighatu fa-law shā'a la-hadā-kum ajma'īn

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], 'Bring forward your witnesses who will testify that Allah has prohibited this.' And if they testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our verses and those who do not believe in the Hereafter, while they equate [others] with their Lord.
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَلُمَّ شُهَدَاءَكُمُ الَّذِينَ يَشْهَدُونَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ حَرَّمَ هَٰذَا ۖ فَإِن شَهِدُوا فَلَا تَشْهَدْ مَعَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ أَهْوَاءَ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَالَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ وَهُم بِرَبِّهِمْ يَعْدِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul halumma shuhadā'a-kumu lladhīna yashhadūna anna llāha ḥarrama hādhā fa-in shahidū fa-lā tashhad ma'ahum wa lā tattabi' ahwā'a lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-āyāti-nā wa lladhīna lā yu'minūna bi-l-ākhirati wa hum bi-rabbi-him ya'dilūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you: that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ تَعَالَوْا أَتْلُ مَا حَرَّمَ رَبُّكُمْ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ أَلَّا تُشْرِكُوا بِهِ شَيْئًا ۖ وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا ۖ وَلَا تَقْتُلُوا أَوْلَادَكُم مِّنْ إِمْلَاقٍ ۖ نَّحْنُ نَرْزُقُكُمْ وَإِيَّاهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا الْفَوَاحِشَ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا وَمَا بَطَنَ ۖ وَلَا تَقْتُلُوا النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ وَصَّاكُم بِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ta'ālā atlu mā ḥarrama rabbukum 'alaykum allā tushrikū bihi shay'an wa bi-l-wālidayni iḥsānan wa lā taqtulū awlādakum min imlāqin naḥnu narzuqukum wa iyyāhum wa lā taqrabū l-fawāḥisha mā ẓahara minhā wa mā baṭana wa lā taqtulū n-nafsa llatī ḥarrama llāhu illā bi-l-ḥaqqi dhālikum waṣṣākum bihi la'allakum ta'qilūn

verses.eng: And do not approach the orphan's property except in a way that is best until he reaches maturity. And give full measure and weight in justice. We do not charge any soul except [with that within] its capacity. And when you testify, be just, even if [it concerns] a near relative. And the covenant of Allah fulfill. This has He instructed you that you may remember.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا مَالَ الْيَتِيمِ إِلَّا بِالَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ حَتَّىٰ يَبْلُغَ أَشُدَّهُ ۖ وَأَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَالْمِيزَانَ بِالْقِسْطِ ۖ لَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۖ وَإِذَا قُلْتُمْ فَاعْدِلُوا وَلَوْ كَانَ ذَا قُرْبَىٰ ۖ وَبِعَهْدِ اللَّهِ أَوْفُوا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ وَصَّاكُم بِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taqrabū māla l-yatīmi illā bi-llatī hiya aḥsanu ḥattā yablugha ashuddahu wa awfū l-kayla wa l-mīzāna bi-l-qisṭi lā nukallifu nafsan illā wus'ahā wa idhā qultum fa-'dilū wa law kāna dhā qurbā wa bi-'ahdi llāhi awfū dhālikum waṣṣākum bihi la'allakum tadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way. This has He instructed you that you may become righteous.
verses.arabic: وَأَنَّ هَٰذَا صِرَاطِي مُسْتَقِيمًا فَاتَّبِعُوهُ ۖ وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا السُّبُلَ فَتَفَرَّقَ بِكُمْ عَن سَبِيلِهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ وَصَّاكُم بِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa anna hādhā ṣirāṭī mustaqīman fa-ttabi'ūhu wa lā tattabi'ū s-subula fa-tafarraqa bikum 'an sabīlihi dhālikum waṣṣākum bihi la'allakum tattaqūn

verses.eng: Then We gave Moses the Scripture, making complete [Our favor] upon the one who did good and as a detailed explanation of all things and as guidance and mercy that perhaps in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord they would believe.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ تَمَامًا عَلَى الَّذِي أَحْسَنَ وَتَفْصِيلًا لِّكُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لَّعَلَّهُم بِلِقَاءِ رَبِّهِمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ātaynā mūsā l-kitāba tamāman 'alā lladhī aḥsana wa tafṣīlan li-kulli shay'in wa hudan wa raḥmatan la'allahum bi-liqā'i rabbihim yu'minūn

verses.eng: And this [Qur'an] is a Book We have revealed [which is] blessed, so follow it and fear Allah that you may receive mercy.
verses.arabic: وَهَٰذَا كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ مُبَارَكٌ فَاتَّبِعُوهُ وَاتَّقُوا لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa hādhā kitābun anzalnāhu mubārakun fa-ttabi'ūhu wa ttaqū la'allakum turḥamūn

verses.eng: [We revealed it] lest you say, 'The Scripture was only sent down to two groups before us, but we were unaware of their study,'
verses.arabic: أَن تَقُولُوا إِنَّمَا أُنزِلَ الْكِتَابُ عَلَىٰ طَائِفَتَيْنِ مِن قَبْلِنَا وَإِن كُنَّا عَن دِرَاسَتِهِمْ لَغَافِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: An taqūlū innamā unzila l-kitābu 'alā ṭā'ifatayni min qablinā wa in kunnā 'an dirāsatihim la-ghāfilīn

verses.eng: Or lest you say, 'If only the Scripture had been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they.' So there has [now] come to you a clear evidence from your Lord and a guidance and mercy. Then who is more unjust than one who denies the verses of Allah and turns away from them? We will recompense those who turn away from Our verses with the worst of punishment for their having turned away.
verses.arabic: أَوْ تَقُولُوا لَوْ أَنَّا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْكِتَابُ لَكُنَّا أَهْدَىٰ مِنْهُمْ ۚ فَقَدْ جَاءَكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ ۚ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن كَذَّبَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَصَدَفَ عَنْهَا ۗ سَنَجْزِي الَّذِينَ يَصْدِفُونَ عَنْ آيَاتِنَا سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ بِمَا كَانُوا يَصْدِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Aw taqūlū law annā unzila 'alaynā l-kitābu la-kunnā ahdā minhum fa-qad jā'akum bayyinatun min rabbikum wa hudan wa raḥmatun fa-man aẓlamu mimman kadhdhaba bi-āyāti llāhi wa ṣadafa 'anhā sa-najzī lladhīna yaṣdifūna 'an āyātinā sū'a l-'adhābi bi-mā kānū yaṣdifūn

verses.eng: Do they await except that the angels should come to them or your Lord should come or that there should come some of the signs of your Lord? The Day that some of the signs of your Lord will come, no soul will benefit from its faith as long as it had not believed before or had earned through its faith some good. Say, 'Wait. Indeed, we are waiting.'
verses.arabic: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا أَن تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ يَأْتِيَ رَبُّكَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَ بَعْضُ آيَاتِ رَبِّكَ ۗ يَوْمَ يَأْتِي بَعْضُ آيَاتِ رَبِّكَ لَا يَنفَعُ نَفْسًا إِيمَانُهَا لَمْ تَكُنْ آمَنَتْ مِن قَبْلُ أَوْ كَسَبَتْ فِي إِيمَانِهَا خَيْرًا ۗ قُلِ انتَظِرُوا إِنَّا مُنتَظِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hal yanẓurūna illā an ta'tiyahumu l-malā'ikatu aw ya'tiya rabbuka aw ya'tiya ba'ḍu āyāti rabbika yawma ya'tī ba'ḍu āyāti rabbika lā yanfa'u nafsan īmānu-hā lam takun āmanat min qablu aw kasabat fī īmāni-hā khayran quli ntaẓirū innā muntaẓirūn

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have divided their religion and become sects - you, [O Muhammad], are not [associated] with them in anything. Their affair is only [left] to Allah; then He will inform them about what they used to do.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَرَّقُوا دِينَهُمْ وَكَانُوا شِيَعًا لَّسْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِي شَيْءٍ ۚ إِنَّمَا أَمْرُهُمْ إِلَى اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna lladhīna farraqū dīnahum wa kānū shiya'an lasta minhum fī shay'in innamā amruhum ilā llāhi thumma yunabbi'uhum bi-mā kānū ya'malūn

verses.eng: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit], and whoever comes with an evil deed will not be recompensed except the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
verses.arabic: مَن جَاءَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ عَشْرُ أَمْثَالِهَا ۖ وَمَن جَاءَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ فَلَا يُجْزَىٰ إِلَّا مِثْلَهَا وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man jā'a bi-l-ḥasanati fa-lahu 'ashru amthāli-hā wa man jā'a bi-s-sayyi'ati fa-lā yujzā illā mithla-hā wa hum lā yuẓlamūn

verses.eng: Say, 'Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct religion - the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth. And he was not among those who associated others with Allah.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّنِي هَدَانِي رَبِّي إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ دِينًا قِيَمًا مِّلَّةَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ حَنِيفًا ۚ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul innanī hadānī rabbī ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin dīnan qiyaman millata ibrāhīma ḥanīfan wa mā kāna mina l-mushrikīn

verses.eng: Say, 'Indeed, my prayer, my rites of sacrifice, my living and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the worlds.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ صَلَاتِي وَنُسُكِي وَمَحْيَايَ وَمَمَاتِي لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul inna ṣalātī wa nusukī wa maḥyāya wa mamātī li-llāhi rabbi l-'ālamīn

verses.eng: No partner has He. And this I have been commanded, and I am the first [among you] of the Muslims.
verses.arabic: لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ ۖ وَبِذَٰلِكَ أُمِرْتُ وَأَنَا أَوَّلُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lā sharīka lahu wa bi-dhālika umirtu wa anā awwalu l-muslimīn

verses.eng: Say, 'Is it other than Allah I should desire as a lord while He is the Lord of all things? And every soul earns not [blame] except against itself, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ أَبْغِي رَبًّا وَهُوَ رَبُّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۚ وَلَا تَكْسِبُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ إِلَّا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُم مَّرْجِعُكُمْ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul a-ghayra llāhi abghī rabban wa huwa rabbu kulli shay'in wa lā taksibu kullu nafsin illā 'alay-hā wa lā taziru wāziratun wizra ukhrā thumma ilā rabbikum marji'ukum fa-yunabbi'ukum bi-mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

verses.eng: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank] that He may try you through what He has given you. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَكُمْ خَلَائِفَ الْأَرْضِ وَرَفَعَ بَعْضَكُمْ فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ دَرَجَاتٍ لِّيَبْلُوَكُمْ فِي مَا آتَاكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ سَرِيعُ الْعِقَابِ وَإِنَّهُ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa lladhī ja'alakum khalā'ifa l-arḍi wa rafa'a ba'ḍakum fawqa ba'ḍin darajātin li-yabluwakum fī mā ātākum inna rabbaka sarī'u l-'iqābi wa innahu la-ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Mim, Sad.
verses.arabic: ﭑﻟٓﻢٓصٓ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Mim-Sad.

verses.eng: (This is) a Book revealed to you, [O Muhammad] - so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom - that you may warn thereby and as a reminder for the believers.
verses.arabic: كِتَٰبٌ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ فَلَا يَكُن فِى صَدْرِكَ حَرَجٌ مِّنْهُ لِتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kitabun unzila ilaika fala yakun fi sadrika harajun minhu litundhira bihi wadhikra lilmu'minin.

verses.eng: Follow, [O mankind], what has been revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow other than Him any allies. Little do you remember.
verses.arabic: ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ مَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۗ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ittabi'u ma unzila ilaikum min rabbikum wala tattabi'u min dunihi awliya'a, qalilan ma tadhakkarun.

verses.eng: And how many a city have We destroyed, and Our punishment came to it at night or while they were sleeping at midday.
verses.arabic: وَكَم مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَٰهَا فَجَآءَهَا بَأْسُنَا بَيَٰتًا أَوْ هُمْ قَآئِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wakam min qaryatin ahlaknaha faja'aha ba'suna bayatan aw hum qa'ilun.

verses.eng: And their claim was not, when Our punishment came to them, except that they said, "Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ دَعْوَىٰهُمْ إِذْ جَآءَهُم بَأْسُنَآ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fama kana da'wahum idh ja'ahum ba'suna illa an qalu inna kunna dhalimin.

verses.eng: Then We will surely question those to whom [messengers] were sent, and We will surely question the messengers.
verses.arabic: فَلَنَسْـَٔلَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَنَسْـَٔلَنَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falanas'alannalladhina ursila ilaihim walanas'alannal-mursalin.

verses.eng: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge, and We were not absent.
verses.arabic: فَلَنَقُصَّنَّ عَلَيْهِم بِعِلْمٍ ۖ وَمَا كُنَّا غَآئِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falanaqussanna 'alaihim bi'ilmin wama kunna gha'ibin.

verses.eng: And the weighing [of deeds] that day will be the truth. So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who will be the successful.
verses.arabic: وَٱلْوَزْنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْحَقُّ ۚ فَمَن ثَقُلَت مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wal-waznu yawma'idhin alhaqqu faman thaqulat mawazinuhu faula'ika humul-muflihun.

verses.eng: And those whose scales are light - it is they who have lost themselves for what injustice they were doing to Our verses.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waman khaffat mawazinuhu faula'ikalladhina khasiru anfusahum bima kanu bi'ayatina yadhlimun.

verses.eng: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein means of livelihood. Little are you grateful.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ مَكَّنَّٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَٰيِشَ ۗ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad makkannakum fil-ardi waja'alna lakum fiha ma'ayisha, qalilan ma tashkurun.

verses.eng: And We have certainly created you, then fashioned you, then said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَٰكُمْ ثُمَّ صَوَّرْنَٰكُمْ ثُمَّ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ لَمْ يَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad khalaqnakum thumma sawwarnakum thumma qulna lilmala'ikati usjudu li'adama fasajadu illa iblisa lam yakun minas-sajidin.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?" [Iblees] said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
verses.arabic: قَالَ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَلَّا تَسْجُدَ إِذْ أَمَرْتُكَ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا۠ خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ خَلَقْتَنِى مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن طِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Qala ma mana'aka alla tasjuda idh amartuka qala ana khairun minhu khalaqtani min narin wakhalaqtahu min tin.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise, for it is not for you to be arrogant therein. So get out; indeed, you are of the debased."
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَٱهْبِطْ مِنْهَا فَمَا يَكُونُ لَكَ أَن تَتَكَبَّرَ فِيهَا فَٱخْرُجْ إِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰغِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala fahbit minha fama yakunu laka an tatakabbara fiha fakhruj innaka minas-saghirin.

verses.eng: [Iblees] said, "Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala andhirni ila yawmi yub'athun.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Indeed, you are of those reprieved."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنظَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala innaka minal-mundharin.

verses.eng: [Iblees] said, "Because you have put me in error, I will surely sit in wait for them on your straight path.
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَبِمَآ أَغْوَيْتَنِى لَأَقْعُدَنَّ لَهُمْ صِرَٰطَكَ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Qala fabima aghwaitani la'aq'udanna lahum sirataka almustaqim.

verses.eng: Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left, and You will not find most of them grateful [to You]."
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لَـَٔاتِيَنَّهُم مِّنۢ بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ وَعَنْ أَيْمَٰنِهِمْ وَعَن شَمَآئِلِهِمْ ۖ وَلَا تَجِدُ أَكْثَرَهُمْ شَٰكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma la'atiyannahum min baini aidihim wamin khalfihim wa'an aimanihim wa'an shama'ilihim wala tajidu aktharahum shakirin.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Get out of Paradise, reproached and expelled. Whoever follows you among them - I will surely fill Hell with you all."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱخْرُجْ مِنْهَا مَذْءُومًا مَّدْحُورًا ۖ لَّمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكُم أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala ukhruj minha madh'umam madhura, laman tabi'aka minhum la'amla'anna jahannama minkum ajma'in.

verses.eng: And [Allah said], "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat from wherever you will. But do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: وَيَٰٓـَٔادَمُ ٱسْكُنْ أَنتَ وَزَوْجُكَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ فَكُلَا مِنْ حَيْثُ شِئْتُمَا وَلَا تَقْرَبَا هَٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waya adamu uskun anta wazawjuka aljannata fakula min haithu shi'tuma wala taqraba hadhihi ashshajarata fatakuna minadhdhalimin.

verses.eng: And Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts. He said, "Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you should become angels or become of the immortal."
verses.arabic: فَوَسْوَسَ لَهُمَا ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ لِيُبْدِىَ لَهُمَا مَا وُۥرِىَ عَنْهُمَا مِن سَوْءَٰتِهِمَا وَقَالَ مَا نَهَىٰكُمَا رَبُّكُمَا عَنْ هَٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةِ إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَا مَلَكَيْنِ أَوْ تَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلْخَٰلِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fawaswasa lahumash-shaitanu liyubdiya lahuma ma wuriya 'anhuma min saw'atihima waqala ma nahakuma rabbukuma 'an hadhihi ashshajarati illa an takuna malakaini aw takuna minal-khalidin.

verses.eng: And he swore to them, "Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors."
verses.arabic: وَقَاسَمَهُمَآ إِنِّى لَكُمَا لَمِنَ ٱلنَّٰصِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqasamahuma inni lakuma laminan-nasihin.

verses.eng: So he made them fall, [both], by deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And their Lord called to them, "Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?"
verses.arabic: فَدَلَّىٰهُمَا بِغُرُورٍ ۚ فَلَمَّا ذَاقَا ٱلشَّجَرَةَ بَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْءَٰتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ وَنَادَىٰهُمَا رَبُّهُمَآ أَلَمْ أَنْهَكُمَا عَن تِلْكُمَا ٱلشَّجَرَةِ وَأَقُل لَّكُمَآ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنَ لَكُمَا عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Fadallahuma bighururin falamma dhaqa ashshajarata badat lahuma saw'atuhuma watafiqa yakhsifani 'alaihima min waraqi aljannati wanadahuma rabbuhuma alam anhakuma 'an tilkuma ashshajarati wa'aqul lakuma inna ashshaitana lakuma 'aduwwun mubin.

verses.eng: They said, "Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers."
verses.arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbana dhalamna anfusana wa-in lam taghfir lana watarhamna lanakunanna minal-khasirin.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Descend, some of you an enemy to others. And you will have upon the earth a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱهْبِطُوا۟ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُسْتَقَرٌّ وَمَتَٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Qala ihbitu ba'dukum liba'din 'aduwwun walakum fil-ardi mustaqarrun wamata'un ila hin.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Therein you will live, and therein you will die, and from it you will be brought forth."
verses.arabic: قَالَ فِيهَا تَحْيَوْنَ وَفِيهَا تَمُوتُونَ وَمِنْهَا تُخْرَجُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala fiha tahyawna wafiha tamutuna waminha tukhrajun.

verses.eng: O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment. But the clothing of righteousness - that is best. That is from the signs of Allah that they might remember.
verses.arabic: يَٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ قَدْ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكُمْ لِبَاسًا يُوَٰرِى سَوْءَٰتِكُمْ وَرِيشًا ۖ وَلِبَاسُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ ءَايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yabani adama qad anzalna 'alaikum libasan yuwari saw'atikum warishan walibasu attaqwa dhalika khairun dhalika min ayati Allahi la'allahum yadhdhakkarun.

verses.eng: O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts. Indeed, he and his soldiers see you from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies for those who do not believe.
verses.arabic: يَٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ لَا يَفْتِنَنَّكُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ كَمَآ أَخْرَجَ أَبَوَيْكُم مِّنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ يَنزِعُ عَنْهُمَا لِبَاسَهُمَا لِيُرِيَهُمَا سَوْءَٰتِهِمَآ ۗ إِنَّهُۥ يَرَىٰكُمْ هُوَ وَقَبِيلُهُۥ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا تَرَوْنَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ أَوْلِيَآءَ لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yabani adama la yaftinannakumu ashshaitanu kama akhraja abawaikum minaljannati yanzi'u 'anhuma libasahuma liyuriyahuma saw'atihima innahu yarakum huwa waqabiluhu min haithu la tarawnahum inna ja'alna ashshayatina awliya'a lilladhina la yu'minun.

verses.eng: And when they commit an immorality, they say, "We found our fathers doing this, and Allah has ordered us to do it." Say, "Indeed, Allah does not order immorality. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?"
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا فَعَلُوا۟ فَٰحِشَةً قَالُوا۟ وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهَآ ءَابَآءَنَا وَٱللَّهُ أَمَرَنَا بِهَا ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَأْمُرُ بِٱلْفَحْشَآءِ ۖ أَتَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idha fa'alu fahishatan qalu wajadna 'alaiha aba'ana wallahu amarana biha qul inna Allaha la ya'muru bilfahsha'i ataquluna 'ala Allahi ma la ta'lamun.

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord has ordered justice. And establish your faces toward Him at every masjid and invoke Him, sincere to Him in religion. Just as He originated you, so will you return [to life]."
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَمَرَ رَبِّى بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۖ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ عِندَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ وَٱدْعُوهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأَكُمْ تَعُودُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul amara rabbi بالقسط wa'aqimu wujuhakum 'inda kulli masjidin wa'duhu mukhlisina lahu addina kama bada'akum ta'udun.

verses.eng: [Some] He has guided, and [some] have deserved [to be in] error. Indeed, they have taken the devils as allies instead of Allah while they think that they are guided.
verses.arabic: فَرِيقًا هَدَىٰ وَفَرِيقًا حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلضَّلَٰلَةُ ۗ إِنَّهُمُ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fariqan hada wafariqan haqqa 'alaihimu addalalatu innahum ittakhadhu ashshayatina awliya'a min duni Allahi wayahsabuna annahum muhtadun.

verses.eng: O children of Adam, take your adornment at every masjid, and eat and drink, but be not excessive. Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.
verses.arabic: يَٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ خُذُوا۟ زِينَتَكُمْ عِندَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ وَكُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ وَلَا تُسْرِفُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yabani adama khudhu zinatakum 'inda kulli masjidin wakulu washrabu wala tusrifu innahu la yuhibbu almusrifin.

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah which He has produced for His servants and the good [lawful] things of provision?" Say, "They are for those who believe during this worldly life [and] exclusively for them on the Day of Resurrection." Thus do We detail the verses for people who know.
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَنْ حَرَّمَ زِينَةَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَخْرَجَ لِعِبَادِهِۦ وَٱلطَّيِّبَٰتِ مِنَ ٱلرِّزْقِ ۚ قُلْ هِىَ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا خَالِصَةً يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul man harrama zinata Allahi allati akhraja li'ibadihi wattayyibati minar-rizqi qul hiya lilladhina amanu filhayati addunya khalisatan yawma alqiyamati kadhalika nufassilu al-ayati liqawmin ya'lamun.

verses.eng: Say, "My Lord has only forbidden immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed - and sin, and oppression without right, and that you associate with Allah that for which He has not sent down authority, and that you say about Allah what you do not know."
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ رَبِّىَ ٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا وَمَا بَطَنَ وَٱلْإِثْمَ وَٱلْبَغْىَ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَأَن تُشْرِكُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِۦ سُلْطَٰنًا وَأَن تَقُولُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul innama harrama rabbiya alfawahisha ma dhahara minha wama batana wal-ithma walbaghya bighairi alhaqqi wa-an tushriku billahi ma lam yunazzil bihi sultanan wa-an taqulu 'ala Allahi ma la ta'lamun.

verses.eng: And for every nation is a [specified] term. So when their term has come, they will not remain behind it an hour, nor will they precede it.
verses.arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ لَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ سَاعَةً وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walikulli ummatin ajalun fa-idha ja'a ajaluhum la yasta'khiruna sa'atan wala yastaqdimun.

verses.eng: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among yourselves relating to you My verses, then whoever fears Allah and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
verses.arabic: يَٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ إِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ رُسُلٌ مِّنكُمْ يَقُصُّونَ عَلَيْكُمْ ءَايَٰتِى ۙ فَمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰ وَأَصْلَحَ فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yabani adama imma ya'tiyannakum rusulun minkum yaqussuna 'alaikum ayati famani ittaqa wa'aslaha fala khawfun 'alaihim wala hum yahzanun.

verses.eng: But those who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ عَنْهَآ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina wastakbaru 'anha ula'ika ashabu annari hum fiha khalidun.

verses.eng: So who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies His verses? Those will attain their portion of the decree until when Our messengers [of death] come to them, they say, "Where are those you used to invoke besides Allah?" They will say, "They have departed from us," and will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
verses.arabic: فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِـَٔايَٰتِهِۦٓ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ يَنَالُهُمْ نَصِيبُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُنَا يَتَوَفَّوْنَهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ ضَلُّوا۟ عَنَّا وَشَهِدُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ كَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faman adhlamu mimmani iftara 'ala Allahi kadhiban aw kadhdhaba bi'ayatihi ula'ika yanaluhum nasibuhum minal-kitabi hatta idha ja'at-hum rusuluna yatawaffawnahum qalu ayna ma kuntum tad'una min duni Allahi qalu dallu 'anna washahidu 'ala anfusihim annahum kanu kafirin.

verses.eng: [Allah] will say, "Enter among the nations which have passed before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire." Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister until, when they have all overtaken one another therein, the last of them will say about the first of them, "Our Lord, these had misled us, so give them a double punishment of the Fire." He will say, "For each is double, but you do not know."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ فِىٓ أُمَمٍ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ فِى ٱلنَّارِ ۖ كُلَّمَا دَخَلَتْ أُمَّةٌ لَّعَنَتْ أُخْتَهَا ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا ٱدَّارَكُوا۟ فِيهَا جَمِيعًا قَالَتْ أُخْرَىٰهُمْ لِأُولَىٰهُمْ رَبَّنَا هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ أَضَلُّونَا فَـَٔاتِهِمْ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ قَالَ لِكُلٍّ ضِعْفٌ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala udkhulu fi umamin qad khalat min qablikum minaljinni wal-insi fi annari kullama dakhalat ummatun la'anat ukhtaha hatta idha iddaraku fiha jami'an qalat ukhrahum li'ulahum rabbana ha'ula'i adalluna fa'atihim 'adhaban di'fan min annari qala likullin di'fun walakin la ta'lamun.

verses.eng: And the first of them will say to the last of them, "So you had no advantage over us, so taste the punishment for what you used to earn."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَتْ أُولَىٰهُمْ لِأُخْرَىٰهُمْ فَمَا كَانَ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا مِن فَضْلٍ فَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqalat ulahum li'ukhrahum fama kana lakum 'alaina min fadlin fadhuku al'adhaba bima kuntum taksibun.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - the gates of heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel enters into the eye of a needle. And thus do We recompense the criminals.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ عَنْهَا لَا تُفَتَّحُ لَهُمْ أَبوَٰبُ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَلَا يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ حَتَّىٰ يَلِجَ ٱلْجَمَلُ فِى سَمِّ ٱلْخِيَاطِ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina wastakbaru 'anha la tufattahu lahum abwabu assama'i wala yadkhuluna aljannata hatta yalija aljamalu fi sammi alkhiyati wakadhalika najzi almujrimin.

verses.eng: They will have from Hell a bed and over them coverings [of fire]. And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: لَهُم مِّن جَهَنَّمَ مِهَادٌ وَمِن فَوْقِهِمْ غَوَاشٍ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lahum min jahannama mihadun wamin fawqihim ghawashin wakadhalika najzi adhthalimin.

verses.eng: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We do not charge any soul beyond its capacity - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَآ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina amanu wa'amilu assalihati la nukallifu nafsan illa wus'aha ula'ika ashabu aljannati hum fiha khalidun.

verses.eng: And We will remove whatever of resentment is in their breasts [so that] rivers will flow beneath them, and they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has guided us to this; and we would never have been guided if Allah had not guided us. Certainly the messengers of our Lord had come with the truth." And they will be called, "This is Paradise, which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do."
verses.arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ ۖ وَقَالُوا۟ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى هَدَىٰنَا لِهَٰذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لِنَهْتَدِىَ لَوْلَآ أَنْ هَدَىٰنَا ٱللَّهُ ۖ لَقَدْ جَآءَتْ رُسُلُ رَبِّنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَنُودُوٓا۟ أَن تِلْكُمُ ٱلْجَنَّةُ أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wanaza'na ma fi sudurihim min ghillin tajri min tahtihimu al-anharu waqalu alhamdu lillahi alladhi hadana lihadha wama kunna linahtadiya lawla an hadana Allahu laqad ja'at rusulu rabbina bilhaqqi wanudu an tilkumu aljannatu urithtumuhha bima kuntum ta'malun.

verses.eng: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire, "We have found what our Lord promised us to be true. Have you also found what your Lord promised [you] to be true?" They will say, "Yes." Then a proclaimer will announce among them, "The curse of Allah be upon the wrongdoers
verses.arabic: وَنَادَىٰٓ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ أَن قَدْ وَجَدْنَا مَا وَعَدَنَا رَبُّنَا حَقًّا فَهَلْ وَجَدتُّم مَّا وَعَدَ رَبُّكُمْ حَقًّا ۖ قَالُوا۟ نَعَمْ ۚ فَأَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ أَن لَّعْنَةُ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanada ashabu aljannati ashaba annari an qad wajadna ma wa'adana rabbuna haqqan fahal wajadttum ma wa'ada rabbukum haqqan qalu na'am fa'adhdhana mu'adhdhinun bainahum an la'natu Allahi 'ala adhthalimin.

verses.eng: Who avert [people] from the way of Allah and desire to make it [seem] distorted, and they, concerning the Hereafter, are disbelievers."
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ كَٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina yasudduna 'an sabili Allahi wayabghunaha 'iwajan wahum bil-akhirati kafirun.

verses.eng: And between them will be a partition, and on [its] elevations will be men who recognize all by their mark. And they will call out to the companions of Paradise, "Peace be upon you." They have not yet entered it, but they long [to].
verses.arabic: وَبَيْنَهُمَا حِجَابٌ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱلْأَعْرَافِ رِجَالٌ يَعْرِفُونَ كُلًّۢا بِسِيمَٰهُمْ ۚ وَنَادَوْا۟ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ أَن سَلَٰمٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ لَمْ يَدْخُلُوهَا وَهُمْ يَطْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wabainahuma hijabun wa'ala al-a'rafi rijalun ya'rifuna kullan bisimahum wanadaw ashaba aljannati an salamun 'alaikum lam yadkhuluha wahum yatma'un.

verses.eng: And when their eyes are turned toward the companions of the Fire, they say, "Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا صُرِفَتْ أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تِلْقَآءَ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلنَّارِ قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idha surifat absaruhum tilqa'a ashabi annari qalu rabbana la taj'alna ma'a alqawmi adhthalimin.

verses.eng: And the companions of the Elevations will call out to men they recognize by their marks, saying, "Of no avail to you was your gathering or your arrogance.
verses.arabic: وَنَادَىٰٓ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْأَعْرَافِ رِجَالًا يَعْرِفُونَهُم بِسِيمَٰهُمْ قَالُوا۟ مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنكُمْ جَمْعُكُمْ وَمَا كُنتُمْ تَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wanada ashabu al-a'rafi rijalan ya'rifunahum bisimahim qalu ma aghna 'ankum jam'ukum wama kuntum tastakbirun.

verses.eng: [Allah will say], "Are these the ones you [swore] would not receive [Allah's] mercy?" [The companions of the Elevations will say], "Enter Paradise; no fear will there be concerning you, nor will you grieve."
verses.arabic: أَهَٰٓؤُلَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ أَقْسَمْتُمْ لَا يَنَالُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ ۚ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَآ أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Aha'ula'i alladhina aqsamttum la yanaluhumu Allahu birahmah udkhulu aljannata la khawfun 'alaikum wala antum tahzanun.

verses.eng: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise, "Pour upon us some water or from whatever Allah has provided you." They will say, "Indeed, Allah has forbidden them [both] to the disbelievers
verses.arabic: وَنَادَىٰٓ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ أَنْ أَفِيضُوا۟ عَلَيْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ أَوْ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ حَرَّمَهُمَا عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanada ashabu annari ashaba aljannati an afidu 'alaina minalma'i aw mimma razaqakumullahu qalu inna Allaha harramahuma 'ala alkafirin.

verses.eng: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement and whom the worldly life deluded." So today We will forget them as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs and for what they used to reject.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ دِينَهُمْ لَهْوًا وَلَعِبًا وَغَرَّتْهُمُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ فَٱلْيَوْمَ نَنسَىٰهُمْ كَمَا نَسُوا۟ لِقَآءَ يَوْمِهِمْ هَٰذَا وَمَا كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا يَجْحَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina attakhadhu dinahum lahwan wala'iban wagharrat-humu alhayatu addunya fal-yawma nansahum kama nasu liqa'a yawmihim hadha wama kanu bi'ayatina yajhadun.

verses.eng: And We had certainly brought them a Book which We detailed with knowledge - as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جِئْنَٰهُم بِكِتَٰبٍ فَصَّلْنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ هُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad ji'nahum bikitabin fassalnahu 'ala 'ilmin hudan warahmatan liqawmin yu'minun.

verses.eng: Do they await its result? The Day its result comes those who previously forgot it will say, "The messengers of our Lord had come with the truth, so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us or could we be returned to [the world] so we could do other than what we used to do?" They will have lost themselves, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.
verses.arabic: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا تَأْوِيلَهُۥ ۚ يَوْمَ يَأْتِى تَأْوِيلُهُۥ يَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ نَسُوهُ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَآءَتْ رُسُلُ رَبِّنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ فَهَل لَّنَا مِن شُفَعَٰٓءَ فَيَشْفَعُوا۟ لَنَآ أَوْ نُرَدُّ فَنَعْمَلَ غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ ۚ قَدْ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hal yanthuruna illa ta'wilahu yawma ya'ti ta'wiluhu yaqulu alladhina nasuhu min qablu qad ja'at rusulu rabbina bilhaqqi fahal lana min shufa'a fayashfa'u lana aw nuraddu fana'mala ghaira alladhi kunna na'malu qad khasiru anfusahum wadalla 'anhum ma kanu yaftarun.

verses.eng: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the night with the day, [another night] closely following it, and the sun, the moon, and the stars - subjected by His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ يُغْشِى ٱلَّيْلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ يَطْلُبُهُۥ حَثِيثًا وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ وَٱلنُّجُومَ مُسَخَّرَٰتٍۭ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ أَلَا لَهُ ٱلْخَلْقُ وَٱلْأَمْرُ ۗ تَبَارَكَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna rabbakumullahu alladhi khalaqa assamawati wal-arda fi sittati ayyamin thumma istawa 'ala al'arshi yughshi allayla annahara yatlubuhu hathithan washshamsa walqamara wannujuma musakhkharatin bi-amrihi ala lahu alkhalqu wal-amru tabarakallahu rabbu al'alamin.

verses.eng: Call upon your Lord in humility and privately; indeed, He does not like transgressors.
verses.arabic: ٱدْعُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ تَضَرُّعًا وَخُفْيَةً ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُعْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ud'u rabbakum tadarru'an wakhufyatan innahu la yuhibbu almu'tadin.

verses.eng: And cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. And invoke Him in fear and aspiration. Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بَعْدَ إِصْلَٰحِهَا وَٱدْعُوهُ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا ۚ إِنَّ رَحْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ قَرِيبٌ مِّنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wala tufsidu fil-ardi ba'da islahiha wa'duhu khawfan watama'an inna rahmata Allahi qaribun minal-muhsinin.

verses.eng: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy until, when they have carried heavy clouds, We drive them to a dead land and We send down rain upon it and bring forth thereby all fruits. And thus will We bring forth the dead; perhaps you may be reminded.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَقَلَّتْ سَحَابًا ثِقَالًا سُقْنَٰهُ لِبَلَدٍ مَّيِّتٍ فَأَنزَلْنَا بِهِ ٱلْمَآءَ فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِۦ مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa alladhi yursilu arriyaha bushran baina yaday rahmatihi hatta idha aqallat sahaban thiqalan suqnahu libaladin mayyitin fa-anzalna bihi alma'a fa'akhrajna bihi min kulli aththamarati kadhalika nukhriju almawta la'allakum tadhakkarun.

verses.eng: And the good land - its vegetation emerges by permission of its Lord; but that which is bad - nothing emerges except sparsely. Thus do We diversify the signs for a people who are grateful.
verses.arabic: وَٱلْبَلَدُ ٱلطَّيِّبُ يَخْرُجُ نَبَاتُهُۥ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِۦ ۖ وَٱلَّذِى خَبُثَ لَا يَخْرُجُ إِلَّا نَكِدًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُصَرِّفُ ٱلْـَٔايَٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walbaladu attayyibu yakhruju nabatuhu bi-idhni rabbihi walladhi khabutha la yakhruju illa nakidan kadhalika nusarrifu al-ayati liqawmin yashkurun.

verses.eng: We had already sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day."
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَقَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Laqad arsalna nuhan ila qawmihi faqala yaqawmi u'budu Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghairuhu inni akhafu 'alaikum 'adhaba yawmin 'adhim.

verses.eng: The eminent among his people said, "Indeed, we see you in clear error."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّا لَنَرَىٰكَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Qala almala'u min qawmihi inna lanaraka fi dalalin mubin.

verses.eng: [Noah] said, "O my people, there is no error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ لَيْسَ بِى ضَلَٰلَةٌ وَلَٰكِنِّى رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala yaqawmi laysa bi dalalatun walakinni rasulun min rabbi al'alamin.

verses.eng: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and advise you; and I know from Allah that which you do not know.
verses.arabic: أُبَلِّغُكُمْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّى وَأَنصَحُ لَكُمْ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Uballighukum risalati rabbi wa-ansahu lakum wa-a'lamu mina Allahi ma la ta'lamun.

verses.eng: Then do you wonder that a reminder has come to you from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear Allah and perhaps you may receive mercy?
verses.arabic: أَوَعَجِبْتُمْ أَن جَآءَكُمْ ذِكْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنكُمْ لِيُنذِرَكُمْ وَلِتَتَّقُوا۟ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa'ajibtum an ja'akum dhikrun min rabbikum 'ala rajulin minkum liyundhirakum walitattaqu wala'allakum tur'hamun.

verses.eng: But they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ark, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind people.
verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَنجَيْنَٰهُ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ وَأَغْرَقْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا عَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakadhdhabuhu fa-anjainahu walladhina ma'ahu fil-fulki wa-aghraqna alladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina innahum kanu qawman 'amin.

verses.eng: And to [the people of] 'Aad We sent their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?
verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ عَادٍ أَخَاهُمْ هُودًا ۗ قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ila 'adin akhahum hudan qala yaqawmi u'budu Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghairuhu afala tattaqun.

verses.eng: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "Indeed, we see you in foolishness, and indeed, we think you are of the liars."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّا لَنَرَىٰكَ فِى سَفَاهَةٍ وَإِنَّا لَنَظُنُّكَ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala almala'u alladhina kafaru min qawmihi inna lanaraka fi safahatin wa-inna lanadhunnuka minal-kadhibin.

verses.eng: [Hud] said, "O my people, there is no foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ لَيْسَ بِى سَفَاهَةٌ وَلَٰكِنِّى رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala yaqawmi laysa bi safahatun walakinni rasulun min rabbi al'alamin.

verses.eng: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I am to you a trustworthy advisor.
verses.arabic: أُبَلِّغُكُمْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّى وَأَنَا۠ لَكُمْ نَاصِحٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Uballighukum risalati rabbi wa-ana lakum nasihun amin.

verses.eng: Then do you wonder that a reminder has come to you from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively. So remember the favors of Allah that you might succeed.
verses.arabic: أَوَعَجِبْتُمْ أَن جَآءَكُمْ ذِكْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنكُمْ لِّيُنذِرَكُمْ ۚ وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَعَلَكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَزَادَكُمْ فِى ٱلْخَلْقِ بَصْطَةً ۖ فَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ ءَالَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa'ajibtum an ja'akum dhikrun min rabbikum 'ala rajulin minkum liyundhirakum wadhkuru idh ja'alakum khulafa'a min ba'di qawmi nuhin wazadakum fil-khalqi bastatan fadhkuru ala'a Allahi la'allakum tuflihun.

verses.eng: They said, "Have you come to us so that we worship Allah alone and abandon what our fathers used to worship? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَجِئْتَنَا لِنَعْبُدَ ٱللَّهَ وَحْدَهُۥ وَنَذَرَ مَا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ ءَابَآؤُنَا ۖ فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qalu aji'tana lina'buda Allaha wahdahu wanadhara ma kana ya'budu aba'una fa'tina bima ta'iduna in kunta minas-sadiqin.

verses.eng: [Hud] said, "Punishment and wrath have already fallen upon you from your Lord. Do you dispute with me concerning names you have named - you and your fathers - for which Allah has not sent down any authority? Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
verses.arabic: قَالَ قَدْ وَقَعَ عَلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ رِجْسٌ وَغَضَبٌ ۖ أَتُجَٰدِلُونَنِى فِىٓ أَسْمَآءٍ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَٰنٍ ۚ فَٱنتَظِرُوٓا۟ إِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُنتَظِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala qad waqa'a 'alaikum min rabbikum rijsun waghadabun atujadilunani fi asma'in sammaitumuhha antum waaba'ukum ma nazzala Allahu biha min sultanin fantadhiru inni ma'akum minal-muntadhirin.

verses.eng: So We saved him and those with him by a mercy from Us, and We uprooted those who denied Our signs, and they were not believers.
verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَٰهُ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِّنَّا وَقَطَعْنَا دَابِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا ۖ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-anjainahu walladhina ma'ahu birahmatin minna waqata'na dabira alladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina wama kanu mu'minin.

verses.eng: And to [the people of] Thamud We sent their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. This is the she-camel of Allah [sent] to you as a sign. So leave her to eat within Allah's land and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَٰلِحًا ۗ قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥ ۖ قَدْ جَآءَتْكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةُ ٱللَّهِ لَكُمْ ءَايَةً ۖ فَذَرُوهَا تَأْكُلْ فِىٓ أَرْضِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ila thamuda akhahum salihan qala yaqawmi u'budu Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghairuhu qad ja'atkum bayyinatun min rabbikum hadhihi naqatu Allahi lakum ayatan fadharuha ta'kul fi ardi Allahi wala tamassuha bisu'in faya'khudhakum 'adhabun alim.

verses.eng: And remember when He made you successors after 'Aad and settled you in the land, [where] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of Allah and do not cause corruption on the earth after its reformation.
verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَعَلَكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ عَادٍ وَبَوَّأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِن سُهُولِهَا قُصُورًا وَتَنْحِتُونَ ٱلْجِبَالَ بُيُوتًا ۖ فَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ ءَالَآءَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wadhkuru idh ja'alakum khulafa'a min ba'di 'adin wabawwa'akum fil-ardi tattakhidhuna min suhuliha qusuran watanhituna aljibala buyutan fadhkuru ala'a Allahi wala ta'thaw fil-ardi mufsidin.

verses.eng: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed - to those who believed among them, "Do you [really] know that Salih was sent by his Lord?" They said, "Indeed we, in what he was sent with, are believers."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ لِمَنْ ءَامَنَ مِنْهُمْ أَتَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ صَٰلِحًا مُّرْسَلٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۚ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِمَآ أُرْسِلَ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala almala'u alladhina istakbaru min qawmihi lilladhina istudh'ifu liman amana minhum ata'lamuna anna salihan mursalun min rabbihi qalu inna bima ursila bihi mu'minun.

verses.eng: Said those who were arrogant, "Indeed we, in what you believe, are disbelievers."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِٱلَّذِىٓ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ كَٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala alladhina istakbaru inna billadhi amantum bihi kafirun.

verses.eng: So they hamstrung the she-camel and defied the command of their Lord and said, "O Salih, bring us what you promised us, if you should be of the messengers.
verses.arabic: فَعَقَرُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةَ وَعَتَوْا۟ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ وَقَالُوا۟ يَٰصَٰلِحُ ٱئْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'aqaru annaqata wa'ataw 'an amri rabbihim waqalu ya salihu i'tina bima ta'iduna in kunta minal-mursalin.

verses.eng: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَٰثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'akhadhat-humu arrajfatu fa'asbahu fi darihim jathimin.

verses.eng: And Salih turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord and advised you, but you do not like advisors.
verses.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَالَةَ رَبِّى وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُحِبُّونَ ٱلنَّٰصِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fatawalla 'anhum waqala yaqawmi laqad ablaghtukum risalata rabbi wanasahtu lakum walakin la tuhibbuna annasihin.

verses.eng: And [We sent] Lot when he said to his people, "Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you in from [all of] the worlds?
verses.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَٰحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُم بِهَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِّنَ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walutan idh qala liqawmihi ata'tuna alfahishata ma sabaqakum biha min ahadin minal'alamin.

verses.eng: Indeed, you approach men with desire instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people.
verses.arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ الرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ النِّسَاءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّسْرِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innakum latatoona arrijala shahwatan min dooni annisa-i bal antum qawmun musrifoon

verses.eng: And the answer of his people was not but they said, 'Expel them from your city! Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure.'
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِ إِلَّا أَن قَالُوا أَخْرِجُوهُم مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama kana jawaba qawmihi illa an qaloo akhrijoohum min qaryatikum innahum onasuny yatatahharoon

verses.eng: So We saved him and his family except his wife; she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].
verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ كَانَتْ مِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faanjaynahu waahlahu illa imraatahu kanat mina alghabireen

verses.eng: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones]. Then see how was the end of the criminals.
verses.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waamtarna AAalayhim mataran fanthur kayfa kana AAaqibatu almujrimeen

verses.eng: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and do not cause corruption upon the earth after its reformation. That is better for you, if you should be believers.
verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًا ۗ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ قَدْ جَاءَتْكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَأَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَالْمِيزَانَ وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تُفْسِدُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ بَعْدَ إِصْلَاحِهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ila madyana akhahum ShuAAayban qala ya qawmi oAAbudoo Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghayruhu qad jaatkum bayyinatun min rabbikum faawfoo alkayla waalmeezana wala tabkhasoo annasa ashyaahum wala tufsidoo fee al-ardi baAAda islahiha thalikum khayrun lakum in kuntum mu/mineen

verses.eng: And do not sit on every path, threatening and averting from the way of Allah those who believe in Him, seeking to make it [seem] deviant. And remember when you were few and He multiplied you. And see how the end of the corrupters was.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْعُدُوا بِكُلِّ صِرَاطٍ تُوعِدُونَ وَتَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ مَنْ آمَنَ بِهِ وَتَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا ۚ وَاذْكُرُوا إِذْ كُنتُمْ قَلِيلًا فَكَثَّرَكُمْ ۖ وَانظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wala taqAAudoo bikulli siratin tooAAidoona watasuddoona AAan sabeeli Allahi man amana bihi watabghoonaha AAiwajan waothkuroo ith kuntum qaleelan fakaththarakum waonthuroo kayfa kana AAaqibatu almufsideen

verses.eng: And if there should be a group among you who has believed in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not believed, then be patient until Allah judges between us. And He is the best of judges.
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ طَائِفَةٌ مِّنكُمْ آمَنُوا بِالَّذِي أُرْسِلْتُ بِهِ وَطَائِفَةٌ لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا فَاصْبِرُوا حَتَّىٰ يَحْكُمَ اللَّهُ بَيْنَنَا ۚ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الْحَاكِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in kana ta-ifatum minkum amanoo biallathee orsiltu bihi wata-ifatum lam yu/minoo faisbiroo hatta yahkuma Allahu baynana wahuwa khayru alhakimeen

verses.eng: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people, 'We will surely evict you, O Shu'ayb, and those who have believed with you from our city, or you must return to our religion.' He said, 'Even if we were unwilling?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا مِن قَوْمِهِ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكَ يَا شُعَيْبُ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَكَ مِن قَرْيَتِنَا أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِي مِلَّتِنَا ۚ قَالَ أَوَلَوْ كُنَّا كَارِهِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala almalao allatheena istakbaroo min qawmihi lanukhrijannaka ya ShuAAaybu waallatheena amanoo maAAaka min qaryatina aw lataAAoodunna fee millatina qala awalaw kunna kariheena

verses.eng: We would have invented against Allah a lie if we returned to your religion after Allah had saved us from it. And it is not for us to return to it except that Allah, our Lord, should will. Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. Upon Allah we have relied. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision.
verses.arabic: قَدِ افْتَرَيْنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا إِنْ عُدْنَا فِي مِلَّتِكُم بَعْدَ إِذْ نَجَّانَا اللَّهُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَمَا يَكُونُ لَنَا أَن نَّعُودَ فِيهَا إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّنَا ۚ وَسِعَ رَبُّنَا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا ۚ عَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا افْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْفَاتِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qadi iftarayna AAala Allahi kathiban in AAudna fee millatikum baAAda ith najjana Allahu minha wama yakoonu lana an naAAooda feeha illa an yashaa Allahu rabbuna wasiAAa rabbuna kulla shay-in AAilman AAala Allahi tawakkalna rabbana iftah baynana wabayna qawmina bialhaqqi waanta khayru alfatihina

verses.eng: And the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people said, 'If you should follow Shu'ayb, indeed, you would then be losers.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن قَوْمِهِ لَئِنِ اتَّبَعْتُمْ شُعَيْبًا إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّخَاسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqala almalao allatheena kafaroo min qawmihi la-ini ittabaAAtum ShuAAayban innakum ithan lakhasiroon

verses.eng: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا فِي دَارِهِمْ جَاثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-akhathat-humu arrajfatu fa-asbahoo fee darihim jathimeen

verses.eng: Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was they who were the losers.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا شُعَيْبًا كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا فِيهَا ۚ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا شُعَيْبًا كَانُوا هُمُ الْخَاسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Allatheena kaththaboo ShuAAayban kaan lam yaghnawoo feeha allatheena kaththaboo ShuAAayban kanoo humu alkhasireen

verses.eng: And he turned away from them and said, 'O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?'
verses.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَا قَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّي وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ آسَىٰ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ كَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fatawalla AAanhum waqala ya qawmi laqad ablaghtukum risalati rabbee wanasahtu lakum fakayfa asa AAala qawmin kafireen

verses.eng: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to Allah].
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا فِي قَرْيَةٍ مِّن نَّبِيٍّ إِلَّا أَخَذْنَا أَهْلَهَا بِالْبَأْسَاءِ وَالضَّرَّاءِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَضَّرَّعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama arsalna fee qaryatin min nabiyyin illa akhathna ahlaha bilba/sa-i waaddarra-i laAAallahum yaddarraAAoon

verses.eng: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, 'Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease.' So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَدَّلْنَا مَكَانَ السَّيِّئَةِ الْحَسَنَةَ حَتَّىٰ عَفَوا وَّقَالُوا قَدْ مَسَّ آبَاءَنَا الضَّرَّاءُ وَالسَّرَّاءُ فَأَخَذْنَاهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma baddalna makana assayyi-ati alhasanata hatta AAafaw waqaloo qad massa abaana addarrao waalssarrao fa-akhathnahum baghtatan wahum la yashAAuroon

verses.eng: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ أَهْلَ الْقُرَىٰ آمَنُوا وَاتَّقَوْا لَفَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَرَكَاتٍ مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبُوا فَأَخَذْنَاهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw anna ahla alqura amanoo waittaqaw lafatahna AAalayhim barakatin mina alssama-i waal-ardi walakin kaththaboo fa-akhathnahum bima kanoo yaksiboon

verses.eng: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?
verses.arabic: أَفَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ الْقُرَىٰ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا بَيَاتًا وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afaamina ahlu alqura an ya/tiyahum ba/suna bayatan wahum na-imoone

verses.eng: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?
verses.arabic: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ الْقُرَىٰ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا ضُحًى وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awaamina ahlu alqura an ya/tiyahum ba/suna duhan wahum yalAAaboon

verses.eng: Then did they feel secure from the plan of Allah? But no one feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people.
verses.arabic: أَفَأَمِنُوا مَكْرَ اللَّهِ ۚ فَلَا يَأْمَنُ مَكْرَ اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْقَوْمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afaaminoo makra Allahi fala ya/manu makra Allahi illa alqawmu alkhasiroon

verses.eng: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] inhabitants that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَهْدِ لِلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَهْلِهَآ أَن لَّوْ نَشَآءُ أَصَبْنَٰهُم بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۚ وَنَطْبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awalam yahdi lilladhina yarithuna al-arda min ba'di ahliha an law nashao asabnahum bidhunubihim wanatba'u 'ala qulubihim fahum la yasma'un.

verses.eng: Those cities - We relate to you [O Muhammad] some of their news. And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus does Allah seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآئِهَا ۚ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَٰتِ فَمَا كَانُوا۟ لِيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِمَا كَذَّبُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Tilka alqura naqussu 'alaika min anba'iha walaqad ja'at-hum rusuluhum bilbayyinati fama kanu liyu'minu bima kadhdhabu min qablu kadhalika yatba'u Allahu 'ala qulubi alkafirin.

verses.eng: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَمَا وَجَدْنَا لِأَكْثَرِهِم مِّنْ عَهْدٍ ۖ وَإِن وَجَدْنَآ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَفَٰسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wama wajadna li'aktharihim min 'ahdin wa-in wajadna aktharahum lafasiqin.

verses.eng: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَظَلَمُوا۟ بِهَا ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ba'athna min ba'dihim musa bi'ayatina ila fir'awna wamala'ihi fadhalamu biha fanthur kaifa kana 'aqibatu almufsidin.

verses.eng: And Moses said, O Pharaoh, indeed I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds -
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ يَٰفِرْعَوْنُ إِنِّى رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqala musa ya fir'awnu inni rasulun min rabbi al'alamin.

verses.eng: [One] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel.
verses.arabic: حَقِيقٌ عَلَىٰٓ أَن لَّآ أَقُولَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْحَقَّ ۚ قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِبَيِّنَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعِىَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.transliteration: Haqiqun 'ala an la aqula 'ala Allahi illa alhaqqa qad ji'tukum bibayyinatin min rabbikum fa'arsil ma'iya bani isra'il.

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِن كُنتَ جِئْتَ بِـَٔايَةٍ فَأْتِ بِهَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala in kunta ji'ta bi'ayatin fa'ti biha in kunta minas-sadiqin.

verses.eng: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a conspicuous serpent.
verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa'alqa 'asahu fa-idha hiya thu'banun mubin.
