verses.eng: And he drew out his hand, and suddenly it was white [with radiance] for the observers.
verses.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanaza'a yadahu fa-idha hiya bayda'u lilnnadhirin.

verses.eng: Said the eminent ones from Pharaoh's people, "Indeed, this is a knowing magician.
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qala almala'u min qawmi fir'awna inna hadha lasahirun 'alim.

verses.eng: He wants to drive you out of your land, so what do you advise?
verses.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُمْ ۖ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yuridu an yukhrijakum min ardikum famadha ta'murun.

verses.eng: They said, "Postpone [consideration of] him and his brother, and send among the cities gatherers
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَأَرْسِلْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qalu arjih wa'akhahu wa'arsil filmada'ini hashirin.

verses.eng: Who will bring you every knowing magician."
verses.arabic: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَٰحِرٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Ya'tuka bikulli sahirin 'alim.

verses.eng: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed, we will have a reward if we are the predominant."
verses.arabic: وَجَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ فِرْعَوْنَ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waja'a assaharatu fir'awna qalu inna lana la'ajran in kunna nahnul-ghalibin.

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, "Yes, and indeed, you will be of those brought near [to me]."
verses.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala na'am wa-innakum lamin almuqarrabin.

verses.eng: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِمَّآ أَن تُلْقِىَ وَإِمَّآ أَن نَّكُونَ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُلْقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qalu ya musa imma an tulqiya wa-imma an nakuna nahnul-mulqin.

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلْقُوا۟ ۖ فَلَمَّآ أَلْقَوْا۟ سَحَرُوٓا۟ أَعْيُنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَٱسْتَرْهَبُوهُمْ وَجَآءُو بِسِحْرٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Qala alqu falamma alqaw saharu a'yuna annasi wastarhabuhum waja'u bisihrin 'adhim.

verses.eng: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.
verses.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-awhayna ila musa an alqi 'asaka fa-idha hiya talqafu ma ya'fikun.

verses.eng: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.
verses.arabic: فَوَقَعَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَبَطَلَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fawaqa'a alhaqqu wabatala ma kanu ya'malun.

verses.eng: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there, and they became debased.
verses.arabic: فَغُلِبُوا۟ هُنَالِكَ وَٱنقَلَبُوا۟ صَٰغِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faghulibu hunalika wanqalabu saghirin.

verses.eng: And the magicians fell down prostrating.
verses.arabic: وَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَٰجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa'ulqiya assaharatu sajidin.

verses.eng: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qalu amanna birabbi al'alamin.

verses.eng: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
verses.arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi musa waharun.

verses.eng: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission? Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you have conspired in the city that you may drive out its people. But you are going to know.
verses.arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَمَكْرٌ مَّكَرْتُمُوهُ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ لِتُخْرِجُوا۟ مِنْهَآ أَهْلَهَا ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala fir'awnu amantum bihi qabla an adhana lakum inna hadha lamakrun makartumuhu filmadinati litukhriju minha ahlaha fasawfa ta'lamun.

verses.eng: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all.
verses.arabic: لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَٰفٍ ثُمَّ لَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: La'uqatti'anna aidiyakum wa'arjulakum min khilafin thumma la'usallibannakum ajma'in.

verses.eng: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qalu inna ila rabbina munqalibun.

verses.eng: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and cause us to die as Muslims [in submission to You]."
verses.arabic: وَمَا تَنقِمُ مِنَّآ إِلَّآ أَنْ ءَامَنَّا بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّنَا لَمَّا جَآءَتْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wama tanqimu minna illa an amanna bi'ayati rabbina lamma ja'atna rabbana afrigh 'alaina sabran watawaffana muslimin.

verses.eng: Said the eminent ones among Pharaoh's people, "Do you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their [newborn] sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are dominant over them."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ أَتَذَرُ مُوسَىٰ وَقَوْمَهُۥ لِيُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَذَرَكَ وَءَالِهَتَكَ ۚ قَالَ سَنُقَتِّلُ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ وَنَسْتَحْىِۦ نِسَآءَهُمْ وَإِنَّا فَوْقَهُمْ قَٰهِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqala almala'u min qawmi fir'awna atadharu musa waqawmahu liyufsidu fil-ardi wayadharaka waalihataka qala sanuqattilu abna'ahum wanastahyi nisa'ahum wa-inna fawqahum qahirun.

verses.eng: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allah and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allah. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
verses.arabic: قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ لِلَّهِ يُورِثُهَا مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ ۚ وَٱلْعَٰقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala musa liqawmihi ista'inu billahi wasbiru inna al-arda lillahi yorithuha man yashao min 'ibadihi wal'aqibatu lilmuttaqin.

verses.eng: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ أُوذِينَا مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَأْتِيَنَا وَمِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جِئْتَنَا ۚ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يُهْلِكَ عَدُوَّكُمْ وَيَسْتَخْلِفَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرَ كَيْفَ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qalu udhina min qabli an ta'tiyana wamin ba'di ma ji'tana qala 'asa rabbukum an yuhlika 'aduwwakum wayastakhlifakum fil-ardi fayanthura kaifa ta'malun.

verses.eng: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of drought and a shortage of fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَا آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ بِالسِّنِينَ وَنَقْصٍ مِّنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad akhathna ala firAAawna bialssineena wanaqsin mina alththamarati laAAallahum yaththakkaroona

verses.eng: But when good came to them, they said, 'This is ours [by right].' And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْحَسَنَةُ قَالُوا لَنَا هَٰذِهِ ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَطَّيَّرُوا بِمُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُ ۗ أَلَا إِنَّمَا طَائِرُهُمْ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-itha jaat-humu alhasanatu qaloo lana hathihi wa-in tusib-hum sayyi-atun yattayyaroo bimusa waman maAAahu ala innama ta-iruhum AAinda Allahi walakinna aktharahum la yaAAlamoona

verses.eng: And they said, 'No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not believe in you.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا مَهْمَا تَأْتِنَا بِهِ مِنْ آيَةٍ لِّتَسْحَرَنَا بِهَا فَمَا نَحْنُ لَكَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqaloo mahma ta/tina bihi min ayatin litasharana biha fama nahnu laka bimu/mineena

verses.eng: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.
verses.arabic: فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الطُّوفَانَ وَالْجَرَادَ وَالْقُمَّلَ وَالضَّفَادِعَ وَالدَّمَ آيَاتٍ مُّفَصَّلَاتٍ فَاسْتَكْبَرُوا وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا مُّجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-arsalna AAalayhimu alttoofana waaljarada waalqummala waalddafadiAAa waalddama ayatin mufassalatin faistakbaroo wakanoo qawman mujrimeena

verses.eng: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, 'O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel.'
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا وَقَعَ عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّجْزُ قَالُوا يَا مُوسَى ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ ۖ لَئِن كَشَفْتَ عَنَّا الرِّجْزَ لَنُؤْمِنَنَّ لَكَ وَلَنُرْسِلَنَّ مَعَكَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.transliteration: Walamma waqaAAa AAalayhimu alrrijzu qaloo ya moosa odAAu lana rabbaka bima AAahida AAindaka la-in kashafta AAanna alrrijza lanu/minanna laka walanursilanna maAAaka banee isra-eela

verses.eng: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ الرِّجْزَ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ هُم بَالِغُوهُ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma kashafna AAanhumu alrrijza ila ajalin hum balighoohu itha hum yankuthoona

verses.eng: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
verses.arabic: فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَكَانُوا عَنْهَا غَافِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faintaqamna minhum fa-aghraqnahum fee alyammi bi-annahum kaththaboo bi-ayatina wakanoo AAanha ghafileena

verses.eng: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.
verses.arabic: وَأَوْرَثْنَا الْقَوْمَ الَّذِينَ كَانُوا يُسْتَضْعَفُونَ مَشَارِقَ الْأَرْضِ وَمَغَارِبَهَا الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَتَمَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ الْحُسْنَىٰ عَلَىٰ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا ۖ وَدَمَّرْنَا مَا كَانَ يَصْنَعُ فِرْعَوْنُ وَقَوْمُهُ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْرِشُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-awrathna alqawma allatheena kanoo yustadAAafoona mashariqa al-ardi wamagharibaha allatee barakna feeha watammat kalimatu rabbika alhusna AAala banee isra-eela bima sabaroo wadammarna ma kana yasnaAAu firAAawnu waqawmuhu wama kanoo yaAArishoona

verses.eng: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and they came upon a people devoted to some idols they had. They said, 'O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods.' He said, 'Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.'
verses.arabic: وَجَاوَزْنَا بِبَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ الْبَحْرَ فَأَتَوْا عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ يَعْكُفُونَ عَلَىٰ أَصْنَامٍ لَّهُمْ ۚ قَالُوا يَا مُوسَى اجْعَل لَّنَا إِلَٰهًا كَمَا لَهُمْ آلِهَةٌ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wajawazna bibanee isra-eela albahra faataw AAala qawmin yaAAkufoona AAala asnamin lahum qaloo ya moosa ijAAal lana ilahan kama lahum alihatun qala innakum qawmun tajhaloona

verses.eng: Indeed, those [idolaters] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ مُتَبَّرٌ مَّا هُمْ فِيهِ وَبَاطِلٌ مَّا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna haola-i mutabbarun ma hum feehi wabatilun ma kanoo yaAAmaloona

verses.eng: He said, "Is it other than Allah I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over [all] the worlds?
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ أَبْغِيكُمْ إِلَٰهًا وَهُوَ فَضَّلَكُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala aghayra Allahi abghikum ilahan wahuwa faddalakum 'ala al'alamin.

verses.eng: And [remember] when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَنجَيْنَٰكُم مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ يُقَتِّلُونَ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh anjaynakum min ali fir'awna yasumunakum su'a al'adhabi yuqattiluna abna'akum wayastahyuna nisa'akum wafi dhalikum bala'un min rabbikum 'adhim.

verses.eng: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them with [another] ten; so the term of his Lord was forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Act for me among my people, do righteousness, and do not follow the way of the corrupters."
verses.arabic: وَوَٰعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰ ثَلَٰثِينَ لَيْلَةً وَأَتْمَمْنَٰهَا بِعَشْرٍ فَتَمَّ مِيقَٰتُ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةً ۚ وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَخِيهِ هَٰرُونَ ٱخْلُفْنِى فِى قَوْمِى وَأَصْلِحْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wawa'adna musa thalathina lailatan wa-atmamnaha bi'ashrin fatamma miqatu rabbihi arba'ina lailatan waqala musa li'akhihi haruna ukhlufni fi qawmi wa'aslih wala tattabi' sabila almufsidin.

verses.eng: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I repent to You, and I am the first of the believers."
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَ مُوسَىٰ لِمِيقَٰتِنَا وَكَلَّمَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥ قَالَ رَبِّ أَرِنِىٓ أَنظُرْ إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ لَن تَرَىٰنِى وَلَٰكِنِ ٱنظُرْ إِلَى ٱلْجَبَلِ فَإِنِ ٱسْتَقَرَّ مَكَانَهُۥ فَسَوْفَ تَرَىٰنِى ۚ فَلَمَّا تَجَلَّىٰ رَبُّهُۥ لِلْجَبَلِ جَعَلَهُۥ دَكًّا وَخَرَّ مُوسَىٰ صَعِقًا ۚ فَلَمَّآ أَفَاقَ قَالَ سُبْحَٰنَكَ تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَأَنَا۠ أَوَّلُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walamma ja'a musa limiqatina wakallamahu rabbuhu qala rabbi arini andhur ilaika qala lan tarani walakini unthur ila aljabali fa-ini istaqarra makanahu fasawfa tarani falamma tajalla rabbuhu liljabali ja'alahu dakkan wakharra musa sa'iqan falamma afaqa qala subhanaka tubtu ilaika wa-ana awwalu almu'minin.

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful.
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنِّى ٱصْطَفَيْتُكَ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ بِرِسَٰلَٰتِى وَبِكَلَٰمِى فَخُذْ مَآ ءَاتَيْتُكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلشَّٰكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala ya musa inni istafaytuka 'ala annasi birisalati وبكلامي fakhudh ma ataituka wakun min ashshakirin.

verses.eng: And We wrote for him on the tablets [the নির্দেশনা] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَكَتَبْنَا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَلْوَاحِ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ مَّوْعِظَةً وَتَفْصِيلًا لِّكُلِّ شَىْءٍ فَخُذْهَا بِقُوَّةٍ وَأْمُرْ قَوْمَكَ يَأْخُذُوا۟ بِأَحْسَنِهَا ۚ سَأُو۟رِيكُمْ دَارَ ٱلْفَٰسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wakatabna lahu fi al-alwahi min kulli shai'in maw'idhatan watafsilan likulli shai'in fakhudhha biquwwatin wa'mur qawmaka ya'khudhu bi-ahsanihha sa'urikum dara alfasiqin.

verses.eng: I will turn away from My verses those who behave arrogantly upon the earth without right; and if they see every sign, they will not believe in it; and if they see the way of guidance, they will not take it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will take it as a way. That is because they have denied Our verses and were heedless of them.
verses.arabic: سَأَصْرِفُ عَنْ ءَايَٰتِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَكَبَّرُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كُلَّ ءَايَةٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَا وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ سَبِيلَ ٱلرُّشْدِ لَا يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًا وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ سَبِيلَ ٱلْغَىِّ يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا غَٰفِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Sa-asrifu 'an ayatiyyalladhina yatakabbaruna fil-ardi bighairi alhaqqi wa-in yaraw kulla ayatin la yu'minu biha wa-in yaraw sabila arrushdi la yattakhidhuhu sabilan wa-in yaraw sabila alghayyi yattakhidhuhu sabilan dhalika bi-annahum kadhdhabu bi'ayatina wakanu 'anha ghafilin.

verses.eng: And those who deny Our verses and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَلِقَآءِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَٰلُهُمْ ۚ هَلْ يُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina waliqa'i al-akhirati habitat a'maluhum hal yujzawna illa ma kanu ya'malun.

verses.eng: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their jewelry a calf - an image [having] a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذَ قَوْمُ مُوسَىٰ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ مِنْ حُلِيِّهِمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَّهُۥ خُوَارٌ ۚ أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّهُۥ لَا يُكَلِّمُهُمْ وَلَا يَهْدِيهِمْ سَبِيلًا ۘ ٱتَّخَذُوهُ وَكَانُوا۟ ظَٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wattakhadha qawmu musa min ba'dihi min huliyyihim 'ijlan jasadan lahu khuwarun alam yaraw annahu la yukallimuhum wala yahdihim sabilan ittakhadhuhu wakanu dhalimin.

verses.eng: And when they regretted it and realized that they had erred, they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا سُقِطَ فِىٓ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَرَأَوْا۟ أَنَّهُمْ قَدْ ضَلُّوا۟ قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ يَرْحَمْنَا رَبُّنَا وَيَغْفِرْ لَنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walamma suqita fi aidihim wara'aw annahum qad dallu qalu la-in lam yarhamna rabbuna wayaghfir lana lanakunanna minal-khasirin.

verses.eng: And when Moses returned to his people, angry [and] grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward himself. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people overpowered me and were about to kill me, so do not let the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me with the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا رَجَعَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ غَضْبَٰنَ أَسِفًا قَالَ بِئْسَمَا خَلَفْتُمُونِى مِنۢ بَعْدِىٓ ۖ أَعَجِلْتُمْ أَمْرَ رَبِّكُمْ ۖ وَأَلْقَى ٱلْأَلْوَاحَ وَأَخَذَ بِرَأْسِ أَخِيهِ يَجُرُّهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِ ۚ قَالَ ٱبْنَ أُمَّ إِنَّ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱسْتَضْعَفُونِى وَكَادُوا۟ يَقْتُلُونَنِى فَلَا تُشْمِتْ بِىَ ٱلْأَعْدَآءَ وَلَا تَجْعَلْنِى مَعَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walamma raja'a musa ila qawmihi ghadhbana asifan qala bi'sama khalaftumuni min ba'di a'ajiltum amra rabbikum wa'alqa al-alwaha wa'akhadha bira'si akhihi yajurruhu ilaihi qala ibna umma inna alqawma istadh'afuni wakadu yaqtulunani fala tushmit biya al-a'da'a wala taj'alni ma'a alqawmi adhthalimin.

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful.
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِأَخِى وَأَدْخِلْنَا فِى رَحْمَتِكَ ۖ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi ighfir li wali'akhi wa-adkhilna fi rahmatika wa-anta arhamu arrahimin.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] - there will reach them anger from their Lord and humiliation in this worldly life. And thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ ٱلْعِجْلَ سَيَنَالُهُمْ غَضَبٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَذِلَّةٌ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُفْتَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina attakhadhu al'ijla sayanaluhum ghadhabun min rabbihim wadhillatun filhayati addunya wakadhalika najzi almuftarin.

verses.eng: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed, your Lord after that is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا وَءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina 'amilu assayyi'ati thumma tabu min ba'diha waamanu inna rabbaka min ba'diha laghafurun rahim.

verses.eng: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who fear their Lord.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا سَكَتَ عَن مُّوسَى ٱلْغَضَبُ أَخَذَ ٱلْأَلْوَاحَ ۖ وَفِى نُسْخَتِهَا هُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِرَبِّهِمْ يَرْهَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walamma sakata 'an musa alghadhabu akhadha al-alwaha wafi nuskhatiha hudan warahmatun lilladhina hum lirabbihim yarhabun.

verses.eng: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, 'My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.'
verses.arabic: وَاخْتَارَ مُوسَىٰ قَوْمَهُ سَبْعِينَ رَجُلًا لِّمِيقَاتِنَا ۖ فَلَمَّا أَخَذَتْهُمُ الرَّجْفَةُ قَالَ رَبِّ لَوْ شِئْتَ أَهْلَكْتَهُم مِّن قَبْلُ وَإِيَّايَ ۖ أَتُهْلِكُنَا بِمَا فَعَلَ السُّفَهَاءُ مِنَّا ۖ إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا فِتْنَتُكَ تُضِلُّ بِهَا مَن تَشَاءُ وَتَهْدِي مَن تَشَاءُ ۖ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا ۖ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْغَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wakhtara moosa qawmahu sabAAeena rajulan limeeqatina falamma akhathat-humu alrrajfatu qala rabbi law shi/ta ahlaktahum min qablu wa-iyyaya a-tuhlikuna bima faAAala alssufahaoo minna in hiya illa fitnatuka tudillu biha man tashao wa tahdee man tashao anta waliyyuna faighfir lana wairhamna waanta khayru alghafireena

verses.eng: And decree for us in this world [what is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You.' [Allah] said, 'My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things.' So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakah and those who believe in Our verses.
verses.arabic: وَاكْتُبْ لَنَا فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ إِنَّا هُدْنَا إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ عَذَابِي أُصِيبُ بِهِ مَنْ أَشَاءُ ۖ وَرَحْمَتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ ۚ فَسَأَكْتُبُهَا لِلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِآيَاتِنَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waktub lana fee hathihi alddunya hasanatan wafee al-akhirati inna hudna ilayka qala AAathabee oseebu bihi man ashao warahmatee wasiAAat kulla shayin fasaa-ktubuha lillatheena yattaqoona wayu/toona alzzakata waallatheena hum bi-ayatina yu/minoona

verses.eng: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَتَّبِعُونَ الرَّسُولَ النَّبِيَّ الْأُمِّيَّ الَّذِي يَجِدُونَهُ مَكْتُوبًا عِندَهُمْ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ وَالْإِنجِيلِ يَأْمُرُهُم بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَاهُمْ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَيُحِلُّ لَهُمُ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَيُحَرِّمُ عَلَيْهِمُ الْخَبَائِثَ وَيَضَعُ عَنْهُمْ إِصْرَهُمْ وَالْأَغْلَالَ الَّتِي كَانَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِهِ وَعَزَّرُوهُ وَنَصَرُوهُ وَاتَّبَعُوا النُّورَ الَّذِي أُنزِلَ مَعَهُ ۙ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allatheena yattabiAAoona alrrasoola alnnabiyya al-ummiya allathee yajidoonahu maktuban AAindahum fee alttawrati waal-injeeli ya/muruhum bialmaAAroofi wayanha-hum AAani almunkari wayuhillu lahumu alttayyibati wayuharrimu AAalayhimu alkhaba-itha wayadaAAu AAanhum israhum waal-aghlala allatee kanat AAalayhim faallatheena amanoo bihi waAAazzaroohu wanasaroohu waittabaAAoo alnnoora allathee onzila maAAahu ola-ika humu almuflihoona

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], 'O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death.' So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنِّي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ جَمِيعًا الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ فَآمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ النَّبِيِّ الْأُمِّيِّ الَّذِي يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَكَلِمَاتِهِ وَاتَّبِعُوهُ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ya ayyuha alnnasu innee rasoolu Allahi ilaykum jameeAAan allathee lahu mulku alssamawati waal-ardi la ilaha illa huwa yuhyee wayumeetu faaminoo biAllahi warasoolihi alnnabiyyi al-ummiyyi allathee yu/minu biAllahi wakalimatihi waittabiAAoohu laAAallakum tahtadoona

verses.eng: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.
verses.arabic: وَمِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰ أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِالْحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعْدِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamin qawmi moosa ommatun yahdoona bialhaqqi wabihi yaAAdiloona

verses.eng: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, 'Strike with your staff the stone,' and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], 'Eat from the good things with which We have provided you.' And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.
verses.arabic: وَقَطَّعْنَاهُمُ اثْنَتَيْ عَشْرَةَ أَسْبَاطًا أُمَمًا ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ إِذِ اسْتَسْقَاهُ قَوْمُهُ أَنِ اضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْحَجَرَ ۖ فَانبَجَسَتْ مِنْهُ اثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنَاسٍ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۚ وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الْغَمَامَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا مِن طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ ۖ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَٰكِن كَانُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: WaqattaAAnahumu ithnata AAashrata asbatan omaman waawhayna ila moosa ini istasqahu qawmuhu ani idrib biAAasaka alhajara fanbajasat minhu ithnata AAashrata AAaynan qad AAalima kullu onasin mashrabahum wathallalna AAalayhimu alghamama waanzalna AAalayhimu almanna waalssalwa kuloo min tayyibati ma razaqnakum wama thalamoona walakin kanoo anfusahum yathlimoona

verses.eng: And [remember] when it was said to them, 'Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, Relieve us [of our burdens], and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward].'
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْكُنُوا هَٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةَ وَكُلُوا مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ وَقُولُوا حِطَّةٌ وَادْخُلُوا الْبَابَ سُجَّدًا نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطِيئَاتِكُمْ ۚ سَنَزِيدُ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ith qeela lahumu oskunoo hathihi alqaryata wakuloo minha haythu shi/tum waqooloo hittatun waodkhuloo albbaba sujjadan naghfir lakum khati-atikum sanazeedu almuhsineena

verses.eng: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong they were doing.
verses.arabic: فَبَدَّلَ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مِنْهُمْ قَوْلًا غَيْرَ الَّذِي قِيلَ لَهُمْ فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِجْزًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَا كَانُوا يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fabaddala allatheena thalamoo minhum qawlan ghayra allathee qeela lahum fa-arsalna AAalayhim rijzan mina alssama-i bima kanoo yathlimoona

verses.eng: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the Sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their Sabbath day, and the day they had no Sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَاسْأَلْهُمْ عَنِ الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي كَانَتْ حَاضِرَةَ الْبَحْرِ إِذْ يَعْدُونَ فِي السَّبْتِ إِذْ تَأْتِيهِمْ حِيتَانُهُمْ يَوْمَ سَبْتِهِمْ شُرَّعًا وَيَوْمَ لَا يَسْبِتُونَ لَا تَأْتِيهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَبْلُوهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْسُقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wais-alhum AAani alqaryati allatee kanat hadirata albahri ith yaAAdoona fee alssabti ith ta/teehim heetanuhum yawma sabtihim shurraAAan wayawma la yasbitoona la ta/teehim kathalika nabloohum bima kanoo yafsuqoona

verses.eng: And when a community among them said, 'Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allah is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?' they [the advisors] said, 'To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him.'
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَتْ أُمَّةٌ مِّنْهُمْ لِمَ تَعِظُونَ قَوْمًا ۙ اللَّهُ مُهْلِكُهُمْ أَوْ مُعَذِّبُهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ قَالُوا مَعْذِرَةً إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ith qalat ommatun minhum lima taAAithoona qawman Allahu muhlikuhum aw muAAaththibuhum AAathaban shadeedan qaloo maAAthiratan ila rabbikum walaAAallahum yattaqoona

verses.eng: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobeying.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا نَسُوا مَا ذُكِّرُوا بِهِ أَنجَيْنَا الَّذِينَ يَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ السُّوءِ وَأَخَذْنَا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا بِعَذَابٍ بَئِيسٍ بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْسُقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma nasoo ma thukkiroo bihi anjayna allatheena yanhawna AAani alssoo-i waakhathna allatheena thalamoo biAAathabin ba-eesin bima kanoo yafsuqoona

verses.eng: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, 'Be apes, despised.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا عَتَوْا عَن مَّا نُهُوا عَنْهُ قُلْنَا لَهُمْ كُونُوا قِرَدَةً خَاسِئِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma AAataw AAan ma nuhoo AAanhu qulna lahum koonoo qiradatan khasi-eena

verses.eng: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكَ لَيَبْعَثَنَّ عَلَيْهِمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ مَن يَسُومُهُمْ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَسَرِيعُ الْعِقَابِ ۖ وَإِنَّهُ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ith ta-aththana rabbuka layabAAathanna AAalayhim ila yawmi alqiyamati man yasoomuhum sooa alAAathabi inna rabbaka lasareeAAu alAAiqabi wa-innahu laghafoorun raheemun

verses.eng: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].
verses.arabic: وَقَطَّعْنَاهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ أُمَمًا ۖ مِّنْهُمُ الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنْهُمْ دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَبَلَوْنَاهُم بِالْحَسَنَاتِ وَالسَّيِّئَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: WaqattaAAnahum fee al-ardi omaman minhumu alssalihoona waminhum doona thalika wabalawnahum bialhasanati waalssayyi-ati laAAallahum yarjiAAoona

verses.eng: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, 'It will be forgiven for us.' And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about Allah except the truth, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah, so will you not use reason?
verses.arabic: فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ وَرِثُوا الْكِتَابَ يَأْخُذُونَ عَرَضَ هَٰذِهِ الْأَدْنَىٰ وَيَقُولُونَ سَيُغْفَرُ لَنَا وَإِن يَأْتِهِمْ عَرَضٌ مِّثْلُهُ يَأْخُذُوهُ ۚ أَلَمْ يُؤْخَذْ عَلَيْهِم مِّيثَاقُ الْكِتَابِ أَن لَّا يَقُولُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْحَقَّ وَدَرَسُوا مَا فِيهِ ۗ وَالدَّارُ الْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fakhalafa min baAAdihim khalfun warithoo alkitaba ya/khuthoona AAarada hathihi al-adna wayaqooloona sayughfaru lana wa-in ya/tihim AAaradun mithluhu ya/khuthoohu alam yu/khath AAalayhim meethaqu alkitabi an la yaqooloo AAala Allahi illa alhaqqa wadarasoo ma feehi waalddaru al-akhiratu khayrun lillatheena yattaqoona afala taAAqiloona

verses.eng: And as for those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُمَسِّكُونَ بِالْكِتَابِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ الْمُصْلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waallatheena yumassikoona bialkitabi waaqamoo alssalata inna la nudeeAAu ajra almuhsileena

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We uprooted the mountain and suspended it over them as if it were a cloud, and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and We said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is therein that you might fear Allah."
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ نَتَقْنَا ٱلْجَبَلَ فَوْقَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُۥ ظُلَّةٌ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُۥ وَاقِعٌۢ بِهِمْ خُذُوا۟ مَآ ءَاتَيْنَٰكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ مَا فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh nataqna aljabala fawqahum ka-annahu dhullatun wadhannu annahu waqi'un bihim khudhu ma atainakum biquwwatin wadhkuru ma fihi la'allakum tattaqun.

verses.eng: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This was] lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذَ رَبُّكَ مِنۢ بَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ مِن ظُهُورِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَأَشْهَدَهُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ أَلَسْتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ ۛ شَهِدْنَآ ۛ أَن تَقُولُوا۟ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّا كُنَّا عَنْ هَٰذَا غَٰفِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh akhadha rabbuka min bani adama min zhuhoorihim dhurriyyatahum wa-ashhadahum 'ala anfusihim alastu birabbikum qalu bala shahidna an taqulu yawma alqiyamati inna kunna 'an hadha ghafilin.

verses.eng: Or [lest] you say, "Indeed, our fathers associated [others with Allah] before, and we were descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?
verses.arabic: أَوْ تَقُولُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَشْرَكَ ءَابَآؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا ذُرِّيَّةً مِّنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ ۖ أَفَتُهْلِكُنَا بِمَا فَعَلَ ٱلْمُبْطِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Aw taqulu innama ashraka aba'una min qablu wakunna dhurriyyatan min ba'dihim afatuhlikuna bima fa'ala almubtilun.

verses.eng: And thus do We detail the verses, and perhaps they will return [to the truth].
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَٰتِ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wakadhalika nufassilu al-ayati wala'allahum yarji'un.

verses.eng: And recite to them, [O Muhammad], the news of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.
verses.arabic: وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ ٱلَّذِىٓ ءَاتَيْنَٰهُ ءَايَٰتِنَا فَٱنسَلَخَ مِنْهَا فَأَتْبَعَهُ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَاوِينَ
verses.transliteration: Watlu 'alaihim naba'a alladhi ataynahu ayatina fansalakha minha fa'atba'ahu ashshaitanu fakana mina alghawin.

verses.eng: And if We had willed, We could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered to the earth and followed his [own] desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you drive him away, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who deny Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَرَفَعْنَٰهُ بِهَا وَلَٰكِنَّهُۥٓ أَخْلَدَ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ ۚ فَمَثَلُهُۥ كَمَثَلِ ٱلْكَلْبِ إِن تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْهِ يَلْهَثْ أَوْ تَتْرُكْهُ يَلْهَث ۚ ذَّٰلِكَ مَثَلُ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا ۚ فَٱقْصُصِ ٱلْقَصَصَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw shi'na larafa'nahu biha walakinnahu akhlada ila al-ardi wattaba'a hawahu famathaluhu kamathali alkalbi in tahmil 'alaihi yalhath aw tatruk-hu yalhath dhalika mathalu alqawmi alladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina fa-uqsusi alqasasa la'allahum yatafakkarun.

verses.eng: How evil is the example of the people who deny Our signs and [thus] wrong themselves.
verses.arabic: سَآءَ مَثَلًا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَأَنفُسَهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sa'a mathalan alqawmu alladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina wa-anfusahum kanu yadhlimun.

verses.eng: Whomever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whomever He leaves astray - those are the losers.
verses.arabic: مَّن يَهْدِ ٱللَّهُ فَهُوَ ٱلْمُهْتَدِى ۖ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَٰسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man yahdi Allahu fahuwa almuhtadi waman yudlil faula'ika humul-khasirun.

verses.eng: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind; they have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ذَرَأْنَا لِجَهَنَّمَ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ ۖ لَهُمْ قُلُوبٌ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ بِهَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْيُنٌ لَّا يُبْصِرُونَ بِهَا وَلَهُمْ ءَاذَانٌ لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ بِهَآ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ كَٱلْأَنْعَٰمِ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْغَٰفِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad dhara'na lijahannama kathiran mina aljinni wal-insi lahum qulubun la yafqahuna biha walahum a'yunun la yubsiruna biha walahum adhanun la yasma'una biha ula'ika kal-an'ami bal hum adallu ula'ika humul-ghafilun.

verses.eng: And to Allah belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.
verses.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْأَسْمَآءُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ فَٱدْعُوهُ بِهَا ۖ وَذَرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ يُلْحِدُونَ فِىٓ أَسْمَٰٓئِهِۦ ۚ سَيُجْزَوْنَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walillahi al-asma'u alhusna fad'uhu biha wadharu alladhina yulhiduna fi asma'ihi sayujzawna ma kanu ya'malun.

verses.eng: And among those We created is a community that guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.
verses.arabic: وَمِمَّنْ خَلَقْنَآ أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَبِهِۦ يَعْدِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamimman khalaqna ummatun yahduna bilhaqqi wabihi ya'dilun.

verses.eng: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina kadhdhabu bi'ayatina sanastadrijuhum min haithu la ya'lamun.

verses.eng: And I will grant them respite; indeed, My plan is firm.
verses.arabic: وَأُمْلِى لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِى مَتِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa'umli lahum inna kaidi matin.

verses.eng: Have they not considered? There is no madness in their companion. He is only a clear warner.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَتَفَكَّرُوا۟ ۗ مَا بِصَاحِبِهِم مِّن جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Awalam yatafakkaru ma bisahibihim min jinnatin in huwa illa nadhirun mubin.

verses.eng: Have they not looked at the realm of the heavens and the earth and at what things Allah has created and that perhaps their time has already approached? Then in what حديث after this will they believe?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَنظُرُوا۟ فِى مَلَكُوتِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍ وَأَنْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ قَدِ ٱقْتَرَبَ أَجَلُهُمْ ۖ فَبِأَىِّ حَدِيثٍۭ بَعْدَهُۥ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awalam yanthuru fi malakuti assamawati wal-ardi wama khalaqa Allahu min shai'in wa-an 'asa an yakuna qadi iqtaraba ajaluhum fabi-ayyi hadithin ba'dahu yu'minun.

verses.eng: Whomever Allah leaves astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression to wander blindly.
verses.arabic: مَن يُضْلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَلَا هَادِىَ لَهُۥ ۚ وَيَذَرُهُمْ فِى طُغْيَٰنِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man yudlili Allahu fala hadiya lahu wayadharuhum fi tughyanihim ya'mahun.

verses.eng: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour - when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It will be heavy upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you were well-acquainted with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."
verses.arabic: يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَىٰهَا ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا عِلْمُهَا عِندَ رَبِّى ۖ لَا يُجَلِّيها لِوَقْتِهَآ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ ثَقُلَتْ فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا تَأْتِيكُمْ إِلَّا بَغْتَةً ۗ يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ كَأَنَّكَ حَفِىٌّ عَنْهَا ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا عِلْمُهَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yas'alunaka 'ani assa'ati ayyana mursaha qul innama 'ilmuha 'inda rabbi la yujalliha liwaqtiha illa huwa thaqulat fi assamawati wal-ardi la ta'tikum illa baghtatan yas'alunaka ka-annaka hafiyyun 'anha qul innama 'ilmuha 'inda Allahi walakinna akthara annasi la ya'lamun.

verses.eng: Say, "I do not possess for myself any benefit or any harm, but what Allah wills. And if I knew the unseen, I would have increased in good, and no evil would have touched me. I am not but a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."
verses.arabic: قُل لَّآ أَمْلِكُ لِنَفْسِى نَفْعًا وَلَا ضَرًّا إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَلَوْ كُنتُ أَعْلَمُ ٱلْغَيْبَ لَٱسْتَكْثَرْتُ مِنَ ٱلْخَيْرِ وَمَا مَسَّنِىَ ٱلسُّوٓءُ ۚ إِنْ أَنَا۠ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ وَبَشِيرٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul la amliku linafsi naf'an wala darran illa ma sha'a Allahu walaw kuntu a'lamu alghaiba lastakthartu mina alkhairi wama massaniya assu'u in ana illa nadhirun wabashirun liqawmin yu'minun.

verses.eng: It is He who created you from one soul and made from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allah, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."
verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍ وَٰحِدَةٍ وَجَعَلَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا لِيَسْكُنَ إِلَيْهَا ۖ فَلَمَّا تَغَشَّىٰهَا حَمَلَتْ حَمْلًا خَفِيفًا فَمَرَّتْ بِهِۦ ۖ فَلَمَّآ أَثْقَلَت دَّعَوَا ٱللَّهَ رَبَّهُمَا لَئِنْ ءَاتَيْتَنَا صَٰلِحًا لَّنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلشَّٰكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa alladhi khalaqakum min nafsin wahidatin waja'ala minha zawjaha liyaskuna ilaiha falamma taghashshaha hamalat hamlan khafifan famarrat bihi falamma athqalat da'awa Allaha rabbahuma la-in ataitana salihan lanakunanna min ashshakirin.

verses.eng: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. So exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّآ ءَاتَىٰهُمَا صَٰلِحًا جَعَلَا لَهُۥ شُرَكَآءَ فِيمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمَا ۚ فَتَعَٰلَى ٱللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma atahuma salihan ja'ala lahu shuraka'a fima atahuma fata'ala Allahu 'amma yushrikun.

verses.eng: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and are themselves created?
verses.arabic: أَيُشْرِكُونَ مَا لَا يَخْلُقُ شَيْـًٔا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ayushrikuna ma la yakhluqu shai'an wahum yukhlaqun.

verses.eng: And [those they invoke] cannot help them, nor can they help themselves.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ لَهُمْ نَصْرًا وَلَآ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَنصُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wala yastati'una lahum nasran wala anfusahum yansurun.

verses.eng: And if you invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.
verses.arabic: وَإِن تَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ لَا يَتَّبِعُوكُمْ ۚ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ أَدَعَوْتُمُوهُمْ أَمْ أَنتُمْ صَٰمِتُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in tad'uhum ila alhuda la yattabi'ukum sawa'un 'alaikum ada'awtumuhum am antum samitun.

verses.eng: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allah are servants like yourselves. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you are truthful.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ عِبَادٌ أَمْثَٰلُكُمْ ۖ فَٱدْعُوهُمْ فَلْيَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina tad'una min duni Allahi 'ibadun amthalukum fad'uhum falyastajibuu lakum in kuntum sadiqin.

verses.eng: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.
verses.arabic: أَلَهُمْ أَرْجُلٌ يَمْشُونَ بِهَآ ۖ أَمْ لَهُمْ أَيْدٍ يَبْطِشُونَ بِهَآ ۖ أَمْ لَهُمْ أَعْيُنٌ يُبْصِرُونَ بِهَآ ۖ أَمْ لَهُمْ ءَاذَانٌ يَسْمَعُونَ بِهَا ۗ قُلِ ٱدْعُوا۟ شُرَكَآءَكُمْ ثُمَّ كِيدُونِ فَلَا تُنظِرُونِ
verses.transliteration: Alahum arjulun yamshuna biha am lahum aidin yabtishuna biha am lahum a'yunun yubsiruna biha am lahum adhanun yasma'una biha quli ud'u shuraka'akum thumma kiduni fala tundhirun.

verses.eng: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He takes care of the righteous.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ وَلِىِّىَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى نَزَّلَ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ ۖ وَهُوَ يَتَوَلَّى ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna waliyyiyallahu alladhi nazzala alkitaba wahuwa yatawalla assalihin.

verses.eng: But those you call upon besides Him cannot help you, nor can they help themselves.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَكُمْ وَلَآ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَنصُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina tad'una min dunihi la yastati'una nasrakum wala anfusahum yansurun.

verses.eng: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you, but they do not see.
verses.arabic: وَإِن تَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ لَا يَسْمَعُوا۟ ۖ وَتَرَىٰهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَيْكَ وَهُمْ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in tad'uhum ila alhuda la yasma'u watarahum yanthuruna ilaika wahum la yubsirun.

verses.eng: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
verses.arabic: خُذِ ٱلْعَفْوَ وَأْمُرْ بِٱلْعُرْفِ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ ٱلْجَٰهِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Khudhi al'afwa wa'mur bil'urfi wa-a'rid 'ani aljahilin.

verses.eng: And if there comes to you from Satan an evil suggestion, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَإِمَّا يَنزَغَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ نَزْغٌ فَٱسْتَعِذْ بِٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-imma yanzaghannaka mina ashshaitani nazghun fasta'idh billahi innahu sami'un 'alim.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who fear Allah - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ إِذَا مَسَّهُمْ طَٰٓئِفٌ مِّنَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ تَذَكَّرُوا۟ فَإِذَا هُم مُّبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina ittaqaw idha massahum ta'ifun mina ashshaitani tadhakkaru fa-idha hum mubsirun.

verses.eng: But their brothers - the devils increase them in error; then they do not stop short.
verses.arabic: وَإِخْوَٰنُهُمْ يَمُدُّونَهُمْ فِى ٱلْغَىِّ ثُمَّ لَا يُقْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ikhwanuhum yamuddunahum fi alghayyi thumma la yuqsirun.

verses.eng: And when you [O Muhammad] do not bring them a sign, they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Quran] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا لَمْ تَأْتِهِم بِـَٔايَةٍ قَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا ٱجْتَبَيْتَهَا ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَتَّبِعُ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ مِن رَّبِّى ۚ هَٰذَا بَصَٰٓئِرُ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idha lam ta'tihim bi'ayatin qalu lawla ijtabaitaha qul innama attabi'u ma yuha ilayya min rabbi hadha basa'iru min rabbikum wahudan warahmatun liqawmin yu'minun.

verses.eng: So when the Quran is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ فَٱسْتَمِعُوا۟ لَهُۥ وَأَنصِتُوا۟ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idha quri'a alqur'anu fastami'u lahu wa-ansitu la'allakum turhamun.

verses.eng: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُر رَّبَّكَ فِى نَفْسِكَ تَضَرُّعًا وَخِيفَةً وَدُونَ ٱلْجَهْرِ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ بِٱلْغُدُوِّ وَٱلْـَٔاصَالِ وَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْغَٰفِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wadhkur rabbaka fi nafsika tadarru'an wakheefatan waduna aljahri mina alqawli bilghuduwwi wal-asali wala takun mina alghafilin.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِۦ وَيُسَبِّحُونَهُۥ وَلَهُۥ يَسْجُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina 'inda rabbika la yastakbiruna 'an 'ibadatihi wayusabbihunahu walahu yasjudun.

verses.eng: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the bounties [of war]. Say, "The bounties are for Allah and the Messenger. So fear Allah and amend that which is between you and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you should be believers."
verses.arabic: يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْأَنفَالِ ۖ قُلِ ٱلْأَنفَالُ لِلَّهِ وَٱلرَّسُولِ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَصْلِحُوا۟ ذَاتَ بَيْنِكُمْ ۖ وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yas'alunaka 'ani al-anfali quli al-anfalu lillahi wa-arrasuli fattaqu Allaha wa-aslihu dhata bainikum wa-ati'u Allaha warasulahu in kuntum mu'minin.

verses.eng: The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts become fearful, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith; and upon their Lord they rely -
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِرَ ٱللَّهُ وَجِلَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَإِذَا تُلِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَٰتُهُۥ زَادَتْهُمْ إِيمَٰنًا وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innama almu'minuna alladhina idha dhukira Allahu wajilat qulubuhum wa-idha tuliyat 'alaihim ayatuhu zadat-hum imanan wa'ala rabbihim yatawakkalun.

verses.eng: The ones who establish prayer and from what We have provided them, they spend.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَٰهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina yuqimuna assalata wamimma razaqnahum yunfiqun.

verses.eng: Those are the believers, truly. For them are degrees [of high position] with their Lord and forgiveness and noble provision.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ حَقًّا ۚ لَّهُمْ دَرَجَٰتٌ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ula'ika humu almu'minuna haqqan lahum darajatun 'inda rabbihim wamaghfiratun warizqun karim.

verses.eng: [Remember] when your Lord brought you out from your home for a just cause, and indeed, a party of the believers were unwilling.
verses.arabic: كَمَآ أَخْرَجَكَ رَبُّكَ مِنۢ بَيْتِكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّ فَرِيقًا مِّنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ لَكَٰرِهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kama akhrajaka rabbuka min baitika bilhaqqi wa-inna fariqan mina almu'minina lakarihun.

verses.eng: Arguing with you concerning the truth after it had become clear, as if they were being driven toward death while they were looking on.
verses.arabic: يُجَٰدِلُونَكَ فِى ٱلْحَقِّ بَعْدَ مَا تَبَيَّنَ كَأَنَّمَا يُسَاقُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَوْتِ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yujadilunaka fi alhaqqi ba'da ma tabayyana ka-annama yusaquna ila almawti wahum yanzurun.

verses.eng: And [remember, O believers], when Allah promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But Allah intended to establish the truth by His words and to eliminate the disbelievers
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ يَعِدُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ إِحْدَى ٱلطَّآئِفَتَيْنِ أَنَّهَا لَكُمْ وَتَوَدُّونَ أَنَّ غَيْرَ ذَاتِ ٱلشَّوْكَةِ تَكُونُ لَكُمْ وَيُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ أَن يُحِقَّ ٱلْحَقَّ بِكَلِمَٰتِهِۦ وَيَقْطَعَ دَابِرَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh ya'idukumullahu ihda attifaataini annaha lakum watawadduna anna ghaira dhati ashshawkati takunu lakum wayuridu Allahu an yuhiqqqa alhaqqa bikalimatihi wayaqta'a dabira alkafirin.

verses.eng: That He might establish the truth and abolish falsehood, even if the criminals disliked it.
verses.arabic: لِيُحِقَّ ٱلْحَقَّ وَيُبْطِلَ ٱلْبَٰطِلَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Liyuhiqqqa alhaqqa wayubtila albatila walaw kariha almujrimun.

verses.eng: [Remember] when you asked help of your Lord, and He answered you, "Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand from the angels, following one another."
verses.arabic: إِذْ تَسْتَغِيثُونَ رَبَّكُمْ فَٱسْتَجَابَ لَكُمْ أَنِّى مُمِدُّكُم بِأَلْفٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ مُرْدِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Idh tastaghithuna rabbakum fa-astajaba lakum anni mumiddukum bi-alfin mina almala'ikati murdifin.

verses.eng: And Allah made it not but good tidings and that your hearts might be assured thereby. And there is no victory except from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Mighty and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بُشْرَىٰ وَلِتَطْمَئِنَّ بِهِۦ قُلُوبُكُمْ ۚ وَمَا ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wama ja'alahu Allahu illa bushra walitatma'inna bihi qulubukum wama annasru illa min 'indi Allahi inna Allaha 'azizun hakim.

verses.eng: [Remember] when Allah covered you with drowsiness [giving] security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky, rain by which to purify you and remove from you the evil suggestion of Satan and to bind together your hearts and plant firmly thereby your feet.
verses.arabic: إِذْ يُغَشِّيكُمُ ٱلنُّعَاسَ أَمَنَةً مِّنْهُ وَيُنَزِّلُ عَلَيْكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً لِّيُطَهِّرَكُم بِهِۦ وَيُذْهِبَ عَنكُمْ رِجْزَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ وَلِيَرْبِطَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِكُمْ وَيُثَبِّتَ بِهِ ٱلْأَقْدَامَ
verses.transliteration: Idh yughashshikumu annu'asa amanatan minhu ويُنزل 'alaikum mina assama'i ma'an liyutahhirakum bihi wayudh'hiba 'ankum rijza ashshaitani waliyarbita 'ala qulubikum wayuthabbita bihi al-aqdam.

verses.eng: [Remember] when your Lord inspired to the angels, "I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, so strike [them] upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip."
verses.arabic: إِذْ يُوحِى رَبُّكَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ أَنِّى مَعَكُمْ فَثَبِّتُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ سَأُلْقِى فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱلرُّعْبَ فَٱضْرِبُوا۟ فَوْقَ ٱلْأَعْنَاقِ وَٱضْرِبُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ كُلَّ بَنَانٍ
verses.transliteration: Idh yuhi rabbuka ila almala'ikati anni ma'akum fathabbitu alladhina amanu sa'ulqi fi qulubi alladhina kafaru arru'ba fadribu fawqa al-a'naqi wadribu minhum kulla banan.

verses.eng: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ شَآقُّوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ ۚ وَمَن يُشَاقِقِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: Dhalika bi-annahum shaqqu Allaha warasulahu waman yushaqiqi Allaha warasulahu fa-inna Allaha shadidu al'iqab.

verses.eng: So taste it, and indeed for the disbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
verses.arabic: فَذَٰلِكُمْ فَذُوقُوهُ وَأَنَّ لِلْكَٰفِرِينَ عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Fadhalikum fadhuquhu wa-anna lilkafirina 'adhaba annar.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve advancing, then do not turn to them your backs [in flight].
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا لَقِيتُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ زَحْفًا فَلَا تُوَلُّوهُمُ ٱلْأَدْبَارَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu idha laqitumu alladhina kafaru zahfan fala tuwalluhumu al-adbar.

verses.eng: And whoever turns his back to them on such a day, unless swerving [for battle] or turning to [join] another company, has certainly returned with anger from Allah, and his refuge is Hell - and wretched is the destination.
verses.arabic: وَمَن يُوَلِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ دُبُرَهُۥٓ إِلَّا مُتَحَرِّفًا لِّقِتَالٍ أَوْ مُتَحَيِّزًا إِلَىٰ فِئَةٍ فَقَدْ بَآءَ بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَمَأْوَىٰهُ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Waman yuwallihim yawma'idhin duburahu illa mutaharrifan liqitalin aw mutahayyizan ila fi'atin faqad ba'a bighadabin min Allahi wama'wahu jahannamu wabi'sa almasir.

verses.eng: And it was not you who killed them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you threw not, [O Muhammad], when you threw, but it was Allah who threw that He might test the believers with a fair test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: فَلَمْ تَقْتُلُوهُمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَتَلَهُمْ ۚ وَمَا رَمَيْتَ إِذْ رَمَيْتَ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَمَىٰ وَلِيُبْلِىَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مِنْهُ بَلَآءً حَسَنًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Falam taqtuluhum walakinnallaha qatalahum wama ramaita idh ramaita walakinnallaha rama waliyubliya almu'minina minhu bala'an hasanan innallaha sami'un 'alim.

verses.eng: That [was so] that Allah might weaken the plot of the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكُمْ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مُوهِنُ كَيْدِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Dhalikum wa-annallaha muhinu kaidi alkafirin.

verses.eng: If you [disbelievers] seek a decision - there has come to you the conquest. And if you desist [from aggression] - it is better for you; and if you return [to war], We will return. And never will you be of any avail, [even] if you are many. And that Allah is with the believers.
verses.arabic: إِن تَسْتَفْتِحُوا۟ فَقَدْ جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْفَتْحُ ۖ وَإِن تَنتَهُوا۟ فَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۖ وَإِن تَعُودُوا۟ نَعُدْ وَلَن تُغْنِىَ عَنكُمْ فِئَتُكُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَوْ كَثُرَتْ ۙ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: In tastaftihu faqad ja'akumu alfat-hu wa-in tantahu fahuwa khairun lakum wa-in ta'udu na'ud walan tughniya 'ankum fi'atukum shai'an walaw kathurat wa-annallaha ma'a almu'minin.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn away from him while you are hearing.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَا تَوَلَّوْا۟ عَنْهُ وَأَنتُمْ تَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu ati'u Allaha warasulahu wala tawallaw 'anhu wa-antum tasma'un.

verses.eng: And do not be like those who say, "We have heard," while they do not hear.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ سَمِعْنَا وَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wala takunu kalladhina qalu sami'na wahum la yasma'un.

verses.eng: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ شَرَّ ٱلدَّوَآبِّ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلصُّمُّ ٱلْبُكْمُ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna sharra addawabbi 'inda Allahi assummu albukmu alladhina la ya'qilun.

verses.eng: Had Allah known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ عَلِمَ ٱللَّهُ فِيهِمْ خَيْرًا لَّأَسْمَعَهُمْ ۖ وَلَوْ أَسْمَعَهُمْ لَتَوَلَّوا۟ وَّهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw 'alima Allahu fihim khairan la-asma'ahum walaw asma'ahum latawallaw wahum mu'ridun.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, respond to Allah and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسُولِ إِذَا دَعَاكُمْ لِمَا يُحْيِيكُمْ ۖ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَحُولُ بَيْنَ ٱلْمَرْءِ وَقَلْبِهِۦ وَأَنَّهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu istajibuu lillahi walirrasuli idha da'akum lima yuhyikum wa'lamu annallaha yahulu baina almar'i waqalbihi wa-annahu ilaihi tuhsharun.

verses.eng: And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
verses.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ فِتْنَةً لَّا تُصِيبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنكُمْ خَآصَّةً ۖ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: Wattaqu fitnatan la tusibanna alladhina dhalamu minkum khassatan wa'lamu annallaha shadidu al'iqab.

verses.eng: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might abduct you. Then He sheltered you, and supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things that you might be grateful.
verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ أَنتُمْ قَلِيلٌ مُّسْتَضْعَفُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ تَخَافُونَ أَن يَتَخَطَّفَكُمُ ٱلنَّاسُ فَـَٔاوَىٰكُمْ وَأَيَّدَكُم بِنَصْرِهِۦ وَرَزَقَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wadhkuru idh antum qaliilun mustad'afuna fi al-ardi takhafuna an yatakhattfakumu annasu fa-awakum wa-ayyadakum binasrihi warazaqakum mina attayyibati la'allakum tashkurun.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not betray Allah and the Messenger or betray your trusts while you know [the consequence].
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَخُونُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلرَّسُولَ وَتَخُونُوٓا۟ أَمَٰنَٰتِكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu la takhunu Allaha warasula watakhunu amanatikum wa-antum ta'lamun.

verses.eng: And know that your properties and your children are but a trial and that with Allah is immense reward.
verses.arabic: وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَآ أَمْوَٰلُكُمْ وَأَوْلَٰدُكُمْ فِتْنَةٌ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عِندَهُۥٓ أَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa'lamu annama amwalukum wa-awladukum fitnatun wa-annallaha 'indahu ajrun 'azim.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, if you fear Allah, He will grant you a criterion and remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تَتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّكُمْ فُرْقَانًا وَيُكَفِّرْ عَنكُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu in tattaqu Allaha yaj'al lakum furqanan wayukaffir 'ankum sayyi'atikum wayaghfir lakum wallahu dhu alfadli al'azim.

verses.eng: And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But Allah was planning, and Allah is the best of planners.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ يَمْكُرُ بِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيُثْبِتُوكَ أَوْ يَقْتُلُوكَ أَوْ يُخْرِجُوكَ ۚ وَيَمْكُرُونَ وَيَمْكُرُ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرُ ٱلْمَٰكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh yamkuru bika alladhina kafaru liyuthbituka aw yaqtuluka aw yukhrijuka wayamkuruna wayamkuru Allahu wallahu khairu almakirin.

verses.eng: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. If we willed, we could say [something] like this. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالُوا۟ قَدْ سَمِعْنَا لَوْ نَشَآءُ لَقُلْنَا مِثْلَ هَٰذَآ ۙ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idha tutla 'alaihim ayatuna qalu qad sami'na law nasha'u laqulna mithla hadha in hadha illa asatiru al-awwalin.

verses.eng: And [remember] when they said, "O Allah, if this should be the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment."
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالُوا۟ ٱللَّهُمَّ إِن كَانَ هَٰذَا هُوَ ٱلْحَقَّ مِنْ عِندِكَ فَأَمْطِرْ عَلَيْنَا حِجَارَةً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَوِ ٱئْتِنَا بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh qalu allahumma in kana hadha huwa alhaqqa min 'indika fa-amtir 'alaina hijaratan mina assama'i awi i'tina bi'adhabin alim.

verses.eng: But Allah would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], were among them, and Allah would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُعَذِّبَهُمْ وَأَنتَ فِيهِمْ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ مُعَذِّبَهُمْ وَهُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama kana Allahu li yu'adhdhibahum wa-anta fihim wama kana Allahu mu'adhdhibahum wahum yastaghfirun.

verses.eng: And why should not Allah punish them while they obstruct [people] from al-Masjid al-Haram and they were not its guardians? Its [rightful] guardians are not but the righteous, but most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: وَمَا لَهُمْ أَلَّا يُعَذِّبَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَهُمْ يَصُدُّونَ عَنِ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ وَمَا كَانُوٓا۟ أَوْلِيَآءَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنْ أَوْلِيَآؤُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama lahum alla yu'adhdhibahumullahu wahum yasudduna 'ani almasjidi alharami wama kanu awliya'ahu in awliya'uhu illa almuttaquna walakinna aktharahum la ya'lamun.

verses.eng: And their prayer at the House was not except [mere] whistling and handclapping. So taste the punishment for what you used to disbelieve.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ صَلَاتُهُمْ عِندَ ٱلْبَيْتِ إِلَّا مُكَآءً وَتَصْدِيَةً ۚ فَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama kana salatuhum 'inda albaiti illa muka'an watasdiyatan fadhuduqu al'adhaba bima kuntum takfurun.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend of their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it; then it will be for them a regret; then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - into Hell they will be gathered.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ لِيَصُدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَسَيُنفِقُونَهَا ثُمَّ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِمْ حَسْرَةً ثُمَّ يُغْلَبُونَ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ يُحْشَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina kafaru yunfiquna amwalahum liyasuddu 'an sabili Allahi fasayunfiqunaha thumma takunu 'alaihim hasratan thumma yughlabuna walladhina kafaru ila jahannama yuhsharun.

verses.eng: [It is] that Allah may distinguish the wicked from the good and place the wicked some of them upon some others and heap them all together and put them into Hell. It is those who are the losers.
verses.arabic: لِيَمِيزَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخَبِيثَ مِنَ ٱلطَّيِّبِ وَيَجْعَلَ ٱلْخَبِيثَ بَعْضَهُۥ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَيَرْكُمَهُۥ جَمِيعًا فَيَجْعَلَهُۥ فِى جَهَنَّمَ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَٰسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Liyamiiza Allahu alkhabiitha mina attayyibi wayaj'ala alkhabiitha ba'dahu 'ala ba'din fayarkumahu jami'an fayaj'alahu fi jahannama ula'ika humu alkhosirun.

verses.eng: Say to those who have disbelieved [that] if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them. But if they return [to hostility] - then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.
verses.arabic: قُل لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِن يَنتَهُوا۟ يُغْفَرْ لَهُم مَّا قَدْ سَلَفَ وَإِن يَعُودُوا۟ فَقَدْ مَضَتْ سُنَّتُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul lilladhina kafaru in yantahu yughfar lahum ma qad salafa wa-in ya'udu faqad madat sunnatu al-awwalin.

verses.eng: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for Allah. And if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Seeing of what they do.
verses.arabic: وَقَٰتِلُوهُمْ حَتَّىٰ لَا تَكُونَ فِتْنَةٌ وَيَكُونَ ٱلدِّينُ كُلُّهُۥ لِلَّهِ ۚ فَإِنِ ٱنتَهَوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Waqatiluhum hatta la takuna fitnatun wayakuna addinu kulluhu lillahi fa-ini intahaw fa-innallaha bima ya'maluna basir.

verses.eng: And if they turn away - then know that Allah is your protector. Excellent is the protector, and Excellent is the helper.
verses.arabic: وَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلْمَوْلَىٰ وَنِعْمَ ٱلنَّصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in tawallaw fa'lamu annallaha mawlakum ni'ma almawla wani'ma annasir.

verses.eng: And know that anything you obtain of war booty - then indeed, for Allah is one fifth of it and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and the orphans, the needy, and the [stranded] traveler, if you have believed in Allah and in what We sent down to Our Servant on the day of criterion - the day when the two armies met. And Allah, over all things, is competent.
verses.arabic: وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَا غَنِمْتُم مِّن شَىْءٍ فَأَنَّ لِلَّهِ خُمُسَهُۥ وَلِلرَّسُولِ وَلِذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَٰكِينِ وَٱبْنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ إِن كُنتُمْ ءَامَنتُم بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ عَبْدِنَا يَوْمَ ٱلْفُرْقَانِ يَوْمَ ٱلْتَقَى ٱلْجَمْعَانِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa'lamu annama ghanimtum min shai'in fa-anna lillahi khumusahu walirrasuli walidhi alqurba wal-yatama walmasakini wabni assabili in kuntum amantum billahi wama anzalna 'ala 'abdina yawma alfurqani yawma altaqa aljam'ani wallahu 'ala kulli shai'in qadir.

verses.eng: [Remember] when you were on the near side [of the valley] and they were on the far side, and the caravan was lower [in position] than you. And if you had made an appointment [to meet], you would have missed the appointment. But [it was] so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - that whoever would perish [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and whoever would live would live upon evidence; and indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: إِذْ أَنتُم بِٱلْعُدْوَةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُم بِٱلْعُدْوَةِ ٱلْقُصْوَىٰ وَٱلرَّكْبُ أَسْفَلَ مِنكُمْ ۚ وَلَوْ تَوَاعَدتُّمْ لَٱخْتَلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْمِيعَٰدِ ۙ وَلَٰكِن لِّيَقْضِىَ ٱللَّهُ أَمْرًا كَانَ مَفْعُولًا لِّيَهْلِكَ مَنْ هَلَكَ عَنۢ بَيِّنَةٍ وَيَحْيَىٰ مَنْ حَىَّ عَنۢ بَيِّنَةٍ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَسَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Idh antum bil'udwati addunya wahum bil'udwati alquswa warrakbu asfala minkum walaw tawa'adttum lakhtalaftum fi almi'adi walakin liyaqdiya Allahu amran kana maf'ulan liyahlika man halaka 'an bayyinatin wayahyya man hayya 'an bayyinatin wa-innallaha lasami'un 'alim.

verses.eng: [Remember, O Muhammad], when Allah showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you [believers] would have lost courage and would have disputed in the matter. But Allah saved [you]. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
verses.arabic: إِذْ يُرِيكَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ فِى مَنَامِكَ قَلِيلًا ۖ وَلَوْ أَرَىٰكَهُمْ كَثِيرًا لَّفَشِلْتُمْ وَلَتَنَٰزَعْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْرِ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَلَّمَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
verses.transliteration: Idh yuriikahumullahu fi manamika qaliilan walaw arakahum kathiran lafashiltum walatanaza'tum fi al-amri walakinnallaha sallama innahu 'alimun bidhati assudur.

verses.eng: And [remember] when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you seem few in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ يُرِيكُمُوهُمْ إِذِ ٱلْتَقَيْتُمْ فِىٓ أَعْيُنِكُمْ قَلِيلًا وَيُقَلِّلُكُمْ فِىٓ أَعْيُنِهِمْ لِيَقْضِىَ ٱللَّهُ أَمْرًا كَانَ مَفْعُولًا ۗ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ ٱلْأُمُورُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh yuriikumuhum idhi altaqaitum fi a'yunikum qaliilan wayuqallilukum fi a'yunihim liyaqdiya Allahu amran kana maf'ulan wa-ila Allahi turja'u al-umur.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, when you meet a company [from the enemy], stand firm and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا لَقِيتُمْ فِئَةً فَٱثْبُتُوا۟ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu idha laqitum fi'atan fathbutu wadhkuru Allaha kathiran la'allakum tuflihun.

verses.eng: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute and [thus] lose courage and [then] your strength would depart; and be patient. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
verses.arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَا تَنَٰزَعُوا۟ فَتَفْشَلُوا۟ وَتَذْهَبَ رِيحُكُمْ ۖ وَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ati'u Allaha warasulahu wala tanaza'u tafshalu watadhhaba rihukum wasbiru innallaha ma'a assabirin.

verses.eng: And do not be like those who went forth from their homes in arrogance and to be seen by people and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And Allah encompasses what they do.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ خَرَجُوا۟ مِن دِيَٰرِهِم بَطَرًا وَرِئَآءَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
verses.transliteration: Wala takunu kalladhina kharaju min diyaribim bataran waria'a annasi wayasudduna 'an sabili Allahi wallahu bima ya'maluna muhit.

verses.eng: And [remember] when Satan made their deeds seem pleasing to them and said, "No one can overcome you today from among the people, and indeed, I am your protector." But when the two armies sighted each other, he turned on his heels and said, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you; indeed, I see what you do not see; indeed, I fear Allah. And Allah is severe in punishment.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ زَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ وَقَالَ لَا غَالِبَ لَكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ مِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَإِنِّى جَارٌ لَّكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا تَرَآءَتِ ٱلْفِئَتَانِ نَكَصَ عَلَىٰ عَقِبَيْهِ وَقَالَ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّنكُمْ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ مَا لَا تَرَوْنَ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ ٱللَّهَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh zayyana lahumu ashshaitanu a'malahum waqala la ghaliba lakumu alyawma mina annasi wa-inni jarun lakum falamma tara'ati alfi'atani nakasa 'ala 'aqibaihi waqala inni bari'un minkum inni ara ma la tarawna inni akhafu Allaha wallahu shadidu al'iqab.

verses.eng: [Remember] when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts was disease said, "Their religion has deluded those [believers]." But whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: إِذْ يَقُولُ ٱلْمُنَٰفِقُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ غَرَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ دِينُهُمْ ۗ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Idh yaqulu almunafiquna walladhina fi qulubihim maradun gharra ha'ula'i dinuhum waman yatawakkal 'ala Allahi fa-innallaha 'azizun hakim.

verses.eng: And if you could see when the angels take the souls of those who disbelieved... They will strike their faces and their posteriors and [say], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰٓ إِذْ يَتَوَفَّى ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۙ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ يَضْرِبُونَ وُجُوهَهُمْ وَأَدْبَٰرَهُمْ وَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
verses.transliteration: Walaw tara idh yatawaffa alladhina kafaru almala'ikatu yadribuna wujuhahum wa-adbarahum wadhuduqu 'adhaba alhariq.

verses.eng: That is for what your hands have put forth [of evil] and because Allah is not ever unjust to [His] servants.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَيْسَ بِظَلَّٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
verses.transliteration: Dhalika bima qaddamat aidikum wa-annallaha laisa bidhallamin lil'abid.

verses.eng: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They disbelieved in the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is powerful and severe in punishment.
verses.arabic: كَدَأْبِ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِىٌّ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: Kada'bi ali fir'awna walladhina min qablihim kafaru bi'ayati Allahi fa'akhadhahumullahu bidhunubihim innallaha qawiyyun shadidu al'iqab.

verses.eng: That is because Allah would never change a favor which He had conferred upon a people until they change what is within themselves. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَمْ يَكُ مُغَيِّرًا نِّعْمَةً أَنْعَمَهَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُوا۟ مَا بِأَنفُسِهِمْ ۘ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Dhalika bi-annallaha lam yaku mughayyiran ni'matan an'amaha 'ala qawmin hatta yughayyiru ma bi-anfusihim wa-annallaha sami'un 'alim.

verses.eng: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all of them were wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: كَدَأْبِ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَهْلَكْنَٰهُم بِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَأَغْرَقْنَآ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ وَكُلٌّ كَانُوا۟ ظَٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kada'bi ali fir'awna walladhina min qablihim kadhdhabu bi'ayati rabbihim fa'ahlaknahum bidhunubihim wa-aghraqna ala fir'awna wakullun kanu dhalimin.

verses.eng: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are those who have disbelieved, for they will not believe.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ شَرَّ ٱلدَّوَآبِّ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna sharra addawabbi 'inda Allahi alladhina kafaru fahum la yu'minun.

verses.eng: [It is of] those with whom you made a treaty and then they break their pledge every time, and they do not fear [Allah].
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ عَٰهَدتَّ مِنْهُمْ ثُمَّ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَهُمْ فِى كُلِّ مَرَّةٍ وَهُمْ لَا يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina 'ahadtta minhum thumma yanquduna 'ahdahum fi kulli marratin wahum la yattaqun.

verses.eng: So if you [O Muhammad] gain dominance over them in war, then disperse by [means of] them those behind them that they may be reminded.
verses.arabic: فَإِمَّا تَثْقَفَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَرْبِ فَشَرِّدْ بِهِم مَّنْ خَلْفَهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-imma tathqafannahum fi alharbi fasharrid bihim man khalfahum la'allahum yadhdhakkarun.

verses.eng: And if you fear treachery from a people, throw [their treaty] back to them, [putting you] on equal terms. Indeed, Allah does not like the treacherous.
verses.arabic: وَإِمَّا تَخَافَنَّ مِن قَوْمٍ خِيَانَةً فَٱنۢبِذْ إِلَيْهِمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَآءٍ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْخَآئِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-imma takhafanna min qawmin khiyanatan fanbidh ilaihim 'ala sawa'in innallaha la yuhibbu alkha'inin.

verses.eng: And let not those who disbelieve suppose that they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to Allah].
