verses.arabic: وَلَا يَحْسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ سَبَقُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ لَا يُعْجِزُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wala yahsabanna alladhina kafaru sabaqu inna hum la yu'jizun.

verses.eng: And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be repaid to you in full, and you will not be wronged.
verses.arabic: وَأَعِدُّوا۟ لَهُم مَّا ٱسْتَطَعْتُم مِّن قُوَّةٍ وَمِن رِّبَاطِ ٱلْخَيْلِ تُرْهِبُونَ بِهِۦ عَدُوَّ ٱللَّهِ وَعَدُوَّكُمْ وَءَاخَرِينَ مِن دُونِهِمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُهُمْ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِن شَىْءٍ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ يُوَفَّ إِلَيْكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تُظْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-a'iddu lahum ma istata'tum min quwwatin wamin ribati alkhaili turhibuna bihi 'aduwwa Allahi wa'aduwwakum wa-akharina min dunihim la ta'lamunahumu Allahu ya'lamuhum wama tunfiqu min shai'in fi sabili Allahi yuwaffa ilaikum wa-antum la tudhlamun.

verses.eng: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it [also] and rely upon Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَإِن جَنَحُوا۟ لِلسَّلْمِ فَٱجْنَحْ لَهَا وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in janahu lilssalmi fajnah laha watawakkal 'ala Allahi innahu huwa assami'u al'alim.

verses.eng: But if they intend to deceive you - then sufficient for you is Allah. It is He who supported you with His victory and with the believers.
verses.arabic: وَإِن يُرِيدُوٓا۟ أَن يَخْدَعُوكَ فَإِنَّ حَسْبَكَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَيَّدَكَ بِنَصْرِهِۦ وَبِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yuriduu an yakhda'uka fa-inna hasbaka Allahu huwa alladhi ayyadaka binasrihi وبالمؤمنين.

verses.eng: And brought together their hearts. If you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have brought their hearts together; but Allah brought them together. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِهِمْ ۚ لَوْ أَنفَقْتَ مَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا مَّآ أَلَّفْتَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَلَّفَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-allafa baina qulubihim law anfaqta ma fi al-ardi jami'an ma allafta baina qulubihim walakinnallaha allafa bainahum innahu 'azizun hakim.

verses.eng: O Prophet, sufficient for you is Allah and [for] those who follow you of the believers.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ حَسْبُكَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha annabiyyu hasbukallahu wamani ittaba'aka mina almu'minin.

verses.eng: O Prophet, urge the believers to battle. If there are among you twenty [who are] patient, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you a hundred [who are] patient, they will overcome a thousand of those who have disbelieved, because they are a people who do not understand.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ حَرِّضِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَى ٱلْقِتَالِ ۚ إِن يَكُن مِّنكُمْ عِشْرُونَ صَٰبِرُونَ يَغْلِبُوا۟ مِاْئَتَيْنِ ۚ وَإِن يَكُن مِّنكُم مِّاْئَةٌ يَغْلِبُوٓا۟ أَلْفًا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha annabiyyu harridi almu'minina 'ala alqitali in yakun minkum 'ishruna sabiruna yaghlibu mi'ataini wa-in yakun minkum mi'atun yaghlibu alfan mina alladhina kafaru bi-annahum qawmun la yafqahun.

verses.eng: Now, Allah has lightened [the hardship] for you, and He knows that among you is weakness. So if there are among you one hundred [who are] patient, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you one thousand, they will overcome two thousand by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the patient.
verses.arabic: ٱلْـَٰٔنَ خَفَّفَ ٱللَّهُ عَنكُمْ وَعَلِمَ أَنَّ فِيكُمْ ضَعْفًا ۚ فَإِن يَكُن مِّنكُم مِّاْئَةٌ صَابِرَةٌ يَغْلِبُوا۟ مِاْئَتَيْنِ ۚ وَإِن يَكُن مِّنكُمْ أَلْفٌ يَغْلِبُوٓا۟ أَلْفَيْنِ بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ مَعَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Al-ana khaffafa Allahu 'ankum wa'alima anna fikum da'fan fa-in yakun minkum mi'atun sabiratun yaghlibu mi'ataini wa-in yakun minkum alfun yaghlibu alfaini bi-idhni Allahi wallahu ma'a assabirin.

verses.eng: It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he has thoroughly subdued [the enemy] in the land. You desire the commodities of this world, but Allah desires [for you] the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِنَبِىٍّ أَن يَكُونَ لَهُۥٓ أَسْرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ يُثْخِنَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ تُرِيدُونَ عَرَضَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ma kana linabiyyin an yakuna lahu asra hatta yuthkhina fi al-ardi turiduna 'arada addunya wallahu yureedu al-akhirata wallahu 'azizun hakim.

verses.eng: If not for a decree from Allah that preceded, you would have been touched for what you took by a great punishment.
verses.arabic: لَّوْلَا كِتَٰبٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ سَبَقَ لَمَسَّكُمْ فِيمَآ أَخَذْتُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Lawla kitabun min Allahi sabaqa lamassakum fima akhathtum 'adhabun 'azim.

verses.eng: So consume what you have taken of war booty [as lawful and good], and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: فَكُلُوا۟ مِمَّا غَنِمْتُمْ حَلَٰلًا طَيِّبًا ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Fakulu mimma ghanimtum halalan tayyiban wattaqu Allaha innallaha ghafurun rahim.

verses.eng: O Prophet, say to whoever of the captives is in your hands, "If Allah knows [any] good in your hearts, He will give you [something] better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ قُل لِّمَن فِىٓ أَيْدِيكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَسْرَىٰٓ إِن يَعْلَمِ ٱللَّهُ فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ خَيْرًا يُؤْتِكُمْ خَيْرًا مِّمَّآ أُخِذَ مِنكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha annabiyyu qul liman fi aidikum mina al-asra in ya'lami Allahu fi qulubikum khairan yu'tikum khairan mimma ukhidha minkum wayaghfir lakum wallahu ghafurun rahim.

verses.eng: But if they intend treachery against you - then they have betrayed Allah before, so He empowered [you] over them. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَإِن يُرِيدُوا۟ خِيَانَتَكَ فَقَدْ خَانُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مِن قَبْلُ فَأَمْكَنَ مِنْهُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yuriduu khiyanataka faqad khanu Allaha min qablu fa-amkana minhum wallahu 'alimun hakim.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and fought with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - those are allies of one another. But those who have believed and have not emigrated - for you there is no guardianship of them until they emigrate. But if they seek your help in religion, then you must help, except against a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَٰهَدُوا۟ بِأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاوَوا۟ وَّنَصَرُوٓا۟ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ بَعْضٍ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَمْ يُهَاجِرُوا۟ مَا لَكُم مِّن وَلَٰيَتِهِم مِّن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰ يُهَاجِرُوا۟ ۚ وَإِنِ ٱسْتَنصَرُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ فَعَلَيْكُمُ ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍۭ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُم مِّيثَٰقٌ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina amanu wahajaru wajahadu bi-amwalihim wa-anfusihim fi sabili Allahi walladhina awaw wanasaru ula'ika ba'duhum awliya'u ba'din walladhina amanu walam yuhajiru ma lakum min walayatihim min shai'in hatta yuhajiru wa-ini istansarukum fi addini fa'alaikumu annasru illa 'ala qawmin bainakum wabainahum mithaqun wallahu bima ta'maluna basir.

verses.eng: And those who have disbelieved are allies of one another. If you do not do so [i.e., ally with the believers], there will be fitnah on earth and great corruption.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ بَعْضٍ ۚ إِلَّا تَفْعَلُوهُ تَكُن فِتْنَةٌ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَفَسَادٌ كَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina kafaru ba'duhum awliya'u ba'din illa taf'aluhu takun fitnatun fi al-ardi wafasadun kabir.

verses.eng: And those who have believed and emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - those are the true believers. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَٰهَدُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاوَوا۟ وَّنَصَرُوٓا۟ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ حَقًّا ۚ لَّهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina amanu wahajaru wajahadu fi sabili Allahi walladhina awaw wanasaru ula'ika humu almu'minuna haqqan lahum maghfiratun warizqun karim.

verses.eng: And those who believed after [the initial emigration] and emigrated and fought with you - they are of you. But those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah is knowing of all things.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدُ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَٰهَدُوا۟ مَعَكُمْ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ مِنكُمْ ۚ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَرْحَامِ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِبَعْضٍ فِى كِتَٰبِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌۢ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina amanu min ba'du wahajaru wajahadu ma'akum fa-ula'ika minkum wa-ulu al-arhami ba'duhum awla bib'adin fi kitabi Allahi innallaha bikulli shai'in 'alim.

verses.eng: This is a declaration of disassociation from Allah and His Messenger to those polytheists with whom you had made a treaty.
verses.arabic: بَرَآءَةٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ عَٰهَدتُّم مِّنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Bara'atun mina Allahi warasulihi ila alladhina 'ahadttum mina almushrikin.

verses.eng: So travel freely through the land [for] four months and know that you cannot cause failure to Allah and that Allah will disgrace the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: فَسِيحُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّكُمْ غَيْرُ مُعْجِزِى ٱللَّهِ ۙ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مُخْزِى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fasihu fi al-ardi arba'ata ashhurin wa'lamu annakum ghairu mu'jizi Allahi wa-annallaha mukhzi alkafirin.

verses.eng: And it is a declaration from Allah and His Messenger to the people on the day of the greater pilgrimage that Allah is disassociated from the polytheists, and [so is] His Messenger. So if you repent, that is best for you; but if you turn away - then know that you will not cause failure to Allah. And give tidings to those who disbelieve of a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَأَذَٰنٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَوْمَ ٱلْحَجِّ ٱلْأَكْبَرِ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَرِىٓءٌ مِّنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ ۙ وَرَسُولُهُۥ ۚ فَإِن تُبْتُمْ فَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۖ وَإِن تَوَلَّيْتُمْ فَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّكُمْ غَيْرُ مُعْجِزِى ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa-adhanun mina Allahi warasulihi ila annasi yawma alhajji al-akbari annallaha bari'un mina almushrikina warasuluhu fa-in tubtum fahuwa khairun lakum wa-in tawallaitum fa'lamu annakum ghairu mu'jizi Allahi wabashshiri alladhina kafaru bi'adhabin alim.

verses.eng: Excepted are those polytheists with whom you made a treaty and then did not fail you in anything and did not support anyone against you; so complete for them their treaty until their term [has ended]. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
verses.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ عَٰهَدتُّم مِّنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَنقُصُوكُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَمْ يُظَٰهِرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ أَحَدًا فَأَتِمُّوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِمْ عَهْدَهُمْ إِلَىٰ مُدَّتِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illa alladhina 'ahadttum mina almushrikina thumma lam yanqusukum shai'an walam yuzahiru 'alaikum ahadan fa-atimmu ilaihim 'ahdahum ila muddatihim innallaha yuhibbu almuttaqin.

verses.eng: And when the sacred months have passed, then kill the polytheists wherever you find them and capture them and besiege them and sit in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they should repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, let them [go] on their way. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱنسَلَخَ ٱلْأَشْهُرُ ٱلْحُرُمُ فَٱقْتُلُوا۟ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ حَيْثُ وَجَدتُّمُوهُمْ وَخُذُوهُمْ وَٱحْصُرُوهُمْ وَٱقْعُدُوا۟ لَهُمْ كُلَّ مَرْصَدٍ ۚ فَإِن تَابُوا۟ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَوُا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ فَخَلُّوا۟ سَبِيلَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa-idha insalakha al-ashhuru alhurumu fa-uqtulu almushrikina haithu wajadttumuhum wakhudhuhum wahsuruhum wa-uq'udu lahum kulla marsadin fa-in tabu wa-aqamu assalata waatawu azzakata fakhallu sabilahum innallaha ghafurun rahim.

verses.eng: And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ أَحَدٌ مِّنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ ٱسْتَجَارَكَ فَأَجِرْهُ حَتَّىٰ يَسْمَعَ كَلَٰمَ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ أَبْلِغْهُ مَأْمَنَهُۥ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in ahadun mina almushrikina istajaraka fa-ajirhu hatta yasma'a kalama Allahi thumma abligh-hu ma'manahu dhalika bi-annahum qawmun la ya'lamun.

verses.eng: How can there be for the polytheists a treaty in the sight of Allah and His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at al-Masjid al-Haram? So as long as they are upright toward you, remain upright toward them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
verses.arabic: كَيْفَ يَكُونُ لِلْمُشْرِكِينَ عَهْدٌ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَعِندَ رَسُولِهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ عَٰهَدتُّمْ عِندَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ۖ فَمَا ٱسْتَقَٰمُوا۟ لَكُمْ فَٱسْتَقِيمُوا۟ لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kaifa yakunu lilmushrikina 'ahdun 'inda Allahi wa'inda rasulihi illa alladhina 'ahadttum 'inda almasjidi alharami fama istaqamu lakum fastaqimu lahum innallaha yuhibbu almuttaqin.

verses.eng: How [can there be a treaty] while if they gain dominance over you, they will not observe concerning you any bond of kinship or covenant? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: كَيْفَ وَإِن يَظْهَرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ لَا يَرْقُبُوا۟ فِيكُمْ إِلًّا وَلَا ذِمَّةً ۚ يُرْضُونَكُم بِأَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَتَأْبَىٰ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۚ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ فَٰسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kaifa wa-in yazharu 'alaikum la yarqubu fikum illan wala dhimmatan yurdunakum bi-afwahihim wata'ba qulubuhum wa-aktharuhum fasiqun.

verses.eng: They have exchanged the verses of Allah for a small price and averted [people] from His way. Indeed, evil is what they have done.
verses.arabic: ٱشْتَرَوْا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا فَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ سَآءَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ishtaraw bi-ayati Allahi thamanan qalilan fasaddu 'an sabilihi innahum sa'a ma kanu ya'malun.

verses.eng: They do not observe toward a believer any bond of kinship or covenant. And it is those who are the transgressors.
verses.arabic: لَا يَرْقُبُونَ فِى مُؤْمِنٍ إِلًّا وَلَا ذِمَّةً ۚ وَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُعْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: La yarqubuna fi mu'minin illan wala dhimmatan wa-ula'ika humu almu'tadun.

verses.eng: But if they repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion. And We detail the verses for a people who know.
verses.arabic: فَإِن تَابُوا۟ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَوُا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ فَإِخْوَٰنُكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ ۗ وَنُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in tabu wa-aqamu assalata waatawu azzakata fa-ikhwanukum fi addini wanufassilu al-ayati liqawmin ya'lamun.

verses.eng: And if they break their pledges after [having made] a treaty with you and revile your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief, for indeed, there is no treaty bond for them, that they might cease.
verses.arabic: وَإِن نَّكَثُوٓا۟ أَيْمَٰنَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ عَهْدِهِمْ وَطَعَنُوا۟ فِى دِينِكُمْ فَقَٰتِلُوٓا۟ أَئِمَّةَ ٱلْكُفْرِ ۘ إِنَّهُمْ لَآ أَيْمَٰنَ لَهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَنتَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in nakathu aimanahum min ba'di 'ahdihim wat'anu fi dinikum faqatilu a'immata alkufri innahum la aimana lahum la'allahum yantahun.

verses.eng: Would you not fight a people who have broken their oaths and determined to expel the Messenger and they began [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right to be feared, if you are [indeed] believers.
verses.arabic: أَلَا تُقَٰتِلُونَ قَوْمًا نَّكَثُوٓا۟ أَيْمَٰنَهُمْ وَهَمُّوا۟ بِإِخْرَاجِ ٱلرَّسُولِ وَهُم بَدَءُوكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۚ أَتَخْشَوْنَهُمْ ۚ فَٱللَّهُ أَحَقُّ أَن تَخْشَوْهُ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ala tuqatiluna qawman nakathu aimanahum wahammu bi-ikhraji arrasuli wahum bada'ukum awwala marratin atakhshawna hum fallahu ahaqqu an takhshawhu in kuntum mu'minin.

verses.eng: Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and satisfy the breasts of a believing people
verses.arabic: قَٰتِلُوهُمْ يُعَذِّبْهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِأَيْدِيكُمْ وَيُخْزِهِمْ وَيَنصُرْكُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَيَشْفِ صُدُورَ قَوْمٍ مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qatiluhum yu'adhdhibhumullahu bi-aidikum wayukhzihim wayansurkum 'alaihim wayashfi sudura qawmin mu'minin.

verses.eng: And remove the anger from their [believers'] hearts. And Allah will accept the repentance of whom He wills; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَيُذْهِبْ غَيْظَ قُلُوبِهِمْ ۗ وَيَتُوبُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wayudh'hib ghaizha qulubihim wayatubu Allahu 'ala man yashao wallahu 'alimun hakim.

verses.eng: Do you think that you will be left [as you are] while Allah has not yet made evident those among you who strive [for His cause] and do not take other than Allah, His Messenger and the believers as allies? And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
verses.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَن تُتْرَكُوا۟ وَلَمَّا يَعْلَمِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ جَٰهَدُوا۟ مِنكُمْ وَلَمْ يَتَّخِذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا رَسُولِهِۦ وَلَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَلِيجَةً ۚ وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am hasibtum an tutraku walamma ya'lamillahu alladhina jahadu minkum walam yattakhidhu min duni Allahi wala rasulihi wala almu'minina walijatan wallahu khabirun bima ta'malun.

verses.eng: It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of Allah while witnessing against themselves with disbelief. [For] those, their deeds have become worthless, and in Hell they will abide eternally.
verses.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِلْمُشْرِكِينَ أَن يَعْمُرُوا۟ مَسَٰجِدَ ٱللَّهِ شَٰهِدِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِم بِٱلْكُفْرِ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَٰلُهُمْ وَفِى ٱلنَّارِ هُمْ خَٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ma kana lilmushrikina an ya'muru masajida Allahi shahidina 'ala anfusihim bilkufri ula'ika habitat a'maluhum wafi annari hum khalidun.

verses.eng: The mosques of Allah are only to be maintained by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and establish prayer and give zakah and do not fear except Allah, for those it is expected that they will be of the [rightly] guided.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَعْمُرُ مَسَٰجِدَ ٱللَّهِ مَنْ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَأَقَامَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَى ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَلَمْ يَخْشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۖ فَعَسَىٰٓ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَن يَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innama ya'muru masajida Allahi man amana billahi wal-yawmi al-akhiri wa-aqama assalata waata azzakata walam yakhsha illa Allaha fa'asa ula'ika an yakunu mina almuhtadin.

verses.eng: Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrim and the maintenance of al-Masjid al-Haram equal to [the deeds of] one who believes in Allah and the Last Day and strives in the cause of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: أَجَعَلْتُمْ سِقَايَةَ ٱلْحَآجِّ وَعِمَارَةَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ كَمَنْ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَجَٰهَدَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ لَا يَسْتَوُۥنَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Aja'altum siqayata alhajji wa'imarata almasjidi alharami kaman amana billahi wal-yawmi al-akhiri wajahada fi sabili Allahi la yastawuna 'inda Allahi wallahu la yahdi alqawma adhthalimin.

verses.eng: The ones who have believed and emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are greater in rank in the sight of Allah. And it is those who are the attainers [of success].
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَٰهَدُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ بِأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ أَعْظَمُ دَرَجَةً عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْفَآئِزُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina amanu wahajaru wajahadu fi sabili Allahi bi-amwalihim wa-anfusihim a'zhamu darajatan 'inda Allahi wa-ula'ika humu al-fa'izun.

verses.eng: Their Lord gives them good tidings of mercy from Him and approval and of gardens for them wherein is enduring pleasure.
verses.arabic: يُبَشِّرُهُمْ رَبُّهُم بِرَحْمَةٍ مِّنْهُ وَرِضْوَٰنٍ وَجَنَّٰتٍ لَّهُمْ فِيهَا نَعِيمٌ مُّقِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yubashshiruhum rabbuhum birahmatin minhu waridwanin wajannatin lahum fiha na'imun muqim.

verses.eng: Abiding therein forever. Indeed, with Allah is a great reward.
verses.arabic: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عِندَهُۥٓ أَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Khalidina fiha abadan innallaha 'indahu ajrun 'azim.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever of you does so - then those are the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوٓا۟ ءَابَآءَكُمْ وَإِخْوَٰنَكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءَ إِنِ ٱسْتَحَبُّوا۟ ٱلْكُفْرَ عَلَى ٱلْإِيمَٰنِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّهُم مِّنكُمْ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu la tattakhidhu aba'akum wa-ikhwanakum awliya'a ini istahabbu alkufra 'ala al-imani waman yatawallahum minkum fa-ula'ika humu adhthalimun.

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have obtained, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than Allah and His Messenger and striving in His cause, then wait until Allah executes His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِن كَانَ ءَابَآؤُكُمْ وَأَبْنَآؤُكُمْ وَإِخْوَٰنُكُمْ وَأَزْوَٰجُكُمْ وَعَشِيرَتُكُمْ وَأَمْوَٰلٌ ٱقْتَرَفْتُمُوهَا وَتِجَٰرَةٌ تَخْشَوْنَ كَسَادَهَا وَمَسَٰكِنُ تَرْضَوْنَهَآ أَحَبَّ إِلَيْكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَجِهَادٍ فِى سَبِيلِهِۦ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِىَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَمْرِهِۦ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْفَٰسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul in kana aba'ukum wa-abna'ukum wa-ikhwanukum wa-azwajukum wa'ashiratukum wa-amwalun iq'taraftumuha watijaratun takhshawna kasadaha wamasakinu tardawnaha ahabba ilaikum mina Allahi warasulihi wajihadin fi sabilihi fatarabbasu hatta ya'tiya Allahu bi-amrihi wallahu la yahdi alqawma alfasiqun.

verses.eng: Allah has already given you victory in many regions and [especially] on the day of Hunayn, when your great number pleased you, but it did not avail you anything; and the earth, with its vastness, was straitened for you, then you turned back, fleeing.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ نَصَرَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ فِى مَوَاطِنَ كَثِيرَةٍ ۙ وَيَوْمَ حُنَيْنٍ ۙ إِذْ أَعْجَبَتْكُمْ كَثْرَتُكُمْ فَلَمْ تُغْنِ عَنكُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَضَاقَتْ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضُ بِمَا رَحُبَتْ ثُمَّ وَلَّيْتُم مُّدْبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Laqad nasarakumullahu fi mawatina kathiratin wayawma hunaynin idh a'jabatkum kathratukum falam tughni 'ankum shai'an wadaqat 'alaikumu al-ardu bima rahubat thumma wallaitum mudbirin.

verses.eng: Then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and sent down soldiers [angels] whom you did not see and punished those who disbelieved. And that is the recompense of the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ وَعَلَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَنزَلَ جُنُودًا لَّمْ تَرَوْهَا وَعَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَآءُ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma anzalallahu sakinatahu 'ala rasulihi wa'ala almu'minina wa-anzala junudan lam tarawha wa'adhdhaba alladhina kafaru wadhallika jaza'u alkafirin.

verses.eng: Then Allah will accept repentance after that from whom He wills; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ يَتُوبُ ٱللَّهُ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Thumma yatubu Allahu min ba'di dhalika 'ala man yashao wallahu ghafurun rahim.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, indeed the polytheists are impure, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this year. And if you fear poverty, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا ٱلْمُشْرِكُونَ نَجَسٌ فَلَا يَقْرَبُوا۟ ٱلْمَسْجِدَ ٱلْحَرَامَ بَعْدَ عَامِهِمْ هَٰذَا ۚ وَإِنْ خِفْتُمْ عَيْلَةً فَسَوْفَ يُغْنِيكُمُ ٱللَّهُ مِن فَضْلِهِۦٓ إِن شَآءَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu innama almushrikuna najasun fala yaqrabu almasjida alharama ba'da 'amihim hadha wa-in khiftum 'ailatan fasawfa yughnikumullahu min fadlihi in sha'a innallaha 'alimun hakim.

verses.eng: Fight those who do not believe in Allah or in the Last Day and who do not consider unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have made unlawful and who do not adopt the religion of truth from those who were given the Scripture - [fight] until they give the jizya willingly while they are humbled.
verses.arabic: قَٰتِلُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَلَا بِٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَلَا يُحَرِّمُونَ مَا حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُۥ وَلَا يَدِينُونَ دِينَ ٱلْحَقِّ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ حَتَّىٰ يُعْطُوا۟ ٱلْجِزْيَةَ عَن يَدٍ وَهُمْ صَٰغِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qatilu alladhina la yu'minuna billahi wala bil-yawmi al-akhiri wala yuharrimuna ma harramallahu warasuluhu wala yadinuna dina alhaqqi mina alladhina utu alkitaba hatta yu'tu aljizyata 'an yadin wahum saghirun.

verses.eng: The Jews say, "Ezra is the son of Allah"; and the Christians say, "The Messiah is the son of Allah." That is their saying with their mouths, resembling the saying of those who disbelieved before [them]. May Allah destroy them; how are they turned away?
verses.arabic: وَقَالَتِ ٱلْيَهُودُ عُزَيْرٌ ٱبْنُ ٱللَّهِ وَقَالَتِ ٱلنَّصَٰرَى ٱلْمَسِيحُ ٱبْنُ ٱللَّهِ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ قَوْلُهُم بِأَفْوَٰهِهِمْ ۖ يُضَٰهُـُٔونَ قَوْلَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ قَٰتَلَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ أَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqalati alyahudu 'uzairuni ibnu Allahi waqalati annasara almasihu ibnu Allahi dhalika qawluhum bi-afwahihim yudah'una qawla alladhina kafaru min qablu qatalahumullahu anna yu'fakun.

verses.eng: They have taken their scholars and monks as lords besides Allah, and [also] the Messiah, the son of Mary. And they were not commanded except to worship one God; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: ٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ أَحْبَارَهُمْ وَرُهْبَٰنَهُمْ أَرْبَابًا مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْمَسِيحَ ٱبْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَٰهًا وَٰحِدًا ۖ لَّآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ سُبْحَٰنَهُۥ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ittakhadhu ahbarahum waruhbanahum arbaban min duni Allahi walmasiha ibna maryama wama umiru illa liya'budu ilahan wahidan la ilaha illa huwa subhanahu 'amma yushrikun.

verses.eng: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah refuses except to perfect His light, even if the disbelievers dislike it.
verses.arabic: يُرِيدُونَ أَن يُطْفِـُٔوا۟ نُورَ ٱللَّهِ بِأَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَيَأْبَى ٱللَّهُ إِلَّآ أَن يُتِمَّ نُورَهُۥ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yuriduna an yutfi'u nura Allahi bi-afwahihim waya'ba Allahu illa an yutimma nurahu walaw kariha alkafirun.

verses.eng: It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although the polytheists dislike it.
verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُۥ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ ٱلْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلدِّينِ كُلِّهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa alladhi arsala rasulahu bilhuda wadini alhaqqi liyuzhirahu 'ala addini kullihi walaw kariha almushrikun.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, indeed many of the scholars and the monks devour the wealth of people unjustly and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And those who hoard gold and silver and do not spend it in the way of Allah - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلْأَحْبَارِ وَٱلرُّهْبَٰنِ لَيَأْكُلُونَ أَمْوَٰلَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلْبَٰطِلِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَكْنِزُونَ ٱلذَّهَبَ وَٱلْفِضَّةَ وَلَا يُنفِقُونَهَا فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu inna kathiran mina al-ahbari warruhbani laya'kuluna amwala annasi bilbatili wayasudduna 'an sabili Allahi walladhina yaknizuna addhahaba walfiddata wala yunfiqunaha fi sabili Allahi fabashshirhum bi'adhabin alim.

verses.eng: [On] the Day when it will be heated in the fire of Hell and their foreheads and their flanks and their backs will be branded by it, [it will be said], "This is what you hoarded for yourselves, so taste what you used to hoard."
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يُحْمَىٰ عَلَيْهَا فِى نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ فَتُكْوَىٰ بِهَا جِبَاهُهُمْ وَجُنُوبُهُمْ وَظُهُورُهُمْ ۖ هَٰذَا مَا كَنَزْتُمْ لِأَنفُسِكُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ مَا كُنتُمْ تَكْنِزُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yawma yuhma 'alaiha fi nari jahannama fatukwa biha jibahuhum wajunubuhum wazuhuruhum hadha ma kanaztum li-anfusikum fadhuduqu ma kuntum taknizun.

verses.eng: Indeed, the number of months with Allah is twelve [lunar] months in the register of Allah [from] the day He created the heavens and the earth; of these, four are sacred. That is the correct religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the polytheists collectively as they fight against you collectively. And know that Allah is with the righteous [who fear Him].
verses.arabic: إِنَّ عِدَّةَ ٱلشُّهُورِ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱثْنَا عَشَرَ شَهْرًا فِى كِتَٰبِ ٱللَّهِ يَوْمَ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ مِنْهَآ أَرْبَعَةٌ حُرُمٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلدِّينُ ٱلْقَيِّمُ ۚ فَلَا تَظْلِمُوا۟ فِيهِنَّ أَنفُسَكُمْ ۚ وَقَٰتِلُوا۟ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ كَآفَّةً كَمَا يُقَٰتِلُونَكُمْ كَآفَّةً ۚ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna 'iddata ashshuhuri 'inda Allahi ithna 'ashara shahran fi kitabi Allahi yawma khalaqa assamawati wal-arda minha arba'atun hurumun dhalika addinu alqayyimu fala tazlimu fihinna anfusakum waqatilu almushrikina kaffatan kama yuqatilunakum kaffatan wa'lamu annallaha ma'a almuttaqin.

verses.eng: Indeed, the postponing [of restricted months] is an increase in disbelief by which those who have disbelieved are led [further] astray. They make it lawful one year and unlawful another year to correspond to the number made unlawful by Allah and [thus] make lawful what Allah has made unlawful. Made fair to them is the evil of their deeds; and Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا ٱلنَّسِىٓءُ زِيَادَةٌ فِى ٱلْكُفْرِ ۖ يُضَلُّ بِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُحِلُّونَهُۥ عَامًا وَيُحَرِّمُونَهُۥ عَامًا لِّيُوَاطِـُٔوا۟ عِدَّةَ مَا حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ فَيُحِلُّوا۟ مَا حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ زُيِّنَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ أَعْمَٰلِهِمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innama annasi'u ziyadatun fi alkufri yudallu bihi alladhina kafaru yuhillunahu 'aman wayuharrimunahu 'aman liyuwati'u 'iddata ma harramallahu fayuhillu ma harramallahu zuyyina lahum su'u a'malihim wallahu la yahdi alqawma alkafirin.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, what is [the matter] with you that, when you are told, "Go forth in the cause of Allah," you cling heavily to the earth? Are you satisfied with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But little is the enjoyment of the life of this world compared to the Hereafter.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَا لَكُمْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَكُمُ ٱنفِرُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ٱثَّاقَلْتُمْ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ أَرَضِيتُم بِٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا مِنَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ فَمَا مَتَٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alladhina amanu ma lakum idha qila lakumu infiru fi sabili Allahi iththaqaltum ila al-ardi araditum bilhayati addunya mina al-akhirati fama mata'u alhayati addunya fi al-akhirati illa qalil.

verses.eng: If you do not go forth, He will punish you with a painful punishment and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all. And Allah is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا تَنفِرُوا۟ يُعَذِّبْكُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا وَيَسْتَبْدِلْ قَوْمًا غَيْرَكُمْ وَلَا تَضُرُّوهُ شَيْـًٔا ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Illa tanfiru yu'adhdhibkum 'adhaban aliman wayastabdil qawman ghairakum wala tadurruhu shai'an wallahu 'ala kulli shai'in qadir.

verses.eng: If you do not aid him [the Prophet] - Allah has already aided him when those who disbelieved had driven him out [of Makkah] as one of two, when they were in the cave and he said to his companion, "Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us." And Allah sent down his tranquility upon him and supported him with soldiers [angels] you did not see and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah - that is the highest. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا تَنصُرُوهُ فَقَدْ نَصَرَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِذْ أَخْرَجَهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ثَانِىَ ٱثْنَيْنِ إِذْ هُمَا فِى ٱلْغَارِ إِذْ يَقُولُ لِصَٰحِبِهِۦ لَا تَحْزَنْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَنَا ۖ فَأَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُۥ عَلَيْهِ وَأَيَّدَهُۥ بِجُنُودٍ لَّمْ تَرَوْهَا وَجَعَلَ كَلِمَةَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱلسُّفْلَىٰ ۗ وَكَلِمَةُ ٱللَّهِ هِىَ ٱلْعُلْيَا ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Illa tansuruhu faqad nasarahullahu idh akhrajahu alladhina kafaru thaniya ithnaini idh huma fi alghari idh yaqulu lisahibihi la tahzan innallaha ma'ana fa-anzalallahu sakinatahu 'alaihi wa-ayyadahu bijunudin lam tarawha waja'ala kalimata alladhina kafaru assufla wakalimatu Allahi hiya al'ulya wallahu 'azizun hakim.

verses.eng: Go forth, whether light or heavy, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the cause of Allah. That is better for you, if you only knew.
verses.arabic: ٱنفِرُوا۟ خِفَافًا وَثِقَالًا وَجَٰهِدُوا۟ بِأَمْوَٰلِكُمْ وَأَنفُسِكُمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Infiru khifafan wathiqalan wajahidu bi-amwalikum wa-anfusikum fi sabili Allahi dhalikum khairun lakum in kuntum ta'lamun.

verses.eng: Had it been an easy gain and a moderate trip, the hypocrites would have followed you, but the distance was too great for them. And they will swear by Allah, "If we were able, we would have gone forth with you." They destroy themselves, and Allah knows that they are liars.
verses.arabic: لَوْ كَانَ عَرَضًا قَرِيبًا وَسَفَرًا قَاصِدًا لَّٱتَّبَعُوكَ وَلَٰكِنۢ بَعُدَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلشُّقَّةُ ۚ وَسَيَحْلِفُونَ بِٱللَّهِ لَوِ ٱسْتَطَعْنَا لَخَرَجْنَا مَعَكُمْ ۚ يُهْلِكُونَ أَنفُسَهُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَٰذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Law kana 'aradan qariban wasafaran qasidan la-attaba'uka walakin ba'udat 'alaihimu ashshuqqatu wasayah'lifuna billahi lawi istata'na lakharajna ma'akum yuhlikuna anfusahum wallahu ya'lamu innahum lakadhibun.

verses.eng: May Allah pardon you, [O Muhammad]; why did you give them permission [to remain behind] until it was evident to you who were truthful and you knew [who were] the liars?
verses.arabic: عَفَا ٱللَّهُ عَنكَ لِمَ أَذِنتَ لَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يَتَبَيَّنَ لَكَ ٱلَّذِينَ صَدَقُوا۟ وَتَعْلَمَ ٱلْكَٰذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: 'Afa Allahu 'anka lima adhinta lahum hatta yatabayyana laka alladhina sadaqu wata'lama alkadhibin.

verses.eng: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day would not ask permission of you to refrain from striving with their wealth and their lives. And Allah is Knowing of those who fear Him.
verses.arabic: لَا يَسْتَـْٔذِنُكَ ٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ أَن يُجَٰهِدُوا۟ بِأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: La yasta'dhinu ka alladhina yu'minuna billahi wal-yawmi al-akhiri an yujahidu bi-amwalihim wa-anfusihim wallahu 'alimun bilmuttaqin.

verses.eng: Only those ask permission of you who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day and whose hearts have doubted, and they, in their doubt, are hesitating.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَسْتَأْذِنُكَ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ وَارْتَابَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي رَيْبِهِمْ يَتَرَدَّدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innama yasta'dhinuka alladhina la yu'minoona billahi wal-yawmi al-akhiri wartabat quloobuhum fahum fee raybihim yataraddadoon

verses.eng: And if they had intended to go forth, they would have prepared for it [some] preparation. But Allah disliked their being sent, so He kept them back, and they were told, 'Remain [behind] with those who remain.'
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَرَادُوا الْخُرُوجَ لَأَعَدُّوا لَهُ عُدَّةً وَلَٰكِن كَرِهَ اللَّهُ انبِعَاثَهُمْ فَثَبَّطَهُمْ وَقِيلَ اقْعُدُوا مَعَ الْقَاعِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law aradoo al-khurooja la-a'addoo lahu 'uddatan walakin kariha Allahu inbi'athahum fathabbatahum wa qeela oq'udoo ma'a al-qa'ideen

verses.eng: Had they gone forth with you, they would not have increased you except in confusion, and they would have been active among you, seeking [to cause] you fitnah. And among you are avid listeners to them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: لَوْ خَرَجُوا فِيكُم مَّا زَادُوكُمْ إِلَّا خَبَالًا وَلَأَوْضَعُوا خِلَالَكُمْ يَبْغُونَكُمُ الْفِتْنَةَ وَفِيكُمْ سَمَّاعُونَ لَهُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِالظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Law kharajoo feekum ma zadookum illa khabalan wa la-awda'oo khilalakum yabghoonakumu al-fitnata wa feekum samma'oona lahum wallahu 'aleemun bith-thalimeen

verses.eng: They had already desired dissension before and had upset matters for you until the truth came and the command of Allah appeared, while they were averse.
verses.arabic: لَقَدِ ابْتَغَوُا الْفِتْنَةَ مِن قَبْلُ وَقَلَّبُوا لَكَ الْأُمُورَ حَتَّىٰ جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَظَهَرَ أَمْرُ اللَّهِ وَهُمْ كَارِهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laqadi ibtaghawoo al-fitnata min qablu wa qallaboo laka al-omoora hatta jaa'a al-haqqu wa thahara amru Allahi wahum karihoon

verses.eng: And among them is he who says, 'Permit me [to remain at home] and do not put me to trial.' Unquestionably, into trial they have fallen. And indeed, Hell will encompass the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَقُولُ ائْذَن لِّي وَلَا تَفْتِنِّي ۚ أَلَا فِي الْفِتْنَةِ سَقَطُوا ۗ وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمُحِيطَةٌ بِالْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa minhum man yaqoolu ithan lee wa la taftinee ala fee al-fitnati saqatoo wa inna jahannama lamuheetatun bil-kafireen

verses.eng: If good befalls you, it distresses them; but if a calamity befalls you, they say, 'We took our precautions beforehand,' and they turn away rejoicing.
verses.arabic: إِن تُصِبْكَ حَسَنَةٌ تَسُؤْهُمْ ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْكَ مُصِيبَةٌ يَقُولُوا قَدْ أَخَذْنَا أَمْرَنَا مِن قَبْلُ وَيَتَوَلَّوْا وَهُمْ فَرِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: In tusibka hasanatun tasu'hum wa in tusibka museebatun yaqooloo qad akhathna amrana min qablu wa yatawallaw wahum farihoon

verses.eng: Say, 'Never will we be struck except by what Allah has decreed for us; He is our protector.' And upon Allah let the believers rely.
verses.arabic: قُل لَّن يُصِيبَنَا إِلَّا مَا كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَنَا هُوَ مَوْلَانَا ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul lan yuseebana illa ma kataba Allahu lana huwa mawlana wa 'ala Allahi falyatawakkali almu'minoon

verses.eng: Say, 'Do you await for us except one of the two best things? But we await for you that Allah will afflict you with punishment from Himself or at our hands. So wait; indeed we, along with you, are waiting.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ تَرَبَّصُونَ بِنَا إِلَّا إِحْدَى الْحُسْنَيَيْنِ ۖ وَنَحْنُ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِكُمْ أَن يُصِيبَكُمُ اللَّهُ بِعَذَابٍ مِّنْ عِندِهِ أَوْ بِأَيْدِينَا ۖ فَتَرَبَّصُوا إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّتَرَبِّصُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul hal tarabbasoona bina illa ihda alhusnayayni wa nahnu natarabbasu bikum an yuseebakumu Allahu bi'adhabin min 'indihi aw bi-aydeena fatarabbasoo inna ma'akum mutarabbisoon

verses.eng: Say, 'Spend willingly or unwillingly; never will it be accepted from you. Indeed, you have been a defiantly disobedient people.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَنفِقُوا طَوْعًا أَوْ كَرْهًا لَّن يُتَقَبَّلَ مِنكُمْ ۖ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul anfiqoo taw'an aw karhan lan yutaqabbala minkum innakum kuntum qawman fasiqeen

verses.eng: And what prevents their expenditures from being accepted from them but that they have disbelieved in Allah and in His Messenger and that they come not to prayer except while they are lazy and that they do not spend except while they are unwilling.
verses.arabic: وَمَا مَنَعَهُمْ أَن تُقْبَلَ مِنْهُمْ نَفَقَاتُهُمْ إِلَّا أَنَّهُمْ كَفَرُوا بِاللَّهِ وَبِرَسُولِهِ وَلَا يَأْتُونَ الصَّلَاةَ إِلَّا وَهُمْ كُسَالَىٰ وَلَا يُنفِقُونَ إِلَّا وَهُمْ كَارِهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ma mana'ahum an tuqbala minhum nafaqatuhum illa annahum kafaroo billahi wa bi-rasoolihi wa la ya'toona as-salata illa wahum kusalawa la yunfiqoona illa wahum karihoon

verses.eng: So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in this world and that their souls should depart while they are disbelievers.
verses.arabic: فَلَا تُعْجِبْكَ أَمْوَالُهُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّمَا يُرِيدُ اللَّهُ لِيُعَذِّبَهُم بِهَا فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَتَزْهَقَ أَنفُسُهُمْ وَهُمْ كَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fala tu'jibka amwaluhum wa la awladuhum innama yureedu Allahu liyu'adhibahum biha fee al-hayati ad-dunya wa tazhaqa anfusuhum wahum kafiroon

verses.eng: And they swear by Allah that they are from among you, while they are not from among you; but they are a people who are afraid.
verses.arabic: وَيَحْلِفُونَ بِاللَّهِ إِنَّهُمْ لَمِنكُمْ وَمَا هُم مِّنكُمْ وَلَٰكِنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ يَفْرَقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yahlifoona billahi innahum laminkum wa ma hum minkum wa lakinahum qawmun yafraqoon

verses.eng: If they could find a refuge or some caves or any place to enter, they would turn to it while they run heedlessly.
verses.arabic: لَوْ يَجِدُونَ مَلْجَـًٔا أَوْ مَغَارَاتٍ أَوْ مُدَّخَلًا لَّوَلَّوْا إِلَيْهِ وَهُمْ يَجْمَحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Law yajidoona malja'an aw magharatin aw muddakhalan lawallaw ilayhi wahum yajmahoon

verses.eng: And among them are some who criticize you concerning the distribution of charities. If they are given from it, they approve; but if they are not given from it, they are enraged.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَلْمِزُكَ فِي الصَّدَقَاتِ فَإِنْ أُعْطُوا مِنْهَا رَضُوا وَإِن لَّمْ يُعْطَوْا مِنْهَا إِذَا هُمْ يَسْخَطُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa minhum man yalmizuka fee as-sadaqati fa-in u'too minha radoo wa in lam yu'taw minha itha hum yaskhatoon

verses.eng: If only they had been satisfied with what Allah and His Messenger gave them and said, 'Sufficient for us is Allah; Allah will give us of His bounty, and so will His Messenger; indeed, we are desirous toward Allah,' [it would have been better for them].
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ رَضُوا مَا آتَاهُمُ اللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُ وَقَالُوا حَسْبُنَا اللَّهُ سَيُؤْتِينَا اللَّهُ مِن فَضْلِهِ وَرَسُولُهُ إِنَّا إِلَى اللَّهِ رَاغِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law annahum radoo ma atahumu Allahu wa rasooluhu wa qaloo hasbuna Allahu sayu'teena Allahu min fadlihi wa rasooluhu inna ila Allahi raghiboon

verses.eng: Zakah expenditures are only for the poor and the needy and for those employed to collect [zakah] and for bringing hearts together [for Islam] and for freeing captives [or slaves] and for those in debt and for the cause of Allah and for the [stranded] traveler - an obligation [imposed] by Allah. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا الصَّدَقَاتُ لِلْفُقَرَاءِ وَالْمَسَاكِينِ وَالْعَامِلِينَ عَلَيْهَا وَالْمُؤَلَّفَةِ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَفِي الرِّقَابِ وَالْغَارِمِينَ وَفِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَابْنِ السَّبِيلِ ۖ فَرِيضَةً مِّنَ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Innama as-sadaqatu lil-fuqara-i wal-masakeeni wal-‘amileena ‘alayha wal-mu-allafati quloobuhum wa fee ar-riqabi wal-gharimeena wa fee sabeeli Allahi wabni as-sabeeli fareedatan min Allahi wallahu ‘aleemun hakeem

verses.eng: And among them are those who abuse the Prophet and say, 'He is an ear.' Say, '[It is] an ear of goodness for you that believes in Allah and believes the believers and [is] a mercy to those who believe among you.' And those who abuse the Messenger of Allah - for them is a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُمُ الَّذِينَ يُؤْذُونَ النَّبِيَّ وَيَقُولُونَ هُوَ أُذُنٌ ۚ قُلْ أُذُنُ خَيْرٍ لَّكُمْ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَيُؤْمِنُ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنكُمْ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْذُونَ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa minhumu allatheena yu’thoona an-nabiyya wa yaqooloona huwa othun qul othunu khayrin lakum yu’minu billahi wa yu’minu lilmu’mineena wa rahmatun lillatheena amanoo minkum wallatheena yu’thoona rasoola Allahi lahum ‘athabun aleem

verses.eng: They swear by Allah to you [Muslims] to satisfy you. But Allah and His Messenger are more worthy for them to satisfy, if they should be believers.
verses.arabic: يَحْلِفُونَ بِاللَّهِ لَكُمْ لِيُرْضُوكُمْ وَاللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُ أَحَقُّ أَن يُرْضُوهُ إِن كَانُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yahlifoona billahi lakum liyurdukum wallahu wa rasooluhu ahaqqu an yurdoohu in kanoo mu’mineen

verses.eng: Do they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - that for him is the fire of Hell, wherein he will abide eternally? That is the great disgrace.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَعْلَمُوا أَنَّهُ مَن يُحَادِدِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَأَنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدًا فِيهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْخِزْيُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Alam ya’lamoo annahu man yuhadidi Allaha wa rasoolahu fa-anna lahu nara jahannama khalidan feeha thalika al-khizyu al-‘atheem

verses.eng: The hypocrites are apprehensive lest a surah be revealed about them, informing them of what is in their hearts. Say, 'Mock [as you wish]; indeed, Allah will expose that which you fear.'
verses.arabic: يَحْذَرُ الْمُنَافِقُونَ أَن تُنَزَّلَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُورَةٌ تُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ ۚ قُلِ اسْتَهْزِئُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ مُخْرِجٌ مَّا تَحْذَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yahtharu al-munafiqoona an tunazzala ‘alayhim sooratun tunabbi’uhum bima fee quloobihim qul istahzi’oo inna Allahu mukrijun ma tahtharoon

verses.eng: And if you ask them, they will surely say, 'We were only conversing and playing.' Say, 'Is it Allah and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking?'
verses.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُمْ لَيَقُولُنَّ إِنَّمَا كُنَّا نَخُوضُ وَنَلْعَبُ ۚ قُلْ أَبِاللَّهِ وَآيَاتِهِ وَرَسُولِهِ كُنتُمْ تَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la-in sa’altahum layaqoolunna innama kunna nakhoodu wa nal’ab qul a billahi wa ayatihi wa rasoolihi kuntum tastahzi’oon

verses.eng: Make no excuse; you have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon one faction of you - We will punish another faction because they were criminals.
verses.arabic: لَا تَعْتَذِرُوا قَدْ كَفَرْتُم بَعْدَ إِيمَانِكُمْ ۚ إِن نَّعْفُ عَن طَائِفَةٍ مِّنكُمْ نُعَذِّبْ طَائِفَةً بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا مُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: La ta’tathiroo qad kafartum ba’da eemanikum in na’fu ‘an ta’ifatin minkum nu’aththib ta’ifatan bi-annahum kanoo mujrimeen

verses.eng: The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right and close their hands. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them [accordingly]. Indeed, the hypocrites - it is they who are the defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: الْمُنَافِقُونَ وَالْمُنَافِقَاتُ بَعْضُهُم مِّن بَعْضٍ ۚ يَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمُنكَرِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَقْبِضُونَ أَيْدِيَهُمْ ۚ نَسُوا اللَّهَ فَنَسِيَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ الْمُنَافِقِينَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Al-munafiqoona wal-munafiqatu ba’duhum min ba’din ya’muroona bil-munkari wa yanhawna ‘ani al-ma’roofi wa yaqbidhoona aydiyahum nasoo Allaha fanasiyahum inna al-munafiqeena humu al-fasiqoon

verses.eng: Allah has promised the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the disbelievers the fire of Hell, wherein they will abide eternally. It is sufficient for them. And Allah has cursed them, and for them is an enduring punishment.
verses.arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الْمُنَافِقِينَ وَالْمُنَافِقَاتِ وَالْكُفَّارَ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ هِيَ حَسْبُهُمْ ۚ وَلَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُّقِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa‘ada Allahu al-munafiqeena wal-munafiqati wal-kuffara nara jahannama khalideena feeha hiya hasbuhum wa la‘anahumu Allahu wa lahum ‘athabun muqeem

verses.eng: Like those before you; they were stronger than you in power and more abundant in wealth and children. They enjoyed their portion [of worldly enjoyment], and you have enjoyed your portion as those before you enjoyed their portion, and you have engaged [in vanities] like that in which they engaged. [It is] those whose deeds have become worthless in this world and in the Hereafter, and it is they who are the losers.
verses.arabic: كَالَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ كَانُوا أَشَدَّ مِنكُمْ قُوَّةً وَأَكْثَرَ أَمْوَالًا وَأَوْلَادًا فَاسْتَمْتَعُوا بِخَلَاقِهِمْ فَاسْتَمْتَعْتُم بِخَلَاقِكُمْ كَمَا اسْتَمْتَعَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُم بِخَلَاقِهِمْ وَخُضْتُمْ كَالَّذِي خَاضُوا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَالُهُمْ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kallatheena min qablikum kanoo ashadda minkum quwwatan wa akthara amwalan wa awladan fastamta’oo bi-khalaqihim fastamta’tum bi-khalaqikum kama istamta‘a allatheena min qablikum bi-khalaqihim wa khudhtum kallathee khadoo ola-ika habitat a’maluhum fee ad-dunya wal-akhirati wa ola-ika humu al-khasiroon

verses.eng: Has there not reached them the news of those before them - the people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Madyan and the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَأْتِهِمْ نَبَأُ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَعَادٍ وَثَمُودَ وَقَوْمِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَأَصْحَابِ مَدْيَنَ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتِ ۚ أَتَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ ۖ فَمَا كَانَ اللَّهُ لِيَظْلِمَهُمْ وَلَٰكِن كَانُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alam ya’tihim naba’u allatheena min qablihim qawmi noohin wa ‘adin wa thamooda wa qawmi ibraheema wa as-habi madyana wal-mu’tafikati atathum rusuluhum bil-bayyinati fama kana Allahu liyathlimahum walakin kanoo anfusahum yathlimoon

verses.eng: The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. Those - Allah will have mercy upon them. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتُ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَاءُ بَعْضٍ ۚ يَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَيُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَيُطِيعُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ سَيَرْحَمُهُمُ اللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wal-mu’minoona wal-mu’minatu ba’duhum awliya’u ba’din ya’muroona bil-ma’roofi wa yanhawna ‘ani al-munkari wa yuqeemoona as-salata wa yu’toona az-zakata wa yutee’oona Allaha wa rasoolahu ola-ika sayarhamuhumu Allahu inna Allaha ‘azeezun hakeem

verses.eng: Allah has promised the believing men and believing women gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence; but approval from Allah is greater. It is that which is the great attainment.
verses.arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا وَمَسَاكِنَ طَيِّبَةً فِي جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ ۚ وَرِضْوَانٌ مِّنَ اللَّهِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa‘ada Allahu al-mu’mineena wal-mu’minati jannatin tajree min tahtiha al-anharu khalideena feeha wa masakina tayyibatan fee jannati ‘adnin wa ridwanun min Allahi akbaru thalika huwa al-fawzu al-‘atheem

verses.eng: O Prophet, fight against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ جَاهِدِ الْكُفَّارَ وَالْمُنَافِقِينَ وَاغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha an-nabiyyu jahidi al-kuffara wal-munafiqeena wa oghluth ‘alayhim wa ma’wahum jahannamu wa bi’sa al-maseer

verses.eng: They swear by Allah that they did not say [anything against the Prophet] while they had said the word of disbelief and disbelieved after their [pretense of] Islam and planned that which they were not to attain. And they were not resentful except [for the fact] that Allah and His Messenger had enriched them of His bounty. So if they repent, it is better for them; but if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And there will not be for them on earth any protector or helper.
verses.arabic: يَحْلِفُونَ بِاللَّهِ مَا قَالُوا وَلَقَدْ قَالُوا كَلِمَةَ الْكُفْرِ وَكَفَرُوا بَعْدَ إِسْلَامِهِمْ وَهَمُّوا بِمَا لَمْ يَنَالُوا ۚ وَمَا نَقَمُوا إِلَّا أَنْ أَغْنَاهُمُ اللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُ مِن فَضْلِهِ ۚ فَإِن يَتُوبُوا يَكُ خَيْرًا لَّهُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَتَوَلَّوْا يُعَذِّبْهُمُ اللَّهُ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ ۚ وَمَا لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Yahlifoona billahi ma qaloo wa laqad qaloo kalimata al-kufri wa kafaroo ba’da islamihim wa hammoo bima lam yanaloowama naqamoo illa an aghnahumu Allahu wa rasooluhu min fadlihi fa-in yatooboo yak khayran lahum wa-in yatawallaw yu‘aththibhumu Allahu ‘athaban aleeman fee ad-dunya wal-akhirati wa ma lahum fee al-ardi min waliyyin wa la naseer

verses.eng: And among them are those who made a covenant with Allah, [saying], 'If He should give us from His bounty, we will surely spend in charity, and we will surely be among the righteous.'
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ عَاهَدَ اللَّهَ لَئِنْ آتَانَا مِن فَضْلِهِ لَنَصَّدَّقَنَّ وَلَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa minhum man ‘ahada Allaha la-in atana min fadlihi lanassaddaqanna wa lanakoonanna mina as-saliheen

verses.eng: But when He gave them from His bounty, they were stingy with it and turned away while they refused.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا آتَاهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِ بَخِلُوا بِهِ وَتَوَلَّوا وَّهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma atahum min fadlihi bakhiloo bihi wa tawallaw wahum mu‘ridoon

verses.eng: So He penalized them with hypocrisy in their hearts until the Day they will meet Him because they failed Allah in what they promised Him and because they [habitually] used to lie.
verses.arabic: فَأَعْقَبَهُمْ نِفَاقًا فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يَلْقَوْنَهُ بِمَا أَخْلَفُوا اللَّهَ مَا وَعَدُوهُ وَبِمَا كَانُوا يَكْذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-a‘qabahum nifaqan fee quloobihim ila yawmi yalqawnahu bima akhlafoo Allaha ma wa‘adoohu wa bima kanoo yakthiboon

verses.eng: Did they not know that Allah knows their secrets and their private conversations and that Allah is the Knower of the unseen?
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ سِرَّهُمْ وَنَجْوَاهُمْ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَّامُ الْغُيُوبِ
verses.transliteration: Alam ya‘lamoo anna Allaha ya‘lamu sirrahum wa najwahum wa anna Allaha ‘allamu al-ghuyoob

verses.eng: Those who criticize the contributors among the believers concerning [their] charities and [criticize] the ones who find nothing [to spend] except their effort, so they ridicule them - Allah will ridicule them, and they will have a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَلْمِزُونَ الْمُطَّوِّعِينَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ فِي الصَّدَقَاتِ وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَجِدُونَ إِلَّا جُهْدَهُمْ فَيَسْخَرُونَ مِنْهُمْ ۙ سَخِرَ اللَّهُ مِنْهُمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Allatheena yalmizoona al-mutawwi‘eena mina al-mu’mineena fee as-sadaqati wallatheena la yajidoona illa juhdahum fayaskharoona minhum sakhira Allahu minhum wa lahum ‘athabun aleem

verses.eng: Ask forgiveness for them, [O Muhammad], or do not ask forgiveness for them. If you should ask forgiveness for them seventy times - never will Allah forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
verses.arabic: اسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ أَوْ لَا تَسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ إِن تَسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةً فَلَن يَغْفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَفَرُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الْفَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Istaghfir lahum aw la tastaghfir lahum in tastaghfir lahum sab‘eena marratan falan yaghfira Allahu lahum thalika bi-annahum kafaroo billahi wa rasoolihi wallahu la yahdi al-qawma al-fasiqeen

verses.eng: Those who remained behind rejoiced in their staying [at home] after [the departure of] the Messenger of Allah and disliked to strive with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah and said, 'Do not go forth in the heat.' Say, 'The fire of Hell is more intensive in heat' - if they would but understand.
verses.arabic: فَرِحَ الْمُخَلَّفُونَ بِمَقْعَدِهِمْ خِلَافَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ وَكَرِهُوا أَن يُجَاهِدُوا بِأَمْوَالِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَقَالُوا لَا تَنفِرُوا فِي الْحَرِّ ۗ قُلْ نَارُ جَهَنَّمَ أَشَدُّ حَرًّا ۚ لَّوْ كَانُوا يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fariha al-mukhallafoona bi-maq‘adihim khilafa rasooli Allahi wa karihoo an yujahidoo bi-amwalihim wa anfusihim fee sabeeli Allahi wa qaloo la tanfiroo fee al-harri qul naru jahannama ashadd harran law kanoo yafqahoon

verses.eng: So let them laugh a little and weep much as recompense for what they used to earn.
verses.arabic: فَلْيَضْحَكُوا قَلِيلًا وَلْيَبْكُوا كَثِيرًا جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falyadhakoo qaleelan wa lyabkoo katheera jaza’an bima kanoo yaksiboon

verses.eng: If Allah should return you to a faction of them [after the expedition] and they ask your permission to go forth [to battle], say, 'You will not go forth with me, ever, and you will never fight with me an enemy. Indeed, you were satisfied with sitting [at home] the first time, so sit [now] with those who remain behind.'
verses.arabic: فَإِن رَّجَعَكَ اللَّهُ إِلَىٰ طَائِفَةٍ مِّنْهُمْ فَاسْتَأْذَنُوكَ لِلْخُرُوجِ فَقُل لَّن تَخْرُجُوا مَعِيَ أَبَدًا وَلَن تُقَاتِلُوا مَعِيَ عَدُوًّا ۖ إِنَّكُمْ رَضِيتُم بِالْقُعُودِ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ فَاقْعُدُوا مَعَ الْخَالِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in raja‘aka Allahu ila ta’ifatin minhum fasta’thanooka lilkhurooji faqul lan takhrujoo ma‘iya abadan wa lan tuqatiloo ma‘iya ‘aduwwan innakum raditum bil-qu‘oodi awwala marratin faq‘udoo ma‘a al-khalideen

verses.eng: And do not pray [the funeral prayer, O Muhammad], over any of them who has died - ever - or stand at his grave. Indeed, they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُصَلِّ عَلَىٰ أَحَدٍ مِّنْهُم مَّاتَ أَبَدًا وَلَا تَقُمْ عَلَىٰ قَبْرِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَفَرُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَمَاتُوا وَهُمْ فَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la tusalli ‘ala ahadin minhum mata abadan wa la taqum ‘ala qabrihi innahum kafaroo billahi wa rasoolihi wa matoo wahum fasiqoon

verses.eng: And let not their wealth and their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in this world and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُعْجِبْكَ أَمْوَالُهُمْ وَأَوْلَادُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّمَا يُرِيدُ اللَّهُ أَن يُعَذِّبَهُم بِهَا فِي الدُّنْيَا وَتَزْهَقَ أَنفُسُهُمْ وَهُمْ كَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la tu‘jibka amwaluhum wa awladuhum innama yureedu Allahu an yu‘adhibahum biha fee ad-dunya wa tazhaqa anfusuhum wahum kafiroon

verses.eng: And when a surah was revealed [enjoining them] to believe in Allah and to fight with His Messenger, those of wealth among them asked your permission [to stay back] and said, 'Leave us to be with them who sit [at home].'
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا أُنزِلَتْ سُورَةٌ أَنْ آمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَجَاهِدُوا مَعَ رَسُولِهِ اسْتَأْذَنَكَ أُولُو الطَّوْلِ مِنْهُمْ وَقَالُوا ذَرْنَا نَكُن مَّعَ الْقَاعِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa itha unzilat sooratun an aminoo billahi wa jahidoo ma‘a rasoolihi ista’thanaka oloo at-tawli minhum wa qaloo tharna nakun ma‘a al-qa‘ideen

verses.eng: They were satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and their hearts were sealed over, so they do not understand.
verses.arabic: رَضُوا بِأَن يَكُونُوا مَعَ الْخَوَالِفِ وَطُبِعَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Radoo bi-an yakoonoo ma‘a al-khawalifi wa tubi‘a ‘ala quloobihim fahum la yafqahoon

verses.eng: But the Messenger and those who believed with him fought with their wealth and their lives. Those will have [all] good things, and it is they who will be the successful.
verses.arabic: لَٰكِنِ الرَّسُولُ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ جَاهَدُوا بِأَمْوَالِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الْخَيْرَاتُ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lakini ar-rasoolu wallatheena amanoo ma‘ahu jahadoo bi-amwalihim wa anfusihim wa ola-ika lahumu al-khayratu wa ola-ika humu al-muflihoon

verses.eng: Allah has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. That is the great attainment.
verses.arabic: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: A‘adda Allahu lahum jannatin tajree min tahtiha al-anharu khalideena feeha thalika al-fawzu al-‘atheem

verses.eng: And those with excuses among the bedouins came to be permitted [to remain], and they who had lied to Allah and His Messenger sat [at home]. There will strike those who disbelieved among them a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَجَاءَ الْمُعَذِّرُونَ مِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ لِيُؤْذَنَ لَهُمْ وَقَعَدَ الَّذِينَ كَذَبُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ ۚ سَيُصِيبُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa jā'a al-muʿadhirūna min al-aʿrābi liyu'dhana lahum wa qaʿada alladhīna kadhabū llāha wa rasūlah, sayuṣību alladhīna kafarū minhum ʿadhābun alīm

verses.eng: Not upon the weak or upon the ill or upon those who do not find anything to spend is there any blame [for remaining behind] - if they are true to Allah and His Messenger. There is not upon the doers of good any cause [for blame]. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: لَّيْسَ عَلَى الضُّعَفَاءِ وَلَا عَلَى الْمَرْضَىٰ وَلَا عَلَى الَّذِينَ لَا يَجِدُونَ مَا يُنفِقُونَ حَرَجٌ إِذَا نَصَحُوا لِلَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۚ مَا عَلَى الْمُحْسِنِينَ مِن سَبِيلٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Laysa ʿalā ḍ-ḍuʿafā'i wa lā ʿalā l-marḍā wa lā ʿalā alladhīna lā yajidūna mā yunfiqūna ḥarajun idhā naṣaḥū lillāhi wa rasūlih, mā ʿalā l-muḥsinīna min sabīl, wa llāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Nor [is there blame] upon those who, when they came to you that you might give them mounts, you said, 'I can find nothing for you to ride upon.' They turned back while their eyes overflowed with tears out of grief that they could not find something to spend [for the cause of Allah].
verses.arabic: وَلَا عَلَى الَّذِينَ إِذَا مَا أَتَوْكَ لِتَحْمِلَهُمْ قُلْتَ لَا أَجِدُ مَا أَحْمِلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ تَوَلَّوا وَّأَعْيُنُهُمْ تَفِيضُ مِنَ الدَّمْعِ حَزَنًا أَلَّا يَجِدُوا مَا يُنفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā ʿalā alladhīna idhā mā atawka li-taḥmilahum qulta lā ajidu mā aḥmilukum ʿalayhi tawallaw wa aʿyunuhum tafīḍu min ad-damʿi ḥazanan allā yajidū mā yunfiqūn

verses.eng: The cause [for blame] is only upon those who ask permission of you [to remain at home] while they are wealthy. They are satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and Allah has sealed over their hearts, so they do not know.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا السَّبِيلُ عَلَى الَّذِينَ يَسْتَأْذِنُونَكَ وَهُمْ أَغْنِيَاءُ ۚ رَضُوا بِأَن يَكُونُوا مَعَ الْخَوَالِفِ وَطَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā as-sabīlu ʿalā alladhīna yasta'dhinūnaka wa hum aghniyā', raḍū bi-an yakūnū maʿa al-khawālif wa ṭabaʿa llāhu ʿalā qulūbihim fa-hum lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: They will make excuses to you when you have returned to them. Say, 'Make no excuse - never will we believe you. Allah has already informed us of your news. And Allah will observe your deeds, and [so will] His Messenger; then you will be taken back to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do.'
verses.arabic: يَعْتَذِرُونَ إِلَيْكُمْ إِذَا رَجَعْتُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ قُل لَّا تَعْتَذِرُوا لَن نُّؤْمِنَ لَكُمْ ۖ قَدْ نَبَّأَنَا اللَّهُ مِنْ أَخْبَارِكُمْ ۚ وَسَيَرَى اللَّهُ عَمَلَكُمْ وَرَسُولُهُ ثُمَّ تُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yaʿtadirūna ilaykum idhā rajaʿtum ilayhim, qul lā taʿtadirū lan nu'mina lakum, qad naba'anā llāhu min akhbārikum, wa sayarā llāhu ʿamalakum wa rasūluh, thumma turaddūna ilā ʿālimi al-ghaybi wa ash-shahādati fa-yunabbi'ukum bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūn

verses.eng: They will swear by Allah to you when you return to them that you would leave them alone. So leave them alone; indeed they are evil, and their refuge is Hell as recompense for what they had been earning.
verses.arabic: سَيَحْلِفُونَ بِاللَّهِ لَكُمْ إِذَا انقَلَبْتُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لِتُعْرِضُوا عَنْهُمْ ۖ فَأَعْرِضُوا عَنْهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ رِجْسٌ ۖ وَمَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sayaḥlifūna bi-llāhi lakum idhā inqalabtum ilayhim li-tuʿriḍū ʿanhum, fa-aʿriḍū ʿanhum, innahum rijs, wa ma'wāhum jahannamu jazā'an bi-mā kānū yaksibūn

verses.eng: They swear to you so that you might be satisfied with them. But if you should be satisfied with them - indeed, Allah is not satisfied with a defiantly disobedient people.
verses.arabic: يَحْلِفُونَ لَكُمْ لِتَرْضَوْا عَنْهُمْ ۖ فَإِن تَرْضَوْا عَنْهُمْ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَرْضَىٰ عَنِ الْقَوْمِ الْفَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yaḥlifūna lakum li-tarḍaw ʿanhum, fa-in tarḍaw ʿanhum fa-inna llāha lā yarḍā ʿani al-qawmi al-fāsiqīn

verses.eng: The bedouins are stronger in disbelief and hypocrisy and more likely not to know the limits of what [laws] Allah has revealed to His Messenger. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: الْأَعْرَابُ أَشَدُّ كُفْرًا وَنِفَاقًا وَأَجْدَرُ أَلَّا يَعْلَمُوا حُدُودَ مَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Al-aʿrābu ashaddu kufran wa nifāqan wa ajdaru allā yaʿlamū ḥudūda mā anzala llāhu ʿalā rasūlih, wa llāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīm

verses.eng: And among the bedouins are some who consider what they spend as a loss and await for you turns of misfortune. Upon them will be a misfortune of evil. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ مَن يَتَّخِذُ مَا يُنفِقُ مَغْرَمًا وَيَتَرَبَّصُ بِكُمُ الدَّوَائِرَ ۚ عَلَيْهِمْ دَائِرَةُ السَّوْءِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina al-aʿrābi man yattakhidhu mā yunfiqu maghraman wa yatarabbaṣu bikum ad-dawā'ir, ʿalayhim dā'iratu as-saw', wa llāhu samīʿun ʿalīm

verses.eng: But among the bedouins are some who believe in Allah and the Last Day and consider what they spend as means of nearness to Allah and of [obtaining] invocations of the Messenger. Unquestionably, it is a means of nearness for them. Allah will admit them to His mercy. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ وَيَتَّخِذُ مَا يُنفِقُ قُرُبَاتٍ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَصَلَوَاتِ الرَّسُولِ ۚ أَلَا إِنَّهَا قُرْبَةٌ لَّهُمْ ۚ سَيُدْخِلُهُمُ اللَّهُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina al-aʿrābi man yu'minu bi-llāhi wa al-yawmi al-ākhiri wa yattakhidhu mā yunfiqu qurbātin ʿinda llāhi wa ṣalawāti ar-rasūl, alā innahā qurbatun lahum, sayudkhiluhumu llāhu fī raḥmatih, inna llāha ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: And the first forerunners [in the faith] among the Muhajireen and the Ansar and those who followed them with good conduct - Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
verses.arabic: وَالسَّابِقُونَ الْأَوَّلُونَ مِنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالْأَنصَارِ وَالَّذِينَ اتَّبَعُوهُم بِإِحْسَانٍ رَّضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي تَحْتَهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa as-sābiqūna al-awwalūna mina al-muhājirīna wa al-anṣāri wa alladhīna attabaʿūhum bi-iḥsānin raḍiya llāhu ʿanhum wa raḍū ʿanhu wa aʿadda lahum jannātin tajrī taḥtahā al-anhāru khālidīna fīhā abadan, dhālika al-fawzu al-ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: And among those around you of the bedouins are hypocrites, and [also] from the people of Madinah. They have persisted in hypocrisy. You, [O Muhammad], do not know them, [but] We know them. We will punish them twice [in this world]; then they will be returned to a great punishment.
verses.arabic: وَمِمَّنْ حَوْلَكُم مِّنَ الْأَعْرَابِ مُنَافِقُونَ ۖ وَمِنْ أَهْلِ الْمَدِينَةِ ۖ مَرَدُوا عَلَى النِّفَاقِ لَا تَعْلَمُهُمْ ۖ نَحْنُ نَعْلَمُهُمْ ۚ سَنُعَذِّبُهُم مَّرَّتَيْنِ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَذَابٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mimman ḥawlakum mina al-aʿrābi munāfiqūn, wa min ahli al-madīnati maradū ʿalā an-nifāqi lā taʿlamuhum, naḥnu naʿlamuhum, sanuʿadhibuhum marratayni thumma yuraddūna ilā ʿadhābin ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: And [there are] others who have acknowledged their sins. They had mixed a righteous deed with another that was bad. Perhaps Allah will turn to them in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَآخَرُونَ اعْتَرَفُوا بِذُنُوبِهِمْ خَلَطُوا عَمَلًا صَالِحًا وَآخَرَ سَيِّئًا عَسَى اللَّهُ أَن يَتُوبَ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa ākharūna iʿtarafū bi-dhunūbihim khalatū ʿamalan ṣāliḥan wa ākhara sayyi'an, ʿasā llāhu an yatūba ʿalayhim, inna llāha ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Take, [O, Muhammad], from their wealth a charity by which you purify them and cause them increase, and invoke [Allah's blessings] upon them. Indeed, your invocations are reassurance for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: خُذْ مِنْ أَمْوَالِهِمْ صَدَقَةً تُطَهِّرُهُمْ وَتُزَكِّيهِم بِهَا وَصَلِّ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ إِنَّ صَلَاتَكَ سَكَنٌ لَّهُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Khudh min amwālihim ṣadaqatan tuṭahhiruhum wa tuzakkīhim bihā wa ṣalli ʿalayhim, inna ṣalātaka sakanun lahum, wa llāhu samīʿun ʿalīm

verses.eng: Do they not know that it is Allah who accepts repentance from His servants and receives charities and that it is Allah who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful?
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ يَقْبَلُ التَّوْبَةَ عَنْ عِبَادِهِ وَيَأْخُذُ الصَّدَقَاتِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Alam yaʿlamū anna llāha huwa yaqbalu at-tawbata ʿan ʿibādihi wa ya'khuḍu aṣ-ṣadaqāti wa anna llāha huwa at-tawwābu ar-raḥīm

verses.eng: And say, 'Do [as you will], for Allah will see your deeds, and [so will] His Messenger and the believers. And you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do.'
verses.arabic: وَقُلِ اعْمَلُوا فَسَيَرَى اللَّهُ عَمَلَكُمْ وَرَسُولُهُ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۖ وَسَتُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa quli i'maloo fasayara Allahu 'amalakum wa rasooluhu wal-mu'minoon, wa saturaddoona ila 'alimi al-ghaybi wash-shahadati fa yunabbi'ukum bima kuntum ta'maloon

verses.eng: And others are deferred until the command of Allah - whether He will punish them or whether He will forgive them. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَآخَرُونَ مُرْجَوْنَ لِأَمْرِ اللَّهِ إِمَّا يُعَذِّبُهُمْ وَإِمَّا يَتُوبُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa akharoona murjawna li-amri Allahi imma yu'adhibuhum wa imma yatoobu 'alayhim, wallahu 'aleemun hakeem

verses.eng: And [there are] those [hypocrites] who took for themselves a mosque for causing harm and disbelief and division among the believers and as a station for whoever had warred against Allah and His Messenger before. And they will surely swear, 'We intended only the best.' And Allah testifies that indeed they are liars.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا مَسْجِدًا ضِرَارًا وَكُفْرًا وَتَفْرِيقًا بَيْنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَإِرْصَادًا لِّمَنْ حَارَبَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ وَلَيَحْلِفُنَّ إِنْ أَرَدْنَا إِلَّا الْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَاللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wallatheena ittakhathoo masjidan diraran wa kufran wa tafreeqan bayna almu'mineena wa irsadan liman haraba Allaha wa rasoolahu min qabl, wa layahlifunna in aradna illa alhusna, wallahu yashhadu innahum lakathiboon

verses.eng: Do not stand [for prayer] within it - ever. A mosque founded on righteousness from the first day is more worthy for you to stand in. Within it are men who love to purify themselves; and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
verses.arabic: لَا تَقُمْ فِيهِ أَبَدًا ۚ لَّمَسْجِدٌ أُسِّسَ عَلَى التَّقْوَىٰ مِنْ أَوَّلِ يَوْمٍ أَحَقُّ أَن تَقُومَ فِيهِ ۚ فِيهِ رِجَالٌ يُحِبُّونَ أَن يَتَطَهَّرُوا ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُحِبُّ الْمُطَّهِّرِينَ
verses.transliteration: La taqum feehi abadan, lama sjidun ussisa 'ala at-taqwa min awwali yawmin ahaqqu an taqooma feeh, feehi rijalun yuhibboona an yatahharoo, wallahu yuhibbu al-mutahhireen

verses.eng: Then is one who laid the foundation of his building on righteousness [with fear] from Allah and [seeking] His approval better or one who laid the foundation of his building on the edge of a bank about to collapse, so it collapsed with him into the fire of Hell? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: أَفَمَنْ أَسَّسَ بُنْيَانَهُ عَلَىٰ تَقْوَىٰ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانٍ خَيْرٌ أَم مَّنْ أَسَّسَ بُنْيَانَهُ عَلَىٰ شَفَا جُرُفٍ هَارٍ فَانْهَارَ بِهِ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ ۗ وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Afaman assasa bunyanahu 'ala taqwa mina Allahi wa ridwanin khayrun am man assasa bunyanahu 'ala shafa jurufin harin fanhara bihi fee nari jahannam, wallahu la yahdi al-qawma ath-thalimeen

verses.eng: Their building which they built will not cease to be a [cause of] skepticism in their hearts until their hearts are stopped. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: لَا يَزَالُ بُنْيَانُهُمُ الَّذِي بَنَوْا رِيبَةً فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ إِلَّا أَن تَقَطَّعَ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: La yazalu bunyanuhumu allathee banaw reebatan fee quloobihim illa an taqatta'a quloobuhum, wallahu 'aleemun hakeem

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties [in exchange] for that they will have Paradise. They fight in the cause of Allah, so they kill and are killed. [It is] a true promise [binding] upon Him in the Torah and the Gospel and the Qur'an. And who is truer to his covenant than Allah? So rejoice in your transaction which you have contracted. And it is that which is the great attainment.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ اشْتَرَىٰ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَمْوَالَهُم بِأَنَّ لَهُمُ الْجَنَّةَ ۚ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ فَيَقْتُلُونَ وَيُقْتَلُونَ ۖ وَعْدًا عَلَيْهِ حَقًّا فِي التَّوْرَاةِ وَالْإِنجِيلِ وَالْقُرْآنِ ۚ وَمَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِعَهْدِهِ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۚ فَاسْتَبْشِرُوا بِبَيْعِكُمُ الَّذِي بَايَعْتُم بِهِ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allaha ishtara mina almu'mineena anfusahum wa amwalahum bi-anna lahumu al-jannah, yuqatiloona fee sabeeli Allahi fayaqtuloona wayuqtaloon, wa'dan 'alayhi haqqan fee at-tawrati wal-injeeli wal-qur'an, wa man awfa bi'ahdihi mina Allahi fastabshiroo bibay'ikumu allathee baaya'tum bih, wa thalika huwa al-fawzu al-'atheem

verses.eng: Those who repent, those who worship, those who praise [Him], those who journey [for His cause], those who bow, those who prostrate, those who enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and those who observe the limits [set by] Allah. And give good tidings to the believers.
verses.arabic: التَّائِبُونَ الْعَابِدُونَ الْحَامِدُونَ السَّائِحُونَ الرَّاكِعُونَ السَّاجِدُونَ الْآمِرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَالنَّاهُونَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَالْحَافِظُونَ لِحُدُودِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: At-ta'iboona al-'abidoona al-hamidoona as-sa'ihoona ar-raki'oona as-sajidoona al-amiroona bil-ma'roofi wan-nahoona 'anil-munkari wal-hafithoona lihudoodi Allah, wa bashshiri almu'mineen

verses.eng: It is not for the Prophet and those who have believed to ask forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they were relatives, after it has become clear to them that they are companions of Hellfire.
verses.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِلنَّبِيِّ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَن يَسْتَغْفِرُوا لِلْمُشْرِكِينَ وَلَوْ كَانُوا أُولِي قُرْبَىٰ مِن بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمْ أَنَّهُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Ma kana linnabiyyi wallatheena amanoo an yastaghfiroo lil-mushrikeena wa law kanoo oolee qurba min ba'di ma tabayyana lahum annahum as-habu aljaheem

verses.eng: And the request of forgiveness of Abraham for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became apparent to Abraham that his father was an enemy to Allah, he disassociated himself from him. Indeed was Abraham compassionate and patient.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ اسْتِغْفَارُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ لِأَبِيهِ إِلَّا عَن مَّوْعِدَةٍ وَعَدَهَا إِيَّاهُ فَلَمَّا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُ أَنَّهُ عَدُوٌّ لِّلَّهِ تَبَرَّأَ مِنْهُ ۚ إِنَّ إِبْرَاهِيمَ لَأَوَّاهٌ حَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa ma kana istighfaru ibraheema li-abeehi illa 'an maw'idatin wa'adaha iyyahu, falamma tabayyana lahu annahu 'aduwwun lillahi tabarra'a minh, inna ibraheema la-awwahun haleem

verses.eng: And Allah would not let a people stray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should avoid. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ اللَّهُ لِيُضِلَّ قَوْمًا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَاهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُبَيِّنَ لَهُم مَّا يَتَّقُونَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa ma kana Allahu liyudilla qawman ba'da idh hadahum hatta yubayyina lahum ma yattaqoon, inna Allaha bikulli shay'in 'aleem
