verses.eng: Indeed, to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He gives life and causes death. And you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۚ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allaha lahu mulku as-samawati wal-ard, yuhyee wa yumeet, wa ma lakum min dooni Allahi min waliyyin wa la naseer

verses.eng: Allah has already forgiven the Prophet and the Muhajireen and the Ansar who followed him in the hour of difficulty after the hearts of a party of them had almost inclined [to doubt], and then He forgave them. Indeed, He was to them Kind and Merciful.
verses.arabic: لَّقَد تَّابَ اللَّهُ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ وَالْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالْأَنصَارِ الَّذِينَ اتَّبَعُوهُ فِي سَاعَةِ الْعُسْرَةِ مِن بَعْدِ مَا كَادَ يَزِيغُ قُلُوبُ فَرِيقٍ مِّنْهُمْ ثُمَّ تَابَ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِهِمْ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Laqad taba Allahu 'ala an-nabiyyi wal-muhajireena wal-ansari allatheena attaba'oohu fee sa'ati al-'usrati min ba'di ma kada yazeegu quloobu fareeqin minhum thumma taba 'alayhim, innahu bihim ra'oofun raheem

verses.eng: And [He also forgave] the three who were left behind [and regretted their error] to the point that the earth closed in on them in spite of its vastness and their souls confined them and they were certain that there is no refuge from Allah except in Him. Then He turned to them so they could repent. Indeed, Allah is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَعَلَى الثَّلَاثَةِ الَّذِينَ خُلِّفُوا حَتَّىٰ إِذَا ضَاقَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَرْضُ بِمَا رَحُبَتْ وَضَاقَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ أَنفُسُهُمْ وَظَنُّوا أَن لَّا مَلْجَأَ مِنَ اللَّهِ إِلَّا إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ تَابَ عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَتُوبُوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa 'ala ath-thalathati allatheena khullifoo hatta idha daqat 'alayhimu al-ardu bima rahubat wa daqat 'alayhim anfusuhum wa thannoo an la malja'a mina Allahi illa ilayhi thumma taba 'alayhim liyatooboo, inna Allaha huwa at-tawwabu ar-raheem

verses.eng: O you who have believed, fear Allah and be with those who are true.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَكُونُوا مَعَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha allatheena amanoo ittaqoo Allaha wa koonoo ma'a as-sadiqeen

verses.eng: It was not for the people of Madinah and those who are around them of the bedouin Arabs to remain behind the Messenger of Allah or to prefer themselves to him. That is because they are not afflicted by thirst or fatigue or hunger in the cause of Allah, nor do they tread on any ground that enrages the disbelievers, nor do they obtain from the enemy that for which they deserve [reward], except that it is recorded for them as a righteous deed. Indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of the doers of good.
verses.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِأَهْلِ ٱلْمَدِينَةِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَعْرَابِ أَن يَتَخَلَّفُوا۟ عَن رَّسُولِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا يَرْغَبُوا۟ بِأَنفُسِهِمْ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ لَا يُصِيبُهُمْ ظَمَأٌ وَلَا نَصَبٌ وَلَا مَخْمَصَةٌ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا يَطَـُٔونَ مَوْطِئًا يَغِيظُ ٱلْكُفَّارَ وَلَا يَنَالُونَ مِنْ عَدُوٍّ نَّيْلًا إِلَّا كُتِبَ لَهُم بِهِۦ عَمَلٌ صَٰلِحٌ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Mā kāna li'ahli l-madīnati waman ḥawlahum mina l-aʿrābi an yataḫallafū ʿan rasūli l-lahi walā yarġabū bi'anfusihim ʿan nafsihi; ḏālika bi'annahum lā yuṣībuhum ẓama'un walā naṣabun walā maḫmaṣatun fī sabīli l-lahi walā yaṭa'ūna mawṭi'an yaġīẓu l-kuffāra walā yanālūna min ʿaduwwin naylan illā kutiba lahum bihī ʿamalun ṣāliḥ; inna l-laha lā yuḍīʿu ajra l-muḥsinīn.

verses.eng: Nor do they spend an expenditure, small or large, nor do they cross a valley, except that it is recorded for them, that Allah may reward them for the best of what they were doing.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يُنفِقُونَ نَفَقَةً صَغِيرَةً وَلَا كَبِيرَةً وَلَا يَقْطَعُونَ وَادِيًا إِلَّا كُتِبَ لَهُمْ لِيَجْزِيَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ أَحْسَنَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walā yunfiqūna nafaqatan ṣaġīratan walā kabīratan walā yaqṭaʿūna wādiyan illā kutiba lahum liyajziyahumu l-lahu aḥsana mā kānū yaʿmalūn.

verses.eng: And it is not for the believers to go forth for [jihad] all at once. For there should separate from every division of them a group [remaining] to obtain understanding in the religion and warn their people when they return to them that they might be cautious.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ لِيَنفِرُوا۟ كَآفَّةً ۚ فَلَوْلَا نَفَرَ مِن كُلِّ فِرْقَةٍ مِّنْهُمْ طَآئِفَةٌ لِّيَتَفَقَّهُوا۟ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَلِيُنذِرُوا۟ قَوْمَهُمْ إِذَا رَجَعُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَحْذَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā kāna l-mu'minūna liyanfirū kāffatan; falawlā nafara min kulli firqatin min'hum ṭā'ifatun liyatafaqqahū fī d-dīni waliyunḏirū qawmahum idhā rajaʿū ilayhim laʿallahum yaḥḏarūn.

verses.eng: O you who have believed, fight those adjacent to you of the disbelievers and let them find in you harshness. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ قَٰتِلُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ يَلُونَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ وَلْيَجِدُوا۟ فِيكُمْ غِلْظَةً ۚ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā l-ladhīna āmanū qātilū l-ladhīna yalūnakum mina l-kuffāri walyajidū fīkum ġilẓatan; wa-iʿ'lamū anna l-laha maʿa l-muttaqīn.

verses.eng: And when a surah is revealed, there are those who say, "Which of you has this increased his faith?" As for those who believed, it has increased them in faith, and they are rejoicing.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا مَآ أُنزِلَتْ سُورَةٌ فَمِنْهُم مَّن يَقُولُ أَيُّكُمْ زَادَتْهُ هَٰذِهِۦٓ إِيمَٰنًا ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ فَزَادَتْهُمْ إِيمَٰنًا وَهُمْ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā mā unzilat sūratun famin'hum man yaqūlu ayyukum zādat'hu hādhihī īmānan; fa'ammā l-ladhīna āmanū fazādat'hum īmānan wahum yastabshirūn.

verses.eng: But as for those in whose hearts is disease, it has only increased them in evil upon evil. And they will have died while they are disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ فَزَادَتْهُمْ رِجْسًا إِلَىٰ رِجْسِهِمْ وَمَاتُوا۟ وَهُمْ كَٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ammā l-ladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun fazādat'hum rij'san ilā rij'sihim wamātū wahum kāfirūn.

verses.eng: Do they not see that they are tried every year or two? Then they do not repent nor do they remember.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَنَّهُمْ يُفْتَنُونَ فِى كُلِّ عَامٍ مَّرَّةً أَوْ مَرَّتَيْنِ ثُمَّ لَا يَتُوبُونَ وَلَا هُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awalā yarawna annahum yuftanūna fī kulli ʿāmin marratan aw marratayni thumma lā yatūbūna walā hum yaḏḏakkarūn.

verses.eng: And when a surah is revealed, they look at each other [saying], "Does anyone see you?" Then they leave. Allah has turned their hearts away because they are a people who do not understand.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا مَآ أُنزِلَتْ سُورَةٌ نَّظَرَ بَعْضُهُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ هَلْ يَرَىٰكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ ثُمَّ ٱنصَرَفُوا۟ ۚ صَرَفَ ٱللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُم بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā mā unzilat sūratun naẓara baʿḍuhum ilā baʿḍin hal yarākum min aḥadin thumma inṣarafū; ṣarafa l-lahu qulūbahum bi-annahum qawmun lā yafqahūn.

verses.eng: There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer; [he is] concerned over you and to the believers is kind and merciful.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ جَآءَكُمْ رَسُولٌ مِّنْ أَنفُسِكُمْ عَزِيزٌ عَلَيْهِ مَا عَنِتُّمْ حَرِيصٌ عَلَيْكُم بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Laqad jā'akum rasūlun min anfusikum ʿazīzun ʿalayhi mā ʿanittum ḥarīṣun ʿalaykum bil-mu'minīna ra'ūfun raḥīm.

verses.eng: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad], say, "Sufficient for me is Allah. There is no deity except Him. Upon Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne."
verses.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُلْ حَسْبِىَ ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ ۖ وَهُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in tawallaw faqul ḥasbiya l-lahu lā ilāha illā huwa ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa huwa rabbu l-ʿarshi l-ʿaẓīm.

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the wise Book.
verses.arabic: الٓرۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Ra. Tilka āyātu l-kitābi l-ḥakīm.

verses.eng: Has it been a wonder to the people that We revealed [revelation] to a man from among themselves, warning the people and giving good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [high] station of truth with their Lord? The disbelievers say, "Indeed, this is an obvious magician."
verses.arabic: أَكَانَ لِلنَّاسِ عَجَبًا أَنْ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَنْ أَنذِرِ ٱلنَّاسَ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَنَّ لَهُمْ قَدَمَ صِدْقٍ عِندَ رَّبِّهِمْ ۗ قَالَ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: ʾAkāna li-n-nāsi ʿajaban ʾan ʾawḥaynā ʾilā rajulin minhum ʾan ʾanḏiri n-nāsa wa bašširi l-laḏīna ʾāmanū ʾanna lahum qadama ṣidqin ʿinda rabbihim. Qāla l-kāfirūna ʾinna hāḏā la sāḥirun mubīn.

verses.eng: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne, arranging [all] matters. There is no intercessor except after His permission. That is Allah, your Lord, so worship Him. Then will you not remember?
verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ يُدَبِّرُ ٱلْأَمْرَ ۖ مَا مِن شَفِيعٍ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ إِذْنِهِۦ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾInna rabbakumu l-lahu l-laḏī ḫalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa fī sittati ʾayyāmin ṯumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarši yudabbiru l-ʾamra. Mā min šafīʿin ʾillā min baʿdi ʾiḏnihī. Ḏālikumu l-lahu rabbukum faʿbudūhu. ʾAfalā taḏakkarūn.

verses.eng: To Him is your return all together. [It is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. Indeed, He begins the creation and then repeats it that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds with justice. But those who disbelieved will have a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment for what they used to deny.
verses.arabic: إِلَيْهِ مَرْجِعُكُمْ جَمِيعًا ۖ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقًّا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَهُمْ شَرَابٌ مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ وَعَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾIlayhi marjiʿukum jamīʿā. Waʿda l-lahi ḥaqqā. ʾInnahū yabdaʾu l-ḫalqa ṯumma yuʿīdūhu li-yajziya l-laḏīna ʾāmanū wa ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti bi-l-qisṭ. Wa l-laḏīna kafarū lahum šarābun min ḥamīmin wa ʿaḏābun ʾalīmun bimā kānū yakfurūn.

verses.eng: It is He who made the sun a shining light and the moon a derived light and determined for it phases - that you may know the number of years and the account [of time]. Allah has not created this except in truth. He details the signs for a people who know.
verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ ضِيَآءً وَٱلْقَمَرَ نُورًا وَقَدَّرَهُۥ مَنَازِلَ لِتَعْلَمُوا۟ عَدَدَ ٱلسِّنِينَ وَٱلْحِسَابَ ۚ مَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ ذَٰلِكَ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ يُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa l-laḏī jaʿala š-šamsa ḍiyāʾan wa l-qamara nūran wa qaddarahū manāzila li-taʿlamū ʿadada s-sinīna wa l-ḥisāb. Mā ḫalaqa l-lahu ḏālika ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqq. Yufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yaʿlamūn.

verses.eng: Indeed, in the alternation of the night and the day and [in] what Allah has created in the heavens and the earth are signs for a people who fear [Him].
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ٱخْتِلَٰفِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَـَٔايَٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾInna fī ḫtilāfi l-layli wa n-nahāri wa mā ḫalaqa l-lahu fī s-samāwāti wa l-ʾarḍi laʾāyātin li-qawmin yattaqūn.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel secure therein, and those who are heedless of Our signs -
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا وَرَضُوا۟ بِٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱطْمَأَنُّوا۟ بِهَا وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنْ ءَايَٰتِنَا غَٰفِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾInna l-laḏīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā wa raḍū bi-l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa ṭmaʾannū bihā wa l-laḏīna hum ʿan ʾāyātinā ġāfilūn.

verses.eng: Those - their refuge will be the Fire because of what they used to earn.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ مَأْوَىٰهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾUlāʾika maʾwāhumu n-nāru bimā kānū yaksibūn.

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - their Lord will guide them because of their faith. Beneath them rivers will flow in gardens of pleasure.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ يَهْدِيهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِإِيمَٰنِهِمْ ۖ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ فِى جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.transliteration: ʾInna l-laḏīna ʾāmanū wa ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti yahdīhim rabbuhum biʾīmānihim tajrī min taḥtihimu l-ʾanhāru fī jannāti n-naʿīm.

verses.eng: Their call therein will be, "Exalted are You, O Allah," and their greeting will be, "Peace." And the conclusion of their call will be, "Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds."
verses.arabic: دَعْوَىٰهُمْ فِيهَا سُبْحَٰنَكَ ٱللَّهُمَّ وَتَحِيَّتُهُمْ فِيهَا سَلَٰمٌ ۚ وَءَاخِرُ دَعْوَىٰهُمْ أَنِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Daʿwāhum fīhā subḥānaka l-lahumma wa taḥiyyatuhum fīhā salām. Wa ʾāḫiru daʿwāhum ʾani l-ḥamdu li-l-lahi rabbi l-ʿālamīn.

verses.eng: And if Allah was to hasten for the people the evil [they invoke] as He hastens for them the good, their term would have been concluded for them. But We leave those who do not expect the meeting with Us in their transgression, wandering blindly.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ يُعَجِّلُ ٱللَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ شَرَّ ٱسْتِعْجَالَهُم بِٱلْخَيْرِ لَقُضِىَ إِلَيْهِمْ أَجَلُهُمْ ۖ فَنَذَرُ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا فِى طُغْيَٰنِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law yuʿajjilu l-lahu li-n-nāsi š-šarra stiʿjālahum bi-l-ḫayri laquḍiya ʾilayhim ʾajaluhum. Fa naḏaru l-laḏīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā fī ṭuġyānihim yaʿmahūn.

verses.eng: And when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, [lying] on his side or sitting or standing; but when We remove from him his affliction, he passes on as if he had never called upon Us to [remove] an affliction that touched him. Thus is made pleasing to the transgressors that which they have been doing.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ ٱلضُّرُّ دَعَانَا لِجَنۢبِهِۦٓ أَوْ قَاعِدًا أَوْ قَآئِمًا ۖ فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُ ضُرَّهُۥ مَرَّ كَأَن لَّمْ يَدْعُنَآ إِلَىٰ ضُرٍّ مَّسَّهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾiḏā massa l-ʾinsāna ḍ-ḍurru daʿānā li-janbihī ʾaw qāʿidan ʾaw qāʾimā. Falammā kašafnā ʿanhu ḍurrahu marra kaʾan lam yadʿunā ʾilā ḍurrin massah. Kaḏālika zuyyina li-l-musrifīna mā kānū yaʿmalūn.

verses.eng: And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا ٱلْقُرُونَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا۟ ۘ وَجَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَٰتِ فَمَا كَانُوا۟ لِيُؤْمِنُوا۟ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ʾahlaknā l-qurūna min qablikum lammā ẓalamū. Wa jāʾat'hum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti famā kānū liyuʾminū. Kaḏālika najzī l-qawma l-mujrimīn.

verses.eng: Then We made you successors in the land after them so that We may observe how you will do.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَٰكُمْ خَلَٰٓئِفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ لِنَنظُرَ كَيْفَ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ṯumma jaʿalnākum ḫalāʾifa fī l-ʾarḍi min baʿdihim li-nanẓura kayfa taʿmalūn.

verses.eng: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Quran other than this or change it." Say, "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, a great Day's punishment."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَاتُنَا بَيِّنَٰتٍ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا ٱئْتِ بِقُرْءَانٍ غَيْرِ هَٰذَآ أَوْ بَدِّلْهُ ۚ قُلْ مَا يَكُونُ لِىٓ أَنْ أُبَدِّلَهُۥ مِن تِلْقَآئِى نَفْسِىٓ ۖ إِنْ أَتَّبِعُ إِلَّا مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّى عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾiḏā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin qāla l-laḏīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā ʾti bi-qurʾānin ġayri hāḏā ʾaw baddilh. Qul mā yakūnu lī ʾan ʾubaddilahū min tilqāʾi nafsī. ʾIn ʾattabiʿu ʾillā mā yūḥā ʾilayya. ʾInnī ʾaḫāfu ʾin ʿaṣaytu rabbī ʿaḏāba yawmin ʿaẓīm.

verses.eng: Say, If Allah had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you. For I had stayed among you a lifetime before it. Then do you not reason?
verses.arabic: قُل لَّوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا تَلَوْتُهُۥ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَآ أَدْرَىٰكُم بِهِۦ ۖ فَقَدْ لَبِثْتُ فِيكُمْ عُمُرًا مِّن قَبْلِهِۦٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul law shā'a l-lahu mā talawtuhū ʿalaykum walā ʾadrākum bihī. Fa-qad labiṯtu fīkum ʿumuran min qablihī. ʾAfalā taʿqilūn.

verses.eng: So who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies His verses? Indeed, the criminals will not succeed.
verses.arabic: فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِـَٔايَٰتِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faman ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā l-lahi kaḏiban ʾaw kaḏḏaba biʾāyātihī. ʾInnahū lā yufliḥu l-mujrimūn.

verses.eng: And they worship other than Allah that which neither harms them nor benefits them, and they say, These are our intercessors with Allah. Say, Do you inform Allah of something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَضُرُّهُمْ وَلَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ شُفَعَٰٓؤُنَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَتُنَبِّـُٔونَ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُ فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ سُبْحَٰنَهُۥ وَتَعَٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaʿbudūna min dūni l-lahi mā lā yaḍurruhum walā yanfaʿuhum wa yaqūlūna hāʾulāʾi šufaʿāʾunā ʿinda l-lah. Qul ʾatunabbiʾūna l-laha bimā lā yaʿlamu fī s-samāwāti walā fī l-ʾarḍ. Subḥānahū wa taʿālā ʿammā yušrikūn.

verses.eng: And mankind was not but one community [united in religion], but [then] they differed. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, the matter would have been judged between them concerning that over which they differ.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ ٱلنَّاسُ إِلَّآ أُمَّةً وَٰحِدَةً فَٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ ۚ وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِّن رَّبِّكَ لَقُضِىَ بَيْنَهُمْ فِيمَا فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā kāna n-nāsu ʾillā ʾummatan wāḥidatan fa-ḫtalafū. Wa lawlā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika laquḍiya baynahum fīmā fīhi yaḫtalifūn.

verses.eng: And they say, Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord? So say, The unseen belongs only to Allah. So wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait.
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۖ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْغَيْبُ لِلَّهِ فَٱنتَظِرُوٓا۟ إِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُنتَظِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqūlūna lawlā ʾunzila ʿalayhi ʾāyatun min rabbihī. Fa-qul ʾinnamā l-ġaybu li-l-lahi fa-ntaẓirū ʾinnī maʿakum mina l-muntaẓirīn.

verses.eng: And when We give the people a taste of mercy after adversity has touched them, at once they conspire against Our verses. Say, Allah is swifter in conspiracy. Indeed, Our messengers record that which you conspire.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَآ أَذَقْنَا ٱلنَّاسَ رَحْمَةً مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ضَرَّآءَ مَسَّتْهُمْ إِذَا لَّهُم مَّكْرٌ فِىٓ ءَايَاتِنَا ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَسْرَعُ مَكْرًا ۚ إِنَّ رُسُلَنَا يَكْتُبُونَ مَا تَمْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾiḏā ʾaḏaqnā n-nāsa raḥmatan min baʿdi ḍarrāʾa massat'hum ʾiḏā lahum makrun fī ʾāyātinā. Quli l-lahu ʾasraʿu makrā. ʾInna rusulanā yaktubūna mā tamkurūn.

verses.eng: It is He who enables you to travel on land and sea until, when you are in ships and they sail with them by a favorable wind and they rejoice therein, there comes a storm wind and the waves come upon them from all sides and they assume that they are overwhelmed, they call upon Allah, sincerely offering Him their religion, If You save us from this, we will surely be among the thankful.
verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُسَيِّرُكُمْ فِى ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا كُنتُمْ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ وَجَرَيْنَ بِهِم بِرِيحٍ طَيِّبَةٍ وَفَرِحُوا۟ بِهَا جَآءَتْهَا رِيحٌ عَاصِفٌ وَجَآءَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْجُ مِن كُلِّ مَكَانٍ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ أُحِيطَ بِهِمْ ۙ دَعَوُا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ لَئِنْ أَنجَيْتَنَا مِنْ هَٰذِهِۦ لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلشَّٰكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa l-laḏī yusayyirukum fī l-barri wa l-baḥri ḥattā ʾiḏā kuntum fī l-fulki wa jarayna bihim bi-rīḥin ṭayyibatin wa fariḥū bihā jāʾat'hā rīḥun ʿāṣifun wa jāʾahumu l-mawju min kulli makānin wa ẓannū ʾannahum ʾuḥīṭa bihim daʿawū l-laha muḫliṣīna lahu d-dīna laʾin ʾanjaytanā min hāḏihī lanakūnanna mina š-šākirīn.

verses.eng: But when He saves them, at once they commit injustice upon the earth without right. O mankind, your injustice is only against yourselves, [being merely] the enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَنجَىٰهُمْ إِذَا هُمْ يَبْغُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۗ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّمَا بَغْيُكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِكُم ۖ مَّتَٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَنُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā ʾanjāhum ʾiḏā hum yabġūna fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ġayri l-ḥaqq. Yā ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾinnamā baġyukum ʿalā ʾanfusikum mataʿu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā ṯumma ʾilaynā marjiʿukum fanunabbiʾukum bimā kuntum taʿmalūn.

verses.eng: The example of [this] worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky, and the plants of the earth mingle with it, from which men and animals eat, until when the earth takes on its adornment and is beautified and its people assume that they have power over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished the day before. Thus do We detail the signs for a people who give thought.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا مَثَلُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلْأَنْعَٰمُ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ زُخْرُفَهَا وَٱزَّيَّنَتْ وَظَنَّ أَهْلُهَآ أَنَّهُمْ قَٰدِرُونَ عَلَيْهَآ أَتَىٰهَآ أَمْرُنَا لَيْلًا أَوْ نَهَارًا فَجَعَلْنَٰهَا حَصِيدًا كَأَن لَّمْ تَغْنَ بِٱلْأَمْسِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾInnamā maṯalu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā kamāʾin ʾanzalnāhu mina s-samāʾi fa-ḫtalaṭa bihī nabātu l-ʾarḍi mimmā yaʾkulu n-nāsu wa l-ʾanʿāmu ḥattā ʾiḏā ʾaḫaḏati l-ʾarḍu zuḫrufahā wa zzayyanat wa ẓanna ʾahluhā ʾannahum qādirūna ʿalayhā ʾatāhā ʾamrunā laylan ʾaw nahāran fajaʿalnāhā ḥaṣīdan kaʾan lam taġna bi-l-ʾams. Kaḏālika nufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yatafakkarūn.

verses.eng: And Allah invites to the Home of Peace and guides whom He wills to a straight path.
verses.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ يَدْعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ دَارِ ٱلسَّلَٰمِ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa l-lahu yadʿū ʾilā dāri s-salām wa yahdī man yašāʾu ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm.

verses.eng: For those who have done good is the best [reward] and extra. No darkness will cover their faces, nor humiliation. Those are companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: لِّلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ وَزِيَادَةٌ ۖ وَلَا يَرْهَقُ وُجُوهَهُمْ قَتَرٌ وَلَا ذِلَّةٌ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Li-l-laḏīna ʾaḥsanū l-ḥusnā wa ziyāda. Walā yarhaqu wujūhahum qatarun walā ḏillah. ʾUlāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati hum fīhā ḫālidūn.

verses.eng: But those who have earned [blame for] evil deeds - their recompense will be an evil deed like it, and disgrace will cover them. They will have from Allah no protector. It will be as if their faces have been covered with pieces of the night - dark [and dreadful]. Those are companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَسَبُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ جَزَآءُ سَيِّئَةٍ بِمِثْلِهَا وَتَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ مَّا لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِنْ عَاصِمٍ ۖ كَأَنَّمَآ أُغْشِيَتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ قِطَعًا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مُظْلِمًا ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa l-laḏīna kasabū s-sayyiʾāti jazāʾu sayyiʾatin bi-miṯlihā wa tarhaquhum ḏillah. Mā lahum mina l-lahi min ʿāṣim. Kaʾannamā ʾuġšiyat wujūhuhum qiṭaʿan mina l-layli muẓlimā. ʾUlāʾika ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri hum fīhā ḫālidūn.

verses.eng: And [mention] the Day when We will gather them all together; then We will say to those who associated partners [with Allah], Remain in your place, you and your associates. And We will separate them from each other, and their associates will say, It was not us that you were worshipping.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ نَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ مَكَانَكُمْ أَنتُمْ وَشُرَكَآؤُكُمْ ۚ فَزَيَّلْنَا بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ شُرَكَآؤُهُم مَّا كُنتُمْ إِيَّانَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma naḥšuruhum jamīʿan ṯumma naqūlu li-l-laḏīna ʾašrakū makānakum ʾantum wa šurakāʾukum. Fazayyalnā baynahum wa qāla šurakāʾuhum mā kuntum ʾiyyānā taʿbudūn.

verses.eng: So sufficient is Allah as a witness between us and you that we were unaware of your worship.
verses.arabic: فَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ شَهِيدًا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمْ إِن كُنَّا عَنْ عِبَادَتِكُمْ لَغَٰفِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakafā billahi shahīdan baynana wa baynakum in kunnā ʿan ʿibādatikum laġāfilīn.

verses.eng: There, every soul will be put to trial for what it did, and they will be returned to Allah, their rightful Lord, and what they used to invent will disappear from them.
verses.arabic: هُنَالِكَ تَبْلُوا۟ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّآ أَسْلَفَتْ ۚ وَرُدُّوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَوْلَىٰهُمُ ٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hunālika tablū kullu nafsin mā ʾaslafat wa ruddū ʾilā l-lahi mawlāhumu l-ḥaqqi wa ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūn.

verses.eng: Say, Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth, or who controls hearing and sight and who brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living and who arranges [all] matters? They will say, Allah. So say, Then do you not fear Him?
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أَمَّن يَمْلِكُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَٰرَ وَمَن يُخْرِجُ ٱلْحَىَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَيِّتِ وَيُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَيِّتَ مِنَ ٱلْحَىِّ وَمَن يُدَبِّرُ ٱلْأَمْرَ ۚ فَسَيَقُولُونَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ فَقُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul man yarzuqukum mina s-samāʾi wa l-ʾarḍi ʾamman yamliku s-samʿa wa l-ʾabṣāra wa man yuḫriju l-ḥayya mina l-mayyiti wa yuḫriju l-mayyita mina l-ḥayyi wa man yudabbiru l-ʾamra. Fasayaqūlūna l-lah. Fa-qul ʾafalā tattaqūn.

verses.eng: For that is Allah, your rightful Lord. So what is there after truth but misguidance? Then how are you turned away?
verses.arabic: فَذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَاذَا بَعْدَ ٱلْحَقِّ إِلَّا ٱلضَّلَٰلُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصْرَفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faḏālikumu l-lahu rabbukumu l-ḥaqq. Famāḏā baʿda l-ḥaqqi ʾillā ḍ-ḍalāl. Faʾannā tuṣrafūn.

verses.eng: Thus the word of your Lord has been justified against those who defiantly disobeyed: that they will not believe.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ حَقَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ فَسَقُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kaḏālika ḥaqqat kalimatu rabbika ʿalā l-laḏīna fasaqū ʾannahum lā yuʾminūn.

verses.eng: Say, Is there among your associate gods one who begins creation and then repeats it? Say, Allah begins creation and then repeats it, so how are you deluded?
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul hal min šurakāʾikum man yabdaʾu l-ḫalqa ṯumma yuʿīdūh. Quli l-lahu yabdaʾu l-ḫalqa ṯumma yuʿīdūh. Faʾannā tuʾfakūn.

verses.eng: Say, Is there among your associate gods one who guides to the truth? Say, Allah guides to the truth. So is He who guides to the truth more worthy to be followed or he who does not guide unless [himself] is guided? Then what is [wrong] with you - how do you judge?
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ يَهْدِى لِلْحَقِّ ۗ أَفَمَن يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلْحَقِّ أَحَقُّ أَن يُتَّبَعَ أَمَّن لَّا يَهِدِّىٓ إِلَّآ أَن يُهْدَىٰ ۖ فَمَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul hal min šurakāʾikum man yahdī ʾilā l-ḥaqq. Quli l-lahu yahdī li-l-ḥaqq. ʾAfaman yahdī ʾilā l-ḥaqqi ʾaḥaqqu ʾan yuttabaʿa ʾamman lā yahiddī ʾillā ʾan yuhdā. Famā lakum kayfa taḥkumūn.

verses.eng: And most of them follow not except assumption. Indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.
verses.arabic: وَمَا يَتَّبِعُ أَكْثَرُهُمْ إِلَّا ظَنًّا ۚ إِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ شَيْـًٔا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā yattabiʿu ʾakṯaruhum ʾillā ẓannā. ʾInna ẓ-ẓanna lā yuġnī mina l-ḥaqqi šayʾā. ʾInna l-laha ʿalīmun bimā yafʿalūn.

verses.eng: And this Quran could not have been produced by other than Allah, but [it is] a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of the [revealed] Book, about which there is no doubt, from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ هَٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانُ أَن يُفْتَرَىٰ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَٰكِن تَصْدِيقَ ٱلَّذِى بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَتَفْصِيلَ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ مِن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā kāna hāḏā l-qurʾānu ʾan yuftarā min dūni l-lahi walākin taṣdīqa l-laḏī bayna yadayhi wa tafṣīla l-kitābi lā rayba fīhi min rabbi l-ʿālamīn.

verses.eng: Or do they say [about the Prophet], He has invented it? Say, Then bring a surah like it and call upon whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful.
verses.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ ۚ قُلْ فَأْتُوا۟ بِسُورَةٍ مِّثْلِهِۦ وَٱدْعُوا۟ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: ʾAm yaqūlūna ftarāh. Qul faʾtū bi-sūratin miṯlihī wa dʿū mani staṭaʿtum min dūni l-lahi ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīn.

verses.eng: Rather, they have denied that whose knowledge they could not encompass, and its interpretation has not yet come to them. Thus did those before them deny. So observe how was the end of the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِمَا لَمْ يُحِيطُوا۟ بِعِلْمِهِۦ وَلَمَّا يَأْتِهِمْ تَأْوِيلُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Bal kaḏḏabū bimā lam yuḥīṭū biʿilmihī wa lammā yaʾtihim taʾwīluh. Kaḏālika kaḏḏaba l-laḏīna min qablihim. Fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu ẓ-ẓālimīn.

verses.eng: And among them are those who believe in it, and among them are those who do not believe in it. And your Lord is most knowing of the corrupters.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يُؤْمِنُ بِهِۦ وَمِنْهُم مَّن لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِهِۦ ۚ وَرَبُّكَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waminhum man yuʾminu bihī waminhum man lā yuʾminu bih. Wa rabbuka ʾaʿlamu bi-l-mufsidīn.

verses.eng: And if they deny you, [say], For me is my deed, and for you is your deed. You are disassociated from what I do, and I am disassociated from what you do.
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَذَّبُوكَ فَقُل لِّى عَمَلِى وَلَكُمْ عَمَلُكُمْ ۖ أَنتُم بَرِيٓـُٔونَ مِّمَّآ أَعْمَلُ وَأَنَا۠ بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾin kaḏḏabūka fa-qul lī ʿamalī walakum ʿamalukum ʾantum barīʾūna mimmā ʾaʿmalu waʾanā barīʾun mimmā taʿmalūn.

verses.eng: And among them are those who listen to you. But can you cause the deaf to hear, even if they will not use reason?
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَسْتَمِعُونَ إِلَيْكَ ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ وَلَوْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waminhum man yastamiʿūna ʾilayk. ʾAfaʾanta tusmiʿu ṣ-ṣumma wa law kānū lā yaʿqilūn.

verses.eng: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind, even if they will not [see]?
verses.arabic: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَنظُرُ إِلَيْكَ ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تَهْدِى ٱلْعُمْىَ وَلَوْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waminhum man yanẓuru ʾilayk. ʾAfaʾanta tahdī l-ʿumya wa law kānū lā yubṣirūn.

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who wrong themselves.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَظْلِمُ ٱلنَّاسَ شَيْـًٔا وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna l-laha lā yaẓlimu n-nāsa shay'an walākinna n-nāsa anfusahum yaẓlimūn.

verses.eng: And on the Day when He will gather them, [it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day. They will recognize one another. Those will have lost who denied the meeting with Allah and were not guided.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ كَأَن لَّمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا سَاعَةً مِّنَ ٱلنَّهَارِ يَتَعَارَفُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ قَدْ خَسِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِلِقَآءِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُهْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma yaḥshuruhum ka'an lam yalbaṯū illā sāʿatan mina n-nahāri yataʿārafūna baynahum qad ḫasira l-laḏīna kaḏḏabū biliqāʾi l-lahi wamā kānū muhtadīn.

verses.eng: And whether We show you some of what We promise them or We take you in death, still to Us is their return. Then, Allah is witness over what they do.
verses.arabic: وَإِمَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ ثُمَّ ٱللَّهُ شَهِيدٌ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa'immā nuriyannaka baʿḍa l-laḏī naʿiduhum ʾaw natawaffayannaka fa'ilaynā marjiʿuhum ṯumma l-lahu shahīdun ʿalā mā yafʿalūn.

verses.eng: And for every nation is a messenger. So when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged.
verses.arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَّسُولٌ ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ رَسُولُهُمْ قُضِىَ بَيْنَهُم بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walikulli ʾummatin rasūl fa'iḏā jāʾa rasūluhum quḍiya baynahum bi-l-qisṭi wahum lā yuẓlamūn.

verses.eng: And they say, 'When will this promise [of punishment] be, if you should be truthful?'
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqūlūna matā hāḏā l-waʿdu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīn.

verses.eng: Say, 'I possess no power for harm or benefit to myself except what Allah wills. For every nation is a [limited] term. When their term comes, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].'
verses.arabic: قُل لَّآ أَمْلِكُ لِأَنفُسِى ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۚ إِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ سَاعَةً وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul lā ʾamliku li'anfusī ḍarran walā nafʿan ʾillā mā shāʾa l-lah li-kulli ʾummatin ʾajal ʾiḏā jāʾa ʾajaluhum falā yastaʾḫirūna sāʿatan walā yastaqdimūn.

verses.eng: Say, 'Have you considered: if His punishment should come to you by night or by day - for what [portion] of it would the criminals be impatient?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَتَىٰكُمْ عَذَابُهُۥ بَيَٰتًا أَوْ نَهَارًا مَّاذَا يَسْتَعْجِلُ مِنْهُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ʾaraʾaytum ʾin ʾatākum ʿaḏābuhū bayātan ʾaw nahāran māḏā yastaʿjilu minhu l-mujrimūn.

verses.eng: Then is it after it has occurred that you will believe in it? Now? But you were [all along] hastening it!
verses.arabic: أَثُمَّ إِذَا مَا وَقَعَ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦٓ ۚ ءَآلْـَٰٔنَ وَقَدْ كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾAṯumma ʾiḏā mā waqaʿa ʾāmantum bihī ʾālʾāna wa qad kuntum bihī tastaʿjilūn.

verses.eng: Then it will be said to those who wronged, 'Taste the punishment of eternity; are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?'
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ قِيلَ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلْخُلْدِ ۖ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ṯumma qīla li-l-laḏīna ẓalamū ḏūqū ʿaḏāba l-ḫuld hal tujzawna ʾillā bimā kuntum taksibūn.

verses.eng: And they ask you to hasten the punishment. Say, 'My Lord is more knowing of its time. None will manifest it except Him.'
verses.arabic: وَيَسْتَنۢبِـُٔونَكَ أَحَقٌّ هُوَ ۖ قُلْ إِى وَرَبِّىٓ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yastanbiʾūnaka ʾaḥaqqun huwa qul ʾī wa rabbī ʾinnahū laḥaqqun wamā ʾantum bi-muʿjizīn.

verses.eng: And if every soul that has wronged had all that is in the earth, it would offer it in ransom. And they will conceal [their] regret when they see the punishment, and they will be judged in justice, and they will not be wronged.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ لِكُلِّ نَفْسٍ ظَلَمَتْ مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لَٱفْتَدَتْ بِهِۦ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّدَامَةَ لَمَّا رَأَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۖ وَقُضِىَ بَيْنَهُم بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۚ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law ʾanna likulli nafsin ẓalamat mā fī l-ʾarḍi la-ftadat bihī wa ʾasarrū n-nadāmata lammā raʾawū l-ʿaḏāba wa quḍiya baynahum bi-l-qisṭi wahum lā yuẓlamūn.

verses.eng: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Unquestionably, the promise of Allah is truth; but most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾAlā ʾinna li-l-lahi mā fī s-samāwāti wa l-ʾarḍ ʾalā ʾinna waʿda l-lahi ḥaqqun walākinna ʾakṯarahum lā yaʿlamūn.

verses.eng: He gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned.
verses.arabic: هُوَ يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa yuḥyī wa yumītu wa ʾilayhi turjaʿūn.

verses.eng: O mankind, there has come to you [from Allah] an admonition and a healing for that which is in the breasts and a guidance and mercy for the believers.
verses.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ قَدْ جَآءَتْكُم مَّوْعِظَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَشِفَآءٌ لِّمَا فِى ٱلصُّدُورِ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ʾayyuhā n-nāsu qad jāʾatkum mawʿiẓatun min rabbikum wa shifāʾun limā fī ṣ-ṣudūri wa hudan wa raḥmatun li-l-muʾminīn.

verses.eng: Say, 'In the bounty of Allah and in His mercy - in that let them rejoice; it is better than what they accumulate.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ بِفَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَبِرَحْمَتِهِۦ فَبِذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَفْرَحُوا۟ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul bi-faḍli l-lahi wa bi-raḥmatihī fabiḏālika falyafraḥū huwa ḫayrun mimmā yajmaʿūn.

verses.eng: Say, 'Have you seen what Allah has sent down to you of provision of which you have made [some] lawful and [some] unlawful?' Say, 'Has Allah permitted you [to do so], or have you invented [something] about Allah?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ فَجَعَلْتُم مِّنْهُ حَرَامًا وَحَلَٰلًا قُلْ ءَآللَّهُ أَذِنَ لَكُمْ ۖ أَمْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum mā anzala l-lahu lakum min rizqin fajaʿaltum min'hu ḥarāman waḥalālā. Qul āl-lahu aḏina lakum am ʿalā l-lahi taftarūn.

verses.eng: And what will be the supposition of those who invent falsehood about Allah on the Day of Resurrection? Indeed, Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of them are not grateful.
verses.arabic: وَمَا ظَنُّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā ẓannu l-laḏīna yaftarūna ʿalā l-lahi l-kaḏiba yawma l-qiyāmah. Inna l-laha laḏū faḍlin ʿalā n-nāsi walākinna ʾakṯarahum lā yaškurūn.

verses.eng: And you are not [engaged] in any matter or recite any part of the Quran or do any deed except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it. And there is not removed from your Lord [even] an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven, nor [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is [written] in a clear record.
verses.arabic: وَمَا تَكُونُ فِى شَأْنٍ وَمَا تَتْلُوا۟ مِنْهُ مِن قُرْءَانٍ وَلَا تَعْمَلُونَ مِنْ عَمَلٍ إِلَّا كُنَّا عَلَيْكُمْ شُهُودًا إِذْ تُفِيضُونَ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَا يَعْزُبُ عَن رَّبِّكَ مِن مِّثْقَالِ ذَرَّةٍ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَلَآ أَصْغَرَ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكْبَرَ إِلَّا فِى كِتَٰبٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wamā takūnu fī shaʾnin wamā تتلوا min'hu min qur'ānin walā taʿmalūna min ʿamalin illā kunnā ʿalaykum shuhūdan iḏ tufīḍūna fīh. Wamā yaʿzubu ʿan rabbika min miṯqāli ḏarratin fī l-ʾarḍi walā fī s-samāʾi walā ʾaṣġara min ḏālika walā ʾakbara illā fī kitābin mubīn.

verses.eng: Unquestionably, [for] the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
verses.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّ أَوْلِيَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾAlā ʾinna ʾawliyāʾa l-lahi lā ḫawfun ʿalayhim walā hum yaḥzanūn.

verses.eng: Those who believed and were fearing Allah.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Al-laḏīna ʾāmanū wa kānū yattaqūn.

verses.eng: For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. No change is there in the words of Allah. That is the great success.
verses.arabic: لَهُمُ ٱلْبُشْرَىٰ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ لَا تَبْدِيلَ لِكَلِمَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Lahumu l-bušrā fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa fī l-ʾāḫirah. Lā tabdīla likalimāti l-lah. Ḏālika huwa l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīm.

verses.eng: And do not be grieved, [O Muhammad], by their speech. Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs to Allah entirely. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّ ٱلْعِزَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًا ۚ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Walā yaḥzunka qawluhum. Inna l-ʿizzata li-l-lahi jamīʿā. Huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīm.

verses.eng: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth. And those who invoke other than Allah do not follow [true] associates. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
verses.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَمَا يَتَّبِعُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَخْرُصُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʾAlā ʾinna li-l-lahi man fī s-samāwāti waman fī l-ʾarḍ. Wamā yattabiʿu l-laḏīna yadʿūna min dūni l-lahi šurakāʾ. ʾIn yattabiʿūna ʾillā ẓ-ẓanna waʾin hum ʾillā yaḫruṣūn.

verses.eng: It is He who made for you the night to rest therein and the day, giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِتَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa l-laḏī jaʿala lakumu l-layla litaskunū fīhi wa n-nahāra mubṣirā. Inna fī ḏālika laʾāyātin li-qawmin yasmaʿūn.

verses.eng: They say, 'Allah has taken a son.' Exalted is He! He is the [self-] sufficient. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. No evidence do you have for this [claim]. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبْحَٰنَهُۥ ۖ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ۖ لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنْ عِندَكُم مِّن سُلْطَٰنٍ بِهَٰذَآ ۚ أَتَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū ttaḫaḏa l-lahu waladā. Subḥānahū huwa l-ġanīy. Lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wamā fī l-ʾarḍ. In ʿindakum min sulṭānin bihāḏā. ʾAtaqūlūna ʿalā l-lahi mā lā taʿlamūn.

verses.eng: Say, 'Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ لَا يُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul inna l-laḏīna yaftarūna ʿalā l-lahi l-kaḏiba lā yufliḥūn.

verses.eng: [It is but] enjoyment in this world; then to Us is their return, and We will make them taste the severe punishment because of what they used to deny.
verses.arabic: مَتَٰعٌ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ ثُمَّ نُذِيقُهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلشَّدِيدَ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Matāʿun fī d-dunyā ṯumma ʾilaynā marjiʿuhum ṯumma nuḏīquhumu l-ʿaḏāba š-šadīda bimā kānū yakfurūn.

verses.eng: And recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, 'O my people, if my residence and my reminding [you] of the signs of Allah has become burdensome upon you - then upon Allah I have relied. So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.'
verses.arabic: وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ نُوحٍ إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَٰقَوْمِ إِن كَانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيْكُم مَّقَامِى وَتَذْكِيرِى بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ فَأَجْمِعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَكُمْ وَشُرَكَآءَكُمْ ثُمَّ لَا يَكُنْ أَمْرُكُمْ عَلَيْكُمْ غُمَّةً ثُمَّ ٱقْضُوٓا۟ إِلَىَّ وَلَا تُنظِرُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-otlu ʿalayhim nabaʾa nūḥin iḏ qāla liqawmihī yā qawmi in kāna kabura ʿalaykum maqāmī wa taḏkīrī biʾāyāti l-lahi faʿalā l-lahi tawakkaltu faʾajmiʿū ʾamrakum wa šurakāʾakum ṯumma lā yakun ʾamrukum ʿalaykum ġummatan ṯumma oqḍū ʾilayya walā tunẓirūn.

verses.eng: And if you turn away [from my counsel], then [know that] I have not asked you for [any] payment. My payment is only from Allah, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims [those who submit to Allah].'
verses.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّيْتُمْ فَمَا سَأَلْتُكُم مِّنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faʾin tawallaytum famā saʾaltukum min ʾajrin in ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā l-lahi waʾumirtu ʾan ʾakūna mina l-muslimīn.

verses.eng: But they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ark, and We made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.
verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَنَجَّيْنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ وَجَعَلْنَٰهُمْ خَلَٰٓئِفَ وَأَغْرَقْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakaḏḏabūhu fanajjaynāhu waman maʿahū fī l-fulki wa jaʿalnāhum ḫalāʾifa waʾaġraqnā l-laḏīna kaḏḏabū biʾāyātinā fa-onẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-munḏarīn.

verses.eng: Then after him We sent messengers to their peoples, and they brought them clear proofs. But they would not believe what they had denied before. Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِن بَعْدِهِۦ رُسُلًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِمْ فَجَآءُوهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَٰتِ فَمَا كَانُوا۟ لِيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِمَا كَذَّبُوا۟ بِهِۦ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَطْبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُعْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ba'athnā mim ba'dihi rusulan ilā qawmihim fajā'ūhum bilbayyināti famā kānū liyu'minū bimā kadh-dhabū bihi min qabl; kadhālika natba'u 'alā qulūbil-mu'tadīn

verses.eng: Then after them We sent Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs, but they acted arrogantly, and they were a criminal people.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِن بَعْدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِيْهِۦ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا مُّجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ba'athnā mim ba'dihim mūsā wahārūna ilā fir'awna wamala'ihi bi'āyātinā fastakbarū wakānū qawmam mujrimīn

verses.eng: So when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “Indeed, this is clear magic.”
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jā'ahumul-haqqu min 'indinā qālū inna hādhā lasihrum mubīn

verses.eng: Moses said, “Do you say [this] about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But magicians will not succeed.”
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَتَقُولُونَ لِلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَكُمْ ۖ أَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا وَلَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلسَّٰحِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ataqūlūna lilhaqqi lammā jā'akum ۖ asihrun hādhā walā yuflihus-sāhirūn

verses.eng: They said, “Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have greatness in the land? And we are not believers in you.”
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتَلْفِتَنَا عَمَّا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهِ ءَابَآءَنَا وَتَكُونَ لَكُمَا ٱلْكِبْرِيَآءُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا نَحْنُ لَكُمَا بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū aji'tanā litalfitanā 'ammā wajadnā 'alayhi ābā'anā watakūna lakumal-kibriyā'u fil-arḍi wamā nahnu lakumā bimu'minīn

verses.eng: And Pharaoh said, “Bring me every skillful magician.”
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱئْتُونِى بِكُلِّ سَٰحِرٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Waqāla fir'awnu i'tūnī bikulli sāhirin 'alīm

verses.eng: And when the magicians came, Moses said to them, “Throw down what you will throw.”
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jā'as-saharatu qāla lahum mūsā alqū mā antum mulqūn

verses.eng: And when they had thrown, Moses said, “What you have brought is [mere] magic. Indeed, Allah will expose it. Indeed, Allah does not amend the work of corrupters.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَلْقَوْا۟ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ مَا جِئْتُم بِهِ ٱلسِّحْرُ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَيُبْطِلُهُۥٓ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُصْلِحُ عَمَلَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā alqaw qāla mūsā mā ji'tum bihis-sihru innallāha sayubtiluhū ۖ innallāha lā yuslihu 'amalal-mufsidīn

verses.eng: And Allah will establish the truth by His words, even if the criminals dislike it.
verses.arabic: وَيُحِقُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحَقَّ بِكَلِمَٰتِهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayuhiqqu l-lāhu l-haqqa bikalimātihi walaw karihal-mujrimūn

verses.eng: But none believed Moses except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his chiefs that they would afflict them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty in the land; and indeed, he was of the transgressors.
verses.arabic: فَمَآ ءَامَنَ لِمُوسَىٰٓ إِلَّا ذُرِّيَّةٌ مِّن قَوْمِهِۦ عَلَىٰ خَوْفٍ مِّن فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِيْهِمْ أَن يَفْتِنَهُمْ ۗ وَإِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ لَعَالٍ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Famā āmana limūsā illā dhurriyyatum min qawmihī 'alā khawfim min fir'awna wamala'ihim ay yaftinahum ۗ wa-inna fir'awna la'ālin fī l-arḍi wa-innahu lamin al-musrifīn

verses.eng: And Moses said, “O my people, if you have believed in Allah, then rely upon Him, if you are Muslims.”
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ يَٰقَوْمِ إِن كُنتُمْ ءَامَنتُم بِٱللَّهِ فَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلُوٓا۟ إِن كُنتُم مُّسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqāla mūsā yā qawmi in kuntum āmantum billāhi fa'alayhi tawakkalū in kuntum muslimīn

verses.eng: So they said, “Upon Allah we have relied. Our Lord, do not make us [fitnah] for the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: فَقَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faqālū 'alallāhi tawakkalnā rabbanā lā taj'alnā fitnatal lilqawmiẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.”
verses.arabic: وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanajjinā biraḥmatika mina l-qawmi l-kāfirīn

verses.eng: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, “Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [places of] worship and establish prayer. And give good tidings to the believers.”
verses.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَأَخِيهِ أَن تَبَوَّءَا لِقَوْمِكُمَا بِمِصْرَ بُيُوتًا وَٱجْعَلُوا۟ بُيُوتَكُمْ قِبْلَةً وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā wa-akhīhi an tabawwa'ā liqawmikumā bimiṣra buyūtaw waj'alū buyūtakum qiblatan wa-aqīmū ṣ-ṣalāh; wabashshiri l-mu'minīn

verses.eng: And Moses said, “Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his chiefs adornment and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may turn [people] away from Your way. Our Lord, destroy their wealth and harden their hearts so they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.”
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ ءَاتَيْتَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَأَهُۥ زِينَةً وَأَمْوَٰلًا فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا رَبَّنَا لِيُضِلُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِكَ ۖ رَبَّنَا ٱطْمِسْ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ وَٱشْدُدْ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَلَا يُؤْمِنُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Waqāla mūsā rabbanā innaka ātayta fir'awna wamala'ahū zīnataw wa-amwālan fī l-ḥayati d-dunyā rabbanā liyuḍillū 'an sabīlika rabbana ṭmis 'alā amwālihim washdud 'alā qulūbihim falā yu'minū ḥattā yarawū l-'adhāba l-alīm

verses.eng: [Allah] said, “Your supplication has been answered, so remain straight. And do not follow the way of those who do not know.”
verses.arabic: قَالَ قَدْ أُجِيبَت دَّعْوَتُكُمَا فَٱسْتَقِيمَا وَلَا تَتَّبِعَآنِّ سَبِيلَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla qad ujībatu da'watukumā fastaqīmā walā tattabi'ānni sabīla alladhīna lā ya'lamūn

verses.eng: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; so Pharaoh and his hosts pursued them in outrage and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, “I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims.”
verses.arabic: وَجَٰوَزْنَا بِبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ بَغْيًۭا وَعَدْوًا ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَدْرَكَهُ ٱلْغَرَقُ قَالَ ءَامَنتُ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِىٓ ءَامَنَتْ بِهِۦ بَنُوٓا۟ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wajāwaznā bibanī is'rā'īla l-baḥra fa-atba'ahum fir'awnu wajunūduhu baghyan wa'adwan ۖ ḥattā idhā adrakahu l-gharaqu qāla āmantu annahu lā ilāha illā alladhī āmanat bihi banū is'rā'īla wa-anā mina l-muslimīn

verses.eng: Now? And you disobeyed before and you were of the corrupters?
verses.arabic: ءَٰلْـَٰٔنَ وَقَدْ عَصَيْتَ قَبْلُ وَكُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Āl'āna waqad 'aṣayta qablu wakunta mina l-mufsidīn

verses.eng: So today We will save you in body that you may be a sign to those after you. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless.
verses.arabic: فَٱلْيَوْمَ نُنَجِّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكُونَ لِمَنْ خَلْفَكَ ءَايَةً ۚ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ عَنْ ءَايَٰتِنَا لَغَٰفِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falyawma nunajjīka bibadanika litakūna liman khalfaka āyah; wa-inna kathīran mina n-nāsi 'an āyātinā laghāfilūn

verses.eng: And We had settled the Children of Israel in an agreeable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until after knowledge came to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they used to differ.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ بَوَّأْنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ مُبَوَّأَ صِدْقٍۢ وَرَزَقْنَٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَٰتِ فَمَا ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعِلْمُ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad bawwa'nā banī is'rā'īla mubawwa'a ṣidqin warazaqnāhum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti famā ikhtalafū ḥattā jā'ahumu l-'ilm; inna rabbaka yaqḍī baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati fīmā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūn

verses.eng: So if you are in doubt, [O, Muhammad], about that which We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.
verses.arabic: فَإِن كُنتَ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّمَّآ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ فَسْـَٔلِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَقْرَءُونَ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبْلِكَ ۚ لَقَدْ جَآءَكَ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُمْتَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in kunta fī shakkin mimmā anzalnā ilayka fas'ali alladhīna yaqra'ūna l-kitāba min qablik; laqad jā'aka l-haqqu min rabbika falā takūnanna mina l-mum'tarīn

verses.eng: And never be of those who deny the signs of Allah lest you be among the losers.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walā takūnanna mina alladhīna kadhdhabū bi'āyāti l-lahi fatakūna mina l-khāsirīn

verses.eng: Indeed, those upon whom the word of your Lord has been justified will not believe
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ حَقَّتْ عَلَيْهِمْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna ḥaqqat 'alayhim kalimatu rabbika lā yu'minūn

verses.eng: Even if every sign should come to them until they see the painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ جَآءَتْهُمْ كُلُّ ءَايَةٍ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw jā'at'hum kullu āyatin ḥattā yarawū l-'adhāba l-alīm

verses.eng: Then has there not been for a city that believed and benefited it its belief except the people of Jonah? When they believed We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment for a time.
verses.arabic: فَلَوْلَا كَانَتْ قَرْيَةٌ ءَامَنَتْ فَنَفَعَهَآ إِيمَٰنُهَآ إِلَّا قَوْمَ يُونُسَ لَمَّآ ءَامَنُوا۟ كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْخِزْىِ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمَتَّعْنَٰهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Falawlā kānat qaryatun āmanat fanafa'ahā īmānuhā illā qawma yūnusa lammā āmanū kashafnā 'anhum 'adhāba l-khiz'yi fī l-ḥayati d-dunyā wamatta'nāhum ilā ḥīn

verses.eng: And if your Lord had willed, those on earth would have believed - all of them entirely. So, [O, Muhammad], would you compel the people until they become believers?
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ شَآءَ رَبُّكَ لَـَٔامَنَ مَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ كُلُّهُمْ جَمِيعًا ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُكْرِهُ ٱلنَّاسَ حَتَّىٰ يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw shā'a rabbuka la'āmana man fī l-arḍi kulluhum jamī'ā; afa-anta tukrihu n-nāsa ḥattā yakūnū mu'minīn

verses.eng: And it is not for a soul to believe except by permission of Allah. And He will place defilement upon those who will not use reason.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفْسٍ أَن تُؤْمِنَ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَيَجْعَلُ ٱلرِّجْسَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā kāna linafsin an tu'mina illā bi-idh'ni l-lahi ۚ wayaj'alu r-rij'sa 'alā alladhīna lā ya'qilūn

verses.eng: Say, “Look at what is in the heavens and earth.” But signs and warners do not avail a people who do not believe.
verses.arabic: قُلِ ٱنظُرُوا۟ مَاذَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَا تُغْنِى ٱلْـَٔايَٰتُ وَٱلنُّذُرُ عَن قَوْمٍۢ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Quli unẓurū mādhā fī s-samāwāti wal-arḍ; wamā tugh'nī l-āyātu wa-n-nudhuru 'an qawmin lā yu'minūn

verses.eng: Then do they wait except for days like the days of those who passed on before them? Say, “Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait.”
verses.arabic: فَهَلْ يَنتَظِرُونَ إِلَّا مِثْلَ أَيَّامِ ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوْا۟ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ فَٱنتَظِرُوٓا۟ إِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُنتَظِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fahal yantaẓirūna illā mith'la ayyāmi alladhīna khalaw min qablihim; qul fa-intaẓirū innī ma'akum mina l-muntaẓirīn

verses.eng: Then We will save Our messengers and those who have believed with them. Thus, it is due upon Us that We save the believers.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّى رُسُلَنَا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ حَقًّا عَلَيْنَا نُنجِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma nunajjī rusulanā wa-alladhīna āmanū; kadhālika ḥaqqan 'alaynā nunji l-mu'minīn

verses.eng: Say, [O, Muhammad], “O people, if you are in doubt about my religion - then I do not worship those which you worship besides Allah; but I worship Allah, who causes your death. And I have been commanded to be of the believers.”
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِن كُنتُمْ فِى شَكٍّ مِّن دِينِى فَلَآ أَعْبُدُ ٱلَّذِينَ تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَٰكِنْ أَعْبُدُ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِى يَتَوَفَّىٰكُمْ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul yāayyuhā n-nāsu in kuntum fī shakkin min dīnī falā a'budu alladhīna ta'budūna min dūni l-lahi walākin a'budu l-laha alladhī yatawaffākum ۖ wa-umir'tu an akūna mina l-mu'minīn

verses.eng: And [I have been commanded], “Direct your face toward the correct religion as a hanif, and never be of those who associate others with Allah.”
verses.arabic: وَأَنْ أَقِمْ وَجْهَكَ لِلدِّينِ حَنِيفًا ۖ وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-an aqim wajhaka lid-dīni ḥanīfā; walā takūnanna mina l-mushrikīn

verses.eng: And do not invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed, you would be of the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَدْعُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكَ وَلَا يَضُرُّكَ ۖ فَإِن فَعَلْتَ فَإِنَّكَ إِذًا مِّنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walā tad'u min dūni l-lahi mā lā yanfa'uka walā yaḍurruka ۖ fa-in fa'alta fa-innaka idhan mina ẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover for it except Him; and if He intends for you good, there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِن يَمْسَسْكَ ٱللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ فَلَا كَاشِفَ لَهُۥٓ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ وَإِن يُرِدْكَ بِخَيْرٍ فَلَا رَآدَّ لِفَضْلِهِۦ ۚ يُصِيبُ بِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yamsas'ka l-lahu biḍurrin falā kāshifa lahū illā huwa ۖ wa-in yurid'ka bikhayrin falā rādda lifaḍlih; yuṣību bihi man yashā'u min 'ibādih; wahuwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīm

verses.eng: Say, “O people, the truth has come to you from your Lord. So whoever is guided is guided only for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And I am not over you a manager.”
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ قَدْ جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُّ عَلَيْهَا ۖ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ عَلَيْكُم بِوَكِيلٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Qul yāayyuhā n-nāsu qad jā'akumu l-haqqu min rabbikum ۖ famani ihtadā fa-innamā yahtadī linafsih; waman ḍalla fa-innamā yaḍillu 'alayhā ۖ wamā anā 'alaykum biwakīl

verses.eng: And follow what is revealed to you, [O, Muhammad], and be patient until Allah judges. And He is the best of judges.
verses.arabic: وَٱتَّبِعْ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ وَٱصْبِرْ حَتَّىٰ يَحْكُمَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلْحَٰكِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ittabi' mā yūḥā ilayka waṣbir ḥattā yaḥkuma l-lah; wahuwa khayru l-ḥākimīn

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Acquainted.
verses.arabic: الر ۚ كِتَابٌ أُحْكِمَتْ آيَاتُهُ ثُمَّ فُصِّلَتْ مِنْ لَدُنْ حَكِيمٍ خَبِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Ra. Kitabun uhkimat ayatuhu thumma fussilat min ladun hakeemin khabeer.

verses.eng: [Through a messenger, saying], "Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings,'
verses.arabic: أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّنِي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ وَبَشِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Alla ta'budoo illa Allaha innanee lakum minhu natheerun wabasheer.

verses.eng: And [saying], 'Seek forgiveness of your Lord and repent to Him, [and] He will let you enjoy a good provision for a specified term and give every doer of favor his favor. But if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.
verses.arabic: وَأَنِ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ ثُمَّ تُوبُوا إِلَيْهِ يُمَتِّعْكُمْ مَتَاعًا حَسَنًا إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى وَيُؤْتِ كُلَّ ذِي فَضْلٍ فَضْلَهُ ۖ وَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ كَبِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Waani istaghfiroo rabbakum thumma tooboo ilayhi yumatti'kum mataa'an hasanan ila ajalin musamman wayu'ti kulla thee fadlin fadlahu wa-in tawallaw fa-innee akhafu 'alaykum 'athaba yawmin kabeer.

verses.eng: To Allah is your return, and He is over all things competent."
verses.arabic: إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرْجِعُكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Ila Allahi marji'ukum wahuwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadeer.

verses.eng: Unquestionably, they the disbelievers turn away their breasts to hide from Him. Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
verses.arabic: أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ يَثْنُونَ صُدُورَهُمْ لِيَسْتَخْفُوا مِنْهُ ۚ أَلَا حِينَ يَسْتَغْشُونَ ثِيَابَهُمْ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
verses.transliteration: Ala innahum yathnoona sudoorahum liyastakhfoo minhu ala heena yastaghshoona thiyabahum ya'lamu ma yusirroona wama yu'linoona innahu 'aleemun bithati assudoor.

verses.eng: And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.
verses.arabic: وَمَا مِنْ دَابَّةٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا عَلَى اللَّهِ رِزْقُهَا وَيَعْلَمُ مُسْتَقَرَّهَا وَمُسْتَوْدَعَهَا ۚ كُلٌّ فِي كِتَابٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wama min dabbatin fee al-ardi illa 'ala Allahi rizquha waya'lamu mustaqarraha wamustawda'aha kullun fee kitabin mubeen.

verses.eng: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne had been upon water - that He might test you as to which of you is best in deed. But if you say, "Indeed, you are resurrected after death," those who disbelieve will surely say, "This is not but obvious magic."
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَكَانَ عَرْشُهُ عَلَى الْمَاءِ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۗ وَلَئِنْ قُلْتَ إِنَّكُمْ مَبْعُوثُونَ مِنْ بَعْدِ الْمَوْتِ لَيَقُولَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee khalaqa assamawati wal-arda fee sittati ayyamin wakana 'arshuhu 'ala almai liyabluwakum ayyukum ahsanu 'amalan wala-in qulta innakum mab'oothoona min ba'di almawti layaqoolanna allatheena kafaroo in hatha illa sihrun mubeen.

verses.eng: And if We hold back from them the punishment for a limited time, they will surely say, "What detains it?" Unquestionably, on the Day it comes to them, it will not be averted from them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَخَّرْنَا عَنْهُمُ الْعَذَابَ إِلَىٰ أُمَّةٍ مَعْدُودَةٍ لَيَقُولُنَّ مَا يَحْبِسُهُ ۗ أَلَا يَوْمَ يَأْتِيهِمْ لَيْسَ مَصْرُوفًا عَنْهُمْ وَحَاقَ بِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wala-in akhkharna 'anhumu al'athaba ila ummatin ma'doodatin layaqoolunna ma yahbisuhu ala yawma ya'teehim laysa masroofan 'anhum wahaqa bihim ma kanoo bihi yastahzi'oon.

verses.eng: And if We give man a taste of mercy from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَذَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنَّا رَحْمَةً ثُمَّ نَزَعْنَاهَا مِنْهُ إِنَّهُ لَيَئُوسٌ كَفُورٌ
verses.transliteration: Wala-in athaqna al-insana minna rahmatan thumma naza'naha minhu innahu laya'oosun kafoor.

verses.eng: But if We give him a taste of favor after hardship has touched him, he will surely say, "The evils have departed from me." Indeed, he is exultant and boastful -
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَذَقْنَاهُ نَعْمَاءَ بَعْدَ ضَرَّاءَ مَسَّتْهُ لَيَقُولَنَّ ذَهَبَ السَّيِّئَاتُ عَنِّي ۚ إِنَّهُ لَفَرِحٌ فَخُورٌ
verses.transliteration: Wala-in athaqnahu na'ma'a ba'da darra'a massathu layaqoolanna thahabat assayyi'atu 'annee innahu lafareehun fakoor.

verses.eng: Except for those who are patient and do righteous deeds. Those will have forgiveness and great reward.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Illa allatheena sabaroo wa'amiloo assalihati ola-ika lahum maghfiratun waajrun kabeer.

verses.eng: Then would you possibly leave [out] some of what is revealed to you, or is your breast constrained by it because they say, "Why has there not been sent down to him a treasure or come with him an angel?" But you are only a warner. And Allah is Disposer of all things.
verses.arabic: فَلَعَلَّكَ تَارِكٌ بَعْضَ مَا يُوحَىٰ إِلَيْكَ وَضَائِقٌ بِهِ صَدْرُكَ أَنْ يَقُولُوا لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْهِ كَنْزٌ أَوْ جَاءَ مَعَهُ مَلَكٌ ۚ إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ نَذِيرٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَكِيلٌ
verses.transliteration: Fala'allaka tarikun ba'da ma yooha ilayka wada-iqun bihi sadruka an yaqooloo lawla unzila 'alayhi kanzun aw ja'a ma'ahu malakun innama anta natheerun wallahu 'ala kulli shay'in wakeel.

verses.eng: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Say, "Then bring ten surahs like it that have been invented and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful."
verses.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ افْتَرَاهُ ۖ قُلْ فَأْتُوا بِعَشْرِ سُوَرٍ مِثْلِهِ مُفْتَرَيَاتٍ وَادْعُوا مَنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Am yaqooloona iftarahu qul fa'too bi'ashri suwarin mithlihi muftarayatin wad'oo mani istata'tum min dooni Allahi in kuntum sadiqeen.

verses.eng: And if they do not respond to you - then know that it was sent down with the knowledge of Allah and that there is no deity except Him. Then, would you [not] be Muslims?
verses.arabic: فَإِلَّمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا لَكُمْ فَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّمَا أُنْزِلَ بِعِلْمِ اللَّهِ وَأَنْ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنْتُمْ مُسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-illam yastajeeboo lakum fa'lamoo annama unzila bi'ilmi Allahi wa-an la ilaha illa huwa fahal antum muslimoon.

verses.eng: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and they therein will not be deprived.
verses.arabic: مَنْ كَانَ يُرِيدُ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتَهَا نُوَفِّ إِلَيْهِمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فِيهَا وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يُبْخَسُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man kana yureedu alhayata addunya wazeenataha nuwaffi ilayhim a'malahum feeha wahum feeha la yubkhasoon.

verses.eng: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire. And lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.
verses.arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ إِلَّا النَّارُ ۖ وَحَبِطَ مَا صَنَعُوا فِيهَا وَبَاطِلٌ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ola-ika allatheena laysa lahum fee al-akhirati illa annaru wahabita ma sana'oo feeha wabatilun ma kanoo ya'maloon.

verses.eng: So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]? And a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy. Those [believers in the former revelations] will believe in it. But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions - the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.
verses.arabic: أَفَمَنْ كَانَ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِ وَيَتْلُوهُ شَاهِدٌ مِنْهُ وَمِنْ قَبْلِهِ كِتَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِمَامًا وَرَحْمَةً ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَكْفُرْ بِهِ مِنَ الْأَحْزَابِ فَالنَّارُ مَوْعِدُهُ ۚ فَلَا تَكُ فِي مِرْيَةٍ مِنْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِنْ رَبِّكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afaman kana 'ala bayyinatin min rabbihi wayatloohu shahidun minhu wamin qablihi kitabu moosa imaman warahmatan ola-ika yu'minoona bihi waman yakfur bihi mina al-ahzabi faannaru maw'iduhu fala taku fee miryatin minhu innahu alhaqqu min rabbika walakinna akthara annasi la yu'minoon.

verses.eng: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah? Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their Lord." Unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers,
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ يُعْرَضُونَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ وَيَقُولُ الْأَشْهَادُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ الَّذِينَ كَذَبُوا عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ أَلَا لَعْنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waman athlamu mimani iftara 'ala Allahi kathiban ola-ika yu'radoona 'ala rabbihim wayaqoolu al-ashhadu haola-i allatheena kathaboo 'ala rabbihim ala la'natu Allahi 'ala aththalimeen.

verses.eng: Those who hinder (others) from the path of Allah and seek to make it crooked, and they are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ كَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli Allāhi wayabghūnahā ʿiwajan wahum bil-ākhirati kāfirūn

verses.eng: They will never escape (Allah) on earth, nor have they protectors besides Allah. The punishment will be doubled for them. They could not bear to hear (the truth), and they did not see.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَمْ يَكُونُوا۟ مُعْجِزِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا كَانَ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِنْ أَوْلِيَآءَۘ يُضَـٰعَفُ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُۚ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ulāika lam yakūnū muʿjizīna fī al-arḍi wamā kāna lahum min dūni Allāhi min awliyāʾa yuḍāʿafu lahumu al-ʿadhābu mā kānū yastaṭīʿūna al-samʿa wamā kānū yubṣirūn

verses.eng: Those are the ones who have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ulā'ika alladhīna khasirū anfusahum wa ḍalla 'anhum mā kānū yaftarūn

verses.eng: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.
verses.arabic: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lā jarama annahum fī l-ākhirati humu l-akhsarūn

verses.eng: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَأَخْبَتُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna āmanū wa 'amilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa akhbatū ilā rabbihim ulā'ika aṣḥābu l-jannati hum fīhā khālidūn

verses.eng: The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?
verses.arabic: مَثَلُ ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ كَٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْأَصَمِّ وَٱلْبَصِيرِ وَٱلسَّمِيعِ ۚ هَلْ يَسْتَوِيَانِ مَثَلًا ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mathalu l-farīqayni ka-l-a'mā wa-l-aṣammi wa-l-baṣīri wa-s-samī'i hal yastawiyāni mathalan afalā tadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnā nūḥan ilā qawmihi innī lakum nadhīrun mubīn

verses.eng: That you not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."
verses.arabic: أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: An lā ta'budū illā llāha innī akhāfu 'alaykum 'adhāba yawmin alīm

verses.eng: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars."
verses.arabic: فَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ مَا نَرَىٰكَ إِلَّا بَشَرًۭا مِّثْلَنَا وَمَا نَرَىٰكَ ٱتَّبَعَكَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ أَرَاذِلُنَا بَادِىَ ٱلرَّأْىِ وَمَا نَرَىٰ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا مِن فَضْلٍۭ بَلْ نَظُنُّكُمْ كَـٰذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa qāla l-mala'u alladhīna kafarū min qawmihi mā narāka illā basharan mithlanā wa mā narāka ittaba'aka illā alladhīna hum arādhilunā bādiya r-ra'i wa mā narā lakum 'alaynā min faḍlin bal naẓunnukum kādhibīn

verses.eng: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّى وَءَاتَىٰنِى رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِهِۦ فَعُمِّيَتْ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنُلْزِمُكُمُوهَا وَأَنتُمْ لَهَا كَـٰرِهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā qawmi a-ra'aytum in kuntu 'alā bayyinatin min rabbī wa ātānī raḥmatan min 'indihi fa 'ummiyat 'alaykum a-nulzimukumūhā wa antum lahā kārihūn

verses.eng: And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allah. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.
verses.arabic: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ لَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مَالًا ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِطَارِدِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُم مُّلَـٰقُوا۟ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَـٰكِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰكُمْ قَوْمًۭا تَجْهَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi lā as'alukum 'alayhi mālan in ajriya illā 'alā llāhi wa mā anā biṭāridi alladhīna āmanū innahum mulāqū rabbihim wa lākinnī arākum qawman tajhalūn

verses.eng: And O my people, who would protect me from Allah if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded?
verses.arabic: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ مَن يَنصُرُنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ إِن طَرَدتُّهُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi man yanṣurunī mina llāhi in ṭaradtuhum afalā tadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [of provision and mercy] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel, nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down that Allah will never grant them any good. Allah is most knowing of what is within their souls. Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: وَلَآ أَقُولُ لَكُمْ عِندِى خَزَآئِنُ ٱللَّهِ وَلَآ أَعْلَمُ ٱلْغَيْبَ وَلَآ أَقُولُ إِنِّى مَلَكٌۭ وَلَآ أَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ تَزْدَرِىٓ أَعْيُنُكُمْ لَن يُؤْتِيَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرًا ۖ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ إِنِّىٓ إِذًۭا لَّمِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā aqūlu lakum 'indī khazā'inullāhi wa lā a'lamu l-ghayba wa lā aqūlu innī malakun wa lā aqūlu li-lladhīna tazdarī a'yunukum lan yu'tiyahumu llāhu khayran allāhu a'lamu bimā fī anfusihim innī idhan la-mina ẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰنُوحُ قَدْ جَـٰدَلْتَنَا فَأَكْثَرْتَ جِدَٰلَنَا فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā nūḥu qad jādaltanā fa aktharta jidālanā fa'tinā bimā ta'idunā in kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīn

verses.eng: He said, "Allah will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure.
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَا يَأْتِيكُم بِهِ ٱللَّهُ إِن شَآءَ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla innamā ya'tīkum bihi llāhu in shā'a wa mā antum bi-mu'jizīn

verses.eng: And my advice will not benefit you - although I wished to advise you - If Allah should intend to put you in error. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned."
