verses.arabic: وَلَا يَنفَعُكُمْ نُصْحِىٓ إِنْ أَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَنصَحَ لَكُمْ إِن كَانَ ٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ أَن يُغْوِيَكُمْ ۚ هُوَ رَبُّكُمْ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā yanfa'ukum nuṣḥī in arattu an anṣaḥa lakum in kāna llāhu yurīdu an yughwiyakum huwa rabbukum wa ilayhi turja'ūn

verses.eng: Or do they say [about Prophet Muhammad], "He invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit."
verses.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ ۖ قُلْ إِنِ ٱفْتَرَيْتُهُۥ فَعَلَىَّ إِجْرَامِى وَأَنَا۠ بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّمَّا تُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul ini ftaraytuhu fa 'alayya ijrāmī wa anā barī'un mimmā tujrimūn

verses.eng: And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.
verses.arabic: وَأُوحِيَ إِلَىٰ نُوحٍ أَنَّهُۥ لَن يُؤْمِنَ مِن قَوْمِكَ إِلَّا مَن قَدْ ءَامَنَ فَلَا تَبْتَئِسْ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ūḥiya ilā Nūḥin annahu lan yu'mina min qawmika illā man qad āmana falā tabta'is bimā kānū yaf'alūn

verses.eng: And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned."
verses.arabic: وَٱصْنَعِ ٱلْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا وَلَا تُخَـٰطِبْنِى فِى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ إِنَّهُم مُّغْرَقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa iṣna'i al-fulka bi-a'yuninā wa waḥyinā wa lā tukhaṭibnī fī alladhīna ẓalamū innahum mughraqūn

verses.eng: And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.
verses.arabic: وَيَصْنَعُ ٱلْفُلْكَ وَكُلَّمَا مَرَّ عَلَيْهِ مَلَأٌۭ مِّن قَوْمِهِۦ سَخِرُوا۟ مِنْهُ ۚ قَالَ إِن تَسْخَرُوا۟ مِنَّا فَإِنَّا نَسْخَرُ مِنكُمْ كَمَا تَسْخَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaṣna'u al-fulka wa kullamā marra 'alayhi mala'un min qawmihi sakhirū minhu qāla in taskharū minnā fa innā naskharu minkum kamā taskharūn

verses.eng: And you are going to know who will get a punishment that will disgrace him [on earth] and upon whom will descend an enduring punishment [in the Hereafter]."
verses.arabic: فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ مَن يَأْتِيهِ عَذَابٌۭ يُخْزِيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيْهِ عَذَابٌۭ مُّقِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Fasawfa ta'lamūna man ya'tīhi 'adhābun yukhziihi wa yaḥillu 'alayhi 'adhābun muqīm

verses.eng: [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon it of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him except a few.
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ قُلْنَا ٱحْمِلْ فِيهَا مِن كُلٍّۢ زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَوْلُ وَمَنْ ءَامَنَ ۚ وَمَآ ءَامَنَ مَعَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā jā'a amrunā wa fāra at-tannūru qulna iḥmil fīhā min kullin zawjayni athnayni wa ahlaka illā man sabaqa 'alayhi al-qawlu wa man āmana wa mā āmana ma'ahu illā qalīl

verses.eng: And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱرْكَبُوا۟ فِيهَا بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ مَجْر۪ىٰهَا وَمُرْسَىٰهَآ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَغَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla irkabū fīhā bismi Allāhi majrāhā wa mursāhā inna rabbī laghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers."
verses.arabic: وَهِىَ تَجْرِى بِهِمْ فِى مَوْجٍۢ كَٱلْجِبَالِ وَنَادَىٰ نُوحٌ ٱبْنَهُۥ وَكَانَ فِى مَعْزِلٍۢ يَـٰبُنَىَّ ٱرْكَب مَّعَنَا وَلَا تَكُن مَّعَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa hiya tajrī bihim fī mawjin kal-jibāli wa nādā Nūḥun ibnahu wa kāna fī ma'zilin yā bunayya irkab ma'anā wa lā takun ma'a al-kāfirīn

verses.eng: [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.
verses.arabic: قَالَ سَـَٔاوِىٓ إِلَىٰ جَبَلٍۢ يَعْصِمُنِى مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ ۚ قَالَ لَا عَاصِمَ ٱلْيَوْمَ مِنْ أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَ ۚ وَحَالَ بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلْمَوْجُ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُغْرَقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla sa'āwī ilā jabalin ya'ṣimunī mina al-mā'i qāla lā 'āṣima al-yawma min amri Allāhi illā man raḥima wa ḥāla baynahumā al-mawju fa kāna mina al-mughraqīn

verses.eng: And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people."
verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ يَـٰٓأَرْضُ ٱبْلَعِى مَآءَكِ وَيَـٰسَمَآءُ أَقْلِعِى وَغِيضَ ٱلْمَآءُ وَقُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ وَٱسْتَوَتْ عَلَى ٱلْجُودِىِّ ۖ وَقِيلَ بُعْدًۭا لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qīla yā arḍu ibl'ī mā'aki wa yā samā'u aqli'ī wa ghīḍa al-mā'u wa quḍiya al-amru wa istawat 'alā al-jūdiyyi wa qīla bu'dan lil-qawmi aẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!"
verses.arabic: وَنَادَىٰ نُوحٌۭ رَّبَّهُۥ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ ٱبْنِى مِنْ أَهْلِى وَإِنَّ وَعْدَكَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنتَ أَحْكَمُ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa nādā Nūḥun rabbahu fa qāla rabbi inna ibnī min ahlī wa inna wa'daka al-ḥaqqu wa anta aḥkamu al-ḥākimīn

verses.eng: He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant."
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰنُوحُ إِنَّهُۥ لَيْسَ مِنْ أَهْلِكَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَمَلٌ غَيْرُ صَـٰلِحٍۢ ۖ فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِ مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَعِظُكَ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā Nūḥu innahu laysa min ahlika innahu 'amalun ghayru ṣāliḥin falā tas'alnī mā laysa laka bihi 'ilmun innī a'iẓuka an takūna mina al-jāhilīn

verses.eng: [Noah] said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَسْـَٔلَكَ مَا لَيْسَ لِى بِهِۦ عِلْمٌۭ ۖ وَإِلَّا تَغْفِرْ لِى وَتَرْحَمْنِىٓ أَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi innī a'ūdhu bika an as'alaka mā laysa lī bihi 'ilmun wa illā taghfir lī wa tarḥamnī akun mina al-khāsirīn

verses.eng: It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment."
verses.arabic: قِيلَ يَـٰنُوحُ ٱهْبِطْ بِسَلَـٰمٍۢ مِّنَّا وَبَرَكَـٰتٍ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلَىٰٓ أُمَمٍۢ مِّمَّن مَّعَكَ ۚ وَأُمَمٌۭ سَنُمَتِّعُهُمْ ثُمَّ يَمَسُّهُم مِّنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Qīla yā Nūḥu ihbiṭ bisalāmin minnā wa barakātin 'alayka wa 'alā umamim mimman ma'aka wa umamun sanumatti'uhum thumma yamassuhum minnā 'adhābun alīm

verses.eng: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهَآ إِلَيْكَ ۖ مَا كُنتَ تَعْلَمُهَآ أَنتَ وَلَا قَوْمُكَ مِن قَبْلِ هَـٰذَا ۖ فَٱصْبِرْ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلْعَـٰقِبَةَ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Tilka min anbā'i al-ghaybi nūḥīhā ilayka mā kunta ta'lamuhā anta wa lā qawmuka min qabli hādhā fa iṣbir inna al-'āqibata lil-muttaqīn

verses.eng: And to 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].
verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ عَادٍ أَخَاهُمْ هُودًۭا ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۖ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا مُفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ilā 'Ādin akhāhum Hūdan qāla yā qawmi u'budū Allāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruhu in antum illā muftarūn

verses.eng: O my people, I do not ask you for it any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?
verses.arabic: يَـٰقَوْمِ لَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًا ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلَّذِى فَطَرَنِىٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā qawmi lā as'alukum 'alayhi ajran in ajriya illā 'alā alladhī faṭaranī afalā ta'qilūn

verses.eng: And O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. And do not turn away, [being] criminals.
verses.arabic: وَيَا قَوْمِ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ ثُمَّ تُوبُوا إِلَيْهِ يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِدْرَارًا وَيَزِدْكُمْ قُوَّةً إِلَىٰ قُوَّتِكُمْ وَلَا تَتَوَلَّوْا مُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi istaghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ilayhi yursili as-samā'a 'alaykum midrāran wa yazidkum quwwatan ilā quwwatikum wa lā tatawallaw mujrimīn

verses.eng: They said, 'O Hud, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so. Nor are we believers in you.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا هُودُ مَا جِئْتَنَا بِبَيِّنَةٍ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِتَارِكِي آلِهَتِنَا عَنْ قَوْلِكَ وَمَا نَحْنُ لَكَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Hūdu mā ji'tanā bibayyinatin wa mā naḥnu bitārikī ālihatinā 'an qawlika wa mā naḥnu laka bimu'minīn

verses.eng: We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil.' He said, 'Indeed, I call Allah to witness, and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate
verses.arabic: إِنْ نَقُولُ إِلَّا اعْتَرَاكَ بَعْضُ آلِهَتِنَا بِسُوءٍ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّي أُشْهِدُ اللَّهَ وَاشْهَدُوا أَنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِمَّا تُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: In naqūlu illā i'tarāka ba'ḍu ālihatinā bisū'in qāla innī ush-hidu Allāha washhadū annī barī'un mimmā tushrikūn

verses.eng: Other than Him. So plot against me all together; then do not give me respite.
verses.arabic: مِنْ دُونِهِ ۖ فَكِيدُونِي جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ لَا تُنْظِرُونِ
verses.transliteration: Min dūnihi fakīdūnī jamī'an thumma lā tunẓirūn

verses.eng: Indeed, I have relied upon Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature but that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a straight path.
verses.arabic: إِنِّي تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ رَبِّي وَرَبِّكُمْ ۚ مَا مِنْ دَابَّةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهَا ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Innī tawakkaltu 'alā Allāhi rabbī wa rabbikum mā min dābbatin illā huwa ākhidhun bināṣiyatihā inna rabbī 'alā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

verses.eng: But if they turn away, [say], 'I have already conveyed that with which I was sent to you. My Lord will give succession to a people other than you, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed, my Lord is, over all things, Guardian.'
verses.arabic: فَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ مَا أُرْسِلْتُ بِهِ إِلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَيَسْتَخْلِفُ رَبِّي قَوْمًا غَيْرَكُمْ وَلَا تَضُرُّونَهُ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ حَفِيظٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa in tawallaw faqad ablaghtukum mā ursiltu bihi ilaykum wa yastakhlifu rabbī qawman ghayrakum wa lā taḍurrūnahu shay'an inna rabbī 'alā kulli shay'in ḥafīẓ

verses.eng: And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us; and We saved them from a harsh punishment.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا نَجَّيْنَا هُودًا وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِنَّا وَنَجَّيْنَاهُمْ مِنْ عَذَابٍ غَلِيظٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā jā'a amrunā najjaynā Hūdan wa alladhīna āmanū ma'ahu biraḥmatin minnā wa najjaynāhum min 'adhābin ghalīẓ

verses.eng: And that was 'Aad, who rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.
verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ عَادٌ ۖ جَحَدُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَعَصَوْا رُسُلَهُ وَاتَّبَعُوا أَمْرَ كُلِّ جَبَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa tilka 'Ādun jaḥadū bi'āyāti rabbihim wa 'aṣaw rusulahu wattaba'ū amra kulli jabbārin 'anīd

verses.eng: And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, 'Aad denied their Lord; then away with 'Aad, the people of Hud.
verses.arabic: وَأُتْبِعُوا فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا لَعْنَةً وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ أَلَا إِنَّ عَادًا كَفَرُوا رَبَّهُمْ ۗ أَلَا بُعْدًا لِعَادٍ قَوْمِ هُودٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa utbi'ū fī hādhihi ad-dunyā la'natan wa yawma al-qiyāmati alā inna 'Ādan kafarū rabbahum alā bu'dan li'Ādin qawmi Hūd

verses.eng: And to Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it, so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive.'
verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَالِحًا ۚ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ هُوَ أَنْشَأَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ وَاسْتَعْمَرَكُمْ فِيهَا فَاسْتَغْفِرُوهُ ثُمَّ تُوبُوا إِلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي قَرِيبٌ مُجِيبٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa ilā Thamūda akhāhum Ṣāliḥan qāla yā qawmi u'budū Allāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruhu huwa ansha'akum min al-arḍi wasta'marakum fīhā fastaghfirūhu thumma tūbū ilayhi inna rabbī qarībun mujīb

verses.eng: They said, 'O Salih, you were among us a man of promise before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped? And indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا صَالِحُ قَدْ كُنْتَ فِينَا مَرْجُوًّا قَبْلَ هَٰذَا ۖ أَتَنْهَانَا أَنْ نَعْبُدَ مَا يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُنَا وَإِنَّنَا لَفِي شَكٍّ مِمَّا تَدْعُونَا إِلَيْهِ مُرِيبٍ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Ṣāliḥu qad kunta fīnā marjuwwan qabla hādhā atanhānā an na'budu mā ya'budu ābā'unā wa innanā lafī shakkin mimmā tad'ūnā ilayhi murīb

verses.eng: He said, 'O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Himself, who would protect me from Allah if I disobeyed Him? So you would not increase me except in loss.
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّي وَآتَانِي مِنْهُ رَحْمَةً فَمَنْ يَنْصُرُنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ إِنْ عَصَيْتُهُ ۖ فَمَا تَزِيدُونَنِي غَيْرَ تَخْسِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā qawmi ara'aytum in kuntu 'alā bayyinatin min rabbī wa ātānī minhu raḥmatan fa man yanṣurunī mina Allāhi in 'aṣaytuhu fa mā tazīdūnani ghayra takhsīr

verses.eng: And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah - [she is] to you a sign. So let her feed upon Allah's earth and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a near punishment.'
verses.arabic: وَيَا قَوْمِ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةُ اللَّهِ لَكُمْ آيَةً فَذَرُوهَا تَأْكُلْ فِي أَرْضِ اللَّهِ وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابٌ قَرِيبٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi hādhihi nāqatu Allāhi lakum āyatan fa dharūhā ta'kul fī arḍi Allāhi wa lā tamassūhā bisū'in fa ya'khudhakum 'adhābun qarīb

verses.eng: But they hamstrung her, so he said, 'Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied.'
verses.arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَقَالَ تَمَتَّعُوا فِي دَارِكُمْ ثَلَاثَةَ أَيَّامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ وَعْدٌ غَيْرُ مَكْذُوبٍ
verses.transliteration: Fa 'aqarūhā fa qāla tamatta'ū fī dārikum thalāthata ayyāmin dhālika wa'dun ghayru makdhūb

verses.eng: So when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us, and [saved them] from the disgrace of that day. Indeed, it is your Lord who is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا نَجَّيْنَا صَالِحًا وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِنَّا وَمِنْ خِزْيِ يَوْمِئِذٍ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ الْقَوِيُّ الْعَزِيزُ
verses.transliteration: Fa lammā jā'a amrunā najjaynā Ṣāliḥan wa alladhīna āmanū ma'ahu biraḥmatin minnā wa min khizyi yawmi'idhin inna rabbaka huwa al-qawiyyu al-'azīz

verses.eng: And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
verses.arabic: وَأَخَذَ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيْحَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا فِي دِيَارِهِمْ جَاثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa akhadha alladhīna ẓalamū aṣ-ṣayḥatu fa aṣbaḥū fī diyārihim jāthimīn

verses.eng: As if they had never prospered therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their Lord; then, away with Thamud.
verses.arabic: كَأَنْ لَمْ يَغْنَوْا فِيهَا ۗ أَلَا إِنَّ ثَمُودَ كَفَرُوا رَبَّهُمْ ۗ أَلَا بُعْدًا لِثَمُودَ
verses.transliteration: Ka'an lam yaghnaw fīhā alā inna Thamūda kafarū rabbahum alā bu'dan liThamūd

verses.eng: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, 'Peace.' He said, 'Peace,' and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَتْ رُسُلُنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ بِالْبُشْرَىٰ قَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ ۖ فَمَا لَبِثَ أَنْ جَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ حَنِيذٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad jā'at rusulunā Ibrāhīma bil-bushrā qālū salāman qāla salāmun fa mā labitha an jā'a bi'ijlin ḥanīdh

verses.eng: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he distrusted them and felt from them apprehension. They said, 'Fear not. We have been sent to the people of Lot.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَىٰ أَيْدِيَهُمْ لَا تَصِلُ إِلَيْهِ نَكِرَهُمْ وَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۚ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِ لُوطٍ
verses.transliteration: Fa lammā ra'ā aydiyahum lā taṣilu ilayhi nakirahum wa awjasa minhum khīfatan qālū lā takhaf innā ursilnā ilā qawmi Lūṭ

verses.eng: And his wife was standing [nearby], and she laughed. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.
verses.arabic: وَٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ قَآئِمَةٌۭ فَضَحِكَتْ فَبَشَّرْنَـٰهَا بِإِسْحَـٰقَ وَمِن وَرَآءِ إِسْحَـٰقَ يَعْقُوبَ
verses.transliteration: Wa imra'atuhu qā'imatum faḍaḥikat fabashsharnāhā bi'isḥāqa wa min warā'i isḥāqa yaʿqūb

verses.eng: She said, "Woe to me! Shall I bear a child while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ يَـٰوَيْلَتَىٰٓ ءَأَلِدُ وَأَنَا۠ عَجُوزٌۭ وَهَـٰذَا بَعْلِى شَيْخًا ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَىْءٌ عَجِيبٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Qālat yā waylatā aalidu wa anā ʿajūzun wa hādhā baʿlī shaykhan inna hādhā lashay'un ʿajīb

verses.eng: They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of Allah? May the mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَتَعْجَبِينَ مِنْ أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ رَحْمَتُ ٱللَّهِ وَبَرَكَـٰتُهُۥ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ ٱلْبَيْتِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَمِيدٌۭ مَّجِيدٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Qālū ataʿjabīna min amri llāhi raḥmatu llāhi wa barakātuhu ʿalaykum ahlal-bayt innahu ḥamīdun majīd

verses.eng: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا ذَهَبَ عَنْ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلرَّوْعُ وَجَآءَتْهُ ٱلْبُشْرَىٰ يُجَـٰدِلُنَا فِى قَوْمِ لُوطٍ
verses.transliteration: Falammā dhahaba ʿan ibrāhīma r-rawʿu wa jā'at-hu l-bushrā yujādilunā fī qawmi lūṭ

verses.eng: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving, and penitent.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ لَحَلِيمٌ أَوَّٰهٌۭ مُّنِيبٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Inna ibrāhīma laḥalīmun awwāhun munīb

verses.eng: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."
verses.arabic: يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ أَعْرِضْ عَنْ هَـٰذَا ۖ إِنَّهُۥ قَدْ جَآءَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَإِنَّهُمْ ءَاتِيهِمْ عَذَابٌ غَيْرُ مَرْدُودٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Yā ibrāhīmu aʿriḍ ʿan hādhā innahu qad jā'a amru rabbika wa innahum ātīhim ʿadhābun ghayru mardūd

verses.eng: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, "This is a trying day."
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَا لُوطًۭا سِىٓءَ بِهِمْ وَضَاقَ بِهِمْ ذَرْعًۭا وَقَالَ هَـٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَصِيبٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā jā'at rusulunā lūṭan sī'a bihim wa ḍāqa bihim dharʿan wa qāla hādhā yawmun ʿaṣīb

verses.eng: And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?"
verses.arabic: وَجَآءَهُۥ قَوْمُهُۥ يُهْرَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ وَمِن قَبْلُ كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِى هُنَّ أَطْهَرُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ فِى ضَيْفِى ۖ أَلَيْسَ مِنكُمْ رَجُلٌۭ رَّشِيدٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa jā'ahu qawmuhu yuhraʿūna ilayhi wa min qablu kānū yaʿmalūna s-sayyi'āt qāla yā qawmi hā'ulā'i banātī hunna aṭharu lakum fa-ttaqū llāha wa lā tukhzūnī fī ḍayfī a laysa minkum rajulun rashīd

verses.eng: They said, "You have already known that we have no claim to your daughters, and indeed, you know what we want."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا لَنَا فِى بَنَاتِكَ مِنْ حَقٍّۢ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَعْلَمُ مَا نُرِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Qālū laqad ʿalimta mā lanā fī banātika min ḥaqqin wa innaka lataʿlamu mā nurīd

verses.eng: He said, "If only I had against you some power or could take refuge in a strong support."
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَوْ أَنَّ لِى بِكُمْ قُوَّةً أَوْ ءَاوِىٓ إِلَىٰ رُكْنٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Qāla law anna lī bikum quwwatan aw āwī ilā ruknin shadīd

verses.eng: The angels said, "O Lot, indeed we are messengers of your Lord; [therefore], they will never reach you. So set out with your family during a portion of the night and let not any among you look back - except your wife. Indeed, she will be struck by that which strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is [for] the morning. Is not the morning near?"
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰلُوطُ إِنَّا رُسُلُ رَبِّكَ لَن يَصِلُوٓا۟ إِلَيْكَ ۖ فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَكَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ مُصِيبُهَا مَآ أَصَابَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ مَوْعِدَهُمُ ٱلصُّبْحُ ۚ أَلَيْسَ ٱلصُّبْحُ بِقَرِيبٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā lūṭu innā rusulu rabbika lan yaṣilū ilayka fa-asri bi'ahlika biqiṭʿin min al-layli wa lā yaltafit minkum aḥadun illā mra'atuka innahu muṣībuhā mā aṣābahum inna mawʿidahumu ṣ-ṣubḥ a laysa ṣ-ṣubḥu biqarīb

verses.eng: So when Our command came, We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of layered hard clay, [which were]
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا جَعَلْنَا عَـٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا حِجَارَةًۭ مِّن سِجِّيلٍۢ مَّنضُودٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jā'a amrunā jaʿalnā ʿāliyahā sāfilahā wa amṭarnā ʿalayhā ḥijāratan min sijjīlin manḍūd

verses.eng: Marked from your Lord. And they [the stones] are not far from the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَمَا هِىَ مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بِبَعِيدٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Musawwamatan ʿinda rabbika wa mā hiya mina ẓ-ẓālimīna bibaʿīd

verses.eng: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. And do not decrease from the measure and the scale. Indeed, I see you in prosperity, but indeed, I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing Day.
verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًۭا ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥ ۖ وَلَا تَنقُصُوا۟ ٱلْمِكْيَالَ وَٱلْمِيزَانَ ۚ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰكُم بِخَيْرٍۢ وَإِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍۢ مُّحِيطٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Wa ilā madyana akhāhum shuʿayban qāla yā qawmi uʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruhu wa lā tanquṣū l-mikyāla wa l-mīzāna innī arākum bikhayrin wa innī akhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin muḥīṭ

verses.eng: And O my people, give full measure and weight in justice and do not deprive the people of their due and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.
verses.arabic: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْمِكْيَالَ وَٱلْمِيزَانَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۖ وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi awfū l-mikyāla wa l-mīzāna bil-qisṭi wa lā tabkhasū n-nāsa ashyā'ahum wa lā taʿthaw fī l-arḍi mufsidīn

verses.eng: What remains with Allah is better for you if you are believers. And I am not a keeper over you.
verses.arabic: بَقِيَّتُ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ وَمَا أَنَا عَلَيْكُمْ بِحَفِيظٍ
verses.transliteration: Baqiyyatullāhi khayrun lakum in kuntum mu'minīn wa mā anā 'alaykum biḥafīẓ

verses.eng: They said, 'O Shu'ayb, does your prayer command you that we should leave what our fathers worship or not do with our wealth what we please? Indeed, you are the forbearing, the discerning!'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا شُعَيْبُ أَصَلَاتُكَ تَأْمُرُكَ أَنْ نَتْرُكَ مَا يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُنَا أَوْ أَنْ نَفْعَلَ فِي أَمْوَالِنَا مَا نَشَاءُ إِنَّكَ لَأَنْتَ الْحَلِيمُ الرَّشِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Shu'aybu aṣalātuka ta'muruka an natruka mā ya'budu ābā'unā aw an naf'ala fī amwālinā mā nashā'u innaka la'anta al-ḥalīmu ar-rashīd

verses.eng: He said, 'O my people, have you considered: if I am upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has provided me with a good provision from Him...? And I do not intend to differ from you in that which I have forbidden you; I only intend reform as much as I am able. And my success is not but through Allah. Upon Him I have relied, and to Him I return.
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّي وَرَزَقَنِي مِنْهُ رِزْقًا حَسَنًا وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُخَالِفَكُمْ إِلَىٰ مَا أَنْهَاكُمْ عَنْهُ إِنْ أُرِيدُ إِلَّا الْإِصْلَاحَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ وَمَا تَوْفِيقِي إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَإِلَيْهِ أُنِيبُ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā qawmi a'raytum in kuntu 'alā bayyinatin min rabbī wa razaqanī minhu rizqan ḥasanan wa mā urīdu an ukhālifakum ilā mā anhākum 'anhu in urīdu illā al-iṣlāḥa mā istaṭa'tu wa mā tawfīqī illā billāh 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa ilayhi unīb

verses.eng: And O my people, let not [your] dissension from me cause you to be struck by that similar to what struck the people of Noah or the people of Hud or the people of Salih. And the people of Lot are not far from you.
verses.arabic: وَيَا قَوْمِ لَا يَجْرِمَنَّكُمْ شِقَاقِي أَنْ يُصِيبَكُمْ مِثْلُ مَا أَصَابَ قَوْمَ نُوحٍ أَوْ قَوْمَ هُودٍ أَوْ قَوْمَ صَالِحٍ وَمَا قَوْمُ لُوطٍ مِنْكُمْ بِبَعِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi lā yajrimannakum shiqāqī an yuṣībakum mithlu mā aṣāba qawma Nūḥin aw qawma Hūdin aw qawma �āliḥin wa mā qawmu Lūṭin minkum biba'īd

verses.eng: And ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is Merciful and Affectionate.
verses.arabic: وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ ثُمَّ تُوبُوا إِلَيْهِ إِنَّ رَبِّي رَحِيمٌ وَدُودٌ
verses.transliteration: Wastaghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ilayhi inna rabbī raḥīmun wadūd

verses.eng: They said, 'O Shu'ayb, we do not understand much of what you say, and indeed, we consider you among us as weak. And if not for your family, we would have stoned you [to death], and you are not to us one respected.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا شُعَيْبُ مَا نَفْقَهُ كَثِيرًا مِمَّا تَقُولُ وَإِنَّا لَنَرَاكَ فِينَا ضَعِيفًا وَلَوْلَا رَهْطُكَ لَرَجَمْنَاكَ وَمَا أَنْتَ عَلَيْنَا بِعَزِيزٍ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Shu'aybu mā nafqahu kathīran mimmā taqūlu wa innā lanarāka fīnā ḍa'īfan wa lawlā raḥṭuka larajamnāka wa mā anta 'alaynā bi'azīz

verses.eng: He said, 'O my people, is my family more respected by you than Allah? But you have taken Him behind your backs [in neglect]. Indeed, my Lord is encompassing of what you do.
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَرَهْطِي أَعَزُّ عَلَيْكُمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَاتَّخَذْتُمُوهُ وَرَاءَكُمْ ظِهْرِيًّا إِنَّ رَبِّي بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā qawmi arahṭī a'azzu 'alaykum mina Allāh wa ittakhadhtumūhu warā'akum ẓihriyyan inna rabbī bimā ta'malūn muḥīṭ

verses.eng: And O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working. You are going to know to whom will come a punishment that will disgrace him and who is a liar. So watch; indeed, I am with you a watcher.'
verses.arabic: وَيَا قَوْمِ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّي عَامِلٌ سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ يَأْتِيهِ عَذَابٌ يُخْزِيهِ وَمَنْ هُوَ كَاذِبٌ وَارْتَقِبُوا إِنِّي مَعَكُمْ رَقِيبٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa yā qawmi i'malū 'alā makānatikum innī 'āmilun sawfa ta'lamūna man ya'tīhi 'adhābun yukhzīhi wa man huwa kādhibun wa irtaqibū innī ma'akum raqīb

verses.eng: And when Our command came, We saved Shu'ayb and those who believed with him by mercy from Us. And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا نَجَّيْنَا شُعَيْبًا وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِنَّا وَأَخَذَتِ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيْحَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا فِي دِيَارِهِمْ جَاثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā jā'a amrunā najjaynā Shu'ayban wa alladhīna āmanū ma'ahu biraḥmatin minnā wa akhadhati alladhīna ẓalamū aṣ-ṣayḥatu fa'aṣbaḥū fī diyārihim jāthimīn

verses.eng: As if they had never prospered therein. Then, away with [the people of] Madyan as [the people of] Thamud were taken away.
verses.arabic: كَأَنْ لَمْ يَغْنَوْا فِيهَا أَلَا بُعْدًا لِمَدْيَنَ كَمَا بَعِدَتْ ثَمُودُ
verses.transliteration: Ka'an lam yaghnaw fīhā alā bu'dan li-Madyana kamā ba'idat Thamūd

verses.eng: And We had certainly sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا وَسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnā Mūsā bi'āyātinā wa sulṭānin mubīn

verses.eng: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not [at all] discerning.
verses.arabic: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاتَّبَعُوا أَمْرَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَا أَمْرُ فِرْعَوْنَ بِرَشِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Ilā Fir'awna wa mala'ihi fattaba'ū amra Fir'awna wa mā amru Fir'awna birashīd

verses.eng: He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection and lead them into the Fire; and wretched is the place to which they are led.
verses.arabic: يَقْدُمُ قَوْمَهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ فَأَوْرَدَهُمُ النَّارَ وَبِئْسَ الْوِرْدُ الْمَوْرُودُ
verses.transliteration: Yaqdumu qawmahu yawma al-qiyāmati fa'awradahumu an-nāra wa bi'sa al-wirdu al-mawrūd

verses.eng: And they were followed in this [world] with a curse and on the Day of Resurrection. And wretched is the gift which will be given.
verses.arabic: وَأُتْبِعُوا فِي هَٰذِهِ لَعْنَةً وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ بِئْسَ الرِّفْدُ الْمَرْفُودُ
verses.transliteration: Wa utbi'ū fī hādhihi la'natan wa yawma al-qiyāmati bi'sa ar-rifdu al-marfūd

verses.eng: That is from the news of the cities, which We relate to you; of them, some are [still] standing and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنْبَاءِ الْقُرَىٰ نَقُصُّهُ عَلَيْكَ مِنْهَا قَائِمٌ وَحَصِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika min anbā'i al-qurā naquṣṣuhu 'alayka minhā qā'imun wa ḥaṣīd

verses.eng: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. So their gods whom they invoked besides Allah did not avail them at all when the command of your Lord came, and they did not increase them in other than ruin.
verses.arabic: وَمَا ظَلَمْنَاهُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ ظَلَمُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ ۖ فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ آلِهَتُهُمُ الَّتِي يَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مِنْ شَيْءٍ لَمَّا جَاءَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَمَا زَادُوهُمْ غَيْرَ تَتْبِيبٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā ẓalamnāhum wa lākin ẓalamū anfusahum famā aghnā 'anhum ālihatuhum allatī yad'ūna min dūni Llāhi min shay'in lammā jā'a amru rabbika wa mā zādūhum ghayra tatbīb

verses.eng: And thus is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَخْذُ رَبِّكَ إِذَا أَخَذَ الْقُرَىٰ وَهِيَ ظَالِمَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ أَخْذَهُ أَلِيمٌ شَدِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika akhdu rabbika idhā akhadha al-qurā wa hiya ẓālimah, inna akhdhahu alīmun shadīd

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign for those who fear the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which the people will be collected, and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِمَنْ خَافَ عَذَابَ الْآخِرَةِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمٌ مَجْمُوعٌ لَهُ النَّاسُ وَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمٌ مَشْهُودٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna fī dhālika la'āyatan liman khāfa 'adhāba al-ākhirah, dhālika yawmum majmū'un lahu al-nāsu wa dhālika yawmum mashhūd

verses.eng: And We do not delay it except for a limited term.
verses.arabic: وَمَا نُؤَخِّرُهُ إِلَّا لِأَجَلٍ مَعْدُودٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā nu'akhkhiruhu illā li'ajalin ma'dūd

verses.eng: The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَأْتِ لَا تَكَلَّمُ نَفْسٌ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ ۚ فَمِنْهُمْ شَقِيٌّ وَسَعِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Yawma ya'ti lā takallamu nafsun illā bi'idhnih, famin hum shaqiyyun wa sa'īd

verses.eng: As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.
verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ شَقُوا فَفِي النَّارِ لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌ وَشَهِيقٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa'ammā alladhīna shaqū fafī al-nāri lahum fīhā zafīrun wa shahīq

verses.eng: [They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.
verses.arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا مَا دَامَتِ السَّمَاوَاتُ وَالْأَرْضُ إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ رَبُّكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ فَعَّالٌ لِمَا يُرِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Khālidīna fīhā mā dāmati al-samāwātu wa al-arḍu illā mā shā'a rabbuk, inna rabbaka fa''ālun limā yurīd

verses.eng: And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted.
verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ سُعِدُوا فَفِي الْجَنَّةِ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا مَا دَامَتِ السَّمَاوَاتُ وَالْأَرْضُ إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ رَبُّكَ ۖ عَطَاءً غَيْرَ مَجْذُوذٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa ammā alladhīna su'idū fafī al-jannati khālidīna fīhā mā dāmati al-samāwātu wa al-arḍu illā mā shā'a rabbuk, 'aṭā'an ghayra majdhūdh

verses.eng: So do not be in doubt, [O Muhammad], as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.
verses.arabic: فَلَا تَكُ فِي مِرْيَةٍ مِمَّا يَعْبُدُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ ۚ مَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا كَمَا يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُهُمْ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۚ وَإِنَّا لَمُوَفُّوهُمْ نَصِيبَهُمْ غَيْرَ مَنْقُوصٍ
verses.transliteration: Falā taku fī miryatin mimmā ya'budu hā'ulā', mā ya'budūna illā kamā ya'budu ābā'uhum min qabl, wa innā lamūfūhum naṣībahum ghayra manqūṣ

verses.eng: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ فَاخْتُلِفَ فِيهِ ۖ وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِنْ رَبِّكَ لَقُضِيَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَفِي شَكٍّ مِنْهُ مُرِيبٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ātaynā mūsā al-kitāba fa'khtulifa fīh, wa lawlā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika laquḍiya baynahum, wa innahum lafī shakkin minhu murīb

verses.eng: And indeed, each [of the believers and disbelievers] - your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Acquainted with what they do.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ كُلًّا لَمَّا لَيُوَفِّيَنَّهُمْ رَبُّكَ أَعْمَالَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna kullan lammā layuwaffiyannahum rabbuka a'mālahum, innahu bimā ya'malūna khabīr

verses.eng: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, [you] and those who have turned back with you [to Allah], and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
verses.arabic: فَاسْتَقِمْ كَمَا أُمِرْتَ وَمَنْ تَابَ مَعَكَ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا ۚ إِنَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Fastaqim kamā umirta wa man tāba ma'aka wa lā taṭghaw, innahu bimā ta'malūna baṣīr

verses.eng: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than Allah any protectors; then you would not be helped.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَرْكَنُوا إِلَى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا فَتَمَسَّكُمُ النَّارُ وَمَا لَكُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مِنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ ثُمَّ لَا تُنْصَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tarkanū ilā alladhīna ẓalamū fatamassakumu al-nāru wa mā lakum min dūni Llāhi min awliyā'a thumma lā tunṣarūn

verses.eng: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember.
verses.arabic: وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ طَرَفَيِ النَّهَارِ وَزُلَفًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ ۚ إِنَّ الْحَسَنَاتِ يُذْهِبْنَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ذِكْرَىٰ لِلذَّاكِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa aqimi al-ṣalāta ṭarafayi al-nahāri wa zulafan min al-layl, inna al-ḥasanāti yudh'hibna al-sayyi'āt, dhālika dhikrā lil-dhākirīn

verses.eng: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.
verses.arabic: وَاصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa iṣbir fa'inna Llāha lā yuḍī'u ajra al-muḥsinīn

verses.eng: So why were there not among the generations before you those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth - except a few of those We saved from among them? But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein, and they were criminals.
verses.arabic: فَلَوْلَا كَانَ مِنَ الْقُرُونِ مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ أُولُو بَقِيَّةٍ يَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْفَسَادِ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِمَّنْ أَنْجَيْنَا مِنْهُمْ ۗ وَاتَّبَعَ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مَا أُتْرِفُوا فِيهِ وَكَانُوا مُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falawlā kāna min al-qurūni min qablikum ulū baqiyyatin yanhawna 'ani al-fasādi fī al-arḍi illā qalīlan mimman anjaynā minhum, wa ittaba'a alladhīna ẓalamū mā utrifū fīhi wa kānū mujrimīn

verses.eng: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly while their people were reformers.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ لِيُهْلِكَ الْقُرَىٰ بِظُلْمٍ وَأَهْلُهَا مُصْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā kāna rabbuka liyuhlika al-qurā biẓulmin wa ahluhā muṣliḥūn

verses.eng: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ,
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ شَاءَ رَبُّكَ لَجَعَلَ النَّاسَ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً ۖ وَلَا يَزَالُونَ مُخْتَلِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law shā'a rabbuka laja'ala al-nāsa ummatan wāḥidatan wa lā yazālūna mukhtalifīn

verses.eng: Except whom your Lord has given mercy, and for that He created them. But the word of your Lord is to be fulfilled that, "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men all together."
verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ رَحِمَ رَبُّكَ ۚ وَلِذَٰلِكَ خَلَقَهُمْ ۗ وَتَمَّتْ كَلِمَةُ رَبِّكَ لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā man raḥima rabbuk, wa lidhālika khalaqahum, wa tammat kalimatu rabbika la'amla'anna jahannama mina al-jinnati wa al-nāsi ajma'īn

verses.eng: And each [story] We relate to you from the news of the messengers is that by which We make firm your heart. And there has come to you, in this, the truth and an instruction and a reminder for the believers.
verses.arabic: وَكُلًّا نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنْبَاءِ الرُّسُلِ مَا نُثَبِّتُ بِهِ فُؤَادَكَ ۚ وَجَاءَكَ فِي هَٰذِهِ الْحَقُّ وَمَوْعِظَةٌ وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kullan naquṣṣu 'alayka min anbā'i al-rusuli mā nuthabbitu bihi fu'ādak, wa jā'aka fī hādhihi al-ḥaqqu wa maw'iẓatun wa dhikrā lil-mu'minīn

verses.eng: And say to those who do not believe, "Work according to your position; indeed, we are working.
verses.arabic: وَقُلْ لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنَّا عَامِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qul lil-ladhīna lā yu'minū i'malū 'alā makānatikum innā 'āmilūn

verses.eng: And wait, indeed, we are waiting.
verses.arabic: وَانْتَظِرُوا إِنَّا مُنْتَظِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa intaẓirū innā muntaẓirūn

verses.eng: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it, so worship Him and rely upon Him. And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do.
verses.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُ ٱلْأَمْرُ كُلُّهُۥ فَٱعْبُدْهُ وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَيْهِ ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lillahi ghaybu alssamawati waal-ardi wa-ilayhi yurjaAAu al-amru kulluhu faoAAbudhu watawakkal AAalayhi wama rabbuka bighafilin AAamma taAAmaloona

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book.
verses.arabic: الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Ra. Tilka ayatul-kitabil mubeen.

verses.eng: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.
verses.arabic: إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَاهُ قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna anzalnahu Qur'anan Arabiyyan la'allakum ta'qiloon.

verses.eng: We relate to you, [O Muhammad], the best of stories in what We have revealed to you of this Qur'an although you were, before it, among the unaware.
verses.arabic: نَحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ أَحْسَنَ الْقَصَصِ بِمَا أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ هَـٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ وَإِن كُنتَ مِن قَبْلِهِ لَمِنَ الْغَافِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Nahnu naqussu 'alayka ahsanal-qasasi bima awhayna ilayka hathal-Qur'ana wa-in kunta min qablihi laminal-ghafileen.

verses.eng: [Of these stories mention] when Joseph said to his father, 'O my father, indeed I have seen [in a dream] eleven stars and the sun and the moon; I saw them prostrating to me.'
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ يُوسُفُ لِأَبِيهِ يَا أَبَتِ إِنِّي رَأَيْتُ أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوْكَبًا وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ رَأَيْتُهُمْ لِي سَاجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qala Yoosufu li-abeehi ya abati innee ra-aytu ahada 'ashara kawkaban wash-shamsa wal-qamara ra-aytuhum lee sajideen.

verses.eng: He said, 'O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers or they will contrive against you a plan. Indeed Satan, to man, is a manifest enemy.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ لَا تَقْصُصْ رُؤْيَاكَ عَلَىٰ إِخْوَتِكَ فَيَكِيدُوا لَكَ كَيْدًا ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ لِلْإِنسَانِ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Qala ya bunayya la taqussu ru'yaka 'ala ikhwatika fayakeedoo laka kaydan inna ash-shaytana lil-insani 'aduwwun mubeen.

verses.eng: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of narratives and complete His favor upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He completed it upon your fathers before, Abraham and Isaac. Indeed, your Lord is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَجْتَبِيكَ رَبُّكَ وَيُعَلِّمُكَ مِن تَأْوِيلِ الْأَحَادِيثِ وَيُتِمُّ نِعْمَتَهُ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلَىٰ آلِ يَعْقُوبَ كَمَا أَتَمَّهَا عَلَىٰ أَبَوَيْكَ مِن قَبْلُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa kathalika yajtabeeka rabbuka wa yu'allimuka min ta'weelil-ahadeethi wa yutimmu ni'matahu 'alayka wa 'ala ali Ya'qooba kama atammaha 'ala abawayka min qablu Ibraheema wa Ishaaq. Inna rabbaka 'aleemun hakeem.

verses.eng: Certainly were there in Joseph and his brothers signs for those who ask.
verses.arabic: لَّقَدْ كَانَ فِي يُوسُفَ وَإِخْوَتِهِ آيَاتٌ لِّلسَّائِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Laqad kana fee Yoosufa wa ikhwatihi ayatun lissa'iloon.

verses.eng: When they said, 'Joseph and his brother are more beloved to our father than we, while we are a clan. Indeed, our father is in clear error.'
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالُوا لَيُوسُفُ وَأَخُوهُ أَحَبُّ إِلَىٰ أَبِينَا مِنَّا وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّ أَبَانَا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Idh qaloo la-Yoosufu wa akhoohu ahabbu ila abeena minna wa nahnu 'usbatun inna abana lafee dalalin mubeen.

verses.eng: Kill Joseph or cast him out to [another] land; the countenance of your father will [then] be only for you, and you will be after that a righteous people.'
verses.arabic: اقْتُلُوا يُوسُفَ أَوِ اطْرَحُوهُ أَرْضًا يَخْلُ لَكُمْ وَجْهُ أَبِيكُمْ وَتَكُونُوا مِن بَعْدِهِ قَوْمًا صَالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Uqtuloo Yoosufa aw itrahoohu ardan yakhlu lakum wajhu abeekum wa takoonoo min ba'dihi qawman saliheen.

verses.eng: Said a speaker among them, 'Do not kill Joseph but throw him into the bottom of the well; some travelers will pick him up—if you would do [something].'
verses.arabic: قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ لَا تَقْتُلُوا يُوسُفَ وَأَلْقُوهُ فِي غَيَابَتِ الْجُبِّ يَلْتَقِطْهُ بَعْضُ السَّيَّارَةِ إِن كُنتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala qailun minhum la taqtuloo Yoosufa wa alqoohu fee ghayabatil-jubbi yaltaqithu ba'dus-sayyarati in kuntum fa'ileen.

verses.eng: They said, 'O our father, why do you not entrust us with Joseph while indeed, we are to him sincere counselors?'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا أَبَانَا مَا لَكَ لَا تَأْمَنَّا عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَنَاصِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo ya abana ma laka la ta'manna 'ala Yoosufa wa inna lahu lanasihoon.

verses.eng: Send him with us tomorrow that he may eat well and play. And indeed, we will be his guardians.'
verses.arabic: أَرْسِلْهُ مَعَنَا غَدًا يَرْتَعْ وَيَلْعَبْ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Arsilhu ma'ana ghadan yarta' wa yal'ab wa inna lahu lahafithoon.

verses.eng: [Jacob] said, 'Indeed, it saddens me that you should take him away, and I fear that a wolf would eat him while you are heedless of him.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي لَيَحْزُنُنِي أَن تَذْهَبُوا بِهِ وَأَخَافُ أَن يَأْكُلَهُ الذِّئْبُ وَأَنتُمْ عَنْهُ غَافِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala innee layahzununee an tathhaboo bihi wa akhafu an ya'kulahu ath-thi'bu wa antum 'anhu ghafiloon.

verses.eng: They said, 'If a wolf should eat him while we are a [strong] clan, indeed, we would then be losers.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا لَئِنْ أَكَلَهُ الذِّئْبُ وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّا إِذًا لَّخَاسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo la-in akalahu ath-thi'bu wa nahnu 'usbatun inna ithan lakhasiroon.

verses.eng: So when they took him [out] and agreed to put him into the bottom of the well... But We inspired to him, 'You will surely inform them [someday] about this affair of theirs while they do not perceive [your identity].'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا ذَهَبُوا بِهِ وَأَجْمَعُوا أَن يَجْعَلُوهُ فِي غَيَابَتِ الْجُبِّ ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم بِأَمْرِهِمْ هَـٰذَا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma thahaboo bihi wa ajma'oo an yaj'aloo-hu fee ghayabatil-jubbi wa awhayna ilayhi latunabbi-annahum bi-amrihim hatha wa hum la yash'uroon.

verses.eng: And they came to their father at night, weeping.
verses.arabic: وَجَاءُوا أَبَاهُمْ عِشَاءً يَبْكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'oo abahum 'isha'an yabkoon.

verses.eng: They said, 'O our father, indeed we went racing each other and left Joseph with our possessions, and a wolf ate him. But you would not believe us, even if we were truthful.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا أَبَانَا إِنَّا ذَهَبْنَا نَسْتَبِقُ وَتَرَكْنَا يُوسُفَ عِندَ مَتَاعِنَا فَأَكَلَهُ الذِّئْبُ ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ بِمُؤْمِنٍ لَّنَا وَلَوْ كُنَّا صَادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo ya abana inna thahabna nastabiqu wa tarakna Yoosufa 'inda mataa'ina fa-akalahu ath-thi'bu wa ma anta bi-mu'minin lana wa law kunna sadiqeen.

verses.eng: And they brought upon his shirt false blood. [Jacob] said, 'Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. And Allah is the one sought for help against that which you describe.'
verses.arabic: وَجَاءُوا عَلَىٰ قَمِيصِهِ بِدَمٍ كَذِبٍ ۚ قَالَ بَلْ سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ أَنفُسُكُمْ أَمْرًا ۖ فَصَبْرٌ جَمِيلٌ ۖ وَاللَّهُ الْمُسْتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'oo 'ala qameesihi bidamin kathib. Qala bal sawwalat lakum anfusukum amran fa-sabrun jameel. Wallahul-musta'aanu 'ala ma tasifoon.

verses.eng: And there came a company of travelers; they sent their water drawer, and he let down his bucket. He said, 'Good news! Here is a boy.' And they concealed him, [taking him] as merchandise; and Allah was Knowing of what they did.
verses.arabic: وَجَاءَتْ سَيَّارَةٌ فَأَرْسَلُوا وَارِدَهُمْ فَأَدْلَىٰ دَلْوَهُ ۖ قَالَ يَا بُشْرَىٰ هَـٰذَا غُلَامٌ ۚ وَأَسَرُّوهُ بِضَاعَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'at sayyaratun fa-arsaloo waridahum fa-adla dalwah. Qala ya bushra hatha ghulam. Wa asarroohu bida'ah. Wallahu 'aleemun bima ya'maloon.

verses.eng: And they sold him for a reduced price—a few dirhams—and they were, concerning him, of those content with little.
verses.arabic: وَشَرَوْهُ بِثَمَنٍ بَخْسٍ دَرَاهِمَ مَعْدُودَةٍ وَكَانُوا فِيهِ مِنَ الزَّاهِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa sharawhu bi-thamanin bakhsin darahima ma'doodah. Wa kanoo feehi minaz-zahideen.

verses.eng: And the one from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, 'Make his residence comfortable. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son.' And thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most of the people do not know.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِي اشْتَرَاهُ مِن مِّصْرَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَكْرِمِي مَثْوَاهُ عَسَىٰ أَن يَنفَعَنَا أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُ وَلَدًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُ مِن تَأْوِيلِ الْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَالِبٌ عَلَىٰ أَمْرِهِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qalallathee ishtarahu min Misra limra'atihi akrimee mathwahu 'asa an yanfa'ana aw nattakhithahu waladan. Wa kathalika makkanna li-Yoosufa fil-ardi wa li-nu'allimahu min ta'weelil-ahadeeth. Wallahu ghalibun 'ala amrihi wa lakinna aktharan-nasi la ya'lamoon.

verses.eng: And when Joseph reached maturity, We gave him judgment and knowledge. And thus We reward the doers of good.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ آتَيْنَاهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lamma balagha ashuddahu ataynahu hukman wa 'ilman. Wa kathalika najzil-muhsineen.

verses.eng: And she, in whose house he was, sought to seduce him. She closed the doors and said, 'Come, you.' He said, '[I seek] the refuge of Allah. Indeed, he is my master, who has made good my residence. Indeed, wrongdoers will not succeed.'
verses.arabic: وَرَاوَدَتْهُ الَّتِي هُوَ فِي بَيْتِهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِ وَغَلَّقَتِ الْأَبْوَابَ وَقَالَتْ هَيْتَ لَكَ ۚ قَالَ مَعَاذَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ رَبِّي أَحْسَنَ مَثْوَايَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa rawadathu allathee huwa fee baytiha 'an nafsihi wa ghallaqatil-abwaba wa qalat hayta lak. Qala ma'adha Allahi innahu rabbee ahsana mathwaya innahu la yuflihu ath-thalimoon.

verses.eng: And she certainly determined [to seduce] him, and he would have inclined to her had he not seen the proof of his Lord. And thus [it was] that We should avert from him evil and immorality. Indeed, he was of Our chosen servants.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ هَمَّتْ بِهِ ۖ وَهَمَّ بِهَا لَوْلَا أَن رَّأَىٰ بُرْهَانَ رَبِّهِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنَصْرِفَ عَنْهُ السُّوءَ وَالْفَحْشَاءَ ۚ إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad hammat bihi wa hamma biha lawla an ra'a burhana rabbih. Kathalika li-nasrifa 'anhu as-soo'a wal-fahsha'a. Innahu min 'ibadinal-mukhlasin.

verses.eng: And they both raced to the door, and she tore his shirt from the back, and they found her husband at the door. She said, 'What is the recompense of one who intended evil for your wife but that he be imprisoned or a painful punishment?'
verses.arabic: وَاسْتَبَقَا الْبَابَ وَقَدَّتْ قَمِيصَهُ مِن دُبُرٍ وَأَلْفَيَا سَيِّدَهَا لَدَى الْبَابِ ۚ قَالَتْ مَا جَزَاءُ مَنْ أَرَادَ بِأَهْلِكَ سُوءًا إِلَّا أَن يُسْجَنَ أَوْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wastabaqa al-baba wa qaddat qameesahu min duburin wa alfaya sayyidaha ladalbab. Qalat ma jaza'u man arada bi-ahlika soo'an illa an yusjana aw 'athabun aleem.

verses.eng: [Joseph] said, 'It was she who sought to seduce me.' And a witness from her family testified, 'If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth, and he is of the liars.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ هِيَ رَاوَدَتْنِي عَن نَّفْسِي ۚ وَشَهِدَ شَاهِدٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَا إِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٍ فَصَدَقَتْ وَهُوَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala hiya rawadatnee 'an nafsee. Wa shahida shahidun min ahliha in kana qameesuhu qudda min qubulin fa-sadaqat wa huwa min al-kathibeen.

verses.eng: 'But if his shirt is torn from the back, then she has lied, and he is of the truthful.'
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ فَكَذَبَتْ وَهُوَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in kana qameesuhu qudda min duburin fa-kathabat wa huwa min as-sadiqeen.

verses.eng: So when he saw that his shirt was torn from the back, he said, 'Indeed, it is of the women's plan. Indeed, your plan is great.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَىٰ قَمِيصَهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ قَالَ إِنَّهُ مِن كَيْدِكُنَّ ۖ إِنَّ كَيْدَكُنَّ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Falamma ra'a qameesahu qudda min duburin qala innahu min kaydikunn. Inna kaydakunna 'atheem.

verses.eng: 'Joseph, ignore this. And you, [O woman], ask forgiveness for your sin. Indeed, you were of the sinful.'
verses.arabic: يُوسُفُ أَعْرِضْ عَنْ هَـٰذَا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرِي لِذَنبِكِ ۖ إِنَّكِ كُنتِ مِنَ الْخَاطِئِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yoosufu a'ridh 'an hatha. Wastaghfiri lithanbiki innaki kunti min al-khati'een.

verses.eng: And women in the city said, 'The wife of al-'Azeez is seeking to seduce her slave boy; he has impassioned her with love. Indeed, we see her [to be] in clear error.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ نِسْوَةٌ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ امْرَأَتُ الْعَزِيزِ تُرَاوِدُ فَتَاهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِ ۖ قَدْ شَغَفَهَا حُبًّا ۖ إِنَّا لَنَرَاهَا فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa qala niswatun fee al-madeenati imra'atu al-'azeezi turawidu fataha 'an nafsih. Qad shaghafaha hubban. Inna lanaraha fee dalalin mubeen.

verses.eng: So when she heard of their scheming, she sent for them and prepared for them a banquet and gave each one of them a knife and said [to Joseph], 'Come out before them.' And when they saw him, they greatly admired him and cut their hands and said, 'Perfect is Allah! This is not a man; this is none but a noble angel!'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا سَمِعَتْ بِمَكْرِهِنَّ أَرْسَلَتْ إِلَيْهِنَّ وَأَعْتَدَتْ لَهُنَّ مُتَّكَأً وَآتَتْ كُلَّ وَاحِدَةٍ مِّنْهُنَّ سِكِّينًا وَقَالَتِ اخْرُجْ عَلَيْهِنَّ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَيْنَهُ أَكْبَرْنَهُ وَقَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ وَقُلْنَ حَاشَ لِلَّهِ مَا هَـٰذَا بَشَرًا إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا مَلَكٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Falamma sami'at bimakrihinna arsalat ilayhinna wa a'tadat lahunna muttaka'an wa atat kulla wahidatin minhunna sikkeeanan wa qalati okhruj 'alayhinna. Falamma ra'aynahu akbarnahu wa qatta'na aydee-hunna wa qulna hasha lillahi ma hatha basharan in hatha illa malakun kareem.

verses.eng: She said, 'That is the one about whom you blamed me. And I certainly sought to seduce him, but he firmly refused. And if he does not do what I order him, he will surely be imprisoned and will be of those debased.'
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ فَذَٰلِكُنَّ الَّذِي لُمْتُنَّنِي فِيهِ ۖ وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدتُّهُ عَن نَّفْسِهِ فَاسْتَعْصَمَ ۖ وَلَئِن لَّمْ يَفْعَلْ مَا آمُرُهُ لَيُسْجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكُونًا مِّنَ الصَّاغِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qalat fathalikunna allathee lumtunnanee feehi. Wa laqad rawadttuhu 'an nafsihi fasta'sam. Wa la-in lam yaf'al ma amuruhu layusjananna wa layakoonan min as-saghireen.

verses.eng: He said, 'My Lord, prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me. And if You do not avert from me their plan, I might incline toward them and [thus] be of the ignorant.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ السِّجْنُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا يَدْعُونَنِي إِلَيْهِ ۖ وَإِلَّا تَصْرِفْ عَنِّي كَيْدَهُنَّ أَصْبُ إِلَيْهِنَّ وَأَكُن مِّنَ الْجَاهِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi as-sijnu ahabbu ilayya mimma yad'oonanee ilayhi. Wa illa tasrif 'annee kaydahunna asbu ilayhinna wa akun min al-jahileen.

verses.eng: So his Lord responded to him and averted from him their plan. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: فَاسْتَجَابَ لَهُ رَبُّهُ فَصَرَفَ عَنْهُ كَيْدَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Fastajaba lahu rabbuhu fa-sarafa 'anhu kaydahunna. Innahu huwa as-Samee'u al-'Aleem.

verses.eng: Then it appeared to them after they had seen the signs that al-'Azeez should surely imprison him for a time.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَدَا لَهُم مِّن بَعْدِ مَا رَأَوُا الْآيَاتِ لَيَسْجُنُنَّهُ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Thumma bada lahum min ba'di ma ra'aw al-ayati layasjununnahu hatta heen.

verses.eng: And there entered the prison with him two young men. One of them said, 'Indeed, I have seen myself [in a dream] pressing wine.' The other said, 'Indeed, I have seen myself carrying bread on my head from which the birds were eating. Inform us of its interpretation; indeed, we see you to be of those who do good.'
verses.arabic: وَدَخَلَ مَعَهُ السِّجْنَ فَتَيَانِ ۖ قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَا إِنِّي أَرَانِي أَعْصِرُ خَمْرًا ۖ وَقَالَ الْآخَرُ إِنِّي أَرَانِي أَحْمِلُ فَوْقَ رَأْسِي خُبْزًا تَأْكُلُ الطَّيْرُ مِنْهُ ۖ نَبِّئْنَا بِتَأْوِيلِهِ ۖ إِنَّا نَرَاكَ مِنَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa dakhala ma'ahu as-sijna fatayan. Qala ahaduhuma innee araanee a'siru khamran. Wa qala al-akharu innee araanee ah-milu fawqa ra'see khubzan ta'kulu at-tayru minhu. Nabbi'na bi-ta'weelihi inna naraka min al-muhsineen.

verses.eng: He said, 'You will not receive food that is provided to you except that I will inform you of its interpretation before it comes to you. That is from what my Lord has taught me. Indeed, I have left the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah, and they, in the Hereafter, are disbelievers.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَا يَأْتِيكُمَا طَعَامٌ تُرْزَقَانِهِ إِلَّا نَبَّأْتُكُمَا بِتَأْوِيلِهِ قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتِيَكُمَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمَا مِمَّا عَلَّمَنِي رَبِّي ۚ إِنِّي تَرَكْتُ مِلَّةَ قَوْمٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ كَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala la ya'teekuma ta'amun turzaqanihi illa nabbatukum bi-ta'weelihi qabla an ya'tiyakuma. Thalikuma mimma 'allamanee rabbee. Innee taraktu millata qawmin la yu'minoona billahi wa hum bil-akhirati hum kafiroon.

verses.eng: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. And it was not for us to associate anything with Allah. That is from the favor of Allah upon us and upon the people, but most of the people are not grateful.
verses.arabic: وَاتَّبَعْتُ مِلَّةَ آبَائِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۚ مَا كَانَ لَنَا أَن نُّشْرِكَ بِاللَّهِ مِن شَيْءٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِن فَضْلِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى النَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wattaba'tu millata aba'ee Ibraheema wa Ishaqa wa Ya'qoob. Ma kana lana an nushrika billahi min shay'. Thalika min fadlillahi 'alayna wa 'ala an-nasi wa lakinna akthara an-nasi la yashkuroon.

verses.eng: O [my] two companions of prison, are separate lords better or Allah, the One, the Prevailing?
verses.arabic: يَا صَاحِبَيِ السِّجْنِ أَأَرْبَابٌ مُّتَفَرِّقُونَ خَيْرٌ أَمِ اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ
verses.transliteration: Ya sahibayi as-sijni a-arbabun mutafarriqoona khayrun amillahu al-Wahidu al-Qahhar?

verses.eng: You worship not besides Him except [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority. Legislation is not but for Allah. He has commanded that you worship not except Him. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.
verses.arabic: مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِهِ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءً سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُم مَّا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِنِ الْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۚ أَمَرَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوا إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الدِّينُ الْقَيِّمُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ma ta'budoona min doonihi illa asma'an sammaytumooha antum wa aba'ukum ma anzala Allahu biha min sultan. Inil-hukmu illa lillah. Amara alla ta'budoo illa iyyah. Thalika ad-deenu al-qayyimu wa lakinna akthara an-nasi la ya'lamoon.

verses.eng: O two companions of prison, as for one of you, he will give drink to his lord of wine; but as for the other, he will be crucified, and the birds will eat from his head. The matter has been decreed about which you both inquire.
verses.arabic: يَا صَاحِبَيِ السِّجْنِ أَمَّا أَحَدُكُمَا فَيَسْقِي رَبَّهُ خَمْرًا ۖ وَأَمَّا الْآخَرُ فَيُصْلَبُ فَتَأْكُلُ الطَّيْرُ مِن رَّأْسِهِ ۚ قُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ الَّذِي فِيهِ تَسْتَفْتِيَانِ
verses.transliteration: Ya sahibayi as-sijni amma ahadukuma fa-yasqee rabbahu khamran, wa amma al-akharu fa-yuslabu fa-ta'kulu at-tayru min ra'sih. Qudiya al-amru allathee feehi tastaftiyan.

verses.eng: And he said to the one whom he knew would be saved, 'Mention me before your lord.' But Satan made him forget the mention [to] his lord, and Joseph remained in prison several years.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ لِلَّذِي ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ نَاجٍ مِّنْهُمَا اذْكُرْنِي عِندَ رَبِّكَ فَأَنسَاهُ الشَّيْطَانُ ذِكْرَ رَبِّهِ فَلَبِثَ فِي السِّجْنِ بِضْعَ سِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qala lillathee thanna annahu najin minhuma ozkurnee 'inda rabbika fa-ansahu ash-shaytanu zikra rabbihi fa-labitha fee as-sijni bid'a sineen.

verses.eng: And [subsequently] the king said, 'Indeed, I have seen [in a dream] seven fat cows being eaten by seven [that were] lean, and seven green spikes [of grain] and others [that were] dry. O eminent ones, explain to me my vision, if you should interpret visions.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلِكُ إِنِّي أَرَىٰ سَبْعَ بَقَرَاتٍ سِمَانٍ يَأْكُلُهُنَّ سَبْعٌ عِجَافٌ وَسَبْعَ سُنْبُلَاتٍ خُضْرٍ وَأُخَرَ يَابِسَاتٍ ۖ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِي فِي رُؤْيَايَ إِن كُنتُمْ لِلرُّؤْيَا تَعْبُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qala al-maliku innee ara sab'a baqaratin simanin ya'kuluhunna sab'un 'ijafun wa sab'a sunbulatin khudrin wa ukhara yabisat. Ya ayyuha al-mala'u aftoonee fee ru'aya in kuntum li-ru'ya ta'buroon.

verses.eng: They said, '[It is but] a mixture of false dreams, and we are not learned in the interpretation of dreams.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا أَضْغَاثُ أَحْلَامٍ ۖ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِتَأْوِيلِ الْأَحْلَامِ بِعَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo adghathu ahlamin wa ma nahnu bi-ta'weelil-ahlami bi-'alimeen.

verses.eng: And the one who was freed and remembered after a time said, 'I will inform you of its interpretation, so send me forth.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِي نَجَا مِنْهُمَا وَادَّكَرَ بَعْدَ أُمَّةٍ أَنَا أُنَبِّئُكُم بِتَأْوِيلِهِ فَأَرْسِلُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wa qala allathee naja minhuma waddakara ba'da ummatin ana onabbi'ukum bi-ta'weelihi fa-arsiloon.

verses.eng: [He said], 'Joseph, O man of truth, explain to us about seven fat cows eaten by seven lean ones, and seven green spikes [of grain] and others dry - that I may return to the people so they may know.'
verses.arabic: يُوسُفُ أَيُّهَا الصِّدِّيقُ أَفْتِنَا فِي سَبْعِ بَقَرَاتٍ سِمَانٍ يَأْكُلُهُنَّ سَبْعٌ عِجَافٌ وَسَبْعِ سُنبُلَاتٍ خُضْرٍ وَأُخَرَ يَابِسَاتٍ لَّعَلِّي أَرْجِعُ إِلَى النَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yūsufu ayyuhā aṣ-ṣiddīqu aftinā fī sabʿi baqarātin simānin yaʾkuluhunna sabʿun ʿijāfun wa sabʿi sunbulātin khuḍrin wa ukhara yābisātin laʿallī arjiʿu ilā an-nāsi laʿallahum yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: [Joseph] said, 'You will plant for seven consecutive years. What you harvest, leave in its spikes, except a little from which you will eat.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ تَزْرَعُونَ سَبْعَ سِنِينَ دَأَبًا فَمَا حَصَدتُّمْ فَذَرُوهُ فِي سُنبُلِهِ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla tazraʿūna sabʿa sinīna daʾaban famā ḥaṣadtum fadharūhu fī sunbulihi illā qalīlan mimmā taʾkulūn

verses.eng: Then will come seven hard years which will consume what you stored except a little you preserve.'
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ يَأْتِي مِن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ سَبْعٌ شِدَادٌ يَأْكُلْنَ مَا قَدَّمْتُمْ لَهُنَّ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّمَّا تُحْصِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma yaʾtī min baʿdi dhālika sabʿun shidādun yaʾkulna mā qaddamtum lahunna illā qalīlan mimmā tuḥṣinūn

verses.eng: Then will come a year of abundant rain in which people will press [grapes and olives].'
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ يَأْتِي مِن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ عَامٌ فِيهِ يُغَاثُ النَّاسُ وَفِيهِ يَعْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma yaʾtī min baʿdi dhālika ʿāmun fīhi yughāthu an-nāsu wa fīhi yaʿṣirūn

verses.eng: The king said, 'Bring him to me.' When the messenger came, Joseph said, 'Return to your lord and ask him about the women who cut their hands. My Lord knows their scheme.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلِكُ ائْتُونِي بِهِ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُ الرَّسُولُ قَالَ ارْجِعْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَاسْأَلْهُ مَا بَالُ النِّسْوَةِ اللَّاتِي قَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي بِكَيْدِهِنَّ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla al-maliku iʾtūnī bihi falammā jāʾahu ar-rasūlu qāla irjiʿ ilā rabbika fasʾalhu mā bālu an-niswati allātī qaṭṭaʿna aydiyahunna inna rabbī bikaydihinna ʿalīm

verses.eng: The king asked the women, 'What happened when you sought to seduce Joseph?' They said, 'Allah forbid! We know no evil of him.' The chief's wife said, 'Now the truth is out. I sought to seduce him - he is truthful.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُنَّ إِذْ رَاوَدتُّنَّ يُوسُفَ عَن نَّفْسِهِ ۚ قُلْنَ حَاشَ لِلَّهِ مَا عَلِمْنَا عَلَيْهِ مِن سُوءٍ ۚ قَالَتِ امْرَأَتُ الْعَزِيزِ الْآنَ حَصْحَصَ الْحَقُّ أَنَا رَاوَدتُّهُ عَن نَّفْسِهِ وَإِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla mā khaṭbukunna idh rāwadtunna yūsufa ʿan nafsih qulna ḥāsha lillāhi mā ʿalimnā ʿalayhi min sūʾ qālat imraʾatu al-ʿazīzi al-āna ḥaṣḥaṣa al-ḥaqqu anā rāwadttuhu ʿan nafsihi wa innahu lamina aṣ-ṣādiqīn

verses.eng: Joseph said, 'This is so he may know I did not betray him secretly, and that Allah does not guide the schemes of betrayers.'
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ لِيَعْلَمَ أَنِّي لَمْ أَخُنْهُ بِالْغَيْبِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي كَيْدَ الْخَائِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika liyaʿlama annī lam akhunhu bil-ghaybi wa anna allāha lā yahdī kayda al-khāʾinīn

verses.eng: I do not absolve myself. The soul commands evil, except those shown mercy by my Lord. My Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.'
verses.arabic: وَمَا أُبَرِّئُ نَفْسِي ۚ إِنَّ النَّفْسَ لَأَمَّارَةٌ بِالسُّوءِ إِلَّا مَا رَحِمَ رَبِّي ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā ubarriʾu nafsī inna an-nafsa laʾammāratun bis-sūʾi illā mā raḥima rabbī inna rabbī ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: The king said, 'Bring him to me - I will have him serve me personally.' When he spoke to him, he said, 'Today you are established and trusted by us.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلِكُ ائْتُونِي بِهِ أَسْتَخْلِصْهُ لِنَفْسِي ۖ فَلَمَّا كَلَّمَهُ قَالَ إِنَّكَ الْيَوْمَ لَدَيْنَا مَكِينٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla al-maliku iʾtūnī bihi astakhliṣhu li-nafsī falammā kallamahu qāla innaka al-yawma ladaynā makīnun amīn

verses.eng: Joseph said, 'Put me in charge of the storehouses of the land. I am a knowledgeable guardian.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ اجْعَلْنِي عَلَىٰ خَزَائِنِ الْأَرْضِ ۖ إِنِّي حَفِيظٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ijʿalnī ʿalā khazāʾini al-arḍ innī ḥafīẓun ʿalīm

verses.eng: Thus We established Joseph in the land to settle where he willed. We bestow Our mercy on whom We please, and We do not waste the reward of the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَتَبَوَّأُ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ يَشَاءُ ۚ نُصِيبُ بِرَحْمَتِنَا مَن نَّشَاءُ ۖ وَلَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhālika makkannā li-yūsufa fī al-arḍi yatawawaʾu minhā ḥaythu yashāʾ nuṣību biraḥmatinā man nashāʾ wa lā nuḍīʿu ajra al-muḥsinīn

verses.eng: The reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believe and are righteous.
verses.arabic: وَلَأَجْرُ الْآخِرَةِ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَكَانُوا يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laʾajru al-ākhirati khayrun lilladhīna āmanū wa kānū yattaqūn

verses.eng: Joseph's brothers came and entered his presence. He recognized them, but they did not recognize him.
verses.arabic: وَجَاءَ إِخْوَةُ يُوسُفَ فَدَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَعَرَفَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُ مُنكِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa jāʾa ikhwatu yūsufa fa-dakhalū ʿalayhi faʿarafahum wa hum lahu munkirūn

verses.eng: When he had provided them with supplies, he said, 'Bring me your brother from your father. Do you not see I give full measure and am the best host?'
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهَازِهِمْ قَالَ ائْتُونِي بِأَخٍ لَّكُم مِّنْ أَبِيكُمْ ۚ أَلَا تَرَوْنَ أَنِّي أُوفِي الْكَيْلَ وَأَنَا خَيْرُ الْمُنزِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā jahhazahum bijahāzihim qāla iʾtūnī biʾakhin lakum min abīkum alā tarawna annī ūfī al-kayla wa anā khayru al-munzilīn

verses.eng: But if you do not bring him, you will have no measure from me, nor shall you approach me.'
verses.arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ تَأْتُونِي بِهِ فَلَا كَيْلَ لَكُمْ عِندِي وَلَا تَقْرَبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Faʾin lam taʾtūnī bihi fa lā kayla lakum ʿindī wa lā taqrabūn

verses.eng: They said, 'We will try to persuade his father, and indeed we will do it.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا سَنُرَاوِدُ عَنْهُ أَبَاهُ وَإِنَّا لَفَاعِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū sanurāwidu ʿanhu abāhu wa innā lafāʿilūn

verses.eng: And [Joseph] said to his servants, 'Put their merchandise into their saddlebags so they may recognize it when they go back to their family that perhaps they will return.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ لِفِتْيَانِهِ اجْعَلُوا بِضَاعَتَهُمْ فِي رِحَالِهِمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَعْرِفُونَهَا إِذَا انقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla lifityānihi ijʿalū biḍāʿatahum fī riḥālihim laʿallahum yaʿrifūnahā idhā inqalabū ilā ahlihim laʿallahum yarjiʿūn

verses.eng: So when they returned to their father, they said, 'O our father, [further] measure has been denied to us, so send with us our brother that we may obtain measure. Indeed, we will be his guardians.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَجَعُوا إِلَىٰ أَبِيهِمْ قَالُوا يَا أَبَانَا مُنِعَ مِنَّا الْكَيْلُ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا أَخَانَا نَكْتَلْ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā rajaʿū ilā abīhim qālū yā abānā muniʿa minnā al-kaylu fa arsil maʿanā akhānā naktal wa innā lahu laḥāfiẓūn

verses.eng: He said, 'Should I entrust you with him as I entrusted you with his brother before? But Allah is the best guardian, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَلْ آمَنُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا كَمَا أَمِنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ أَخِيهِ مِن قَبْلُ فَاللَّهُ خَيْرٌ حَافِظًا وَهُوَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla hal āmanukum ʿalayhi illā kamā amintukum ʿalā akhīhi min qablu fa allāhu khayrun ḥāfiẓan wa huwa arḥamu ar-rāḥimīn

verses.eng: And when they opened their baggage, they found their merchandise returned to them. They said, 'O our father, what [more] could we desire? This is our merchandise returned to us. And we will obtain more food for our family and protect our brother and obtain an addition of a camel's load. That is an easy measurement.'
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا فَتَحُوا مَتَاعَهُمْ وَجَدُوا بِضَاعَتَهُمْ رُدَّتْ إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ قَالُوا يَا أَبَانَا مَا نَبْغِي ۖ هَـٰذِهِ بِضَاعَتُنَا رُدَّتْ إِلَيْنَا ۖ وَنَمِيرُ أَهْلَنَا وَنَحْفَظُ أَخَانَا وَنَزْدَادُ كَيْلَ بَعِيرٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ كَيْلٌ يَسِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā fataḥū matāʿahum wajadū biḍāʿatahum ruddat ilayhim qālū yā abānā mā nabghī hādhihi biḍāʿatunā ruddat ilaynā wa namīru ahlanā wa naḥfaẓu akhānā wa nazdādu kayla baʿīrin dhālika kaylun yasīr

verses.eng: [Jacob] said, 'I will not send him with you until you give me a promise by Allah that you will bring him back to me, unless you are completely overtaken.' So when they gave him their promise, he said, 'Allah is witness over what we say.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَنْ أُرْسِلَهُ مَعَكُمْ حَتَّىٰ تُؤْتُونِ مَوْثِقًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ لَتَأْتُنَّنِي بِهِ إِلَّا أَن يُحَاطَ بِكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا آتَوْهُ مَوْثِقَهُمْ قَالَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lan ursilahu maʿakum ḥattā tuʾtūnī mawthiqan mina allāhi lataʾtunnanī bihi illā an yuḥāṭa bikum fa lammā ātawhu mawthiqahum qāla allāhu ʿalā mā naqūlu wakīl

verses.eng: And he said, 'O my sons, do not enter from one gate but enter from different gates. And I cannot avail you against [the decree of] Allah at all. The decision is only for Allah; upon Him I have relied, and upon Him let those who would rely [indeed] rely.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ يَا بَنِيَّ لَا تَدْخُلُوا مِن بَابٍ وَاحِدٍ وَادْخُلُوا مِنْ أَبْوَابٍ مُّتَفَرِّقَةٍ ۖ وَمَا أُغْنِي عَنكُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ مِن شَيْءٍ ۖ إِنِ الْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۖ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ ۖ وَعَلَيْهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla yā banīya lā tadkhulū min bābin wāḥidin wa udkhulū min abwābin mutafarriqatin wa mā ughnī ʿankum mina allāhi min shayʾ in al-ḥukmu illā lillāhi ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa ʿalayhi fal yatawakkali al-mutawakkilūn

verses.eng: And when they entered from where their father had ordered them, it did not avail them against Allah at all, except [it was] a need within the soul of Jacob, which he satisfied. And indeed, he was a possessor of knowledge because of what We had taught him. But most of the people do not know.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا مِنْ حَيْثُ أَمَرَهُمْ أَبُوهُم مَّا كَانَ يُغْنِي عَنْهُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ مِن شَيْءٍ إِلَّا حَاجَةً فِي نَفْسِ يَعْقُوبَ قَضَاهَا ۚ وَإِنَّهُ لَذُو عِلْمٍ لِّمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā dakhalū min ḥaythu amarahum abūhum mā kāna yughnī ʿanhum mina allāhi min shayʾ illā ḥājatan fī nafsi yaʿqūba qaḍāhā wa innahu la dhū ʿilmin limā ʿallamnāhu wa lākinna akthara an-nāsi lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his brother to himself. He said, 'Indeed, I am your brother, so do not despair over what they used to do [to me].'
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ آوَىٰ إِلَيْهِ أَخَاهُ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّي أَنَا أَخُوكَ فَلَا تَبْتَئِسْ بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā dakhalū ʿalā yūsufa āwā ilayhi akhāhu qāla innī anā akhūka falā tabtaʾis bimā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: And when he had furnished them with their supplies, he put the drinking cup into the bag of his brother. Then an announcer called out, 'O caravan, indeed you are thieves!'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهَازِهِمْ جَعَلَ السِّقَايَةَ فِي رَحْلِ أَخِيهِ ثُمَّ أَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ أَيَّتُهَا الْعِيرُ إِنَّكُمْ لَسَارِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa lammā jahhazahum bijahāzihim jaʿala as-siqāyata fī raḥli akhīhi thumma adhdhana muʾadhdhinun ayyatuhā al-ʿīru innakum lasāriqūn

verses.eng: They said, approaching them, 'What is it you are missing?'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا وَأَقْبَلُوا عَلَيْهِم مَّاذَا تَفْقِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū wa aqbalū ʿalayhim mādhā tafqidūn

verses.eng: They said, 'We are missing the measuring cup of the king. And for he who produces it is [the reward of] a camel's load, and I am responsible for it.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا نَفْقِدُ صُوَاعَ الْمَلِكِ وَلِمَن جَاءَ بِهِ حِمْلُ بَعِيرٍ وَأَنَا بِهِ زَعِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qālū nafqidu ṣuwāʿa al-maliki wa liman jāʾa bihi ḥimlu baʿīrin wa anā bihi zaʿīm

verses.eng: They said, 'By Allah, certainly you know we did not come to cause corruption in the land, and we have not been thieves.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا تَاللَّهِ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتُم مَّا جِئْنَا لِنُفْسِدَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا كُنَّا سَارِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū ta allāhi laqad ʿalimtum mā jiʾnā li nufsida fī al-arḍi wa mā kunnā sāriqīn

verses.eng: They said, 'Then what should be its recompense if you should be liars?'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا فَمَا جَزَاؤُهُ إِن كُنتُمْ كَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū fa mā jazāʾuhu in kuntum kādhibīn

verses.eng: [The brothers] said, 'Its recompense is that he in whose bag it is found - he [himself] will be its recompense. Thus do we punish the wrongdoers.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا جَزَاؤُهُ مَن وُجِدَ فِي رَحْلِهِ فَهُوَ جَزَاؤُهُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū jazāʾuhu man wujida fī raḥlihi fa huwa jazāʾuhu kadhālika najzī aẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: So he began with their bags before his brother's bag, then he extracted it from his brother's bag. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother under the king's law except that Allah willed. We raise in degrees whom We will, and above every possessor of knowledge is the All-Knowing.
verses.arabic: فَبَدَأَ بِأَوْعِيَتِهِمْ قَبْلَ وِعَاءِ أَخِيهِ ثُمَّ اسْتَخْرَجَهَا مِن وِعَاءِ أَخِيهِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كِدْنَا لِيُوسُفَ ۖ مَا كَانَ لِيَأْخُذَ أَخَاهُ فِي دِينِ الْمَلِكِ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ نَرْفَعُ دَرَجَاتٍ مَّن نَّشَاءُ ۗ وَفَوْقَ كُلِّ ذِي عِلْمٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Fabadaa bi-aw'iyatihim qabla wi'a-i akheeh thumma istakhrajaha min wi'a-i akheeh; kathalika kidna liyoosufa ma kana liya/khutha akhahu fee deeni almaliki illa an yashaa Allahu narfa'u darajatin man nashao wafawqa kulli thee 'ilmin 'aleem

verses.eng: They said, 'If he has stolen, a brother of his had stolen before.' But Joseph kept it within himself and did not reveal it to them. He said, 'You are in a worse position, and Allah is most knowing of what you describe.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا إِن يَسْرِقْ فَقَدْ سَرَقَ أَخٌ لَّهُ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ فَأَسَرَّهَا يُوسُفُ فِي نَفْسِهِ وَلَمْ يُبْدِهَا لَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ أَنتُمْ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا ۖ وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo in yasriq faqad saraqa akhun lahu min qablu faasarraha yoosufu fee nafsihi walam yubdiha lahum qala antum sharun makanan waAllahu a'lamu bima tasifoon

verses.eng: They said, 'O noble one, indeed he has a father [who is] an old man, so take one of us in his place. Indeed, we see you as a doer of good.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الْعَزِيزُ إِنَّ لَهُ أَبًا شَيْخًا كَبِيرًا فَخُذْ أَحَدَنَا مَكَانَهُ ۖ إِنَّا نَرَاكَ مِنَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo ya ayyuha al'azeezu inna lahu aban shaykhan kabeeran fakhuth ahadana makanahu inna naraka mina almuhsineen

verses.eng: He said, 'Allah forbid that we should take except him with whom we found our possession. Indeed, we would then be unjust.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ مَعَاذَ اللَّهِ أَن نَّأْخُذَ إِلَّا مَن وَجَدْنَا مَتَاعَنَا عِندَهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَّظَالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala ma'aatha Allahi an nakhutha illa man wajadna mataa'ana 'indahu inna ithan lathalimoon

verses.eng: So when they had despaired of him, they secluded themselves in private consultation. The eldest of them said, 'Do you not know that your father has taken upon you an oath by Allah and before that failed in regard to Joseph? So I will not leave this land until my father permits me or Allah decides for me, and He is the best of judges.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا اسْتَيْأَسُوا مِنْهُ خَلَصُوا نَجِيًّا ۖ قَالَ كَبِيرُهُمْ أَلَمْ تَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ أَبَاكُمْ قَدْ أَخَذَ عَلَيْكُم مَّوْثِقًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَمِن قَبْلُ مَا فَرَّطتُّمْ فِي يُوسُفَ ۖ فَلَنْ أَبْرَحَ الْأَرْضَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْذَنَ لِي أَبِي أَوْ يَحْكُمَ اللَّهُ لِي ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الْحَاكِمِينَ
