verses.transliteration: Falamma istay-asoo minhu khalasoo najiyyan qala kabeeruhum alam ta'lamoo anna abakum qad akhatha 'alaykum mawthiqan mina Allahi wamin qablu ma farrattum fee yoosufa falan abraha al-arda hatta ya/thana lee abee aw yahkuma Allahu lee wahuwa khayru alhakimeen

verses.eng: Return to your father and say, 'O our father, indeed your son has stolen, and we did not testify except to what we knew. And we were not guardians of the unseen.'
verses.arabic: ارْجِعُوا إِلَىٰ أَبِيكُمْ فَقُولُوا يَا أَبَانَا إِنَّ ابْنَكَ سَرَقَ وَمَا شَهِدْنَا إِلَّا بِمَا عَلِمْنَا وَمَا كُنَّا لِلْغَيْبِ حَافِظِينَ
verses.transliteration: Irji'oo ila abeekum faqooloo ya abana inna ibnaka saraqa wama shahidna illa bima 'alimna wama kunna lilghaybi hafitheena

verses.eng: And ask the city in which we were and the caravan in which we came - and indeed, we are truthful.'
verses.arabic: وَاسْأَلِ الْقَرْيَةَ الَّتِي كُنَّا فِيهَا وَالْعِيرَ الَّتِي أَقْبَلْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wais-ali alqaryata allatee kunna feeha waal'eera allatee aqbalna feeha wa-inna lasadiqoon

verses.eng: He [Jacob] said, 'Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. Perhaps Allah will bring them all [back] to me. Indeed it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ بَلْ سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ أَنفُسُكُمْ أَمْرًا ۖ فَصَبْرٌ جَمِيلٌ ۖ عَسَى اللَّهُ أَن يَأْتِيَنِي بِهِمْ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qala bal sawwalat lakum anfusukum amran fasabrun jameelun 'asa Allahu an ya/tiyanee bihim jamee'an innahu huwa al'alimu alhakeem

verses.eng: And he turned away from them and said, 'Oh, my sorrow over Joseph,' and his eyes became white from grief, for he was [of that] a suppressor.
verses.arabic: وَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَا أَسَفَىٰ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ وَابْيَضَّتْ عَيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْحُزْنِ فَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Watawalla 'anhum waqala ya asafa 'ala yoosufa wabyaddat 'aynahu mina alhuzni fahuwa katheem

verses.eng: They said, 'By Allah, you will not cease remembering Joseph until you become fatally ill or become of those who perish.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا تَاللَّهِ تَفْتَأُ تَذْكُرُ يُوسُفَ حَتَّىٰ تَكُونَ حَرَضًا أَوْ تَكُونَ مِنَ الْهَالِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo taAllahi tafta-u tathkuru yoosufa hatta takoona haradan aw takoona mina alhalikeen

verses.eng: He said, 'I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you do not know.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَا أَشْكُو بَثِّي وَحُزْنِي إِلَى اللَّهِ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala innama ashkoo baththee wahuznee ila Allahi wa'a'lamu mina Allahi ma la ta'lamoon

verses.eng: O my sons, go and find out about Joseph and his brother and despair not of relief from Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people.'
verses.arabic: يَا بَنِيَّ اذْهَبُوا فَتَحَسَّسُوا مِن يُوسُفَ وَأَخِيهِ وَلَا تَيْأَسُوا مِن رَّوْحِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَا يَيْأَسُ مِن رَّوْحِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْقَوْمُ الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya baniyyi ithhaboo fatahassasoo min yoosufa waakheehi wala tay-asoo min rawhi Allahi innahu la yay-asu min rawhi Allahi illa alqawmu alkafiroon

verses.eng: So when they entered upon him, they said, 'O noble one, adversity has touched us and our family, and we have come with goods of little value, but give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ قَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الْعَزِيزُ مَسَّنَا وَأَهْلَنَا الضُّرُّ وَجِئْنَا بِبِضَاعَةٍ مُّزْجَاةٍ فَأَوْفِ لَنَا الْكَيْلَ وَتَصَدَّقْ عَلَيْنَا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَجْزِي الْمُتَصَدِّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma dakhaloo 'alayhi qaloo ya ayyuha al'azeezu massana waahlana alddurru waji/na bibi'atin muzjatin faawfi lana alkayla watasaddaq 'alayna inna Allaha yajzee almutasaddiqeen

verses.eng: He said, 'Do you know what you did with Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَلْ عَلِمْتُم مَّا فَعَلْتُم بِيُوسُفَ وَأَخِيهِ إِذْ أَنتُمْ جَاهِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala hal 'alimtum ma fa'altum biyoosufa waakheehi ith antum jahiloon

verses.eng: They said, 'Are you indeed Joseph?' He said, 'I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Allah has certainly favored us. Indeed, he who fears Allah and is patient - then indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا أَئِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ يُوسُفُ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا يُوسُفُ وَهَـٰذَا أَخِي ۖ قَدْ مَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا ۖ إِنَّهُ مَن يَتَّقِ وَيَصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo a-innaka laanta yoosufu qala ana yoosufu wahatha akhee qad manna Allahu 'alayna innahu man yattaqi wayasbir fa-inna Allaha la yudee'u ajra almuhsineen

verses.eng: They said, 'By Allah, certainly Allah has preferred you over us, and indeed, we have been sinners.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا تَاللَّهِ لَقَدْ آثَرَكَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَإِن كُنَّا لَخَاطِئِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū ta allāhi laqad ātharaka allāhu ʿalaynā wa in kunnā la khāṭiʾīn

verses.eng: He said, 'No blame will there be upon you today. Allah will forgive you, and He is the most merciful of the merciful.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَا تَثْرِيبَ عَلَيْكُمُ الْيَوْمَ ۖ يَغْفِرُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lā tathrība ʿalaykumu al-yawma yaghfiru allāhu lakum wa huwa arḥamu al-rāḥimīn

verses.eng: Go with this shirt of mine and cast it over the face of my father; he will become seeing. And bring me your family, all together.'
verses.arabic: اذْهَبُوا بِقَمِيصِي هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقُوهُ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِ أَبِي يَأْتِ بَصِيرًا وَأْتُونِي بِأَهْلِكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Idhhabū biqamīṣī hādhā fa alqūhu ʿalā wajhi abī yaʾti baṣīran wa ʾtūnī bi-ahlikum ajmaʿīn

verses.eng: And when the caravan departed, their father said, 'Indeed, I find the smell of Joseph [and would say that] if you did not think me weakened in mind.'
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا فَصَلَتِ الْعِيرُ قَالَ أَبُوهُمْ إِنِّي لَأَجِدُ رِيحَ يُوسُفَ ۖ لَوْلَا أَن تُفَنِّدُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā faṣalati al-ʿīru qāla abūhum innī la-ajidu rīḥa yūsufa lawlā an tufannidūn

verses.eng: They said, 'By Allah, indeed you are in your [same] old error.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا تَاللَّهِ إِنَّكَ لَفِي ضَلَالِكَ الْقَدِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Qālū ta allāhi innaka lafī ḍalālika al-qadīm

verses.eng: But when the bearer of good tidings arrived, he cast it over his face, and he returned [once again] seeing. He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know from Allah that which you do not know?'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا أَن جَاءَ الْبَشِيرُ أَلْقَاهُ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ فَارْتَدَّ بَصِيرًا ۖ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ إِنِّي أَعْلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa lammā an jāʾa al-bashīru alqāhu ʿalā wajhihi fa irtadda baṣīran qāla a lam aqul lakum innī aʿlamu mina allāhi mā lā taʿlamūn

verses.eng: They said, 'O our father, ask forgiveness for us of our sins; indeed, we have been sinners.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا أَبَانَا اسْتَغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا خَاطِئِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā abānā istaghfir lanā dhunūbanā innā kunnā khāṭiʾīn

verses.eng: He said, 'I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ سَوْفَ أَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكُمْ رَبِّي ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qāla sawfa astaghfiru lakum rabbī innahu huwa al-ghafūru al-raḥīm

verses.eng: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his parents to himself and said, 'Enter Egypt, Allah willing, safe [and secure].'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ آوَىٰ إِلَيْهِ أَبَوَيْهِ وَقَالَ ادْخُلُوا مِصْرَ إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa lammā dakhalū ʿalā yūsufa āwā ilayhi abawayhi wa qāla udkhulū miṣra in shāʾa allāhu āminīn

verses.eng: And he raised his parents upon the throne, and they bowed to him in prostration. And he said, 'O my father, this is the explanation of my vision of before. My Lord has made it reality. And He was certainly good to me when He took me out of prison and brought you [here] from bedouin life after Satan had induced [estrangement] between me and my brothers. Indeed, my Lord is Subtle in what He wills. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise.'
verses.arabic: وَرَفَعَ أَبَوَيْهِ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ وَخَرُّوا لَهُ سُجَّدًا ۖ وَقَالَ يَا أَبَتِ هَـٰذَا تَأْوِيلُ رُؤْيَايَ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَعَلَهَا رَبِّي حَقًّا ۖ وَقَدْ أَحْسَنَ بِي إِذْ أَخْرَجَنِي مِنَ السِّجْنِ وَجَاءَ بِكُم مِّنَ الْبَدْوِ مِن بَعْدِ أَن نَّزَغَ الشَّيْطَانُ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَ إِخْوَتِي ۖ إِنَّ رَبِّي لَطِيفٌ لِّمَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa rafaʿa abawayhi ʿalā al-ʿarshi wa kharū lahu sujjadan wa qāla yā abati hādhā taʾwīlu ruʾyāya min qablu qad jaʿalahā rabbī ḥaqqan wa qad aḥsana bī idh akhrijanī mina al-sijni wa jāʾa bikum mina al-badwi min baʿdi an nazagha al-shayṭānu baynī wa bayna ikhwatī innā rabbī laṭīfun limā yashāʾ innahu huwa al-ʿalīmu al-ḥakīm

verses.eng: My Lord, You have given me [something] of sovereignty and taught me of the interpretation of dreams. Creator of the heavens and earth, You are my protector in this world and the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous.'
verses.arabic: رَبِّ قَدْ آتَيْتَنِي مِنَ الْمُلْكِ وَعَلَّمْتَنِي مِن تَأْوِيلِ الْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ فَاطِرَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ أَنتَ وَلِيِّي فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ ۖ تَوَفَّنِي مُسْلِمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi qad ātaytanī mina al-mulki wa ʿallamtanī min taʾwīli al-aḥādīth fāṭira al-samāwāti wa al-arḍi anta waliyyī fī al-dunyā wa al-ākhirah tawaffanī musliman wa alḥiqnī bi-al-ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they put together their plan while they conspired.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنبَاءِ الْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ أَجْمَعُوا أَمْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ يَمْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika min anbāʾi al-ghaybi nūḥīhi ilayka wa mā kunta ladayhim idh ajmaʿū amrahum wa hum yamkurūn

verses.eng: And most of the people, although you strive [for it], are not believers.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ وَلَوْ حَرَصْتَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā aktharu al-nāsi wa law ḥaraṣta bi-muʾminīn

verses.eng: And you do not ask of them for it any payment. It is not except a reminder to the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَا تَسْأَلُهُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā tasʾaluhum ʿalayhi min ajrin in huwa illā dhikrun li-al-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: And how many a sign within the heavens and earth do they pass over while they, therefrom, are turning away.
verses.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّنْ آيَةٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهَا وَهُمْ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ka-ayyin min āyatin fī al-samāwāti wa al-arḍi yamurrūna ʿalayhā wa hum ʿanhā muʿriḍūn

verses.eng: And most of them believe not in Allah except while they associate others with Him.
verses.arabic: وَمَا يُؤْمِنُ أَكْثَرُهُم بِاللَّهِ إِلَّا وَهُم مُّشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā yuʾminu aktharuhum bi-allāhi illā wa hum mushrikūn

verses.eng: Then do they feel secure that there will not come to them an overwhelming [aspect] of the punishment of Allah or that the Hour will not come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive?
verses.arabic: أَفَأَمِنُوا أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ غَاشِيَةٌ مِّنْ عَذَابِ اللَّهِ أَوْ تَأْتِيَهُمُ السَّاعَةُ بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afa-amīnū an taʾtiyahum ghāshiyatun min ʿadhābi allāhi aw taʾtiyahumu al-sāʿatu baghtatan wa hum lā yashʿurūn

verses.eng: Say, 'This is my way; I invite to Allah with insight, I and those who follow me. And exalted is Allah; and I am not of those who associate others with Him.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَـٰذِهِ سَبِيلِي أَدْعُو إِلَى اللَّهِ ۚ عَلَىٰ بَصِيرَةٍ أَنَا وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَنِي ۖ وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul hādhihī sabīlī adʿū ilā allāhi ʿalā baṣīratin anā wa mani ittabaʿanī wa subḥāna allāhi wa mā anā mina al-mushrikīn

verses.eng: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed from among the people of cities. So have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah. Then will you not reason?
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُّوحِي إِلَيْهِم مِّنْ أَهْلِ الْقُرَىٰ ۗ أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۗ وَلَدَارُ الْآخِرَةِ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā arsalnā min qablika illā rijālan nūḥī ilayhim min ahli al-qurā afalam yasīrū fī al-arḍi fa yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu alladhīna min qablihum wa la-dāru al-ākhirati khayrun li-alladhīna ittaqaw a fa lā taʿqilūn

verses.eng: Until, when the messengers despaired and were certain that they had been denied, there came to them Our victory, and whoever We willed was saved. And Our punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals.
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا اسْتَيْأَسَ الرُّسُلُ وَظَنُّوا أَنَّهُمْ قَدْ كُذِبُوا جَاءَهُمْ نَصْرُنَا فَنُجِّيَ مَن نَّشَاءُ ۖ وَلَا يُرَدُّ بَأْسُنَا عَنِ الْقَوْمِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā istay-asa al-rusulu wa ẓannū annahum qad kudhibū jāʾahum naṣrunā fa nujjiya man nashāʾu wa lā yuraddu baʾsunā ʿani al-qawmi al-mujrimīn

verses.eng: There was certainly in their stories a lesson for those of understanding. Never was it [the Qur'an] a narration invented, but a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of all things and guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ كَانَ فِي قَصَصِهِمْ عِبْرَةٌ لِّأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ ۗ مَا كَانَ حَدِيثًا يُفْتَرَىٰ وَلَـٰكِن تَصْدِيقَ الَّذِي بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَتَفْصِيلَ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laqad kāna fī qaṣaṣihim ʿibratun li-ulī al-albāb mā kāna ḥadīthan yuftarā wa lākin taṣdīqa alladhī bayna yadayhi wa tafṣīla kulli shayʾin wa hudan wa raḥmatan li-qawmin yuʾminūn

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Meem, Ra. These are the verses of the Book; and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe.
verses.arabic: المر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ ۗ وَالَّذِي أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ الْحَقُّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Meem-Ra. Tilka ayatu alkitabi waallathee onzila ilayka min rabbika alhaqqu walakinna akthara annasi la yu/minoon

verses.eng: It is Allah who erected the heavens without pillars that you [can] see; then He established Himself above the Throne and made subject the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. He arranges [each] matter; He details the signs that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذِي رَفَعَ السَّمَاوَاتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَوْنَهَا ۖ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ يُدَبِّرُ الْأَمْرَ يُفَصِّلُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّكُم بِلِقَاءِ رَبِّكُمْ تُوقِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allahu allathee rafaAAa assamawati bighayri AAamadin tarawnaha thumma istawa AAala alAAarshi wasakhkhara ashshamsa walqamara kullun yajree li-ajalin musamman yudabbiru al-amra yufassilu al-ayati laAAallakum biliqa-i rabbikum tooqinoon

verses.eng: And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates; He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَدَّ الْأَرْضَ وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْهَارًا ۖ وَمِن كُلِّ الثَّمَرَاتِ جَعَلَ فِيهَا زَوْجَيْنِ اثْنَيْنِ ۖ يُغْشِي اللَّيْلَ النَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee madda al-arda wajaAAala feeha rawasiya waanaharan wamin kulli aththamarati jaAAala feeha zawjayni ithnayni yughshee allayla annahara inna fee thalika laayatin liqawmin yatafakkaroon

verses.eng: And within the land are neighboring plots and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, [growing] several from a root or otherwise, watered with one water; but We make some of them exceed others in [quality of] fruit. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.
verses.arabic: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ قِطَعٌ مُّتَجَاوِرَاتٌ وَجَنَّاتٌ مِّنْ أَعْنَابٍ وَزَرْعٌ وَنَخِيلٌ صِنْوَانٌ وَغَيْرُ صِنْوَانٍ يُسْقَىٰ بِمَاءٍ وَاحِدٍ وَنُفَضِّلُ بَعْضَهَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فِي الْأُكُلِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wafee al-ardi qitaAAun mutajawiratun wajannatun min aAAnabin wazarAAun wanakheelun sinwanun waghayru sinwanin yusqa bima-in wahidin wanufaddilu baAAdaha AAala baAAdin fee al-ukuli inna fee thalika laayatin liqawmin yaAAqiloon

verses.eng: And if you are astonished, [O Muhammad] - then astonishing is their saying, 'When we are dust, will we indeed be [brought] into a new creation?' Those are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord, and those will have shackles upon their necks, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: وَإِن تَعْجَبْ فَعَجَبٌ قَوْلُهُمْ أَإِذَا كُنَّا تُرَابًا أَإِنَّا لَفِي خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ ۗ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ الْأَغْلَالُ فِي أَعْنَاقِهِمْ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in taAAjab faAAajabun qawluhum a-itha kunna turaban a-inna lafee khalqin jadeedin ola-ika allatheena kafaroo birabbihim waola-ika al-aghlalu fee aAAnaqihim waola-ika as-habu annari hum feeha khalidoon

verses.eng: They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good, while there has already occurred before them similar punishments [to what they demand]. And indeed, your Lord is full of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing, and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty.
verses.arabic: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ الْحَسَنَةِ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهِمُ الْمَثُلَاتُ ۗ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو مَغْفِرَةٍ لِّلنَّاسِ عَلَىٰ ظُلْمِهِمْ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَشَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: WayastaAAjiloonaka bissayyi-ati qabla alhasanati waqad khalat min qablihimu almathulatu wa-inna rabbaka lathoo maghfiratin linnasi AAala thulmihim wa-inna rabbaka lashadeedu alAAiqabi

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' You are only a warner, and for every people is a guide.
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْلَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ آيَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۗ إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَلِكُلِّ قَوْمٍ هَادٍ
verses.transliteration: Wayaqoolu allatheena kafaroo lawla onzila AAalayhi ayatun min rabbihi innama anta munthirun walikulli qawmin hadin

verses.eng: Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs lose [prematurely] or exceed. And everything with Him is by due measure.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَحْمِلُ كُلُّ أُنثَىٰ وَمَا تَغِيضُ الْأَرْحَامُ وَمَا تَزْدَادُ ۖ وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ عِندَهُ بِمِقْدَارٍ
verses.transliteration: Allahu yaAAlamu ma tahmilu kullu ontha wama tagheedu al-arhamu wama tazdadu wakullu shay-in AAindahu bimiqdarin

verses.eng: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Grand, the Exalted.
verses.arabic: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ الْكَبِيرُ الْمُتَعَالِ
verses.transliteration: AAalimu alghaybi washshahadati alkabeeru almutaAAali

verses.eng: It is the same [to Him] concerning you whether one conceals [his] speech or one publicizes it and whether one is hidden by night or conspicuous [by day].
verses.arabic: سَوَاءٌ مِّنكُم مَّن أَسَرَّ الْقَوْلَ وَمَن جَهَرَ بِهِ وَمَنْ هُوَ مُسْتَخْفٍ بِاللَّيْلِ وَسَارِبٌ بِالنَّهَارِ
verses.transliteration: Sawaon minkum man asarra alqawla waman jahara bihi waman huwa mustakhfin billayli wasaribun binnahari

verses.eng: For each one are successive [angels] before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron.
verses.arabic: لَهُ مُعَقِّبَاتٌ مِّن بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ يَحْفَظُونَهُ مِنْ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُغَيِّرُ مَا بِقَوْمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُوا مَا بِأَنفُسِهِمْ ۗ وَإِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِقَوْمٍ سُوءًا فَلَا مَرَدَّ لَهُ ۚ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِ مِن وَالٍ
verses.transliteration: Lahu muAAaqqibatun min bayni yadayhi wamin khalfihi yahfathoonahu min amri Allahi inna Allaha la yughayyiru ma biqawmin hatta yughayyiroo ma bi-anfusihim wa-itha arada Allahu biqawmin soo-an fala maradda lahu wama lahum min doonihi min walin

verses.eng: It is He who shows you lightening, [causing] fear and hope, and generates the heavy clouds.
verses.arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي يُرِيكُمُ الْبَرْقَ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنشِئُ السَّحَابَ الثِّقَالَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa allathee yureekumu albarqa khawfan watamaAAan wayunshio assahaba aththiqala

verses.eng: And the thunder exalts [Allah] with praise of Him - and the angels [as well] from fear of Him - and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills while they dispute about Allah; and He is severe in assault.
verses.arabic: وَيُسَبِّحُ الرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ مِنْ خِيفَتِهِ وَيُرْسِلُ الصَّوَاعِقَ فَيُصِيبُ بِهَا مَن يَشَاءُ وَهُمْ يُجَادِلُونَ فِي اللَّهِ وَهُوَ شَدِيدُ الْمِحَالِ
verses.transliteration: Wayusabbihu arraAAdu bihamdihi walmala-ikatu min kheefatihi wayursilu assawaAAiqa fayuseebu biha man yashao wahum yujadiloona fee Allahi wahuwa shadeedu almihali

verses.eng: To Him [alone] is the supplication of truth. And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches his hands toward water [from afar, calling it] to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it [thus]. And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error [i.e., futility].
verses.arabic: لَهُ دَعْوَةُ الْحَقِّ ۖ وَالَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ لَا يَسْتَجِيبُونَ لَهُم بِشَيْءٍ إِلَّا كَبَاسِطِ كَفَّيْهِ إِلَى الْمَاءِ لِيَبْلُغَ فَاهُ وَمَا هُوَ بِبَالِغِهِ ۚ وَمَا دُعَاءُ الْكَافِرِينَ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ
verses.transliteration: Lahu daAAwatu alhaqqi waallatheena yadAAoona min doonihi la yastajeeboona lahum bishay-in illa kabasiti kaffayhi ila almai liyablugha fahu wama huwa bibalighihi wama duAAao alkafireena illa fee dalalin

verses.eng: And to Allah prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and their shadows [as well] in the mornings and the afternoons.
verses.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا وَظِلَالُهُم بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالْآصَالِ ۩
verses.transliteration: Walillahi yasjudu man fee assamawati wal-ardi tawAAan wakaran wathilaluhum bialghuduwwi wal-asali

verses.eng: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and earth?" Say, "Allah." Say, "Have you then taken besides Him allies not possessing [even] for themselves any benefit or any harm?" Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Or is darkness equivalent to light? Or have they attributed to Allah partners who created like His creation so that the creation [of each] seemed similar to them?" Say, "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing."
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قُلْ أَفَٱتَّخَذْتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمْ نَفْعًۭا وَلَا ضَرًّۭا ۚ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْبَصِيرُ أَمْ هَلْ تَسْتَوِى ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتُ وَٱلنُّورُ ۗ أَمْ جَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ خَلَقُوا۟ كَخَلْقِهِۦ فَتَشَـٰبَهَ ٱلْخَلْقُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ خَـٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَهُوَ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّـٰرُ
verses.transliteration: Qul man rabbu as-samawati wal-ard quli Allahu qul afattakhadhtum min doonihi awliyaa la yamlikoona li-anfusihim naf'an wa la darran qul hal yastawi al-a'ma wal-baseeru am hal tastawi ath-thulumatu wan-noor am ja'aloo lillahi shurakaa khalaqoo ka-khalqihi fatashabaha al-khalqu 'alayhim quli Allahu khaliqo kulli shayin wa huwa al-Wahid al-Qahhar

verses.eng: He sends down from the sky rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a rising foam. And from that [ore] which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils, is a foam like it. Thus Allah presents [the example of] truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off; but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth. Thus does Allah present examples.
verses.arabic: أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَسَالَتْ أَوْدِيَةٌۢ بِقَدَرِهَا فَٱحْتَمَلَ ٱلسَّيْلُ زَبَدًۭا رَّابِيًۭا ۖ وَمِمَّا يُوقِدُونَ عَلَيْهِ فِى ٱلنَّارِ ٱبْتِغَآءَ حِلْيَةٍ أَوْ مَتَـٰعٍۢ زَبَدٌۭ مِّثْلُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحَقَّ وَٱلْبَـٰطِلَ ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلزَّبَدُ فَيَذْهَبُ جُفَآءًۭ ۖ وَأَمَّا مَا يَنفَعُ ٱلنَّاسَ فَيَمْكُثُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ
verses.transliteration: Anzala min as-samaa'i maa'an fa-saalat awdiyatun bi-qadariha fahtamala as-saylu zabadan raabiyan wa mimma yooqidoona 'alayhi fi an-nari ibtighaa'a hilyatin aw mataa'in zabadun mithluhu kathalika yadribu Allahu al-haqqa wal-batila fa-amma az-zabadu fa-yadhhabu jufaa'an wa amma ma yanfa'u an-nasa fa-yamkuthu fi al-ardi kathalika yadribu Allahu al-amthal

verses.eng: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward], but those who did not respond to Him - if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby. Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.
verses.arabic: لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَجَابُوا۟ لِرَبِّهِمُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ لَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُۥ لَوْ أَنَّ لَهُم مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًۭا وَمِثْلَهُۥ مَعَهُۥ لَٱفْتَدَوْا۟ بِهِۦٓ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْحِسَابِ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
verses.transliteration: Lilladhina istajaboo li-rabbihim al-husna walladhina lam yastajeeboo lahu law anna lahum ma fi al-ardi jamee'an wa mithlahu ma'ahu laftadaw bihi ulaika lahum soo'u al-hisabi wa ma'wahum jahannamu wa bi'sa al-mihad

verses.eng: Then, is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? Only those will be reminded who are people of understanding -
verses.arabic: أَفَمَن يَعْلَمُ أَنَّمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلْحَقُّ كَمَنْ هُوَ أَعْمَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
verses.transliteration: Afaman ya'lamu annama unzila ilayka min rabbika al-haqqu kaman huwa a'ma innama yatadhakkaru uloo al-albab

verses.eng: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract,
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُوفُونَ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا يَنقُضُونَ ٱلْمِيثَـٰقَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina yufoona bi'ahdi Allahi wa la yanqudoona al-meethaq

verses.eng: And those who join that which Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَصِلُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ وَيَخَافُونَ سُوٓءَ ٱلْحِسَابِ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina yasiloona ma amara Allahu bihi an yoosala wa yakhshawna rabbahum wa yakhafoona soo'a al-hisab

verses.eng: And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of [this] home -
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ ٱبْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَأَنفَقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ سِرًّۭا وَعَلَانِيَةًۭ وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina sabaroo ibtighaa'a wajhi rabbihim wa aqamoo as-salata wa anfaqoo mimma razaqnahum sirran wa 'alaniyatan wa yadra'oona bil-hasanati as-sayyi'ata ulaika lahum 'uqba ad-dar

verses.eng: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter with whoever were righteous among their forefathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],
verses.arabic: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ يَدْخُلُونَهَا وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنْ ءَابَآئِهِمْ وَأَزْوَٰجِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِهِمْ ۖ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَدْخُلُونَ عَلَيْهِم مِّن كُلِّ بَابٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Jannatu 'adnin yadkhuloonaha wa man salaha min aba'ihim wa azwajihim wa dhurriyyatihim wal-malaikatu yadkhuloona 'alayhim min kulli bab

verses.eng: "Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. And excellent is the final home."
verses.arabic: سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُم بِمَا صَبَرْتُمْ ۚ فَنِعْمَ عُقْبَى ٱلدَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Salamun 'alaykum bima sabartum fa ni'ma 'uqba ad-dar

verses.eng: But those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مِيثَـٰقِهِۦ وَيَقْطَعُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمُ ٱللَّعْنَةُ وَلَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلدَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Walladhina yanqudoona 'ahda Allahi min ba'di meethaqihi wa yaqta'oona ma amara Allahu bihi an yoosala wa yufsidoona fi al-ardi ulaika lahumu al-la'natu wa lahum soo'u ad-dar

verses.eng: Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.
verses.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ وَفَرِحُوا۟ بِٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِلَّا مَتَـٰعٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Allahu yabsutu ar-rizqa liman yashaa'u wa yaqdiru wa farihoo bil-hayati ad-dunya wa ma al-hayatu ad-dunya fil-akhirati illa mata'un

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] -
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِىٓ إِلَيْهِ مَنْ أَنَابَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqoolu alladhina kafaroo lawla unzila 'alayhi ayatun min rabbihi qul inna Allaha yudillu man yashaa'u wa yahdee ilayhi man anab

verses.eng: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured."
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَطْمَئِنُّ قُلُوبُهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَا بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ ٱلْقُلُوبُ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina amanoo wa tatma'innu quloobuhum bi-dhikri Allahi ala bi-dhikri Allahi tatma'innu al-quloob

verses.eng: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ طُوبَىٰ لَهُمْ وَحُسْنُ مَـَٔابٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina amanoo wa 'amiloo as-salihati tooba lahum wa husnu ma'ab

verses.eng: Thus have We sent you to a community before which [other] communities have passed on so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return."
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ أَرْسَلْنَاكَ فِي أُمَّةٍ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهَا أُمَمٌ لِّتَتْلُوَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ وَهُمْ يَكْفُرُونَ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ قُلْ هُوَ رَبِّي لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَإِلَيْهِ مَتَابِ
verses.transliteration: Kadhalika arsalnaka fee ommatin qad khalat min qabliha omamun litatlua AAalayhimu allathee awhayna ilayka wahum yakfuroona bi alrrahmani qul huwa rabbee la ilaha illa huwa AAalayhi tawakkaltu wa-ilayhi matabi

verses.eng: And if there was any Qur'an by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur'an], but to Allah belongs the matter entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allah willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in [His] promise.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ قُرْآنًا سُيِّرَتْ بِهِ الْجِبَالُ أَوْ قُطِّعَتْ بِهِ الْأَرْضُ أَوْ كُلِّمَ بِهِ الْمَوْتَىٰ بَلْ لِلَّهِ الْأَمْرُ جَمِيعًا أَفَلَمْ يَيْأَسِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنْ لَوْ يَشَاءُ اللَّهُ لَهَدَى النَّاسَ جَمِيعًا وَلَا يَزَالُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا تُصِيبُهُمْ بِمَا صَنَعُوا قَارِعَةٌ أَوْ تَحُلُّ قَرِيبًا مِنْ دَارِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَ وَعْدُ اللَّهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ الْمِيعَادَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law anna qur'anan suyyirat bihi aljibalu aw qutti'at bihi al-ardu aw kullima bihi almawta bal lillahi al-amru jamee'an afalam yay-asi allatheena amanoo an law yashao Allahu lahadan nassa jamee'an wala yazalu allatheena kafaroo tuseebuhum bima sana'oo qari'atun aw tahullu qareebun min darihim hatta yatiya wa'du Allahi inna Allaha la yukhlifu almee'ad

verses.eng: And certainly were messengers ridiculed before you, but I gave respite to those who disbelieved, then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدِ اسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ فَأَمْلَيْتُ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهُمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عِقَابِ
verses.transliteration: Walaqadi ustuhzi-a birusulin min qablika fa-amlaytu lillatheena kafaroo thumma akhadhtuhum fakayfa kana 'iqab

verses.eng: Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul, [knowing] what it has earned, [like any other]? But they have attributed to Allah partners. Say, "Name them. Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth or of what is apparent of speech?" Nay, their [evil] plotting has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have been averted from the way. And whomever Allah leaves astray - there will be for him no guide.
verses.arabic: أَفَمَنْ هُوَ قَائِمٌ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ وَجَعَلُوا لِلَّهِ شُرَكَاءَ قُلْ سَمُّوهُمْ أَمْ تُنَبِّئُونَهُ بِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ بِظَاهِرٍ مِنَ الْقَوْلِ بَلْ زُيِّنَ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مَكْرُهُمْ وَصُدُّوا عَنِ السَّبِيلِ وَمَنْ يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ هَادٍ
verses.transliteration: Afaman huwa qa-imun 'ala kulli nafsin bima kasabat waja'aloo lillahi shurakaa qul sammoohum am tunabbi-oonahu bima la ya'lamu fee al-ardi am bithahirin mina alqawli bal zuyyina lillatheena kafaroo makruhum wasuddoo 'ani alssabeeli waman yudlili Allahu fama lahu min hadin

verses.eng: For them is punishment in the life of this world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allah any protector.
verses.arabic: لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَشَقُّ وَمَا لَهُمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِنْ وَاقٍ
verses.transliteration: Lahum 'athabun fee alhayati alddunya wala'athabu al-akhirati ashaqqu wama lahum mina Allahi min waqin

verses.eng: The description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow; its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.
verses.arabic: مَثَلُ الْجَنَّةِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ أُكُلُهَا دَائِمٌ وَظِلُّهَا تِلْكَ عُقْبَى الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا وَعُقْبَى الْكَافِرِينَ النَّارُ
verses.transliteration: Mathalu aljannati allatee wu'ida almuttaqoona tajree min tahtiha al-anharu okuluha da-imun wathilluha tilka 'uqba allatheena ittaqaw wa'uqba alkafireena alnnaru

verses.eng: And those to whom We have given the Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], but among the [opposing] factions are those who deny part of it. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not associate [anything] with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ يَفْرَحُونَ بِمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكَ وَمِنَ الْأَحْزَابِ مَنْ يُنْكِرُ بَعْضَهُ قُلْ إِنَّمَا أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ اللَّهَ وَلَا أُشْرِكَ بِهِ إِلَيْهِ أَدْعُو وَإِلَيْهِ مَآبِ
verses.transliteration: Waallatheena ataynahumu alkitaba yafrahoona bima onzila ilayka wamina al-ahzabi man yunkiru ba'dahu qul innama omirtu an a'buda Allaha wala oshrika bihi ilayhi ad'oo wa-ilayhi maabi

verses.eng: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allah any ally or any protector.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ حُكْمًا عَرَبِيًّا وَلَئِنِ اتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ بَعْدَمَا جَاءَكَ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ مَا لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِنْ وَلِيٍّ وَلَا وَاقٍ
verses.transliteration: Wakathalika anzalnahu hukman 'arabiyyan wala-ini ittaba'ta ahwaahum ba'dama jaaka mina al'ilmi ma laka mina Allahi min waliyyin wala waqin

verses.eng: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلًا مِنْ قَبْلِكَ وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ أَزْوَاجًا وَذُرِّيَّةً وَمَا كَانَ لِرَسُولٍ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ بِآيَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ لِكُلِّ أَجَلٍ كِتَابٌ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalna rusulan min qablika waja'alna lahum azwajan wathurriyyatan wama kana lirasoolin an ya/tiya bi-ayatin illa bi-ithni Allahi likulli ajalin kitabun

verses.eng: Allah eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book.
verses.arabic: يَمْحُو اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ وَيُثْبِتُ وَعِنْدَهُ أُمُّ الْكِتَابِ
verses.transliteration: Yamhu Allahu ma yashao wayuthbitu wa'indahu ummu alkitabi

verses.eng: And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ مَا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ الَّذِي نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ الْبَلَاغُ وَعَلَيْنَا الْحِسَابُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in ma nuriyannaka ba'da allathee na'iduhum aw natawaffayannaka fa-innama 'alayka albalaghu wa'alayna alhisabu

verses.eng: Have they not seen that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allah decides; there is no adjuster of His decision. And He is swift in account.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا نَأْتِي الْأَرْضَ نَنْقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا وَاللَّهُ يَحْكُمُ لَا مُعَقِّبَ لِحُكْمِهِ وَهُوَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
verses.transliteration: Awalam yaraw anna na/tee al-arda nanqusuha min atrafiha waAllahu yahkumu la mu'aqqiba lihukmihi wahuwa saree'u alhisabi

verses.eng: And those before them had plotted, but to Allah belongs the plan entirely. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.
verses.arabic: وَقَدْ مَكَرَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَلِلَّهِ الْمَكْرُ جَمِيعًا يَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْسِبُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الْكُفَّارُ لِمَنْ عُقْبَى الدَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Waqad makara allatheena min qablihim falillahi almakru jamee'an ya'lamu ma taksibu kullu nafsin wasaya'lamu alkuffaru liman 'uqba alddari

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say, "You are not a messenger." Say, [O Muhammad], "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you, and [the witness of] whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَسْتَ مُرْسَلًا قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكُمْ وَمَنْ عِنْدَهُ عِلْمُ الْكِتَابِ
verses.transliteration: Wayaqoolu allatheena kafaroo lasta mursalan qul kafa biAllahi shaheedan baynee wabaynakum waman 'indahu 'ilmu alkitabi

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light by permission of their Lord - to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -
verses.arabic: الر ۚ كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ لِتُخْرِجَ النَّاسَ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Ra. Kitabun anzalnahu ilayka litukhrija annasa mina aththulumati ila annoori biithni rabbihim ila sirati alAAazeezi alhameed

verses.eng: Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe punishment
verses.arabic: اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ وَوَيْلٌ لِّلْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Allahi allathee lahu ma fee assamawati wama fee alardi wawaylun lilkafireena min AAathabin shadeed

verses.eng: The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allah, seeking to make it (seem) deviant. Those are in extreme error.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَسْتَحِبُّونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا عَلَى الْآخِرَةِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Allatheena yastahibboona alhayata addunya AAala alakhirati wayasuddoona AAan sabeeli Allahi wayabghoonaha AAiwajan olaika fee dalalin baAAeed

verses.eng: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا بِلِسَانِ قَوْمِهِ لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمْ ۖ فَيُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wama arsalna min rasoolin illa bilisani qawmihi liyubayyina lahum fayudillu Allahu man yashao wayahdee man yashao wahuwa alAAazeezu alhakeem

verses.eng: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring out your people from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allah." Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا أَنْ أَخْرِجْ قَوْمَكَ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ وَذَكِّرْهُم بِأَيَّامِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّكُلِّ صَبَّارٍ شَكُورٍ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalna moosa biayatina an akhrij qawmaka mina aththulumati ila annoori wathakkirhum biayyami Allahi inna fee thalika laayatin likulli sabbarin shakoor

verses.eng: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when Moses said to his people, "Remember the favor of Allah upon you when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst torment and were slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ أَنجَاكُم مِّنْ آلِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ وَيُذَبِّحُونَ أَبْنَاءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَاءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكُم بَلَاءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Waith qala moosa liqawmihi othkuroo niAAmata Allahi AAalaykum ith anjakum min ali firAAawna yasoomoonakum sooa alAAathabi wayuthabbihoona abnaakum wayastahyoona nisaakum wafee thalikum balaon min rabbikum AAatheem

verses.eng: And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'"
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُمْ لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِي لَشَدِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Waith taaththana rabbukum lain shakartum laazeedannakum walain kafartum inna AAathabee lashadeed

verses.eng: And Moses said, "If you should disbelieve, you and whoever is on the earth entirely - indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ إِن تَكْفُرُوا أَنتُمْ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَغَنِيٌّ حَمِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Waqala moosa in takfuroo antum waman fee alardi jameeAAan fainna Allaha laghaniyyun hameed

verses.eng: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَبَأُ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَعَادٍ وَثَمُودَ ۛ وَالَّذِينَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ ۛ لَا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۛ جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَرَدُّوا أَيْدِيَهُمْ فِي أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَقَالُوا إِنَّا كَفَرْنَا بِمَا أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِ وَإِنَّا لَفِي شَكٍّ مِّمَّا تَدْعُونَنَا إِلَيْهِ مُرِيبٍ
verses.transliteration: Alam yatikum nabaou allatheena min qablikum qawmi noohin waAAadin wathamooda wallatheena min baAAdihim la yaAAlamuhum illa Allahu jaathum rusuluhum bilbayyinati faraddoo aydeehum fee afwahihim waqaloo inna kafarna bima orsiltum bihi wainna lafee shakkin mimma tadAAoonana ilayhi mureeb

verses.eng: Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allah, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays your death for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority."
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ رُسُلُهُمْ أَفِي اللَّهِ شَكٌّ فَاطِرِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِيَغْفِرَ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرَكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ قَالُوا إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا تُرِيدُونَ أَن تَصُدُّونَا عَمَّا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُنَا فَأْتُونَا بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Qalat rusuluhum afee Allahi shakkun fatiri assamawati walardi yadAAookum liyaghfira lakum min thunoobikum wayuakhkhirakum ila ajalin musamma qaloo in antum illa basharun mithluna tureedoona an tasuddoona AAamma kana yaAAbudu abaona fatoona bisultanin mubeen

verses.eng: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allah confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely."
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ لَهُمْ رُسُلُهُمْ إِن نَّحْنُ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يَمُنُّ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا أَن نَّأْتِيَكُم بِسُلْطَانٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qalat lahum rusuluhum in nahnu illa basharun mithlukum walakinna Allaha yamunnu AAala man yashao min AAibadihi wama kana lana an natiyakum bisultanin illa biithni Allahi waAAala Allahi falyatawakkali almuminoon

verses.eng: And why should we not rely upon Allah while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allah let those who would rely [indeed] rely."
verses.arabic: وَمَا لَنَا أَلَّا نَتَوَكَّلَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَقَدْ هَدَانَا سُبُلَنَا ۚ وَلَنَصْبِرَنَّ عَلَىٰ مَا آذَيْتُمُونَا ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama lana alla natawakkala AAala Allahi waqad hadana subulana walanasbiranna AAala ma athaytumoona waAAala Allahi falyatawakkali almutawakkiloon

verses.eng: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِرُسُلِهِمْ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِنَا أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِي مِلَّتِنَا ۖ فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ لَنُهْلِكَنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqala allatheena kafaroo lirusulihim lanukhrijannakum min ardina aw lataAAoodunna fee millatina faawha ilayhim rabbuhum lanuhlikanna aththalimeen

verses.eng: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."
verses.arabic: وَلَنُسْكِنَنَّكُمُ الْأَرْضَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامِي وَخَافَ وَعِيدِ
verses.transliteration: Walanuskinnakumu alarda min baAAdihim thalika liman khafa maqamee wakhafa waAAeed

verses.eng: And they requested victory from Allah, and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.
verses.arabic: وَاسْتَفْتَحُوا وَخَابَ كُلُّ جَبَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Wastaftahoo wakhaba kullu jabbarin AAaneed

verses.eng: Before him is Hell, and he will be given to drink of purulent water.
verses.arabic: مِّن وَرَائِهِ جَهَنَّمُ وَيُسْقَىٰ مِن مَّاءٍ صَدِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Min warāihi jahannamu wa yusqā min mā'in �adīd.

verses.eng: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.
verses.arabic: يَتَجَرَّعُهُۥ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُسِيغُهُۥ وَيَأْتِيهِ ٱلْمَوْتُ مِن كُلِّ مَكَانٍ وَمَا هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍ وَمِن وَرَآئِهِۦ عَذَابٌ غَلِيظٌ
verses.transliteration: Yatajarraʿuhu walā yakādu yusīghuhu wa yaʾtīhi l-mawtu min kulli makānin wa mā huwa bimayyitin wa min warāihi ʿadhābun ghalīẓ.

verses.eng: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.
verses.arabic: مَّثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ كَرَمَادٍ ٱشْتَدَّتْ بِهِ ٱلرِّيحُ فِى يَوْمٍ عَاصِفٍ لَّا يَقْدِرُونَ مِمَّا كَسَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلضَّلَـٰلُ ٱلْبَعِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Mathalu alladhīna kafarū birabbihim aʿmāluhum karamādin ishtaddat bihi r-rīḥu fī yawmin ʿāṣifin lā yaqdirūna mimmā kasabū ʿalā shayʾin dhālika huwa ḍ-ḍalālu l-baʿīd.

verses.eng: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ إِن يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَأْتِ بِخَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allāha khalaqa s-samāwāti wal-arḍa bil-ḥaqqi in yashaʾ yudhhibkum wa yaʾti bikhalqin jadīd.

verses.eng: And that is not difficult for Allah.
verses.arabic: وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā dhālika ʿalā Allāhi biʿazīz.

verses.eng: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allah all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allah?" They will say, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."
verses.arabic: وَبَرَزُوا۟ لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًا فَقَالَ ٱلضُّعَفَـٰٓؤُا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا لَكُمْ تَبَعًا فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّغْنُونَ عَنَّا مِنْ عَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ قَالُوا۟ لَوْ هَدَىٰنَا ٱللَّهُ لَهَدَيْنَـٰكُمْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَجَزِعْنَا أَمْ صَبَرْنَا مَا لَنَا مِن مَّحِيصٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa barazū lillāhi jamīʿan faqāla ḍ-ḍuʿafāʾu lilladhīna stakbarū innā kunnā lakum tabaʿan fa hal antum mughnūna ʿannā min ʿadhābi Allāhi min shayʾin qālū law hadānā Allāhu lahadaynākum sawāʾun ʿalaynā ajaziʿnā am ṣabarnā mā lanā min maḥīṣ.

verses.eng: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allah had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allah] before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ لَمَّا قُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ وَعَدَكُمْ وَعْدَ ٱلْحَقِّ وَوَعَدتُّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُكُمْ وَمَا كَانَ لِىَ عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍ إِلَّآ أَن دَعَوْتُكُمْ فَٱسْتَجَبْتُمْ لِى فَلَا تَلُومُونِى وَلُومُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُم مَّآ أَنَا۠ بِمُصْرِخِكُمْ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُصْرِخِىَّ إِنِّى كَفَرْتُ بِمَآ أَشْرَكْتُمُونِ مِن قَبْلُ إِنَّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla sh-shayṭānu lammā quḍiya l-amru inna Allāha waʿadakum waʿda l-ḥaqqi wa waʿadtukum fa akhlaftukum wa mā kāna liya ʿalaykum min sulṭānin illā an daʿawtukum fa stajabtum lī falā talūmūnī wa lūmū anfusakum mā anā bimuṣrikhikum wa mā antum bimuṣrikhiya innī kafartu bimā ashraktumūni min qablu inna ẓ-ẓālimīna lahum ʿadhābun alīm.

verses.eng: And those who believed and did righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord; and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"
verses.arabic: وَأُدْخِلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ تَحِيَّتُهُمْ فِيهَا سَلَـٰمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa udkhila alladhīna āmanū wa ʿamilū �-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-anhāru khālidīna fīhā biʾidhni rabbihim taḥiyyatuhum fīhā salām.

verses.eng: Have you not considered how Allah presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًا كَلِمَةً طَيِّبَةً كَشَجَرَةٍ طَيِّبَةٍ أَصْلُهَا ثَابِتٌ وَفَرْعُهَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara kayfa ḍaraba Allāhu mathalan kalimatan ṭayyibatan kashajaratin ṭayyibatin aṣluhā thābitun wa farʿuhā fī s-samāʾ.

verses.eng: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.
verses.arabic: تُؤْتِىٓ أُكُلَهَا كُلَّ حِينٍۭ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهَا وَيَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Tuʾtī ukulahā kulla ḥīnin biʾidhni rabbihā wa yaḍribu Allāhu l-amthāla lilnnāsi laʿallahum yatadhakkarūn.

verses.eng: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.
verses.arabic: وَمَثَلُ كَلِمَةٍ خَبِيثَةٍ كَشَجَرَةٍ خَبِيثَةٍ ٱجْتُثَّتْ مِن فَوْقِ ٱلْأَرْضِ مَا لَهَا مِن قَرَارٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mathalu kalimatin khabīthatin kashajaratin khabīthatin ijtuṯṯhat min fawqi l-arḍi mā lahā min qarār.

verses.eng: Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills.
verses.arabic: يُثَبِّتُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱلْقَوْلِ ٱلثَّابِتِ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَيُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ وَيَفْعَلُ ٱللَّهُ مَا يَشَآءُ
verses.transliteration: Yuthabbitu Allāhu alladhīna āmanū bil-qawli th-thābiti fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa fī l-ākhirati wa yuḍillu Allāhu ẓ-ẓālimīna wa yafʿalu Allāhu mā yashāʾ.

verses.eng: Have you not seen those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ بَدَّلُوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ كُفْرًا وَأَحَلُّوا۟ قَوْمَهُمْ دَارَ ٱلْبَوَارِ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara ilā alladhīna baddalū niʿmata Allāhi kufran wa aḥallū qawmahum dāra l-bawār.

verses.eng: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.
verses.arabic: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا وَبِئْسَ ٱلْقَرَارُ
verses.transliteration: Jahannama yaṣlawnahā wa biʾsa l-qarār.

verses.eng: And they have attributed to Allah equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا لِّيُضِلُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ قُلْ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ فَإِنَّ مَصِيرَكُمْ إِلَى ٱلنَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Wa jaʿalū lillāhi andādan liyuḍillū ʿan sabīlihi qul tamattaʿū fa inna maṣīrakum ilā n-nār.

verses.eng: Tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange [of friendship] nor any ransom.
verses.arabic: قُل لِّعِبَادِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ سِرًّا وَعَلَانِيَةً مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِىَ يَوْمٌ لَّا بَيْعٌ فِيهِ وَلَا خِلَـٰلٌ
verses.transliteration: Qul li'ibadiya alladhīna āmanū yuqīmū al-ṣalata wayunfiqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirran wa'alāniyatan min qabli an yatiya yawmun lā bay'un fīhi wa lā khilālun

verses.eng: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.
verses.arabic: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَخْرَجَ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ رِزْقًا لَّكُمْ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلْفُلْكَ لِتَجْرِىَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ بِأَمْرِهِۦ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرَ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu alladhī khalaqa al-samāwāti wa al-arḍa wa anzala mina al-samā'i mā'an fa akhraja bihi mina al-thamarāti rizqan lakum wa sakhkhara lakumu al-fulka litajriya fī al-baḥri bi amrihi wa sakhkhara lakumu al-anhār

verses.eng: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.
verses.arabic: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ دَآئِبَيْنِ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ
verses.transliteration: Wa sakhkhara lakumu al-shamsa wa al-qamara dā'ibayni wa sakhkhara lakumu al-layla wa al-nahār

verses.eng: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.
verses.arabic: وَءَاتَىٰكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُ وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَظَلُومٌ كَفَّارٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa ātākum min kulli mā sa'altumūhu wa in ta'uddū ni'mata Allāhi lā tuḥṣūhā inna al-insāna laẓalūmun kaffār

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْ هَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدَ ءَامِنًا وَٱجْنُبْنِى وَبَنِىَّ أَن نَّعْبُدَ ٱلْأَصْنَامَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idh qāla Ibrāhīmu rabbi ij'al hādhā al-balada āminan wa ajnubnī wa baniyya an na'bud al-aṣnām

verses.eng: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: رَبِّ إِنَّهُنَّ أَضْلَلْنَ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ فَمَن تَبِعَنِى فَإِنَّهُۥ مِنِّى وَمَنْ عَصَانِى فَإِنَّكَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi innahunna aḍlalna kathīran mina al-nāsi fa man tabi'anī fa innahu minnī wa man 'aṣānī fa innaka ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.
verses.arabic: رَّبَّنَآ إِنِّىٓ أَسْكَنتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِى بِوَادٍ غَيْرِ ذِى زَرْعٍ عِندَ بَيْتِكَ ٱلْمُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ فَٱجْعَلْ أَفْـِٔدَةً مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ تَهْوِىٓ إِلَيْهِمْ وَٱرْزُقْهُم مِّنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbana innī askantu min dhurriyyatī biwādin ghayri dhī zar'in 'inda baytika al-muḥarrami rabbanā liyuqīmū al-ṣalata fa ij'al af'idatan mina al-nāsi tahwī ilayhim wa urzuqhum mina al-thamarāti la'allahum yashkurūn

verses.eng: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.
verses.arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ مَا نُخْفِى وَمَا نُعْلِنُ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
verses.transliteration: Rabbana innaka ta'lamu mā nukhfī wa mā nu'linu wa mā yakhfā 'alā Allāhi min shay'in fī al-arḍi wa lā fī al-samā'i

verses.eng: Praise to Allah, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.
verses.arabic: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى وَهَبَ لِى عَلَى ٱلْكِبَرِ إِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَسَمِيعُ ٱلدُّعَآءِ
verses.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī wahaba lī 'alā al-kibari Ismā'īla wa Isḥāqa inna rabbī lasamī'u al-du'ā'i

verses.eng: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
verses.arabic: رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْنِى مُقِيمَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِى رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَآءِ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi ij'alnī muqīma al-ṣalati wa min dhurriyyatī rabbanā wa taqabbal du'ā'i

verses.eng: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established.
verses.arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلْحِسَابُ
verses.transliteration: Rabbana ighfir lī wa liwālidayya wa lilmu'minīna yawma yaqūmu al-ḥisāb

verses.eng: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَـٰفِلًا عَمَّا يَعْمَلُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ إِنَّمَا يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ تَشْخَصُ فِيهِ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taḥsabanna Allāha ghāfilan 'ammā ya'malu al-ẓālimūna innamā yu'akhkhiruhum liyawmin tashkhaṣu fīhi al-abṣār

verses.eng: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void.
verses.arabic: مُهْطِعِينَ مُقْنِعِى رُءُوسِهِمْ لَا يَرْتَدُّ إِلَيْهِمْ طَرْفُهُمْ وَأَفْـِٔدَتُهُمْ هَوَآءٌ
verses.transliteration: Muḥṭi'īna muqni'ī ru'ūsihim lā yartaddu ilayhim ṭarfuhum wa af'idatuhum hawā'

verses.eng: And, [O Muhammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, 'Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers.' [But it will be said], 'Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?
verses.arabic: وَأَنذِرِ ٱلنَّاسَ يَوْمَ يَأْتِيهِمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ فَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ أَخِّرْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ قَرِيبٍ نُّجِبْ دَعْوَتَكَ وَنَتَّبِعِ ٱلرُّسُلَ أَوَلَمْ تَكُونُوٓا۟ أَقْرَرْتُم مِّن قَبْلُ مَا لَكُم مِّن زَوَالٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa andhiri al-nāsa yawma ya'tīhimu al-'adhābu fa yaqūlu alladhīna ẓalamū rabbanā akhkhirnā ilā ajalin qarībin nujib da'wataka wa nattabi'i al-rusula a wa lam takūnū aqrar tum min qablu mā lakum min zawāl

verses.eng: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [their] examples.
verses.arabic: وَسَكَنتُمْ فِى مَسَـٰكِنِ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمْ كَيْفَ فَعَلْنَا بِهِمْ وَضَرَبْنَا لَكُمُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ
verses.transliteration: Wa sakantum fī masākini alladhīna ẓalamū anfusahum wa tabayyana lakum kayfa fa'alnā bihim wa ḍarabnā lakumu al-amthāl

verses.eng: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you examples.
verses.arabic: وَسَكَنتُم فِي مَسٰكِنِ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا أَنفُسَهُم وَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُم كَيفَ فَعَلنا بِهِم وَضَرَبنا لَكُمُ الأَمثالَ
verses.transliteration: Wa sakantum fee masakiniallatheena thalamoo anfusahum watabayyana lakum kayfa fa'alna bihim wadarabna lakumul-amthala

verses.eng: And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.
verses.arabic: وَقَد مَكَروا مَكرَهُم وَعِندَ اللَّهِ مَكرُهُم وَإِن كانَ مَكرُهُم لِتَزولَ مِنهُ الجِبالُ
verses.transliteration: Wa qad makaroo makrahum wa 'indAllahi makruhum wa in kana makruhum litazoola minhul-jibalu

verses.eng: So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
verses.arabic: فَلا تَحسَبَنَّ اللَّهَ مُخلِفَ وَعدِهِ رُسُلَهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ ذُو انتِقامٍ
verses.transliteration: Fala tahsabanna Allaha mukhlifa wa'dihi rusulahu inna Allaha 'azeezun thoo intiqam

verses.eng: The Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
verses.arabic: يَومَ تُبَدَّلُ الأَرضُ غَيرَ الأَرضِ وَالسَّمٰوٰتُ ۖ وَبَرَزوا لِلَّهِ الوٰحِدِ القَهّارِ
verses.transliteration: Yawma tubaddalu al-ardu ghayra al-ardi wassamawatu wabarazoo lillahi alwahidi alqahhar

verses.eng: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,
verses.arabic: وَتَرَى المُجرِمينَ يَومَئِذٍ مُقَرَّنينَ فِي الأَصفادِ
verses.transliteration: Watara almujrimeena yawma-ithin muqarraneena fee alasfad

verses.eng: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.
verses.arabic: سَرابيلُهُم مِن قَطرانٍ وَتَغشىٰ وُجوهَهُمُ النّارُ
verses.transliteration: Sarabeeluhum min qatranin wataghsha wujoohahumu annar

verses.eng: So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
verses.arabic: لِيَجزِيَ اللَّهُ كُلَّ نَفسٍ ما كَسَبَت ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
verses.transliteration: Liyajziya Allahu kulla nafsin ma kasabat inna Allaha saree'u alhisab

verses.eng: This is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.
verses.arabic: هٰذا بَلٰغٌ لِلنّاسِ وَلِيُنذَروا بِهِ وَلِيَعلَموا أَنَّما هُوَ إِلٰهٌ وٰحِدٌ وَلِيَذَّكَّرَ أُولُو الأَلبابِ
verses.transliteration: Hatha balaghun linnasi waliyuntharoo bihi waliya'lamoo annama huwa ilahun wahidun waliyaththakkara ooloo al-albab

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.
verses.arabic: الٓرۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَقُرْءَانٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Ra. Tilka ayatu alkitabi waqur-anin mubeen

verses.eng: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish they had been Muslims.
verses.arabic: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Rubama yawaddu allatheena kafaroo law kanoo muslimeen

verses.eng: Leave them to eat and enjoy, and let them be preoccupied with hope, for they are going to know.
verses.arabic: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا۟ وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ وَيُلْهِهِمُ ٱلْأَمَلُۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Tharhum ya/kuloo wayatamattaAAoo wayulhihimu alamalu fasawfa yaAAlamoon

verses.eng: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَـٰبٌۭ مَّعْلُومٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wama ahlakna min qaryatin illa walaha kitabun maAAloom

verses.eng: No nation can advance its term, nor can it delay it.
verses.arabic: مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ma tasbiqu min ommatin ajalaha wama yasta/khiroon

verses.eng: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِى نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Waqaloo ya ayyuha allathee nuzzila AAalayhi alththikru innaka lamajnoon

verses.eng: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"
verses.arabic: لَّوْمَا تَأْتِينَا بِٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lawma ta/teena bialmala-ikati in kunta mina alssadiqeen

verses.eng: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.
verses.arabic: مَا نُنَزِّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوٓا۟ إِذًۭا مُّنظَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ma nunazzilu almala-ikata illa bialhaqqi wama kanoo ithan munthareen

verses.eng: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.
verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا ٱلذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna nahnu nazzalna alththikra wa-inna lahu lahafithoon

verses.eng: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِى شِيَعِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalna min qablika fee shiyaAAi al-awwaleen

verses.eng: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.
verses.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama ya/teehim min rasoolin illa kanoo bihi yastahzi-oon

verses.eng: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُۥ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kathalika naslukuhu fee quloobi almujrimeen

verses.eng: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.
verses.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۖ وَقَدْ مَضَتْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: La yu/minoona bihi waqad madat sunnatu al-awwaleen

verses.eng: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَظَلُّوا۟ فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw fatahna AAalayhim baban mina alssama-i fathalloo feehi yaAArujoon

verses.eng: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
verses.arabic: لَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَـٰرُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌۭ مَّسْحُورُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laqaloo innama sukkirat absaruna bal nahnu qawmun mashooroon

verses.eng: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad jaʿalnā fī al-samāʾi burūjan wazayyannāhā lilnnāẓirīna

verses.eng: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]
verses.arabic: وَحَفِظْنَاهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ رَّجِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Waḥafiẓnāhā min kulli shayṭānin rajīmin

verses.eng: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَرَقَ ٱلسَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Illā mani is'taraqa al-samʿa fa'atbaʿahu shihābun mubīnun

verses.eng: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.
verses.arabic: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ مَّوْزُونٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Wal-arḍa madadnāhā wa'alqaynā fīhā rawāsiya wa'anbatnā fīhā min kulli shay'in mawzūnin

verses.eng: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَـٰيِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُۥ بِرَٰزِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wajaʿalnā lakum fīhā maʿāyisha waman lastum lahu birazīqīna

verses.eng: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.
verses.arabic: وَإِن مِّن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَآئِنُهُۥ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in min shay'in illā ʿindanā khazāinuhu wamā nunazziluhu illā biqadarin maʿlūmin

verses.eng: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.
verses.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَا ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ لَوَٰقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَسْقَيْنَـٰكُمُوهُ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِخَـٰزِنِيهِ
verses.transliteration: Wa'arsalnā al-riyāḥa lawāqiḥa fa'anzalnā min al-samāʾi māʾan fa'asqaynākumūhu wamā antum bikhāzinīhi

verses.eng: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ ٱلْوَٰرِثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa'innā lanaḥnu nuḥ'yī wanumītu wanaḥnu al-wārithūna

verses.eng: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَـْٔخِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad ʿalimnā al-mustaqdimīna minkum walaqad ʿalimnā al-mustaʾkhirīna

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka huwa yaḥshuruhum innahu ḥakīmun ʿalīmun

verses.eng: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍۢ مِّنْ حَمَإٍۢ مَّسْنُونٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad khalaqnā al-insāna min ṣalṣālin min ḥamaʾin masnūnin

verses.eng: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.
verses.arabic: وَٱلْجَآنَّ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ ٱلسَّمُومِ
verses.transliteration: Wal-jāna khalaqnāhu min qablu min nāri al-samūmi

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّى خَـٰلِقٌۢ بَشَرًۭا مِّن صَلْصَـٰلٍۢ مِّنْ حَمَإٍۢ مَّسْنُونٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh qāla rabbuka lilmalāikati innī khāliqun basharan min ṣalṣālin min ḥamaʾin masnūnin

verses.eng: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُۥ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِى فَقَعُوا۟ لَهُۥ سَـٰجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-idhā sawwaytuhu wanafakhtu fīhi min rūḥī faqaʿū lahu sājidīna

verses.eng: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.
verses.arabic: فَسَجَدَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fasajada al-malāikatu kulluhum ajmaʿūna

verses.eng: Except Iblees (Satan), he refused to be among the prostrators.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā ibleesa abā an yakoona maʿa as-sājideen

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā ibleesu mā laka allā takoona maʿa as-sājideen

verses.eng: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lam akun li-asjuda libasharin khalaqtahu min ṣalṣālin min ḥama-in masnoon

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fakhruj minhā fa-innaka rajeem

verses.eng: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ اللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna ʿalayka al-laʿnata ilā yawmi ad-deen

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi fa-anẓirnee ilā yawmi yubʿathoon

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنظَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa-innaka mina al-munẓareen

verses.eng: Until the Day of the time well-known."
verses.arabic: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ
verses.transliteration: Ilā yawmi al-waqti al-maʿloom

verses.eng: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَغْوَيْتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi bimā aghwaytanee la-uzayyinanna lahum fee al-arḍi wa-la-ughwiyannahum ajmaʿeen

verses.eng: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
verses.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā ʿibādaka minhumu al-mukhlaṣeen

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا صِرَاطٌ عَلَيَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla hādhā ṣirāṭun ʿalayya mustaqeem

verses.eng: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَانٌ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْغَاوِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna ʿibādee laysa laka ʿalayhim sulṭānun illā mani ittabaʿaka mina al-ghāween

verses.eng: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna jahannama lamaʿduhum ajmaʿeen

verses.eng: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."
verses.arabic: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَابٍ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَّقْسُومٌ
verses.transliteration: Lahā sabʿatu abwābin likulli bābin minhum juz-un maqsoom

verses.eng: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.transliteration: Inna al-muttaqeena fee jannātin wa ʿuyoon

verses.eng: Enter it in peace, safe.
verses.arabic: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ آمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Udkhulūhā bisalāmin āminīna

verses.eng: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.
verses.arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَانًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanazaʿnā mā fī ṣudūrihim min ghillin ikhwānan ʿalā sururin mutaqābilīna

verses.eng: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.
verses.arabic: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lā yamassuhum fīhā naṣabun wamā hum minhā bimukhrajīna

verses.eng: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: نَبِّئْ عِبَادِي أَنِّي أَنَا الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Nabbiʾ ʿibādī annī anā l-ghafūru l-raḥīmu

verses.eng: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِي هُوَ الْعَذَابُ الْأَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Waanna ʿadhābī huwa l-ʿadhābu l-alīmu

verses.eng: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,
verses.arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَن ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Wanabbiʾhum ʿan ḍayfi ibrāhīma

verses.eng: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." He said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."
verses.arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idh dakhalū ʿalayhi faqālū salāman qāla innā minkum wajilūna

verses.eng: They said, "Do not fear. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."
