verses.arabic: قَالُوا لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Qālū lā tawjal innā nubashiruka bighulāmin ʿalīmin

verses.eng: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِي عَلَىٰ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ الْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla abashartumūnī ʿalā an massaniya l-kibaru fabima tubashirūna

verses.eng: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا بَشَّرْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ الْقَانِطِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū bashsharnāka bil-ḥaqqi falā takun mina l-qāniṭīna

verses.eng: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِ إِلَّا الضَّالُّونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla waman yaqnaṭu min raḥmati rabbihi illā l-ḍāllūna

verses.eng: He said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla famā khaṭbukum ayyuhā l-mursalūna

verses.eng: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,
verses.arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū innā ursilnā ilā qawmin mujrimīna

verses.eng: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all
verses.arabic: إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā āla lūṭin innā lamunajjūhum ajmaʿīna

verses.eng: Except his wife. We have decreed that she is of those who remain behind."
verses.arabic: إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَا ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā im'ra-atahu qaddarnā innahā lamina l-ghābirīna

verses.eng: So when the messengers came to the family of Lot,
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma ja aala lootin almursaloon

verses.eng: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala innakum qawmun munkaroon

verses.eng: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo bal jinaka bima kanoo feehi yamtaroon

verses.eng: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.
verses.arabic: وَأَتَيْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ataynaka bilhaqqi wa inna lasadiqoon

verses.eng: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and go where you are commanded."
verses.arabic: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱتَّبِعْ أَدْبَـٰرَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَٱمْضُوا۟ حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faasri biahlika biqitAAin mina allayli wattabiAA adbarahum wala yaltafit minkum ahadun wamdoo haythu tumaroon

verses.eng: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.
verses.arabic: وَقَضَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُّصْبِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqadayna ilayhi thalika alamra anna dabira haolai maqtooAAun musbiheen

verses.eng: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
verses.arabic: وَجَآءَ أَهْلُ ٱلْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wajaa ahlu almadeenati yastabshiroon

verses.eng: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ضَيْفِى فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qala inna haolai dayfee fala tafdahoon

verses.eng: And fear Allah and do not disgrace me."
verses.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wattaqoo Allaha wala tukhzoon

verses.eng: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo awalam nanhaka AAani alAAalameen

verses.eng: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِىٓ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala haolai banatee in kuntum faAAileen

verses.eng: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.
verses.arabic: لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِى سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: LaAAamruka innahum lafee sakratihim yaAAmahoon

verses.eng: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faakhathat-humu assayhatu mushriqeen

verses.eng: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.
verses.arabic: فَجَعَلْنَا عَـٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
verses.transliteration: FajaAAalna AAaliyaha safilahaa waamtarna AAalayhim hijaratan min sijjeel

verses.eng: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّلْمُتَوَسِّمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatin lilmutawassimeen

verses.eng: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٍ مُّقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa innahā lasabīlin muqīm

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fī dhālika laāyatan lilmu'minīn

verses.eng: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ لَظَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in kāna aṣḥābu al-aykati laẓālimīn

verses.eng: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.
verses.arabic: فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Fāntaqamnā minhum wa innahumā la-imāmin mubīn

verses.eng: And certainly did the companions of Hijr deny the messengers.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْحِجْرِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad kadhdhaba aṣḥābu al-ḥijri al-mursalīn

verses.eng: And We gave them Our signs, but they were turning away from them.
verses.arabic: وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ آيَاتِنَا فَكَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ātaynāhum āyātinā fakānū ʿanhā muʿriḍīn

verses.eng: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.
verses.arabic: وَكَانُوا يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا آمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wakānū yanḥitūna mina al-jibāli buyūtan āminīn

verses.eng: But the shriek seized them at early morning.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-akhadhathumu al-ṣayḥatu muṣ'biḥīn

verses.eng: And what they had been earning did not avail them.
verses.arabic: فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Famā aghnā ʿanhum mā kānū yaksibūn

verses.eng: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
verses.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ السَّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ ۖ فَاصْفَحِ الصَّفْحَ الْجَمِيلَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā khalaqnā al-samāwāti wal-arḍa wamā baynahumā illā bil-ḥaqqi wa-inna al-sāʿata laātiyatun faṣfaḥi al-ṣafḥa al-jamīl

verses.eng: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Inna rabbaka huwa al-khallāqu al-ʿalīm

verses.eng: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ سَبْعًا مِّنَ الْمَثَانِي وَالْقُرْآنَ الْعَظِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad ātaynāka sabʿan mina al-mathānī wal-qur'āna al-ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] groups of them, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers.
verses.arabic: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lā tamuddanna ʿaynayka ilā mā mattaʿnā bihi azwājan minhum walā taḥzan ʿalayhim wa-ikhfiḍ janāḥaka lilmu'minīn

verses.eng: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner."
verses.arabic: وَقُلْ إِنِّي أَنَا النَّذِيرُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Waqul innī anā al-nadhīru al-mubīn

verses.eng: Just as We had sent [warning] down to the dividers.
verses.arabic: كَمَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَى الْمُقْتَسِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kamā anzalnā ʿalā al-muqtasimīn

verses.eng: Those who made the Quran into portions.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ جَعَلُوا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ عِضِينَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna jaʿalū l-qur'āna ʿiḍīn

verses.eng: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all
verses.arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسْـَٔلَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fawarabbika lanas'alannahum ajmaʿīn

verses.eng: About what they used to do.
verses.arabic: عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʿAmā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: So proclaim what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.
verses.arabic: فَٱصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faṣdaʿ bimā tu'maru wa-aʿriḍ ʿani l-mushrikīn

verses.eng: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers
verses.arabic: إِنَّا كَفَيْنَـٰكَ ٱلْمُسْتَهْزِءِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innā kafaynāka l-mustahzi'īn

verses.eng: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّـهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yajʿalūna maʿa llāhi ilāhan ākhara fasawfa yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad naʿlamu annaka yaḍīqu ṣadruka bimā yaqūlūn

verses.eng: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].
verses.arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fasabbiḥ biḥamdi rabbika wakun mina s-sājidīn

verses.eng: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).
verses.arabic: وَٱعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ ٱلْيَقِينُ
verses.transliteration: Waʿbud rabbaka ḥattā yatiyaka l-yaqīn

verses.eng: The command of Allah is coming, so do not seek to hasten it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: أَتَىٰ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُوهُ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ وَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Atā amru Allāhi falā tastaʿjilūh, subḥānahu wataʿālā ʿammā yushrikūn.

verses.eng: He sends down the angels with the revelation of His command upon whom He wills of His servants, [saying], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."
verses.arabic: يُنَزِّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ بِٱلرُّوحِ مِنْ أَمْرِهِۦ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱتَّقُونِ
verses.transliteration: Yunazzilu l-malāikata bi-r-rūḥi min amrihi ʿalā man yashāu min ʿibādihi an andhirū annahu lā ilāha illā anā fa-ttaqūn.

verses.eng: He created the heavens and the earth in truth. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ تَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-arḍa bi-l-ḥaqq, taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūn.

verses.eng: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once, he is a clear adversary.
verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Khalaqa l-insāna min nuṭfatin fa-idhā huwa khaṣīmun mubīn.

verses.eng: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [other] benefits, and from them you eat.
verses.arabic: وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمَ خَلَقَهَا ۗ لَكُمْ فِيهَا دِفْءٌۭ وَمَنَـٰفِعُ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-l-anʿāma khalaqahā, lakum fīhā difʾun wa-manāfiʿu wa-minhā taʾkulūn.

verses.eng: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].
verses.arabic: وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا جَمَالٌ حِينَ تُرِيحُونَ وَحِينَ تَسْرَحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-lakum fīhā jamālun ḥīna turīḥūna wa-ḥīna tasraḥūn.

verses.eng: And they carry your loads to [distant] lands which you could not reach except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَتَحْمِلُ أَثْقَالَكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٍۢ لَّمْ تَكُونُوا۟ بَـٰلِغِيهِ إِلَّا بِشِقِّ ٱلْأَنفُسِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa-taḥmilu athqālakum ilā baladin lam takūnū bālighīhi illā bi-shiqqi l-anfus, inna rabbakum la-raʾūfun raḥīm.

verses.eng: And [He created] the horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.
verses.arabic: وَٱلْخَيْلَ وَٱلْبِغَالَ وَٱلْحَمِيرَ لِتَرْكَبُوهَا وَزِينَةًۭ ۚ وَيَخْلُقُ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-l-khayla wa-l-bighāla wa-l-ḥamīra litarkabūhā wa-zīnatan, wa-yakhluqu mā lā taʿlamūn.

verses.eng: And upon Allah is the direction of the [right] way, and among them [the paths] are deviant. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.
verses.arabic: وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ قَصْدُ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَمِنْهَا جَآئِرٌۭ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَهَدَىٰكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʿalā Allāhi qaṣdu s-sabīli wa-minhā jāʾir, wa-law shāʾa la-hadākum ajmaʿīn.

verses.eng: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].
verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ ۖ لَّكُم مِّنْهُ شَرَابٌۭ وَمِنْهُ شَجَرٌۭ فِيهِ تُسِيمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Huwa lladhī anzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan, lakum minhu sharābun wa-minhu shajarun fīhi tusīmūn.

verses.eng: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed, in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
verses.arabic: يُنبِتُ لَكُم بِهِ ٱلزَّرْعَ وَٱلزَّيْتُونَ وَٱلنَّخِيلَ وَٱلْأَعْنَـٰبَ وَمِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yunbitu lakum bihi z-zarʿa wa-z-zaytūna wa-n-nakhīla wa-l-aʿnāba wa-min kulli th-thamarāt, inna fī dhālika la-āyatan li-qawmin yatafakkarūn.

verses.eng: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who reason.
verses.arabic: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ وَٱلنُّجُومُ مُسَخَّرَٰتُۢ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-sakhkhara lakumu l-layla wa-n-nahāra wa-sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara, wa-n-nujūmu musakhkharātun bi-amrih, inna fī dhālika la-āyātin li-qawmin yaʿqilūn.

verses.eng: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed, in that is a sign for a people who remember.
verses.arabic: وَمَا ذَرَأَ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَٰنُهُۥٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-mā dharaʾa lakum fī l-arḍi mukhtalifan alwānuh, inna fī dhālika la-āyatan li-qawmin yadhakkarūn.

verses.eng: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ ٱلْبَحْرَ لِتَأْكُلُوا۟ مِنْهُ لَحْمًۭا طَرِيًّۭا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُوا۟ مِنْهُ حِلْيَةًۭ تَلْبَسُونَهَا وَتَرَى ٱلْفُلْكَ مَوَاخِرَ فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-huwa lladhī sakhkhara l-baḥra litaʾkulū minhu laḥman ṭariyyan wa-tastakhrijū minhu ḥilyatan talbasūnahā wa-tarā l-fulka mawākhira fīhi wa-li-tabtaghū min faḍlihi wa-laʿallakum tashkurūn.

verses.eng: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,
verses.arabic: وَأَلْقَىٰ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَأَنْهَـٰرًۭا وَسُبُلًۭا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alqā fī l-arḍi rawāsiya an tamīda bikum wa-anhāran wa-subulan laʿallakum tahtadūn.

verses.eng: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.
verses.arabic: وَعَلَامَاتٍ ۚ وَبِالنَّجْمِ هُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʿalāmātin wa bil-najmi hum yahtadūn

verses.eng: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?
verses.arabic: أَفَمَن يَخْلُقُ كَمَن لَّا يَخْلُقُ ۗ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afaman yakhluqu kamal lā yakhluqu ʾafalā tadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa in taʿuddū niʿmata Allāhi lā tuḥṣūhā ʾinna Allāha laghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.
verses.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allāhu yaʿlamu mā tusirrūna wa mā tuʿlinūn

verses.eng: And those they invoke other than Allah create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْـًٔا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna yadʿūna min dūni Allāhi lā yakhluqūna shayʾan wa hum yukhlaqūn

verses.eng: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.
verses.arabic: أَمْوَٰتٌ غَيْرُ أَحْيَآءٍ ۖ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Amwātun ghayru ʾaḥyāʾin wa mā yashʿurūna ʾayyāna yubʿathūn

verses.eng: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are denying, and they are arrogant.
verses.arabic: إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مُّنكِرَةٌ وَهُم مُّسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun fa alladhīna lā yuʾminūna bil-ʾākhirati qulūbuhum munkiratun wa hum mustakbirūn

verses.eng: Assuredly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
verses.arabic: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُسْتَكْبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lā jarama ʾanna Allāha yaʿlamu mā yusirrūna wa mā yuʿlinūn ʾinnahu lā yuḥibbu al-mustakbirīn

verses.eng: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Legends of the former peoples,"
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُم مَّاذَآ أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۙ قَالُوٓا۟ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾidhā qīla lahum mādhā ʾanzala rabbukum qālū ʾasāṭīru al-ʾawwalīn

verses.eng: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
verses.arabic: لِيَحْمِلُوٓا۟ أَوْزَارَهُمْ كَامِلَةً يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ وَمِنْ أَوْزَارِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُضِلُّونَهُم بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ أَلَا سَآءَ مَا يَزِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Liyaḥmilū ʾawzārahum kāmilatan yawma al-qiyāmati wa min ʾawzāri alladhīna yuḍillūnahum bighayri ʿilmin ʾalā sāʾa mā yazirūn

verses.eng: Those before them had plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.
verses.arabic: قَدْ مَكَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَى ٱللَّهُ بُنْيَـٰنَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقَوَاعِدِ فَخَرَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلسَّقْفُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qad makara alladhīna min qablihim fa ʾatā Allāhu bunyānahum min al-qawāʿidi fa kharra ʿalayhimu al-saqfu min fawqihim wa ʾatāhumu al-ʿadhābu min ḥaythu lā yashʿurūn

verses.eng: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers"
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يُخْزِيهِمْ وَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تُشَـٰٓقُّونَ فِيهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ إِنَّ ٱلْخِزْىَ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَٱلسُّوٓءَ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma yawma al-qiyāmati yukhziīhim wa yaqūlu ʾayna shurakāʾiya alladhīna kuntum tushāqqūna fīhim qāla alladhīna ʾūtū al-ʿilma ʾinna al-khizya al-yawma wa al-sūʾa ʿalā al-kāfirīn

verses.eng: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." [The angels will reply], "Yes, indeed, Allah is Knowing of what you used to do.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ تَتَوَفَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ ظَالِمِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ فَأَلْقَوُا۟ ٱلسَّلَمَ مَا كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ مِن سُوٓءٍۭ ۚ بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna tatawaffāhumu al-malāʾikatu ẓālimī ʾanfusihim fa ʾalqawu al-salama mā kunnā naʿmalu min sūʾin balā ʾinna Allāha ʿalīmun bimā kuntum taʿmalūn

verses.eng: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.
verses.arabic: فَٱدْخُلُوٓا۟ أَبْوَٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ فَلَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى ٱلْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa udkhulū ʾabwāba jahannama khālidīna fīhā fa labiʾsa mathwā al-mutakabbirīn

verses.eng: And it will be said to those who feared Allah, "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -
verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ مَاذَآ أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۚ قَالُوا۟ خَيْرًۭا ۗ لِّلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۚ وَلَدَارُ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌۭ ۚ وَلَنِعْمَ دَارُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qīla lil-ladhīna attaqaw mādhā ʾanzala rabbukum qālū khayran lil-ladhīna ʾaḥsanū fī hādhihi al-dunyā ḥasanatun wa la-dāru al-ʾākhirati khayrun wa la-niʿma dāru al-muttaqīn

verses.eng: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous.
verses.arabic: جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَاءُونَ كَذَٰلِكَ يَجْزِي اللَّهُ الْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Jannātu 'adnin yadkhulūnahā tajrī min taḥtihā al-anhāru lahum fīhā mā yashā'ūna kadhālika yajzī Allāhu al-muttaqīna

verses.eng: Those whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, 'Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do.'
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ تَتَوَفَّاهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ طَيِّبِينَ يَقُولُونَ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمُ ادْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna tatawaffāhumu al-malā'ikatu ṭayyibīna yaqūlūna salāmun 'alaykumu udkhulū al-jannata bimā kuntum ta'malūna

verses.eng: Do the disbelievers await [anything] except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.
verses.arabic: هَلْ يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ يَأْتِيَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ كَذَٰلِكَ فَعَلَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ وَمَا ظَلَمَهُمُ اللَّهُ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hal yanẓurūna illā an ta'tiyahumu al-malā'ikatu aw ya'tiya amru rabbika kadhālika fa'ala alladhīna min qablihim wa mā ẓalamahumu Allāhu wa lākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūna

verses.eng: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
verses.arabic: فَأَصَابَهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا عَمِلُوا وَحَاقَ بِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'aṣābahum sayyi'ātu mā 'amilū wa ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihi yastahzi'ūna

verses.eng: And those who associate others with Allah say, 'If Allah had willed, we would not have worshiped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him.' Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا لَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ مَا عَبَدْنَا مِنْ دُونِهِ مِنْ شَيْءٍ نَحْنُ وَلَا آبَاؤُنَا وَلَا حَرَّمْنَا مِنْ دُونِهِ مِنْ شَيْءٍ كَذَٰلِكَ فَعَلَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَهَلْ عَلَى الرُّسُلِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla alladhīna ashrakū law shā'a Allāhu mā 'abadnā min dūnihi min shay'in naḥnu wa lā ābā'unā wa lā ḥarramnā min dūnihi min shay'in kadhālika fa'ala alladhīna min qablihim fahal 'alā al-rusuli illā al-balāghu al-mubīnu

verses.eng: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], 'Worship Allah and avoid Taghut.' And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ بَعَثْنَا فِي كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَسُولًا أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاجْتَنِبُوا الطَّاغُوتَ فَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ هَدَى اللَّهُ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ حَقَّتْ عَلَيْهِ الضَّلَالَةُ فَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَانْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ba'athnā fī kulli ummatin rasūlan ani u'budū Allāha wa ijtanibū al-ṭāghūta faminhum man hadā Allāhu wa minhum man ḥaqqat 'alayhi al-ḍalālatu fasīrū fī al-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa kāna 'āqibatu al-mukadhdhibīna

verses.eng: If you should desire their guidance, [know that] Allah does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.
verses.arabic: إِنْ تَحْرِصْ عَلَىٰ هُدَاهُمْ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي مَنْ يُضِلُّ وَمَا لَهُمْ مِنْ نَاصِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: In taḥriṣ 'alā hudāhum fa'inna Allāha lā yahdī man yuḍillu wa mā lahum min nāṣirīna

verses.eng: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths [that] Allah will not resurrect one who dies. But yes, [He will]; it is a promise [binding] upon Him in truth, but most of the people do not know.
verses.arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَا يَبْعَثُ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَمُوتُ بَلَىٰ وَعْدًا عَلَيْهِ حَقًّا وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa aqsamū bi-llāhi jahda aymānihim lā yab'athu Allāhu man yamūtu balā wa'dan 'alayhi ḥaqqan wa lākinna akthara al-nāsi lā ya'lamūna

verses.eng: [It is] so He may make clear to them that over which they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.
verses.arabic: لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ الَّذِي يَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا كَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Liyubayyina lahum alladhī yakhtalifūna fīhi wa liya'lama alladhīna kafarū annahum kānū kādhibīna

verses.eng: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, 'Be,' and it is.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا قَوْلُنَا لِشَيْءٍ إِذَا أَرَدْنَاهُ أَنْ نَقُولَ لَهُ كُنْ فَيَكُونُ
verses.transliteration: Innamā qawlunā li-shay'in idhā aradnāhu an naqūla lahu kun fa-yakūnu

verses.eng: And those who emigrated for [the sake of] Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا فِي اللَّهِ مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُمْ فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَلَأَجْرُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna hājarū fī Allāhi min ba'di mā ẓulimū lanubawwi'annahum fī al-dunyā ḥasanatan wa la-ajru al-ākhirati akbaru law kānū ya'lamūna

verses.eng: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna ṣabarū wa 'alā rabbihim yatawakkalūna

verses.eng: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُوحِي إِلَيْهِمْ فَاسْأَلُوا أَهْلَ الذِّكْرِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā arsalnā min qablika illā rijālan nūḥī ilayhim fa-as'alū ahla al-dhikri in kuntum lā ta'lamūna

verses.eng: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.
verses.arabic: بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ وَالزُّبُرِ وَأَنْزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الذِّكْرَ لِتُبَيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ مَا نُزِّلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bi-al-bayyināti wa al-zuburi wa anzalnā ilayka al-dhikra litubayyina li-al-nāsi mā nuzzila ilayhim wa la'allahum yatafakkarūna

verses.eng: Do those who have conspired evils feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they will not perceive?
verses.arabic: أَفَأَمِنَ الَّذِينَ مَكَرُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ أَنْ يَخْسِفَ اللَّهُ بِهِمُ الْأَرْضَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afa-amina alladhīna makarū al-sayyi'āti an yakhsifa Allāhu bihimu al-arḍa aw ya'tiyahumu al-'adhābu min ḥaythu lā yash'urūna

verses.eng: Or that He may seize them in the midst of their going to and fro, and they will not be able to frustrate Him?
verses.arabic: أَوْ يَأْخُذَهُمْ عَلَىٰ تَخَوُّفٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Aw ya'khudhahum 'ala takhawwufin fa'inna rabbakum lara'ufun rahim

verses.eng: Or that He may seize them with gradual wasting? Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.
verses.arabic: أَوْ يَأْخُذَهُمْ عَلَىٰ تَخَوُّفٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Aw ya'khudhahum 'ala takhawwufin fa'inna rabbakum lara'ufun rahim

verses.eng: Have they not seen what Allah has created from [their] inclining and straightening?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍۢ يَتَفَيَّؤُا۟ ظِلَـٰلُهُۥ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَٱلشَّمَآئِلِ سُجَّدًۭا لِّلَّهِ وَهُمْ دَٰخِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw ila ma khalaqa Allahu min shay'in yatafayya'u zilaluhu 'ani al-yameeni waalshshama'ili sujjadan lillahi wahum dakhiroon

verses.eng: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.
verses.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِن دَآبَّةٍۢ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُمْ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walillahi yasjudu ma fee alssamawati wama fee al-ardi min dabbatin waalmala-ikatu wahum la yastakbiroon

verses.eng: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
verses.arabic: يَخَافُونَ رَبَّهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yakhafoona rabbahum min fawqihim wayaf'aloona ma yu'maroon

verses.eng: And Allah has said, "Do not take for yourselves two deities. He is but one God, so fear only Me."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱللَّهُ لَا تَتَّخِذُوٓا۟ إِلَـٰهَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ إِنَّمَا هُوَ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ فَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱرْهَبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Waqala Allahu la tattakhithu ilahayni ithnayni innama huwa ilahun wahidun fa-iyyai farhaboon

verses.eng: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] obedience enduring. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?
verses.arabic: وَلَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَهُ ٱلدِّينُ وَاصِبًا أَفَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walahu ma fee alssamawati waal-ardi walahu alddeenu wasiban afaghayra Allahi tattaqoon

verses.eng: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allah. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.
verses.arabic: وَمَا بِكُم مِّن نِّعْمَةٍۢ فَمِنَ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا مَسَّكُمُ ٱلضُّرُّ فَإِلَيْهِ تَجْـَٔرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama bikum min ni'matin famina Allahi thumma itha massakumu alddurru fa-ilayhi taj'eroon

verses.eng: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا كَشَفَ ٱلضُّرَّ عَنكُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌۭ مِّنكُم بِرَبِّهِمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma itha kashafa alddurra 'ankum itha fareequn minkum birabbihim yushrikoon

verses.eng: So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
verses.arabic: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ فَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Liyakfuroo bima ataynahum fatamatta'oo fasawfa ta'lamoon

verses.eng: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.
verses.arabic: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ نَصِيبًۭا مِّمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ تَٱللَّهِ لَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ عَمَّا كُنتُمْ تَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayaj'aloona lima la ya'lamoona naseeban mimma razaqnahum taAllahi latus'alunna 'amma kuntum taftaroon

verses.eng: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.
verses.arabic: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِلَّهِ ٱلْبَنَـٰتِ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ وَلَهُم مَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayaj'aloona lillahi albanati subhanahu walahum ma yashtahoon

verses.eng: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِٱلْأُنثَىٰ ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُۥ مُسْوَدًّۭا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa-itha bushshira ahaduhum bial-untha thalla wajhuhu muswaddan wahuwa katheem

verses.eng: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.
verses.arabic: يَتَوَٰرَىٰ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ مِن سُوٓءِ مَا بُشِّرَ بِهِۦٓ أَيُمْسِكُهُۥ عَلَىٰ هُونٍ أَمْ يَدُسُّهُۥ فِى ٱلتُّرَابِ أَلَا سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yatawara mina alqawmi min soo-i ma bushshira bihi ayumsikuhu 'ala hoonin am yadussuhu fee altturabi ala sa'a ma yahkumoon

verses.eng: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest description. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.
verses.arabic: لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مَثَلُ ٱلسَّوْءِ وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَثَلُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Lillatheena la yu'minoona bial-akhirati mathalu alssaw-i walillahi almathalu al-a'la wahuwa al'azeezu alhakeem

verses.eng: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term comes, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ يُؤَاخِذُ اللَّهُ النَّاسَ بِظُلْمِهِم مَّا تَرَكَ عَلَيْهَا مِن دَابَّةٍ وَلَٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَجَلُهُمْ لَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ سَاعَةً ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law yu'ākhidhu Allāhu an-nāsa biẓulmihim mā taraka 'alayhā min dābbatin wa lākin yu'akhkhiruhum ilā ajalin musammā, fa'idhā jā'a ajaluhum lā yasta'khirūna sā'atan wa lā yastaqdimūn

verses.eng: And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.
verses.arabic: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِلَّهِ مَا يَكْرَهُونَ وَتَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُهُمُ الْكَذِبَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ النَّارَ وَأَنَّهُم مُّفْرَطُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaj'alūna lillāhi mā yakrahoona wa taṣifu alsinatuhumu al-każiba anna lahumu al-ḥusnā, lā jarama anna lahumu an-nāra wa annahum mufraṭūn

verses.eng: By Allah, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: تَاللَّهِ لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمَمٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُمُ الْيَوْمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ta-Allāhi laqad arsalnā ilā umamin min qablika fazayyana lahumu ash-shayṭānu a'mālahum fahuwa waliyyuhumu al-yawma wa lahum 'adhābun alīm

verses.eng: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا لِتُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ الَّذِي اخْتَلَفُوا فِيهِ ۙ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā anzalnā 'alayka al-kitāba illā litubayyina lahumu alladhī ikhtalafū fīhi wa hudan wa raḥmatan liqawmin yu'minūn

verses.eng: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَحْيَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allāhu anzala min as-samā'i mā'an fa'aḥyā bihi al-arḍa ba'da mawtihā, inna fī dhālika la'āyatan liqawmin yasma'ūn

verses.eng: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِي الْأَنْعَامِ لَعِبْرَةً ۖ نُّسْقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِي بُطُونِهِ مِن بَيْنِ فَرْثٍ وَدَمٍ لَّبَنًا خَالِصًا سَائِغًا لِّلشَّارِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna lakum fī al-an'āmi la'ibratan, nusqīkum mimmā fī buṭūnihi min bayni farthin wa damin labanan khāliṣan sā'ighan li-ash-shāribīn

verses.eng: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.
verses.arabic: وَمِن ثَمَرَاتِ النَّخِيلِ وَالْأَعْنَابِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min thamarāti an-nakhīli wal-a'nābi tattakhidhūna minhu sakaran wa rizqan ḥasanan, inna fī dhālika la'āyatan liqawmin ya'qilūn

verses.eng: And your Lord inspired to the bee, 'Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.
verses.arabic: وَأَوْحَىٰ رَبُّكَ إِلَى النَّحْلِ أَنِ اتَّخِذِي مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا وَمِنَ الشَّجَرِ وَمِمَّا يَعْرِشُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa awḥā rabbuka ilā an-naḥli ani ittakhidhī min al-jibāli buyūtan wa min ash-shajari wa mimmā ya'rishūn

verses.eng: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you].' There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ كُلِي مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَرَاتِ فَاسْلُكِي سُبُلَ رَبِّكِ ذُلُلًا ۚ يَخْرُجُ مِن بُطُونِهَا شَرَابٌ مُّخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَانُهُ فِيهِ شِفَاءٌ لِّلنَّاسِ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma kulī min kulli ath-thamarāti faslukī subula rabbiki dhululan, yakhruju min buṭūnihā sharābun mukhtalifun alwānuhu fīhi shifā'un li-n-nās, inna fī dhālika la'āyatan liqawmin yatafakkarūn

verses.eng: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ يَتَوَفَّاكُمْ ۖ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ أَرْذَلِ الْعُمُرِ لِكَيْ لَا يَعْلَمَ بَعْدَ عِلْمٍ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allāhu khalaqakum thumma yatawaffākum, wa minkum man yuraddu ilā ardhali al-'umuri li-kay lā ya'lama ba'da 'ilmin shay'an, inna Allāha 'alīmun qadīr

verses.eng: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ فَضَّلَ بَعْضَكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فِي الرِّزْقِ ۚ فَمَا الَّذِينَ فُضِّلُوا بِرَادِّي رِزْقِهِمْ عَلَىٰ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَهُمْ فِيهِ سَوَاءٌ ۚ أَفَبِنِعْمَةِ اللَّهِ يَجْحَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allāhu faḍḍala ba'ḍakum 'alā ba'ḍin fī ar-rizqi, famā alladhīna fuḍḍilū birādī rizqihim 'alā mā malakat aymānuhum fahum fīhi sawā', afa bini'mati Allāhi yajḥadūn

verses.eng: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَاجِكُم بَنِينَ وَحَفَدَةً وَرَزَقَكُم مِّنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ ۚ أَفَبِالْبَاطِلِ يُؤْمِنُونَ وَبِنِعْمَتِ اللَّهِ هُمْ يَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allāhu ja'ala lakum min anfusikum azwājan wa ja'ala lakum min azwājikum banīna wa ḥafadatan wa razaqakum min aṭ-ṭayyibāt, afa bi-al-bāṭili yu'minūna wa bini'mati Allāhi hum yakfurūn

verses.eng: And they worship other than Allah that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.
verses.arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ رِزْقًا مِّنَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ya'budūna min dūni Allāhi mā lā yamliku lahum rizqan min as-samāwāti wal-arḍi shay'an wa lā yastaṭī'ūn

verses.eng: So do not assert similarities to Allah. Indeed, Allah knows and you do not know.
verses.arabic: فَلَا تَضْرِبُوا لِلَّهِ الْأَمْثَالَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falā taḍribū lillāhi al-amthāl, inna Allāha ya'lamu wa antum lā ta'lamūn

verses.eng: Allah presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah! But most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا عَبْدًا مَّمْلُوكًا لَّا يَقْدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَيْءٍ وَمَن رَّزَقْنَاهُ مِنَّا رِزْقًا حَسَنًا فَهُوَ يُنفِقُ مِنْهُ سِرًّا وَجَهْرًا ۖ هَلْ يَسْتَوُونَ ۚ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ḍaraba Allāhu mathalan 'abdan mamlūkan lā yaqdiru 'alā shay'in wa man razaqnāhu minnā rizqan ḥasanan fahuwa yunfiqu minhu sirran wa jahran, hal yastawn, al-ḥamdu lillāh, bal aktharuhum lā ya'lamūn

verses.eng: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb, unable to do anything, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?
verses.arabic: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَّجُلَيْنِ أَحَدُهُمَا أَبْكَمُ لَا يَقْدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَيْءٍ وَهُوَ كَلٌّ عَلَىٰ مَوْلَاهُ أَيْنَمَا يُوَجِّههُّ لَا يَأْتِ بِخَيْرٍ ۖ هَلْ يَسْتَوِي هُوَ وَمَن يَأْمُرُ بِالْعَدْلِ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa daraba Allahu mathalan rajulayni ahaduhuma abkamu la yaqdiru 'ala shay'in wahuwa kallun 'ala mawlahu aynama yuwajjihhu la ya'ti bikhayrin hal yastawi huwa wa man ya'muru bil-'adli wahuwa 'ala siratin mustaqim

verses.eng: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ غَيْبُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَا أَمْرُ السَّاعَةِ إِلَّا كَلَمْحِ الْبَصَرِ أَوْ هُوَ أَقْرَبُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lillahi ghaybu as-samawati wal-ardi wa ma amru as-sa'ati illa kalamhi al-basari aw huwa aqrabu inna Allaha 'ala kulli shay'in qadir

verses.eng: And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and intellect that perhaps you would be grateful.
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَخْرَجَكُم مِّن بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ شَيْئًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۙ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allahu akhrajakum min butuni ummahatikum la ta'lamuna shay'an wa ja'ala lakumu as-sam'a wal-absara wal-af'idata la'allakum tashkurun

verses.eng: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ مُسَخَّرَاتٍ فِي جَوِّ السَّمَاءِ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alam yaraw ila at-tayri musakhkharatin fi jawwi as-sama'i ma yumsikuhunna illa Allahu inna fi dhalika la'ayatin liqawmin yu'minun

verses.eng: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّن بُيُوتِكُمْ سَكَنًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّن جُلُودِ الْأَنْعَامِ بُيُوتًا تَسْتَخِفُّونَهَا يَوْمَ ظَعْنِكُمْ وَيَوْمَ إِقَامَتِكُمْ ۙ وَمِنْ أَصْوَافِهَا وَأَوْبَارِهَا وَأَشْعَارِهَا أَثَاثًا وَمَتَاعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allahu ja'ala lakum min buyutikum sakanan wa ja'ala lakum min juludi al-an'ami buyutan tastakhiffunaha yawma za'nikum wa yawma iqamatikum wa min aswafiha wa awbariha wa ash'ariha athathan wa mata'an ila hin

verses.eng: And Allah has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّمَّا خَلَقَ ظِلَالًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الْجِبَالِ أَكْنَانًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمْ سَرَابِيلَ تَقِيكُمُ الْحَرَّ وَسَرَابِيلَ تَقِيكُم بَأْسَكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُتِمُّ نِعْمَتَهُ عَلَيْكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Allahu ja'ala lakum mimma khalaqa zilalan wa ja'ala lakum mina al-jibali aknanan wa ja'ala lakum sarabila taqikum al-harra wa sarabila taqikum ba'sakum kathalika yutimmu ni'matahu 'alaykum la'allakum tuslimun

verses.eng: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear conveyance.
verses.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in tawallaw fa-innama 'alayka al-balaghu al-mubin

verses.eng: They recognize the favor of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.
verses.arabic: يَعْرِفُونَ نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنكِرُونَهَا وَأَكْثَرُهُمُ الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ya'rifuna ni'mata Allahi thumma yunkirunaha wa aktharuhumu al-kafirun

verses.eng: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَبْعَثُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهِيدًا ثُمَّ لَا يُؤْذَنُ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma nab'athu min kulli ummatin shahidan thumma la yu'dhanu lilladhina kafaru wa la hum yusta'tabun

verses.eng: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا الْعَذَابَ فَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idha ra'a alladhina zalamu al-'adhaba fala yukhaffafu 'anhum wa la hum yunzarun

verses.eng: And when those who associated others with Allah see their 'partners,' they will say, 'Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke besides You.' But they will throw at them the statement, 'Indeed, you are liars.'
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَى الَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا شُرَكَاءَهُمْ قَالُوا رَبَّنَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ شُرَكَاؤُنَا الَّذِينَ كُنَّا نَدْعُو مِن دُونِكَ ۖ فَأَلْقَوْا إِلَيْهِمُ الْقَوْلَ إِنَّكُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idha ra'a alladhina ashraku shuraka'ahum qalu rabbana ha'ula'i shuraka'una alladhina kunna nad'u min dunka fa-alqaw ilayhimu al-qawla innakum lakathibun

verses.eng: And they will impart to Allah that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
verses.arabic: وَأَلْقَوْا إِلَى اللَّهِ يَوْمَئِذٍ السَّلَمَ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alqaw ila Allahi yawma'idhin as-salam wa dalla 'anhum ma kanu yaftarun

verses.eng: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوا عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ زِدْنَاهُمْ عَذَابًا فَوْقَ الْعَذَابِ بِمَا كَانُوا يُفْسِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhina kafaru wa saddu 'an sabili Allahi zidnahum 'adhaban fawqa al-'adhabi bima kanu yufsidun

verses.eng: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَبْعَثُ فِي كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهِيدًا عَلَيْهِم مِّنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ وَجِئْنَا بِكَ شَهِيدًا عَلَىٰ هَٰؤُلَاءِ ۚ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ تِبْيَانًا لِّكُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma nab'athu fi kulli ummatin shahidan 'alayhim min anfusihim wa ji'naka shahidan 'ala ha'ula'i wa nazzalna 'alayka al-kitaba tibyanan likulli shay'in wa hudan wa rahmatan wa bushra lilmuslimin

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَأْمُرُ بِالْعَدْلِ وَالْإِحْسَانِ وَإِيتَاءِ ذِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَيَنْهَىٰ عَنِ الْفَحْشَاءِ وَالْمُنكَرِ وَالْبَغْيِ ۚ يَعِظُكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allaha ya'muru bil-'adli wal-ihsani wa ita'i dhi al-qurba wa yanha 'ani al-fahsha'i wal-munkari wal-baghyi ya'izukum la'allakum tathakkarun

verses.eng: And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah your witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.
verses.arabic: وَأَوْفُوا بِعَهْدِ اللَّهِ إِذَا عَاهَدتُّمْ وَلَا تَنقُضُوا الْأَيْمَانَ بَعْدَ تَوْكِيدِهَا وَقَدْ جَعَلْتُمُ اللَّهَ عَلَيْكُمْ كَفِيلًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa awfū bi'ahdi Allahi idhā 'āhadttum wa lā tanquḍū al-aymāna ba'da tawkīdihā wa qad ja'altumu Allah 'alaykum kafīlā, inna Allāha ya'lamu mā taf'alūn

verses.eng: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong by taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا كَالَّتِي نَقَضَتْ غَزْلَهَا مِن بَعْدِ قُوَّةٍ أَنكَاثًا تَتَّخِذُونَ أَيْمَانَكُمْ دَخَلًا بَيْنَكُمْ أَن تَكُونَ أُمَّةٌ هِيَ أَرْبَىٰ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ ۚ إِنَّمَا يَبْلُوكُمُ اللَّهُ بِهِ ۚ وَلَيُبَيِّنَنَّ لَكُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ مَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā takūnū kallatī naqaḍat ghazlahā min ba'di quwwatin ankāthā, tattakhidhūna aymānakum dakhalan baynakum an takūna ummatun hiya arbā min ummah, innamā yablūkumu Allahu bih, wa layubayyinanna lakum yawma al-qiyāmati mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

verses.eng: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you one nation, but He lets go astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَلَـٰكِن يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَلَتُسْأَلُنَّ عَمَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law shā'a Allahu laja'alakum ummatan wāḥidatan wa lākin yuḍillu man yashā'u wa yahdī man yashā', wa latus'alunna 'ammā kuntum ta'malūn

verses.eng: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [mischief] you have been diverting from the way of Allah, and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَتَّخِذُوا أَيْمَانَكُمْ دَخَلًا بَيْنَكُمْ فَتَزِلَّ قَدَمٌ بَعْدَ ثُبُوتِهَا وَتَذُوقُوا السُّوءَ بِمَا صَدَدتُّمْ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَلَكُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tattakhidhū aymānakum dakhalan baynakum fa-tazilla qadamun ba'da thubūtihā wa tadūqū as-sū'a bimā �adadtum 'an sabīli Allah, wa lakum 'adhābun 'aẓīm

verses.eng: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا بِعَهْدِ اللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّمَا عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tashtarū bi'ahdi Allahi thamanan qalīlā, innamā 'inda Allahi huwa khayrun lakum in kuntum ta'lamūn

verses.eng: Whatever you have will end, but what Allah has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.
verses.arabic: مَا عِندَكُمْ يَنفَدُ ۖ وَمَا عِندَ اللَّهِ بَاقٍ ۗ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّ الَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā 'indakum yanfadu wa mā 'inda Allahi bāq, wa lanajziyanna alladhīna ṣabarū ajrahum bi-aḥsani mā kānū ya'malūn

verses.eng: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.
verses.arabic: مَنْ عَمِلَ صَالِحًا مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَنُحْيِيَنَّهُ حَيَاةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man 'amila ṣāliḥan min dhakarin aw unthā wa huwa mu'minun falanuḥyiyannahu ḥayātan ṭayyibatan, wa lanajziyannahum ajrahum bi-aḥsani mā kānū ya'malūn

verses.eng: So when you recite the Qur'an, seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ الْقُرْآنَ فَاسْتَعِذْ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Fa-idhā qara'ta al-qur'āna fasta'idh bi-Allāhi mina ash-shayṭāni ar-rajīm

verses.eng: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ لَهُ سُلْطَانٌ عَلَى الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innahu laysa lahu sulṭānun 'alā alladhīna āmanū wa 'alā rabbihim yatawakkalūn

verses.eng: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allah.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا سُلْطَانُهُ عَلَى الَّذِينَ يَتَوَلَّوْنَهُ وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِهِ مُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā sulṭānuhu 'alā alladhīna yatawallawnahu wa alladhīna hum bihi mushrikūn

verses.eng: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muhammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا بَدَّلْنَا آيَةً مَّكَانَ آيَةٍ ۙ وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُنَزِّلُ قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مُفْتَرٍ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā baddalnā āyatan makāna āyatin, wa Allahu a'lamu bimā yunazzilu, qālū innamā anta muftar, bal aktharuhum lā ya'lamūn

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."
verses.arabic: قُلْ نَزَّلَهُ رُوحُ الْقُدُسِ مِن رَّبِّكَ بِالْحَقِّ لِيُثَبِّتَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَهُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul nazzalahu rūḥu al-qudusi min rabbika bil-ḥaqqi liyuthabbita alladhīna āmanū wa hudan wa bush'rā lil-muslimīn

verses.eng: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches him." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّمَا يُعَلِّمُهُ بَشَرٌ ۗ لِّسَانُ الَّذِي يُلْحِدُونَ إِلَيْهِ أَعْجَمِيٌّ وَهَـٰذَا لِسَانٌ عَرَبِيٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad na'lamu annahum yaqūlūna innamā yu'allimuhu bashar, lisānu alladhī yulḥidūna ilayhi a'jamīyun wa hādhā lisānun 'arabīyun mubīn

verses.eng: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ لَا يَهْدِيهِمُ اللَّهُ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna lā yu'minūna bi-āyāti Allahi lā yahdīhimu Allahu wa lahum 'adhābun alīm

verses.eng: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allah, and it is those who are the liars.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَفْتَرِي الْكَذِبَ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَاذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā yaftarī al-kadhiba alladhīna lā yu'minūna bi-āyāti Allah, wa ulā'ika humu al-kādhibūn

verses.eng: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith...
verses.arabic: مَن كَفَرَ بِٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ إِيمَـٰنِهِۦٓ إِلَّا مَنْ أُكْرِهَ وَقَلْبُهُۥ مُطْمَئِنٌّۢ بِٱلْإِيمَـٰنِ...
verses.transliteration: Man kafara bil-lahi min ba'di imanihi illa man ukriha wa qalbuhu mutma'innun bil-imani...

verses.eng: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter...
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ ٱسْتَحَبُّوا۟ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا عَلَى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ...
verses.transliteration: Dhalika bi-annahumus-tahabbu al-hayata ad-dunya 'ala al-akhirati...

verses.eng: Those are the ones over whose hearts Allah has set a seal...
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ طَبَعَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ...
verses.transliteration: Ula'ika alladhina taba'a Allahu 'ala qulubihim...

verses.eng: No doubt, in the Hereafter they will be the losers.
verses.arabic: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: La jarama annahum fil-akhirati humu al-khasirun

verses.eng: Then indeed, your Lord—to those who emigrated after they had been persecuted...
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا فُتِنُوا۟...
verses.transliteration: Thumma inna rabbaka lilladhina hajaru min ba'di ma futinu...

verses.eng: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself...
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ تَأْتِى كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ تُجَـٰدِلُ عَن نَّفْسِهَا...
verses.transliteration: Yawma ta'ti kullu nafsin tujadilu 'an nafsiha...

verses.eng: And Allah presents an example: a city which was secure and peaceful...
verses.arabic: وَضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا قَرْيَةًۭ كَانَتْ ءَامِنَةًۭ مُّطْمَئِنَّةًۭ...
verses.transliteration: Wa daraba Allahu mathalan qaryatan kanat aminatan mutma'innatan...

verses.eng: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among them...
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُمْ رَسُولٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ فَكَذَّبُوهُ...
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ja'ahum rasulum minhum fa-kadhabuhu...

verses.eng: So eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good...
verses.arabic: فَكُلُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ حَلَـٰلًۭا طَيِّبًۭا...
verses.transliteration: Fakulu mimma razaqakumu Allahu halalan tayyiban...

verses.eng: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine...
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَيْتَةَ وَٱلدَّمَ وَلَحْمَ ٱلْخِنزِيرِ...
verses.transliteration: Innama harrama 'alaykumu al-maytata wad-dama wa lahmal-khinziri...

verses.eng: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth...
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقُولُوا۟ لِمَا تَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُكُمُ ٱلْكَذِبَ...
verses.transliteration: Wa la taqulu lima tasifu alsinatukumu al-kadhiba...

verses.eng: A brief enjoyment, then for them is a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: مَتَـٰعٌۭ قَلِيلٌۭ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Mata'un qalilun wa lahum 'adhabun alim

verses.eng: And to those who are Jews, We have prohibited what We related to you before...
verses.arabic: وَعَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوا۟ حَرَّمْنَا مَا قَصَصْنَا عَلَيْكَ مِن قَبْلُ...
verses.transliteration: Wa 'ala alladhina hadu harramna ma qasasna 'alayka min qablu...

verses.eng: Then indeed, your Lord—to those who did wrong out of ignorance and then repented...
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِجَهَـٰلَةٍۢ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ...
verses.transliteration: Thumma inna rabbaka lilladhina 'amilu as-su'a bi-jahalatin thumma tabu min ba'di dhalika...

verses.eng: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah...
verses.arabic: إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ كَانَ أُمَّةًۭ قَانِتًۭا لِّلَّهِ...
verses.transliteration: Inna Ibrahima kana ummatan qanitan lillahi...

verses.eng: Grateful for His favors. He [Allah] chose him and guided him to a straight path.
verses.arabic: شَاكِرًۭا لِّأَنْعُمِهِ ٱجْتَبَىٰهُ وَهَدَىٰهُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Shakiran li-an'umihij-tabahu wa hadahu ila siratin mustaqim

verses.eng: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةًۭ ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ataynahu fid-dunya hasanatan wa innahu fil-akhirati lamina as-salihin

verses.eng: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham...
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ أَنِ ٱتَّبِعْ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ حَنِيفًۭا...
verses.transliteration: Thumma awhayna ilayka anittabi' millata Ibrahima hanifa...

verses.eng: The Sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it...
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ ٱلسَّبْتُ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فِيهِ...
verses.transliteration: Innama ju'ila as-sabtu 'ala alladhina ikhtalafu fihi...

verses.eng: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction...
verses.arabic: ٱدْعُ إِلَىٰ سَبِيلِ رَبِّكَ بِٱلْحِكْمَةِ وَٱلْمَوْعِظَةِ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ...
verses.transliteration: Ud'u ila sabili rabbika bil-hikmati wal-maw'izati al-hasanati...

verses.eng: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed...
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ عَاقَبْتُمْ فَعَاقِبُوا۟ بِمِثْلِ مَا عُوقِبْتُم بِهِۦ...
verses.transliteration: Wa in 'aqabtum fa'aqibu bi-mithli ma 'uqiqtum bihi...

verses.eng: And be patient, for your patience is not but through Allah...
verses.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ وَمَا صَبْرُكَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ...
verses.transliteration: Wasbir wa ma sabruka illa billahi...

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّٱلَّذِينَ هُم مُّحْسِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allaha ma'a alladhina ittaqaw walladhina hum muhsinun

verses.eng: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
verses.arabic: سُبْحَانَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَسْرَىٰ بِعَبْدِهِۦ لَيْلًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ إِلَى ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْأَقْصَا ٱلَّذِى بَـٰرَكْنَا حَوْلَهُۥ لِنُرِيَهُۥ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَآ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْبَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Subḥāna alladhī asrā biʿabdihi laylan mina l-masjidi l-ḥarāmi ilā l-masjidi l-aqṣā alladhī bāraknā ḥawlahu linuriyahu min āyātinā ʾinnahu huwa l-samīʿu l-baṣīr

verses.eng: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,
verses.arabic: وَءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ هُدًۭى لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَلَّا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ مِن دُونِى وَكِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba wajaʿalnāhu hudan libanī ʾisrāʾīla ʾallā tattakhidhū min dūnī wakīlā

verses.eng: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.
verses.arabic: ذُرِّيَّةَ مَنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَبْدًۭا شَكُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Dhurriyyata man ḥamalnā maʿa nūḥin ʾinnahu kāna ʿabdan shakūrā

verses.eng: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, 'You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness.'
verses.arabic: وَقَضَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَتُفْسِدُنَّ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مَرَّتَيْنِ وَلَتَعْلُنَّ عُلُوًّۭا كَبِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waqaḍaynā ʾilā banī ʾisrāʾīla fī l-kitābi latufsidunna fī l-arḍi marratayni walataʿlunna ʿuluwwan kabīrā

verses.eng: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ أُولَىٰهُمَا بَعَثْنَا عَلَيْكُمْ عِبَادًۭا لَّنَآ أُو۟لِى بَأْسٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ فَجَاسُوا۟ خِلَـٰلَ ٱلدِّيَارِ ۚ وَكَانَ وَعْدًۭا مَّفْعُولًۭا
verses.transliteration: Faʾidhā jāʾa waʿdu ʾūlāhumā baʿathnā ʿalaykum ʿibādan lanā ʾūlī baʾsin shadīdin fajāsū khilāla l-diyāri wakāna waʿdan mafʿūlā

verses.eng: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَا لَكُمُ ٱلْكَرَّةَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَأَمْدَدْنَـٰكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍۢ وَبَنِينَ وَجَعَلْنَـٰكُمْ أَكْثَرَ نَفِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Thumma radadnā lakumu l-karrata ʿalayhim waʾamdadnākum biʾamwālin wabanīna wajaʿalnākum ʾakthara nafīrā

verses.eng: [And said], 'If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to yourselves.' Then when the final promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the masjid as they entered it the first time and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.
verses.arabic: إِنْ أَحْسَنتُمْ أَحْسَنتُمْ لِأَنفُسِكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ أَسَأْتُمْ فَلَهَا ۚ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لِيَسُۥٓـُٔوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ وَلِيَدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْمَسْجِدَ كَمَا دَخَلُوهُ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۢ وَلِيُتَبِّرُوا۟ مَا عَلَوْا۟ تَتْبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: ʾIn ʾaḥsantum ʾaḥsantum liʾanfusikum waʾin ʾasaʾtum falahā faʾidhā jāʾa waʿdu l-ʾākhirati liyasūʾū wujūhakum walayadkhulū l-masjida kamā dakhalūhu ʾawwala marratin waliyutabbirū mā ʿalaw tatbīrā

verses.eng: [It may be that] your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed.
verses.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يَرْحَمَكُمْ ۚ وَإِنْ عُدتُّمْ عُدْنَا ۘ وَجَعَلْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ حَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: ʿAsā rabbukum ʾan yarḥamakum waʾin ʿudtum ʿudnā wajaʿalnā jahannama lil-kāfirīna ḥaṣīrā

verses.eng: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ يَهْدِى لِلَّتِى هِىَ أَقْوَمُ وَيُبَشِّرُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: ʾInna hādhā l-qurʾāna yahdī lil-latī hiya ʾaqwamu wayubashshiru l-muʾminīna alladhīna yaʿmalūna l-ṣāliḥāti ʾanna lahum ʾajran kabīrā

verses.eng: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَأَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waʾanna alladhīna lā yuʾminūna bil-ʾākhirati ʾaʿtadnā lahum ʿadhāban ʾalīmā

verses.eng: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.
verses.arabic: وَيَدْعُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ بِٱلشَّرِّ دُعَآءَهُۥ بِٱلْخَيْرِ ۖ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ عَجُولًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wayadʿu l-insānu bil-sharri duʿāʾahu bil-khayri wakāna l-insānu ʿajūlā

verses.eng: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ ءَايَتَيْنِ ۖ فَمَحَوْنَآ ءَايَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَجَعَلْنَآ ءَايَةَ ٱلنَّهَارِ مُبْصِرَةًۭ لِّتَبْتَغُوا۟ فَضْلًۭا مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَلِتَعْلَمُوا۟ عَدَدَ ٱلسِّنِينَ وَٱلْحِسَابَ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَىْءٍۢ فَصَّلْنَـٰهُ تَفْصِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wajaʿalnā l-layla wal-nahāra ʾāyatayni famaḥawnā ʾāyata l-layli wajaʿalnā ʾāyata l-nahāri mubṣiratan litabtaghū faḍlan min rabbikum walitaʿlamū ʿadada l-sinīna wal-ḥisāba wakulla shayʾin faṣṣalnāhu tafṣīlā

verses.eng: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.
verses.arabic: وَكُلَّ إِنسَـٰنٍ أَلْزَمْنَـٰهُ طَـٰٓئِرَهُۥ فِى عُنُقِهِۦ ۖ وَنُخْرِجُ لَهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ كِتَـٰبًۭا يَلْقَىٰهُ مَنشُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wakulla insānin ʾalzamnāhu ṭāʾirahu fī ʿunuqihi wanukhriju lahu yawma l-qiyāmati kitāban yalqāhu manshūrā

verses.eng: [It will be said], 'Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant.'
verses.arabic: ٱقْرَأْ كِتَـٰبَكَ كَفَىٰ بِنَفْسِكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكَ حَسِيبًۭا
verses.transliteration: Iqraʾ kitābaka kafā binafsika l-yawma ʿalayka ḥasībā

verses.eng: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.
verses.arabic: مَّنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُّ عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌۭ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۗ وَمَا كُنَّا مُعَذِّبِينَ حَتَّىٰ نَبْعَثَ رَسُولًۭا
verses.transliteration: Mani ihtadā faʾinnamā yahtadī linafsihi waman ḍalla faʾinnamā yaḍillu ʿalayhā walā taziru wāziratun wizra ʾukhrā wamā kunnā muʿadhdhibīna ḥattā nabʿatha rasūlā

verses.eng: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا أَرَدْنَا أَن نُّهْلِكَ قَرْيَةً أَمَرْنَا مُتْرَفِيهَا فَفَسَقُوا فِيهَا فَحَقَّ عَلَيْهَا الْقَوْلُ فَدَمَّرْنَاهَا تَدْمِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā aradnā an nuhlika qaryatan amarnā mutrafīhā fafasaqū fīhā fahaqqa ʿalayhā l-qawlu fadammarnāhā tadmīrā

verses.eng: And how many generations have We destroyed after Noah? And sufficient is your Lord as Aware and Seeing of the sins of His servants.
verses.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنَ الْقُرُونِ مِن بَعْدِ نُوحٍ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا بَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknā mina l-qurūni min baʿdi nūḥin wakafā birabbika bidhunūbi ʿibādihi khabīran baṣīrā

verses.eng: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.
verses.arabic: مَّن كَانَ يُرِيدُ الْعَاجِلَةَ عَجَّلْنَا لَهُ فِيهَا مَا نَشَاءُ لِمَن نُّرِيدُ ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَاهَا مَذْمُومًا مَّدْحُورًا
verses.transliteration: Man kāna yurīdu l-ʿājilata ʿajjalnā lahu fīhā mā nashā'u liman nurīdu thumma jaʿalnā lahu jahannama yaṣlāhā madhmūmam madḥūrā

verses.eng: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is appreciated.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَرَادَ الْآخِرَةَ وَسَعَىٰ لَهَا سَعْيَهَا وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَأُولَٰئِكَ كَانَ سَعْيُهُم مَّشْكُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa man arāda l-ākhirata wasaʿā lahā saʿyahā wahuwa mu'minun fa'ulā'ika kāna saʿyuhum mashkūrā

verses.eng: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.
verses.arabic: كُلًّا نُّمِدُّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ وَهَٰؤُلَاءِ مِنْ عَطَاءِ رَبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ عَطَاءُ رَبِّكَ مَحْظُورًا
verses.transliteration: Kullan numiddu hā'ulā'i wahā'ulā'i min ʿaṭā'i rabbika wamā kāna ʿaṭā'u rabbika maḥẓūrā

verses.eng: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.
verses.arabic: انظُرْ كَيْفَ فَضَّلْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ وَلَلْآخِرَةُ أَكْبَرُ دَرَجَاتٍ وَأَكْبَرُ تَفْضِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Unẓur kayfa faḍḍalnā baʿḍahum ʿalā baʿḍin walal'ākhiratu akbaru darajātin wa'akbaru tafḍīlā

verses.eng: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.
verses.arabic: لَّا تَجْعَلْ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَقْعُدَ مَذْمُومًا مَّخْذُولًا
verses.transliteration: Lā tajʿal maʿa l-lahi ilāhan ākhara fataqʿuda madhmūmam makhdhūlā

verses.eng: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], 'uff,' and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.
verses.arabic: وَقَضَىٰ رَبُّكَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوا إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا ۚ إِمَّا يَبْلُغَنَّ عِندَكَ الْكِبَرَ أَحَدُهُمَا أَوْ كِلَاهُمَا فَلَا تَقُل لَّهُمَا أُفٍّ وَلَا تَنْهَرْهُمَا وَقُل لَّهُمَا قَوْلًا كَرِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Waqaḍā rabbuka allā taʿbudū illā iyyāhu wabi-l-wālidayni iḥsānā immā yablughanna ʿindaka l-kibara aḥaduhumā aw kilāhumā falā taqul lahumā uffin walā tanharhumā waqul lahumā qawlān karīmā

verses.eng: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, 'My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small.'
verses.arabic: وَاخْفِضْ لَهُمَا جَنَاحَ الذُّلِّ مِنَ الرَّحْمَةِ وَقُل رَّبِّ ارْحَمْهُمَا كَمَا رَبَّيَانِي صَغِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wakhfiḍ lahumā janāḥa dh-dhulli mina r-raḥmati waqul rabbi rḥamhumā kamā rabbayānī �aghīrā

verses.eng: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.
verses.arabic: رَّبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا فِي نُفُوسِكُمْ ۚ إِن تَكُونُوا صَالِحِينَ فَإِنَّهُ كَانَ لِلْأَوَّابِينَ غَفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Rabbukum aʿlamu bimā fī nufūsikum in takūnū ṣāliḥīna fa'innahu kāna lil'awwābīna ghafūrā

verses.eng: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.
verses.arabic: وَآتِ ذَا الْقُرْبَىٰ حَقَّهُ وَالْمِسْكِينَ وَابْنَ السَّبِيلِ وَلَا تُبَذِّرْ تَبْذِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Waāti dhā l-qurbā ḥaqqahu wa-l-miskīna wa-bna s-sabīli walā tubadhir tabdhīrā

verses.eng: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الْمُبَذِّرِينَ كَانُوا إِخْوَانَ الشَّيَاطِينِ ۖ وَكَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ لِرَبِّهِ كَفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Inna l-mubadhirīna kānū ikhwāna sh-shayāṭīni wakāna sh-shayṭānu lirabbihi kafūrā

verses.eng: And if you [must] turn away from them awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.
verses.arabic: وَإِمَّا تُعْرِضَنَّ عَنْهُمُ ابْتِغَاءَ رَحْمَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكَ تَرْجُوهَا فَقُل لَّهُمْ قَوْلًا مَّيْسُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa'immā tuʿriḍanna ʿanhumu ib'tighā'a raḥmatin min rabbika tarjūhā faqul lahum qawlān maysūrā

verses.eng: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلْ يَدَكَ مَغْلُولَةً إِلَىٰ عُنُقِكَ وَلَا تَبْسُطْهَا كُلَّ الْبَسْطِ فَتَقْعُدَ مَلُومًا مَّحْسُورًا
verses.transliteration: Walā tajʿal yadaka maghlūlatan ilā ʿunuqika walā tabsuṭhā kulla l-basṭi fataqʿuda malūmam maḥsūrā

verses.eng: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed, He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا بَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Inna rabbaka yabsuṭu r-rizqa liman yashā'u wayaqdiru innahu kāna biʿibādihi khabīran baṣīrā

verses.eng: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْتُلُوا أَوْلَادَكُمْ خَشْيَةَ إِمْلَاقٍ ۖ نَحْنُ نَرْزُقُهُمْ وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ قَتْلَهُمْ كَانَ خِطْئًا كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taqtulū awlādakum khashyata imlāqin, naḥnu narzuquhum wa iyyākum, inna qatlahum kāna khiṭ'an kabīrā

verses.eng: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is an outrage and an evil way.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا الزِّنَىٰ ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ فَاحِشَةً وَسَاءَ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taqrabū az-zinā, innahu kāna fāḥishatan wa sā'a sabīlā

verses.eng: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْتُلُوا النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَمَنْ قُتِلَ مَظْلُومًا فَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا لِوَلِيِّهِ سُلْطَانًا فَلَا يُسْرِفْ فِي الْقَتْلِ ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ مَنصُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taqtulū an-nafsa allatī ḥarrama Allāhu illā bil-ḥaqqi, wa man qutila maẓlūman faqad ja'alnā liwaliyyihi sulṭānan falā yusrif fil-qatli, innahu kāna manṣūrā

verses.eng: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا مَالَ الْيَتِيمِ إِلَّا بِالَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ حَتَّىٰ يَبْلُغَ أَشُدَّهُ ۚ وَأَوْفُوا بِالْعَهْدِ ۖ إِنَّ الْعَهْدَ كَانَ مَسْئُولًا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taqrabū māla al-yatīmi illā billatī hiya aḥsanu ḥattā yablugha ashuddah, wa awfū bil-'ahdi, inna al-'ahda kāna mas'ūlā

verses.eng: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
verses.arabic: وَأَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ إِذَا كِلْتُمْ وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَحْسَنُ تَأْوِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa awfū al-kayla idhā kiltum wa zinū bil-qisṭāsi al-mustaqīm, dhālika khayrun wa aḥsanu ta'wīlā
