verses.eng: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقْفُ مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلْمٌ ۚ إِنَّ السَّمْعَ وَالْبَصَرَ وَالْفُؤَادَ كُلُّ أُولَٰئِكَ كَانَ عَنْهُ مَسْئُولًا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā taqfu mā laysa laka bihi 'ilmun, inna as-sam'a wal-baṣara wal-fu'āda kullu ulā'ika kāna 'anhu mas'ūlā

verses.eng: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَمْشِ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّكَ لَنْ تَخْرِقَ الْأَرْضَ وَلَنْ تَبْلُغَ الْجِبَالَ طُولًا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tamsi fil-arḍi maraḥan, innaka lan takhriqa al-arḍa wa lan tablugha al-jibāla ṭūlā

verses.eng: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.
verses.arabic: كُلُّ ذَٰلِكَ كَانَ سَيِّئُهُ عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ مَكْرُوهًا
verses.transliteration: Kullu dhālika kāna sayyi'uhu 'inda rabbika makrūhā

verses.eng: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِمَّا أَوْحَىٰ إِلَيْكَ رَبُّكَ مِنَ الْحِكْمَةِ ۗ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتُلْقَىٰ فِي جَهَنَّمَ مَلُومًا مَدْحُورًا
verses.transliteration: Dhālika mimmā awḥā ilayka rabbuka mina al-ḥikmati, wa lā taj'al ma'a Allāhi ilāhan ākhara fatulqā fī jahannama malūman madḥūrā

verses.eng: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.
verses.arabic: أَفَأَصْفَاكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ بِالْبَنِينَ وَاتَّخَذَ مِنَ الْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنَاثًا ۚ إِنَّكُمْ لَتَقُولُونَ قَوْلًا عَظِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Afa aṣfākum rabbukum bil-banīna wa ittakhadha mina al-malā'ikati ināthā, innakum lataqūlūna qawlān 'aẓīmā

verses.eng: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase them except in aversion.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِي هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا وَمَا يَزِيدُهُمْ إِلَّا نُفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ṣarrafnā fī hādhā al-qur'āni liyadhakkarū wa mā yazīduhum illā nufūrā

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."
verses.arabic: قُلْ لَوْ كَانَ مَعَهُ آلِهَةٌ كَمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذًا لَابْتَغَوْا إِلَىٰ ذِي الْعَرْشِ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Qul law kāna ma'ahu ālihatun kamā yaqūlūna idhan labtaghaw ilā dhī al-'arshi sabīlā

verses.eng: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.
verses.arabic: سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يَقُولُونَ عُلُوًّا كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Subḥānahu wa ta'ālā 'ammā yaqūlūna 'ulūwan kabīrā

verses.eng: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
verses.arabic: تُسَبِّحُ لَهُ السَّمَاوَاتُ السَّبْعُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ ۚ وَإِنْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِلَّا يُسَبِّحُ بِحَمْدِهِ وَلَٰكِنْ لَا تَفْقَهُونَ تَسْبِيحَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّهُ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Tusabbiḥu lahu as-samāwātu as-sab'u wal-arḍu wa man fīhinna, wa in min shay'in illā yusabbiḥu biḥamdihi wa lākin lā tafqahūna tasbīḥahum, innahu kāna ḥalīman ghafūrā

verses.eng: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ الْقُرْآنَ جَعَلْنَا بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ حِجَابًا مَسْتُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā qara'ta al-qur'āna ja'alnā baynaka wa bayna alladhīna lā yu'minūna bil-ākhirati ḥijāban mastūrā

verses.eng: And We have placed coverings over their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِي آذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًا ۚ وَإِذَا ذَكَرْتَ رَبَّكَ فِي الْقُرْآنِ وَحْدَهُ وَلَّوْا عَلَىٰ أَدْبَارِهِمْ نُفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wajaʿalnā ʿalā qulūbihim akinnatan an yafqahūhu wafī ādhānihim waqran wa-idhā dhakarta rabbaka fī l-qur'āni waḥdahu wallaw ʿalā adbārihim nufūran

verses.eng: We know best what they listen to when they listen to you, and [what] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, 'You follow not but a man affected by magic.'
verses.arabic: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَسْتَمِعُونَ بِهِ إِذْ يَسْتَمِعُونَ إِلَيْكَ وَإِذْ هُمْ نَجْوَىٰ إِذْ يَقُولُ الظَّالِمُونَ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًا مَّسْحُورًا
verses.transliteration: Naḥnu aʿlamu bimā yastamiʿūna bihi idh yastamiʿūna ilayka wa-idh hum najwā idh yaqūlu l-ẓālimūna in tattabiʿūna illā rajulan masḥūran

verses.eng: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
verses.arabic: انظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا لَكَ الْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Unẓur kayfa ḍarabū laka l-amthāla faḍallū falā yastaṭīʿūna sabīlan

verses.eng: And they say, 'When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?'
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا وَرُفَاتًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ خَلْقًا جَدِيدًا
verses.transliteration: Waqālū a-idhā kunnā ʿiẓāman warufātan a-innā lamabʿūthūna khalqan jadīdan

verses.eng: Say, 'Be you stones or iron,'
verses.arabic: قُلْ كُونُوا حِجَارَةً أَوْ حَدِيدًا
verses.transliteration: Qul kūnū ḥijāratan aw ḥadīdan

verses.eng: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts.' And they will say, 'Who will restore us?' Say, 'He who brought you forth the first time.' Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, 'When will it be?' Say, 'Perhaps it will be soon—
verses.arabic: أَوْ خَلْقًا مِّمَّا يَكْبُرُ فِي صُدُورِكُمْ ۚ فَسَيَقُولُونَ مَن يُعِيدُنَا ۖ قُلِ الَّذِي فَطَرَكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۚ فَسَيُنْغِضُونَ إِلَيْكَ رُءُوسَهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هُوَ ۖ قُلْ عَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ قَرِيبًا
verses.transliteration: Aw khalqan mimmā yakburu fī ṣudūrikum fasayaqūlūna man yuʿīdunā quli alladhī faṭarakum awwala marratin fasayunghiḍūna ilayka ruʾūsahum wayaqūlūna matā huwa qul ʿasā an yakūna qarīban

verses.eng: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little.'
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَدْعُوكُمْ فَتَسْتَجِيبُونَ بِحَمْدِهِ وَتَظُنُّونَ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Yawma yadʿūkum fatastajībūna biḥamdihi wataẓunnūna in labithtum illā qalīlan

verses.eng: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.
verses.arabic: وَقُل لِّعِبَادِي يَقُولُوا الَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ ۚ إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ يَنزَغُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ كَانَ لِلْإِنسَانِ عَدُوًّا مُّبِينًا
verses.transliteration: Waqul liʿibādī yaqūlū llatī hiya aḥsanu inna l-shayṭāna yanzaghu baynahum inna l-shayṭāna kāna lil'insāni ʿaduwwan mubīnan

verses.eng: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He can have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He can punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.
verses.arabic: رَّبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ ۖ إِن يَشَأْ يَرْحَمْكُمْ أَوْ إِن يَشَأْ يُعَذِّبْكُمْ ۚ وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَكِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Rabbukum aʿlamu bikum in yashaʾ yarḥamkum aw in yashaʾ yuʿadhibkum wamā arsalnāka ʿalayhim wakīlan

verses.eng: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
verses.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۗ وَلَقَدْ فَضَّلْنَا بَعْضَ النَّبِيِّينَ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۖ وَآتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ زَبُورًا
verses.transliteration: Warabbuka aʿlamu biman fī l-samāwāti wal-arḍi walaqad faḍḍalnā baʿḍa l-nabiyyīna ʿalā baʿḍin waātaynā dāwūda zabūran

verses.eng: Say, 'Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides Him, for they do not possess the ability to remove adversity from you or to avert [it].'
verses.arabic: قُلِ ادْعُوا الَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُم مِّن دُونِهِ فَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ كَشْفَ الضُّرِّ عَنكُمْ وَلَا تَحْوِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Quli idʿū lladhīna zaʿamtum min dūnihi falā yamlikūna kashfa l-ḍurri ʿankum walā taḥwīlan

verses.eng: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.
verses.arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ يَبْتَغُونَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمُ الْوَسِيلَةَ أَيُّهُمْ أَقْرَبُ وَيَرْجُونَ رَحْمَتَهُ وَيَخَافُونَ عَذَابَهُ ۚ إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ كَانَ مَحْذُورًا
verses.transliteration: Ulāika lladhīna yadʿūna yabtaghūna ilā rabbihimu l-wasīlata ayyuhum aqrabu wayarjūna raḥmatahu wayakhāfūna ʿadhābahu inna ʿadhāba rabbika kāna maḥdhūran

verses.eng: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.
verses.arabic: وَإِن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا نَحْنُ مُهْلِكُوهَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ أَوْ مُعَذِّبُوهَا عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۚ كَانَ ذَٰلِكَ فِي الْكِتَابِ مَسْطُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-in min qaryatin illā naḥnu muhlikūhā qabla yawmi l-qiyāmati aw muʿadhibūhā ʿadhāban shadīdan kāna dhālika fī l-kitābi masṭūran

verses.eng: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.
verses.arabic: وَمَا مَنَعَنَا أَن نُّرْسِلَ بِالْآيَاتِ إِلَّا أَن كَذَّبَ بِهَا الْأَوَّلُونَ ۚ وَآتَيْنَا ثَمُودَ النَّاقَةَ مُبْصِرَةً فَظَلَمُوا بِهَا ۚ وَمَا نُرْسِلُ بِالْآيَاتِ إِلَّا تَخْوِيفًا
verses.transliteration: Wamā manaʿanā an nursila bi-l-āyāti illā an kadhdhaba bihā l-awwalūna waātaynā thamūda l-nāqata mubṣiratan faẓalamū bihā wamā nursilu bi-l-āyāti illā takhwīfan

verses.eng: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, 'Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people.' And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, and the cursed tree in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لَكَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ أَحَاطَ بِالنَّاسِ ۚ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا الرُّؤْيَا الَّتِي أَرَيْنَاكَ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَالشَّجَرَةَ الْمَلْعُونَةَ فِي الْقُرْآنِ ۚ وَنُخَوِّفُهُمْ فَمَا يَزِيدُهُمْ إِلَّا طُغْيَانًا كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh qulnā laka inna rabbaka aḥāṭa bi-l-nāsi wamā jaʿalnā l-ruʾyā llatī araynāka illā fitnatan li-l-nāsi wal-shajarata l-malʿūnata fī l-qur'āni wanukhawwifuhum famā yazīduhum illā ṭughyānan kabīran

verses.eng: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ قَالَ أَأَسْجُدُ لِمَنْ خَلَقْتَ طِينًا
verses.transliteration: Wa ith qulna lil-malaikati usjudoo li-adama fasajadoo illa ibleesa qala a-asjudu liman khalaqta teenan

verses.eng: [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَرَأَيْتَكَ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كَرَّمْتَ عَلَىَّ لَئِنْ أَخَّرْتَنِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ لَأَحْتَنِكَنَّ ذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Qala araaytaka hatha allathee karramta AAalayya la-in akhkhartani ila yawmi alqiyamati laahtanikanna thurriyyatahu illa qaleelan

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱذْهَبْ فَمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ فَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ جَزَآؤُكُمْ جَزَآءًۭ مَّوْفُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Qala ithhab faman tabiAAaka minhum fa-inna jahannama jazawokum jazaan mawfooran

verses.eng: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
verses.arabic: وَٱسْتَفْزِزْ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتَ مِنْهُم بِصَوْتِكَ وَأَجْلِبْ عَلَيْهِم بِخَيْلِكَ وَرَجِلِكَ وَشَارِكْهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْوَٰلِ وَٱلْأَوْلَـٰدِ وَعِدْهُمْ ۚ وَمَا يَعِدُهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ إِلَّا غُرُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wastafziz mani istataAAtam bisawtika waajlib AAalayhim bikhaylika warajilika washarihim fee al-amwali wal-awladi waAAidhum wama yaAAiduhumu ashshaytanu illa ghurooran

verses.eng: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ عِبَادِى لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَـٰنٌۭ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ وَكِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Inna AAibadee laysa laka AAalayhim sultanun wakafa birabbika wakeelan

verses.eng: Your Lord is the one who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ ٱلَّذِى يُزْجِى لَكُمُ ٱلْفُلْكَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ لِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِكُمْ رَحِيمًۭا
verses.transliteration: Warabbuka allathee yuzjee lakumu alfulka fee albahri litabtaghoo min fadlihi innahu kana bikum raheeman

verses.eng: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّكُمُ ٱلضُّرُّ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ ضَلَّ مَن تَدْعُونَ إِلَّآ إِيَّاهُ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَجَّىٰكُمْ إِلَى ٱلْبَرِّ أَعْرَضْتُمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ كَفُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waitha massakumu addurru fee albahri dalla man tadAAoona illa iyyahu falamma najjakum ila albarri aAAradtum wakana al-insanu kafooran

verses.eng: Then do you feel secure that He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.
verses.arabic: أَفَأَمِنتُمْ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمْ جَانِبَ ٱلْبَرِّ أَوْ يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًۭا ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُوا۟ لَكُمْ وَكِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Afaamintum an yakhsifa bikum janiba albarri aw yursila AAalaykum hasiban thumma la tajidoo lakum wakeelan

verses.eng: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into it another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.
verses.arabic: أَمْ أَمِنتُمْ أَن يُعِيدَكُمْ فِيهِ تَارَةًۭ أُخْرَىٰ فَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ قَاصِفًۭا مِّنَ ٱلرِّيحِ فَيُغْرِقَكُم بِمَا كَفَرْتُمْ ۙ ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُوا۟ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا بِهِۦ تَبِيعًۭا
verses.transliteration: Am amintum an yuAAeedakum feehi taratan okhra fayursila AAalaykum qasifan mina alrreehi fayughriqakum bima kafartum thumma la tajidoo lakum AAalayna bihi tabeeAAan

verses.eng: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَرَّمْنَا بَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ وَحَمَلْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَرَزَقْنَـٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَفَضَّلْنَـٰهُمْ عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍۢ مِّمَّنْ خَلَقْنَا تَفْضِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Walaqad karramna banee adama wahamalnahum fee albarri walbahri warazaqnahum mina alttayyibati wafaddalnahum AAala katheerin mimman khalaqna tafdeelan

verses.eng: [The Day] We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ نَدْعُوا۟ كُلَّ أُنَاسٍۭ بِإِمَـٰمِهِمْ ۖ فَمَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَقْرَءُونَ كِتَـٰبَهُمْ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ فَتِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Yawma nadAAoo kulla onasin bi-imamihim faman ootiya kitabahu biyameenihi faolaika yaqraoona kitabahum wala yuthlamoona fateelan

verses.eng: But whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.
verses.arabic: وَمَن كَانَ فِى هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَعْمَىٰ فَهُوَ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَعْمَىٰ وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waman kana fee hathihi aAAma fahuwa fee al-akhirati aAAma waadallu sabeelan

verses.eng: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a close friend.
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَادُوا۟ لَيَفْتِنُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ لِتَفْتَرِىَ عَلَيْنَا غَيْرَهُۥ ۖ وَإِذًۭا لَّٱتَّخَذُوكَ خَلِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-in kadoo layaftinoonaka AAani allathee awhayna ilayka litaftariya AAalayna ghayrahu wa-ithan lattakhathooka khaleelan

verses.eng: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَآ أَن ثَبَّتْنَـٰكَ لَقَدْ كِدتَّ تَرْكَنُ إِلَيْهِمْ شَيْـًۭٔا قَلِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Walawla an thabbatnaka laqad kidta tarkanu ilayhim shayan qaleelan

verses.eng: Then [had you done so], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.
verses.arabic: إِذًۭا لَّأَذَقْنَـٰكَ ضِعْفَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ وَضِعْفَ ٱلْمَمَاتِ ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُ لَكَ عَلَيْنَا نَصِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Ithan laathaqnaka diAAfa alhayati wadiAAfa almamati thumma la tajidu laka AAalayna naseeran

verses.eng: And indeed, they were near to alarming you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then they would not have remained after you, except for a little.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ كَادُوا لَيَسْتَفِزُّونَكَ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ لِيُخْرِجُوكَ مِنْهَا ۖ وَإِذًا لَا يَلْبَثُونَ خِلَافَكَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa in kādū layastafizzūnaka mina l-arḍi liyukhrijūka minhā wa idhan lā yalbathūna khilāfaka illā qalīlā

verses.eng: [This is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.
verses.arabic: سُنَّةَ مَنْ قَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنْ رُسُلِنَا ۖ وَلَا تَجِدُ لِسُنَّتِنَا تَحْوِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Sunnata man qad arsalnā qablaka min rusulinā wa lā tajidu lisunnatinā taḥwīlā

verses.eng: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.
verses.arabic: أَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ لِدُلُوكِ الشَّمْسِ إِلَىٰ غَسَقِ اللَّيْلِ وَقُرْآنَ الْفَجْرِ ۖ إِنَّ قُرْآنَ الْفَجْرِ كَانَ مَشْهُودًا
verses.transliteration: Aqimi ṣ-ṣalāta lidulūki sh-shamsi ilā ghasaqi l-layli wa qur'āna l-fajri inna qur'āna l-fajri kāna mashhūdā

verses.eng: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَتَهَجَّدْ بِهِ نَافِلَةً لَكَ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَبْعَثَكَ رَبُّكَ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا
verses.transliteration: Wa mina l-layli fatahajjad bihī nāfilatan laka ʿasā an yabʿathaka rabbuka maqāman maḥmūdā

verses.eng: And say, 'My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority.'
verses.arabic: وَقُلْ رَبِّ أَدْخِلْنِي مُدْخَلَ صِدْقٍ وَأَخْرِجْنِي مُخْرَجَ صِدْقٍ وَاجْعَلْ لِي مِنْ لَدُنْكَ سُلْطَانًا نَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qul rabbi adkhilnī mudkhala ṣidqin wa akhrijnī mukh'raja ṣidqin wa jʿal lī min ladunka sul'ṭānan naṣīrā

verses.eng: And say, 'Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart.'
verses.arabic: وَقُلْ جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ الْبَاطِلُ ۖ إِنَّ الْبَاطِلَ كَانَ زَهُوقًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qul jā'a l-ḥaqqu wa zahaqa l-bāṭilu inna l-bāṭila kāna zahūqā

verses.eng: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
verses.arabic: وَنُنَزِّلُ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ مَا هُوَ شِفَاءٌ وَرَحْمَةٌ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۙ وَلَا يَزِيدُ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
verses.transliteration: Wa nunazzilu mina l-qur'āni mā huwa shifā'un wa raḥmatun lilmu'minīna wa lā yazīdu ẓ-ẓālimīna illā khasārā

verses.eng: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا أَنْعَمْنَا عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ أَعْرَضَ وَنَأَىٰ بِجَانِبِهِ ۖ وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ كَانَ يَئُوسًا
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā anʿamnā ʿala l-insāni aʿraḍa wa na'ā bijānibihi wa idhā massahu sh-sharru kāna ya'ūsā

verses.eng: Say, 'Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ كُلٌّ يَعْمَلُ عَلَىٰ شَاكِلَتِهِ فَرَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ هُوَ أَهْدَىٰ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Qul kullun yaʿmalu ʿalā shākilatihi fa rabbukum aʿlamu biman huwa ahdā sabīlā

verses.eng: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, 'The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind has not been given of knowledge except a little.'
verses.arabic: وَيَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ الرُّوحِ ۖ قُلِ الرُّوحُ مِنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّي وَمَا أُوتِيتُمْ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa yas'alūnaka ʿani r-rūḥi quli r-rūḥu min amri rabbī wa mā ūtītum mina l-ʿilmi illā qalīlā

verses.eng: And if We willed, We could surely take away that which We have revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ شِئْنَا لَنَذْهَبَنَّ بِالَّذِي أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُ لَكَ بِهِ عَلَيْنَا وَكِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa la'in shi'nā lanaḍhabanna bi-lladhī awḥaynā ilayka thumma lā tajidu laka bihi ʿalaynā wakīlā

verses.eng: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّ فَضْلَهُ كَانَ عَلَيْكَ كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Illā raḥmatan min rabbika inna faḍlahu kāna ʿalayka kabīrā

verses.eng: Say, 'If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ لَئِنِ اجْتَمَعَتِ الْإِنْسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يَأْتُوا بِمِثْلِ هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ لَا يَأْتُونَ بِمِثْلِهِ وَلَوْ كَانَ بَعْضُهُمْ لِبَعْضٍ ظَهِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Qul la-ini jtamaʿati l-insu wa l-jinnu ʿalā an ya'tū bimithli hādhā l-qur'āni lā ya'tūna bimithlihi wa law kāna baʿḍuhum libaʿḍin ẓahīrā

verses.eng: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِي هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ مِنْ كُلِّ مَثَلٍ فَأَبَىٰ أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ṣarrafnā li-nnāsi fī hādhā l-qur'āni min kulli mathalin fa abā aktharu n-nāsi illā kufūrā

verses.eng: And they say, 'We will not believe you until you break forth for us from the ground a spring'
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا لَنْ نُؤْمِنَ لَكَ حَتَّىٰ تَفْجُرَ لَنَا مِنَ الْأَرْضِ يَنْبُوعًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qālū lan nu'mina laka ḥattā tafjura lanā mina l-arḍi yanbūʿā

verses.eng: Or you have a house of gold, or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"
verses.arabic: أَوْ تَكُونَ لَكَ جَنَّةٌ مِنْ نَخِيلٍ وَعِنَبٍ فَتُفَجِّرَ الْأَنْهَارَ خِلَالَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Aw takoona laka jannatun min nakheelin wa 'inabin fatufajjira al-anhara khilalaha tafjeera

verses.eng: Or you cause the heaven to fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed, or you bring Allah and the angels before [us].
verses.arabic: أَوْ تُسْقِطَ السَّمَاءَ كَمَا زَعَمْتَ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا أَوْ تَأْتِيَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْمَلَائِكَةِ قَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Aw tusqita al-samaa kama za'amta 'alayna kisafan aw ta/tiya biAllahi wa almala-ikati qabeela

verses.eng: Or you have a house of gold, or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"
verses.arabic: أَوْ يَكُونَ لَكَ بَيْتٌ مِنْ زُخْرُفٍ أَوْ تَرْقَى فِي السَّمَاءِ وَلَنْ نُؤْمِنَ لِرُقِيِّكَ حَتَّى تُنَزِّلَ عَلَيْنَا كِتَابًا نَقْرَؤُهُ قُلْ سُبْحَانَ رَبِّي هَلْ كُنْتُ إِلَّا بَشَرًا رَسُولًا
verses.transliteration: Aw yakoona laka baytun min zukhrufin aw tarqa fee al-sama-i walan nu/minu liruqiyyika hatta tunazzila 'alayna kitaban naqra/uhu qul subhana rabbee hal kuntu illa basharan rasoola

verses.eng: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"
verses.arabic: وَمَا مَنَعَ النَّاسَ أَنْ يُؤْمِنُوا إِذْ جَاءَهُمُ الْهُدَى إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا أَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ بَشَرًا رَسُولًا
verses.transliteration: Wama mana'a al-nasa an yu/minoo ith jaahumu alhuda illa an qaloo aba'atha Allahu basharan rasoola

verses.eng: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."
verses.arabic: قُلْ لَوْ كَانَ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَلَائِكَةٌ يَمْشُونَ مُطْمَئِنِّينَ لَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَلَكًا رَسُولًا
verses.transliteration: Qul law kana fee al-ardi mala-ikatun yamshoona mutma-inneena lanazzalna 'alayhim mina al-sama-i malakan rasoola

verses.eng: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."
verses.arabic: قُلْ كَفَى بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا بَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Qul kafa biAllahi shaheedan baynee wabaynakum innahu kana bi'ibadihi khabeeran baseera

verses.eng: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ يَهْدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ الْمُهْتَدِ وَمَنْ يُضْلِلْ فَلَنْ تَجِدَ لَهُمْ أَوْلِيَاءَ مِنْ دُونِهِ وَنَحْشُرُهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ عَلَى وُجُوهِهِمْ عُمْيًا وَبُكْمًا وَصُمًّا مَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ كُلَّمَا خَبَتْ زِدْنَاهُمْ سَعِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Waman yahdi Allahu fahuwa almuhtadi waman yudlil falan tajida lahum awliyaa min doonihi wanahshuruhum yawma al-qiyamati 'ala wujoohihum 'umyan wabukman wasumman ma/wahum jahannamu kullama khabat zidnahum sa'eera

verses.eng: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَاؤُهُمْ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَقَالُوا أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا وَرُفَاتًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ خَلْقًا جَدِيدًا
verses.transliteration: Thalika jazao-uhum bi-annahum kafaroo bi-ayatina waqaloo a-itha kunna 'ithaman warufatan a-inna lamab'oothoona khalqan jadeeda

verses.eng: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّ اللَّهَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ قَادِرٌ عَلَى أَنْ يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَهُمْ أَجَلًا لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ فَأَبَى الظَّالِمُونَ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw anna Allaha allathee khalaqa al-samawati waal-arda qadirun 'ala an yakhluqa mithlahum waja'ala lahum ajalan la rayba feehi faaba alththalimoona illa kufoora

verses.eng: Say, "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending. And ever has man been stingy."
verses.arabic: قُلْ لَوْ أَنْتُمْ تَمْلِكُونَ خَزَائِنَ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّي إِذًا لَأَمْسَكْتُمْ خَشْيَةَ الْإِنْفَاقِ وَكَانَ الْإِنْسَانُ قَتُورًا
verses.transliteration: Qul law antum tamlikoona khaza-ina rahmati rabbee ithan la-amsaktum khashyata al-infaqi wakana al-insanu qatoora

verses.eng: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ تِسْعَ آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ فَاسْأَلْ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ إِذْ جَاءَهُمْ فَقَالَ لَهُ فِرْعَوْنُ إِنِّي لَأَظُنُّكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ مَسْحُورًا
verses.transliteration: Walaqad atayna moosa tis'aa ayatin bayyinatin faisal banee isra-eela ith jaahum faqala lahu fir'awnu innee laathunnuka ya moosa mas-hoora

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا أَنْزَلَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ بَصَائِرَ وَإِنِّي لَأَظُنُّكَ يَا فِرْعَوْنُ مَثْبُورًا
verses.transliteration: Qala laqad 'alimta ma anzala haola-i illa rabbu alssamawati waal-ardi basa-ira wa-innee laathunnuka ya fir'awnu mathboora

verses.eng: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.
verses.arabic: فَأَرَادَ أَنْ يَسْتَفِزَّهُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faarada an yastafizzahum mina al-ardi fa-aghraqnahu waman ma'ahu ajma'een

verses.eng: And We said after [that] to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter comes, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."
verses.arabic: وَقُلْنَا مِنْ بَعْدِهِ لِبَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ اسْكُنُوا الْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا جَاءَ وَعْدُ الْآخِرَةِ جِئْنَا بِكُمْ لَفِيفًا
verses.transliteration: Waqulna min ba'dihi libanee isra-eela oskunoo al-arda fa-itha jaa wa'du al-akhirati ji/nna bikum lafeefa

verses.eng: And with the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
verses.arabic: وَبِالْحَقِّ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ وَبِالْحَقِّ نَزَلَ وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wabilhaqqi anzalnahu wabilhaqqi nazala wama arsalnaka illa mubashshiran wanatheera

verses.eng: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
verses.arabic: وَقُرْآنًا فَرَقْنَاهُ لِتَقْرَأَهُ عَلَى النَّاسِ عَلَىٰ مُكْثٍ وَنَزَّلْنَاهُ تَنْزِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qur'ānan faraqnāhu litaqra'ahu 'alā an-nāsi 'alā mukthin wa nazzalnāhu tanzīlā

verses.eng: Say, 'Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,'
verses.arabic: قُلْ آمِنُوا بِهِ أَوْ لَا تُؤْمِنُوا ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ إِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ يَخِرُّونَ لِلْأَذْقَانِ سُجَّدًا
verses.transliteration: Qul āminū bihi aw lā tu'minū. Inna alladhīna ūtū al-'ilma min qablihi idhā yutlā 'alayhim yakhirrūna lil-adhqāni sujjadā

verses.eng: And they say, 'Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled.'
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنْ كَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّنَا لَمَفْعُولًا
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqūlūna subḥāna rabbinā in kāna wa'du rabbinā lamaf'ūlā

verses.eng: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.
verses.arabic: وَيَخِرُّونَ لِلْأَذْقَانِ يَبْكُونَ وَيَزِيدُهُمْ خُشُوعًا
verses.transliteration: Wa yakhirrūna lil-adhqāni yabkūna wa yazīduhum khushū'ā

verses.eng: Say, 'Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names.' And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an intermediate way.
verses.arabic: قُلِ ادْعُوا اللَّهَ أَوِ ادْعُوا الرَّحْمَٰنَ ۖ أَيًّا مَا تَدْعُوا فَلَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَلَا تَجْهَرْ بِصَلَاتِكَ وَلَا تُخَافِتْ بِهَا وَابْتَغِ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Quli id'ū Allāha awi id'ū ar-Raḥmān. Ayyam mā tad'ū fa lahu al-asmā'u al-ḥusnā. Wa lā tajhar biṣalātika wa lā tukhāfit bihā wabtaghi bayna dhālika sabīlā

verses.eng: And say, 'Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification.'
verses.arabic: وَقُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي لَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًا وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ شَرِيكٌ فِي الْمُلْكِ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ وَلِيٌّ مِنَ الذُّلِّ ۖ وَكَبِّرْهُ تَكْبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa quli al-ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī lam yattakhidh waladan wa lam yakun lahu sharīkun fī al-mulki wa lam yakun lahu waliyyun mina adh-dhulli wa kabbirhu takbīrā

verses.eng: All praise is due to Allah, who has sent down to His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.
verses.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَنْزَلَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ الْكِتَابَ وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ لَهُ عِوَجًا
verses.transliteration: Alhamdu lillahi allathee anzala AAala AAabdihi alkitaba walam yajAAal lahu AAiwaja

verses.eng: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward
verses.arabic: قَيِّمًا لِيُنْذِرَ بَأْسًا شَدِيدًا مِنْ لَدُنْهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ الَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ الصَّالِحَاتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا
verses.transliteration: Qayyiman liyunthira ba/san shadeedan min ladunhu wayubashshira almumineena allatheena yaAAmaloona alssalihati anna lahum ajran hasanan

verses.eng: In which they will remain forever
verses.arabic: مَاكِثِينَ فِيهِ أَبَدًا
verses.transliteration: Makitheena feehi abadan

verses.eng: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."
verses.arabic: وَيُنْذِرَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ وَلَدًا
verses.transliteration: Wayunthira allatheena qaloo ittakhatha Allahu waladan

verses.eng: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.
verses.arabic: مَا لَهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ وَلَا لِآبَائِهِمْ ۚ كَبُرَتْ كَلِمَةً تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ ۚ إِنْ يَقُولُونَ إِلَّا كَذِبًا
verses.transliteration: Ma lahum bihi min AAilmin wala liaba-ihim kaburat kalimatan takhruju min afwahihim in yaqooloona illa kathiban

verses.eng: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.
verses.arabic: فَلَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَفْسَكَ عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ إِنْ لَمْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ أَسَفًا
verses.transliteration: FalaAAallaka bakhiaAAun nafsaka AAala atharihim in lam yuminoo bihatha alhadeethi asafan

verses.eng: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.
verses.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا مَا عَلَى الْأَرْضِ زِينَةً لَهَا لِنَبْلُوَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا
verses.transliteration: Inna jaAAalna ma AAala alardi zeenatan laha linabluwahum ayyuhum ahsanu AAamalan

verses.eng: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَاعِلُونَ مَا عَلَيْهَا صَعِيدًا جُرُزًا
verses.transliteration: Wainna lajaAAiloona ma AAalayha saAAeedan juruzan

verses.eng: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?
verses.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَابَ الْكَهْفِ وَالرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا مِنْ آيَاتِنَا عَجَبًا
verses.transliteration: Am hasibta anna ashaba alkahfi waalrraqeemi kanoo min ayatina AAajaban

verses.eng: When the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."
verses.arabic: إِذْ أَوَى الْفِتْيَةُ إِلَى الْكَهْفِ فَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا آتِنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا
verses.transliteration: Ith awa alfitayatu ila alkahfi faqaloo rabbana atina min ladunka rahmatan wahayyi lana min amrina rashadan

verses.eng: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.
verses.arabic: فَضَرَبْنَا عَلَىٰ آذَانِهِمْ فِي الْكَهْفِ سِنِينَ عَدَدًا
verses.transliteration: Fadarabna AAala athanihim fee alkahfi sineena AAadadan

verses.eng: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَاهُمْ لِنَعْلَمَ أَيُّ الْحِزْبَيْنِ أَحْصَىٰ لِمَا لَبِثُوا أَمَدًا
verses.transliteration: Thumma baAAathnahum linaAAlama ayyu alhizbayni ahsa lima labithoo amadan

verses.eng: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
verses.arabic: نَحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ نَبَأَهُمْ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ فِتْيَةٌ آمَنُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ وَزِدْنَاهُمْ هُدًى
verses.transliteration: Nahnu naqussu AAalayka nabaahum bialhaqqi innahum fitayatun amanoo birabbihim wazidnahum hudan

verses.eng: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.
verses.arabic: وَرَبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ إِذْ قَامُوا فَقَالُوا رَبُّنَا رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ لَنْ نَدْعُوَ مِنْ دُونِهِ إِلَٰهًا ۖ لَقَدْ قُلْنَا إِذًا شَطَطًا
verses.transliteration: Warabatna AAala quloobihim ith qamoo faqaloo rabbuna rabbu alssamawati waalardi lan nadAAuwa min doonihi ilahan laqad qulna ithan shatatan

verses.eng: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"
verses.arabic: هَٰؤُلَاءِ قَوْمُنَا اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً ۖ لَوْلَا يَأْتُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ بَيِّنٍ ۖ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
verses.transliteration: Haola-i qawmuna ittakhathoo min doonihi alihatan lawla yatoona AAalayhim bisultanin bayyin faman athlamu mimani iftara AAala Allahi kathiban

verses.eng: And when you withdraw from them and that which they worship other than Allah, then seek refuge in the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility.
verses.arabic: وَإِذِ اعْتَزَلْتُمُوهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا اللَّهَ فَأْوُوا إِلَى الْكَهْفِ يَنْشُرْ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ مِنْ رَحْمَتِهِ وَيُهَيِّئْ لَكُمْ مِنْ أَمْرِكُمْ مِرْفَقًا
verses.transliteration: Wa idhi i'tazaltumoohum wa ma ya'budoona illa Allaha fa'woo ila alkahfi yanshur lakum rabbukum min rahmatihi wayuhayyi' lakum min amrikum mirfaqan

verses.eng: And you would have seen the sun, when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.
verses.arabic: وَتَرَى الشَّمْسَ إِذَا طَلَعَتْ تَّزَاوَرُ عَن كَهْفِهِمْ ذَاتَ الْيَمِينِ وَإِذَا غَرَبَت تَّقْرِضُهُمْ ذَاتَ الشِّمَالِ وَهُمْ فِي فَجْوَةٍ مِّنْهُ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ مَن يَهْدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ الْمُهْتَدِ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُ وَلِيًّا مُّرْشِدًا
verses.transliteration: Watara ashshamsa idha tala'at tazawaru 'an kahfihim thata alyameeni waidha gharabat taqriduhum thata ashshimali wahum fee fajwatin minhu thalika min ayati Allahi man yahdi Allahu fahuwa almuhtadi waman yudlil falan tajida lahu waliyyan murshidan

verses.eng: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.
verses.arabic: وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ أَيْقَاظًا وَهُمْ رُقُودٌ وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ ذَاتَ الْيَمِينِ وَذَاتَ الشِّمَالِ وَكَلْبُهُم بَاسِطٌ ذِرَاعَيْهِ بِالْوَصِيدِ لَوِ اطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَوَلَّيْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِرَارًا وَلَمُلِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ رُعْبًا
verses.transliteration: Watahsabuhum ayqathan wahum ruqoodun wanuqallibuhum thata alyameeni wathata ashshimali wakalbuhum basitun thira'ayhi bilwaseedi lawi ittala'ta 'alayhim lawallayta minhum firaran walamuli'ta minhum ru'ban

verses.eng: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ بَعَثْنَاهُمْ لِيَتَسَاءَلُوا بَيْنَهُمْ قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ قَالُوا لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ قَالُوا رَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثْتُمْ فَابْعَثُوا أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَٰذِهِ إِلَى الْمَدِينَةِ فَلْيَنظُرْ أَيُّهَا أَزْكَىٰ طَعَامًا فَلْيَأْتِكُم بِرِزْقٍ مِّنْهُ وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ بِكُمْ أَحَدًا
verses.transliteration: Wakathalika ba'athnahum liyatasaa'aloo baynahum qala qailun minhum kam labithtum qaloo labithna yawman aw ba'da yawmin qaloo rabbukum a'lamu bima labithtum faib'athoo ahadakum biwariqikum hathihi ila almadeenati falyathur ayyuha azka ta'aman falyatikum birizqin minhu walyatalattaf wala yush'iranna bikum ahadan

verses.eng: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ إِن يَظْهَرُوا عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِي مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَن تُفْلِحُوا إِذًا أَبَدًا
verses.transliteration: Innahum in yathharoo 'alaykum yarjumookum aw yu'eedookum fee millatihim walan tuflihoo ithan abadan

verses.eng: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَعْثَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَأَنَّ السَّاعَةَ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَا إِذْ يَتَنَازَعُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَمْرَهُمْ فَقَالُوا ابْنُوا عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَانًا رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِهِمْ قَالَ الَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا عَلَىٰ أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم مَّسْجِدًا
verses.transliteration: Wakathalika a'tharna 'alayhim liya'lamoo anna wa'da Allahi haqqun waanna alssa'ata la rayba feeha ith yatanaza'oona baynahum amrahum faqaloo ibnoo 'alayhim bunyaanan rabbuhum a'lamu bihim qala allatheena ghalaboo 'ala amrihim lanattakhithanna 'alayhim masjidan

verses.eng: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."
verses.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَاثَةٌ رَّابِعُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ خَمْسَةٌ سَادِسُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ رَجْمًا بِالْغَيْبِ وَيَقُولُونَ سَبْعَةٌ وَثَامِنُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ قُل رَّبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمْ إِلَّا مِرَاءً ظَاهِرًا وَلَا تَسْتَفْتِ فِيهِم مِّنْهُمْ أَحَدًا
verses.transliteration: Sayaqooloona thalathatun rabi'uhum kalbuhum wayaqooloona khamsatun sadisuhum kalbuhum rajman bialghaybi wayaqooloona sab'atun wathaminuhum kalbuhum qul rabbee a'lamu bi'iddatihim ma ya'lamuhum illa qaleelun fala tumari feehim illa miraan thahiran wala tastafti feehim minhum ahadan

verses.eng: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَقُولَنَّ لِشَيْءٍ إِنِّي فَاعِلٌ ذَٰلِكَ غَدًا
verses.transliteration: Wala taqoolanna lishay'in innee fa'ilun thalika ghadan

verses.eng: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."
verses.arabic: إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ وَاذْكُر رَّبَّكَ إِذَا نَسِيتَ وَقُلْ عَسَىٰ أَن يَهْدِيَنِ رَبِّي لِأَقْرَبَ مِنْ هَٰذَا رَشَدًا
verses.transliteration: Illa an yashaa Allahu waothkur rabbaka itha naseeta waqul 'asa an yahdiyanee rabbee li-aqraba min hatha rashadan

verses.eng: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.
verses.arabic: وَلَبِثُوا فِي كَهْفِهِمْ ثَلَاثَ مِائَةٍ سِنِينَ وَازْدَادُوا تِسْعًا
verses.transliteration: Walabithoo fee kahfihim thalatha miatin sineena wazdadoo tis'an

verses.eng: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."
verses.arabic: قُلِ اللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثُوا لَهُ غَيْبُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ أَبْصِرْ بِهِ وَأَسْمِعْ مَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلَا يُشْرِكُ فِي حُكْمِهِ أَحَدًا
verses.transliteration: Quli Allahu a'lamu bima labithoo lahu ghaybu alssamawati waalardi absir bihi waasmi' ma lahum min doonihi min waliyyin wala yushriku fee hukmihi ahadan

verses.eng: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.
verses.arabic: وَاتْلُ مَا أُوحِيَ إِلَيْكَ مِن كِتَابِ رَبِّكَ لَا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَاتِهِ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا
verses.transliteration: Waatlu ma oohiya ilayka min kitabi rabbika la mubaddila likalimatihi walan tajida min doonihi multahadan

verses.eng: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.
verses.arabic: وَاصْبِرْ نَفْسَكَ مَعَ الَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِالْغَدَاةِ وَالْعَشِيِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَهُ وَلَا تَعْدُ عَيْنَاكَ عَنْهُمْ تُرِيدُ زِينَةَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَلَا تُطِعْ مَنْ أَغْفَلْنَا قَلْبَهُ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَاتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ وَكَانَ أَمْرُهُ فُرُطًا
verses.transliteration: Waisbir nafsaka ma'a allatheena yad'oona rabbahum bialghadati waal'ashiyyi yureedoona wajhahu wala ta'du 'aynaka 'anhum tureedu zeenata alhayati alddunya wala tuti' man aghfalna qalbahu 'an thikrina waittaba'a hawahu wakana amruhu furutan

verses.eng: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, scalding [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
verses.arabic: وَقُلِ الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ فَمَن شَاءَ فَلْيُؤْمِن وَمَن شَاءَ فَلْيَكْفُرْ إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ نَارًا أَحَاطَ بِهِمْ سُرَادِقُهَا وَإِن يَسْتَغِيثُوا يُغَاثُوا بِمَاءٍ كَالْمُهْلِ يَشْوِي الْوُجُوهَ بِئْسَ الشَّرَابُ وَسَاءَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
verses.transliteration: Waquli alhaqqu min rabbikum faman shaa falyu/min waman shaa falyakfur inna a'tadna lilththalimeena naran ahata bihim suradiquha wa-in yastagheethoo yughathoo bima-in kaalmuhli yashwee alwujooha bi/sa alshsharabu wasaat murtafaqan

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ مَنْ أَحْسَنَ عَمَلًا
verses.transliteration: Inna allatheena amanoo wa'amiloo alssalihati inna la nudee'u ajra man ahsana 'amalan

verses.eng: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍۢ وَيَلْبَسُونَ ثِيَابًا خُضْرًۭا مِّن سُندُسٍۢ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِۚ نِعْمَ ٱلثَّوَابُ وَحَسُنَتْ مُرْتَفَقًۭا
verses.transliteration: Ulaika lahum jannatu 'adnin tajree min tahtihimu al-anharu yuhallawna feeha min asawira min thahabin wayalbasoona thiyaban khudran min sundusin wa-istabraqin muttaki-eena feeha 'ala al-araiki ni'ma alththawabu wahasunat murtafaqan

verses.eng: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.
verses.arabic: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًۭا رَّجُلَيْنِ جَعَلْنَا لِأَحَدِهِمَا جَنَّتَيْنِ مِنْ أَعْنَـٰبٍۢ وَحَفَفْنَـٰهُمَا بِنَخْلٍۢ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمَا زَرْعًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waidrib lahum mathalan rajulayni ja'alna li-ahadihima jannatayni min a'nabin wahafafnahuma binakhlin waja'alna baynahuma zar'an

verses.eng: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.
verses.arabic: كِلْتَا ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ ءَاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا وَلَمْ تَظْلِم مِّنْهُ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ وَفَجَّرْنَا خِلَـٰلَهُمَا نَهَرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Kiltā aljannatayni atat ukulahā walam tathlim minhu shay-an wafajjarnā khilālahumā naharan

verses.eng: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, 'I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men.'
verses.arabic: وَكَانَ لَهُۥ ثَمَرٌۭ فَقَالَ لِصَـٰحِبِهِۦ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَنَا۠ أَكْثَرُ مِنكَ مَالًۭا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wakāna lahu thamarun faqāla liṣāḥibihi wahuwa yuḥāwiruhu anā aktharu minka mālan wa-a'azzu nafaran

verses.eng: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, 'I do not think that this will perish - ever.
verses.arabic: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُۥ وَهُوَ ظَالِمٌۭ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ قَالَ مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wadakhala jannatahu wahuwa ẓālimun linafsihi qāla mā aẓunnu an tabīda hādhihi abadan

verses.eng: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return.'
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَظُنُّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ قَآئِمَةًۭ وَلَئِن رُّدِدتُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهَا مُنقَلَبًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wamā aẓunnu alssā'ata qāimatan wala-in rudidtu ilā rabbee la-ajidanna khayran minhā munqalaban

verses.eng: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, 'Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَهُۥ صَاحِبُهُۥ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَكَفَرْتَ بِٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ ثُمَّ سَوَّىٰكَ رَجُلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Qāla lahu ṣāḥibuhu wahuwa yuḥāwiruhu akafarta bi-alladhī khalaqaka min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma sawwāka rajulan

verses.eng: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.
verses.arabic: لَّـٰكِنَّا۠ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Lākinna huwa Allāhu rabbee walā ushriku birabbee aḥadan

verses.eng: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah'? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَآ إِذْ دَخَلْتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلْتَ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِۚ إِن تَرَنِۦٓ أَنَا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مَالًۭا وَوَلَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Walawlā idh dakhalta jannataka qulta mā shāa Allāhu lā quwwata illā billāhi in tarani anā aqalla minka mālan wawaladan

verses.eng: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,
verses.arabic: فَعَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يُؤْتِيَنِ خَيْرًۭا مِّن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهَا حُسْبَانًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَتُصْبِحَ صَعِيدًۭا زَلَقًا
verses.transliteration: Fa'asā rabbee an yu'tiyani khayran min jannatika wayursila 'alayḥā ḥusbānan mina alssamāi faṭuṣbiḥa ṣa'īdan zalaqan

verses.eng: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it.
verses.arabic: أَوْ يُصْبِحَ مَآؤُهَا غَوْرًۭا فَلَن تَسْتَطِيعَ لَهُۥ طَلَبًۭا
verses.transliteration: Aw yuṣbiḥa māuhā ghawran falan tastaṭī'a lahu ṭalaban

verses.eng: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, 'Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone.'
verses.arabic: وَأُحِيطَ بِثَمَرِهِۦ فَأَصْبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيْهِ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنفَقَ فِيهَا وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُشْرِكْ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-uḥīṭa bithamarihi fa-aṣbaḥa yuqallibu kaffayhi 'alā mā anfaqa feehā wahiya khāwiyatun 'alā 'urūshihā wayaqūlu yā laytanee lam ushrik birabbee aḥadan

verses.eng: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.
verses.arabic: وَلَمْ تَكُن لَّهُۥ فِئَةٌۭ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مُنتَصِرًا
verses.transliteration: Walam takun lahu fi-atun yanṣurūnahu min dūni Allāhi wamā kāna muntaṣiran

verses.eng: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.
verses.arabic: هُنَالِكَ ٱلْوَلَـٰيَةُ لِلَّهِ ٱلْحَقِّۚ هُوَ خَيْرٌۭ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌ عُقْبًۭا
verses.transliteration: Hunālika alwalāyatu lillāhi alḥaqqi huwa khayrun thawāban wakhayrun 'uqban

verses.eng: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.
verses.arabic: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَصْبَحَ هَشِيمًۭا تَذْرُوهُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحُۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرًا
verses.transliteration: Waidrib lahum mathala alḥayati alddunyā kamāin anzalnāhu mina alssamāi fa-ikhtalaṭa bihi nabātu al-arḍi fa-aṣbaḥa hashīman tadhrūhu alrriyāḥu wakāna Allāhu 'alā kulli shay-in muqtadiran

verses.eng: Wealth and children are the adornment of the life of this world. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.
verses.arabic: ٱلْمَالُ وَٱلْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌ أَمَلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Almālu walbanūna zīnatu alḥayati alddunyā walbāqiyātu alṣṣāliḥātu khayrun ʿinda rabbika thawāban wakhayrun amalan

verses.eng: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نُسَيِّرُ ٱلْجِبَالَ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ بَارِزَةًۭ وَحَشَرْنَـٰهُمْ فَلَمْ نُغَادِرْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wayawma nusayyiru aljibāla watarā al-arḍa bārizatan waḥasharnāhum falam nughādir minhum aḥadan

verses.eng: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."
verses.arabic: وَعُرِضُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّۭا لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمُونَا كَمَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۭ ۚ بَلْ زَعَمْتُمْ أَلَّن نَّجْعَلَ لَكُم مَّوْعِدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waʿuriḍū ʿalā rabbika ṣaffan laqad jiʾtumūnā kamā khalaqnākum awwala marratin bal zaʿamtum allan najʿala lakum mawʿidan

verses.eng: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.
verses.arabic: وَوُضِعَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ فَتَرَى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ مُشْفِقِينَ مِمَّا فِيهِ وَيَقُولُونَ يَـٰوَيْلَتَنَا مَالِ هَـٰذَا ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَا يُغَادِرُ صَغِيرَةًۭ وَلَا كَبِيرَةً إِلَّآ أَحْصَىٰهَا ۚ وَوَجَدُوا۟ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ حَاضِرًۭا ۗ وَلَا يَظْلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wawuḍiʿa alkitābu fatarā almujrimīna mushfiqīna mimmā fīhi wayaqūlūna yāwaylatanā māli hādhā alkitābi lā yughādiru �aghīratan walā kabīratan illā aḥṣāhā wawajadū mā ʿamilū ḥāḍiran walā yaẓlimu rabbuka aḥadan

verses.eng: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذُونَهُۥ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِى وَهُمْ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۢ ۚ بِئْسَ لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بَدَلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh qulnā lilmalāikati usjudū li-ādama fasajadū illā iblīsa kāna mina aljinni fafasaqa ʿan amri rabbihi afatattakhidhūnahu wadhurriyyatahu awliyāa min dūnī wahum lakum ʿaduwwun biʾsa lilẓẓālimīna badalan

verses.eng: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.
verses.arabic: مَّآ أَشْهَدتُّهُمْ خَلْقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا خَلْقَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمَا كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ ٱلْمُضِلِّينَ عَضُدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Mā ashhadttuhum khalqa alssamāwāti wal-arḍi walā khalqa anfusihim wamā kuntu muttakhidha almuḍillīna ʿaḍudan

verses.eng: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them a partition.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَقُولُ نَادُوا۟ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّوْبِقًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wayawma yaqūlu nādū shurakāiya alladhīna zaʿamtum fadaʿawhum falam yastajībū lahum wajaʿalnā baynahum mawbiqan

verses.eng: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.
verses.arabic: وَرَءَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ ٱلنَّارَ فَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مُّوَاقِعُوهَا وَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ عَنْهَا مَصْرِفًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waraā almujrimūna alnnāra faẓannū annahum muwāqiʿūhā walam yajidū ʿanhā maṣrifan

verses.eng: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ لِلنَّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍۢ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَكْثَرَ شَىْءٍۢ جَدَلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Walaqad ṣarrafnā fī hādhā alqurāni lilnnāsi min kulli mathalin wakāna al-insānu akthara shayin jadalan

verses.eng: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.
verses.arabic: وَمَا مَنَعَ ٱلنَّاسَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ قُبُلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wamā manaʿa alnnāsa an yuʾminū idh jāahumu alhudā wayastaghfirū rabbahum illā an taʾtiyahum sunnatu al-awwalīna aw yaʾtiyahumu alʿadhābu qubulan

verses.eng: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.
verses.arabic: وَمَا نُرْسِلُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ ۚ وَيُجَـٰدِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ لِيُدْحِضُوا۟ بِهِ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَمَآ أُنذِرُوا۟ هُزُوًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wamā nursilu almursalīna illā mubashirīna wamundhirīna wayujādilu alladhīna kafarū bilbāṭili liyud'ḥiḍū bihi alḥaqqa waittakhadhū āyātī wamā undhirū huzuwan

verses.eng: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ فَأَعْرَضَ عَنْهَا وَنَسِىَ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ ۚ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًۭا ۖ وَإِن تَدْعُهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ فَلَن يَهْتَدُوٓا۟ إِذًۭا أَبَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Waman aẓlamu mimman dhukkira bi-āyāti rabbihi fa-aʿraḍa ʿanhā wanasiya mā qaddamat yadāhu innā jaʿalnā ʿalā qulūbihim akinnatan an yafqahūhu wafī ādhānihim waqran wa-in tadʿuhum ilā alhudā falan yahtadū idhan abadan

verses.eng: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.
verses.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ذُو ٱلرَّحْمَةِ ۖ لَوْ يُؤَاخِذُهُم بِمَا كَسَبُوا۟ لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ بَل لَّهُم مَّوْعِدٌۭ لَّن يَجِدُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَوْئِلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Warabbuka alghafūru dhū alrraḥmati law yuʾākhidhuhum bimā kasabū laʿajjala lahumu alʿadhāba bal lahum mawʿidun lan yajidū min dūnihi mawilan

verses.eng: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.
verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا۟ وَجَعَلْنَا لِمَهْلِكِهِم مَّوْعِدًۭا
verses.transliteration: Watilka alqurā ahlaknāhum lammā ẓalamū wajaʿalnā limahlikihim mawʿidan

verses.eng: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِفَتَىٰهُ لَآ أَبْرَحُ حَتَّىٰٓ أَبْلُغَ مَجْمَعَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ أَوْ أَمْضِىَ حُقُبًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh qāla mūsā lifatāhu lā abraḥu ḥattā ablugha majmaʿa albaḥrayni aw amḍiya ḥuquban

verses.eng: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَا مَجْمَعَ بَيْنِهِمَا نَسِيَا حُوتَهُمَا فَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ سَرَبًا
verses.transliteration: Falammā balaghā majmaʿa baynihimā nasīā ḥūtahumā fa-ttakhadha sabīlahu fī l-baḥri sarabā

verses.eng: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ لِفَتَىٰهُ ءَاتِنَا غَدَآءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَـٰذَا نَصَبًا
verses.transliteration: Falammā jāwazā qāla lifatāhu ātinā ghadā'anā laqad laqīnā min safarinā hādhā naṣabā

verses.eng: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly."
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَرَءَيْتَ إِذْ أَوَيْنَآ إِلَى ٱلصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّى نَسِيتُ ٱلْحُوتَ وَمَآ أَنسَىٰنِيهُ إِلَّا ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَنْ أَذْكُرَهُۥ ۚ وَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ عَجَبًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla ara'ayta idh awaynā ilā ṣ-ṣakhrati fa'innī nasītu l-ḥūta wa mā ansānīhu illā sh-shayṭānu an adhkurahu wa-ttakhadha sabīlahu fī l-baḥri ʿajabā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.
verses.arabic: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنَّا نَبْغِ ۚ فَٱرْتَدَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَارِهِمَا قَصَصًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla dhālika mā kunnā nabghi fartaddā ʿalā āthārihimā qaṣaṣā

verses.eng: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom We had given mercy from Us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.
verses.arabic: فَوَجَدَا عَبْدًا مِّنْ عِبَادِنَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَعَلَّمْنَـٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْمًا
verses.transliteration: Fawajadā ʿabdan min ʿibādinā ātaynāhu raḥmatan min ʿindinā wa ʿallamnāhu min ladunnā ʿilmā

verses.eng: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ هَلْ أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ رُشْدًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla lahu Mūsā hal attabiʿuka ʿalā an tuʿallimani mimmā ʿullimta rushdā

verses.eng: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla innaka lan tastaṭīʿa maʿiya �abrā

verses.eng: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"
verses.arabic: وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ خُبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa kayfa taṣbiru ʿalā mā lam tuḥiṭ bihi khubrā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."
verses.arabic: قَالَ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ صَابِرًا وَلَآ أَعْصِى لَكَ أَمْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla sa-tajidunī in shā'a Allāhu ṣābirā wa lā aʿṣī laka amrā

verses.eng: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَنِى فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِى عَن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰٓ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa-ini ttabaʿtanī falā tas'alnī ʿan shay'in ḥattā uḥditha laka minhu dhikrā

verses.eng: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r made a hole in it. [Moses] said, "Have you made a hole in it to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."
verses.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَكِبَا فِى ٱلسَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا ۖ قَالَ أَخَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا إِمْرًا
verses.transliteration: Fānṭalaqā ḥattā idhā rakibā fī s-safīnati kharaqahā qāla akharaqtahā litughriqa ahlahā laqad ji'ta shay'an imrā

verses.eng: He said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla alam aqul innaka lan tastaṭīʿa maʿiya ṣabrā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِى بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِى مِنْ أَمْرِى عُسْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla lā tu'ākhidhnī bimā nasītu wa lā turhiqnī min amrī ʿusrā

verses.eng: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."
verses.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلَـٰمًا فَقَتَلَهُۥ قَالَ أَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا زَكِيَّةًۢ بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ لَّقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا نُّكْرًا
verses.transliteration: Fānṭalaqā ḥattā idhā laqiyā ghulāman faqatalahu qāla aqatalta nafsan zakiyyatan bighayri nafsin laqad ji'ta shay'an nukrā

verses.eng: He said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla alam aqul laka innaka lan tastaṭīʿa maʿiya ṣabrā

verses.eng: Moses said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِن سَأَلْتُكَ عَن شَيْءٍ بَعْدَهَا فَلَا تُصَاحِبْنِي ۖ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّي عُذْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla in sa'altuka ʿan shay'in baʿdahā falā tuṣāḥibnī qad balaghta min ladunnī ʿudhrā

verses.eng: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] set it up straight. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."
verses.arabic: فَانطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَيَا أَهْلَ قَرْيَةٍ اسْتَطْعَمَا أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا أَن يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارًا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقَامَهُ ۖ قَالَ لَوْ شِئْتَ لَاتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًا
verses.transliteration: Fānṭalaqā ḥattā idhā atayā ahla qaryatin istaṭʿamā ahlahā fa-abaw an yuḍayyifūhumā fawajadā fīhā jidāran yurīdu an yanqaḍḍa fa-aqāmah qāla law shi'ta la-ittakhadhta ʿalayhi ajrā

verses.eng: He [i.e., al-Khiḍr] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَٰذَا فِرَاقُ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأْوِيلِ مَا لَمْ تَسْتَطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla hādhā firāqu baynī wa-baynik sa-unabbi'uka bita'wīli mā lam tastaṭiʿ ʿalayhi ṣabrā

verses.eng: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.
verses.arabic: أَمَّا ٱلسَّفِينَةُ فَكَانَتْ لِمَسَٰكِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَعِيبَهَا وَكَانَ وَرَآءَهُم مَّلِكٌ يَأْخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْبًا
verses.transliteration: Ammā al-safīnatu fakānat limasākīna yaʿmalūna fī al-baḥri fa-aradttu an aʿībahā wakāna warā'ahum malikun ya'khudhu kulla safīnin ghaṣbā

verses.eng: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.
verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْغُلَٰمُ فَكَانَ أَبَوَاهُ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ فَخَشِينَآ أَن يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَٰنًا وَكُفْرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-ammā al-ghulāmu fakāna abawāhu mu'minayni fakhashīnā an yurhiqahumā ṭughyānan wakufrā

verses.eng: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.
verses.arabic: فَأَرَدْنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهُ زَكَوٰةً وَأَقْرَبَ رُحْمًا
verses.transliteration: Fa-aradnā an yubdilahumā rabbuhumā khayran minhu zakātan wa-aqraba ruḥmā

verses.eng: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."
verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَٰمَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُۥ كَنزٌ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَٰلِحًا فَأَرَادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبْلُغَآ أَشُدَّهُمَا وَيَسْتَخْرِجَا كَنزَهُمَا رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا فَعَلْتُهُۥ عَنْ أَمْرِى ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَأْوِيلُ مَا لَمْ تَسْطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-ammā al-jidāru fakāna lighulāmayni yatīmayni fī al-madīnati wakāna taḥtahu kanzun lahumā wakāna abūhumā ṣāliḥan fa-arāda rabbuka an yablughā ashuddahumā wayastakhrijā kanzahumā raḥmatan min rabbik wa-mā faʿaltuhu ʿan amrī dhālika ta'wīlu mā lam tasṭiʿ ʿalayhi ṣabrā

verses.eng: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."
verses.arabic: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَن ذِى ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ ۖ قُلْ سَأَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْهُ ذِكْرًا
verses.transliteration: Wayas'alūnaka ʿan dhī al-qarnayn qul sa-atlū ʿalaykum minhu dhikrā

verses.eng: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.
verses.arabic: إِنَّا مَكَّنَّا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَءَاتَيْنَٰهُ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ سَبَبًا
verses.transliteration: Innā makkannā lahu fī al-arḍi wa-ātaynāhu min kulli shay'in sababā

verses.eng: So he followed a way
verses.arabic: فَأَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
verses.transliteration: Fa-atbaʿa sababā

verses.eng: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a body of dark water, and he found near it a people. We said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَغْرِبَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَغْرُبُ فِى عَيْنٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَهَا قَوْمًا ۗ قُلْنَا يَٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِمَّآ أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّآ أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمْ حُسْنًا
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā balagha maghriba al-shamsi wajadahā taghrubu fī ʿaynin ḥami'atin wawajada ʿindahā qawmā qulnā yā dhā al-qarnayni immā an tuʿadhdhiba wa-immā an tattakhidha fīhim ḥusnā

verses.eng: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَمَّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوْفَ نُعَذِّبُهُۥ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ فَيُعَذِّبُهُۥ عَذَابًا نُّكْرًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla ammā man ẓalama fasawfa nuʿadhdhibuhu thumma yuraddu ilā rabbihi fayuʿadhdhibuhu ʿadhāban nukrā

verses.eng: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."
verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحًا فَلَهُۥ جَزَآءً ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقُولُ لَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِنَا يُسْرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-ammā man āmana waʿamila ṣāliḥan falahu jazā'an al-ḥusnā wa-sanaqūlu lahu min amrinā yusrā

verses.eng: Then he followed a way
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
verses.transliteration: Thumma atbaʿa sababā

verses.eng: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَطْلِعَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَطْلُعُ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ لَّمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتْرًا
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā balagha maṭliʿa al-shamsi wajadahā taṭluʿu ʿalā qawmin lam najʿal lahum min dūnihā sitrā

verses.eng: Thus [he traveled] until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ وَقَدْ أَحَطْنَا بِمَا لَدَيْهِ خُبْرًا
verses.transliteration: Kadhālika wa qad aḥaṭnā bimā ladayhi khubrā

verses.eng: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
verses.transliteration: Thumma atbaʿa sababā

verses.eng: Then he followed a way
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ السَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًا
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā balagha bayna as-saddayni wajada min dūnihimā qawman lā yakādūna yafqahūna qawlā

verses.eng: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِنَّ يَأْجُوجَ وَمَأْجُوجَ مُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَهَلْ نَجْعَلُ لَكَ خَرْجًا عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَجْعَلَ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَهُمْ سَدًّا
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā dhā al-qarnayni inna yaʾjūja wa maʾjūja mufsidūna fī al-arḍi fahal najʿalu laka kharjan ʿalā an tajʿala baynanā wa baynahum saddā

verses.eng: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّى فِيهِ رَبِّى خَيْرٌ فَأَعِينُونِى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla mā makkanī fīhi rabbī khayrun fa-aʿīnūnī biquwwatin ajʿal baynakum wa baynahum radmā

verses.eng: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.
verses.arabic: ءَاتُونِى زُبَرَ ٱلْحَدِيدِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيْنَ ٱلصَّدَفَيْنِ قَالَ ٱنفُخُوا۟ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَعَلَهُۥ نَارًا قَالَ ءَاتُونِىٓ أُفْرِغْ عَلَيْهِ قِطْرًا
verses.transliteration: Ātūnī zubara al-ḥadīdi ḥattā idhā sāwā bayna aṣ-ṣadafayni qāla unfukhū ḥattā idhā jaʿalahū nārā qāla ātūnī uf'riqh ʿalayhi qiṭrā

verses.eng: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."
verses.arabic: فَمَا ٱسْطَـٰعُوٓا۟ أَن يَظْهَرُوهُ وَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ لَهُۥ نَقْبًا
verses.transliteration: Famā isṭaʿū an yaẓharūhu wa mā istaṭāʿū lahū naqbā

verses.eng: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا رَحْمَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى جَعَلَهُۥ دَكَّآءَ ۖ وَكَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى حَقًّۭا
verses.transliteration: Qāla hādhā raḥmatun min rabbī fa-idhā jāʾa waʿdu rabbī jaʿalahū dakkāʾa wa kāna waʿdu rabbī ḥaqqā

verses.eng: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."
verses.arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَمُوجُ فِى بَعْضٍۢ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَـٰهُمْ جَمْعًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa taraknā baʿḍahum yawmaʾidhin yamūju fī baʿḍin wa nufikha fī aṣ-ṣūri fajamaʿnāhum jamʿā

verses.eng: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.
verses.arabic: وَعَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَرْضًا
verses.transliteration: Wa ʿaraḍnā jahannama yawmaʾidhin lil-kāfirīna ʿarḍā

verses.eng: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ كَانَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِى غِطَآءٍ عَن ذِكْرِى وَكَانُوا۟ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَمْعًا
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna kānat aʿyunuhum fī ghiṭāʾin ʿan dhikrī wa kānū lā yastaṭīʿūna samʿā

verses.eng: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.
