verses.arabic: أَفَحَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن يَتَّخِذُوا۟ عِبَادِى مِن دُونِىٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ نُزُلًا
verses.transliteration: Afaḥasiba alladhīna kafarū an yattakhidhū ʿibādī min dūnī awliyāʾa innā aʿtadnā jahannama lil-kāfirīna nuzulā

verses.eng: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.
verses.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ نُنَبِّئُكُم بِٱلْأَخْسَرِينَ أَعْمَـٰلًا
verses.transliteration: Qul hal nunabbiʾukum bil-akhsarīna aʿmālā

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna ḍalla saʿyuhum fī al-ḥayāti ad-dunyā wa hum yaḥsabūna annahum yuḥsinūna ṣunʿā

verses.eng: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَلِقَآئِهِۦ فَحَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَزْنًۭا
verses.transliteration: Ulāʾika alladhīna kafarū biʾāyāti rabbihim wa liqāʾihi faḥabiṭat aʿmāluhum falā nuqīmu lahum yawma al-qiyāmati waznā

verses.eng: That is their recompense - Hell - because they disbelieved and took My verses and My messengers in ridicule.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَاؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ بِمَا كَفَرُوا وَاتَّخَذُوا آيَاتِي وَرُسُلِي هُزُوًا
verses.transliteration: Dhālika jazā'uhum jahannamu bimā kafarū wa-ittakhadhū āyātī wa-rusulī huzūwā

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a hospitality,
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتُ الْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna āmanū wa-ʿamilū al-ṣāliḥāti kānat lahum jannātu al-firdawsi nuzulā

verses.eng: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.
verses.arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يَبْغُونَ عَنْهَا حِوَلًا
verses.transliteration: Khālidīna fīhā lā yabghūna ʿanhā ḥiwala

verses.eng: Say, 'If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement.'
verses.arabic: قُل لَّوْ كَانَ الْبَحْرُ مِدَادًا لِّكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّي لَنَفِدَ الْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمَاتُ رَبِّي وَلَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِ مَدَدًا
verses.transliteration: Qul law kāna al-baḥru midādan li-kalimāti rabbī la-nafida al-baḥru qabla an tanfada kalimātu rabbī wa-law ji'nā bimithlihi madadā

verses.eng: Say, 'I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّمَا إِلَٰهُكُمْ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ ۖ فَمَن كَانَ يَرْجُو لِقَاءَ رَبِّهِ فَلْيَعْمَلْ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِ أَحَدًا
verses.transliteration: Qul innamā anā basharun mithlukum yūḥā ilayya annamā ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun faman kāna yarjū liqā'a rabbihi falyaʿmal ʿamalan ṣāliḥan walā yushrik bi-ʿibādati rabbihi aḥadā

verses.eng: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.
verses.arabic: كهيعص
verses.transliteration: Kāf Hā Yā 'Ayn Ṣād

verses.eng: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah
verses.arabic: ذِكْرُ رَحْمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبْدَهُ زَكَرِيَّا
verses.transliteration: Dhikru raḥmati rabbika ʿabdahu zakariyyā

verses.eng: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.
verses.arabic: إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ نِدَاءً خَفِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Idh nādā rabbahu nidā'an khafiyyā

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي وَهَنَ ٱلْعَظْمُ مِنِّي وَٱشْتَعَلَ ٱلرَّأْسُ شَيْبًا وَلَمْ أَكُنۢ بِدُعَآئِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi innī wahana al-ʿaẓmu minnī wa-ishtahala al-ra'su shayban wa-lam akun bi-duʿā'ika rabbi shaqiyyā

verses.eng: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
verses.arabic: وَإِنِّي خِفْتُ ٱلْمَوَٰلِىَ مِن وَرَآءِى وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًا فَهَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-innī khiftu al-mawālīya min warā'ī wa-kānati imra'atī ʿāqiran fa-hab lī min ladunka waliyyā

verses.eng: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."
verses.arabic: يَرِثُنِى وَيَرِثُ مِنْ ءَالِ يَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَٱجْعَلْهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yarithunī wa-yarithu min āli yaʿqūba wa-ij'alhu rabbi raḍiyyā

verses.eng: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."
verses.arabic: يَـٰزَكَرِيَّآ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَـٰمٍ ٱسْمُهُۥ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yā zakariyyā innā nubashiruka bighulāmin ismuhu yaḥyā lam najʿal lahu min qablu samiyyā

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌ وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًا وَقَدْ بَلَغْتُ مِنَ ٱلْكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi annā yakūnu lī ghulāmun wa-kānati imra'atī ʿāqiran wa-qad balaghtu mina al-kibari ʿitiyyā

verses.eng: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.'"
verses.arabic: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌ وَقَدْ خَلَقْتُكَ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ تَكُ شَيْـًٔا
verses.transliteration: Qāla kadhālika qāla rabbuka huwa ʿalayya hayyinun wa-qad khalaqtuka min qablu wa-lam taku shay'ā

verses.eng: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجْعَل لِّىٓ ءَايَةً ۖ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَـٰثَ لَيَالٍ سَوِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi ijʿal lī āyatan qāla āyatuka allā tukallima al-nāsa thalātha layālin sawiyyā

verses.eng: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
verses.arabic: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْمِحْرَابِ فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِمْ أَن سَبِّحُوا۟ بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fakharaja ʿalā qawmihi mina al-miḥrābi fa-awḥā ilayhim an sabbiḥū bukratan wa-ʿashiyyā

verses.eng: [Allah said], "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy
verses.arabic: يَـٰيَحْيَىٰ خُذِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yā yaḥyā khudhi al-kitāba biquwwatin wa-ātaynāhu al-ḥukma ṣabiyyā

verses.eng: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah
verses.arabic: وَحَنَانًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةً ۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-ḥanānan min ladunnā wa-zakātan wa-kāna taqiyyā

verses.eng: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
verses.arabic: وَبَرًّا بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ وَلَمْ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-barrān bi-wālidayhi wa-lam yakun jabbāran ʿaṣiyyā

verses.eng: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.
verses.arabic: وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-salāmun ʿalayhi yawma wulida wa-yawma yamūtu wa-yawma yubʿathu ḥayyā

verses.eng: And mention in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ انْتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًا شَرْقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-zkur fī al-kitābi Maryama idh intabathat min ahlihā makānan sharqiyyā

verses.eng: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.
verses.arabic: فَاتَّخَذَتْ مِنْ دُونِهِمْ حِجَابًا فَأَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fattakhathat min dūnihim ḥijāban fa-arsalnā ilayhā rūḥanā fatamaththala lahā basharan sawiyyā

verses.eng: She said, 'Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, if you should be fearing of Allah.'
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِالرَّحْمَـٰنِ مِنْكَ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qālat innī aʿūdhu bi-al-Raḥmāni minka in kunta taqiyyā

verses.eng: He said, 'I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَا أَنَا رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَامًا زَكِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla innamā anā rasūlu rabbiki li-ahabaki ghulāman zakiyyā

verses.eng: She said, 'How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?'
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَامٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِي بَشَرٌ وَلَمْ أَكُ بَغِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qālat annā yakūnu lī ghulām wa lam yamsasnī bashar wa lam aku baghiyyā

verses.eng: He said, 'Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.''
verses.arabic: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ ۖ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُ آيَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةً مِّنَّا ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرًا مَّقْضِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla kadhāliki qāla rabbuki huwa ʿalayya hayyin wa li-najʿalahu āyatan li-al-nāsi wa raḥmatan minnā wa kāna amran maqḍiyyā

verses.eng: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.
verses.arabic: فَحَمَلَتْهُ فَانْتَبَذَتْ بِهِ مَكَانًا قَصِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fa-ḥamalathu fa-intabathat bihi makānan qaṣiyyā

verses.eng: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, 'Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten.'
verses.arabic: فَأَجَاءَهَا الْمَخَاضُ إِلَىٰ جِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ قَالَتْ يَا لَيْتَنِي مِتُّ قَبْلَ هَـٰذَا وَكُنتُ نَسْيًا مَّنسِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fa-ajāʾahā al-makhāḍu ilā jidhʿi al-nakhlati qālat yā laytanī mittu qabla hādhā wa kuntu nasyan mansiyyā

verses.eng: But he called her from below her, 'Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.'
verses.arabic: فَنَادَاهَا مِن تَحْتِهَا أَلَّا تَحْزَنِي قَدْ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحْتَكِ سَرِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fa-nādāhā min taḥtihā allā taḥzanī qad jaʿala rabbuki taḥtaki sariyyā

verses.eng: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
verses.arabic: وَهُزِّي إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ تُسَاقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-huzzī ilayki bi-jidhʿi al-nakhlati tusāqiṭ ʿalayki ruṭaban janīyā

verses.eng: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.'
verses.arabic: فَكُلِي وَاشْرَبِي وَقَرِّي عَيْنًا ۖ فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ الْبَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقُولِي إِنِّي نَذَرْتُ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ صَوْمًا فَلَنْ أُكَلِّمَ الْيَوْمَ إِنسِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fa-kulī wa-ishrabī wa qarrī ʿaynan fa-immā tarayinna min al-bashari aḥadan fa-qūlī innī nadhartu li-al-Raḥmāni ṣawman fa-lan ukallima al-yawma insiyyā

verses.eng: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, 'O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.'
verses.arabic: فَأَتَتْ بِهِ قَوْمَهَا تَحْمِلُهُ ۖ قَالُوا يَا مَرْيَمُ لَقَدْ جِئْتِ شَيْئًا فَرِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fa-atat bihi qawmahā taḥmiluhu qālū yā Maryamu laqad jiʾti shayʾan fariyyā

verses.eng: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste.'
verses.arabic: يَا أُخْتَ هَارُونَ مَا كَانَ أَبُوكِ امْرَأَ سَوْءٍ وَمَا كَانَتْ أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yā ukhta Hārūna mā kāna abūki imraʾa sawʾin wa mā kānat ummuki baghiyyā

verses.eng: So she pointed to him. They said, 'How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?'
verses.arabic: فَأَشَارَتْ إِلَيْهِ ۖ قَالُوا كَيْفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كَانَ فِي الْمَهْدِ صَبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fa-ashārat ilayhi qālū kayfa nukallimu man kāna fī al-mahdi �abiyyā

verses.eng: [Jesus] said, 'Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللَّهِ آتَانِيَ الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلَنِي نَبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla innī ʿabdu Allāhi ātāniya al-kitāba wa jaʿalanī nabiyyā

verses.eng: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلَنِي مُبَارَكًا أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوْصَانِي بِالصَّلَاةِ وَالزَّكَاةِ مَا دُمْتُ حَيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wajaʿalanī mubārakan ayna mā kuntu wa-awṣānī biṣ-ṣalāti wa-zzakāti mā dumtu ḥayyā

verses.eng: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
verses.arabic: وَبَرًّا بِوَالِدَتِي وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْنِي جَبَّارًا شَقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wabarrā biwālidatī walam yajʿalnī jabbāran shaqiyyā

verses.eng: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive.
verses.arabic: وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَيَّ يَوْمَ وُلِدتُّ وَيَوْمَ أَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ أُبْعَثُ حَيًّا
verses.transliteration: Was-salāmu ʿalayya yawma wulidtu wayawma amūtu wayawma ubʿathu ḥayyā

verses.eng: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ ۚ قَوْلَ الْحَقِّ الَّذِي فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika ʿīsā ib'nu maryama qawla l-ḥaqqi alladhī fīhi yamtarūn

verses.eng: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.
verses.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍ ۖ سُبْحَانَهُ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ
verses.transliteration: Mā kāna lillāhi an yattakhidha min waladin subḥānahu idhā qaḍā amran fa-innamā yaqūlu lahu kun fayakūn

verses.eng: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبُّكُمْ فَاعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna Allāha rabbī warabbukum faʿbudūhu hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīm

verses.eng: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.
verses.arabic: فَاخْتَلَفَ الْأَحْزَابُ مِن بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن مَّشْهَدِ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Fākhtalafa l-aḥzābu min baynihim fawaylun lil-ladhīna kafarū min mashhadi yawmin ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.
verses.arabic: أَسْمِعْ بِهِمْ وَأَبْصِرْ يَوْمَ يَأْتُونَنَا ۖ لَٰكِنِ الظَّالِمُونَ الْيَوْمَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Asmiʿ bihim wa-abṣir yawma ya'tūnanā lākini ẓ-ẓālimūna l-yawma fī ḍalālin mubīn

verses.eng: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.
verses.arabic: وَأَنذِرْهُمْ يَوْمَ الْحَسْرَةِ إِذْ قُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ وَهُمْ فِي غَفْلَةٍ وَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-andhirhum yawma l-ḥasrati idh quḍiya l-amru wahum fī ghaflatin wahum lā yu'minūn

verses.eng: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.
verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَرِثُ الْأَرْضَ وَمَنْ عَلَيْهَا وَإِلَيْنَا يُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innā naḥnu narithu l-arḍa waman ʿalayhā wa-ilaynā yurjaʿūn

verses.eng: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-dhkur fī l-kitābi ibrāhīma innahu kāna ṣiddīqan nabiyyā

verses.eng: When he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ يَا أَبَتِ لِمَ تَعْبُدُ مَا لَا يَسْمَعُ وَلَا يُبْصِرُ وَلَا يُغْنِي عَنكَ شَيْئًا
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla li-abīhi yā abati lima taʿbudu mā lā yasmaʿu walā yubṣiru walā yughnī ʿanka shay'ā

verses.eng: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.
verses.arabic: يَا أَبَتِ إِنِّي قَدْ جَاءَنِي مِنَ الْعِلْمِ مَا لَمْ يَأْتِكَ فَاتَّبِعْنِي أَهْدِكَ صِرَاطًا سَوِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yā abati innī qad jāanī mina l-ʿilmi mā lam ya'tika fa-ttabiʿnī ahdika ṣirāṭan sawiyyā

verses.eng: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.
verses.arabic: يَا أَبَتِ لَا تَعْبُدِ الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ عَصِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yā abati lā taʿbudi sh-shayṭāna inna sh-shayṭāna kāna li-r-raḥmāni ʿaṣiyyā

verses.eng: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."
verses.arabic: يَا أَبَتِ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذَابٌ مِّنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ فَتَكُونَ لِلشَّيْطَانِ وَلِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Yā abati innī akhāfu an yamassaka ʿadhābun mina r-raḥmāni fatakūna lish-shayṭāni waliyyā

verses.eng: He said, "Do you reject my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنْ آلِهَتِي يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ لَأَرْجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَاهْجُرْنِي مَلِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla a rāghibun anta ʿan ālihatī yā ibrāhīmu la-in lam tantahi la-arjumannaka wa-uhjur'nī malīyā

verses.eng: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.
verses.arabic: قَالَ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكَ ۖ سَأَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّي ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ بِي حَفِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Qāla salāmun ʿalayka sa-astaghfiru laka rabbī innahu kāna bī ḥafiyyā

verses.eng: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will call upon my Lord. I expect that I will not be in calling upon my Lord unhappy."
verses.arabic: وَأَعْتَزِلُكُمْ وَمَا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَأَدْعُو رَبِّي عَسَىٰ أَلَّا أَكُونَ بِدُعَاءِ رَبِّي شَقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-aʿtazilukum wa-mā tadʿūna min dūni allāhi wa-adʿū rabbī ʿasā allā akūna biduʿāʾi rabbī shaqiyyā

verses.eng: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا اعْتَزَلَهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا نَبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Falammā iʿtazalahum wa-mā yaʿbudūna min dūni allāhi wahabnā lahu is'ḥāqa wayaʿqūba wa-kullan jaʿalnā nabiyyā

verses.eng: And We gave them of Our mercy, and We made for them a reputation of high honor.
verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِنَا وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ عَلِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wawahbnā lahum min raḥmatinā wajaʿalnā lahum lisāna ṣid'qin ʿaliyyā

verses.eng: And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ مُوسَىٰ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ مُخْلَصًا وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-udh'kur fī l-kitābi mūsā innahu kāna mukh'laṣan wakāna rasūlan nabiyyā

verses.eng: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].
verses.arabic: وَنَادَيْنَاهُ مِن جَانِبِ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنِ وَقَرَّبْنَاهُ نَجِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wanādaynāhu min jānibi l-ṭūri l-aymani waqarrabnāhu najiyyā

verses.eng: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.
verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ مِن رَّحْمَتِنَا أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ نَبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wawahbnā lahu min raḥmatinā akhāhu hārūna nabiyyā

verses.eng: And mention in the Book Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ صَادِقَ الْوَعْدِ وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-udh'kur fī l-kitābi is'māʿīla innahu kāna ṣādiqa l-waʿdi wakāna rasūlan nabiyyā

verses.eng: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.
verses.arabic: وَكَانَ يَأْمُرُ أَهْلَهُ بِالصَّلَاةِ وَالزَّكَاةِ وَكَانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِ مَرْضِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wakāna yaʾmuru ahlahu biṣ-ṣalāti wa-z-zakāti wakāna ʿinda rabbihi marḍiyyā

verses.eng: And mention in the Book Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
verses.arabic: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ إِدْرِيسَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa-udh'kur fī l-kitābi id'rīsa innahu kāna ṣiddīqan nabiyyā

verses.eng: And We raised him to a high station.
verses.arabic: وَرَفَعْنَاهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Warafaʿnāhu makānan ʿaliyyā

verses.eng: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنْعَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ ءَادَمَ وَمِمَّنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍۢ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَمِمَّنْ هَدَيْنَا وَٱجْتَبَيْنَاۚ إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ خَرُّوا۟ سُجَّدًۭا وَبُكِيًّۭا
verses.transliteration: Ulāʾika alladhīna anʿama allāhu ʿalayhim mina n-nabiyyīna min dhurriyyati ādama wa-mimman ḥamalnā maʿa nūḥin wa-min dhurriyyati ibrāhīma wa-is'rāʾīla wa-mimman hadaynā wa-ij'tabaynā idhā tutlā ʿalayhim āyātu r-raḥmāni kharū sujjadan wabukiyyā

verses.eng: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil.
verses.arabic: فَخَلَفَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ أَضَاعُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِۖ فَسَوْفَ يَلْقَوْنَ غَيًّۭا
verses.transliteration: Fakhalafa min baʿdihim khalfun aḍāʿū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ittabaʿū sh-shahawāti fasawfa yalqawna ghayyā

verses.eng: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ شَيْـًۭٔا
verses.transliteration: Illā man tāba wa-āmana wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-ulāʾika yadkhulūna l-jannata walā yuẓ'lamūna shayʾā

verses.eng: Gardens of perpetual residence, which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.
verses.arabic: جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ الَّتِي وَعَدَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ عِبَادَهُ بِالْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَأْتِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Jannāti 'adnin allatī wa'ada ar-Raḥmānu 'ibādahu bil-ghayb, innahu kāna wa'duhu ma'tiyyā

verses.eng: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.
verses.arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا إِلَّا سَلَامًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ رِزْقُهُمْ فِيهَا بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Lā yasma'ūna fīhā laghwan illā salāmā, wa lahum rizquhum fīhā bukratan wa 'ashiyyā

verses.eng: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ الْجَنَّةُ الَّتِي نُورِثُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا مَنْ كَانَ تَقِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Tilka al-jannatu allatī nūrithu min 'ibādinā man kāna taqiyyā

verses.eng: And we [angels] descend not except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful.
verses.arabic: وَمَا نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلَّا بِأَمْرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِينَا وَمَا خَلْفَنَا وَمَا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa mā natanazzalu illā bi-amri rabbika, lahu mā bayna aydīnā wa mā khalfanā wa mā bayna dhālik, wa mā kāna rabbuka nasiyyā

verses.eng: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?
verses.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَٱعْبُدْهُ وَٱصْطَبِرْ لِعِبَٰدَتِهِۦ ۚ هَلْ تَعْلَمُ لَهُۥ سَمِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Rabbu as-samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā fa'budhu waṣṭabir li'ibādatih, hal ta'lamu lahū samiyyā

verses.eng: And the human being says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَءِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوْفَ أُخْرَجُ حَيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqūlu al-insānu a-idhā mā mittu la-sawfa ukhraju ḥayyā

verses.eng: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَا يَذْكُرُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ يَكُ شَيْـًٔا
verses.transliteration: Awa lā yadhkuru al-insānu annā khalaqnāhu min qablu wa lam yaku shay'ā

verses.eng: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.
verses.arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحْشُرَنَّهُمْ وَٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحْضِرَنَّهُمْ حَوْلَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Fawarabbika lanaḥshurannahum wash-shayāṭīna thumma lanuḥḍirannahum ḥawla jahannama jithiyyā

verses.eng: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمْ أَشَدُّ عَلَى ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ عِتِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Thumma lananzi'anna min kulli shī'atin ayyuhum ashaddu 'alā ar-Raḥmāni 'itiyyā

verses.eng: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لَنَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِهَا صِلِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Thumma lanaḥnu a'lamu bi-alladhīna hum awlā bihā ṣiliyyā

verses.eng: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.
verses.arabic: وَإِن مِّنكُمْ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَا ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتْمًا مَّقْضِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa in minkum illā wāriduhā, kāna 'alā rabbika ḥatman maqḍiyyā

verses.eng: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّي ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّنَذَرُ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ فِيهَا جِثِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Thumma nunajjī alladhīna attaqaw wa nadharu aẓ-ẓālimīna fīhā jithiyyā

verses.eng: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَاتُنَا بَيِّنَٰتٍ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَىُّ ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ خَيْرٌ مَّقَامًا وَأَحْسَنُ نَدِيًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā tutlā 'alayhim āyātunā bayyinātin qāla alladhīna kafarū lil-ladhīna āmanū ayyu al-farīqayni khayrun maqāmā wa aḥsanu nadiyyā

verses.eng: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?
verses.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَحْسَنُ أَثَٰثًا وَرِءْيًا
verses.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknā qablahum min qarnin hum aḥsanu athāthā wa ri'yā

verses.eng: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلضَّلَٰلِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ مَدًّا ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ إِمَّا ٱلْعَذَابَ وَإِمَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضْعَفُ جُندًا
verses.transliteration: Qul man kāna fī aḍ-ḍalāli falyamdud lahu ar-Raḥmānu maddā, ḥattā idhā ra'aw mā yū'adūna immā al-'adhāba wa immā as-sā'ata fa-saya'lamūna man huwa sharrun makānā wa aḍ'afu jundā

verses.eng: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.
verses.arabic: وَيَزِيدُ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ اهْتَدَوْا هُدًى ۗ وَالْبَاقِيَاتُ الصَّالِحَاتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ مَّرَدًّا
verses.transliteration: Wa yazeedullahu allatheena ihtadaw hudan walbaqiyatu assalihatu khayrun AAinda rabbika thawaban wakhayrun maraddan

verses.eng: Have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]"?
verses.arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي كَفَرَ بِآيَاتِنَا وَقَالَ لَأُوتَيَنَّ مَالًا وَوَلَدًا
verses.transliteration: Afaraayta allathee kafara biayatina waqala laootayanna malan wawaladan

verses.eng: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?
verses.arabic: أَطَّلَعَ الْغَيْبَ أَمِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ عَهْدًا
verses.transliteration: AttalaAAa alghayba ami ittakhatha AAinda arrahmani AAahdan

verses.eng: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.
verses.arabic: كَلَّا ۚ سَنَكْتُبُ مَا يَقُولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ مَدًّا
verses.transliteration: Kalla sanaktubu ma yaqoolu wanamuddu lahu mina alAAathabi madan

verses.eng: And We will inherit him what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.
verses.arabic: وَنَرِثُهُ مَا يَقُولُ وَيَأْتِينَا فَرْدًا
verses.transliteration: Waneerithuhu ma yaqoolu wayateena fardan

verses.eng: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be to them [a source of] honor.
verses.arabic: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لِّيَكُونُوا لَهُمْ عِزًّا
verses.transliteration: Wattakhathoo min dooni Allahi alihatan liyakoonoo lahum AAizzan

verses.eng: No! Those 'gods' will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgment].
verses.arabic: كَلَّا ۚ سَيَكْفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضِدًّا
verses.transliteration: Kalla sayakfuroona biAAibadatihim wayakoonoona AAalayhim diddan

verses.eng: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا الشَّيَاطِينَ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمْ أَزًّا
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna arsalna ashshayateena AAala alkafireena tawuzzuhum azzan

verses.eng: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.
verses.arabic: فَلَا تَعْجَلْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمْ عَدًّا
verses.transliteration: Fala taAAjal AAalayhim innama naAAuddu lahum AAaddan

verses.eng: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ الْمُتَّقِينَ إِلَى الرَّحْمَٰنِ وَفْدًا
verses.transliteration: Yawma nahshuru almuttaqeena ila arrahmani wafdan

verses.eng: And We will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst.
verses.arabic: وَنَسُوقُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِرْدًا
verses.transliteration: Wanasooqu almujrimeena ila jahannama wirdan

verses.eng: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.
verses.arabic: لَا يَمْلِكُونَ الشَّفَاعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ عَهْدًا
verses.transliteration: La yamlikoona ashshafaAAata illa mani ittakhatha AAinda arrahmani AAahdan

verses.eng: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَلَدًا
verses.transliteration: Waqaloo ittakhatha arrahmanu waladan

verses.eng: You have done an atrocious thing.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ جِئْتُمْ شَيْئًا إِدًّا
verses.transliteration: Laqad ji/tum shayan iddan

verses.eng: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation
verses.arabic: تَكَادُ السَّمَاوَاتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ مِنْهُ وَتَنشَقُّ الْأَرْضُ وَتَخِرُّ الْجِبَالُ هَدًّا
verses.transliteration: Takadu assamawatu yatafattarna minhu watanshaqqu alardu watakhirru aljibalu haddan

verses.eng: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.
verses.arabic: أَن دَعَوْا۟ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَلَدًۭا
verses.transliteration: An da'aw lilrrahmani walada

verses.eng: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.
verses.arabic: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
verses.transliteration: Wama yanbaghee lilrrahmani an yattakhitha walada

verses.eng: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.
verses.arabic: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّآ ءَاتِى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَبْدًۭا
verses.transliteration: In kullu man fee alssamawati waalardi illa atee alrrahmani 'abdan

verses.eng: He has enumerated them and counted them a full counting.
verses.arabic: لَّقَدْ أَحْصَىٰهُمْ وَعَدَّهُمْ عَدًّۭا
verses.transliteration: Laqad ahsahum wa'addahum 'addan

verses.eng: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.
verses.arabic: وَكُلُّهُمْ ءَاتِيهِ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فَرْدًا
verses.transliteration: Wakulluhum ateethi yawma alqiyamati fardan

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ سَيَجْعَلُ لَهُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وُدًّۭا
verses.transliteration: Inna allatheena amanoo wa'amiloo alssalihati sayaj'alu lahumu alrrahmanu wuddan

verses.eng: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in your language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.
verses.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَـٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ قَوْمًۭا لُّدًّۭا
verses.transliteration: Fa-innama yassarnahu bilisanika litubashshira bihi almuttaqeena watunthira bihi qawman luddan

verses.eng: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?
verses.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هَلْ تُحِسُّ مِنْهُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ أَوْ تَسْمَعُ لَهُمْ رِكْزًۢا
verses.transliteration: Wakam ahlakna qablahum min qarnin hal tuhissu minhum min ahadin aw tasma'u lahum rikzan

verses.eng: Ta, Ha.
verses.arabic: طه
verses.transliteration: Tā Hā

verses.eng: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed
verses.arabic: مَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ لِتَشْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Mā anzalnā ʿalayka l-qur'āna litashqā

verses.eng: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah]
verses.arabic: إِلَّا تَذْكِرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Illā tadhkiratan liman yakhshā

verses.eng: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens
verses.arabic: تَنزِيلًا مِّمَّنْ خَلَقَ الْأَرْضَ وَالسَّمَاوَاتِ الْعُلَى
verses.transliteration: Tanzīlan mimman khalaqa l-arḍa wa-s-samāwāti l-ʿulā

verses.eng: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established
verses.arabic: الرَّحْمَـٰنُ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ اسْتَوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Ar-raḥmānu ʿalā l-ʿarshi istawā

verses.eng: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil
verses.arabic: لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمَا تَحْتَ الثَّرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Lahu mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-arḍi wa-mā baynahumā wa-mā taḥta th-tharā

verses.eng: And if you speak aloud - indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden
verses.arabic: وَإِن تَجْهَرْ بِالْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى
verses.transliteration: Wa-in tajhar bi-l-qawli fa-innahu yaʿlamu s-sirra wa-akhfā

verses.eng: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu lā ilāha illā huwa lahu l-asmā'u l-ḥusnā

verses.eng: And has there come to you the story of Moses?
verses.arabic: وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa-hal atāka ḥadīthu mūsā

verses.eng: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."
verses.arabic: إِذْ رَأَىٰ نَارًا فَقَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَّعَلِّي آتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِقَبَسٍ أَوْ أَجِدُ عَلَى النَّارِ هُدًى
verses.transliteration: Idh ra'ā nāran fa-qāla li-ahlihi mkuthū innī ānastu nāran laʿallī ātīkum minhā biqabasin aw ajidu ʿalā n-nāri hudan

verses.eng: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fa-lammā atāhā nūdiya yā mūsā

verses.eng: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
verses.arabic: إِنِّي أَنَا رَبُّكَ فَاخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
verses.transliteration: Innī anā rabbuka fākhlaʿ naʿlayka innaka bi-l-wādi l-muqaddasi ṭuwan

verses.eng: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed.
verses.arabic: وَأَنَا اخْتَرْتُكَ فَاسْتَمِعْ لِمَا يُوحَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa-anā khtartuka fa-stamiʿ limā yūḥā

verses.eng: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.
verses.arabic: إِنَّنِي أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدْنِي وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ لِذِكْرِي
verses.transliteration: Innanī anā Allāhu lā ilāha illā anā fa-ʿbudnī wa-aqimi ṣ-ṣalāta li-dhikrī

verses.eng: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ السَّاعَةَ ءَاتِيَةٌ أَكَادُ أُخْفِيهَا لِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا تَسْعَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Inna s-sāʿata ātiyatun akādu ukhfīhā litujzā kullu nafsin bimā tasʿā

verses.eng: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.
verses.arabic: فَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنْهَا مَنْ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِهَا وَاتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ فَتَرْدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Falā yaṣuddannaka ʿanhā man lā yuʾminu bihā wa-ittabaʿa hawāhu fatardā

verses.eng: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?
verses.arabic: وَمَا تِلْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā tilka biyamīnika yā Mūsā

verses.eng: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."
verses.arabic: قَالَ هِيَ عَصَايَ أَتَوَكَّأُ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَىٰ غَنَمِي وَلِيَ فِيهَا مَآرِبُ أُخْرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla hiya ʿaṣāya atawakkaʾu ʿalayhā wa-ahushshu bihā ʿalā ghanamī wa-liya fīhā maʾāribu ukhrā

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلْقِهَا يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla alqihā yā Mūsā

verses.eng: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.
verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَاهَا فَإِذَا هِيَ حَيَّةٌ تَسْعَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fa-alqāhā fa-idhā hiya ḥayyatun tasʿā

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "Take it and do not fear. We will return it to its former condition.
verses.arabic: قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا الْأُولَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla khudh'hā wa lā takhaf sanuʿīduhā sīratahā al-ūlā

verses.eng: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,
verses.arabic: وَاضْمُمْ يَدَكَ إِلَىٰ جَنَاحِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ آيَةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ḍmum yadaka ilā janāḥika takhruj bayḍāʾa min ghayri sūʾin āyatan ukh'rā

verses.eng: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.
verses.arabic: لِنُرِيَكَ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا الْكُبْرَى
verses.transliteration: Linuriyaka min āyātinā al-kubrā

verses.eng: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
verses.arabic: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Idh'hab ilā Firʿawna innahu ṭaghā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِي صَدْرِي
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi ish'raḥ lī ṣadrī

verses.eng: And ease for me my task
verses.arabic: وَيَسِّرْ لِي أَمْرِي
verses.transliteration: Wa yassir lī amrī

verses.eng: And untie the knot from my tongue
verses.arabic: وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِّن لِّسَانِي
verses.transliteration: Wa-ḥlul ʿuqdatan min lisānī

verses.eng: That they may understand my speech.
verses.arabic: يَفْقَهُوا قَوْلِي
verses.transliteration: Yafqahū qawlī

verses.eng: And appoint for me a minister from my family -
verses.arabic: وَاجْعَل لِّي وَزِيرًا مِّنْ أَهْلِي
verses.transliteration: Wa-jʿal lī wazīran min ahlī

verses.eng: Aaron, my brother.
verses.arabic: هَـٰرُونَ أَخِي
verses.transliteration: Hārūna akhī

verses.eng: Strengthen through him my back
verses.arabic: اشْدُدْ بِهِ أَزْرِي
verses.transliteration: Ushdud bihi azree

verses.eng: And let him share my task
verses.arabic: وَأَشْرِكْهُ فِي أَمْرِي
verses.transliteration: Wa ashrikhu fee amree

verses.eng: That we may exalt You much
verses.arabic: كَيْ نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Kay nusabbihaka katheera

verses.eng: And remember You much
verses.arabic: وَنَذْكُرَكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa nathkuraka katheera

verses.eng: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing.
verses.arabic: إِنَّكَ كُنْتَ بِنَا بَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Innaka kunta bana baseera

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.
verses.arabic: قَالَ قَدْ أُوتِيتَ سُؤْلَكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qala qad ooteeta su'laka ya Moosa

verses.eng: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَيْكَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad mananna 'alayka marratan ukhra

verses.eng: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,
verses.arabic: إِذْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ مَا يُوحَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Ith awhayna ila ummika ma yooha

verses.eng: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.
verses.arabic: أَنِ اقْذِفِيهِ فِي التَّابُوتِ فَاقْذِفِيهِ فِي الْيَمِّ فَلْيُلْقِهِ الْيَمُّ بِالسَّاحِلِ يَأْخُذْهُ عَدُوٌّ لِّي وَعَدُوٌّ لَّهُ ۚ وَأَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْكَ مَحَبَّةً مِّنِّي وَلِتُصْنَعَ عَلَىٰ عَيْنِي
verses.transliteration: Ani iqdhifeehi fee al-tabooti fa-iqdhifeehi fee al-yammi fal-yulqihi al-yammu bialssahili ya/khuthhu 'aduwwun lee wa'aduwwun lahu waalqaytu 'alayka mahabbatan minnee walitusna'a 'ala 'aynee

verses.eng: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to one who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.
verses.arabic: إِذْ تَمْشِي أُخْتُكَ فَتَقُولُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن يَكْفُلُهُ ۖ فَرَجَعْنَاكَ إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ كَيْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا فَنَجَّيْنَاكَ مِنَ الْغَمِّ وَفَتَنَّاكَ فُتُونًا ۚ فَلَبِثْتَ سِنِينَ فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ ثُمَّ جِئْتَ عَلَىٰ قَدَرٍ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Ith tamshee okhtuka fataqoolu hal adullukum 'ala man yakfuluhu faraja'naka ila ummika kay taqarra 'aynuha wala tahzana waqatalta nafsan fanajjaynaka mina alghammi wafatannaka futoonan falabithta sineena fee ahli madyana thumma ji'ta 'ala qadarin ya Moosa

verses.eng: And I produced you for Myself.
verses.arabic: وَاصْطَنَعْتُكَ لِنَفْسِي
verses.transliteration: Wastana'tuka linafsee

verses.eng: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.
verses.arabic: اذْهَبْ أَنتَ وَأَخُوكَ بِآيَاتِي وَلَا تَنِيَا فِي ذِكْرِي
verses.transliteration: Ithhab anta waakhooka bi-ayatee wala taniya fee thikree

verses.eng: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
verses.arabic: اذْهَبَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Ithhaba ila fir'awna innahu tagha

verses.eng: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah].
verses.arabic: فَقُولَا لَهُ قَوْلًا لَّيِّنًا لَّعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Faqoola lahu qawlan layyinan la'allahu yatathakkaru aw yakhsha

verses.eng: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."
verses.arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَا أَوْ أَن يَطْغَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbana innana nakhafu an yafruta 'alayna aw an yatgha

verses.eng: He said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخَافَآ ۖ إِنَّنِى مَعَكُمَآ أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lā takhāfā innanī maʿakumā asmaʿu wa-arā

verses.eng: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.
verses.arabic: فَأْتِيَاهُ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَلَا تُعَذِّبْهُمْ ۖ قَدْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِـَٔايَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ وَٱلسَّلَـٰمُ عَلَىٰ مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
verses.transliteration: Faʾtiyāhu faqūlā innā rasūlā rabbika fa-arsil maʿanā banī isrāʾīla wa-lā tuʿadhdhibhum qad jiʾnāka bi-āyatin min rabbika wa-salāmun ʿalā mani ittabaʿa l-hudā

verses.eng: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.'"
verses.arabic: إِنَّا قَدْ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْنَآ أَنَّ ٱلْعَذَابَ عَلَىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
verses.transliteration: Innā qad ūḥiya ilaynā anna l-ʿadhāba ʿalā man kadhaba wa-tawallā

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَمَن رَّبُّكُمَا يَـٰمُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa-man rabbukumā yā mūsā

verses.eng: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّنَا ٱلَّذِىٓ أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلْقَهُۥ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbunā alladhī aʿṭā kulla shayʾin khalqahu thumma hadā

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَمَا بَالُ ٱلْقُرُونِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa-mā bālu l-qurūni l-ūlā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."
verses.arabic: قَالَ عِلْمُهَا عِندَ رَبِّى فِى كِتَـٰبٍۢ ۖ لَّا يَضِلُّ رَبِّى وَلَا يَنسَى
verses.transliteration: Qāla ʿilmuha ʿinda rabbī fī kitābin lā yaḍillu rabbī wa-lā yansā

verses.eng: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ مَهْدًۭا وَسَلَكَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًۭا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًۭا مِّن نَّبَاتٍۢ شَتَّىٰ
verses.transliteration: Alladhī jaʿala lakumu l-arḍa mahdan wa-salak lakum fīhā subulan wa-anzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-akhrajnā bihi azwājan min nabātin shattā

verses.eng: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.
verses.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱرْعَوْا۟ أَنْعَـٰمَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلنُّهَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Kulū wa-rʿaw anʿāmakum inna fī dhālika la-āyātin li-ulī n-nuhā

verses.eng: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.
verses.arabic: مِنْهَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ وَفِيهَا نُعِيدُكُمْ وَمِنْهَا نُخْرِجُكُمْ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Minhā khalaqnākum wa-fīhā nuʿīdukum wa-minhā nukhrijukum tāratan ukh'rā

verses.eng: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَـٰهُ ءَايَـٰتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa-laqad araynāhu āyātinā kullahā fa-kadhaba wa-abā

verses.eng: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتُخْرِجَنَا مِنْ أَرْضِنَا بِسِحْرِكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ajiʾtanā li-tukhrijanā min arḍinā bi-siḥrika yā mūsā

verses.eng: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."
verses.arabic: فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحْرٍۢ مِّثْلِهِۦ فَٱجْعَلْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكَ مَوْعِدًۭا لَّا نُخْلِفَهُۥ نَحْنُ وَلَآ أَنتَ مَكَانًۭا سُوًۭى
verses.transliteration: Fa-lanaʾtiyannaka bi-siḥrin mithlihi fa-jʿal baynanā wa-baynaka mawʿidan lā nukhlifahu naḥnu wa-lā anta makānan suwā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."
verses.arabic: قَالَ مَوْعِدُكُمْ يَوْمُ ٱلزِّينَةِ وَأَن يُحْشَرَ ٱلنَّاسُ ضُحًۭى
verses.transliteration: Qāla mawʿidukum yawmu z-zīnati wa-an yuḥshara n-nāsu ḍuḥā

verses.eng: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].
verses.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُۥ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fa-tawallā firʿawnu fa-jamaʿa kaydahu thumma atā

verses.eng: He (Moses) said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ وَيْلَكُمْ لَا تَفْتَرُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًۭا فَيُسْحِتَكُم بِعَذَابٍۢ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lahum mūsā waylakum lā taftarū ʿalā l-lahi kadhiban fayus'ḥitakum biʿadhābin waqad khāba mani if'tarā

verses.eng: So they disputed their matter among themselves and concealed their private conversation.
verses.arabic: فَتَنَـٰزَعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fatanāzaʿū amrahum baynahum wa-asarru n-najwā

verses.eng: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way.
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَٰنِ لَسَـٰحِرَٰنِ يُرِيدَانِ أَن يُخْرِجَاكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِمَا وَيَذْهَبَا بِطَرِيقَتِكُمُ ٱلْمُثْلَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qālū in hādhāni lasāḥirāni yurīdāni an yukhrijākum min arḍikum bisih'rihimā wayadhhabā biṭarīqatikumu l-muthlā

verses.eng: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."
verses.arabic: فَأَجْمِعُوا۟ كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ٱئْتُوا۟ صَفًّۭا ۚ وَقَدْ أَفْلَحَ ٱلْيَوْمَ مَنِ ٱسْتَعْلَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fa-ajmiʿū kaydakum thumma i'tū ṣaffan waqad aflaḥa l-yawma mani is'taʿlā

verses.eng: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the first to throw."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِمَّآ أَن تُلْقِىَ وَإِمَّآ أَن نَّكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَلْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā mūsā immā an tul'qiya wa-immā an nakūna awwala man alqā

verses.eng: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].
verses.arabic: قَالَ بَلْ أَلْقُوا۟ ۖ فَإِذَا حِبَالُهُمْ وَعِصِيُّهُمْ يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ مِن سِحْرِهِمْ أَنَّهَا تَسْعَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla bal alqū fa-idhā ḥibāluhum waʿiṣiyyuhum yukhayyalu ilayhi min siḥ'rihim annahā tasʿā

verses.eng: And Moses sensed within himself fear.
verses.arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ فِى نَفْسِهِۦ خِيفَةًۭ مُّوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fa-awjasa fī nafsihi khīfatan mūsā

verses.eng: We [Allah] said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.
verses.arabic: قُلْنَا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qulnā lā takhaf innaka anta l-aʿlā

verses.eng: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."
verses.arabic: وَأَلْقِ مَا فِى يَمِينِكَ تَلْقَفْ مَا صَنَعُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا۟ كَيْدُ سَـٰحِرٍۢ ۖ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلسَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alqi mā fī yamīnika talqaf mā ṣanaʿū innamā ṣanaʿū kaydu sāḥirin walā yufliḥu s-sāḥiru ḥaythu atā

verses.eng: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."
verses.arabic: فَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًۭا قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ هَـٰرُونَ وَمُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fa-ul'qiya s-saḥaratu sujjadan qālū āmannā birabbi hārūna wamūsā

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, "Have you believed him before I gave you permission? Indeed, he is your chief who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍۢ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِى جُذُوعِ ٱلنَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَآ أَشَدُّ عَذَابًۭا وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla āmantum lahu qabla an ādhantu lakum innahu lakabīrukumu alladhī ʿallamakumu s-siḥ'ra fala-uqaṭṭiʿanna aydiyakum wa-arjulakum min khilāfin wala-uṣallibannakum fī judhūʿi n-nakhli walataʿlamunna ayyunā ashaddu ʿadhāban wa-abqā

verses.eng: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَن نُّؤْثِرَكَ عَلَىٰ مَا جَآءَنَا مِنَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَٱلَّذِى فَطَرَنَا ۖ فَٱقْضِ مَآ أَنتَ قَاضٍ ۖ إِنَّمَا تَقْضِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَآ
verses.transliteration: Qālū lan nu'thiraka ʿalā mā jāanā mina l-bayyināti wa-alladhī faṭaranā faqḍi mā anta qāḍin innamā taqḍī hādhihi l-ḥayata d-dunyā

verses.eng: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."
verses.arabic: إِنَّآ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّنَا لِيَغْفِرَ لَنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَا وَمَآ أَكْرَهْتَنَا عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلسِّحْرِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌۭ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ
verses.transliteration: Innā āmannā birabbinā liyaghfira lanā khaṭāyānā wamā akrahtanā ʿalayhi mina s-siḥ'ri wa-l-lahu khayrun wa-abqā

verses.eng: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَأْتِ رَبَّهُۥ مُجْرِمًۭا فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Innahu man yati rabbahu muj'riman fa-inna lahu jahannama lā yamūtu fīhā walā yaḥyā

verses.eng: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for them will be the highest degrees [in position]:
verses.arabic: وَمَن يَأْتِهِۦ مُؤْمِنًۭا قَدْ عَمِلَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمُ ٱلدَّرَجَـٰتُ ٱلْعُلَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Waman yatihi mu'minan qad ʿamila ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-ulāika lahumu d-darajātu l-ʿulā

verses.eng: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.
verses.arabic: جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ مَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ
verses.transliteration: Jannātu 'adnin tajrī min taḥtihā al-anhāru khālidīna fīhā, wa dhālika jazā'u man tazakkā

verses.eng: And We had inspired to Moses, 'Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken nor be afraid [of drowning].'
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي فَاضْرِبْ لَهُمْ طَرِيقًا فِي الْبَحْرِ يَبَسًا لَّا تَخَافُ دَرَكًا وَلَا تَخْشَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad awḥaynā ilā Mūsá an asri bi'ibādī faḍrib lahum ṭarīqan fīl-baḥri yabasan lā takhāfu darakan wa lā takhshā

verses.eng: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them.
verses.arabic: فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ بِجُنُودِهِ فَغَشِيَهُم مِّنَ الْيَمِّ مَا غَشِيَهُمْ
verses.transliteration: Fa atba'ahum Fir'awnu bijunūdihi faghashiyahum minal-yammi mā ghashiyahum

verses.eng: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].
verses.arabic: وَأَضَلَّ فِرْعَوْنُ قَوْمَهُ وَمَا هَدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa aḍalla Fir'awnu qawmahu wa mā hadā

verses.eng: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,
verses.arabic: يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ قَدْ أَنجَيْنَاكُم مِّنْ عَدُوِّكُمْ وَوَاعَدْنَاكُمْ جَانِبَ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنَ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Yā banī Isrā'īla qad anjaynākum min 'aduwwikum wa wā'adnākum jānibaṭ-ṭūril-aymana wa nazzalnā 'alaykumul-manna was-salwā

verses.eng: [Saying], 'Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen.'
verses.arabic: كُلُوا مِن طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِي ۖ وَمَن يَحْلِلْ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبِي فَقَدْ هَوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Kulū min ṭayyibāti mā razaqnākum wa lā taṭghaw fīhi fa yaḥilla 'alaykum ghaḍabī, wa man yaḥlil 'alayhi ghaḍabī fa qad hawā

verses.eng: And indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.
verses.arabic: وَإِنِّي لَغَفَّارٌ لِّمَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا ثُمَّ اهْتَدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa innī laghaffārul liman tāba wa āmana wa 'amila ṣāliḥan thumma ahtadā

verses.eng: [Allah said], 'And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?'
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَعْجَلَكَ عَن قَوْمِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā a'jalaka 'an qawmika yā Mūsā

verses.eng: He said, 'They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ هُمْ أُولَاءِ عَلَىٰ أَثَرِي وَعَجِلْتُ إِلَيْكَ رَبِّ لِتَرْضَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla hum ulā'i 'alā atharī wa 'ajiltu ilayka rabbi litarḍā

verses.eng: [Allah] said, 'But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Samiri has led them astray.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّا قَدْ فَتَنَّا قَوْمَكَ مِن بَعْدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ السَّامِرِيُّ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa innā qad fatannā qawmaka min ba'dika wa aḍallahumu-s-Sāmiriyy

verses.eng: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, 'O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise to me?'
verses.arabic: فَرَجَعَ مُوسَىٰ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ غَضْبَانَ أَسِفًا ۚ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَلَمْ يَعِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطَالَ عَلَيْكُمُ الْعَهْدُ أَمْ أَرَدتُّمْ أَن يَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُم مَّوْعِدِي
verses.transliteration: Faraja'a Mūsá ilá qawmihi ghaḍbāna asifā, qāla yā qawmi alam ya'idkum rabbukum wa'dan ḥasanan, a fa ṭāla 'alaykumul-'ahdu am aradtum an yaḥilla 'alaykum ghaḍabun min rabbikum fa akhlaf tum maw'idī

verses.eng: They said, 'We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Samiri throw.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ مَا أَخْلَفْنَا مَوْعِدَكَ بِمَلْكِنَا وَلَـٰكِنَّا حُمِّلْنَا أَوْزَارًا مِّن زِينَةِ ٱلْقَوْمِ فَقَذَفْنَـٰهَا فَكَذَٰلِكَ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّامِرِىُّ
verses.transliteration: Qālū mā akhlafnā maw'idaka bimalkinā wa lākinnā ḥummilnā awzāram min zīnati al-qawmi fa qadhafnāhā fa kadhālika alqā as-Sāmiriyy

verses.eng: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, 'This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot.'
verses.arabic: فَأَخْرَجَ لَهُمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَّهُ خُوَارٌ فَقَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ وَإِلَـٰهُ مُوسَىٰ فَنَسِىَ
verses.transliteration: Fa akhraja lahum 'ijlan jasadan lahu khuwārun fa qālū hādhā ilāhukum wa ilāhu Mūsá fa nasiya

verses.eng: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?
verses.arabic: أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَلَّا يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَوْلًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا
verses.transliteration: Afalā yarawna allā yarji'u ilayhim qawlan wa lā yamliku lahum ḍarran wa lā naf'ā

verses.eng: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], 'O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order.'
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لَهُمْ هَـٰرُونُ مِن قَبْلُ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنَّمَا فُتِنتُم بِهِۦ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَٱتَّبِعُونِى وَأَطِيعُوٓا۟ أَمْرِى
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad qāla lahum Hārūnu min qablu yā qawmi innamā futintum bihī, wa inna rabbakumur-Raḥmānu fattabi'ūnī wa aṭī'ū amrī

verses.eng: They said, "We will not cease to worship it until Moses returns to us."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَن نَّبْرَحَ عَلَيْهِ عَـٰكِفِينَ حَتَّىٰ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qālū lan nabraḥa ʿalayhi ʿākifīna ḥattā yarjiʿa ilaynā Mūsā

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰهَـٰرُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوٓا۟
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā Hārūnu mā manaʿaka idh ra'aytahum ḍallū

verses.eng: That you did not follow me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"
verses.arabic: أَلَّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيْتَ أَمْرِى
verses.transliteration: Allā tattabiʿani a faʿaṣayta amrī

verses.eng: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You have caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.'"
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَبْنَؤُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِى وَلَا بِرَأْسِىٓ ۖ إِنِّى خَشِيتُ أَن تَقُولَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَلَمْ تَرْقُبْ قَوْلِى
verses.transliteration: Qāla yabna'umma lā ta'khudh biliḥyatī walā bira'sī innī khashītu an taqūla farraqta bayna banī Isrāīla wa lam tarqub qawlī

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Samiri?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يَـٰسَـٰمِرِىُّ
verses.transliteration: Qāla famā khaṭbuka yā Sāmiriyyu

verses.eng: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."
verses.arabic: قَالَ بَصُرْتُ بِمَا لَمْ يَبْصُرُوا۟ بِهِۦ فَقَبَضْتُ قَبْضَةًۭ مِّنْ أَثَرِ ٱلرَّسُولِ فَنَبَذْتُهَا وَكَذَٰلِكَ سَوَّلَتْ لِى نَفْسِى
verses.transliteration: Qāla baṣurtu bimā lam yabṣurū bihi faqabaḍtu qabḍatan min athari r-rasūli fanabadhtuhā wa kadhalika sawwalat lī nafsī

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it into the sea with a blast.
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَٱذْهَبْ فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ أَن تَقُولَ لَا مِسَاسَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوْعِدًۭا لَّن تُخْلَفَهُۥ ۖ وَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰٓ إِلَـٰهِكَ ٱلَّذِى ظَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفًۭا ۖ لَّنُحَرِّقَنَّهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَنسِفَنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ نَسْفًا
verses.transliteration: Qāla fadhhab fa'inna laka fī l-ḥayāti an taqūla lā misāsa wa inna laka mawʿidan lan tukhlafahu wa nẓur ilā ilāhika alladhī ẓalta ʿalayhi ʿākifan lanuḥarriqannahu thumma lanasfannahu fī l-yammi nasfā

verses.eng: Your god is only Allah, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عِلْمًۭا
verses.transliteration: Innamā ilāhukumu Allāhu alladhī lā ilāha illā huwa wasiʿa kulla shay'in ʿilmā

verses.eng: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ مَا قَدْ سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكَ مِن لَّدُنَّا ذِكْرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Kadhālika naquṣṣu ʿalayka min anbāi mā qad sabaqa wa qad ātaynāka min ladunnā dhikrā

verses.eng: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,
verses.arabic: مَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَحْمِلُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وِزْرًا
verses.transliteration: Man aʿraḍa ʿanhu fa'innahu yaḥmilu yawma l-qiyāmati wizrā

verses.eng: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -
verses.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهِ ۖ وَسَآءَ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ حِمْلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Khālidīna fīhi wa sā'a lahum yawma l-qiyāmati ḥimlā

verses.eng: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ۚ وَنَحْشُرُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ زُرْقًۭا
verses.transliteration: Yawma yunfakhu fī ṣ-ṣūri wa naḥshuru l-mujrimīna yawma'idhin zurqā

verses.eng: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."
verses.arabic: يَتَخَـٰفَتُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا عَشْرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Yatakhāfatūna baynahum in labithtum illā ʿashrā

verses.eng: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."
verses.arabic: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذْ يَقُولُ أَمْثَلُهُمْ طَرِيقَةً إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا يَوْمًۭا
verses.transliteration: Naḥnu aʿlamu bimā yaqūlūna idh yaqūlu amthaluhum ṭarīqatan in labithtum illā yawmā

verses.eng: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.
verses.arabic: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْجِبَالِ فَقُلْ يَنسِفُهَا رَبِّى نَسْفًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa yas'alūnaka ʿani l-jibāli faqul yansifuhā rabbī nasfā

verses.eng: So He will leave it as a level, bare plain,
verses.arabic: فَيَذَرُهَا قَاعًا صَفْصَفًا
verses.transliteration: Fayatharuha qaAAan safsafan

verses.eng: You will see therein no depression or elevation.
verses.arabic: لَّا تَرَىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَآ أَمْتًا
verses.transliteration: La tara feeha AAiwajan wala amtan

verses.eng: That Day, they will follow the Caller with no deviation from him, and voices will be hushed for the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعُونَ الدَّاعِيَ لَا عِوَجَ لَهُ وَخَشَعَتِ الْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ فَلَا تَسْمَعُ إِلَّا هَمْسًا
verses.transliteration: Yawma-ithin yattabiAAoona addaAAiya la AAiwaja lahu wakhashaAAati al-aswatu lirrahmani fala tasmaAAu illa hamsan

verses.eng: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا تَنفَعُ الشَّفَاعَةُ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَرَضِيَ لَهُ قَوْلًا
verses.transliteration: Yawma-ithin la tanfaAAu ashshafaAAatu illa man athina lahu arrahmanu waradiya lahu qoolan

verses.eng: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.
verses.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِهِ عِلْمًا
verses.transliteration: YaAAlamu ma bayna aydeehim wama khalfahum wala yuheetoona bihi AAilman

verses.eng: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.
verses.arabic: وَعَنَتِ الْوُجُوهُ لِلْحَيِّ الْقَيُّومِ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ حَمَلَ ظُلْمًا
verses.transliteration: WaAAanati alwujoohu lilhayyi alqayyoomi waqad khaba man hamala thulman

verses.eng: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.
verses.arabic: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًا وَلَا هَضْمًا
verses.transliteration: Waman yaAAmal mina assalihati wahuwa mu/minun fala yakhafu thulman wala hadman

verses.eng: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَاهُ قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفْنَا فِيهِ مِنَ الْوَعِيدِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ أَوْ يُحْدِثُ لَهُمْ ذِكْرًا
verses.transliteration: Wakathalika anzalnahu qur-anan AAarabiyyan wasarrafna feehi mina alwaAAeedi laAAallahum yattaqoona aw yuhdithu lahum thikran

verses.eng: So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
verses.arabic: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُقْضَىٰ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُ وَقُل رَّبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا
verses.transliteration: FataAAala Allahu almaliku alhaqqu wala taAAjal bilqur-ani min qabli an yuqda ilayka wahyuhu waqul rabbi zidnee AAilman

verses.eng: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَهِدْنَا إِلَىٰ آدَمَ مِن قَبْلُ فَنَسِيَ وَلَمْ نَجِدْ لَهُ عَزْمًا
verses.transliteration: Walaqad AAahidna ila adama min qablu fanasiya walam najid lahu AAazman

verses.eng: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ith qulna lilmala-ikatiosjudoo li-adama fasajadoo illa ibleesa aba

verses.eng: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.
verses.arabic: فَقُلْنَا يَا آدَمُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا عَدُوٌّ لَّكَ وَلِزَوْجِكَ فَلَا يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فَتَشْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Faqulna ya adamu inna hatha AAaduwwun laka walizawjika fala yukhrijannakuma mina aljannati fatashqa

verses.eng: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلَّا تَجُوعَ فِيهَا وَلَا تَعْرَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Inna laka alla tajooAAa feeha wala taAAra

verses.eng: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."
verses.arabic: وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَأُ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Waannaka la tathmao feeha wala tadha

verses.eng: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"
verses.arabic: فَوَسْوَسَ إِلَيْهِ الشَّيْطَانُ قَالَ يَا آدَمُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَىٰ شَجَرَةِ الْخُلْدِ وَمُلْكٍ لَّا يَبْلَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Fawaswasa ilayhi ashshaytanu qala ya adamu hal adulluka AAala shajarati alkhuldi wamulkin la yabla

verses.eng: So they both ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.
verses.arabic: فَأَكَلَا مِنْهَا فَبَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْءَاتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ الْجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصَىٰ آدَمُ رَبَّهُ فَغَوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Faakalā minhā fabadat lahumā sawʾātuhumā waṭafiqā yakhṣifāni ʿalayhimā min waraqi l-jannati waʿaṣā ādamu rabbahu faghawā

verses.eng: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and gave him guidance.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱجْتَبَٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ij'tabāhu rabbuhu fatāba ʿalayhi wahadā

verses.eng: He said, "Descend from it, all of you, as enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray nor suffer.
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱهْبِطَا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًۢا بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُم مِّنِّى هُدًۭى فَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ هُدَاىَ فَلَا يَضِلُّ وَلَا يَشْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ihbiṭā minhā jamīʿan baʿḍukum libaʿḍin ʿaduwwun faʾimmā yaʾtiyannakum minnī hudan famani ittabaʿa hudāya falā yaḍillu walā yashqā

verses.eng: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind."
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَن ذِكْرِى فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ مَعِيشَةًۭ ضَنكًۭا وَنَحْشُرُهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ أَعْمَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Waman aʿraḍa ʿan dhikrī faʾinna lahu maʿīshatan ḍankan wanaḥshuruhu yawma l-qiyāmati aʿmā

verses.eng: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرْتَنِي أَعْمَىٰ وَقَدْ كُنتُ بَصِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi lima ḥashartanī aʿmā waqad kuntu baṣīran

verses.eng: He will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."
verses.arabic: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ أَتَتْكَ ءَايَـٰتُنَا فَنَسِيتَهَا ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ تُنسَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qāla kadhālika atatka āyātunā fanasītahā wakadhālika l-yawma tunsā

verses.eng: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِنۢ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ ۚ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ
verses.transliteration: Wakadhālika najzī man asrafa walam yuʾmin biʾāyāti rabbihi walaʿadhābu l-ākhirati ashaddu waʾabqā

verses.eng: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.
verses.arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِى مَسَـٰكِنِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلنُّهَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Afalam yahdi lahum kam ahlaknā qablahum mina l-qurūni yamshūna fī masākinihim ʾinna fī dhālika laʾāyātin liʾūlī l-nuhā

verses.eng: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌۭ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًۭا وَأَجَلٌۭ مُّسَمًّۭى
verses.transliteration: Walawlā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika lakāna lizāman waʾajalun musamman

verses.eng: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.
verses.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ غُرُوبِهَا ۖ وَمِنْ ءَانَآئِ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْ وَأَطْرَافَ ٱلنَّهَارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرْضَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Faṣbir ʿalā mā yaqūlūna wasabbiḥ biḥamdi rabbika qabla ṭulūʿi l-shamsi waqabla ghurūbihā wamin ānāʾi l-layli fasabbiḥ waʾaṭrāfa l-nahāri laʿallaka tarḍā

verses.eng: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] groups of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًۭا مِّنْهُمْ زَهْرَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَرِزْقُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌۭ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Walā tamuddanna ʿaynayka ilā mā mattaʿnā bihi azwājan minhum zahrata l-ḥayati l-dunyā linaftinahum fīhi warizqu rabbika khayrun waʾabqā

verses.eng: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.
verses.arabic: وَأْمُرْ أَهْلَكَ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱصْطَبِرْ عَلَيْهَا ۖ لَا نَسْـَٔلُكَ رِزْقًۭا ۖ نَّحْنُ نَرْزُقُكَ ۗ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Waʾmur ahlaka biṣ-ṣalāti waṣṭabir ʿalayhā lā nasʾaluka rizqan naḥnu narzuquka wal-ʿāqibatu lilttaqwā

verses.eng: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا يَأْتِينَا بِـَٔايَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦٓ ۚ أَوَلَمْ تَأْتِهِم بَيِّنَةُ مَا فِى ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Waqālū lawlā yaʾtīnā biʾāyatin min rabbihi ʾawalam taʾtihim bayyinu mā fī ṣ-ṣuḥufi l-ʾūlā

verses.eng: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّآ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُم بِعَذَابٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ لَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا لَوْلَآ أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًۭا فَنَتَّبِعَ ءَايَـٰتِكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن نَّذِلَّ وَنَخْزَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Walaw ʾannā ʾahlaknāhum biʿadhābin min qablihi laqālū rabbanā lawlā ʾarsalta ʾilaynā rasūlan fanattabiʿa ʾāyātika min qabli ʾan nadhilla wanakhzā

verses.eng: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."
verses.arabic: قُلْ كُلٌّۭ مَّتَرَبِّصٌۭ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ ٱلسَّوِيِّ وَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qul kullun mutarabbiṣun fatarabbaṣū fasataʿlamūna man ʾaṣḥābu ṣ-ṣirāṭi s-sawiyyi wamani htadā

verses.eng: Their reckoning has drawn near to mankind, while they turn away in heedlessness.
verses.arabic: اقْتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمْ وَهُمْ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Iqtaraba lilnnasi hisabuhum wahum fee ghafletin muAAridoon

verses.eng: No new reminder comes to them from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play,
verses.arabic: مَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا اسْتَمَعُوهُ وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ma yateehim min thikrin min rabbihim muhdathin illa istamaAAoohu wahum yalAAaboon

verses.eng: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"
verses.arabic: لَاهِيَةً قُلُوبُهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجْوَى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا هَلْ هَذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ أَفَتَأْتُونَ السِّحْرَ وَأَنْتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lahiyatan quloobuhum waasarroo alnnajwa allatheena thalamoo hal hatha illa basharun mithlukum afatatoona alssihra waantum tubsiroon

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّي يَعْلَمُ الْقَوْلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbee yaAAlamu alqawla fee alssamai waalardi wahuwa alssameeAAu alAAaleemu
