verses.eng: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."
verses.arabic: بَلْ قَالُوا أَضْغَاثُ أَحْلَامٍ بَلِ افْتَرَاهُ بَلْ هُوَ شَاعِرٌ فَلْيَأْتِنَا بِآيَةٍ كَمَا أُرْسِلَ الْأَوَّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal qaloo adghathu ahlamin bali iftarahu bal huwa shaAAirun falyatina biayatin kama orsila alawwaloon

verses.eng: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?
verses.arabic: مَا آمَنَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا أَفَهُمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ma amanat qablahum min qaryatin ahlaknaha afahum yuminoon

verses.eng: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُوحِي إِلَيْهِمْ فَاسْأَلُوا أَهْلَ الذِّكْرِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama arsalna qablaka illa rijalan noohee ilayhim faisaloo ahla alththikri in kuntum la taAAlamoon

verses.eng: And We did not make them bodies not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].
verses.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَاهُمْ جَسَدًا لَا يَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَمَا كَانُوا خَالِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wama jaAAalnahum jasadan la yakuloona alttaAAama wama kanoo khalideena

verses.eng: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ صَدَقْنَاهُمُ الْوَعْدَ فَأَنْجَيْنَاهُمْ وَمَنْ نَشَاءُ وَأَهْلَكْنَا الْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma sadaqnahumu alwaAAda faanjaynahum waman nashao waahlakna almusrifeena

verses.eng: We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ كِتَابًا فِيهِ ذِكْرُكُمْ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laqad anzalna ilaykum kitaban feehi thikrukum afala taAAqiloon

verses.eng: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.
verses.arabic: وَكَمْ قَصَمْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ كَانَتْ ظَالِمَةً وَأَنْشَأْنَا بَعْدَهَا قَوْمًا آخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wakam qasamna min qaryatin kanat thalimatan waanshana baAAdaha qawman akhareena

verses.eng: And when they perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا أَحَسُّوا بَأْسَنَا إِذَا هُمْ مِنْهَا يَرْكُضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma ahassoo basana itha hum minha yarkudoon

verses.eng: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."
verses.arabic: لَا تَرْكُضُوا وَارْجِعُوا إِلَى مَا أُتْرِفْتُمْ فِيهِ وَمَسَاكِنِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْأَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: La tarkudoo wairjiAAoo ila ma otriftum feehi wamasakinikum laAAallakum tusaloon

verses.eng: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo ya waylana inna kunna thalimeena

verses.eng: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].
verses.arabic: فَمَا زَالَتْ تِلْكَ دَعْوَاهُمْ حَتَّى جَعَلْنَاهُمْ حَصِيدًا خَامِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fama zalat tilka daAAwahum hatta jaAAalnahum haseedan khamideena

verses.eng: We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them in play.
verses.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَاعِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wama khalaqna alssamaa waalarda wama baynahuma laAAibeen

verses.eng: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.
verses.arabic: لَوْ أَرَدْنَا أَنْ نَتَّخِذَ لَهْوًا لَاتَّخَذْنَاهُ مِنْ لَدُنَّا إِنْ كُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Law aradna an nattakhitha lahwan lattakhathnahu min ladunna in kunna faAAileen

verses.eng: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from what you describe.
verses.arabic: بَلْ نَقْذِفُ بِالْحَقِّ عَلَى الْبَاطِلِ فَيَدْمَغُهُ فَإِذَا هُوَ زَاهِقٌ وَلَكُمُ الْوَيْلُ مِمَّا تَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal naqdhifu bialhaqqi AAala albatili fayadmaghuhu faitha huwa zahiqun walakumu alwaylu mimma tasifoon

verses.eng: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.
verses.arabic: وَلَهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَنْ عِنْدَهُ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِ وَلَا يَسْتَحْسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walahu man fee alssamawati waalardi waman AAindahu la yastakbiroona AAan AAibadatihi wala yastahsiroon

verses.eng: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.
verses.arabic: يُسَبِّحُونَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ لَا يَفْتُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yusabbihoona allayla waalnnahara la yafturoon

verses.eng: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?
verses.arabic: أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا آلِهَةً مِنَ الْأَرْضِ هُمْ يُنشِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ami ittakhathoo alihatan mina alardi hum yunshiroon

verses.eng: Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
verses.arabic: لَوْ كَانَ فِيهِمَا آلِهَةٌ إِلَّا اللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتَا فَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Law kana feehima alihatun illa Allahu lafasadata fasubhana Allahi rabbi alAAarshi AAamma yasifoon

verses.eng: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
verses.arabic: لَا يُسْأَلُ عَمَّا يَفْعَلُ وَهُمْ يُسْأَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: La yusalu AAamma yafAAalu wahum yusaloon

verses.eng: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
verses.arabic: أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً قُلْ هَاتُوا بُرْهَانَكُمْ هَذَا ذِكْرُ مَنْ مَعِيَ وَذِكْرُ مَنْ قَبْلِي بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ الْحَقَّ فَهُمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ami ittakhathoo min doonihi alihatan qul hatoo burhanakum hatha thikru man maAAiya wathikru man qablee bal aktharuhum la yaAAlamoona alhaqqa fahum muAAridoon

verses.eng: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِكَ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا نُوحِي إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wama arsalna min qablika min rasoolin illa noohee ilayhi annahu la ilaha illa ana faoAAbudoon

verses.eng: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَلَدًا سُبْحَانَهُ بَلْ عِبَادٌ مُكْرَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqaloo ittakhatha alrrahmanu waladan subhanahu bal AAibadun mukramoon

verses.eng: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.
verses.arabic: لَا يَسْبِقُونَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ وَهُمْ بِأَمْرِهِ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: La yasbiqoonahu bialqawli wahum biamrihi yaAAmaloon

verses.eng: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.
verses.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يَشْفَعُونَ إِلَّا لِمَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ وَهُمْ مِنْ خَشْيَتِهِ مُشْفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: YaAAlamu ma bayna aydeehim wama khalfahum wala yashfaAAoona illa limani irtada wahum min khashyatihi mushfiqoon

verses.eng: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him," that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ يَقُلْ مِنْهُمْ إِنِّي إِلَٰهٌ مِنْ دُونِهِ فَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِيهِ جَهَنَّمَ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waman yaqul minhum innee ilahun min doonihi fathalika najzeehi jahannama kathalika najzee alththalimeen

verses.eng: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ كَانَتَا رَتْقًا فَفَتَقْنَاهُمَا وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ حَيٍّ أَفَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awalam yara allatheena kafaroo anna alssamawati waalarda kanata ratqan fafataqnahuma wajaAAalna mina almai kulla shayin hayyin afala yuminoon

verses.eng: And We have placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِي الْأَرْضِ رَوَاسِيَ أَنْ تَمِيدَ بِهِمْ وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا فِجَاجًا سُبُلًا لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa jaʿalnā fī al-arḍi rawāsiya an tamīda bihim wa jaʿalnā fīhā fijājan subulan laʿallahum yahtadūn

verses.eng: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا السَّمَاءَ سَقْفًا مَحْفُوظًا وَهُمْ عَنْ آيَاتِهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa jaʿalnā as-samāʾa saqfan maḥfūẓan wa hum ʿan āyātihā muʿriḍūn

verses.eng: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ كُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa alladhī khalaqa al-layla wa an-nahāra wa ash-shamsa wa al-qamara kullun fī falakin yasbaḥūn

verses.eng: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?
verses.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا لِبَشَرٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ الْخُلْدَ أَفَإِنْ مِتَّ فَهُمُ الْخَالِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā jaʿalnā li-basharin min qablika al-khulda a fa-in mitta fa-humu al-khālidūn

verses.eng: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.
verses.arabic: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَائِقَةُ الْمَوْتِ وَنَبْلُوكُمْ بِالشَّرِّ وَالْخَيْرِ فِتْنَةً وَإِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kullu nafsin dhāʾiqatu al-mawti wa nablūkum bi-ash-sharri wa al-khayri fitnatan wa ilaynā turjaʿūn

verses.eng: And when those who disbelieve see you, they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who insults your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا رَآكَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي يَذْكُرُ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَهُمْ بِذِكْرِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ هُمْ كَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā raʾāka alladhīna kafarū in yattakhidhūnaka illā huzuwan a hādhā alladhī yadhkuru ālihatakum wa hum bi-dhikri ar-raḥmāni hum kāfirūn

verses.eng: Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.
verses.arabic: خُلِقَ الْإِنْسَانُ مِنْ عَجَلٍ سَأُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِي فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
verses.transliteration: Khuliqa al-insānu min ʿajalin sa-urīkum āyātī fa lā tastaʿjilūn

verses.eng: And they say, "When will this promise be, if you should be truthful?"
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqūlūna matā hādhā al-waʿdu in kuntum �ādiqīn

verses.eng: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...
verses.arabic: لَوْ يَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا حِينَ لَا يَكُفُّونَ عَنْ وُجُوهِهِمُ النَّارَ وَلَا عَنْ ظُهُورِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Law yaʿlamu alladhīna kafarū ḥīna lā yakuffūna ʿan wujūhihimu an-nāra wa lā ʿan ẓuhūrihim wa lā hum yunṣarūn

verses.eng: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.
verses.arabic: بَلْ تَأْتِيهِمْ بَغْتَةً فَتَبْهَتُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ رَدَّهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْظَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal taʾtīhim baghtatan fa tabhatuhum fa lā yastaṭīʿūna raddahā wa lā hum yunẓarūn

verses.eng: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدِ اسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِالَّذِينَ سَخِرُوا مِنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqadi ustuhziʾa bi-rusulin min qablika fa ḥāqa bi-alladhīna sakhirū minhum mā kānū bihi yastahziʾūn

verses.eng: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَنْ يَكْلَؤُكُمْ بِاللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ بَلْ هُمْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul man yaklaʾukum bi-al-layli wa an-nahāri min ar-raḥmāni bal hum ʿan dhikri rabbihim muʿriḍūn

verses.eng: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.
verses.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ آلِهَةٌ تَمْنَعُهُمْ مِنْ دُونِنَا لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ مِنَّا يُصْحَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am lahum ālihatun tamnaʿuhum min dūninā lā yastaṭīʿūna naṣra anfusihim wa lā hum minnā yuṣḥabūn

verses.eng: But We have provided enjoyment for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?
verses.arabic: بَلْ مَتَّعْنَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ طَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعُمُرُ أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَنَّا نَأْتِي الْأَرْضَ نَنْقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا أَفَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal mattaʿnā hāʾulāʾi wa ābāʾahum ḥattā ṭāla ʿalayhimu al-ʿumuru a fa lā yarawna annā naʾtī al-arḍa nanquṣuhā min aṭrāfihā a fa-humu al-ghālibūn

verses.eng: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أُنْذِرُكُمْ بِالْوَحْيِ وَلَا يَسْمَعُ الصُّمُّ الدُّعَاءَ إِذَا مَا يُنْذَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul innamā undhirkum bi-al-waḥyi wa lā yasmaʿu aṣ-ṣummu ad-duʿāʾa idhā mā yundharūn

verses.eng: And if a breath of your Lord's punishment were to touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ مَسَّتْهُمْ نَفْحَةٌ مِنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la-in massat-hum nafhatun min 'adhabi rabbika la-yaqoolunna ya waylana inna kunna zalimeen

verses.eng: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be wronged at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
verses.arabic: وَنَضَعُ الْمَوَازِينَ الْقِسْطَ لِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ فَلَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا وَإِنْ كَانَ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍ مِنْ خَرْدَلٍ أَتَيْنَا بِهَا وَكَفَى بِنَا حَاسِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa nada'u al-mawazeena al-qista li-yawmi al-qiyamati fala tuzlamu nafsun shay'an wa in kana mithqala habbatin min khardalin atayna biha wa kafa bina hasibeen

verses.eng: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى وَهَارُونَ الْفُرْقَانَ وَضِيَاءً وَذِكْرًا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad atayna Musa wa Haroona al-furqana wa diya'an wa thikran lil-muttaqeen

verses.eng: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ وَهُمْ مِنَ السَّاعَةِ مُشْفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allatheena yakhshawna rabbahum bil-ghaybi wa hum min al-sa'ati mushfiqoon

verses.eng: And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?
verses.arabic: وَهَذَا ذِكْرٌ مُبَارَكٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ أَفَأَنْتُمْ لَهُ مُنْكِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa hatha thikrun mubarakun anzalnahu afa-antum lahu munkiroon

verses.eng: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-aware
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ رُشْدَهُ مِنْ قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا بِهِ عَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad atayna Ibrahim rushdahu min qablu wa kunna bihi 'alimeen

verses.eng: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا هَذِهِ التَّمَاثِيلُ الَّتِي أَنْتُمْ لَهَا عَاكِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ith qala li-abeehi wa qawmihi ma hathihi al-tamathilu allatee antum laha 'akifoon

verses.eng: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا لَهَا عَابِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo wajadna abaana laha 'abideen

verses.eng: He said, "Then indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest error."
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَقَدْ كُنْتُمْ أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Qala laqad kuntum antum wa aba'ukum fee dalalin mubeen

verses.eng: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"
verses.arabic: قَالُوا أَجِئْتَنَا بِالْحَقِّ أَمْ أَنْتَ مِنَ اللَّاعِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo aji'tana bil-haqqi am anta mina al-la'ibeen

verses.eng: He said, "Rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.
verses.arabic: قَالَ بَلْ رَبُّكُمْ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ الَّذِي فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنَا عَلَى ذَلِكُمْ مِنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala bal rabbukum rabbu al-samawati wa al-ardhi allathee fatarahunna wa ana 'ala thalikum mina al-shahideen

verses.eng: And by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."
verses.arabic: وَتَاللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصْنَامَكُمْ بَعْدَ أَنْ تُوَلُّوا مُدْبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa tallahi la-akeedanna asnamakum ba'da an tuwalloo mudbireen

verses.eng: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].
verses.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمْ جُذَاذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرًا لَهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faja'alahum juthathan illa kabeelan lahum la'allahum ilayhi yarji'oon

verses.eng: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا مَنْ فَعَلَ هَذَا بِآلِهَتِنَا إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo man fa'ala hatha bi-alihatina innahu lamina al-thalimeen

verses.eng: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا سَمِعْنَا فَتًى يَذْكُرُهُمْ يُقَالُ لَهُ إِبْرَاهِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo sami'na fatan yathkuruhum yuqalu lahu Ibrahim

verses.eng: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا فَأْتُوا بِهِ عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِ النَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū fa'tū bihi ʿalā aʿyunin nāsi laʿallahum yashhadūn

verses.eng: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"
verses.arabic: قَالُوا أَأَنتَ فَعَلْتَ هَـٰذَا بِآلِهَتِنَا يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qālū a'anta faʿalta hādhā biālihatinā yā ibrāhīm

verses.eng: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."
verses.arabic: قَالَ بَلْ فَعَلَهُ كَبِيرُهُمْ هَـٰذَا فَاسْأَلُوهُمْ إِن كَانُوا يَنطِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla bal faʿalahu kabīruhum hādhā fas'alūhum in kānū yanṭiqūn

verses.eng: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: فَرَجَعُوا إِلَىٰ أَنفُسِهِمْ فَقَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ أَنتُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Farajaʿū ilā anfusihim faqālū innakum antumu aẓ-ẓālimūn

verses.eng: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ نُكِسُوا عَلَىٰ رُءُوسِهِمْ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا هَـٰؤُلَاءِ يَنطِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma nukisū ʿalā ruʾūsihim laqad ʿalimta mā hāʾulāʾi yanṭiqūn

verses.eng: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَفَتَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَضُرُّكُمْ
verses.transliteration: Qāla afa taʿbudūna min dūni llāhi mā lā yanfaʿukum shayʾan walā yaḍurrukum

verses.eng: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"
verses.arabic: أُفٍّ لَّكُمْ وَلِمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Uffin lakum walimā taʿbudūna min dūni llāhi afalā taʿqilūn

verses.eng: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا حَرِّقُوهُ وَانصُرُوا آلِهَتَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū ḥarriqūhu wanṣurū ālihatakum in kuntum fāʿilīn

verses.eng: We [Allah] said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
verses.arabic: قُلْنَا يَا نَارُ كُونِي بَرْدًا وَسَلَامًا عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Qulnā yā nāru kūnī bardan wasalāman ʿalā ibrāhīm

verses.eng: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.
verses.arabic: وَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَخْسَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa'arādū bihi kaydan fajaʿalnāhumu al-akhsarīn

verses.eng: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا لِلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanajjaynāhu walūṭan ilā al-arḍi allatī bāraknā fīhā lilʿālamīn

verses.eng: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةً ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا صَالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wawahabnā lahu is'ḥāqa wayaʿqūba nāfilatan wakullan jaʿalnā ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَهْدُونَ بِأَمْرِنَا وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِمْ فِعْلَ الْخَيْرَاتِ وَإِقَامَ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءَ الزَّكَاةِ ۖ وَكَانُوا لَنَا عَابِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wajaʿalnāhum aʾimmatan yahdūna biʾamrinā waʾawḥaynā ilayhim fiʿla l-khayrāti waʾiqāma ṣ-ṣalāti waʾītāʾa z-zakāti wakānū lanā ʿābidīn

verses.eng: And to Lot We gave judgment and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَلُوطًا آتَيْنَاهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي كَانَت تَّعْمَلُ الْخَبَائِثَ ۗ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walūṭan ātaynāhu ḥukman waʿilman wanajjaynāhu mina l-qaryati allatī kānat taʿmalu l-khabāʾitha innahum kānū qawma sawʾin fāsiqīn

verses.eng: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَأَدْخَلْنَاهُ فِي رَحْمَتِنَا ۖ إِنَّهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waʾadkhalnāhu fī raḥmatinā innahu mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.
verses.arabic: وَنُوحًا إِذْ نَادَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wa Nūḥan idh nādā min qablu fastajabnā lahu fanajjaynāhu wa ahlahu mina al-karbi al-ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.
verses.arabic: وَنَصَرْنَاهُ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanaṣarnāhu mina al-qawmi alladhīna kadhabū biāyātinā innahum kānū qawma sawʾin fa-aghraqnāhum ajmaʿīn

verses.eng: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.
verses.arabic: وَدَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ إِذْ يَحْكُمَانِ فِي الْحَرْثِ إِذْ نَفَشَتْ فِيهِ غَنَمُ الْقَوْمِ وَكُنَّا لِحُكْمِهِمْ شَاهِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Dāwūda wa Sulaymāna idh yaḥkumāni fī al-ḥarthi idh nafashat fīhi ghanamu al-qawmi wakunnā liḥukmihim shāhidīn

verses.eng: And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].
verses.arabic: فَفَهَّمْنَاهَا سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ وَكُلًّا آتَيْنَا حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَسَخَّرْنَا مَعَ دَاوُودَ الْجِبَالَ يُسَبِّحْنَ وَالطَّيْرَ ۚ وَكُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fafahhamnāhā Sulaymāna wakullan ātaynā ḥukman wa ʿilman wasakhkharṇā maʿa Dāwūda al-jibāla yusabbiḥna wa-al-ṭayra wakunnā fāʿilīn

verses.eng: And We taught him the making of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?
verses.arabic: وَعَلَّمْنَاهُ صَنْعَةَ لَبُوسٍ لَّكُمْ لِتُحْصِنَكُم مِّن بَأْسِكُمْ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُمْ شَاكِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ʿallamnāhu ṣanʿata labūsin lakum lituḥṣinakum min baʾsikum fahal antum shākirūn

verses.eng: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَلِسُلَيْمَانَ الرِّيحَ عَاصِفَةً تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ إِلَى الْأَرْضِ الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا ۚ وَكُنَّا بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa li-Sulaymāna al-rīḥa ʿāṣifatan tajrī bi-amrihi ilā al-arḍi allatī bāraknā fīhā wakunnā bikulli shayʾin ʿālimīn

verses.eng: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ الشَّيَاطِينِ مَن يَغُوصُونَ لَهُ وَيَعْمَلُونَ عَمَلًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَكُنَّا لَهُمْ حَافِظِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina al-shayāṭīni man yaghūṣūna lahu wa yaʿmalūna ʿamalan dūna dhālika wakunnā lahum ḥāfiẓīn

verses.eng: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
verses.arabic: وَأَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Ayyūba idh nādā rabbahu annī massaniya al-ḍurru wa-anta arḥamu al-rāḥimīn

verses.eng: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah].
verses.arabic: فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ فَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِ مِن ضُرٍّ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْعَابِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fastajabnā lahu fakashafnā mā bihi min ḍurrin waātaynāhu ahlahu wamithlahum maʿahum raḥmatan min ʿindinā wadhikrā lil-ʿābidīn

verses.eng: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.
verses.arabic: وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِدْرِيسَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ كُلٌّ مِّنَ الصَّابِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Ismāʿīla wa Idrīsa wa Dhā al-Kifli kullun mina al-ṣābirīn

verses.eng: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَأَدْخَلْنَاهُمْ فِي رَحْمَتِنَا ۖ إِنَّهُم مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa adkhalnāhum fī raḥmatinā innahum mina al-ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: وَذَا النُّونِ إِذ ذَّهَبَ مُغَاضِبًا فَظَنَّ أَن لَّن نَّقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ فَنَادَىٰ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ أَن لَّا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Dhā al-Nūni idh dhahaba mughāḍiban faẓanna an lan naqdira ʿalayhi fanādā fī al-ẓulumāti an lā ilāha illā anta subḥānaka innī kuntu mina al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
verses.arabic: فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْغَمِّ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُنجِي الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fastajabnā lahu wanajjaynāhu mina al-gham wa kadhalika nunji al-muʾminīn

verses.eng: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."
verses.arabic: وَزَكَرِيَّا إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِي فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Zakariyyā idh nādā rabbahu rabbi lā tadhar-nī fardan wa-anta khayru al-wārithīn

verses.eng: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.
verses.arabic: فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ يَحْيَىٰ وَأَصْلَحْنَا لَهُ زَوْجَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا ۖ وَكَانُوا لَنَا خَاشِعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fastajabnā lahu wawahabnā lahu Yaḥyā wa-aṣlaḥnā lahu zawjahū innahum kānū yusāriʿūna fī al-khayrāti wayadʿūnanā raghaban warahaban wakānū lanā khāshiʿīn

verses.eng: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّتِىٓ أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهَا مِن رُّوحِنَا وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا وَٱبْنَهَآ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa allatī aḥṣanat farjahā fanafakhnā fīhā min rūḥinā wa jaʿalnāhā wa abnahā āyatan lilʿālamīn

verses.eng: Indeed, this religion of yours is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُونِ
verses.transliteration: Inna hādhihi ummatukum ummatan wāḥidatan wa anā rabbukum faʿbudūn

verses.eng: But they divided their affair among themselves; [yet] all are returning to Us.
verses.arabic: وَتَقَطَّعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ كُلٌّ إِلَيْنَا رَٰجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wataqaṭṭaʿū amrahum baynahum kullun ilaynā rājiʿūn

verses.eng: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - his effort will not be denied; and indeed, We will record it for him.
verses.arabic: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌۭ فَلَا كُفْرَانَ لِسَعْيِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ كَـٰتِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faman yaʿmal mina alṣṣāliḥāti wahuwa muʾminun falā kufrāna lisaʿyihi wa innā lahu kātibūn

verses.eng: And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return
verses.arabic: وَحَرَامٌ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَآ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ḥarām ʿalā qaryatin ahlaknāhā annahum lā yarjiʿūn

verses.eng: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فُتِحَتْ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ وَهُم مِّن كُلِّ حَدَبٍۢ يَنسِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā futiḥat yaʾjūju wamaʾjūju wahum min kulli ḥadabin yansilūn

verses.eng: And [when] the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], 'O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers.'
verses.arabic: وَٱقْتَرَبَ ٱلْوَعْدُ ٱلْحَقُّ فَإِذَا هِىَ شَـٰخِصَةٌ أَبْصَـٰرُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَا قَدْ كُنَّا فِى غَفْلَةٍۢ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا بَلْ كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqtaraba alwaʿdu alḥaqqu fa-idhā hiya shākhiṣatun abṣāru alladhīna kafarū yā waylanā qad kunnā fī ghaflatin min hādhā bal kunnā ẓālimīn

verses.eng: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.
verses.arabic: إِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُمْ لَهَا وَٰرِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innakum wa mā taʿbudūna min dūni Allāhi ḥaṣabu jahannama antum lahā wāridūn

verses.eng: Had these [false deities] been gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.
verses.arabic: لَوْ كَانَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ءَالِهَةًۭ مَّا وَرَدُوهَا ۖ وَكُلٌّۭ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Law kāna hāʾulāʾi ālihatan mā waradūhā wakullun fīhā khālidūn

verses.eng: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.
verses.arabic: لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌۭ وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lahum fīhā zafīrun wahum fīhā lā yasmaʿūn

verses.eng: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقَتْ لَهُم مِّنَّا ٱلْحُسْنَىٰٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَنْهَا مُبْعَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna sabaqat lahum minnā alḥusnā ulāʾika ʿanhā mubʿadūn

verses.eng: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.
verses.arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ حَسِيسَهَا ۖ وَهُمْ فِى مَا ٱشْتَهَتْ أَنفُسُهُمْ خَـٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lā yasmaʿūna ḥasīsahā wahum fī mā ishtahat anfusuhum khālidūn

verses.eng: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], 'This is your Day which you have been promised.'
verses.arabic: لَا يَحْزُنُهُمُ ٱلْفَزَعُ ٱلْأَكْبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ هَـٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lā yaḥzunuhumu alfazaʿu al-akbaru wa tatalaqqāhumu almalāʾikatu hādhā yawmukumu alladhī kuntum tūʿadūn

verses.eng: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ نَطْوِى ٱلسَّمَآءَ كَطَىِّ ٱلسِّجِلِّ لِلْكُتُبِ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأْنَآ أَوَّلَ خَلْقٍۢ نُّعِيدُهُۥ ۚ وَعْدًا عَلَيْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا فَـٰعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yawma naṭwī alssamāʾa kaṭayyi alssijilli lilkitāb kamā badaʾnā awwala khalqin nuʿīduhu waʿdan ʿalaynā innā kunnā fāʿilīn

verses.eng: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَتَبْنَا فِى ٱلزَّبُورِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ٱلذِّكْرِ أَنَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ يَرِثُهَا عِبَادِىَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad katabnā fī alzzabūri min baʿdi aldhikri anna al-arḍa yarithuhā ʿibādīya alṣṣāliḥūn

verses.eng: Indeed, in this [Quran] is notification for a worshipping people.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي هَـٰذَا لَبَلَاغًا لِّقَوْمٍ عَابِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fī hādhā labalāghan liqawmin ʿābidīna

verses.eng: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا رَحْمَةً لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā arsalnāka illā raḥmatan lil'ʿālamīna

verses.eng: Say, 'It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul innamā yūḥā ilayya annamā ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun fahal antum muslimūna

verses.eng: But if they turn away, then say, 'I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.'
verses.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُلْ ءَاذَنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَآءٍ ۖ وَإِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ أَم بَعِيدٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in tawallaw faqul ādhantukum ʿalā sawāin wa-in adrī aqarībun am baʿīdun mā tūʿadūna

verses.eng: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْتُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innahū yaʿlamu al-jahra mina al-qawli wa-yaʿlamu mā taktumūna

verses.eng: And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ أَدْرِى لَعَلَّهُۥ فِتْنَةٌ لَّكُمْ وَمَتَـٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in adrī laʿallahu fitnatun lakum wamatāʿun ilā ḥīnin

verses.eng: He said, 'My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe.'
verses.arabic: قَـٰلَ رَبِّ ٱحْكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَرَبُّنَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ٱلْمُسْتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi uḥ'kum bil-ḥaqqi wa-rabbunā al-raḥmānu al-mustaʿānu ʿalā mā taṣifūna

verses.eng: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ زَلْزَلَةَ السَّاعَةِ شَيْءٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā an-nāsu ittaqū rabbakum inna zalzala as-sāʿati shayʾun ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ تَرَوْنَهَا تَذْهَلُ كُلُّ مُرْضِعَةٍ عَمَّا أَرْضَعَتْ وَتَضَعُ كُلُّ ذَاتِ حَمْلٍ حَمْلَهَا وَتَرَى النَّاسَ سُكَارَىٰ وَمَا هُم بِسُكَارَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّ عَذَابَ اللَّهِ شَدِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Yawma tarawnahā tadh-halu kullu murḍiʿatin ʿammā arḍaʿat wa taḍaʿu kullu dhāti ḥamlin ḥamlahā wa tarā an-nāsa sukārā wa mā hum bisukārā wa lākinna ʿadhāba Allāhi shadīd

verses.eng: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يُجَادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَيَتَّبِعُ كُلَّ شَيْطَانٍ مَّرِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina an-nāsi man yujādilu fī Allāhi bighayri ʿilmin wa yattabiʿu kulla shayṭānin marīd

verses.eng: It has been decreed for every devil that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.
verses.arabic: كُتِبَ عَلَيْهِ أَنَّهُ مَن تَوَلَّاهُ فَأَنَّهُ يُضِلُّهُ وَيَهْدِيهِ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ السَّعِيرِ
verses.transliteration: Kutiba ʿalayhi annahu man tawallāhu fa-annahu yuḍilluhu wa yahdīhi ilā ʿadhābi as-saʿīr

verses.eng: O people, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in death [young], and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِن كُنتُمْ فِي رَيْبٍ مِّنَ الْبَعْثِ فَإِنَّا خَلَقْنَاكُم مِّن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ مِنْ عَلَقَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن مُّضْغَةٍ مُّخَلَّقَةٍ وَغَيْرِ مُخَلَّقَةٍ لِّنُبَيِّنَ لَكُمْ ۚ وَنُقِرُّ فِي الْأَرْحَامِ مَا نَشَاءُ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ثُمَّ نُخْرِجُكُمْ طِفْلًا ثُمَّ لِتَبْلُغُوا أَشُدَّكُمْ ۖ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُتَوَفَّىٰ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ أَرْذَلِ الْعُمُرِ لِكَيْلَا يَعْلَمَ مِن بَعْدِ عِلْمٍ شَيْئًا ۚ وَتَرَى الْأَرْضَ هَامِدَةً فَإِذَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهَا الْمَاءَ اهْتَزَّتْ وَرَبَتْ وَأَنبَتَتْ مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā an-nāsu in kuntum fī raybin mina al-baʿthi fa-innā khalaqnākum min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma min ʿalaqatin thumma min muḍghatin mukhallaqatin wa ghayri mukhallaqatin linubayyina lakum wa nuqirru fī al-arḥāmi mā nashāʾu ilā ajalin musamman thumma nukhrijukum ṭiflan thumma litablughū ashuddakum wa minkum man yutawaffā wa minkum man yuraddu ilā ardhali al-ʿumuri likaylā yaʿlama min baʿdi ʿilmin shayʾā wa tarā al-arḍa hāmidatan fa-idhā anzalnā ʿalayhā al-māʾa ih-tazzat wa rabat wa anbatat min kulli zawjin bahīj

verses.eng: That is because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْحَقُّ وَأَنَّهُ يُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ وَأَنَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika bi-anna Allāha huwa al-ḥaqqu wa annahu yuḥyī al-mawtā wa annahu ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīr

verses.eng: And that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.
verses.arabic: وَأَنَّ السَّاعَةَ آتِيَةٌ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهَا وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبْعَثُ مَن فِي الْقُبُورِ
verses.transliteration: Wa anna as-sāʿata ātiyatun lā rayba fīhā wa anna Allāha yabʿathu man fī al-qubūr

verses.eng: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him],
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يُجَادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَلَا هُدًى وَلَا كِتَابٍ مُّنِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina an-nāsi man yujādilu fī Allāhi bighayri ʿilmin wa lā hudan wa lā kitābin munīr

verses.eng: Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allah. For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire.
verses.arabic: ثَانِيَ عِطْفِهِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ لَهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا خِزْيٌ ۖ وَنُذِيقُهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ عَذَابَ الْحَرِيقِ
verses.transliteration: Thāniya ʿiṭfihi liyuḍilla ʿan sabīli Allāhi lahu fī ad-dunyā khizyun wa nudhīquhu yawma al-qiyāmati ʿadhāba al-ḥarīq

verses.eng: That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allah is not ever unjust to [His] servants.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاكَ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَيْسَ بِظَلَّامٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika bimā qaddamat yadāka wa anna Allāha laysa biẓallāmin lil-ʿabīd

verses.eng: And of the people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to the other direction]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يَعْبُدُ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ حَرْفٍ ۖ فَإِنْ أَصَابَهُ خَيْرٌ اطْمَأَنَّ بِهِ ۖ وَإِنْ أَصَابَتْهُ فِتْنَةٌ انقَلَبَ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ خَسِرَ الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْخُسْرَانُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina an-nāsi man yaʿbudu Allāha ʿalā ḥarfin fa-in aṣābahu khayrun iṭmaʾanna bihi wa in aṣābathu fitnatun inqalaba ʿalā wajhihi khasira ad-dunyā wa al-ākhirah dhālika huwa al-khus'rānu al-mubīn

verses.eng: He invokes instead of Allah that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.
verses.arabic: يَدْعُو مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَضُرُّهُ وَمَا لَا يَنفَعُهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الضَّلَالُ الْبَعِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Yadʿū min dūni Allāhi mā lā yaḍurruhu wa mā lā yanfaʿuh dhālika huwa aḍ-ḍalālu al-baʿīd

verses.eng: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.
verses.arabic: يَدْعُو لَمَن ضَرُّهُ أَقْرَبُ مِن نَّفْعِهِ ۚ لَبِئْسَ الْمَوْلَىٰ وَلَبِئْسَ الْعَشِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Yadʿū liman ḍarruhu aqrabu min nafʿihi labiʾsa al-mawlā wa labiʾsa al-ʿashīr

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدْخِلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفْعَلُ مَا يُرِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allāha yudkhilu alladhīna āmanū wa ʿamilū aṣ-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā al-anhār inna Allāha yafʿalu mā yurīd

verses.eng: Whoever should think that Allah will not support [Prophet Muhammad] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?
verses.arabic: مَن كَانَ يَظُنُّ أَن لَّن يَنصُرَهُ اللَّهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ بِسَبَبٍ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ ثُمَّ لْيَقْطَعْ فَلْيَنظُرْ هَلْ يُذْهِبَنَّ كَيْدُهُ مَا يَغِيظُ
verses.transliteration: Man kāna yaẓunnu an lan yanṣurahu Allāhu fī ad-dunyā wa al-ākhirati falyamdud bisababin ilā as-samāʾi thumma lyaqṭaʿ falyanẓur hal yudh'hibanna kayduhu mā yaghīẓ

verses.eng: And thus have We sent it down as clear verses, and indeed, Allah guides whom He intends.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَاهُ آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَهْدِي مَن يُرِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhalika anzalnahu ayatin bayyinatin wa anna Allaha yahdi man yureed

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, over all things, Witness.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَالَّذِينَ هَادُوا وَالصَّابِئِينَ وَالنَّصَارَىٰ وَالْمَجُوسَ وَالَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina amanu walladhina hadu wassabi'ina wannasara walmajusa walladhina ashraku inna Allaha yafsilu baynahum yawma alqiyamati inna Allaha 'ala kulli shay'in shaheed

verses.eng: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَسْجُدُ لَهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ وَالشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ وَالنُّجُومُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَالشَّجَرُ وَالدَّوَابُّ وَكَثِيرٌ مِّنَ النَّاسِ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ الْعَذَابُ ۗ وَمَن يُهِنِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِن مُّكْرِمٍ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفْعَلُ مَا يَشَاءُ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allaha yasjudu lahu man fi assamawati wa man fi al'ardi washshamsu walqamaru wannujoomu waljibalu washshajaru waddawabbu wa katheerun min annasi wa katheerun haqqa 'alayhi al'adhabu wa man yuhini Allahu fama lahu min mukrimin inna Allaha yaf'alu ma yasha'

verses.eng: These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water
verses.arabic: هَٰذَانِ خَصْمَانِ اخْتَصَمُوا فِي رَبِّهِمْ ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا قُطِّعَتْ لَهُمْ ثِيَابٌ مِّن نَّارٍ يُصَبُّ مِن فَوْقِ رُءُوسِهِمُ الْحَمِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Hathani khasmani ikhtasamu fee rabbihim falladhina kafaru qutti'at lahum thiyabun min narin yusabbu min fawqi ru'oosihimu alhameem

verses.eng: By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.
verses.arabic: يُصْهَرُ بِهِ مَا فِي بُطُونِهِمْ وَالْجُلُودُ
verses.transliteration: Yus'haru bihi ma fee butoonihim waljulood

verses.eng: And for [striking] them are maces of iron.
verses.arabic: وَلَهُم مَّقَامِعُ مِنْ حَدِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa lahum maqami'u min hadeed

verses.eng: Every time they want to get out of it from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"
verses.arabic: كُلَّمَا أَرَادُوا أَن يَخْرُجُوا مِنْهَا مِنْ غَمٍّ أُعِيدُوا فِيهَا وَذُوقُوا عَذَابَ الْحَرِيقِ
verses.transliteration: Kullama aradoo an yakhrujoo minha min ghammin u'eedoo feeha wa thooqoo 'adhaba alhareeq

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدْخِلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَلُؤْلُؤًا ۖ وَلِبَاسُهُمْ فِيهَا حَرِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allaha yudkhilu alladhina amanu wa 'amilu assalihati jannatin tajree min tahtiha al'anharu yuhallawna feeha min asawira min thahabin wa lu'lu'an wa libasuhum feeha hareer

verses.eng: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.
verses.arabic: وَهُدُوا إِلَى الطَّيِّبِ مِنَ الْقَوْلِ وَهُدُوا إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْحَمِيدِ
verses.transliteration: Wa hudoo ila attayyibi min alqawli wa hudoo ila sirati alhameed

verses.eng: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَالْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ الَّذِي جَعَلْنَاهُ لِلنَّاسِ سَوَاءً الْعَاكِفُ فِيهِ وَالْبَادِ ۚ وَمَن يُرِدْ فِيهِ بِإِلْحَادٍ بِظُلْمٍ نُّذِقْهُ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhina kafaroo wa yasuddoona 'an sabeeli Allahi walmasjidi alharami allathee ja'annahu linnasi sawaan al'akifu feehi walbadi wa man yurid feehi bi'ilhadin bithulmin nudhiqhu min 'adhabin aleem

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ بَوَّأْنَا لِإِبْرَاهِيمَ مَكَانَ الْبَيْتِ أَن لَّا تُشْرِكْ بِي شَيْئًا وَطَهِّرْ بَيْتِيَ لِلطَّائِفِينَ وَالْقَائِمِينَ وَالرُّكَّعِ السُّجُودِ
verses.transliteration: Wa ith bawwa'na li'ibraheema makana albayti an la tushrik bee shay'an wa tahhir baytiya litta'ifeena walqa'imeena warrukka'i assujood

verses.eng: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -
verses.arabic: وَأَذِّن فِي النَّاسِ بِالْحَجِّ يَأْتُوكَ رِجَالًا وَعَلَىٰ كُلِّ ضَامِرٍ يَأْتِينَ مِن كُلِّ فَجٍّ عَمِيقٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa aththin fi annasi bilhajji ya'tooka rijalan wa 'ala kulli damirin ya'teena min kulli fajjin 'ameeq

verses.eng: That they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.
verses.arabic: لِّيَشْهَدُوا مَنَافِعَ لَهُمْ وَيَذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ فِي أَيَّامٍ مَّعْلُومَاتٍ عَلَىٰ مَا رَزَقَهُم مِّن بَهِيمَةِ الْأَنْعَامِ ۖ فَكُلُوا مِنْهَا وَأَطْعِمُوا الْبَائِسَ الْفَقِيرَ
verses.transliteration: Li yashhadoo manafi'a lahum wa yathkuroo isma Allahi fi ayyamin ma'lumatin 'ala ma razaqahum min baheemati al'an'ami fakuloo minha wa at'imoo alba'isa alfaqeer

verses.eng: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform Tawaf around the ancient House.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ وَلْيُوفُوا نُذُورَهُمْ وَلْيَطَّوَّفُوا بِالْبَيْتِ الْعَتِيقِ
verses.transliteration: Thumma lyuqdoo tafathahum wa lyufoo nudhoorahum walyattawwafoo bilbayti al'ateeq

verses.eng: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّمْ حُرُمَاتِ اللَّهِ فَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ ۗ وَأُحِلَّتْ لَكُمُ الْأَنْعَامُ إِلَّا مَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاجْتَنِبُوا الرِّجْسَ مِنَ الْأَوْثَانِ وَاجْتَنِبُوا قَوْلَ الزُّورِ
verses.transliteration: Thalika wa man yu'aththim hurumati Allahi fahuwa khayrun lahu 'inda rabbihi wa uhillat lakumu al'an'amu illa ma yutla 'alaykum fajtaniboo arrijsa min alawthani wajtaniboo qawla azzoor

verses.eng: Being true to Allah, not associating anything with Him. And whoever associates others with Allah - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.
verses.arabic: حُنَفَاءَ لِلَّهِ غَيْرَ مُشْرِكِينَ بِهِ ۚ وَمَن يُشْرِكْ بِاللَّهِ فَكَأَنَّمَا خَرَّ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ فَتَخْطَفُهُ الطَّيْرُ أَوْ تَهْوِي بِهِ الرِّيحُ فِي مَكَانٍ سَحِيقٍ
verses.transliteration: Ḥunafā'a lillāhi ghayra mushrikīna bih; wa man yushrik billāhi fa-ka-annamā kharra mina s-samā'i fa-takhtaful-hu �-ṭayru aw tahwī bihi r-rīḥu fī makānin saḥīq

verses.eng: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّمْ شَعَائِرَ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّهَا مِنْ تَقْوَى الْقُلُوبِ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika wa man yu'aẓẓim sha'ā'ira llāhi fa-innahā min taqwā l-qulūb

verses.eng: For you the animals marked for sacrifice are benefits for a specified term; then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.
verses.arabic: لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ثُمَّ مَحِلُّهَا إِلَى الْبَيْتِ الْعَتِيقِ
verses.transliteration: Lakum fīhā manāfi'u ilā ajalin musammā thumma maḥilluhā ilā l-bayti l-'atīq

verses.eng: And for every religion We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muhammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord].
verses.arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ جَعَلْنَا مَنْسَكًا لِيَذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ عَلَىٰ مَا رَزَقَهُمْ مِنْ بَهِيمَةِ الْأَنْعَامِ ۗ فَإِلَٰهُكُمْ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ فَلَهُ أَسْلِمُوا ۗ وَبَشِّرِ الْمُخْبِتِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa li-kulli ummatin ja'alnā mansakan li-yadhkuru sma llāhi 'alā mā razaqahum min bahīmati l-an'ām; fa-ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun fa-lahu aslimū; wa bashshiri l-mukhbitīn

verses.eng: Those whose hearts are filled with fear when Allah is mentioned, and who patiently endure whatever may befall them, and who establish prayer and who spend from what We have provided for them.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَجِلَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَالصَّابِرِينَ عَلَىٰ مَا أَصَابَهُمْ وَالْمُقِيمِي الصَّلَاةِ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ يُنْفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna idhā dhukira llāhu wajilat qulūbuhum wa ṣ-ṣābirīna 'alā mā aṣābahum wa l-muqīmī ṣ-ṣalāti wa mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūn

verses.eng: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols of Allah; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allah upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.
verses.arabic: وَالْبُدْنَ جَعَلْنَاهَا لَكُمْ مِنْ شَعَائِرِ اللَّهِ لَكُمْ فِيهَا خَيْرٌ ۖ فَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهَا صَوَافَّ ۖ فَإِذَا وَجَبَتْ جُنُوبُهَا فَكُلُوا مِنْهَا وَأَطْعِمُوا الْقَانِعَ وَالْمُعْتَرَّ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ سَخَّرْنَاهَا لَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa l-budna ja'alnāhā lakum min sha'ā'iri llāhi lakum fīhā khayr; fa-dhkurū sma llāhi 'alayhā ṣawwāff; fa-idhā wajabat junūbuhā fa-kulū minhā wa aṭ'imū l-qāni'a wa l-mu'tarr; kadhālika sakhkharnāhā lakum la'allakum tashkurūn

verses.eng: Their meat will not reach Allah, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.
verses.arabic: لَنْ يَنَالَ اللَّهَ لُحُومُهَا وَلَا دِمَاؤُهَا وَلَٰكِنْ يَنَالُهُ التَّقْوَىٰ مِنْكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ سَخَّرَهَا لَكُمْ لِتُكَبِّرُوا اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ مَا هَدَاكُمْ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Lan yanāla llāha luḥūmuhā wa lā dimā'uhā wa lākin yanāluhu t-taqwā minkum; kadhālika sakhkharahā lakum li-tukabbirū llāha 'alā mā hadākum; wa bashshiri l-muḥsinīn

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدَافِعُ عَنِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ خَوَّانٍ كَفُورٍ
verses.transliteration: Inna llāha yudāfi'u 'ani lladhīna āmanū; inna llāha lā yuḥibbu kulla khawwānin kafūr

verses.eng: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.
verses.arabic: أُذِنَ لِلَّذِينَ يُقَاتَلُونَ بِأَنَّهُمْ ظُلِمُوا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ نَصْرِهِمْ لَقَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Udhina li-lladhīna yuqātalūna bi-annahum ẓulimū; wa inna llāha 'alā naṣrihim la-qadīr

verses.eng: Those who have been evicted from their homes without right - only because they say, 'Our Lord is Allah.' And were it not that Allah checks the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allah is much mentioned. And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ أُخْرِجُوا مِنْ دِيَارِهِمْ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ إِلَّا أَنْ يَقُولُوا رَبُّنَا اللَّهُ ۗ وَلَوْلَا دَفْعُ اللَّهِ النَّاسَ بَعْضَهُمْ بِبَعْضٍ لَهُدِّمَتْ صَوَامِعُ وَبِيَعٌ وَصَلَوَاتٌ وَمَسَاجِدُ يُذْكَرُ فِيهَا اسْمُ اللَّهِ كَثِيرًا ۗ وَلَيَنْصُرَنَّ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَنْصُرُهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَقَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٌ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna ukhrijū min diyārihim bi-ghayri ḥaqqin illā an yaqūlū rabbunā llāh; wa lawlā daf'u llāhi n-nāsa ba'ḍahum bi-ba'ḍin la-huddimat ṣawāmi'u wa biya'un wa ṣalawātun wa masājidu yudhkaru fīhā smu llāhi kathīrā; wa la-yanṣuranna llāhu man yanṣuruh; inna llāha la-qawiyyun 'azīz

verses.eng: Those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of [all] matters.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ إِنْ مَكَّنَّاهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتَوُا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَمَرُوا بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَنَهَوْا عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ عَاقِبَةُ الْأُمُورِ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna in makkannāhum fi l-arḍi aqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa ātawu z-zakāta wa amarū bi-l-ma'rūfi wa nahaw 'ani l-munkar; wa li-llāhi 'āqibatu l-umūr

verses.eng: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - already before them the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud denied,
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَثَمُودُ
verses.transliteration: Wa in yukadhdhibūka fa-qad kadhdhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin wa 'ādun wa thamūd

verses.eng: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot
verses.arabic: وَقَوْمُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa qawmu ibrāhīma wa qawmu lūṭ

verses.eng: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
verses.arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ مَدْيَنَ ۖ وَكُذِّبَ مُوسَىٰ فَأَمْلَيْتُ لِلْكَافِرِينَ ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
verses.transliteration: Wa aṣḥābu madyana wa kudhdhiba mūsā fa-amlaytu li-l-kāfirīna thumma akhadhtuhum; fa-kayfa kāna nakīr

verses.eng: And how many a city have We destroyed while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin - and [how many] a deserted well and [how many] a lofty palace!
verses.arabic: فَكَأَيِّنْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا وَهِيَ ظَالِمَةٌ فَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَبِئْرٍ مُعَطَّلَةٍ وَقَصْرٍ مَشِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Fa-ka-ayyin min qaryatin ahlaknāhā wa hiya ẓālimatun fa-hiya khāwiyatun 'alā 'urūshihā wa bi'rin mu'aṭṭalatin wa qaṣrin mashīd

verses.eng: Have they not traveled through the land, and have they hearts wherewith to understand and ears wherewith to hear? Verily, it is not the eyes that grow blind, but it is the hearts which are in the breasts that grow blind.
verses.arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَتَكُونَ لَهُمْ قُلُوبٌ يَعْقِلُونَ بِهَا أَوْ آذَانٌ يَسْمَعُونَ بِهَا ۖ فَإِنَّهَا لَا تَعْمَى الْأَبْصَارُ وَلَٰكِن تَعْمَى الْقُلُوبُ الَّتِي فِي الصُّدُورِ
verses.transliteration: Afalam yaseeroo fee al-ardi fatakoona lahum quloobun yaʿqiloona biha aw athanun yasmaʿoona biha fa-innaha la taʿma al-absaru walakin taʿma al-quloobu allatee fee al-sudoor

verses.eng: And they ask you to hasten the punishment. But Allah will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.
verses.arabic: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِالْعَذَابِ وَلَن يُخْلِفَ اللَّهُ وَعْدَهُ ۚ وَإِنَّ يَوْمًا عِندَ رَبِّكَ كَأَلْفِ سَنَةٍ مِّمَّا تَعُدُّونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayastaʿjiloonaka bialʿathabi walan yukhlifa Allahu waʿdahu wa-inna yawman ʿinda rabbika ka-alfi sanatin mimma taʿuddoon

verses.eng: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.
verses.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَمْلَيْتُ لَهَا وَهِيَ ظَالِمَةٌ ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهَا وَإِلَيَّ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Waka-ayyin min qaryatin amlaytu laha wahiya thalimatun thumma akhathtuha wa-ilayya almaseer

verses.eng: Say, "O people, I am only to you a clear warner."
verses.arabic: قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنَّمَا أَنَا لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Qul ya ayyuha alnnasu innama ana lakum natheerun mubeen

verses.eng: So those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.
verses.arabic: فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Faallatheena amanoo waʿamiloo alssalihati lahum maghfiratun warizqun kareem

verses.eng: But those who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure - those are the companions of Hellfire.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ سَعَوْا فِي آيَاتِنَا مُعَاجِزِينَ أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Waallatheena saʿaw fee ayatina muʿajizeena ola-ika as-habu aljaheem

verses.eng: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allah abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allah makes precise His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رَّسُولٍ وَلَا نَبِيٍّ إِلَّا إِذَا تَمَنَّىٰ أَلْقَى الشَّيْطَانُ فِي أُمْنِيَّتِهِ فَيَنسَخُ اللَّهُ مَا يُلْقِي الشَّيْطَانُ ثُمَّ يُحْكِمُ اللَّهُ آيَاتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wama arsalna min qablika min rasoolin wala nabiyyin illa itha tamanna alqa alshshaytanu fee umniyyatihi fayansakhu Allahu ma yulqee alshshaytanu thumma yuhkimu Allahu ayatihi waAllahu ʿaleemun hakeem

verses.eng: [Allah] may make what Satan throws in a trial for those within whose hearts is disease and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.
verses.arabic: لِّيَجْعَلَ مَا يُلْقِي الشَّيْطَانُ فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَالْقَاسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَإِنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ لَفِي شِقَاقٍ بَعِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Liyajʿala ma yulqee alshshaytanu fitnatan lillatheena fee quloobihim maradun waalqasiyati quloobuhum wa-inna alththalimeena lafee shiqaqin baʿeed

verses.eng: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allah the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.
verses.arabic: وَلِيَعْلَمَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ أَنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَيُؤْمِنُوا بِهِ فَتُخْبِتَ لَهُ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهَادِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Waliyaʿlama allatheena ootoo alʿilma annahu alhaqqu min rabbika fayu/minoo bihi fatukhbeta lahu quloobuhum wa-inna Allaha lahadi allatheena amanoo ila siratin mustaqeem

verses.eng: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يَزَالُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي مِرْيَةٍ مِّنْهُ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ السَّاعَةُ بَغْتَةً أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wala yazalu allatheena kafaroo fee miryatin minhu hatta ta/tiyahumu alssaʿatu baghtatan aw ya/tiyahum ʿathabu yawmin ʿaqeem

verses.eng: Sovereignty that Day is for Allah; He will judge between them. So they who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.
verses.arabic: الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلَّهِ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Almulku yawma-ithin lillahi yahkumu baynahum faallatheena amanoo waʿamiloo alssalihati fee jannati alnnaʿeem

verses.eng: And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those will be a humiliating punishment.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُّهِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Waallatheena kafaroo wakaththaboo bi-ayatina faola-ika lahum ʿathabun muheen

verses.eng: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ قُتِلُوا أَوْ مَاتُوا لَيَرْزُقَنَّهُمُ اللَّهُ رِزْقًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waallatheena hajaroo fee sabeeli Allahi thumma qutiloo aw matoo layarzuqannahumu Allahu rizqan hasanan wa-inna Allaha lahuwa khayru alrraziqeen

verses.eng: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
verses.arabic: لَيُدْخِلَنَّهُم مُّدْخَلًا يَرْضَوْنَهُ ۗ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَلِيمٌ حَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Layudkhilannahum mudkhalan yardawnahu wa-inna Allaha laʿaleemun haleem

verses.eng: That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ وَمَنْ عَاقَبَ بِمِثْلِ مَا عُوقِبَ بِهِ ثُمَّ بُغِيَ عَلَيْهِ لَيَنصُرَنَّهُ اللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٌ
verses.transliteration: Thalika waman ʿaqaba bimithli ma ʿooqiba bihi thumma bughiya ʿalayhi layansurannahu Allahu inna Allaha laʿafuwwun ghafoor

verses.eng: That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ بَصِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika bi-anna Allāha yūliju al-layla fī al-nahāri wayūliju al-nahāra fī al-layli wa-anna Allāha samīʿun baṣīr

verses.eng: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِهِ هُوَ الْبَاطِلُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْكَبِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika bi-anna Allāha huwa al-ḥaqqu wa-anna mā yadʿūna min dūnihi huwa al-bāṭilu wa-anna Allāha huwa al-ʿaliyyu al-kabīr

verses.eng: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنْزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَتُصْبِحُ الْأَرْضُ مُخْضَرَّةً إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَطِيفٌ خَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allāha anzala mina al-samāʾi māʾan fa-tuṣbiḥu al-arḍu mukhḍarrah inna Allāha laṭīfun khabīr

verses.eng: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
verses.arabic: لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Lahu mā fī al-samāwāti wa-mā fī al-arḍi wa-inna Allāha lahuwa al-ghaniyyu al-ḥamīd

verses.eng: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُمْ مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَالْفُلْكَ تَجْرِي فِي الْبَحْرِ بِأَمْرِهِ وَيُمْسِكُ السَّمَاءَ أَنْ تَقَعَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِالنَّاسِ لَرَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allāha sakhkhara lakum mā fī al-arḍi wa-al-fulka tajrī fī al-baḥri bi-amrihi wayumsiku al-samāʾa an taqaʿa ʿalā al-arḍi illā bi-idhnih inna Allāha bi-al-nāsi la-raʾūfun raḥīm

verses.eng: And it is He who gave you life, then He will cause you to die, then He will give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَحْيَاكُمْ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لَكَفُورٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-huwa alladhī aḥyākum thumma yumītukum thumma yuḥyīkum inna al-insāna la-kafūr

verses.eng: For every religion We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muhammad], let them not contend with you over the matter but invite them to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.
verses.arabic: لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ جَعَلْنَا مَنْسَكًا هُمْ نَاسِكُوهُ فَلَا يُنَازِعُنَّكَ فِي الْأَمْرِ وَادْعُ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ إِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ هُدًى مُسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Likulli ummatin jaʿalnā mansakan hum nāsikūhu falā yunāziʿunnaka fī al-amri wa-udʿu ilā rabbika innaka la-ʿalā hudan mustaqīm

verses.eng: And if they dispute with you, say, "Allah is most knowing of what you do."
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ جَادَلُوكَ فَقُلِ اللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in jādalūka faquli Allāhu aʿlamu bi-mā taʿmalūn

verses.eng: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ فِيمَا كُنْتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu yaḥkumu baynakum yawma al-qiyāmati fīmā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

verses.eng: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَعْلَمْ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ فِي كِتَابٍ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Alam taʿlam anna Allāha yaʿlamu mā fī al-samāʾi wa-al-arḍi inna dhālika fī kitābin inna dhālika ʿalā Allāhi yasīr

verses.eng: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.
verses.arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِ سُلْطَانًا وَمَا لَيْسَ لَهُمْ بِهِ عِلْمٌ وَمَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِنْ نَصِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa-yaʿbudūna min dūni Allāhi mā lam yunazzil bihi sul'ṭānan wa-mā laysa lahum bihi ʿil'mun wa-mā li-al-ẓālimīna min naṣīr

verses.eng: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتُنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ تَعْرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا الْمُنْكَرَ يَكَادُونَ يَسْطُونَ بِالَّذِينَ يَتْلُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا قُلْ أَفَأُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِشَرٍّ مِنْ ذَٰلِكُمُ النَّارُ وَعَدَهَا اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā tutlā ʿalayhim āyātunā bayyinātin taʿrifu fī wujūhi alladhīna kafarū al-munkara yakādūna yasṭūna bi-alladhīna yatlūna ʿalayhim āyātinā qul a-fa-unabbiʾukum bi-sharrin min dhālikumu al-nāru waʿadahā Allāhu alladhīna kafarū wa-biʾsa al-maṣīr

verses.eng: O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ ضُرِبَ مَثَلٌ فَاسْتَمِعُوا لَهُ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ لَنْ يَخْلُقُوا ذُبَابًا وَلَوِ اجْتَمَعُوا لَهُ وَإِنْ يَسْلُبْهُمُ الذُّبَابُ شَيْئًا لَا يَسْتَنْقِذُوهُ مِنْهُ ضَعُفَ الطَّالِبُ وَالْمَطْلُوبُ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā al-nāsu ḍuriba mathalun fa-is'tamiʿū lahu inna alladhīna tadʿūna min dūni Allāhi lan yakhluqū dhubāban wa-lawi ijtamaʿū lahu wa-in yaslub'humu al-dhubābu shayʾan lā yastanqidhūhu minhu ḍaʿufa al-ṭālibu wa-al-maṭlūb

verses.eng: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
verses.arabic: مَا قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدْرِهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَقَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٌ
verses.transliteration: Mā qadarū Allāha ḥaqqa qadrihi inna Allāha la-qawiyyun ʿazīz

verses.eng: Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ يَصْطَفِي مِنَ الْمَلَائِكَةِ رُسُلًا وَمِنَ النَّاسِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ بَصِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu yaṣṭafī mina al-malāʾikati rusulan wa-mina al-nāsi inna Allāha samīʿun baṣīr

verses.eng: He knows what is before them and what will be after them. And to Allah will all matters be returned.
verses.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ الْأُمُورُ
verses.transliteration: Ya'lamu mā bayna aydīhim wa mā khalfahum wa ilā Allāhi turja'u al-umūr

verses.eng: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good that you may succeed.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ارْكَعُوا وَاسْجُدُوا وَاعْبُدُوا رَبَّكُمْ وَافْعَلُوا الْخَيْرَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū irka'ū wa usjudū wa u'budū rabbakum wa if'alū al-khayra la'allakum tufliḥūn

verses.eng: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. It is the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you 'Muslims' before and in this [Quran] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.
verses.arabic: وَجَاهِدُوا فِي اللَّهِ حَقَّ جِهَادِهِ هُوَ اجْتَبَاكُمْ وَمَا جَعَلَ عَلَيْكُمْ فِي الدِّينِ مِنْ حَرَجٍ مِلَّةَ أَبِيكُمْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ هُوَ سَمَّاكُمُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ مِنْ قَبْلُ وَفِي هَذَا لِيَكُونَ الرَّسُولُ شَهِيدًا عَلَيْكُمْ وَتَكُونُوا شُهَدَاءَ عَلَى النَّاسِ فَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَاعْتَصِمُوا بِاللَّهِ هُوَ مَوْلَاكُمْ فَنِعْمَ الْمَوْلَى وَنِعْمَ النَّصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa jāhidū fī Allāhi ḥaqqa jihādihi huwa ijtabākum wa mā ja'ala 'alaykum fī ad-dīni min ḥarajin millata abīkum Ibrāhīma huwa sammākumu al-muslimīna min qablu wa fī hādhā liyakūna ar-rasūlu shahīdan 'alaykum wa takūnū shuhadā'a 'alā an-nāsi fa aqīmū aṣ-ṣalāta wa ātū az-zakāta wa i'taṣimū billāhi huwa mawlākum fa ni'ma al-mawlā wa ni'ma an-naṣīr

verses.eng: Certainly will the believers have succeeded.
verses.arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qad aflaḥa al-mu'minūn

verses.eng: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي صَلَاتِهِمْ خَاشِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna hum fī ṣalātihim khāshiʿūn

verses.eng: And they who turn away from ill speech.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنِ اللَّغْوِ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna hum ʿani al-laghwi muʿriḍūn

verses.eng: And they who are observant of zakah.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِلزَّكَاةِ فَاعِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna hum lilzzakāti fāʿilūn

verses.eng: And they who guard their private parts.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna hum lifurūjihim ḥāfiẓūn

verses.eng: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā ʿalā azwājihim aw mā malakat aymānuhum fa'innahum ghayru malūmīn

verses.eng: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors.
verses.arabic: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ
verses.transliteration: Famani ibtaghā warā'a dhālika fa'ulā'ika humu al-ʿādūn

verses.eng: And they who are to their trusts and promises attentive.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna hum li'amānātihim wa ʿahdihim rāʿūn

verses.eng: And they who carefully maintain their prayers.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَوَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna hum ʿalā ṣalawātihim yuḥāfiẓūn

verses.eng: Those are the inheritors.
verses.arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْوَارِثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ulā'ika humu al-wārithūn

verses.eng: Who will inherit al-Firdaus. They will abide therein eternally.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ الْفِرْدَوْسَ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yarithūna al-firdawsa hum fīhā khālidūn

verses.eng: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ سُلَالَةٍ مِنْ طِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad khalaqnā al-insāna min sulālatin min ṭīnin

verses.eng: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَاهُ نُطْفَةً فِي قَرَارٍ مَكِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Thumma jaʿalnāhu nuṭfatan fī qarārin makīnin

verses.eng: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ خَلَقْنَا النُّطْفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْعَلَقَةَ مُضْغَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْمُضْغَةَ عِظَامًا فَكَسَوْنَا الْعِظَامَ لَحْمًا ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَاهُ خَلْقًا آخَرَ ۚ فَتَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma khalaqnā al-nuṭfata ʿalaqatan fakhalaqnā al-ʿalaqata muḍghatan fakhalaqnā al-muḍghata ʿiẓāman fakasawnā al-ʿiẓāma laḥman thumma ansha'nāhu khalqan ākhara fatabāraka Allāhu aḥsanu al-khāliqīn

verses.eng: Then indeed, after that you are to die.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma innakum baʿda dhālika lamayyitūn

verses.eng: Then indeed, on the Day of Resurrection you will be resurrected.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ تُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma innakum yawma al-qiyamati tub'athoon

verses.eng: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعَ طَرَآئِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ ٱلْخَلْقِ غَـٰفِلِينَ
