verses.transliteration: Walaqad khalaqna fawqakum sab'a tara-iqa wama kunna 'ani alkhalqi ghafileen

verses.eng: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.
verses.arabic: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۢ بِقَدَرٍۢ فَأَسْكَنَّـٰهُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ ذَهَابٍۭ بِهِۦ لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waanzalna mina alssama-i maan biqadarin faaskannahu fee al-ardi wa-inna 'ala thahabin bihi laqadiroon

verses.eng: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.
verses.arabic: فَأَنشَأْنَا لَكُم بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ مِّن نَّخِيلٍۢ وَأَعْنَـٰبٍۢ لَّكُمْ فِيهَا فَوَٰكِهُ كَثِيرَةٌۭ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faansha/na lakum bihi jannatin min nakheelin waa'nabin lakum feeha fawakihatun katheeratun waminha ta/kuloon

verses.eng: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food for those who eat.
verses.arabic: وَشَجَرَةًۭ تَخْرُجُ مِن طُورِ سَيْنَآءَ تَنۢبُتُ بِٱلدُّهْنِ وَصِبْغٍۢ لِّلْـَٔاكِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Washajaratan takhruju min toori saynaa tanbutu bialddhuni wasibghin lil-akileen

verses.eng: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ لَعِبْرَةًۭ ۖ نُّسْقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِى بُطُونِهَا وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ كَثِيرَةٌۭ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna lakum fee al-an'ami la'ibratan nusqeekum mimma fee butooniha walakum feeha manafi'u katheeratun waminha ta/kuloon

verses.eng: And upon them and on ships you are carried.
verses.arabic: وَعَلَيْهَا وَعَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ تُحْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa'alayha wa'ala alfulki tuhmaloon

verses.eng: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?'
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalna noohan ila qawmihi faqala ya qawmi o'budoo Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghayruhu afala tattaqoon

verses.eng: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, 'This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allah had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.
verses.arabic: فَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُرِيدُ أَن يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَنزَلَ مَلَـٰٓئِكَةًۭ مَّا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِىٓ ءَابَآئِنَا ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faqala almalao allatheena kafaroo min qawmihi ma hatha illa basharun mithlukum yureedu an yatafaddala 'alaykum walaw shaa Allahu laanzala mala-ikatan ma sami'na bihatha fee aba-ina al-awwaleen

verses.eng: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time.'
verses.arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌۢ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۭ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍۢ
verses.transliteration: In huwa illa rajulun bihi jinnatun fatarabbasoo bihi hatta heen

verses.eng: [Noah] said, 'My Lord, support me because they have denied me.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi onsurnee bima kaththaboon

verses.eng: So We inspired to him, 'Construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows, put into it from each [creature] two mates and your family, except those for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.'
verses.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ أَنِ ٱصْنَعِ ٱلْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ ۙ فَٱسْلُكْ فِيهَا مِن كُلٍّۢ زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَوْلُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُخَـٰطِبْنِى فِى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّهُم مُّغْرَقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faawhayna ilayhi ani isna'i alfulka bi-a'yunina wawahyina fa-itha jaa amruna wafara alttannooru faosluk feeha min kullin zawjayni ithnayni waahlaka illa man sabaqa 'alayhi alqawlu minhum wala tukhatibnee fee allatheena thalamoo innahum mughraqoon

verses.eng: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allah who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱسْتَوَيْتَ أَنتَ وَمَن مَّعَكَ عَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ فَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى نَجَّىٰنَا مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-itha istawayta anta waman ma'aka 'ala alfulki faquli alhamdu lillahi allathee najjana mina alqawmi alththalimeen

verses.eng: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].'
verses.arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَنزِلْنِى مُنزَلًۭا مُّبَارَكًۭا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْمُنزِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqul rabbi anzilnee munzalan mubarakan waanta khayru almunzileen

verses.eng: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ وَإِن كُنَّا لَمُبْتَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatin wa-in kunna lamubtaleen

verses.eng: Then We raised after them another generation.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَا مِن بَعْدِهِمْ قَرْنًا آخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ansha'nā min baʿdihim qarnan ākharīn

verses.eng: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], 'Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?'
verses.arabic: فَأَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ رَسُولًا مِّنْهُمْ أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-arsalnā fīhim rasūlan minhum ani uʿbudū Allāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruhu afalā tattaqūn

verses.eng: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, 'This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِهِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِلِقَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ وَأَتْرَفْنَاهُمْ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا مَا هَـٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يَأْكُلُ مِمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ مِنْهُ وَيَشْرَبُ مِمَّا تَشْرَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla al-mala-u min qawmihi alladhīna kafarū wa kadhdhabū biliqā'i al-ākhirati wa atrafnāhum fī al-ḥayati al-dunyā mā hādhā illā basharun mithlukum ya'kulu mimmā ta'kulūna minhu wa yashrabu mimmā tashrabūn

verses.eng: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَطَعْتُم بَشَرًا مِّثْلَكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّخَاسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la-in aṭaʿtum basharan mithlakum innakum idhan lakhāsirūn

verses.eng: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?
verses.arabic: أَيَعِدُكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ إِذَا مِتُّمْ وَكُنتُمْ تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَنَّكُم مُّخْرَجُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ayaʿidukum annakum idhā mittum wa kuntum turāban wa ʿiẓāman annakum mukhrajūn

verses.eng: How far, how far is that which you are promised!
verses.arabic: هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hayhāta hayhāta limā tūʿadūn

verses.eng: It is not but our worldly life - we die and live, and we will not be resurrected.
verses.arabic: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَبْعُوثِينَ
verses.transliteration: In hiya illā ḥayātunā al-dunyā namūtu wa naḥyā wa mā naḥnu bimabʿūthīn

verses.eng: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allah, and we will not believe him.'
verses.arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا وَمَا نَحْنُ لَهُ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: In huwa illā rajulun iftarā ʿalā Allāhi kadhiban wa mā naḥnu lahu bimu'minīn

verses.eng: He said, 'My Lord, support me because they have denied me.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ انصُرْنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi inṣurnī bimā kadhdhabūn

verses.eng: [Allah] said, 'After a little, they will surely become regretful.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ عَمَّا قَلِيلٍ لَّيُصْبِحُنَّ نَادِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ʿammā qalīlin layuṣ'biḥunna nādimīn

verses.eng: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ بِالْحَقِّ فَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ غُثَاءً ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِّلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-akhadhathumu al-ṣayḥatu bi-al-ḥaqqi fa-jaʿalnāhum ghuṭhā'an fa-buʿdan lil-qawmi al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: Then We produced after them other generations.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَا مِن بَعْدِهِمْ قُرُونًا آخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma ansha'nā min baʿdihim qurūnan ākharīn

verses.eng: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].
verses.arabic: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā tasbiq min ummatin ajalaha wa mā yasta'khirūn

verses.eng: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا تَتْرَىٰ ۖ كُلَّ مَا جَاءَ أُمَّةً رَّسُولُهَا كَذَّبُوهُ ۚ فَأَتْبَعْنَا بَعْضَهُم بَعْضًا وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَحَادِيثَ ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِّقَوْمٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma arsalnā rusulanā tatrā kullā mā jā'a ummatan rasūluhā kadhdhabūhu fa-atbaʿnā baʿḍahum baʿḍan wa jaʿalnāhum aḥādīth fa-buʿdan liqawmin lā yu'minūn

verses.eng: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَأَخَاهُ هَارُونَ بِآيَاتِنَا وَسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Thumma arsalnā Mūsā wa akhāhu Hārūna bi-āyātinā wa sulṭānin mubīn

verses.eng: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.
verses.arabic: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاسْتَكْبَرُوا وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا عَالِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ilā firʿawna wamala-ihi fa-stakbarū wakānū qawman ʿālīna

verses.eng: And they said, 'Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?'
verses.arabic: فَقَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لِبَشَرَيْنِ مِثْلِنَا وَقَوْمُهُمَا لَنَا عَابِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faqālū anu'minu libasharayni mithlinā waqawmuhumā lanā ʿābidūna

verses.eng: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.
verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَكَانُوا مِنَ الْمُهْلَكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakadhdhabūhumā fakānū mina l-muh'lakīna

verses.eng: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad ātaynā mūsā l-kitāba laʿallahum yahtadūna

verses.eng: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُ آيَةً وَآوَيْنَاهُمَا إِلَىٰ رَبْوَةٍ ذَاتِ قَرَارٍ وَمَعِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wajaʿalnā ib'na maryama wa-ummahu āyatan waāwaynāhumā ilā rabwatin dhāti qarārin wamaʿīnin

verses.eng: O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Knowing.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الرُّسُلُ كُلُوا مِنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَاعْمَلُوا صَالِحًا إِنِّي بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā l-rusulu kulū mina l-ṭayyibāti wa-iʿ'malū ṣāliḥan innī bimā taʿmalūna ʿalīmun

verses.eng: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ هَٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَأَنَا رَبُّكُمْ فَاتَّقُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna hādhihi ummatukum ummatan wāḥidatan wa-anā rabbukum fa-ittaqūni

verses.eng: But they divided their affair among themselves, [returning] to sects, each party rejoicing in what it has.
verses.arabic: فَتَقَطَّعُوا أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُرًا كُلُّ حِزْبٍ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fataqaṭṭaʿū amrahum baynahum zuburan kullu ḥizbin bimā ladayhim fariḥūna

verses.eng: So leave them in their confusion for a time.
verses.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ فِي غَمْرَتِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Fadharhum fī ghamratihim ḥattā ḥīnin

verses.eng: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children
verses.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّمَا نُمِدُّهُم بِهِ مِن مَّالٍ وَبَنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ayaḥsabūna annamā numidduhum bihi min mālin wabanīna

verses.eng: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.
verses.arabic: نُسَارِعُ لَهُمْ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ بَل لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Nusāriʿu lahum fī l-khayrāti bal lā yashʿurūna

verses.eng: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ خَشْيَةِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna hum min khashyati rabbihim mush'fiqūna

verses.eng: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna hum bi-āyāti rabbihim yu'minūna

verses.eng: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِرَبِّهِمْ لَا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna hum birabbihim lā yush'rikūna

verses.eng: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord -
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْتُونَ مَا آتَوا وَّقُلُوبُهُمْ وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ رَاجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna yu'tūna mā ātaw waqulūbuhum wajilatun annahum ilā rabbihim rājiʿūna

verses.eng: It is these who race toward good deeds, and they are foremost in them.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَهُمْ لَهَا سَـٰبِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ulaika yusari'una fil khayrati wa hum laha sabiqun

verses.eng: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.
verses.arabic: وَلَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۖ وَلَدَيْنَا كِتَـٰبٌ يَنطِقُ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۙ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la nukallifu nafsan illa wus'aha wa ladayna kitabun yantiqu bilhaqqi wa hum la yuzlamun

verses.eng: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides which they are doing.
verses.arabic: بَلْ قُلُوبُهُمْ فِى غَمْرَةٍۢ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلٌۭ مِّن دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ هُمْ لَهَا عَـٰمِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal qulubuhum fee ghamratim min hatha wa lahum a'malun min dooni thalika hum laha 'amilun

verses.eng: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they cry for help.
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِم بِٱلْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْـَٔرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hatta itha akhathna mutrafeehim bil'adhabi itha hum yajarun

verses.eng: Do not cry for help this Day! Indeed, you will not be helped by Us.
verses.arabic: لَا تَجْـَٔرُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّكُم مِّنَّا لَا تُنصَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: La taj'aru alyawma innakum minna la tunsarun

verses.eng: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels
verses.arabic: قَدْ كَانَتْ ءَايَـٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنتُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ تَنكِصُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qad kanat ayatee tutla 'alaykum fakuntum 'ala a'qabikum tankisun

verses.eng: In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.
verses.arabic: مُسْتَكْبِرِينَ بِهِۦ سَـٰمِرًۭا تَهْجُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mustakbireena bihi samiran tahjuroon

verses.eng: Then have they not reflected over the word, or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?
verses.arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَدَّبَّرُوا۟ ٱلْقَوْلَ أَمْ جَآءَهُم مَّا لَمْ يَأْتِ ءَابَآءَهُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Afalam yaddabaroo alqawla am jaahum ma lam yati abaahumu al-awwaleen

verses.eng: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?
verses.arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يَعْرِفُوا۟ رَسُولَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am lam ya'rifoo rasoolahum fahum lahu munkiroon

verses.eng: Or do they say, 'In him is madness'? Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.
verses.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۢ ۚ بَلْ جَآءَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَـٰرِهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am yaqooloona bihi jinnatun bal jaahum bilhaqqi wa aktharuhum lilhaqqi karihoon

verses.eng: But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.
verses.arabic: وَلَوِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلْحَقُّ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ لَفَسَدَتِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهِنَّ ۚ بَلْ أَتَيْنَـٰهُم بِذِكْرِهِمْ فَهُمْ عَن ذِكْرِهِم مُّعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lawi ittaba'a alhaqqu ahwaahum lafasadati assamawatu wal-ardu wa man feehinna bal ataynahum bithikrihim fahum 'an thikrihim mu'ridoon

verses.eng: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.
verses.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ خَرْجًۭا فَخَرَاجُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌۭ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Am tas'aluhum khajaran fakharaju rabbika khayrun wa huwa khayru arraziqeen

verses.eng: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Wa innaka latad'uhum ila siratin mustaqeem

verses.eng: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ عَنِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ لَنَـٰكِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna allatheena la yu'minoona bil-akhirati 'ani assirati lanakiboon

verses.eng: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ رَحِمْنَـٰهُمْ وَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِم مِّن ضُرٍّۢ لَّلَجُّوا۟ فِى طُغْيَـٰنِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa law rahimnahum wa kashafna ma bihim min durrin lalajjoo fee tughyanihim ya'mahoon

verses.eng: And We had gripped them with suffering, but they did not humble themselves to their Lord, nor did they supplicate in humility.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَاهُم بِالْعَذَابِ فَمَا اسْتَكَانُوا لِرَبِّهِمْ وَمَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad akhathnahum bialʿathabi fama istakanoo lirabbihim wama yatadarAAoon

verses.eng: Until when We open upon them a gate of severe punishment, immediately they will be in despair.
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا ذَا عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ
verses.transliteration: Hatta itha fatahna AAalayhim baban tha AAathabin shadeedin itha hum feehi mublisoon

verses.eng: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنشَأَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee ansha lakumu alssamAAa waalabsara waalafidata qaleelan ma tashkuroon

verses.eng: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee tharaakum fee alardi wailayhi tuhsharoon

verses.eng: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَلَهُ اخْتِلَافُ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee yuhyee wayumeetu walahu ikhtilafu allayli waalnnahari afala taAAqiloon

verses.eng: Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.
verses.arabic: بَلْ قَالُوا مِثْلَ مَا قَالَ الْأَوَّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal qaloo mithla ma qala alawwaloon

verses.eng: They said, 'When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
verses.arabic: قَالُوا أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo aitha mitna wakunna turaban waAAithaman ainna lamabAAoothoon

verses.eng: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples.'
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا نَحْنُ وَآبَاؤُنَا هَـٰذَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Laqad wuAAidna nahnu waabaona hatha min qablu in hatha illa asateeru alawwaleen

verses.eng: Say, 'To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?'
verses.arabic: قُل لِّمَنِ الْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهَا إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul limani alardu waman feeha in kuntum taAAlamoon

verses.eng: They will say, 'To Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not remember?'
verses.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sayaqooloona lillahi qul afala tathakkaroon

verses.eng: Say, 'Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن رَّبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Qul man rabbu alssamawati alssabAAi warabbu alAAarshi alAAatheemi

verses.eng: They will say, 'To Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not fear Him?'
verses.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sayaqooloona lillahi qul afala tattaqoon

verses.eng: Say, 'In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?'
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَهُوَ يُجِيرُ وَلَا يُجَارُ عَلَيْهِ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul man biyadihi malakootu kulli shayin wahuwa yujeeru wala yujaru AAalayhi in kuntum taAAlamoon

verses.eng: They will say, 'To Allah.' Say, 'Then how are you deluded?'
verses.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ فَأَنَّىٰ تُسْحَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sayaqooloona lillahi qul faanna tusharoon

verses.eng: Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.
verses.arabic: بَلْ أَتَيْنَاهُم بِالْحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal ataynahum bialhaqqi wainnahum lakathiboon

verses.eng: Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe [concerning Him].
verses.arabic: مَا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِنْ وَلَدٍ وَمَا كَانَ مَعَهُ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ إِذًا لَّذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلَٰهٍ بِمَا خَلَقَ وَلَعَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā ittakhadha Allāhu min waladin wa mā kāna maʿahu min ilāhin idhan ladhahaba kullu ilāhin bimā khalaqa wa laʿalā baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin subḥāna Allāhi ʿammā yaṣifūn

verses.eng: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].
verses.arabic: عَٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَٰدَةِ فَتَعَٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: ʿĀlimi l-ghaybi wa l-shahādati fa-taʿālā ʿammā yush'rikūn

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,
verses.arabic: قُل رَّبِّ إِمَّا تُرِيَنِّي مَا يُوعَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul rabbi immā turiyanī mā yūʿadūn

verses.eng: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
verses.arabic: رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِي فِي ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi falā tajʿalnī fī l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And indeed, We are able to show you what We have promised them.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّرِيَكَ مَا نَعِدُهُمْ لَقَٰدِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa innā ʿalā an nuriyaka mā naʿiduhum laqādirūn

verses.eng: Repel evil by that which is better. We are most knowing of what they describe.
verses.arabic: ٱدْفَعْ بِٱلَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَصِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idfaʿ bi-llatī hiya aḥsanu s-sayyi'ata naḥnu aʿlamu bimā yaṣifūn

verses.eng: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,
verses.arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَٰتِ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينِ
verses.transliteration: Wa qul rabbi aʿūdhu bika min hamazāti sh-shayāṭīn

verses.eng: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me."
verses.arabic: وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَن يَحْضُرُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wa aʿūdhu bika rabbi an yaḥḍurūn

verses.eng: [For such is the state of the disbelievers], until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ٱرْجِعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā jā'a aḥadahumu l-mawtu qāla rabbi irjiʿūn

verses.eng: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.
verses.arabic: لَعَلِّيٓ أَعْمَلُ صَٰلِحًا فِيمَا تَرَكْتُ كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَآئِلُهَا وَمِن وَرَآئِهِم بَرْزَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laʿallī aʿmalu ṣāliḥan fīmā taraktu kallā innahā kalimatun huwa qā'iluhā wa min warā'ihim barzakhun ilā yawmi yubʿathūn

verses.eng: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَلَآ أَنسَابَ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَلَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-idhā nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri falā ansāba baynahum yawma'idhin wa lā yatasā'alūn

verses.eng: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who will be the successful.
verses.arabic: فَمَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faman thaqulat mawāzīnuhu fa-ulā'ika humu l-mufliḥūn

verses.eng: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ فِي جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa man khaffat mawāzīnuhu fa-ulā'ika alladhīna khasirū anfusahum fī jahannama khālidūn

verses.eng: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.
verses.arabic: تَلْفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ وَهُمْ فِيهَا كَٰلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Talfaḥu wujūhahumu n-nāru wa hum fīhā kāliḥūn

verses.eng: [It will be said], "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَكُنْ ءَايَٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alam takun āyātī tut'lā ʿalaykum fa-kuntum bihā tukadhibūn

verses.eng: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْنَا شِقْوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوْمًا ضَآلِّينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū rabbanā ghalabat ʿalaynā shiqwatunā wakunnā qawman ḍāllīn

verses.eng: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: رَبَّنَآ أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbanā akhrijnā minhā fa-in ʿudnā fa-innā ẓālimūn

verses.eng: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱخْسَـُٔوا۟ فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ikhsaʾū fīhā walā tukallimūn

verses.eng: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فَرِيقٌۭ مِّنْ عِبَادِى يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innahu kāna farīqun min ʿibādī yaqūlūna rabbanā āmannā faghfir lanā warḥamnā wa-anta khayru r-rāḥimīn

verses.eng: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
verses.arabic: فَٱتَّخَذْتُمُوهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا حَتَّىٰٓ أَنسَوْكُمْ ذِكْرِى وَكُنتُم مِّنْهُمْ تَضْحَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fattakhadhtumūhum sikhriyyan ḥattā ansawkum dhikrī wakuntum minhum taḍḥakūn

verses.eng: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."
verses.arabic: إِنِّى جَزَيْتُهُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ هُمُ ٱلْفَآئِزُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innī jazaytuhumu l-yawma bimā �abarū annahum humu l-fāʾizūn

verses.eng: [Allah] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"
verses.arabic: قَـٰلَ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla kam labithtum fī l-arḍi ʿadada sinīn

verses.eng: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍۢ فَسْـَٔلِ ٱلْعَآدِّينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū labithnā yawman aw baʿḍa yawmin fasʾali l-ʿāddīn

verses.eng: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.
verses.arabic: قَـٰلَ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا ۖ لَّوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla in labithtum illā qalīlan law annakum kuntum taʿlamūn

verses.eng: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"
verses.arabic: أَفَحَسِبْتُمْ أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ عَبَثًۭا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afaḥasibtum annamā khalaqnākum ʿabathan wa-annakum ilaynā lā turjaʿūn

verses.eng: So exalted is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.
verses.arabic: فَتَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Fataʿālā llāhu l-maliku l-ḥaqqu lā ilāha illā huwa rabbu l-ʿarshi l-karīm

verses.eng: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
verses.arabic: وَمَن يَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ لَا بُرْهَـٰنَ لَهُۥ بِهِۦ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُۥ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waman yadʿu maʿa llāhi ilāhan ākhara lā burhāna lahu bihi fa-innamā ḥisābuhu ʿinda rabbihi innahu lā yufliḥu l-kāfirūn

verses.eng: And, [O Muhammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."
verses.arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ وَٱرْحَمْ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqul rabbi ghfir warḥam wa-anta khayru r-rāḥimīn

verses.eng: A Surah which We have sent down and which We have ordained. In it have We sent down Clear Signs, in order that you may receive admonition.
verses.arabic: سُورَةٌ أَنزَلْنَاهَا وَفَرَضْنَاهَا وَأَنزَلْنَا فِيهَا آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Sūratun anzalnāhā wafaradnāhā waanzalnā fīhā āyātin bayyinātin laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

verses.eng: The woman and the man guilty of adultery or fornication—flog each of them with a hundred stripes: let not compassion move you in their case, in a matter prescribed by Allah, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day: and let a party of the Believers witness their punishment.
verses.arabic: الزَّانِيَةُ وَالزَّانِي فَاجْلِدُوا كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِّنْهُمَا مِائَةَ جَلْدَةٍ ۖ وَلَا تَأْخُذْكُم بِهِمَا رَأْفَةٌ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ ۖ وَلْيَشْهَدْ عَذَابَهُمَا طَائِفَةٌ مِّنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Alzzāniyatu waalzzānī fājlidū kulla wāhidin minhumā miata jaladatin walā takhudhkum bihimā rafatun fī dīni Allāhi in kuntum tu'minūna biAllāhi waalyawmi alākhiri walyashhad ʿadhābahumā tāifatun mina almu'minīna

verses.eng: Let no man guilty of adultery or fornication marry any but a woman similarly guilty, or an Unbeliever: nor let any but such a man or an Unbeliever marry such a woman: to the Believers such a thing is forbidden.
verses.arabic: الزَّانِي لَا يَنكِحُ إلَّا زَانِيَةً أَوْ مُشْرِكَةً وَالزَّانِيَةُ لَا يَنكِحُهَا إِلَّا زَانٍ أَوْ مُشْرِكٌ ۚ وَحُرِّمَ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Alzzānī lā yankihu illā zāniyatan aw mushrikatan waalzzāniyatu lā yankihuhā illā zānin aw mushrikun wuhurrima dhālika ʿalā almu'minīna

verses.eng: And those who launch a charge against chaste women, and produce not four witnesses (to support their allegations), flog them with eighty stripes; and reject their evidence ever after: for such men are wicked transgressors;
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَرْمُونَ الْمُحْصَنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَأْتُوا بِأَرْبَعَةِ شُهَدَاءَ فَاجْلِدُوهُمْ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً وَلَا تَقْبَلُوا لَهُمْ شَهَادَةً أَبَدًا ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waalladhīna yarmūna almuḥṣanāti thumma lam ya'tū biarbaʿati shuhadāa fājlidūhum thamānīna jaladatan walā taqbalū lahum shahādatan abadan waulāika humu alfāsiqūna

verses.eng: Unless they repent thereafter and mend (their conduct); for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ تَابُوا مِن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Illā alladhīna tābū min baʿdi dhālika wa-aṣlaḥū fa-inna Allāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

verses.eng: And for those who launch a charge against their spouses, and have (in support) no evidence but their own, their solitary evidence (can be received) if they bear witness four times (with an oath) by Allah that they are solemnly telling the truth;
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَرْمُونَ أَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ شُهَدَاءُ إِلَّا أَنفُسُهُمْ فَشَهَادَةُ أَحَدِهِمْ أَرْبَعُ شَهَادَاتٍ بِاللَّهِ ۙ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waalladhīna yarmūna azwājahum walam yakun lahum shuhadāu illā anfusuhum fashahādatu aḥadihim arbaʿu shahādātin biAllāhi innahu lamina alṣṣādiqīna

verses.eng: And the fifth (oath) (should be) that they solemnly invoke the curse of Allah on themselves if they tell a lie.
verses.arabic: وَالْخَامِسَةُ أَنَّ لَعْنَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ إِن كَانَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waalkhāmisatu anna laʿnata Allāhi ʿalayhi in kāna mina alkādhibīna

verses.eng: But it would avert the punishment from the wife, if she bears witness four times (with an oath) by Allah, that (her husband) is telling a lie;
verses.arabic: وَيَدْرَأُ عَنْهَا الْعَذَابَ أَن تَشْهَدَ أَرْبَعَ شَهَادَاتٍ بِاللَّهِ ۙ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wayadrau ʿanhā alʿadhāba an tashhada arbaʿa shahādātin biAllāhi innahu lamina alkādhibīna

verses.eng: And the fifth (oath) should be that she solemnly invokes the wrath of Allah on herself if (her accuser) is telling the truth.
verses.arabic: وَالْخَامِسَةُ أَنَّ غَضَبَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهَا إِن كَانَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waalkhāmisatu anna ghaḍaba Allāhi ʿalayhā in kāna mina alṣṣādiqīna

verses.eng: If it were not for Allah's grace and mercy on you, and that Allah is Oft-Returning, full of Wisdom, (you would be ruined indeed).
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Walawlā faḍlu Allāhi ʿalaykum waraḥmatuhu wa-anna Allāha tawwābun ḥakīmun

verses.eng: Those who brought forward the lie are a body among yourselves: think it not to be an evil to you; on the contrary it is good for you: to every man among them (will come the punishment) of the sin that he earned, and to him who took on himself the lead among them, will be a penalty grievous.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ جَاءُوا بِالْإِفْكِ عُصْبَةٌ مِّنكُمْ ۚ لَا تَحْسَبُوهُ شَرًّا لَّكُم ۖ بَلْ هُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۚ لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُم مَّا اكْتَسَبَ مِنَ الْإِثْمِ ۚ وَالَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ كِبْرَهُ مِنْهُمْ لَهُ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna jāū bi-al-ifki ʿuṣbatun minkum lā taḥsabūhu sharrān lakum bal huwa khayrun lakum likulli imriin minhum mā iktasaba mina al-ithmi waalladhī tawallā kib'rahu minhum lahu ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

verses.eng: Why did not the believers—men and women—when you heard of the affair,—put the best construction on it in their own minds and say, "This (charge) is an obvious lie"?
verses.arabic: لَّوْلَا إِذْ سَمِعْتُمُوهُ ظَنَّ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتُ بِأَنفُسِهِمْ خَيْرًا وَقَالُوا هَٰذَا إِفْكٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Lawlā idh samiʿtumūhu ẓanna almu'minūna waalmu'minātu bi-anfusihim khayran waqālū hādhā ifkun mubīnun

verses.eng: Why did they not bring four witnesses to prove it? When they have not brought the witnesses, such men, in the sight of Allah, (stand forth) themselves as liars!
verses.arabic: لَّوْلَا جَاءُوا عَلَيْهِ بِأَرْبَعَةِ شُهَدَاءَ ۚ فَإِذْ لَمْ يَأْتُوا بِالشُّهَدَاءِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الْكَاذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Lawlā jāū ʿalayhi bi-arbaʿati shuhadāa fa-idh lam ya'tū bi-alshshuhadāi fa-ulāika ʿinda Allāhi humu alkādhibūna

verses.eng: Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you, in this world and the Hereafter, a grievous penalty would have seized you in that you rushed glibly into this affair.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ لَمَسَّكُمْ فِي مَا أَفَضْتُمْ فِيهِ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Walawlā faḍlu Allāhi ʿalaykum waraḥmatuhu fī alddunyā waal-ākhirati lamassakum fī mā afaḍtum fīhi ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

verses.eng: Behold, you received it on your tongues, and said out of your mouths things of which you had no knowledge; and you thought it to be a light matter, while it was most serious in the sight of Allah.
verses.arabic: إِذْ تَلَقَّوْنَهُ بِأَلْسِنَتِكُمْ وَتَقُولُونَ بِأَفْوَاهِكُم مَّا لَيْسَ لَكُم بِهِ عِلْمٌ وَتَحْسَبُونَهُ هَيِّنًا وَهُوَ عِندَ اللَّهِ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Idh talaqqawnahu bi-alsinatikum wataqūlūna bi-afwāhikum mā laysa lakum bihi ʿil'mun wataḥsabūnahu hayyinan wahuwa ʿinda Allāhi ʿaẓīmun

verses.eng: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, 'It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allah]; this is a great slander'?
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَا إِذْ سَمِعْتُمُوهُ قُلْتُم مَّا يَكُونُ لَنَا أَن نَّتَكَلَّمَ بِهَـٰذَا سُبْحَانَكَ هَـٰذَا بُهْتَانٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lawlā idh samiʿtumūhu qultum mā yakūnu lanā an natakallama bihādhā subḥānaka hādhā buhtānun ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: Allah warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.
verses.arabic: يَعِظُكُمُ اللَّهُ أَن تَعُودُوا لِمِثْلِهِ أَبَدًا إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yaʿiẓukumu Allāhu an taʿūdū limithlihi abadan in kuntum mu'minīn

verses.eng: And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَيُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa yubayyinu Allāhu lakumu l-āyāti wa Allāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīm

verses.eng: Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows and you do not know.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُحِبُّونَ أَن تَشِيعَ الْفَاحِشَةُ فِي الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna yuḥibbūna an tashīʿa l-fāḥishatu fī alladhīna āmanū lahum ʿadhābun alīmun fī d-dunyā wa l-ākhirati wa Allāhu yaʿlamu wa antum lā taʿlamūn

verses.eng: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Kind and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lawlā faḍlu Allāhi ʿalaykum wa raḥmatuhu wa anna Allāha raʾūfun raḥīm

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allah purifies whom He wills, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّبِعُوا خُطُوَاتِ الشَّيْطَانِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّبِعْ خُطُوَاتِ الشَّيْطَانِ فَإِنَّهُ يَأْمُرُ بِالْفَحْشَاءِ وَالْمُنكَرِ ۚ وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ مَا زَكَىٰ مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ أَبَدًا وَلَـٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يُزَكِّي مَن يَشَاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tattabiʿū khuṭuwāti sh-shayṭāni wa man yattabiʿ khuṭuwāti sh-shayṭāni fa-innahu yaʾmuru bi l-faḥshāʾi wa l-munkari wa lawlā faḍlu Allāhi ʿalaykum wa raḥmatuhu mā zakā minkum min aḥadin abadan wa lākinna Allāha yuzakkī man yashāʾu wa Allāhu samīʿun ʿalīm

verses.eng: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allah, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يَأْتَلِ أُولُو الْفَضْلِ مِنكُمْ وَالسَّعَةِ أَن يُؤْتُوا أُولِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْمَسَاكِينَ وَالْمُهَاجِرِينَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَلْيَعْفُوا وَلْيَصْفَحُوا ۗ أَلَا تُحِبُّونَ أَن يَغْفِرَ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā yaʾtali ulū l-faḍli minkum wa s-saʿati an yuʾtū ulī l-qurbā wa l-masākīna wa l-muhājirīna fī sabīli Allāhi wa l-yaʿfū wa l-yaṣfaḥū a lā tuḥibbūna an yaghfira Allāhu lakum wa Allāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment
verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَرْمُونَ الْمُحْصَنَاتِ الْغَافِلَاتِ الْمُؤْمِنَاتِ لُعِنُوا فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna yarmūna l-muḥṣanāti l-ghāfilāti l-muʾmināti luʿinū fī d-dunyā wa l-ākhirati wa lahum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: On the Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ تَشْهَدُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَلْسِنَتُهُمْ وَأَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَرْجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yawma tashhadu ʿalayhim alsinatuhum wa aydīhim wa arjuluhum bimā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: That Day, Allah will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is Allah who is the perfect in justice.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ يُوَفِّيهِمُ اللَّهُ دِينَهُمُ الْحَقَّ وَيَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْحَقُّ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Yawmaʾidhin yuwaffīhimu Allāhu dīnahumu l-ḥaqqa wa yaʿlamūna anna Allāha huwa l-ḥaqqu l-mubīn

verses.eng: Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words. Those [good people] are declared innocent of what the slanderers say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
verses.arabic: الْخَبِيثَاتُ لِلْخَبِيثِينَ وَالْخَبِيثُونَ لِلْخَبِيثَاتِ ۖ وَالطَّيِّبَاتُ لِلطَّيِّبِينَ وَالطَّيِّبُونَ لِلطَّيِّبَاتِ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ مُبَرَّءُونَ مِمَّا يَقُولُونَ ۖ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Al-khabīthātu li l-khabīthīna wa l-khabīthūna li l-khabīthāti wa ṭ-ṭayyibātu li ṭ-ṭayyibīna wa ṭ-ṭayyibūna li ṭ-ṭayyibāti ulāʾika mubarraʾūna mimmā yaqūlūna lahum maghfiratun wa rizqun karīm

verses.eng: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَدْخُلُوا بُيُوتًا غَيْرَ بُيُوتِكُمْ حَتَّىٰ تَسْتَأْنِسُوا وَتُسَلِّمُوا عَلَىٰ أَهْلِهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tadkhulū buyūtan ghayra buyūtikum ḥattā tastaʾnisū wa tusallimū ʿalā ahlihā dhālikum khayrun lakum laʿallakum tadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if it is said to you, 'Go back,' then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.
verses.arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ تَجِدُوا فِيهَا أَحَدًا فَلَا تَدْخُلُوهَا حَتَّىٰ يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ وَإِن قِيلَ لَكُمُ ارْجِعُوا فَارْجِعُوا ۖ هُوَ أَزْكَىٰ لَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa in lam tajidū fīhā aḥadan fa lā tadkhulūhā ḥattā yuʾdhana lakum wa in qīla lakumu rjiʿū farjiʿū huwa azkā lakum wa Allāhu bimā taʿmalūna ʿalīm

verses.eng: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
verses.arabic: لَّيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَن تَدْخُلُوا بُيُوتًا غَيْرَ مَسْكُونَةٍ فِيهَا مَتَاعٌ لَّكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُبْدُونَ وَمَا تَكْتُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laysa ʿalaykum junāḥun an tadkhulū buyūtan ghayra maskūnatin fīhā matāʿun lakum wa Allāhu yaʿlamu mā tubdūna wa mā taktumūn

verses.eng: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do.
verses.arabic: قُل لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَغُضُّوا مِنْ أَبْصَارِهِمْ وَيَحْفَظُوا فُرُوجَهُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ أَزْكَىٰ لَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا يَصْنَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul li l-muʾminīna yaghudḍū min abṣārihim wa yaḥfaẓū furūjahum dhālika azkā lahum inna Allāha khabīrun bimā yaṣnaʿūn

verses.eng: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.
verses.arabic: وَقُل لِّلْمُؤْمِنَاتِ يَغْضُضْنَ مِنْ أَبْصَارِهِنَّ وَيَحْفَظْنَ فُرُوجَهُنَّ وَلَا يُبْدِينَ زِينَتَهُنَّ إِلَّا مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا ۖ وَلْيَضْرِبْنَ بِخُمُرِهِنَّ عَلَىٰ جُيُوبِهِنَّ ۖ وَلَا يُبْدِينَ زِينَتَهُنَّ إِلَّا لِبُعُولَتِهِنَّ أَوْ آبَائِهِنَّ أَوْ آبَاءِ بُعُولَتِهِنَّ أَوْ أَبْنَائِهِنَّ أَوْ أَبْنَاءِ بُعُولَتِهِنَّ أَوْ إِخْوَانِهِنَّ أَوْ بَنِي إِخْوَانِهِنَّ أَوْ بَنِي أَخَوَاتِهِنَّ أَوْ نِسَائِهِنَّ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُنَّ أَوِ التَّابِعِينَ غَيْرِ أُولِي الْإِرْبَةِ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ أَوِ الطِّفْلِ الَّذِينَ لَمْ يَظْهَرُوا عَلَىٰ عَوْرَاتِ النِّسَاءِ ۖ وَلَا يَضْرِبْنَ بِأَرْجُلِهِنَّ لِيُعْلَمَ مَا يُخْفِينَ مِن زِينَتِهِنَّ ۚ وَتُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ جَمِيعًا أَيُّهَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qul lilmu'mināti yaghḍuḍna min abṣārihinna wa yaḥfaẓna furūjahunna wa lā yubdīna zīnatahunna illā mā ẓahara minhā wal-yaḍribna bikhumurihinna ʿalā juyūbihinna wa lā yubdīna zīnatahunna illā libuʿūlatihinna aw ābā'ihinna aw ābā'i buʿūlatihinna aw abnā'ihinna aw abnā'i buʿūlatihinna aw ikhwānihinna aw banī ikhwānihinna aw banī akhawātihinna aw nisā'ihinna aw mā malakat aymānuhunna awi ttābiʿīna ghayri ulī l-irbati mina r-rijāli awi ṭ-ṭifli alladhīna lam yaẓharū ʿalā ʿawrāti n-nisā'i wa lā yaḍribna bi-arjulihinna liyuʿlama mā yukhfīna min zīnatihinna wa tūbū ilā llāhi jamīʿan ayyuha l-mu'minūna laʿallakum tufliḥūn

verses.eng: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَأَنكِحُوا الْأَيَامَىٰ مِنكُمْ وَالصَّالِحِينَ مِنْ عِبَادِكُمْ وَإِمَائِكُمْ ۚ إِن يَكُونُوا فُقَرَاءَ يُغْنِهِمُ اللَّهُ مِن فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa ankiḥū l-ayāmā minkum waṣ-ṣāliḥīna min ʿibādikum wa imā'ikum in yakūnū fuqarā'a yughnihimu llāhu min faḍlih wa llāhu wāsiʿun ʿalīm

verses.eng: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَلْيَسْتَعْفِفِ الَّذِينَ لَا يَجِدُونَ نِكَاحًا حَتَّىٰ يُغْنِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ مِن فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَالَّذِينَ يَبْتَغُونَ الْكِتَابَ مِمَّا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ فَكَاتِبُوهُمْ إِنْ عَلِمْتُمْ فِيهِمْ خَيْرًا وَآتُوهُم مِّن مَّالِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي آتَاكُمْ ۚ وَلَا تُكْرِهُوا فَتَيَاتِكُمْ عَلَى الْبِغَاءِ إِنْ أَرَدْنَ تَحَصُّنًا لِّتَبْتَغُوا عَرَضَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۚ وَمَن يُكْرِههُّنَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ مِن بَعْدِ إِكْرَاهِهِنَّ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Walyastaʿfifi alladhīna lā yajidūna nikāḥan ḥattā yughniyahumu llāhu min faḍlih wa alladhīna yabtaghūna l-kitāba mimmā malakat aymānukum fakātibūhum in ʿalimtum fīhim khayran wa ātūhum min māli llāhi alladhī ātākum wa lā tukrihū fatayātikum ʿalā l-bighā'i in aradna taḥaṣṣunan litabtaghū ʿaraḍa l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa man yukrihhunna fa-inna llāha min baʿdi ikrāhihinna ghafūrun raḥīm

verses.eng: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allah.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ آيَاتٍ مُّبَيِّنَاتٍ وَمَثَلًا مِّنَ الَّذِينَ خَلَوْا مِن قَبْلِكُمْ وَمَوْعِظَةً لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad anzalnā ilaykum āyātin mubayyinātin wa mathalan mina alladhīna khalaw min qablikum wa mawʿiẓatan lil-muttaqīn

verses.eng: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ نُورُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ مَثَلُ نُورِهِ كَمِشْكَاةٍ فِيهَا مِصْبَاحٌ ۖ الْمِصْبَاحُ فِي زُجَاجَةٍ ۖ الزُّجَاجَةُ كَأَنَّهَا كَوْكَبٌ دُرِّيٌّ يُوقَدُ مِن شَجَرَةٍ مُّبَارَكَةٍ زَيْتُونَةٍ لَّا شَرْقِيَّةٍ وَلَا غَرْبِيَّةٍ يَكَادُ زَيْتُهَا يُضِيءُ وَلَوْ لَمْ تَمْسَسْهُ نَارٌ ۚ نُورٌ عَلَىٰ نُورٍ ۗ يَهْدِي اللَّهُ لِنُورِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَيَضْرِبُ اللَّهُ الْأَمْثَالَ لِلنَّاسِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu nūru s-samāwāti wal-arḍ mathalu nūrihi kamishkātin fīhā miṣbāḥ al-miṣbāḥ fī zujājah az-zujājatu ka'annahā kawkabun durriyyun yūqadu min shajaratin mubārakatin zaytūnatin lā sharqiyyatin wa lā gharbiyyatin yakādu zaytuhā yuḍī'u wa lam tamsas-hu nār nūrun ʿalā nūr yahdī llāhu linūrihi man yashā' wa yaḍribu llāhu l-amthāla li-n-nās wa llāhu bikulli shay'in ʿalīm

verses.eng: [Such niches are] in houses [i.e., mosques] which Allah has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings
verses.arabic: فِي بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَن تُرْفَعَ وَيُذْكَرَ فِيهَا اسْمُهُ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ فِيهَا بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالْآصَالِ
verses.transliteration: Fī buyūtin adhina llāhu an turfaʿa wa yudhkara fīhā smuh yusabbiḥu lahu fīhā bil-ghuduwwi wal-āṣāl

verses.eng: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about
verses.arabic: رِجَالٌ لَّا تُلْهِيهِمْ تِجَارَةٌ وَلَا بَيْعٌ عَن ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَإِقَامِ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ ۙ يَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا تَتَقَلَّبُ فِيهِ الْقُلُوبُ وَالْأَبْصَارُ
verses.transliteration: Rijālun lā tulhīhim tijāratun wa lā bayʿun ʿan dhikri llāhi wa iqāmi ṣ-ṣalāti wa ītā'i z-zakāti yakhāfūna yawman tataqallabu fīhi l-qulūbu wal-abṣār

verses.eng: That Allah may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.
verses.arabic: لِيَجْزِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنَ مَا عَمِلُوا وَيَزِيدَهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَرْزُقُ مَن يَشَاءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
verses.transliteration: Liyajziyahumu llāhu aḥsana mā ʿamilū wa yazīdahum min faḍlih wa llāhu yarzuqu man yashā'u bighayri ḥisāb

verses.eng: But those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allah is swift in account.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَعْمَالُهُمْ كَسَرَابٍ بِقِيعَةٍ يَحْسَبُهُ الظَّمْآنُ مَاءً حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَهُ لَمْ يَجِدْهُ شَيْئًا وَوَجَدَ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ فَوَفَّاهُ حِسَابَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna kafarū aʿmāluhum ka-sarābin biqīʿatin yaḥsabuhu ẓ-ẓam'ānu mā'an ḥattā idhā jā'ahu lam yajidhu shay'an wa wajada llāha ʿindahu fa waffāhu ḥisābah wa llāhu sarīʿu l-ḥisāb

verses.eng: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light - for him there is no light.
verses.arabic: أَوْ كَظُلُمَاتٍ فِي بَحْرٍ لُّجِّيٍّ يَغْشَاهُ مَوْجٌ مِّن فَوْقِهِ مَوْجٌ مِّن فَوْقِهِ سَحَابٌ ۚ ظُلُمَاتٌ بَعْضُهَا فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ إِذَا أَخْرَجَ يَدَهُ لَمْ يَكَدْ يَرَاهَا ۗ وَمَن لَّمْ يَجْعَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ نُورًا فَمَا لَهُ مِن نُّورٍ
verses.transliteration: Aw kaẓulumātin fī baḥrin lujjiyyin yaghshāhu mawjun min fawqihi mawjun min fawqihi saḥāb ẓulumātun baʿḍuhā fawqa baʿḍin idhā akhraja yadahu lam yakad yarāhā wa man lam yajʿali llāhu lahu nūran fa-mā lahu min nūr

verses.eng: Do you not see that Allah is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allah is Knowing of what they do.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَالطَّيْرُ صَافَّاتٍ ۖ كُلٌّ قَدْ عَلِمَ صَلَاتَهُ وَتَسْبِيحَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allaha yusabbihu lahu man fi alssamawati waalardi waalttayru saffatin kullun qad AAalima salatahu watasbeehahu waAllahu AAaleemun bima yafAAaloona

verses.eng: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the destination.
verses.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Walillahi mulku alssamawati waalardi waila Allahi almaseeru

verses.eng: Do you not see that Allah drives clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost takes away the eyesight.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُزْجِي سَحَابًا ثُمَّ يُؤَلِّفُ بَيْنَهُ ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُ رُكَامًا فَتَرَى الْوَدْقَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ خِلَالِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مِن جِبَالٍ فِيهَا مِن بَرَدٍ فَيُصِيبُ بِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَصْرِفُهُ عَن مَّن يَشَاءُ ۖ يَكَادُ سَنَا بَرْقِهِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْأَبْصَارِ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allaha yuzjee sahaban thumma yuallifu baynahu thumma yajAAaluhu rukaman fatara alwadqa yakhruju min khilalihi wayunazzilu mina alssama-i min jibalin feeha min baradin fayuseebu bihi man yashao wayasrifuhu AAan man yashao yakadu sana barqihi yathhabu bialabsari

verses.eng: Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.
verses.arabic: يُقَلِّبُ اللَّهُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّأُولِي الْأَبْصَارِ
verses.transliteration: Yuqallibu Allahu allayla waalnnahara inna fee thalika laAAibratan liolee alabsari

verses.eng: Allah has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَ كُلَّ دَابَّةٍ مِّن مَّاءٍ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّن يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ بَطْنِهِ وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ رِجْلَيْنِ وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ أَرْبَعٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُ اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: WaAllahu khalaqa kulla dabbatin min main faminhum man yamshee AAala batnihi waminhum man yamshee AAala rijlayni waminhum man yamshee AAala arbaAAin yakhluqu Allahu ma yashao inna Allaha AAala kulli shayin qadeerun

verses.eng: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا آيَاتٍ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Laqad anzalna ayatin mubayyinatin wallahu yahdee man yashao ila siratin mustaqeem

verses.eng: But they say, "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالرَّسُولِ وَأَطَعْنَا ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا أُولَٰئِكَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wayaqooloona amanna billahi wabialrrasooli waataAAna thumma yatawalla fareequn minhum min baAAdi thalika wama olaika bialmu/mineena

verses.eng: And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌ مِنْهُمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waitha duAAoo ila Allahi warasoolihi liyahkuma baynahum itha fareequn minhum muAAridoona

verses.eng: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ يَكُنْ لَهُمُ الْحَقُّ يَأْتُوا إِلَيْهِ مُذْعِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yakun lahumu alhaqqu ya/too ilayhi muthAAineena

verses.eng: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them and His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: أَفِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ أَمِ ارْتَابُوا أَمْ يَخَافُونَ أَنْ يَحِيفَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَرَسُولُهُ ۚ بَلْ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afi quloobihim maradun ami irtaboo am yakhafoona an yaheefa Allahu AAalayhim warasooluhu bal olaika humu alththalimoona

verses.eng: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا كَانَ قَوْلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَنْ يَقُولُوا سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innama kana qawla almu/mineena itha duAAoo ila Allahi warasoolihi liyahkuma baynahum an yaqooloo samiAAna waataAAna waolaika humu almuflihoona

verses.eng: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَيَخْشَ اللَّهَ وَيَتَّقْهِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waman yutiAAi Allaha warasoolahu wayakhsha Allaha wayattaqhi faolaika humu alfaizoona

verses.eng: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allah's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do."
verses.arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِنْ أَمَرْتَهُمْ لَيَخْرُجُنَّ ۖ قُلْ لَا تُقْسِمُوا ۖ طَاعَةٌ مَعْرُوفَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waaqsamoo biAllahi jahda aymanihim la-in amartahum layakhrujunna qul la tuqsimoo taAAatun maAAroofatun inna Allaha khabeerun bima taAAmaloona

verses.eng: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْهِ مَا حُمِّلَ وَعَلَيْكُمْ مَا حُمِّلْتُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُطِيعُوهُ تَهْتَدُوا ۚ وَمَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Qul ateeAAoo Allaha waateeAAoo alrrasoola fain tawallaw fainnama AAalayhi ma hummila waAAalaykum ma hummiltum wain tuteeAAoohu tahtadoo wama AAala alrrasooli illa albalaghu almubeenu

verses.eng: Allah has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَيَسْتَخْلِفَنَّهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ كَمَا اسْتَخْلَفَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ وَلَيُمَكِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ دِينَهُمُ الَّذِي ارْتَضَىٰ لَهُمْ وَلَيُبَدِّلَنَّهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ خَوْفِهِمْ أَمْنًا ۚ يَعْبُدُونَنِي لَا يُشْرِكُونَ بِي شَيْئًا ۚ وَمَنْ كَفَرَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: WaAAada Allahu allatheena amanoo minkum waAAamiloo alssalihati layastakhlifannahum fee alardi kama istakhlafa allatheena min qablihim walayumakkinanna lahum deenahumu allathee irtada lahum walayubaddilannahum min baAAdi khawfihim amnan yaAAbudoonanee la yushrikoona bee shayan waman kafara baAAdi thalika faolaika humu alfasiqoona

verses.eng: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.
verses.arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waaqeemoo alssalata waatoo alzzakata waateeAAoo alrrasoola laAAallakum turhamoona

verses.eng: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allah] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.
verses.arabic: لَا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مُعْجِزِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمُ النَّارُ ۖ وَلَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: La tahsabanna allatheena kafaroo muAAjizeena fee alardi wamawahumu alnnaru walabi/sa almaseeru

verses.eng: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you around others [as well]. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لِيَسْتَأْذِنْكُمُ الَّذِينَ مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ وَالَّذِينَ لَمْ يَبْلُغُوا الْحُلُمَ مِنْكُمْ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ ۚ مِنْ قَبْلِ صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ وَحِينَ تَضَعُونَ ثِيَابَكُمْ مِنَ الظَّهِيرَةِ وَمِنْ بَعْدِ صَلَاةِ الْعِشَاءِ ۚ ثَلَاثُ عَوْرَاتٍ لَكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَا عَلَيْهِمْ جُنَاحٌ بَعْدَهُنَّ ۚ طَوَّافُونَ عَلَيْكُمْ بَعْضُكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha allatheena amanoo liyasta/thinakumu allatheena malakat aymanukum waallatheena lam yablughoo alhuluma minkum thalatha marratin min qabli salati alfajri waheena tadaAAoona thiyabakum mina althaheerati wamin baAAdi salati alAAishai thalathu AAawratin lakum laysa AAalaykum wala AAalayhim junahun baAAdahunna tawwafoona AAalaykum baAAdukum AAala baAAdin kathalika yubayyinu Allahu lakumu alayati waAllahu AAaleemun hakeemun

verses.eng: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا بَلَغَ الْأَطْفَالُ مِنْكُمُ الْحُلُمَ فَلْيَسْتَأْذِنُوا كَمَا اسْتَأْذَنَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ آيَاتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Waitha balagha alatfalu minkumu alhuluma falyasta/thinoo kama istathana allatheena min qablihim kathalika yubayyinu Allahu lakum ayatihi waAllahu AAaleemun hakeemun

verses.eng: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَالْقَوَاعِدُ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ اللَّاتِي لَا يَرْجُونَ نِكَاحًا فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِنَّ جُنَاحٌ أَنْ يَضَعْنَ ثِيَابَهُنَّ غَيْرَ مُتَبَرِّجَاتٍ بِزِينَةٍ ۖ وَأَنْ يَسْتَعْفِفْنَ خَيْرٌ لَهُنَّ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: WaalqawaAAidu mina alnnisai allatee la yarjoona nikaahan falaysa AAalayhinna junahun an yadaAAna thiyabahunna ghayra mutabarrijatin bizeenatin waan yastaAAfifna khayrun lahunna waAllahu sameeAAun AAaleemun

verses.eng: There is no blame upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor any blame upon the sick nor upon yourselves if you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your fathers' brothers or the houses of your fathers' sisters or the houses of your mothers' brothers or the houses of your mothers' sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.
verses.arabic: لَّيْسَ عَلَى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌۭ وَلَا عَلَى ٱلْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌۭ وَلَا عَلَى ٱلْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌۭ وَلَا عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَن تَأْكُلُوا۟ مِنۢ بُيُوتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ ءَابَآئِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ إِخْوَٰنِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخَوَٰتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَعْمَـٰمِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ عَمَّـٰتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخْوَٰلِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ خَـٰلَـٰتِكُمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكْتُم مَّفَاتِحَهُۥٓ أَوْ صَدِيقِكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَن تَأْكُلُوا۟ جَمِيعًا أَوْ أَشْتَاتًۭا ۚ فَإِذَا دَخَلْتُم بُيُوتًۭا فَسَلِّمُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ تَحِيَّةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ مُبَـٰرَكَةًۭ طَيِّبَةًۭ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Laysa ʿalā al-aʿmā ḥarajun walā ʿalā al-aʿraji ḥarajun walā ʿalā al-marīḍi ḥarajun walā ʿalā anfusikum an taʾkulū min buyūtikum aw buyūti ābāʾikum aw buyūti ummahātikum aw buyūti ikhwānikum aw buyūti akhawātikum aw buyūti aʿmāmikum aw buyūti ʿammātikum aw buyūti akhwālikum aw buyūti khālātikum aw mā malaktum mafātīḥahu aw ṣadīqikum laysa ʿalaykum junāḥun an taʾkulū jamīʿan aw ashtātan fa-idhā dakhaltum buyūtan fasallimū ʿalā anfusikum taḥiyyatan min ʿindi Allāhi mubārakatan ṭayyibatan kadhālika yubayyinu Allāhu lakumu al-āyāti laʿallakum taʿqilūn

verses.eng: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muhammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَإِذَا كَانُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍۢ جَامِعٍۢ لَّمْ يَذْهَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَسْتَـْٔذِنُوهُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَسْتَـْٔذِنُونَكَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ۚ فَإِذَا ٱسْتَـْٔذَنُوكَ لِبَعْضِ شَأْنِهِمْ فَأْذَن لِّمَن شِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمُ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Innamā al-muʾminūna alladhīna āmanū bi-Allāhi warasūlihi wa-idhā kānū maʿahu ʿalā amrin jāmiʿin lam yadhhabū ḥattā yastaʾdhinūhu inna alladhīna yastaʾdhinūnaka ulāʾika alladhīna yuʾminūna bi-Allāhi warasūlihi fa-idhā istaʾdhanūka libaʿḍi shaʾnihim faʾdhan liman shiʾta minhum wa-staghfir lahumu Allāha inna Allāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

verses.eng: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from his order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: لَّا تَجْعَلُوا۟ دُعَآءَ ٱلرَّسُولِ بَيْنَكُمْ كَدُعَآءِ بَعْضِكُم بَعْضًۭا ۚ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَسَلَّلُونَ مِنكُمْ لِوَاذًۭا ۚ فَلْيَحْذَرِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُخَالِفُونَ عَنْ أَمْرِهِۦٓ أَن تُصِيبَهُمْ فِتْنَةٌ أَوْ يُصِيبَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Lā tajʿalū duʿāʾa al-rasūli baynakum kadduʿāʾi baʿḍikum baʿḍan qad yaʿlamu Allāhu alladhīna yatasallalūna minkum liwādhan fal-yaḥdhari alladhīna yukhālifūna ʿan amrihi an tuṣībahum fitnatun aw yuṣībahum ʿadhābun alīmun

verses.eng: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
verses.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ مَآ أَنتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَيَوْمَ يُرْجَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌۢ
verses.transliteration: Alā inna li-Allāhi mā fī al-samāwāti wal-arḍi qad yaʿlamu mā antum ʿalayhi wayawma yurjaʿūna ilayhi fayunabbiʾuhum bimā ʿamilū wa-Allāhu bikulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

verses.eng: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -
verses.arabic: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى نَزَّلَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِۦ لِيَكُونَ لِلْعَـٰلَمِينَ نَذِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Tabāraka alladhī nazzala al-furqāna ʿalā ʿabdihi liyakūna lilʿālamīna nadhīrā

verses.eng: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًۭا وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ شَرِيكٌۭ فِى ٱلْمُلْكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍۢ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ تَقْدِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Alladhī lahu mulku al-samāwāti wa-al-arḍi walam yattakhidh waladan walam yakun lahu sharīkun fī al-mulki wakhalaqa kulla shayʾin faqaddarahu taqdīrā

verses.eng: But they have taken besides Him gods who create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.
verses.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةًۭ لَّا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْـًۭٔا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمْ ضَرًّۭا وَلَا نَفْعًۭا وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ مَوْتًۭا وَلَا حَيَوٰةًۭ وَلَا نُشُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-ittakhadhū min dūnihi ālihatan lā yakhluqūna shayʾan wahum yukhlaqūna walā yamlikūna li-anfusihim ḍarran walā nafʿan walā yamlikūna mawtan walā ḥayātan walā nushūrā

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ إِفْكٌ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ وَأَعَانَهُۥ عَلَيْهِ قَوْمٌ ءَاخَرُونَ ۖ فَقَدْ جَآءُو ظُلْمًۭا وَزُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-qāla alladhīna kafarū in hādhā illā ifkun iftarāhu wa-aʿānahu ʿalayhi qawmun ākharūna faqad jāʾū ẓulman wazūrā

verses.eng: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ ٱكْتَتَبَهَا فَهِىَ تُمْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ بُكْرَةًۭ وَأَصِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālū asāṭīru al-awwalīna iktatabahā fahiya tumlā ʿalayhi bukratan wa-aṣīlā

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَنزَلَهُ ٱلَّذِى يَعْلَمُ ٱلسِّرَّ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
verses.transliteration: Qul anzalahu alladhī yaʿlamu al-sirra fī al-samāwāti wa-al-arḍi innahu kāna ghafūran raḥīmā

verses.eng: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?"
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ مَالِ هَـٰذَا ٱلرَّسُولِ يَأْكُلُ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشِى فِى ٱلْأَسْوَاقِ ۙ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌۭ فَيَكُونَ مَعَهُۥ نَذِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālū māli hādhā al-rasūli yaʾkulu al-ṭaʿāma wayamshī fī al-aswāqi lawlā unzila ilayhi malakun fayakūna maʿahu nadhīrā

verses.eng: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
verses.arabic: أَوْ يُلْقَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ كَنزٌ أَوْ تَكُونُ لَهُۥ جَنَّةٌۭ يَأْكُلُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَقَالَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًۭا مَّسْحُورًا
verses.transliteration: Aw yulqā ilayhi kanzun aw takūnu lahu jannatun yaʾkulu minhā wa-qāla al-ẓālimūna in tattabiʿūna illā rajulan masḥūrā

verses.eng: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
verses.arabic: ٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا۟ لَكَ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا۟ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Unẓur kayfa ḍarabū laka al-amthāla faḍallū falā yastaṭīʿūna sabīlā

verses.eng: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.
verses.arabic: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِىٓ إِن شَآءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيْرًۭا مِّن ذَٰلِكَ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ وَيَجْعَل لَّكَ قُصُورًۢا
verses.transliteration: Tabāraka alladhī in shāʾa jaʿala laka khayran min dhālika jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā al-anhāru wayajʿal laka quṣūrā

verses.eng: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
verses.arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلسَّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِمَن كَذَّبَ بِٱلسَّاعَةِ سَعِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Bal kadhabū bi-al-sāʿati wa-aʿtadnā li-man kadhaba bi-al-sāʿati saʿīrā

verses.eng: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
verses.arabic: إِذَا رَأَتْهُم مِّن مَّكَانٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ سَمِعُوا۟ لَهَا تَغَيُّظًۭا وَزَفِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Idhā raʾathum min makānin baʿīdin samiʿū lahā taghayyuẓan wazafīrā

verses.eng: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَآ أُلْقُوا۟ مِنْهَا مَكَانًۭا ضَيِّقًۭا مُّقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا۟ هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā ulqū minhā makānan ḍayyiqan muqarranīna daʿaw hunālika thubūrā

verses.eng: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."
verses.arabic: لَا تَدْعُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ثُبُورًۭا وَٰحِدًۭا وَٱدْعُوا۟ ثُبُورًۭا كَثِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Lā tadʿū al-yawma thubūran wāḥidan wa-udʿū thubūran kathīrā

verses.eng: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination."
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ أَمْ جَنَّةُ ٱلْخُلْدِ ٱلَّتِى وُعِدَ ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ ۚ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَزَآءًۭ وَمَصِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Qul a-dhālika khayrun am jannatu al-khuldi allatī wuʿida al-muttaqūna kānat lahum jazāʾan wamaṣīrā

verses.eng: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.
verses.arabic: لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَاءُونَ خَالِدِينَ ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَسْئُولًا
verses.transliteration: Lahum fīhā mā yashā'ūna khālidīna kāna 'alā rabbika wa'dan mas'ūlā

verses.eng: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقُولُ أَأَنتُمْ أَضْلَلْتُمْ عِبَادِي هَٰؤُلَاءِ أَمْ هُمْ ضَلُّوا الطَّرِيقَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma yaḥshuruhum wa mā ya'budūna min dūni Allāhi fa yaqūlu a antum aḍlaltum 'ibādī hā'ulā'i am hum ḍallū aṭ-ṭarīq

verses.eng: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ مَا كَانَ يَنبَغِي لَنَا أَن نَّتَّخِذَ مِن دُونِكَ مِنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ وَلَٰكِن مَّتَّعْتَهُمْ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكْرَ وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا بُورًا
verses.transliteration: Qālū subḥānaka mā kāna yanbaghī lanā an nattakhidha min dūnika min awliyā'a wa lakin matta'tahum wa ābā'ahum ḥattā nasū adh-dhikra wa kānū qawman būrā

verses.eng: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.
verses.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُم بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًا وَلَا نَصْرًا ۚ وَمَن يَظْلِم مِّنكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًا كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Faqad kadhdhabūkum bimā taqūlūna famā tastatī'ūna ṣarfan wa lā naṣrā wa man yaẓlim minkum nudhiquhu 'adhāban kabīrā

verses.eng: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.
