verses.arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa mā arsalnā qablaka min al-mursalīna illā innahum laya'kulūna aṭ-ṭa'āma wa yamshūna fī al-aswāq wa ja'alnā ba'ḍakum liba'ḍin fitnatan a taṣbirūn wa kāna rabbuka baṣīrā

verses.eng: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَاءَنَا لَوْلَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ اسْتَكْبَرُوا فِي أَنفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْا عُتُوًّا كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla alladhīna lā yarjūna liqā'anā lawlā unzila 'alaynā al-malā'ikatu aw narā rabbanā laqadi istakbarū fī anfusihim wa 'ataw 'utuwwan kabīrā

verses.eng: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا
verses.transliteration: Yawma yarawna al-malā'ikata lā bushra yawma'idhin lil-mujrimīna wa yaqūlūna ḥijran maḥjūrā

verses.eng: And We will approach [i.e., regard] what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
verses.arabic: وَقَدِمْنَا إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا مِنْ عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ هَبَاءً مَّنثُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qadimnā ilā mā 'amilū min 'amalin fa ja'alnāhu habā'an manthūrā

verses.eng: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.
verses.arabic: أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌ مُّسْتَقَرًّا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Aṣḥābu al-jannati yawma'idhin khayrun mustaqarran wa aḥsanu maqīlā

verses.eng: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّمَاءُ بِالْغَمَامِ وَنُزِّلَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma tashaqqaq as-samā'u bi al-ghamāmi wa nuzzila al-malā'ikatu tanzīlā

verses.eng: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.
verses.arabic: الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ عَسِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Al-mulku yawma'idhin al-ḥaqqu li ar-Raḥmāni wa kāna yawman 'alā al-kāfirīna 'asīrā

verses.eng: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ الظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي اتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma ya'aḍḍu aẓ-ẓālimu 'alā yadayhi yaqūlu yā laytanī ittakhadhtu ma'a ar-rasūli sabīlā

verses.eng: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
verses.arabic: يَا وَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Yā waylatā laytanī lam attakhidh fulānan khalīlā

verses.eng: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter.
verses.arabic: لَّقَدْ أَضَلَّنِي عَنِ الذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَاءَنِي ۗ وَكَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ لِلْإِنسَانِ خَذُولًا
verses.transliteration: Laqad aḍallanī 'ani adh-dhikri ba'da idh jā'anī wa kāna ash-shayṭānu lil'insāni khadhūlā

verses.eng: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الرَّسُولُ يَا رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي اتَّخَذُوا هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ مَهْجُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla ar-rasūlu yā rabbi inna qawmī ittakhadhū hādhā al-qur'āna mahjūrā

verses.eng: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا مِّنَ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًا وَنَصِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhālika jaʿalnā li-kulli nabiyyin ʿaduwwan mina l-mujrimīn. Wa kafā bi-rabbika hādiyan wa naṣīrā.

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ جُمْلَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِۦ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَـٰهُ تَرْتِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla alladhīna kafarū lawlā nuzzila ʿalayhi l-qur'ānu jumlatan wāḥidatan. Kadhālika li-nuthabbita bihī fu'ādaka wa rattalnāhu tartīlā.

verses.eng: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa lā ya'tūnaka bi-mathalin illā ji'nāka bi-l-ḥaqqi wa aḥsana tafsīrā.

verses.eng: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in path.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ شَرٌّۭ مَّكَانًۭا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yuḥsharūna ʿalā wujūhihim ilā jahannama ulā'ika sharrun makānan wa aḍallu sabīlā.

verses.eng: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُۥٓ أَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ وَزِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ātaynā mūsā l-kitāba wa jaʿalnā maʿahū akhāhu hārūna wazīrā.

verses.eng: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.
verses.arabic: فَقُلْنَا ٱذْهَبَآ إِلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا ۖ فَدَمَّرْنَـٰهُمْ تَدْمِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Fa-qulnā dh-habā ilā l-qawmi alladhīna kadhdhabū bi-āyātinā fa-dammarnāhum tadmīrā.

verses.eng: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍۢ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُوا۟ ٱلرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ ءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa qawma nūḥin lammā kadhdhabū r-rusula aghraqnāhum wa jaʿalnāhum li-n-nāsi āyatan. Wa aʿtadnā li-ẓ-ẓālimīna ʿadhāban alīmā.

verses.eng: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
verses.arabic: وَعَادًۭا وَثَمُودَ وَأَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًۢا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa ʿādan wa thamūda wa aṣḥāba r-rassi wa qurūnan bayna dhālika kathīrā.

verses.eng: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.
verses.arabic: وَكُلًّۭا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلَ ۖ وَكُلًّۭا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa kullan ḍarabnā lahu l-amthāl. Wa kullan tabbarnā tatbīrā.

verses.eng: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَى ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا۟ يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًۭا
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ataw ʿalā l-qaryati allatī umṭirat maṭara s-saw'i. A-fa-lam yakūnū yarawnahā? Bal kānū lā yarjūna nushūrā.

verses.eng: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ ٱللَّهُ رَسُولًا
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā ra'awka in yattakhidhūnaka illā huzuwan. A-hādhā alladhī baʿatha Llāhu rasūlā?

verses.eng: He would have almost led us astray from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.
verses.arabic: إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لَوْلَآ أَن صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: In kāda la-yuḍillunā ʿan ālihatinā lawlā an ṣabarnā ʿalayhā. Wa sawfa yaʿlamūna ḥīna yarawna l-ʿadhāba man aḍallu sabīlā.

verses.eng: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
verses.arabic: أَرَءَيْتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَـٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ ۖ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا
verses.transliteration: A-ra'ayta mani t-takhadha ilāhahū hawāhu? Afa-anta takūnu ʿalayhi wakīlā?

verses.eng: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
verses.arabic: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Am taḥsabu anna aktharahum yasmaʿūna aw yaʿqilūn? In hum illā ka-l-anʿām. Bal hum aḍallu sabīlā.

verses.eng: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ ٱلظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَجَعَلَهُۥ سَاكِنًۭا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًۭا
verses.transliteration: A-lam tara ilā rabbika kayfa madda ẓ-ẓilla. Wa law shā'a la-jaʿalahū sākinan. Thumma jaʿalnā sh-shamsa ʿalayhi dalīlā.

verses.eng: Then We gradually seize them from where they do not perceive.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَاهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Thumma qabadhnahu ilayna qabdan yasira

verses.eng: And it is He who has made the night a covering for you and sleep a rest and has made the day a resurrection.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَٱلنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ نُشُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee jaAAala lakumu allayla libasan waalnnawma subatan wajaAAala alnnahara nushoora

verses.eng: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَرْسَلَ ٱلرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً طَهُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee arsala alrriyaha bushran bayna yaday rahmatihi waanzalna mina alssama-i maan tahoora

verses.eng: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
verses.arabic: لِّنُحْـِۧيَ بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُۥ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَآ أَنْعَـٰمًا وَأَنَاسِىَّ كَثِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Linuhya bihi baldatan maytan wanusqiyahu mimma khalaqna anAAaman waanasiyya katheera

verses.eng: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَـٰهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا۟ فَأَبَىٰٓ أَكْثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Walaqad sarrafnahu baynahum liyaththakkaroo faaba aktharu alnnasi illa kufoora

verses.eng: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِى كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَّذِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Walaw shina labaAAathna fee kulli qaryatin natheera

verses.eng: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.
verses.arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ وَجَـٰهِدْهُم بِهِۦ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Fala tutiAAi alkafireena wajahidhum bihi jihadan kabeera

verses.eng: And it is He who has released the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ هَـٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَـٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee maraja albahrayni hatha AAathbun furatun wahatha milhun ojajun wajaAAala baynahuma barzakhan wahijran mahjoora

verses.eng: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُۥ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa allathee khalaqa mina almai basharan fajaAAalahu nasaban wasihran wakana rabbuka qadeera

verses.eng: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
verses.arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ ظَهِيرًا
verses.transliteration: WayaAAbudoona min dooni Allahi ma la yanfaAAuhum wala yadurruhum wakana alkafiru AAala rabbihi zaheera

verses.eng: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Wama arsalnaka illa mubashshiran wanatheera

verses.eng: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
verses.transliteration: Qul ma asalukum AAalayhi min ajrin illa man shaa an yattakhitha ila rabbihi sabeela

verses.eng: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -
verses.arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْحَىِّ ٱلَّذِى لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِۦ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِۦ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Watawakkal AAala alhayyi allathee la yamootu wasabbih bihamdihi wakafa bihi bithunoobi AAibadihi khabeera

verses.eng: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۚ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَٱسْـَٔلْ بِهِۦ خَبِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Allathee khalaqa alssamawati waalarda wama baynahuma fee sittati ayyamin thumma istawa AAala alAAarshi alrrahmanu faisal bihi khabeera

verses.eng: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ قَالُوا۟ وَمَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا
verses.transliteration: Waitha qeela lahumu osjudoo lilrrahmani qaloo wama alrrahmanu anasjudu lima tamuruna wazadahum nufoora

verses.eng: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.
verses.arabic: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَاجًا وَقَمَرًا مُّنِيرًا
verses.transliteration: Tabāraka alladhī jaʿala fī al-samāʾi burūjan wajaʿala fīhā sirājan waqamaran munīran

verses.eng: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِّمَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa alladhī jaʿala al-layla waal-nahāra khilfatan liman arāda an yadhakkara aw arāda shukūran

verses.eng: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,
verses.arabic: وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا
verses.transliteration: Waʿibādu al-Raḥmāni alladhīna yamshūna ʿalā al-arḍi hawnan wa-idhā khāṭabahumu al-jāhilūna qālū salāman

verses.eng: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَامًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna yabītūna lirabbihim sujjadan waqiyāman

verses.eng: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā isrif ʿannā ʿadhāba jahannama inna ʿadhābahā kāna gharāman

verses.eng: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."
verses.arabic: إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
verses.transliteration: Innahā sāʾat mustaqarran wamuqāman

verses.eng: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا أَنفَقُوا لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna idhā anfaqū lam yusrifū walam yaqturū wakāna bayna dhālika qawāman

verses.eng: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna lā yadʿūna maʿa Allāhi ilāhan ākhara walā yaqtulūna al-nafsa allatī ḥarrama Allāhu illā bi-al-ḥaqqi walā yaznūna waman yafʿal dhālika yalqa athāman

verses.eng: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -
verses.arabic: يُضَاعَفْ لَهُ الْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِ مُهَانًا
verses.transliteration: Yuḍāʿaf lahu al-ʿadhābu yawma al-qiyāmati wayakhlud fīhi muhānan

verses.eng: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَأُولَـٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ حَسَنَاتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
verses.transliteration: Illā man tāba waāmana waʿamila ʿamalan ṣāliḥan fa-ulāʾika yubaddilu Allāhu sayyiʾātihim ḥasanātin wakāna Allāhu ghafūran raḥīman

verses.eng: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.
verses.arabic: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتَابًا
verses.transliteration: Waman tāba waʿamila �āliḥan fa-innahu yatūbu ilā Allāhi matāban

verses.eng: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ الزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا كِرَامًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna lā yashhadūna al-zūra wa-idhā marrū bi-al-laghwi marrū kirāman

verses.eng: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna idhā dhukkirū bi-āyāti rabbihim lam yakhirrū ʿalayhā ṣumman waʿumyānan

verses.eng: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā hab lanā min azwājinā wadhurriyyātinā qurrata aʿyunin wa-ijʿalnā lil-muttaqīna imāman

verses.eng: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.
verses.arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَامًا
verses.transliteration: Ulāʾika yujzawna al-ghurfata bimā ṣabarū wayulaqqawna fīhā taḥiyyatan wasalāman

verses.eng: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.
verses.arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
verses.transliteration: Khālidīna fīhā ḥasunat mustaqarran wamuqāman

verses.eng: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication? For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent."
verses.arabic: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَأُ بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْلَا دُعَاؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًا
verses.transliteration: Qul mā yaʿbaʾu bikum rabbī lawlā duʿāʾukum faqad kadhdhabtum fasawfa yakūnu lizāman

verses.eng: Ta, Seen, Meem.
verses.arabic: طسٓمٓ
verses.transliteration: Ta-Seen-Meem

verses.eng: These are the verses of the clear Book.
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
verses.transliteration: Tilka āyātu alkitābi almubeen

verses.eng: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
verses.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌۭ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Laʿallaka bākhiʿun nafsaka allā yakoonoo muʾmineen

verses.eng: If We will, We could send down to them a sign from the heaven, before which their necks would remain humbled.
verses.arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةًۭ فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
verses.transliteration: In nashaʾ nunazzil ʿalayhim mina alssamāi āyatan faẓallat aʿnāquhum lahā khāḍiʿeen

verses.eng: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
verses.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā yateehim min thikrin mina alrraḥmāni muḥdathin illā kānū ʿanhu muʿriḍeen

verses.eng: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
verses.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faqad kaḏḏaboo fasayateehim anbāo mā kānū bihi yastahziʾoon

verses.eng: Have they not looked at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۢ كَرِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw ilā al-arḍi kam anbatnā feehā min kulli zawjin kareem

verses.eng: Indeed, in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fee dhālika laāyatan wamā kāna aktharuhum muʾmineen

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka lahuwa alʿazeezu alrraḥeem

verses.eng: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idh nādā rabbuka moosā ani iti alqawma alẓẓāleemeen

verses.eng: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"
verses.arabic: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qawma firʿawna alā yattaqoon

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi innee akhāfu an yukaḏḏiboon

verses.eng: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
verses.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayaḍeequ ṣadree walā yanṭaliqu lisanee fa-arsil ilā hārūn

verses.eng: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
verses.arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌۭ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
verses.transliteration: Walahum ʿalayya dhanbun fa-akhāfu an yaqtuloon

verses.eng: [Allah] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
verses.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla kallā fa-idhhabā bi-āyātinā innā maʿakum mustamiʿoon

verses.eng: So go to Pharaoh and say, 'Indeed, we are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,'
verses.arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'tiyā fir'awna faqūlā innā rasūlu rabbi l-'ālamīn

verses.eng: [Commanding him], 'Send with us the Children of Israel.'
verses.arabic: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.transliteration: An arsil ma'anā banī isrā'īl

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, 'Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla alam nurabbika fīnā walīdan walabithta fīnā min 'umurika sinīn

verses.eng: And you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful.'
verses.arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wafa'alta fa'lataka allatī fa'alta wa'anta mina l-kāfirīn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, 'I did it then, while I was of those astray.
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa'altuhā idhan wa'anā mina ḍ-ḍāllīn

verses.eng: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and made me of the messengers.
verses.arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fafarartu minkum lammā khiftukum fawahaba lī rabbī ḥukmaw waja'alanī mina l-mursalīn

verses.eng: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?'
verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.transliteration: Watilka ni'matun tamunnuhā 'alayya an 'abbadta banī isrā'īl

verses.eng: Pharaoh said, 'And what is the Lord of the worlds?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fir'awnu wa mā rabbu l-'ālamīn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, 'The Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them, if you should be convinced.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbu s-samāwāti wa l-arḍi wa mā baynahumā in kuntum mūqinīn

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, 'Do you not hear?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla li man ḥawlahu alā tastami'ūn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, 'Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbukum wa rabbu ābā'ikumu l-awwalīn

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, 'Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla inna rasūlakumu alladhī ursila ilaykum lamajnūn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, 'Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbu l-mashriqi wa l-maghribi wa mā baynahumā in kuntum ta'qilūn

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, 'If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla la'ini ittakhadhta ilāhan ghayrī la'aj'alannaka mina l-masjūnīn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, 'Even if I brought you proof manifest?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيْءٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Qāla a walaw ji'tuka bishay'in mubīn

verses.eng: He said, 'Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla fa'ti bihi in kunta mina aṣ-ṣādiqīn

verses.eng: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.
verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Fa'alqā 'aṣāhu fa'idhā hiya thu'bānun mubīn

verses.eng: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
verses.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wanaza'a yadahu fa'idhā hiya bayḍā'u lilnnāẓirīn

verses.eng: He said to the eminent ones around him, 'Indeed, this is a learned magician.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lilmalai ḥawlahu innahādhā lasāḥirun 'alīm

verses.eng: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you instruct?
verses.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yurīdu an yukhrijakum min arḍikum bisih'rihi famādhā ta'murūn

verses.eng: They said, 'Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَأَرْسِلْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū arjih wa'akhāhu wa'arsil fī l-madāini ḥāshirīn

verses.eng: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician.'
verses.arabic: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Ya'tūka bikulli saḥḥārin 'alīm

verses.eng: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.
verses.arabic: فَجُمِعَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَـٰتِ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Fajumi'a as-saḥaratu limīqāti yawmin ma'lūm

verses.eng: And it was said to the people, 'Will you congregate
verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqīla linnāsi hal antum mujtami'ūn

verses.eng: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?'
verses.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: La'allanā nattabi'u as-saḥarata in kānū humu l-ghālibīn

verses.eng: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, 'Will there indeed be a reward for us if we are the predominant?'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jā'a as-saḥaratu qālū lifir'awna a'inna lanā la'ajran in kunnā naḥnu l-ghālibīn

verses.eng: He said, 'Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me].'
verses.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًۭا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla na'am wa'innakum idhan lamina l-muqarrabīn

verses.eng: Moses said to them, 'Throw whatever you will throw.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla lahum mūsā alqū mā antum mulqūn

verses.eng: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, 'By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant.'
verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'alqaw ḥibālahum wa'isiyyahum waqālū bi'izzati fir'awna innā lanaḥnu l-ghālibūn

verses.eng: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'alqā mūsā 'aṣāhu fa'idhā hiya talqafu mā ya'fikūn

verses.eng: So the magicians fell down in prostration.
verses.arabic: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'ulqiya as-saharatu sajideen

verses.eng: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
verses.arabic: قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo amanna birabbi al-'alameen

verses.eng: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
verses.arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi Moosa wa Haroon

verses.eng: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."
verses.arabic: قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِي جُذُوعِ النَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَا أَشَدُّ عَذَابًا وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Qala amantum lahu qabla an athana lakum innahu lakabeerukum allathee 'allamakumu assihra falaoqatti'anna aydiyakum wa arjulakum min khilafin walaosallibannakum fee judhoo'i annakhli walata'lamunna ayyuna ashaddu 'athaban wa abqa

verses.eng: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo la dayra inna ila rabbina munqaliboon

verses.eng: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَن كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna natma'u an yaghfira lana rabbuna khataayana an kunna awwala almu'mineen

verses.eng: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
verses.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa awhayna ila Moosa an asri bi'ibadee innakum muttaba'oon

verses.eng: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers
verses.arabic: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'arsala Fir'awnu fee almadaini hashireen

verses.eng: [And said], "Indeed, these are but a small band,
verses.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna ha'ula'i lashirdhimatun qaleeloon

verses.eng: And indeed, they are enraging us
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَائِظُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa innahum lana lagha'ithoon

verses.eng: And indeed, we are a cautious society..."
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna lajamee'un hathiroon

verses.eng: So We removed them from gardens and springs
verses.arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُم مِّن جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.transliteration: Fa'akhrajnahum min jannatin wa 'uyoon

verses.eng: And treasures and honorable station -
verses.arabic: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa kunoozin wa maqamin kareem

verses.eng: Thus. And We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.transliteration: Kathalika wa awrathnaha banee isra'eel

verses.eng: So they pursued them at sunrise.
verses.arabic: فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'atba'uhum mushriqeen

verses.eng: So when the two forces sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma tara'a aljam'aani qaala as-haabu Moosaaa innaa lamudrakoon

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
verses.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
verses.transliteration: Qaala kallaaa inna ma'iya Rabbee sa yahdeen

verses.eng: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
verses.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍۢ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Faawhaynaaa ilaa Moosaaa anidrib bi'asaakal bahra fanfalaqa fakaana kullu firqin kattawdil 'azeem

verses.eng: And We brought near the others [i.e., the pursuers] to that place.
verses.arabic: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa azlafnaa thammal aakhareen

verses.eng: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
verses.arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa anjainaa Moosaa wa mam ma'ahooo ajma'een

verses.eng: Then We drowned the others.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma aghraqnal aakhareen

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka lahuwal 'Azeezur Raheem

verses.eng: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
verses.arabic: وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Watlu 'alaihim naba'a Ibraaheem

verses.eng: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi wa qawmihee maa ta'budoon

verses.eng: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًۭا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo na'budu asnaaman fanazzallu lahaa 'aakifeen

verses.eng: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaala hal yasma'oonakum iz tad'oon

verses.eng: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
verses.arabic: أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ
verses.transliteration: Aw yanfa'oonakum aw yadurroon

verses.eng: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo bal wajadnaaa aabaaa'anaa kazaalika yaf'aloon

verses.eng: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshiping,
verses.arabic: قَالَ أَفَرَءَيْتُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaala afara'aytum maa kuntum ta'budoon

verses.eng: You and your forefathers before you.
verses.arabic: أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُمُ ٱلْأَقْدَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Antum waābāukumu al-aqdamūna

verses.eng: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,
verses.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّۭ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-innahum ʿaduwwun lī illā rabba al-ʿālamīna

verses.eng: Who created me, and He guides me.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَنِى فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ
verses.transliteration: Alladhī khalaqanī fahuwa yahdīni

verses.eng: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِى هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِى وَيَسْقِينِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhī huwa yuṭʿimunī wa-yasqīni

verses.eng: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā maridtu fahuwa yashfīni

verses.eng: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِى يُمِيتُنِى ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhī yumītunī thumma yuḥyīni

verses.eng: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhī aṭmaʿu an yaghfira lī khaṭīatī yawma al-dīni

verses.eng: My Lord, grant me wisdom and join me with the righteous.
verses.arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًۭا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi hab lī ḥukman wa-alḥiqnī bi-al-ṣāliḥīna

verses.eng: And grant me a mention of honor among later generations.
verses.arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍۢ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ijʿal lī lisāna ṣidqin fī al-ākhirīna

verses.eng: And make me of the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
verses.arabic: وَٱجْعَلْنِى مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ijʿalnī min warathati jannati al-naʿīmi

verses.eng: And forgive my father. Indeed, he was of those who went astray.
verses.arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-ighfir li-abī innahu kāna mina al-ḍāllīna

verses.eng: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are resurrected.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُخْزِنِى يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-lā tukhzinī yawma yubʿathūna

verses.eng: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children.
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌۭ وَلَا بَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yawma lā yanfaʿu mālun wa-lā banūna

verses.eng: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍۢ سَلِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Illā man atā Allāha biqalbin salīmin

verses.eng: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-uzlifati al-jannatu lil-muttaqīna

verses.eng: And Hell will be brought forth for the deviators,
verses.arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa burrizati aljaheemu lilghaweena

verses.eng: And it will be said to them, 'Where is that which you used to worship
verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qeela lahum ayna ma kuntum ta'budoona

verses.eng: Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'
verses.arabic: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Min dooni Allahi hal yansuroonakum aw yantasiroona

verses.eng: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators
verses.arabic: فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ وَالْغَاوُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fakubkiboo feeha hum walghawoona

verses.eng: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
verses.arabic: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wajunoodu ibleesa ajma'oona

verses.eng: They will say while they dispute therein,
verses.arabic: قَالُوا وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaloo wahum feeha yakhtasimoona

verses.eng: 'By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error
verses.arabic: تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: TaAllahi in kunna lafee dalalin mubeenin

verses.eng: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ith nusawweekum birabbi al'alameena

verses.eng: And no one misguided us except the criminals.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلَّا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama adallana illa almujrimoona

verses.eng: So now we have no intercessors
verses.arabic: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَافِعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fama lana min shafi'eena

verses.eng: And not a devoted friend.
verses.arabic: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wala sadeeqin hameemin

verses.eng: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers.'
verses.arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falaw anna lana karratan fanakoona mina almu'mineena

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wama kana aktharuhum mu'mineena

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka lahuwa al'azeezu alrraheemu

verses.eng: The people of Noah denied the messengers.
verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kaththabat qawmu noohin almursaleena

verses.eng: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?"
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla lahum akhūhum nūḥun alā tattaqūn

verses.eng: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
verses.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Innī lakum rasūlun amīn

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allaha wa aṭīʿūn

verses.eng: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā as'alukum ʿalayhi min ajrin in ajriya illā ʿalā rabbi l-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me."
verses.arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allaha wa aṭīʿūn

verses.eng: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
verses.arabic: قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَاتَّبَعَكَ الْأَرْذَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū a nu'minu laka wa ittabaʿaka l-ardhalūn

verses.eng: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?"
verses.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla wa mā ʿilmī bimā kānū yaʿmalūn

verses.eng: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
verses.arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: In ḥisābuhum illā ʿalā rabbī law tashʿurūn

verses.eng: And I am not one to drive away the believers.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَنَا بِطَارِدِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā anā biṭāridi l-mu'minīn

verses.eng: I am only a clear warner."
verses.arabic: إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: In anā illā nadhīrun mubīn

verses.eng: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū la'in lam tantahi yā nūḥu latakūnanna mina l-marjūmīn

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي كَذَّبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi inna qawmī kadhdhabūn

verses.eng: So judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those believers who are with me."
verses.arabic: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faftaḥ baynī wa baynahum fatḥan wa najjinī wa man maʿiya mina l-mu'minīn

verses.eng: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fa anjaynāhu wa man maʿahu fī l-fulki l-mashḥūn

verses.eng: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ الْبَاقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma aghraqnā baʿdu l-bāqīn

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةًۭ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fī dhālika laāyatan wamā kāna aktharuhum mu'minīna

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka lahuwa al-ʿazīzu al-raḥīmu

verses.eng: The 'Aad denied the messengers.
verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kadhabat ʿādun al-mursalīna

verses.eng: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?"
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla lahum akhūhum hūdun alā tattaqūna

verses.eng: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
verses.arabic: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Innī lakum rasūlun amīnun

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allāha wa-aṭīʿūni

verses.eng: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍۢ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā as'alukum ʿalayhi min ajrin in ajriya illā ʿalā rabbi al-ʿālamīna

verses.eng: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves?
verses.arabic: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ ءَايَةًۭ تَعْبَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Atabnūna bikulli rīʿin āyatan taʿbathūna

verses.eng: And you take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?
verses.arabic: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa tattakhidhūna maṣāniʿa laʿallakum takhludūna

verses.eng: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُم بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā baṭashtum baṭashtum jabbārīna

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allāha wa-aṭīʿūni

verses.eng: And fear He who has provided you with what you know,
verses.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa attaqū alladhī amaddakum bimā taʿlamūna

verses.eng: He who provided you with grazing livestock and children
verses.arabic: أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنْعَـٰمٍۢ وَبَنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Amaddakum bi-anʿāmin wa banīna

verses.eng: And gardens and springs.
verses.arabic: وَجَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa jannātin wa ʿuyūnin

verses.eng: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day.
verses.arabic: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Innī akhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

verses.eng: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū sawā'un ʿalaynā awaʿaẓta am lam takun mina l-wāʿiẓīn

verses.eng: This [message] is not but the custom of the former peoples,
verses.arabic: إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا خُلُقُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: In hādhā illā khuluqu l-awwalīn

verses.eng: And we are not to be punished."
verses.arabic: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā naḥnu bimuʿadhabīn

verses.eng: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakadhabūhu fa-ahlaknāhum. Inna fī dhālika laāyatan wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu'minīn

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna rabbaka lahuwa l-ʿazīzu l-raḥīm

verses.eng: The people of Thamud denied the messengers,
verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kadhabat Thamūdu al-mursalīna

verses.eng: When their brother Salih said to them, 'Will you not fear Allah?'
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla lahum akhūhum Ṣāliḥun alā tattaqūna

verses.eng: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
verses.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Innī lakum rasūlun amīnun

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allāha wa aṭīʿūni

verses.eng: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍۢ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā as'alukum ʿalayhi min ajrin in ajriya illā ʿalā rabbi al-ʿālamīna

verses.eng: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
verses.arabic: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِى مَا هَـٰهُنَآ ءَامِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Atut'rakūna fī mā hāhunā āminīna

verses.eng: In gardens and springs
verses.arabic: فِى جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Fī jannātin wa ʿuyūnin

verses.eng: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
verses.arabic: وَزُرُوعٍۢ وَنَخْلٍۢ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa zurūʿin wa nakhlīn ṭalʿuhā haḍīmun

verses.eng: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
verses.arabic: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًۭا فَـٰرِهِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa tanḥitūna mina al-jibāli buyūtan fārihīna

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allāha wa aṭīʿūni

verses.eng: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُطِيعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tuṭīʿū amra al-mus'rifīna

verses.eng: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend.
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yufsidūna fī al-arḍi wa lā yuṣliḥūna

verses.eng: They said, 'You are only of those affected by magic.
verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū innamā anta mina al-musaḥḥarīna

verses.eng: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful.'
verses.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Mā anta illā basharun mithlunā fa'ti biāyatin in kunta mina al-ṣādiqīna

verses.eng: He said, 'This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌۭ لَّهَا شِرْبٌۭ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Qāla hādhihi nāqatun lahā shirbun wa lakum shirbu yawmin maʿlūmin

verses.eng: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍۢ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tamassūhā bisū'in faya'khudhakum 'adhābu yawmin 'aẓīm.

verses.eng: But they hamstrung her, and then they became regretful.
verses.arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ نَـٰدِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'aqarūhā fa'aṣbaḥū nādimīn.

verses.eng: So the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to believe.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'akhadhahumu l-'adhāb. Inna fī dhālika la'āyatan wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu'minīn.

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna rabbaka lahuwa l-'azīzu r-raḥīm.

verses.eng: The people of Lot denied the messengers.
verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kadhabat qawmu Lūṭin l-mursalīn.

verses.eng: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?"
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla lahum akhūhum Lūṭun alā tattaqūn.

verses.eng: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
verses.arabic: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Innī lakum rasūlun amīn.

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Llāha wa aṭī'ūn.

verses.eng: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā as'alukum 'alayhi min ajr. In ajriya illā 'alā rabbi l-'ālamīn.

verses.eng: Do you approach males among the worlds
verses.arabic: أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ata'tūna dh-dhukrāna mina l-'ālamīn.

verses.eng: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
verses.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌۭ عَادُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa tadharūna mā khalaqa lakum rabbukum min azwājikum. Bal antum qawmun 'ādūn.

verses.eng: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū la'il lam tantahi yā Lūṭu latakūnanna mina l-mukhrajiīn.

verses.eng: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it]."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّى لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْقَالِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla innī li'amalikum mina l-qālīn.

verses.eng: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
verses.arabic: رَبِّ نَجِّنِى وَأَهْلِى مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Rabbi najjinī wa ahlī mimmā ya'malūn.

verses.eng: So We saved him and his family, all,
verses.arabic: فَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fanajjaynāhu wa ahlahu ajma'īn.

verses.eng: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illā ʿajūzan fī al-ghābirīn

verses.eng: Then We destroyed the others.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma dammarnā al-ākharīn

verses.eng: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
verses.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa amṭarnā ʿalayhim maṭaran fasāʾa maṭaru al-muntharīn

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fī dhālika laʾāyatan wamā kāna aktharuhum muʾminīn

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka lahuwa al-ʿazīzu al-raḥīm

verses.eng: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers
verses.arabic: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kadhdhaba aṣḥābu al-aykati al-mursalīn

verses.eng: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?"
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idh qāla lahum Shuʿaybun alā tattaqūn

verses.eng: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
verses.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Innī lakum rasūlun amīn

verses.eng: So fear Allah and obey me.
verses.arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.transliteration: Fattaqū Allaha wa aṭīʿūn

verses.eng: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā asʾalukum ʿalayhi min ajrin in ajriya illā ʿalā rabbi al-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
verses.arabic: أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Awfū al-kayla wa lā takūnū mina al-mukhsirīn

verses.eng: And weigh with an even balance.
verses.arabic: وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wazinū bil-qisṭāsi al-mustaqīm

verses.eng: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tabkhasū al-nāsa ashyāʾahum wa lā taʿthaw fī al-arḍi mufsidīn

verses.eng: And fear He who created you and the former peoples.
verses.arabic: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالْجِبِلَّةَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wattaqū alladhī khalaqakum wa al-jibilata al-awwalīn

verses.eng: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū innamā anta mina al-musaḥḥarīn

verses.eng: And you are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are of the liars.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَإِنْ نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in anta illa basharun mithluna wa in nazunnuka lamina alkathibeen

verses.eng: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful.
verses.arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa asqit AAalayna kisafan mina alssama-i in kunta mina alssadiqeen

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbee aAAlamu bima taAAmaloon

verses.eng: But they denied him, so the punishment of the Day of the Black Cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.
verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Fakaththaboohu faakhathahum AAathabu yawmi alththullati innahu kana AAathaba yawmin AAatheem

verses.eng: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wama kana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.eng: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka lahuwa alAAazeezu alrraheem

verses.eng: And indeed, it is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنْزِيلُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-innahu latanzeelu rabbi alAAalameen

verses.eng: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down
verses.arabic: نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ
verses.transliteration: Nazala bihi alrroohu al-ameen

verses.eng: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -
verses.arabic: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنْذِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: AAala qalbika litakoona mina almunthireen

verses.eng: In a clear Arabic language.
verses.arabic: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيٍّ مُبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Bilisanin AArabiyyin mubeen

verses.eng: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-innahu lafee zuburi al-awwaleen

verses.eng: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُمْ آيَةً أَنْ يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yakun lahum ayatan an yaAAlamahu AAulamao banee isra-eela

verses.eng: And if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ الْأَعْجَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaw nazzalnahu AAala baAAdi al-aAAjameen

verses.eng: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would not have believed in it.
verses.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faqaraahu AAalayhim ma kanoo bihi mu/mineen

verses.eng: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَاهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Kathalika salaknahu fee quloobi almujrimeen

verses.eng: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
verses.arabic: فَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Falā yu'minūna bihī ḥattā yarawū l-ʿadhāba l-alīma

verses.eng: So it will come upon them suddenly while they perceive not.
verses.arabic: فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةًۭ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faya'tiyahum baghtatan wahum lā yashʿurūna

verses.eng: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
verses.arabic: فَيَقُولُوا۟ هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fayaqūlū hal naḥnu munẓarūna

verses.eng: Then do they wish to hasten Our punishment?
verses.arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Afabiʿadhābinā yastaʿjilūna

verses.eng: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
verses.arabic: أَفَرَءَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَـٰهُمْ سِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Afara'ayta in mattaʿnāhum sinīna

verses.eng: And then there came to them that which they were promised?
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ جَآءَهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma jā'ahum mā kānū yūʿadūna

verses.eng: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
verses.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mā aghnā ʿanhum mā kānū yumattaʿūna

verses.eng: And We did not destroy any city but that it had warners
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā ahlaknā min qaryatin illā lahā mundhirūna

verses.eng: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
verses.arabic: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Dhikrā wa mā kunnā ẓālimīna

verses.eng: And the devils have not brought it [i.e., the Quran] down.
verses.arabic: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā tanazzalat bihi l-shayāṭīnu

verses.eng: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
verses.arabic: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā yanbaghī lahum wa mā yastaṭīʿūna

verses.eng: Indeed, they are removed from hearing it.
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innahum ʿani l-samʿi lamaʿzūlūna

verses.eng: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
verses.arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falā tadʿu maʿa Allāhi ilāhan ākhara fatakūna mina l-muʿadhabīna

verses.eng: And warn your closest kindred.
verses.arabic: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ ٱلْأَقْرَبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa andhir ʿashīrataka l-aqrabīna

verses.eng: And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to those who follow you of the believers.
verses.arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ikhfiḍ janāḥaka limani ittabaʿaka mina l-mu'minīna

verses.eng: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
verses.arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-in ʿaṣawka faqul innī barīon mimmā taʿmalūn

verses.eng: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
verses.arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Wa tawakkal ʿalā al-ʿazīzi al-raḥīm

verses.eng: Who sees you when you arise
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يَرَىٰكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
verses.transliteration: Alladhī yarāka ḥīna taqūm

verses.eng: And your movement among those who prostrate.
verses.arabic: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wataqallubaka fī al-sājidīn

verses.eng: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Innahu huwa al-samīʿu al-ʿalīm

verses.eng: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
verses.arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
verses.transliteration: Hal unabbi'ukum ʿalā man tanzilu al-shayāṭīn

verses.eng: They descend upon every sinful liar.
verses.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Tanzilu ʿalā kulli affākin athīm

verses.eng: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.
verses.arabic: يُلْقُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَـٰذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yulqūna al-samʿa wa-aktharuhum kādhibūn

verses.eng: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;
verses.arabic: وَٱلشُّعَرَآءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ ٱلْغَاوُۥنَ
verses.transliteration: Wa al-shuʿarāu yattabiʿuhumu al-ghāwūn

verses.eng: Do you not see that in every valley they roam
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍۢ يَهِيمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara annahum fī kulli wādin yahīmūn

verses.eng: And that they say what they do not do?
verses.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa annahum yaqūlūna mā lā yafʿalūn

verses.eng: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍۢ يَنقَلِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Illā alladhīna āmanū waʿamilū al-ṣāliḥāti wa-dhakarū Allāha kathīran wa-intaṣarū min baʿdi mā ẓulimū wa-sayaʿlamu alladhīna ẓalamū ayyā munqalabin yanqalibūn

verses.eng: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book
verses.arabic: طسٓ ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَكِتَابٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Ta-Seen. Tilka ayatu alqur-ani wakitabin mubeen

verses.eng: As guidance and good tidings for the believers
verses.arabic: هُدًۭى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Hudan wabushra lilmu/mineen

verses.eng: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain
verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allatheena yuqeemoona alssalata wayu/toona alzzakata wahum bial-akhirati hum yooqinoon

verses.eng: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna allatheena la yu/minoona bial-akhirati zayyanna lahum aAAmalahum fahum yaAAmahoon

verses.eng: It is they who will have the worst punishment, and in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ola-ika allatheena lahum soo-o alAAathabi wahum fee al-akhirati humu al-akhsaroon

verses.eng: And indeed, you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa-innaka latulaqqa alqur-ana min ladun hakeemin AAaleem

verses.eng: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."
verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِۦٓ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًۭا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍۢ قَبَسٍۢ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ith qala moosa li-ahlihi innee anastu naran saateekum minha bikhabarin aw ateekum bishihabin qabasin laAAallakum tastaloon

verses.eng: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِىَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falamma jaaha noodiya an buwrika man fee alnnari waman hawlahaa wasubhana Allahi rabbi alAAalameen

verses.eng: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
verses.arabic: يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Ya moosa innahu ana Allahu alAAazeezu alhakeem

verses.eng: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.
verses.arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّۭ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًۭا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ إِنِّى لَا يَخَافُ لَدَىَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-alqi AAasaka falamma raaha tahtazzu kaannaha jannun walla mudbiran walam yuAAaqqib ya moosa la takhaf innee la yakhafu ladayya almursaloon

verses.eng: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.
verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنَۢا بَعْدَ سُوٓءٍۢ فَإِنِّى غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Illa man thalamma thumma baddala husnan baAAda soo-in fa-innee ghafoorun raheem

verses.eng: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."
verses.arabic: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍۢ ۖ فِى تِسْعِ ءَايَـٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا فَـٰسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-adkhil yadaka fee jaybika takhruj baydaa min ghayri soo-in fee tisAAi ayatin ila firAAawna waqawmihi innahum kanoo qawman fasiqeen

verses.eng: But when Our visible signs came to them, they said, "This is obvious magic."
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا مُبْصِرَةًۭ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Falamma jaathum ayatuna mubsiratan qaloo hatha sihrun mubeen

verses.eng: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
verses.arabic: وَجَحَدُوا۟ بِهَا وَٱسْتَيْقَنَتْهَآ أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًۭا وَعُلُوًّۭا ۚ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wajahadoo biha waistayqanatha anfusuhum thulman waAAuluwwan faonthur kayfa kana AAaqibatu almufsideen

verses.eng: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيْمَـٰنَ عِلْمًۭا ۖ وَقَالَا ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍۢ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad atayna dawooda wasulaymana AAilman waqala alhamdu lillahi allathee faddalana AAala katheerin min AAibadihi almu/mineen

verses.eng: And Solomon inherited David. He said, 'O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty.'
verses.arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَانُ دَاوُودَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنْطِقَ الطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Wa waritha sulaymānu dāwūda wa qāla yā ayyuhā an-nāsu ʿullimnā manṭiqa aṭ-ṭayri wa ūtīnā min kulli shayʾin inna hādhā lahuwa al-faḍlu al-mubīn

verses.eng: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.
verses.arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَانَ جُنُودُهُ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ وَالطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ḥushira lisulaymāna junūduhu mina al-jinni wal-insi waṭ-ṭayri fahum yūzaʿūn

verses.eng: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, 'O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not.'
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ النَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā ataw ʿalā wādi an-namli qālat namlatun yā ayyuhā an-namlu udkhulū masākinakum lā yaḥṭimannakum sulaymānu wa junūduhu wa hum lā yashʿurūn

verses.eng: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, 'My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants.'
verses.arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِنْ قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fatabassama ḍāḥikan min qawlihā wa qāla rabbi awziʿnī an ashkura niʿmataka allatī anʿamta ʿalayya wa ʿalā wālidayya wa an aʿmala Ṣāliḥan tarḍāhu wa adkhilnī biraḥmatika fī ʿibādika aṣ-Ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: And he took attendance of the birds and said, 'Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?'
verses.arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لَا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa tafaqqada aṭ-ṭayra faqāla mā liya lā arā al-hudhuda am kāna mina al-ghāʾibīn

verses.eng: 'I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization.'
verses.arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Laʿudhhibannahu ʿadhāban shadīdan aw laʾadhbaḥannahu aw layaʾtiyannī bisulṭānin mubīn

verses.eng: But the hoopoe stayed not long and said, 'I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.'
verses.arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُّ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِنْ سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Famakatha ghayra baʿīdin faqāla aḥaṭtu bimā lam tuḥiṭ bihi wa jiʾtuka min sabaʾin binabaʾin yaqīn

verses.eng: 'Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.'
verses.arabic: إِنِّي وَجَدْتُ امْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Innī wajadtu imraʾatan tamlikuhum wa ūtiyat min kulli shayʾin wa lahā ʿarshun ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: 'I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,'
verses.arabic: وَجَدْتُهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wajadtuhā wa qawmahā yasjudūna lish-shamsi min dūni allāhi wa zayyana lahumu ash-shayṭānu aʿmālahum faṣaddahum ʿani as-sabīli fahum lā yahtadūn

verses.eng: '[And] so they do not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -'
verses.arabic: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allā yasjudū lillāhi alladhī yukhriju al-khabʾa fī as-samāwāti wal-arḍi wa yaʿlamu mā tukhfūna wa mā tuʿlinūn

verses.eng: 'Allah - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne.'
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu lā ilāha illā huwa rabbu al-ʿarshi al-ʿaẓīm

verses.eng: [Solomon] said, 'We will see whether you were truthful or were of the liars.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ سَنَنْظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
