verses.transliteration: Qāla sananẓuru aṣadaqta am kunta mina al-kādhibīn

verses.eng: 'Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return.'
verses.arabic: اذْهَبْ بِكِتَابِي هَٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَانْظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Idhhab bikitābī hādhā faʾalqih ilayhim thumma tawalla ʿanhum fānẓur mādhā yarjiʿūn

verses.eng: She said, 'O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.'
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ إِنِّي أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qālat yā ayyuhā al-malaʾu innī ulqiya ilayya kitābun karīm

verses.eng: 'Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,
verses.arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Innahu min sulaymāna wa innahu bismi allāhi ar-raḥmāni ar-raḥīm

verses.eng: Do not be arrogant toward me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].'
verses.arabic: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Allā taʿlū ʿalayya waʾtūnī muslimīn

verses.eng: She said, 'O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me.'
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِي فِي أَمْرِي مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qālat yā ayyuhā l-malaʾu aftūnī fī amrī mā kuntu qāṭiʿatan amran ḥattā tashhadūn

verses.eng: They said, 'We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا نَحْنُ أُولُو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولُو بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَالْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَانظُرِي مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū naḥnu ulū quwwatin waulū baʾsin shadīdin wal-amru ilayki fa-unẓurī mādhā taʾmurīn

verses.eng: She said, 'Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.'
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ إِنَّ الْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَا أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālat inna l-mulūka idhā dakhalū qaryatan afsadūhā wajaʿalū aʿizzata ahlihā adhillatan wakadhālika yafʿalūn

verses.eng: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return.'
verses.arabic: وَإِنِّي مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-innī mursilatun ilayhim bihadīyatin fanaẓiratun bima yarjiʿu l-mursalūn

verses.eng: So when they came to Solomon, he said, 'Do you provide me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَا آتَانِيَ اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا آتَاكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jāʾa sulaymāna qāla atumiddūnan bimālin famā ātāniya llāhu khayrun mimmā ātākum bal antum bihadīyatikum tafraḥūn

verses.eng: Return to them, for we will surely come to them with soldiers that they will be powerless to encounter, and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation, and they will be debased.'
verses.arabic: ارْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَا أَذِلَّةً وَهُمْ صَاغِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Irjiʿ ilayhim falanātiyannahum bijunūdin lā qibala lahum bihā walanukhrijannahum minhā adhillatan wahum ṣāghirūn

verses.eng: [Solomon] said, 'O assembly [of jinn], which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِي بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā ayyuhā l-malaʾu ayyukum yaʾtīnī biʿarshihā qabla an yaʾtūnī muslimīn

verses.eng: A powerful one from among the jinn said, 'I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ أَنَا آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّي عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِيٌّ أَمِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla ʿifritun mina l-jinni anā ātīka bihi qabla an taqūma min maqāmika wa-innī ʿalayhi laqawiyyun amīn

verses.eng: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, 'I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you.' And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, 'This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever is ungrateful - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ الَّذِي عِندَهُ عِلْمٌ مِّنَ الْكِتَابِ أَنَا آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُ قَالَ هَٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّي لِيَبْلُوَنِي أَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّي غَنِيٌّ كَرِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla alladhī ʿindahu ʿilmun mina l-kitābi anā ātīka bihi qabla an yartadda ilayka ṭarfuka falammā raʾāhu mustaqirran ʿindahu qāla hādhā min faḍli rabbī liyabluwanī aʾashkuru am akfuru waman shakara fa-innamā yashkuru linafsihi waman kafara fa-inna rabbī ghaniyyun karīm

verses.eng: He said, 'Disguise for her her throne; we will see whether she will be guided [to truth] or will be of those who are not guided.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ نَكِّرُوا لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِي أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla nakkirū lahā ʿarshahā nanẓur ahtahidī am takūnu mina alladhīna lā yahtadūn

verses.eng: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], 'Is your throne like this?' She said, '[It is] as though it was it.' [Solomon said], 'And we were given knowledge before her, and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allah].'
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَتْ قِيلَ أَهَٰكَذَا عَرْشُكِ ۖ قَالَتْ كَأَنَّهُ هُوَ ۚ وَأُوتِينَا الْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jāʾat qīla ahākadhā ʿarshuki qālat kaʾannahu huwa waūtīnā l-ʿilma min qablihā wakunnā muslimīn

verses.eng: And that which she was worshipping other than Allah had averted her [from submission to Him]. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people.
verses.arabic: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعْبُدُ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ مِن قَوْمٍ كَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waṣaddahā mā kānat taʿbudu min dūni llāhi innahā kānat min qawmin kāfirīn

verses.eng: She was told, 'Enter the palace.' But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water and uncovered her shins [to wade through]. He said, 'Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass.' She said, 'My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the worlds.'
verses.arabic: قِيلَ لَهَا ادْخُلِي الصَّرْحَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَتْهُ حَسِبَتْهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَتْ عَن سَاقَيْهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُ صَرْحٌ مُّمَرَّدٌ مِّن قَوَارِيرَ ۗ قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي وَأَسْلَمْتُ مَعَ سُلَيْمَانَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qīla lahā udkhulī l-ṣarḥa falammā raʾathu ḥasibathu lujjatan wakashafat ʿan sāqayhā qāla innahu ṣarḥun mumarradun min qawārīra qālat rabbi innī ẓalamtu nafsī wa-aslamtu maʿa sulaymāna lillāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: And We had certainly sent to Thamud their brother Salih, [saying], 'Worship Allah,' and at once they were two parties conflicting.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَالِحًا أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمْ فَرِيقَانِ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalnā ilā thamūda akhāhum ṣāliḥan ani uʿbudū llāha fa-idhā hum farīqāni yakhtaṣimūn

verses.eng: He said, 'O my people, why are you impatient for evil before [good]? Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allah that you may receive mercy?'
verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ ۖ لَوْلَا تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā qawmi lima tastaʿjilūna bil-sayiʾati qabla al-ḥasanati lawlā tastaghfirūna Allāha laʿallakum turḥamūn

verses.eng: They said, 'We consider you and those with you a bad omen.' He said, 'Your omen is with Allah. Rather, you are a people being tested.'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱطَّيَّرْنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَ ۚ قَالَ طَـٰٓئِرُكُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌۭ تُفْتَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū iṭṭayyarnā bika wabiman maʿaka qāla ṭāʾirukum ʿinda Allāhi bal antum qawmun tuftanūn

verses.eng: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].
verses.arabic: وَكَانَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ تِسْعَةُ رَهْطٍۢ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wakāna fī al-madīnati tisʿatu rahṭin yufsidūna fī al-arḍi walā yuṣliḥūn

verses.eng: They said, 'Take a mutual oath by Allah that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, "We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful."'
verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَقَاسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُۥ وَأَهْلَهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِذِى عَهْدٍۢ مَّا شَهِدْنَا مَهْلِكَ أَهْلِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qālū taqāsamū bi-llahi lanubayyitannahu wa-ahlahu thumma lanaqūlanna li-dhī ʿahdin mā shahidnā mahlika ahlihi wa-innā laṣādiqūn

verses.eng: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.
verses.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًۭا وَمَكَرْنَا مَكْرًۭا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamakarū makran wamakarnā makran wahum lā yashʿurūn

verses.eng: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.
verses.arabic: فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ مَكْرِهِمْ أَنَّا دَمَّرْنَـٰهُمْ وَقَوْمَهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-unẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu makrihim annā dammarnāhum waqawmahum ajmaʿīn

verses.eng: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who know.
verses.arabic: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةًۢ بِمَا ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fatilka buyūtuhum khāwiyatan bimā ẓalamū inna fī dhālika laʾāyatan liqawmin yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: And We saved those who believed and feared Allah.
verses.arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-anjaynā alladhīna āmanū wakānū yattaqūn

verses.eng: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, 'Do you commit immorality while you see?
verses.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walūṭan idh qāla liqawmihi ataʾtūna al-fāḥishata wa-antum tubṣirūn

verses.eng: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly.'
verses.arabic: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةًۭ مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌۭ تَجْهَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: A-innakum lataʾtūna al-rijāla shahwatan min dūni al-nisāʾi bal antum qawmun tajhalūn

verses.eng: But the answer of his people was only that they said, 'Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure.'
verses.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ أَخْرِجُوٓا۟ ءَالَ لُوطٍۢ مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌۭ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Famā kāna jawāba qawmihi illā an qālū akhrijū āla Lūṭin min qaryatikum innahum unāsun yataṭahharūn

verses.eng: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.
verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَـٰهَا مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-anjaynāhu wa-ahlahu illā im'ra-atahu qaddarnāhā mina al-ghābirīn

verses.eng: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
verses.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًۭا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-amṭarnā ʿalayhim maṭaran fasāʾa maṭaru al-mundharīn

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], 'Praise be to Allah, and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or what they associate with Him?'
verses.arabic: قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَىٰ عِبَادِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصْطَفَىٰٓ ۗ ءَآللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Quli al-ḥamdu lillāhi wasalāmun ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafā ā-llāhu khayrun ammā yushrikūn

verses.eng: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you rain from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].
verses.arabic: أَمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ حَدَآئِقَ ذَاتَ بَهْجَةٍۢ مَّا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُنۢبِتُوا۟ شَجَرَهَآ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌۭ يَعْدِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Amman khalaqa al-samāwāti wal-arḍa wa-anzala lakum mina al-samāʾi māʾan fa-anbatnā bihi ḥadāʾiqa dhāta bahjatin mā kāna lakum an tunbitū shajarahā a-ilāhun maʿa Allāhi bal hum qawmun yaʿdilūn

verses.eng: Is not He (better than your gods) Who has made the earth as a fixed abode, and has placed rivers in its midst, and has placed firm mountains therein, and has set a barrier between the two seas (of salt and sweet water). Is there any ilah (god) with Allah? Nay, but most of them know not.
verses.arabic: أَمَّن جَعَلَ ٱلْأَرْضَ قَرَارًۭا وَجَعَلَ خِلَـٰلَهَآ أَنْهَـٰرًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ حَاجِزًا ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Aman ja'alal arda qararanw wa ja'ala khilalahaa anhaaranw wa ja'ala lahaa rawaasiya wa ja'ala bainal bahrayni haajizaa; a ilaahun ma'al laahi bal aksaruhum laa ya'lamoon

verses.eng: Is not He (better than your gods) Who responds to the distressed one, when he calls Him, and Who removes the evil, and makes you inheritors of the earth, generations after generations. Is there any ilah (god) with Allah? Little is that you remember!
verses.arabic: أَمَّن يُجِيبُ ٱلْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ ٱلسُّوٓءَ وَيَجْعَلُكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Aman yujeebul mudtarra izaa da'aahu wa yakshifus sooo'a wa yaj'alukum khulafaaa'ar ardi a ilaahun ma'al laahi qaleelam maa tazakkaroon

verses.eng: Is not He (better than your gods) Who guides you in the darkness of the land and the sea, and Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His Mercy (rain)? Is there any ilah (god) with Allah? High Exalted be Allah above all that they associate as partners (to Him)!
verses.arabic: أَمَّن يَهْدِيكُمْ فِى ظُلُمَـٰتِ ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَمَن يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦٓ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ تَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Aman yahdeekum fee zulumaatil barri wal bahri wa many yursilur riyaaha bushram baina yadai rahmatih; a ilaahun ma'al laahi ta'aalal laahu 'ammaa yushrikoon

verses.eng: Is not He (better than your gods) Who originates creation, and shall thereafter repeat it, and Who provides for you from heaven and earth? Is there any ilah (god) with Allah? Say: "Bring forth your proofs, if you are truthful."
verses.arabic: أَمَّن يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ وَمَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Aman yabda'ul khalqa summa yu'eeduhoo wa many yarzuqukum minas samaaa'i wal ard; a ilaahun ma'al laahi qul haatoo burhaanakum in kuntum saadiqeen

verses.eng: Say: "None in the heavens and the earth knows the Ghaib (unseen) except Allah, nor can they perceive when they shall be resurrected."
verses.arabic: قُل لَّا يَعْلَمُ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْغَيْبَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul laa ya'lamu man fis samaawaati wal ardil ghaiba illal laah; wa maa yash'uroona ayyana yub'asoon

verses.eng: Nay, their knowledge will perceive (fail to know) about the Hereafter. Nay, they are in doubt about it. Nay, they are blind about it.
verses.arabic: بَلِ ٱدَّٰرَكَ عِلْمُهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّنْهَا ۖ بَلْ هُم مِّنْهَا عَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bali idaarak 'ilmuhum fil Aakhirati bal hum fee shakkim minhaa bal hum minhaa 'amoon

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say: "When we have become dust, we and our fathers, shall we really be brought forth (again)?"
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا كُنَّا تُرَٰبًۭا وَءَابَآؤُنَآ أَءِنَّا لَمُخْرَجُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafarooo a izaa kunnaa turaabanw wa aabaaa'unaaa a innaa lamukhrajoon

verses.eng: Indeed we were promised this, we and our forefathers before, verily, these are nothing but tales of ancients.
verses.arabic: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا هَـٰذَا نَحْنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Laqad wu'idnaa haazaa nahnu wa aabaaa'u mina qablu in haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen

verses.eng: Say: "Travel in the land and see how (Allah) originated creation, and then Allah will bring forth (resurrect) the creation of the Hereafter (i.e. resurrection after death). Verily, Allah is Able to do all things."
verses.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul seeroo fil ardi fanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mujrimeen

verses.eng: He punishes whom He wills, and shows mercy to whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِى ضَيْقٍۢ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laa tahzan 'alaihim wa laa takun fee daiqim mimmaa yamkuroon

verses.eng: And you cannot escape in the earth or in the heaven. And besides Allah you have neither any Wali (protector or guardian) nor any helper.
verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen

verses.eng: And those who believe not in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah and in the meeting with Him, it is they who have no hope of My Mercy, and it is they who will have a painful torment.
verses.arabic: قُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ ٱلَّذِى تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul 'asaaa ai yakoona radifa lakum ba'dul lazee tasta'jiloon

verses.eng: And the answer of your people was only that they said: "Drive us out (by calling us) from our land with your (so-called) gods! So bring us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful!"
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Zoo fadlin 'alan naasi wa laakinna aksarahum laa yashkuroon

verses.eng: And indeed We have set forth for mankind, in this Qur'an every kind of parable. But if you (O Muhammad) bring to them any sign or proof, (as an evidence for the truth of your Prophethood), the disbelievers are sure to say (to the believers): "You follow nothing but falsehood, and magic."
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la ya'lamu maa tukinnu sudooruhum wa maa yu'linoon

verses.eng: And nothing is hidden from your Lord (so much as) the weight of an atom (or small ant) on the earth or in the heaven. Not what is less than that or what is greater than that but is (written) in a Clear Record.
verses.arabic: وَمَا مِنْ غَآئِبَةٍۢ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا فِى كِتَـٰبٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa maa min ghaaa'ibatin fis samaaa'i wal ardi illaa fee Kitaabim Mubeen

verses.eng: Indeed, this Qur'an relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they disagree.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ يَقُصُّ عَلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَكْثَرَ ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Inna hādhā al-qur'āna yaquṣṣu ʿalā banī is'rāīla akthara alladhī hum fīhi yakhtalifūn

verses.eng: And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers.
verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةٌۭ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-innahu lahudan warahmatun lilmu'minīn

verses.eng: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them by His wisdom. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُم بِحُكْمِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Inna rabbaka yaqḍī baynahum biḥukmihi wahuwa al-ʿazīzu al-ʿalīm

verses.eng: So rely upon Allah; indeed, you are upon the clear truth.
verses.arabic: فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلْمُبِينِ
verses.transliteration: Fatawakkal ʿalā allāhi innaka ʿalā al-ḥaqqi al-mubīn

verses.eng: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.
verses.arabic: إِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innaka lā tusmiʿu al-mawtā walā tusmiʿu al-ṣumma al-duʿāa idhā wallaw mud'birīn

verses.eng: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [in submission to Allah].
verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ بِهَـٰدِ ٱلْعُمْىِ عَن ضَلَـٰلَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamā anta bihādi al-ʿumyi ʿan ḍalālatihim in tusmiʿu illā man yu'minu biāyātinā fahum muslimūn

verses.eng: And when the word [of punishment] falls upon them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain [in faith].
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا وَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَخْرَجْنَا لَهُمْ دَآبَّةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ تُكَلِّمُهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا لَا يُوقِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-idhā waqaʿa al-qawlu ʿalayhim akhrajnā lahum dābbatan mina al-arḍi tukallimuhum anna al-nāsa kānū biāyātinā lā yūqinūn

verses.eng: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather from every nation a company of those who deny Our signs, and they will be [driven] in rows.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ فَوْجًۭا مِّمَّن يُكَذِّبُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayawma naḥshuru min kulli ummatin fawjan mimman yukadhibu biāyātinā fahum yūzaʿūn

verses.eng: Until, when they arrive [at the place of Judgement], He will say, "Did you deny My signs while you encompassed them not in knowledge, or what [was it that] you were doing?"
verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءُو قَالَ أَكَذَّبْتُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِى وَلَمْ تُحِيطُوا۟ بِهَا عِلْمًا أَمَّاذَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ḥattā idhā jāū qāla akadhabtum biāyātī walam tuḥīṭū bihā ʿilman ammādhā kuntum taʿmalūn

verses.eng: And the decree will befall them for the wrong they did, and they will not [be able to] speak.
verses.arabic: وَوَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِم بِمَا ظَلَمُوا۟ فَهُمْ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wawaqaʿa al-qawlu ʿalayhim bimā ẓalamū fahum lā yanṭiqūn

verses.eng: Have they not seen that We made the night that they may rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِيَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alam yaraw annā jaʿalnā al-layla liyaskunū fīhi wal-nahāra mub'ṣiran inna fī dhālika laāyātin liqawmin yu'minūn

verses.eng: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will be terrified except whom Allah wills. And all will come to Him humbled.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَفَزِعَ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَكُلٌّ أَتَوْهُ دَٰخِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wayawma yunfakhu fī al-ṣūri fafaziʿa man fī al-samāwāti waman fī al-arḍi illā man shāa allāhu wakullun atawhu dākhirīn

verses.eng: And you see the mountains, thinking them rigid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. [It is] the work of Allah, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Acquainted with that which you do.
verses.arabic: وَتَرَى ٱلْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةًۭ وَهِىَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ ٱلسَّحَابِ ۚ صُنْعَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَتْقَنَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَفْعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Watara al-jibāla taḥsabuhā jāmidatan wahiya tamurru marra al-saḥābi ṣunʿa allāhi alladhī atqana kulla shay'in innahu khabīrun bimā tafʿalūn

verses.eng: Whoever comes with a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.
verses.arabic: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْهَا وَهُم مِّن فَزَعٍۢ يَوْمَئِذٍ ءَامِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man jāa bi-al-ḥasanati falahu khayrun min'hā wahum min fazaʿin yawma'idhin āminūn

verses.eng: And whoever comes with an evil deed - their faces will be overturned into the Fire, [and it will be said], "Are you recompensed except for what you used to do?"
verses.arabic: وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِى ٱلنَّارِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waman jāa bi-al-sayyi'ati fakubbat wujūhuhum fī al-nāri hal tujzawna illā mā kuntum taʿmalūn

verses.eng: I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city, Who made it sacred and to Whom [belongs] all things. And I am commanded to be of the Muslims
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ رَبَّ هَٰذِهِ الْبَلْدَةِ الَّذِي حَرَّمَهَا وَلَهُ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innamā umirtu an aʿbuda rabba hādhihi l-baladati alladhī ḥarramahā wa lahu kullu shayʾin wa umirtu an akūna mina l-muslimīn

verses.eng: And to recite the Qur'an." And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself; and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."
verses.arabic: وَأَنْ أَتْلُوَ الْقُرْآنَ ۖ فَمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِي لِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ ضَلَّ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُنذِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa an atluwa l-qurʾāna famani ihtadā fa innamā yahtadī li nafsihi wa man ḍalla fa qul innamā anā mina l-mundhirīn

verses.eng: And say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah. He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."
verses.arabic: وَقُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِهِ فَتَعْرِفُونَهَا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa quli l-ḥamdu lillāhi sayurīkum āyātihi fa taʿrifūnahā wa mā rabbuka bighāfilin ʿammā taʿmalūn

verses.eng: Ta, Seen, Meem.
verses.arabic: طسٓمٓ
verses.transliteration: Ta-Seen-Meem

verses.eng: These are the verses of the clear Book.
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
verses.transliteration: Tilka āyātu l-kitābi l-mubīni

verses.eng: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: نَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكَ مِن نَّبَإِ مُوسَىٰ وَفِرْعَوْنَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Natlu ʿalayka min naba-i mūsā wafirʿawna bil-ḥaqqi liqawmin yuʾminūna

verses.eng: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ عَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلَ أَهْلَهَا شِيَعًا يَسْتَضْعِفُ طَآئِفَةً مِّنْهُمْ يُذَبِّحُ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ وَيَسْتَحْىِۦ نِسَآءَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna firʿawna ʿalā fī l-arḍi wajaʿala ahlahā shiyaʿan yastaḍʿifu ṭāʾifatan minhum yudhabbiḥu abnāʾahum wayastaḥyī nisāʾahum innahu kāna mina l-mufsidīna

verses.eng: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors
verses.arabic: وَنُرِيدُ أَن نَّمُنَّ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَنَجْعَلَهُمْ أَئِمَّةً وَنَجْعَلَهُمُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa nurīdu an namunna ʿalā alladhīna us'tuḍʿifū fī l-arḍi wanajʿalahum aʾimmatan wanajʿalahumu l-wārithīna

verses.eng: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.
verses.arabic: وَنُمَكِّنَ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَنُرِىَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَحْذَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wanumakkina lahum fī l-arḍi wanuriya firʿawna wahāmāna wajunūdahumā minhum mā kānū yaḥdharūna

verses.eng: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, 'Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers.'
verses.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَرْضِعِيهِ ۖ فَإِذَا خِفْتِ عَلَيْهِ فَأَلْقِيهِ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ وَلَا تَخَافِى وَلَا تَحْزَنِىٓ ۖ إِنَّا رَآدُّوهُ إِلَيْكِ وَجَاعِلُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa awḥaynā ilā ummi mūsā an arḍiʿīhi fa-idhā khifti ʿalayhi fa-alqīhi fī l-yammi walā takhāfī walā taḥzanī innā rāddūhu ilayki wajāʿilūhu mina l-mursalīna

verses.eng: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were sinners.
verses.arabic: فَٱلْتَقَطَهُۥٓ ءَالُ فِرْعَوْنَ لِيَكُونَ لَهُمْ عَدُوًّا وَحَزَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا كَانُوا۟ خَـٰطِـِٔينَ
verses.transliteration: Fal-taqaṭahu ālu firʿawna liyakūna lahum ʿaduwwan waḥazanan inna firʿawna wahāmāna wajunūdahumā kānū khāṭiʾīna

verses.eng: And the wife of Pharaoh said, '[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son.' And they perceived not.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ فِرْعَوْنَ قُرَّتُ عَيْنٍ لِّى وَلَكَ ۖ لَا تَقْتُلُوهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدًا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālati m'raatu firʿawna qurratu ʿaynin lī walaka lā taqtulūhu ʿasā an yanfaʿanā aw nattakhidhahu waladan wahum lā yashʿurūna

verses.eng: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.
verses.arabic: وَأَصْبَحَ فُؤَادُ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ فَـٰرِغًا ۖ إِن كَادَتْ لَتُبْدِى بِهِۦ لَوْلَآ أَن رَّبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قَلْبِهَا لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa aṣbaḥa fuʾādu ummi mūsā fārighan in kādat latubdī bihi lawlā an rabaṭnā ʿalā qalbihā litakūna mina l-muʾminīna

verses.eng: And she said to his sister, 'Follow him'; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَتْ لِأُخْتِهِۦ قُصِّيهِ ۖ فَبَصُرَتْ بِهِۦ عَن جُنُبٍ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālat li-ukhtihi quṣṣīhi fabaṣurat bihi ʿan junubin wahum lā yashʿurūna

verses.eng: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, 'Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?'
verses.arabic: وَحَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِ ٱلْمَرَاضِعَ مِن قَبْلُ فَقَالَتْ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ يَكْفُلُونَهُۥ لَكُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُۥ نَـٰصِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ḥarramnā ʿalayhi l-marāḍiʿa min qablu faqālat hal adullukum ʿalā ahli baytin yakfulūnahu lakum wahum lahu nāṣiḥūna

verses.eng: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: فَرَدَدْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّهِۦ كَىْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ وَلِتَعْلَمَ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faradadnāhu ilā ummihi kay taqarra ʿaynuhā walā taḥzana walitaʿlama anna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun walākinna aktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

verses.eng: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُۥ وَٱسْتَوَىٰٓ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā balagha ashuddahu was'tawā ātaynāhu ḥukman waʿilman wakadhālika najzī l-muḥsinīna

verses.eng: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, 'This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy.'
verses.arabic: وَدَخَلَ ٱلْمَدِينَةَ عَلَىٰ حِينِ غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَا فَوَجَدَ فِيهَا رَجُلَيْنِ يَقْتَتِلَانِ هَـٰذَا مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ وَهَـٰذَا مِنْ عَدُوِّهِۦ ۖ فَٱسْتَغَـٰثَهُ ٱلَّذِى مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ عَلَى ٱلَّذِى مِنْ عَدُوِّهِۦ فَوَكَزَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ فَقَضَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ۖ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِنْ عَمَلِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَدُوٌّ مُّضِلٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa dakhala l-madīnata ʿalā ḥīni ghaflatin min ahlihā fawajada fīhā rajulayni yaqtatilāni hādhā min shīʿatihi wahādhā min ʿaduwwihi fastaghāthahu alladhī min shīʿatihi ʿalā alladhī min ʿaduwwihi fawakazahu mūsā faqaḍā ʿalayhi qāla hādhā min ʿamali sh-shayṭāni innahu ʿaduwwun muḍillun mubīnun

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَغَفَرَ لَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi innī ẓalamtu nafsī faghfir lī faghafara lahū, innahū huwa al-ghafūru al-raḥīm

verses.eng: He said, "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be an assistant to the criminals."
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ فَلَنْ أَكُونَ ظَهِيرًا لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi bimā anʿamta ʿalayya falan akūna ẓahīran lil-mujrimīn

verses.eng: And he became inside the city fearful and watchful when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."
verses.arabic: فَأَصْبَحَ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ خَائِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ فَإِذَا الَّذِي اسْتَنصَرَهُ بِالْأَمْسِ يَسْتَصْرِخُهُ ۚ قَالَ لَهُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّكَ لَغَوِيٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa-aṣbaḥa fī al-madīnati khā'ifan yataraqqabu fa-idhā alladhī istanṣarahū bil-amsi yastaṣrikhuhū, qāla lahū Mūsā innaka laghawiyyun mubīn

verses.eng: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed a soul yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the reformers."
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا أَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَبْطِشَ بِالَّذِي هُوَ عَدُوٌّ لَّهُمَا قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ أَتُرِيدُ أَن تَقْتُلَنِي كَمَا قَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا بِالْأَمْسِ ۖ إِن تُرِيدُ إِلَّا أَن تَكُونَ جَبَّارًا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا تُرِيدُ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُصْلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā an arāda an yabṭisha billadhī huwa ʿaduwwun lahumā qāla yā Mūsā aturīdu an taqtulanī kamā qatalta nafsan bil-amsi, in turīdu illā an takūna jabbāran fī al-arḍi wa-mā turīdu an takūna mina al-muṣliḥīn

verses.eng: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring about you to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."
verses.arabic: وَجَاءَ رَجُلٌ مِّنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّ الْمَلَأَ يَأْتَمِرُونَ بِكَ لِيَقْتُلُوكَ فَاخْرُجْ إِنِّي لَكَ مِنَ النَّاصِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa-jā'a rajulun min aqṣā al-madīnati yasʿā qāla yā Mūsā inna al-mala'a ya'tamirūna bika liyaqtulūka fa-ukhruj innī laka mina al-nāṣiḥīn

verses.eng: So he left it, fearful and watchful. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."
verses.arabic: فَخَرَجَ مِنْهَا خَائِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ نَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakharaja minhā khā'ifan yataraqqabu, qāla rabbi najjinī mina al-qawmi al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقَاءَ مَدْيَنَ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبِّي أَن يَهْدِيَنِي سَوَاءَ السَّبِيلِ
verses.transliteration: Wa-lammā tawajjaha tilqā'a Madyana qāla ʿasā rabbī an yahdiyanī sawā'a al-sabīl

verses.eng: And when he came to the water of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks], and he found aside from them two women driving back [their flocks]. He said, "What is your circumstance?" They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks]; and our father is an old man."
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا وَرَدَ مَاءَ مَدْيَنَ وَجَدَ عَلَيْهِ أُمَّةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ يَسْقُونَ وَوَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمُ امْرَأَتَيْنِ تَذُودَانِ ۖ قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُمَا ۖ قَالَتَا لَا نَسْقِي حَتَّىٰ يُصْدِرَ الرِّعَاءُ ۖ وَأَبُونَا شَيْخٌ كَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa-lammā warada mā'a Madyana wajada ʿalayhi ummatan mina al-nāsi yasqūna wa-wajada min dūnihimu im'ra-atayni tadhūdāni, qāla mā khaṭbukumā, qālatā lā nasqī ḥattā yuṣdira al-riʿā'u wa-abūnā shaykhun kabīr

verses.eng: So he watered [their flocks] for them; then he went back to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."
verses.arabic: فَسَقَىٰ لَهُمَا ثُمَّ تَوَلَّىٰ إِلَى الظِّلِّ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي لِمَا أَنزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Fasaqā lahumā thumma tawallā ilā al-ẓilli faqāla rabbi innī limā anzalta ilayya min khayrin faqīr

verses.eng: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."
verses.arabic: فَجَاءَتْهُ إِحْدَاهُمَا تَمْشِي عَلَى اسْتِحْيَاءٍ قَالَتْ إِنَّ أَبِي يَدْعُوكَ لِيَجْزِيَكَ أَجْرَ مَا سَقَيْتَ لَنَا ۚ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُ وَقَصَّ عَلَيْهِ الْقَصَصَ قَالَ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ نَجَوْتَ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fajā'at-hu iḥdāhumā tamsī ʿalā istiḥyā'in qālat inna abī yadʿūka liyajziyaka ajra mā saqayta lanā, fa-lammā jā'ahu wa-qaṣṣa ʿalayhi al-qaṣaṣa qāla lā takhaf, najawta mina al-qawmi al-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: One of the women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy."
verses.arabic: قَالَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا يَا أَبَتِ اسْتَأْجِرْهُ ۖ إِنَّ خَيْرَ مَنِ اسْتَأْجَرْتَ الْقَوِيُّ الْأَمِينُ
verses.transliteration: Qālat iḥdāhumā yā abati ista'jirhu, inna khayra mani ista'jarta al-qawiyyu al-amīn

verses.eng: He said, "Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters, on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years; but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you. And I do not wish to put you in difficulty. You will find me, if Allah wills, from among the righteous."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُنكِحَكَ إِحْدَى ابْنَتَيَّ هَاتَيْنِ عَلَىٰ أَن تَأْجُرَنِي ثَمَانِيَ حِجَجٍ ۖ فَإِنْ أَتْمَمْتَ عَشْرًا فَمِنْ عِندِكَ ۖ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَيْكَ ۚ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla innī urīdu an unkiḥaka iḥdā ibnatayya hātayni ʿalā an ta'juranī thamāniya ḥijajin, fa-in atmamta ʿashran fa-min ʿindika, wa-mā urīdu an ashuqqa ʿalayka, satajidunī in shā'a Allāhu mina al-ṣāliḥīn

verses.eng: [Moses] said, "That is [established] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete - there is no injustice to me, and Allah, over what we say, is Witness."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكَ ۖ أَيَّمَا الْأَجَلَيْنِ قَضَيْتُ فَلَا عُدْوَانَ عَلَيَّ ۖ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌ
verses.transliteration: Qāla dhālika baynī wa-baynika, ayyamā al-ajalayni qaḍaytu falā ʿudwāna ʿalayya, wa-Allāhu ʿalā mā naqūlu wakīl

verses.eng: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves."
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا قَضَىٰ مُوسَى الْأَجَلَ وَسَارَ بِأَهْلِهِ آنَسَ مِن جَانِبِ الطُّورِ نَارًا قَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَّعَلِّي آتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ جَذْوَةٍ مِّنَ النَّارِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-lammā qaḍā Mūsā al-ajala wa-sāra bi-ahlihi ānasa min jānibi al-ṭūri nāran, qāla li-ahlihi umkuthū innī ānastu nāran laʿallī ātīkum minhā bikhabarin aw jadhwatin mina al-nāri laʿallakum taṣṭalūn

verses.eng: But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot - from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allah, Lord of the worlds."
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ مِن شَاطِئِ الْوَادِ الْأَيْمَنِ فِي الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبَارَكَةِ مِنَ الشَّجَرَةِ أَن يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنِّي أَنَا اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-lammā atāhā nūdiya min shāṭi'i al-wādi al-aymani fī al-buqʿati al-mubārakati mina al-shajarati an yā Mūsā innī anā Allāhu rabbu al-ʿālamīn

verses.eng: And throw down your staff. But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], O Moses, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure.
verses.arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ أَقْبِلْ وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنَ الْآمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alqi 'aṣāka, falammā ra'āhā tahtazzu ka'annahā jānnun wallā mudbiran wa lam yu'aqib, yā Mūsā aqbil wa lā takhaf, innaka mina al-āminīn

verses.eng: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient.
verses.arabic: اسْلُكْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ وَاضْمُمْ إِلَيْكَ جَنَاحَكَ مِنَ الرَّهْبِ ۖ فَذَانِكَ بُرْهَانَانِ مِنْ رَبِّكَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Usluk yadaka fī jaybika takhruj bayḍā'a min ghayri sū'in wa aḍmum ilayka janāḥaka mina ar-rahbi, fa dhānika burhānāni min rabbika ilā Fir'awna wa mala'ihi, innahum kānū qawman fāsiqīn

verses.eng: He said, My Lord, indeed, I killed from among them someone, and I fear they will kill me.
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي قَتَلْتُ مِنْهُمْ نَفْسًا فَأَخَافُ أَنْ يَقْتُلُونِ
verses.transliteration: Qāla rabbi innī qataltu minhum nafsan fa akhāfu an yaqtulūn

verses.eng: And my brother Aaron is more eloquent than me in speech, so send him with me as a helper to confirm me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me.
verses.arabic: وَأَخِي هَارُونُ هُوَ أَفْصَحُ مِنِّي لِسَانًا فَأَرْسِلْهُ مَعِيَ رِدْءًا يُصَدِّقُنِي ۖ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَنْ يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.transliteration: Wa akhī Hārūnu huwa afṣaḥu minnī lisānan fa arsilhu ma'iya rid'an yuṣaddiqunī, innī akhāfu an yukadhibūn

verses.eng: [Allah] said, We will strengthen your arm through your brother and grant you both authority so they will not reach you. With Our signs, you and those who follow you will be the predominant.
verses.arabic: قَالَ سَنَشُدُّ عَضُدَكَ بِأَخِيكَ وَنَجْعَلُ لَكُمَا سُلْطَانًا فَلَا يَصِلُونَ إِلَيْكُمَا ۚ بِآيَاتِنَا أَنْتُمَا وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَكُمَا الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla sanashuddu 'aḍudaka bi akhīka wa naj'alu lakumā sulṭānan fa lā yaṣilūna ilaykumā, bi āyātinā antumā wa mani ittaba'akumā al-ghālibūn

verses.eng: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers.
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ قَالُوا مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُفْتَرًى وَمَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي آبَائِنَا الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jā'ahum Mūsā bi āyātinā bayyinātin qālū mā hādhā illā siḥrun muftaran wa mā sami'nā bi hādhā fī ābā'inā al-awwalīn

verses.eng: And Moses said, My Lord is most knowing of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be the outcome of the home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ جَاءَ بِالْهُدَىٰ مِنْ عِنْدِهِ وَمَنْ تَكُونُ لَهُ عَاقِبَةُ الدَّارِ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla Mūsā rabbī a'lamu bi man jā'a bil-hudā min 'indihi wa man takūnu lahu 'āqibatu ad-dār, innahu lā yufliḥu aẓ-ẓālimūn

verses.eng: And Pharaoh said, O eminent ones, I have not known you to have a god other than me. Then ignite for me, O Haman, [a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses. And indeed, I do think he is among the liars.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ مَا عَلِمْتُ لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرِي فَأَوْقِدْ لِي يَا هَامَانُ عَلَى الطِّينِ فَاجْعَلْ لِي صَرْحًا لَعَلِّي أَطَّلِعُ إِلَىٰ إِلَٰهِ مُوسَىٰ وَإِنِّي لَأَظُنُّهُ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla Fir'awnu yā ayyuhā al-mala'u mā 'alimtu lakum min ilāhin ghayrī fa awqid lī yā Hāmānu 'alā aṭ-ṭīni faj'al lī ṣarḥan la'allī aṭṭali'u ilā ilāhi Mūsā wa innī la'aẓunnuhu mina al-kādhibīn

verses.eng: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.
verses.arabic: وَاسْتَكْبَرَ هُوَ وَجُنُودُهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ وَظَنُّوا أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا يُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa istakbara huwa wa junūduhu fī al-arḍi bighayri al-ḥaqqi wa ẓannū annahum ilaynā lā yurja'ūn

verses.eng: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ ۖ فَانْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa akhadhnāhu wa junūdahu fa nabadhnāhum fī al-yammi, fa unẓur kayfa kāna 'āqibatu aẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.
verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَدْعُونَ إِلَى النَّارِ ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ لَا يُنْصَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'alnāhum a'immatan yad'ūna ilā an-nār, wa yawma al-qiyāmati lā yunṣarūn

verses.eng: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.
verses.arabic: وَأَتْبَعْنَاهُمْ فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا لَعْنَةً ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ هُمْ مِنَ الْمَقْبُوحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa atba'nāhum fī hādhihi ad-dunyā la'natan, wa yawma al-qiyāmati hum mina al-maqbūḥīn

verses.eng: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا أَهْلَكْنَا الْقُرُونَ الْأُولَىٰ بَصَائِرَ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ātaynā Mūsā al-kitāba min ba'di mā ahlaknā al-qurūna al-ūlā baṣā'ira lin-nāsi wa hudan wa raḥmatan la'allahum yatadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And you, [O Muhammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].
verses.arabic: وَمَا كُنْتَ بِجَانِبِ الْغَرْبِيِّ إِذْ قَضَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَى الْأَمْرَ وَمَا كُنْتَ مِنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā kunta bi jānibi al-gharbiyyi idh qaḍaynā ilā Mūsā al-amra wa mā kunta mina ash-shāhidīn

verses.eng: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].
verses.arabic: وَلَٰكِنَّا أَنْشَأْنَا قُرُونًا فَتَطَاوَلَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعُمُرُ ۚ وَمَا كُنْتَ ثَاوِيًا فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ تَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا وَلَٰكِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lākinnā ansha'nā qurūnan fa taṭāwala 'alayhimu al-'umru, wa mā kunta thāwiyan fī ahli Madyana tatlu 'alayhim āyātinā wa lākinnā kunnā mursilīn

verses.eng: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ الطُّورِ إِذْ نَادَيْنَا وَلَـٰكِن رَّحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًا مَّا أَتَاهُم مِّن نَّذِيرٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā kunta bijānibi aṭ-ṭūri idh nādaynā wa lākin raḥmatam mir rabbika litunthira qawmam mā atāhum min nathīrin min qablika laʿallahum yatadhakkarūn

verses.eng: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands have put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"
verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَا أَن تُصِيبَهُم مُّصِيبَةٌ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُوا رَبَّنَا لَوْلَا أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آيَاتِكَ وَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lawlā an tuṣībahum muṣībatun bimā qaddamat aydīhim fa yaqūlū rabbanā lawlā arsalta ilaynā rasūlan fanattabiʿa āyātika wa nakūna min al-muʾminīn

verses.eng: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."
verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمُ الْحَقُّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوا لَوْلَا أُوتِيَ مِثْلَ مَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ أَوَلَمْ يَكْفُرُوا بِمَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ قَالُوا سِحْرَانِ تَظَاهَرَا وَقَالُوا إِنَّا بِكُلٍّ كَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Falammā jāʾahumu al-ḥaqqu min ʿindinā qālū lawlā ūtiya mithla mā ūtiya Mūsá a wa lam yakfurū bimā ūtiya Mūsá min qablu qālū siḥrāni taẓāharā wa qālū innā bikullin kāfirūn

verses.eng: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allah which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."
verses.arabic: قُلْ فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابٍ مِّنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ هُوَ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْهُمَا أَتَّبِعْهُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul faʾtū bikitābin min ʿindi Allāhi huwa ahdā minhumā attabiʿhu in kuntum ṣādiqīn

verses.eng: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
verses.arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا لَكَ فَاعْلَمْ أَنَّمَا يَتَّبِعُونَ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ وَمَنْ أَضَلُّ مِمَّنِ اتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ بِغَيْرِ هُدًى مِّنَ اللَّهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa in lam yastajībū laka faʿlam annamā yattabiʿūna ahwāʾahum wa man aḍallu mim mani ittabaʿa hawāhu bighayri hudan mina Allāhi inna Allāha lā yahdī al-qawma aẓ-ẓālimīn

verses.eng: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the word that they might be reminded.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ وَصَّلْنَا لَهُمُ الْقَوْلَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad waṣṣalnā lahumu al-qawla laʿallahum yatadhakkarūn

verses.eng: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ مِن قَبْلِهِ هُم بِهِ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna ātaynāhumu al-kitāba min qablihi hum bihi yuʾminūn

verses.eng: And when it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed we were, [even] before it, Muslims [submitting to Allah]."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِهِ إِنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلِهِ مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā yutlā ʿalayhim qālū āmannā bihi innahu al-ḥaqqu mir rabbinā innā kunnā min qablihi muslimīn

verses.eng: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.
verses.arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ يُؤْتَوْنَ أَجْرَهُم مَّرَّتَيْنِ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ السَّيِّئَةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ulāʾika yuʾtawna ajrahum marratayni bimā ṣabarū wa yadraʾūna bil-ḥasanati as-sayyiʾata wa mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūn

verses.eng: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we seek not the ignorant."
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا سَمِعُوا اللَّغْوَ أَعْرَضُوا عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا لَنَا أَعْمَالُنَا وَلَكُمْ أَعْمَالُكُمْ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ لَا نَبْتَغِي الْجَاهِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā samiʿū al-laghwa aʿraḍū ʿanhu wa qālū lanā aʿmālunā wa lakum aʿmālukum salāmun ʿalaykum lā nabtaghī al-jāhilīn

verses.eng: Indeed, [O Muhammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
verses.arabic: إِنَّكَ لَا تَهْدِي مَنْ أَحْبَبْتَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innaka lā tahdī man aḥbabta wa lākinna Allāha yahdī man yashāʾu wa huwa aʿlamu bil-muhtadīn

verses.eng: And they say, "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we would be swept from our land." Have We not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا إِن نَّتَّبِعِ الْهُدَىٰ مَعَكَ نُتَخَطَّفْ مِنْ أَرْضِنَا أَوَلَمْ نُمَكِّن لَّهُمْ حَرَمًا آمِنًا يُجْبَىٰ إِلَيْهِ ثَمَرَاتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ رِّزْقًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālū in nattabiʿi al-hudā maʿaka nutakhaṭṭaf min arḍinā a wa lam numakkin lahum ḥaraman āminan yujbā ilayhi thamarātu kulli shayʾin rizqam mil ladunnā wa lākinna aktharahum lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.
verses.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ بَطِرَتْ مَعِيشَتَهَا فَتِلْكَ مَسَاكِنُهُمْ لَمْ تُسْكَن مِّن بَعْدِهِمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا وَكُنَّا نَحْنُ الْوَارِثِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknā min qaryatin baṭirat maʿīshatahā fa tilka masākinuhum lam tuskam min baʿdihim illā qalīlan wa kunnā naḥnu al-wārithīn

verses.eng: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ مُهْلِكَ الْقُرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ يَبْعَثَ فِي أُمِّهَا رَسُولًا يَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا وَمَا كُنَّا مُهْلِكِي الْقُرَىٰ إِلَّا وَأَهْلُهَا ظَالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā kāna rabbuka muhliqa al-qurá ḥattā yabʿatha fī ummihā rasūlan yatlū ʿalayhim āyātinā wa mā kunnā muhlikī al-qurá illā wa ahluhā ẓālimūn

verses.eng: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?
verses.arabic: وَمَا أُوتِيتُم مِّن شَيْءٍ فَمَتَاعُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتُهَا وَمَا عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā ūtītum min shayʾin fa matāʿu al-ḥayāti ad-dunyā wa zīnatuhā wa mā ʿinda Allāhi khayrun wa abqá afalā taʿqilūn

verses.eng: Is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will meet like him whom We have provided with the enjoyment of this worldly life, then on the Day of Resurrection he will be among those presented [for punishment]?
verses.arabic: أَفَمَن وَعَدْنَـٰهُ وَعْدًا حَسَنًۭا فَهُوَ لَـٰقِيهِ كَمَن مَّتَّعْنَـٰهُ مَتَـٰعَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ثُمَّ هُوَ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Afaman waʿadnāhu waʿdan ḥasanan fahuwa lāqīhi kaman mattaʿnāhu matāʿa l-ḥayati d-dunyā thumma huwa yawma l-qiyāmati mina l-muḥḍarīn

verses.eng: And the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My partners which you used to claim?"
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَـٰٓؤِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayawma yunādīhim fayaqūlu ayna shurakāiya alladhīna kuntum tazʿumūn

verses.eng: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we led astray; we led them astray just as we were astray. We declare our disassociation [from them] to You. They did not used to worship us."
verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقَوْلُ رَبَّنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ أَغْوَيْنَآ أَغْوَيْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا غَوَيْنَآ ۖ تَبَرَّأْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ۖ مَا كَانُوٓا۟ إِيَّانَا يَعْبُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla alladhīna ḥaqqa ʿalayhimu l-qawlu rabbanā hāulāi alladhīna aghwaynā aghwaynāhum kamā ghawaynā tabarra`nā ilayka mā kānū iyyānā yaʿbudūn

verses.eng: And it will be said, "Call upon your 'partners,'" and they will call upon them, but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!
verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ ٱدْعُوا۟ شُرَكَآءَكُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَرَأَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ لَوْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqīla dʿū shurakāakum fadaʿawhum falam yastajībū lahum wara`awu l-ʿadhāba law annahum kānū yahtadūn

verses.eng: And the Day He will call them and say, "What did you answer the messengers?"
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ مَاذَآ أَجَبْتُمُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wayawma yunādīhim fayaqūlu mādhā ajabtumu l-mursalīn

verses.eng: Then the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.
verses.arabic: فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ فَهُمْ لَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faʿamiyat ʿalayhimu l-anbāu yawma`idhin fahum lā yatasā`alūn

verses.eng: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is expected that he will be among the successful.
verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَعَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa`ammā man tāba wa`āmana waʿamila ṣāliḥan faʿasā an yakūna mina l-mufliḥīn

verses.eng: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُ وَيَخْتَارُ ۗ مَا كَانَ لَهُمُ ٱلْخِيَرَةُ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ وَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Warabbuka yakhluqu mā yashāu wayakhtāru mā kāna lahumu l-khīratu subḥāna l-lahi wataʿālā ʿammā yushrikūn

verses.eng: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.
verses.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Warabbuka yaʿlamu mā tukinnu ṣudūruhum wamā yuʿlinūn

verses.eng: And He is Allah; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْحَمْدُ فِى ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ وَلَهُ ٱلْحُكْمُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wahuwa l-lahu lā ilāha illā huwa lahu l-ḥamdu fī l-ūlā wal-ākhirati walahu l-ḥukmu wa`ilayhi turjaʿūn

verses.eng: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ سَرْمَدًا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مَنْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِضِيَآءٍ ۖ أَفَلَا تَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ara`aytum in jaʿala l-lahu ʿalaykumu l-layla sarmadan ilā yawmi l-qiyāmati man ilāhun ghayru l-lahi ya`tīkum biḍiyāin afalā tasmaʿūn

verses.eng: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you a night in which you may rest? Then will you not see?"
verses.arabic: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلنَّهَارَ سَرْمَدًا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مَنْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِلَيْلٍۢ تَسْكُنُونَ فِيهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul ara`aytum in jaʿala l-lahu ʿalaykumu n-nahāra sarmadan ilā yawmi l-qiyāmati man ilāhun ghayru l-lahi ya`tīkum bilaylin taskunūna fīhi afalā tubṣirūn

verses.eng: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.
verses.arabic: وَمِن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ لِتَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wamin raḥmatihi jaʿala lakumu l-layla wan-nahāra litaskunū fīhi walitabtaghū min faḍlihi walaʿallakum tashkurūn

verses.eng: And the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My partners which you used to claim?"
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَـٰٓؤِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wayawma yunādīhim fayaqūlu ayna shurakāiya alladhīna kuntum tazʿumūn

verses.eng: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof," and they will know that the truth belongs to Allah, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.
verses.arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ شَهِيدًۭا فَقُلْنَا هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ فَعَلِمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱلْحَقَّ لِلَّهِ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wanazaʿnā min kulli ummatin shahīdan faqulnā hātū burhānakum faʿalimū anna l-ḥaqqa lillahi waḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūn

verses.eng: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he tyrannized them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men; thereupon his people said to him, 'Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.'
verses.arabic: إِنَّ قَارُونَ كَانَ مِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰ فَبَغَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ مِنَ ٱلْكُنُوزِ مَا إِنَّ مَفَاتِحَهُۥ لَتَنُوٓأُ بِٱلْعُصْبَةِ أُو۟لِى ٱلْقُوَّةِ إِذْ قَالَ لَهُۥ قَوْمُهُۥ لَا تَفْرَحْ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْفَرِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna Qaroona kana min qawmi Moosa fabagha 'alayhim wa ataynahu mina alkunoozi ma inna mafateehahu latanoo'u bial'usbati oolee alquwwati ith qala lahu qawmuhu la tafrah inna Allaha la yuhibbu alfariheena

verses.eng: But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters.
verses.arabic: وَٱبْتَغِ فِيمَآ ءَاتَىٰكَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلدَّارَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۖ وَلَا تَنسَ نَصِيبَكَ مِنَ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَأَحْسِن كَمَآ أَحْسَنَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَلَا تَبْغِ ٱلْفَسَادَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wabtaghi feema ataka Allahu alddara alakhirata wala tansa naseebaka mina alddunya waahsin kama ahsana Allahu ilayka wala tabghi alfasad fee alardi inna Allaha la yuhibbu almufsideena

verses.eng: He said, 'I was only given it because of knowledge I have.' Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]? But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أُوتِيتُهُۥ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عِندِىٓ ۚ أَوَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَدْ أَهْلَكَ مِن قَبْلِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ مَنْ هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُ قُوَّةً وَأَكْثَرُ جَمْعًا ۚ وَلَا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذُنُوبِهِمُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qala innama ooteetuhu 'ala 'ilmin 'indee awalam ya'lam anna Allaha qad ahlaka min qablihi mina alqurooni man huwa ashaddu minhu quwwatan waaktharu jam'an wala yus'alu 'an thunoobihimu almujrimoona

verses.eng: So he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, 'Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qarun. Indeed, he is one of great fortune.'
verses.arabic: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فِى زِينَتِهِۦ ۖ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ يُرِيدُونَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا يَـٰلَيْتَ لَنَا مِثْلَ مَآ أُوتِىَ قَـٰرُونُ إِنَّهُۥ لَذُو حَظٍّ عَظِيمٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Fakharaja 'ala qawmihi fee zeenatihi qala allatheena yureedoona alhayata alddunya yalaytana mithla ma ootiya Qaroonu innahu lathoo haththin 'atheemin

verses.eng: But those who had been given knowledge said, 'Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for he who believes and does righteousness. And none are granted it except the patient.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ وَيْلَكُمْ ثَوَابُ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ لِّمَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا ۚ وَلَا يُلَقَّىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلصَّـٰبِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqala allatheena ootoo al'ilma waylakum thawabu Allahi khayrun liman amana wa'amila salihan wala yulaqqaha illa alssabiroona

verses.eng: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.
verses.arabic: فَخَسَفْنَا بِهِۦ وَبِدَارِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَمَا كَانَ لَهُۥ مِن فِئَةٍۢ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنتَصِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fakhasafna bihi wabidarihi alarda fama kana lahu min fi'atin yansuroonahu min dooni Allahi wama kana mina almuntasireena

verses.eng: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say, 'Oh, how Allah extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it! If not that Allah had conferred favor on us, He would have caused it to swallow us. Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!'
verses.arabic: وَأَصْبَحَ ٱلَّذِينَ تَمَنَّوْا۟ مَكَانَهُۥ بِٱلْأَمْسِ يَقُولُونَ وَيْكَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَقْدِرُ ۖ لَوْلَآ أَن مَّنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا لَخَسَفَ بِنَا ۖ وَيْكَأَنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waasbaha allatheena tamannaw makanahu bialamsi yaqooloona waykaanna Allaha yabsutu alrrizqa liman yashao min 'ibadihi wayaqdiru lawla an manna Allahu 'alayna lakhasafa bina waykaannahu la yuflihu alkafiroona

verses.eng: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ ٱلدَّارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ نَجْعَلُهَا لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُرِيدُونَ عُلُوًّۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فَسَادًۭا ۚ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Tilka alddaru alakhiratu naj'aluha lillatheena la yureedoona 'uluwwan fee alardi wala fasadan waal'aaqibatu lilmuttaqeena

verses.eng: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.
verses.arabic: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْهَا ۖ وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَلَا يُجْزَى ٱلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man jaa bialhasanati falahu khayrun minha waman jaa bialssayyiati fala yujza allatheena 'amiloo alssayyiati illa ma kanoo ya'maloona

verses.eng: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, 'My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error.'
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِى فَرَضَ عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لَرَآدُّكَ إِلَىٰ مَعَادٍۢ ۚ قُل رَّبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَمَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Inna allathee farada 'alayka alqurana laradduka ila ma'adin qul rabbee a'lamu man jaa bialhuda waman huwa fee dalalin mubeenin

verses.eng: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ تَرْجُوٓا۟ أَن يُلْقَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ إِلَّا رَحْمَةًۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ ظَهِيرًۭا لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wama kunta tarjoo an yulqa ilayka alkitabu illa rahmatan min rabbika fala takoonanna thaheeran lilkafireena

verses.eng: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allah.
verses.arabic: وَلَا يَصُدُّنَّكَ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ بَعْدَ إِذْ أُنزِلَتْ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَٱدْعُ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wala yasuddunnaka 'an ayati Allahi ba'da ith onzilat ilayka waod'u ila rabbika wala takoonanna mina almushrikeena

verses.eng: And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ ۘ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ كُلُّ شَىْءٍۢ هَالِكٌ إِلَّا وَجْهَهُۥ ۚ لَهُ ٱلْحُكْمُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wala tad'u ma'a Allahi ilahan akhara la ilaha illa huwa kullu shayin halikun illa wajhahu lahu alhukmu wa-ilayhi turja'oona

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Meem.
verses.arabic: الٓمٓ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Meem

verses.eng: Do the people think that they will be left to say, 'We believe' and they will not be tried?
verses.arabic: أَحَسِبَ ٱلنَّاسُ أَن يُتْرَكُوٓا۟ أَن يَقُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَهُمْ لَا يُفْتَنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ahasiba an-nāsu an yutrakoo an yaqooloo amannā wa hum lā yuftanoon

verses.eng: But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۖ فَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ صَدَقُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad fatannā alladhīna min qablihim falayaAAlamanna Allāhu alladhīna sadaqoo walayaAAlamanna alkādhibīna

verses.eng: Or do those who do evil deeds think they can outrun Us? Evil is what they judge.
verses.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ أَن يَسْبِقُونَا ۚ سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am hasiba alladhīna yaAAmaloona assayyiāti an yasbiqoonā sāa mā yahkumoon

verses.eng: Whoever should hope for the meeting with Allah - indeed, the term decreed by Allah is coming. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: مَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ لَءَاتٍۢ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Man kāna yarjoo liqāa Allāhi fa-inna ajala Allāhi laātin wa huwa assameeAAu alAAaleem

verses.eng: And whoever strives only strives for [the benefit of] himself. Indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَمَن جَـٰهَدَ فَإِنَّمَا يُجَـٰهِدُ لِنَفْسِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَنِىٌّ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waman jāhada fa-innamā yujāhidu linafsihi inna Allāha laghaniyyun AAani alAAālamīna

verses.eng: Those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَحْسَنَ ٱلَّذِي كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waalladhīna āmanoo waAAamiloo assālihāti lanukaffiranna AAanhum sayyiātihim walanajziyannahum ahsana alladhī kānoo yaAAmaloon

verses.eng: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to parents. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
verses.arabic: وَوَصَّيْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ حُسْنًۭا ۖ وَإِن جَـٰهَدَاكَ لِتُشْرِكَ بِى مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌۭ فَلَا تُطِعْهُمَآ ۚ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wawassaynā al-insāna biwālidayhi husnan wa-in jāhadāka litushrika bee mā laysa laka bihi AAilmun falā tutiAAhumā ilayya marjiAAukum faonabbi-okum bimā kuntum taAAmaloon

verses.eng: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous [into Paradise].
verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُدْخِلَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waalladhīna āmanoo waAAamiloo assālihāti lanudkhilannahum fee assāliheena

verses.eng: And of the people are some who say, 'We believe in Allah,' but when one [of them] is harmed for [the cause of] Allah, they consider the trial of the people as [if it were] the punishment of Allah. But if victory comes from your Lord, they say, 'Indeed, We were with you.' Is not Allah most knowing of what is within the breasts of all creatures?
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ فَإِذَآ أُوذِىَ فِى ٱللَّهِ جَعَلَ فِتْنَةَ ٱلنَّاسِ كَعَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَلَئِن جَآءَ نَصْرٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ إِنَّا كُنَّا مَعَكُمْ ۚ أَوَلَيْسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَعْلَمَ بِمَا فِى صُدُورِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wamina an-nāsi man yaqoolu āmannā biAllāhi fa-idhā oothiya fee Allāhi jaAAala fitnata an-nāsi kaAAathābi Allāhi wala-in jāa nasrun min rabbika layaqoolunna innā kunnā maAAakum awalaysa Allāhu bi-aAAlama bimā fee sudoori alAAālamīna

verses.eng: And Allah will surely make evident those who believe, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.
verses.arabic: وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: WalayaAAlamanna Allāhu alladhīna āmanoo walayaAAlamanna almunāfiqeena

verses.eng: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'Follow our way, and we will carry your sins.' But they will not carry anything of their sins. Indeed, they are liars.
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ سَبِيلَنَا وَلْنَحْمِلْ خَطَـٰيَـٰكُمْ وَمَا هُم بِحَـٰمِلِينَ مِنْ خَطَـٰيَـٰهُم مِّن شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waqāla alladhīna kafaroo lilladhīna āmanoo ittabiAAoo sabeelanā walnahmil khatāyākum wamā hum bihāmileena min khatāyāhum min shay-in innahum lakādhiboon

verses.eng: But they will surely carry their [own] burdens and [other] burdens along with their burdens, and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.
verses.arabic: وَلَيَحْمِلُنَّ أَثْقَالَهُمْ وَأَثْقَالًۭا مَّعَ أَثْقَالِهِمْ ۖ وَلَيُسْـَٔلُنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walayahmilunna athqālahum waathqālan maAAa athqālihim walayus-alunna yawma alqiyāmati AAammā kānoo yaftaroon

verses.eng: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَلَبِثَ فِيهِمْ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ إِلَّا خَمْسِينَ عَامًۭا فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلطُّوفَانُ وَهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalnā noohan ilā qawmihi falabitha feehim alfa sanatin illā khamseena AAāman faakhathahumu attoofānu wahum thalimoon

verses.eng: But We saved him and the companions of the ship, and We made it a sign for the worlds.
verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلسَّفِينَةِ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-anjaynāhu waashaba assafeenati wajaAAalnāhā āyatan lilAAālamīna

verses.eng: And [mention] Abraham, when he said to his people, 'Worship Allah and fear Him. That is best for you, if you should know.'
verses.arabic: وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقُوهُ ۖ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Ibraheema ith qala liqawmihi oAAbudoo Allaha waittaqoohu thalikum khayrun lakum in kuntum taAAlamoon

verses.eng: You only worship, besides Allah, idols and you produce a falsehood. Indeed, those you worship besides Allah do not possess for you [the power of] provision. So seek from Allah provision and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned.'
verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَوْثَانًا وَتَخْلُقُونَ إِفْكًا ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ تَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ لَكُمْ رِزْقًا فَابْتَغُوا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ الرِّزْقَ وَاعْبُدُوهُ وَاشْكُرُوا لَهُ ۖ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Innama taAAbudoona min dooni Allahi awthanan watakhluqoona ifkan inna allatheena taAAbudoona min dooni Allahi la yamlikoona lakum rizqan faibtaghoo AAinda Allahi alrrizqa waoAAbudoohu waoshkuroo lahu ilayhi turjaAAoon

verses.eng: And if you [people] deny [the message] - already nations before you have denied. And there is not upon the Messenger except [the duty of] clear notification.
verses.arabic: وَإِنْ تُكَذِّبُوا فَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أُمَمٌ مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ ۖ وَمَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.transliteration: Wa-in tukaththiboo faqad kaththaba umamun min qablikum wama AAala alrrasooli illa albalaghu almubeen

verses.eng: Have they not considered how Allah begins creation and then repeats it? Indeed, that is easy for Allah.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَيْفَ يُبْدِئُ اللَّهُ الْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw kayfa yubdio Allahu alkhalqa thumma yuAAeeduhu inna thalika AAala Allahi yaseer

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], 'Travel through the land and observe how He began creation. Then Allah will produce the final creation. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.'
verses.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَانْظُرُوا كَيْفَ بَدَأَ الْخَلْقَ ۚ ثُمَّ اللَّهُ يُنْشِئُ النَّشْأَةَ الْآخِرَةَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Qul seeroo fee al-ardi fanthuroo kayfa badaa alkhalqa thumma Allahu yunshio alnnashata al-akhirata inna Allaha AAala kulli shayin qadeer

verses.eng: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.
verses.arabic: يُعَذِّبُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَرْحَمُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ تُقْلَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: YuAAaththibu man yashao wayarhamu man yashao wa-ilayhi tuqlaboon

verses.eng: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth or in the heaven. And you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper.
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَنْتُمْ بِمُعْجِزِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ ۖ وَمَا لَكُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مِنْ وَلِيٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Wama antum bimuAAjizeena fee al-ardi wala fee alssama-i wama lakum min dooni Allahi min waliyyin wala naseer
