verses.eng: And those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَلِقَائِهِ أُولَٰئِكَ يَئِسُوا مِنْ رَحْمَتِي وَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Waallatheena kafaroo bi-ayati Allahi waliqa-ihi ola-ika ya-isoo min rahmatee waola-ika lahum AAathabun aleem

verses.eng: So the answer of Abraham's people was only that they said, 'Kill him or burn him,' but Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا اقْتُلُوهُ أَوْ حَرِّقُوهُ فَأَنْجَاهُ اللَّهُ مِنَ النَّارِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fama kana jawaba qawmihi illa an qaloo oqtuloohu aw harriqoohu faanjahu Allahu mina alnnari inna fee thalika laayatin liqawmin yu/minoon

verses.eng: And [Abraham] said, 'You have only taken, other than Allah, idols as [a bond of] affection among you in worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers.'
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنَّمَا اتَّخَذْتُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَوْثَانًا مَوَدَّةَ بَيْنِكُمْ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۖ ثُمَّ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ يَكْفُرُ بَعْضُكُمْ بِبَعْضٍ وَيَلْعَنُ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضًا وَمَأْوَاكُمُ النَّارُ وَمَا لَكُمْ مِنْ نَاصِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Waqala innama ittakhathtum min dooni Allahi awthanan mawaddata baynikum fee alhayati alddunya thumma yawma alqiyamati yakfuru baAAdukum bibaAAdin wayalAAanu baAAdukum baAAdan wama/wakumu alnnaru wama lakum min nasireen

verses.eng: And Lot believed him. [Abraham] said, 'Indeed, I will emigrate to [the service of] my Lord. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.'
verses.arabic: فَآمَنَ لَهُ لُوطٌ ۘ وَقَالَ إِنِّي مُهَاجِرٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Faamana lahu lootun waqala innee muhajirun ila rabbee innahu huwa alAAazeezu alhakeem

verses.eng: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.
verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِي ذُرِّيَّتِهِ النُّبُوَّةَ وَالْكِتَابَ وَآتَيْنَاهُ أَجْرَهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَإِنَّهُ فِي الْآخِرَةِ لَمِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wawahabna lahu is-haqa wayaAAqooba wajaAAalna fee thurriyyatihi alnnubuwwata waalkitaba waataynahu ajrahu fee alddunya wa-innahu fee al-akhirati lamina alssaliheen

verses.eng: And [We sent] Lot when he said to his people, 'Indeed, you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds.
verses.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ الْفَاحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُمْ بِهَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walootan ith qala liqawmihi innakum lata/toona alfahishata ma sabaqakum biha min ahadin min alAAalameen

verses.eng: Indeed, you approach men and obstruct the road and commit in your meetings [every] evil.' And the answer of his people was not but they said, 'Bring us the punishment of Allah, if you should be of the truthful.'
verses.arabic: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ الرِّجَالَ وَتَقْطَعُونَ السَّبِيلَ وَتَأْتُونَ فِي نَادِيكُمُ الْمُنْكَرَ ۖ فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا ائْتِنَا بِعَذَابِ اللَّهِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: A-innakum lata/toona alrrijala wataqtaAAoona alssabeela wata/toona fee nadeekumu almunkara fama kana jawaba qawmihi illa an qaloo i/tina biAAathabi Allahi in kunta mina alssadiqeen

verses.eng: He said, 'My Lord, support me against the corrupting people.'
verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ انْصُرْنِي عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi onsurnee AAala alqawmi almufsideen

verses.eng: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that Lot's city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَاءَتْ رُسُلُنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ بِالْبُشْرَىٰ قَالُوا إِنَّا مُهْلِكُو أَهْلِ هَٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ ۖ إِنَّ أَهْلَهَا كَانُوا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā jā'at rusulunā Ibrāhīma bil-bush'rā qālū innā muhlikū ahli hādhihi l-qaryati inna ahlahā kānū ẓālimīn

verses.eng: He said, "Indeed, within it is Lot." They said, "We are more knowing of who is in it. We will surely save him and his family, except his wife. She is to be of those who remain behind."
verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ فِيهَا لُوطًا ۚ قَالُوا نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ فِيهَا ۖ لَنُنَجِّيَنَّهُ وَأَهْلَهُ إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ كَانَتْ مِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qāla inna fīhā Lūṭan qālū naḥnu aʿlamu biman fīhā lanunajjiyannahu wa ahlahu illā mra'atahu kānat mina l-ghābirīn

verses.eng: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, "This is a trying day."
verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا أَنْ جَاءَتْ رُسُلُنَا لُوطًا سِيءَ بِهِمْ وَضَاقَ بِهِمْ ذَرْعًا وَقَالَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَصِيبٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammā an jā'at rusulunā Lūṭan sī'a bihim wa ḍāqa bihim dharʿan wa qāla hādhā yawmun ʿaṣīb

verses.eng: And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?"
verses.arabic: وَجَاءَهُ قَوْمُهُ يُهْرَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ وَمِنْ قَبْلُ كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ هَٰؤُلَاءِ بَنَاتِي هُنَّ أَطْهَرُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ فِي ضَيْفِي ۖ أَلَيْسَ مِنْكُمْ رَجُلٌ رَشِيدٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa jā'ahu qawmuhu yuhraʿūna ilayhi wa min qablu kānū yaʿmalūna s-sayyi'āti qāla yā qawmi hā'ulā'i banātī hunna aṭharu lakum fattaqū Llāha wa lā tukh'zūnī fī ḍayfī a laysa minkum rajulun rashīd

verses.eng: They said, "You have already known that we have not concerning your daughters any claim, and indeed, you know what we want."
verses.arabic: قَالُوا لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا لَنَا فِي بَنَاتِكَ مِنْ حَقٍّ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَعْلَمُ مَا نُرِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Qālū laqad ʿalimta mā lanā fī banātika min ḥaqqin wa innaka lataʿlamu mā nurīd

verses.eng: He said, "If only I had against you some power or could take refuge in a strong support."
verses.arabic: قَالَ لَوْ أَنَّ لِي بِكُمْ قُوَّةً أَوْ آوِي إِلَىٰ رُكْنٍ شَدِيدٍ
verses.transliteration: Qāla law anna lī bikum quwwatan aw āwī ilā ruknin shadīd

verses.eng: They [the angels] said, "O Lot, indeed we are messengers of your Lord; [therefore], they will never reach you. So set out with your family during a portion of the night and let not any among you look back - except your wife; indeed, she will be struck by that which strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is [for] the morning. Is not the morning near?"
verses.arabic: قَالُوا يَا لُوطُ إِنَّا رُسُلُ رَبِّكَ لَنْ يَصِلُوا إِلَيْكَ ۖ فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنْكُمْ أَحَدٌ إِلَّا امْرَأَتَكَ ۖ إِنَّهُ مُصِيبُهَا مَا أَصَابَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ مَوْعِدَهُمُ الصُّبْحُ ۚ أَلَيْسَ الصُّبْحُ بِقَرِيبٍ
verses.transliteration: Qālū yā Lūṭu innā rusulu rabbika lan yaṣilū ilayka fa-asri bi'ahlika biqṭiʿin mina l-layli wa lā yaltafit minkum aḥadun illā mra'ataka innahu muṣībuhā mā aṣābahum inna mawʿidahumu ṣ-ṣubḥu a laysa ṣ-ṣubḥu biqarīb

verses.eng: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا فِي دَارِهِمْ جَاثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa'akhadhathumu r-rajfatu fa'aṣbaḥū fī dārihim jāthimīn

verses.eng: And [We destroyed] Qarun and Pharaoh and Haman. And Moses had already come to them with clear evidences, and they were arrogant in the land, but they were not outrunners [of Our punishment].
verses.arabic: وَقَارُونَ وَفِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَاسْتَكْبَرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا كَانُوا سَابِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Qārūna wa Firʿawna wa Hāmāna wa laqad jā'ahum Mūsā bil-bayyināti fastakbarū fī l-arḍi wa mā kānū sābiqīn

verses.eng: So each We seized for his sin; and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them were those who were seized by the blast [from the sky], and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.
verses.arabic: فَكُلًّا أَخَذْنَا بِذَنْبِهِ ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِ حَاصِبًا وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ أَخَذَتْهُ الصَّيْحَةُ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ خَسَفْنَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ أَغْرَقْنَا ۚ وَمَا كَانَ اللَّهُ لِيَظْلِمَهُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fakullan akhadhnā bidhanbihi fa-minhum man arsalnā ʿalayhi ḥāṣiban wa minhum man akhadhathu ṣ-ṣayḥatu wa minhum man khasafnā bihi l-arḍa wa minhum man aghraqnā wa mā kāna Llāhu liyaẓlimahum wa lākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

verses.eng: The example of those who take allies other than Allah is like that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.
verses.arabic: مَثَلُ الَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ كَمَثَلِ الْعَنْكَبُوتِ اتَّخَذَتْ بَيْتًا ۖ وَإِنَّ أَوْهَنَ الْبُيُوتِ لَبَيْتُ الْعَنْكَبُوتِ ۖ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mathalu alladhīna ittakhadhū min dūni Llāhi awliyā'a kamathali l-ʿankabūti ittakhadhat baytan wa inna awhana l-buyūti labaytu l-ʿankabūti law kānū yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah knows whatever thing they call upon other than Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِنْ دُونِهِ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Inna Llāha yaʿlamu mā yadʿūna min dūnihi min shay'in wa huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīm

verses.eng: And these examples We present to the people, but none will understand them except those of knowledge.
verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ الْأَمْثَالُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ ۖ وَمَا يَعْقِلُهَا إِلَّا الْعَالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa tilka l-amthālu naḍribuhā li-n-nāsi wa mā yaʿqiluhā illā l-ʿālimūn

verses.eng: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
verses.arabic: خَلَقَ اللَّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Khalaqa Llāhu s-samāwāti wa l-arḍa bil-ḥaqqi inna fī dhālika la'āyatan lil-mu'minīn

verses.eng: Recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows that which you do.
verses.arabic: اتْلُ مَا أُوحِيَ إِلَيْكَ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ ۖ إِنَّ الصَّلَاةَ تَنْهَىٰ عَنِ الْفَحْشَاءِ وَالْمُنْكَرِ ۗ وَلَذِكْرُ اللَّهِ أَكْبَرُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَصْنَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Utlu mā ūḥiya ilayka mina l-kitābi wa aqimi ṣ-ṣalāta inna ṣ-ṣalāta tanhā ʿani l-faḥshā'i wa l-munkari wa la-dhikru Llāhi akbaru wa Llāhu yaʿlamu mā taṣnaʿūn

verses.eng: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, "We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one; and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُجَادِلُوا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ إِلَّا بِالَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مِنْهُمْ وَقُولُوا آمَنَّا بِالَّذِي أُنزِلَ إِلَيْنَا وَأُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ وَإِلَٰهُنَا وَإِلَٰهُكُمْ وَاحِدٌ وَنَحْنُ لَهُ مُسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tujādilū ahlal-kitābi illā billatī hiya aḥsanu illā alladhīna ẓalamū minhum wa qūlū āmannā billadhī unzila ilaynā wa unzila ilaykum wa ilāhunā wa ilāhukum wāḥidun wa naḥnu lahu muslimūn

verses.eng: And thus We have sent down to you the Scripture. So those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture believe in it, and among these [people of Makkah] are those who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ فَالَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ وَمِنْ هَٰؤُلَاءِ مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِهِ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِآيَاتِنَا إِلَّا الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa kadhālika anzalnā ilaykal-kitāba falladhīna ātaynāhumul-kitāba yu'minūna bihī wa min hā'ulā'i may yu'minu bihī wa mā yajḥadu bi'āyātinā illāl-kāfirūn

verses.eng: And you did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Otherwise the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.
verses.arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ تَتْلُو مِن قَبْلِهِ مِن كِتَابٍ وَلَا تَخُطُّهُ بِيَمِينِكَ إِذًا لَّارْتَابَ الْمُبْطِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā kunta tatlū min qablihī min kitābin wa lā takhuṭṭuhu biyamīnika idhan lartābal-mubṭilūn

verses.eng: Rather, it is [Allah's] verses [which are] evident within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.
verses.arabic: بَلْ هُوَ آيَاتٌ بَيِّنَاتٌ فِي صُدُورِ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِآيَاتِنَا إِلَّا الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Bal huwa āyātun bayyinātun fī ṣudūril-ladhīna ūtul-'ilma wa mā yajḥadu bi'āyātinā illāẓ-ẓālimūn

verses.eng: But they say, "Why are not signs sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "The signs are only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِ قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْآيَاتُ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa qālū lawlā unzila 'alayhi āyātum mir rabbihī qul innamal-āyātu 'indallāhi wa innamā anā nadhīrum mubīn

verses.eng: Is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and reminder for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكْفِهِمْ أَنَّا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَرَحْمَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yakfihim annā anzalnā 'alaykal-kitāba yutlā 'alayhim inna fī dhālika laraḥmatan wa dhikrā liqawmin yu'minūn

verses.eng: Say, "Sufficient is Allah between me and you as Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and earth. And they who have believed in falsehood and disbelieved in Allah - it is those who are the losers."
verses.arabic: قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكُمْ شَهِيدًا يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِالْبَاطِلِ وَكَفَرُوا بِاللَّهِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qul kafā billāhi baynī wa baynakum shahīdan ya'lamu mā fis-samāwāti wal-arḍi walladhīna āmanū bil-bāṭili wa kafarū billāhi ulā'ika humul-khāsirūn

verses.eng: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And if not for [the decree of] a specified term, punishment would have reached them. But it will surely come to them suddenly while they perceive not.
verses.arabic: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِالْعَذَابِ وَلَوْلَا أَجَلٌ مُّسَمًّى لَّجَاءَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ وَلَيَأْتِيَنَّهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yasta'jilūnaka bil-'adhābi wa lawlā ajalum musamman lajā'ahumul-'adhābu wa laya'tiyannahum baghtatan wa hum lā yash'urūn

verses.eng: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers
verses.arabic: يَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِالْعَذَابِ وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمُحِيطَةٌ بِالْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Yasta'jilūnaka bil-'adhābi wa inna jahannama lamuḥīṭatun bil-kāfirīn

verses.eng: On the Day the punishment will cover them from above them and from below their feet and it is said, "Taste [the result of] what you used to do."
verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَغْشَاهُمُ الْعَذَابُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَمِن تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِهِمْ وَيَقُولُ ذُوقُوا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yawma yaghshāhumul-'adhābu min fawqihim wa min taḥti arjulihim wa yaqūlu dhūqū mā kuntum ta'malūn

verses.eng: O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.
verses.arabic: يَا عِبَادِيَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنَّ أَرْضِي وَاسِعَةٌ فَإِيَّايَ فَاعْبُدُونِ
verses.transliteration: Yā 'ibādiya alladhīna āmanū inna arḍī wāsi'atun fa iyyāya fa'budūn

verses.eng: Every soul will taste death. Then to Us will you be returned.
verses.arabic: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَائِقَةُ الْمَوْتِ ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kullu nafsin dhā'iqatul-mawti thumma ilaynā turja'ūn

verses.eng: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will surely assign to them of Paradise [elevated] chambers beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers,
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم مِّنَ الْجَنَّةِ غُرَفًا تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا نِعْمَ أَجْرُ الْعَامِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Walladhīna āmanū wa 'amiluṣ-ṣāliḥāti lanubawwi'annahum minal-jannati ghurafan tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā ni'ma ajrul-'āmilīn

verses.eng: Who have been patient and upon their Lord rely.
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna ṣabarū wa 'alā rabbihim yatawakkalūn

verses.eng: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision. Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
verses.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِن دَابَّةٍ لَا تَحْمِلُ رِزْقَهَا اللَّهُ يَرْزُقُهَا وَإِيَّاكُمْ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa ka'ayyin min dābbatin lā taḥmilu rizqahā allāhu yarzuquhā wa iyyākum wa huwas-samī'ul-'alīm

verses.eng: And if you asked them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Then how are they deluded?
verses.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ لَيَقُولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la-in sa'altahum man khalaqa as-samawati wal-arda wa sakhkhara ash-shamsa wal-qamara la-yaqulunna Allahu fa-anna yu'fakun

verses.eng: Allah extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed, Allah is, of all things, Knowing.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ وَيَقْدِرُ لَهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Allahu yabsutu ar-rizqa liman yashau min 'ibadihi wa yaqdiru lahu inna Allaha bikulli shay'in 'alim

verses.eng: And if you asked them, 'Who sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Praise to Allah'; but most of them do not reason.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّن نَّزَّلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَحْيَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ مِن بَعْدِ مَوْتِهَا لَيَقُولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la-in sa'altahum man nazzala min as-sama'i ma'an fa-ahya bihi al-arda min ba'di mawtiha la-yaqulunna Allahu quli al-hamdu lillahi bal aktharuhum la ya'qilun

verses.eng: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement. And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life, if only they knew.
verses.arabic: وَمَا هَٰذِهِ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا إِلَّا لَهْوٌ وَلَعِبٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ الدَّارَ الْآخِرَةَ لَهِيَ الْحَيَوَانُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ma hathihi al-hayatu ad-dunya illa lahwun wa la'ibun wa inna ad-dara al-akhirata lahiya al-hayawanu law kanu ya'lamun

verses.eng: And when they board a ship, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, at once they associate others with Him
verses.arabic: فَإِذَا رَكِبُوا فِي الْفُلْكِ دَعَوُا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ فَلَمَّا نَجَّاهُمْ إِلَى الْبَرِّ إِذَا هُمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-itha rakibu fi al-fulki da'aw Allaha mukhlisina lahu ad-dina fa-lamma najjahum ila al-barri idha hum yushrikun

verses.eng: So that they will deny what We have granted them, and they will enjoy themselves. But they are going to know.
verses.arabic: لِيَكْفُرُوا بِمَا آتَيْنَاهُمْ وَلِيَتَمَتَّعُوا ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Li-yakfuru bima ataynahum wa li-yatamatta'u fasawfa ya'lamun

verses.eng: Have they not seen that We made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary, while people are being taken away all around them? Then in falsehood do they believe, and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا حَرَمًا آمِنًا وَيُتَخَطَّفُ النَّاسُ مِنْ حَوْلِهِمْ ۚ أَفَبِالْبَاطِلِ يُؤْمِنُونَ وَبِنِعْمَةِ اللَّهِ يَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw anna ja'alna haraman aminan wa yutakhattafu an-nasu min hawlihim afa bil-batili yu'minuna wa bi-ni'mati Allahi yakfurun

verses.eng: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?
verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُ ۚ أَلَيْسَ فِي جَهَنَّمَ مَثْوًى لِّلْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa man azlamu mimmani iftara 'ala Allahi kathiban aw kaththaba bil-haqqi lamma ja'ahu alaysa fi jahannama mathwan lil-kafirin

verses.eng: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ جَاهَدُوا فِينَا لَنَهْدِيَنَّهُمْ سُبُلَنَا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَمَعَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhina jahadu fina la-nahdiyannahum subulana wa inna Allaha la-ma'a al-muhsinin

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Meem.
verses.arabic: الم
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Meem

verses.eng: The Byzantines have been defeated
verses.arabic: غُلِبَتِ ٱلرُّومُ
verses.transliteration: Ghulibati ar-Rūm

verses.eng: In the nearest land. But they, after their defeat, will overcome.
verses.arabic: فِىٓ أَدْنَى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ غَلَبِهِمْ سَيَغْلِبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fī adnā al-arḍi wa hum min baʿdi ghalabihim sayaghlibūn

verses.eng: Within three to nine years. To Allah belongs the command before and after. And that day the believers will rejoice
verses.arabic: فِى بِضْعِ سِنِينَ ۗ لِلَّهِ ٱلْأَمْرُ مِن قَبْلُ وَمِنۢ بَعْدُ ۚ وَيَوْمَئِذٍ يَفْرَحُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fī biḍʿi sinīna, lillahi al-amru min qablu wa min baʿdu, wa yawmaʾidhin yafraḥu al-muʾminūn

verses.eng: In the victory of Allah. He gives victory to whom He wills, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
verses.arabic: بِنَصْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ يَنصُرُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Bi-naṣri Allahi, yanṣuru man yashāʾu, wa huwa al-ʿazīzu al-raḥīm

verses.eng: [It is] the promise of Allah. Allah does not fail in His promise, but most of the people do not know.
verses.arabic: وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱللَّهُ وَعْدَهُۥ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waʿda Allahi, lā yukhlifu Allahu waʿdahu wa lākinna akthara an-nāsi lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: They know what is apparent of the worldly life, but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.
verses.arabic: يَعْلَمُونَ ظَـٰهِرًا مِّنَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ غَـٰفِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yaʿlamūna ẓāhiran min al-ḥayāti ad-dunyā wa hum ʿan al-ākhirati hum ghāfilūn

verses.eng: Do they not contemplate within themselves? Allah has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَتَفَكَّرُوا۟ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِم ۗ مَّا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۗ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِلِقَآءِ رَبِّهِمْ لَكَـٰفِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yatafakkarū fī anfusihim, mā khalaqa Allahu as-samāwāti wa al-arḍa wa mā baynahumā illā bil-ḥaqqi wa ajalim musammā, wa inna kathīran min an-nāsi biliqāʾi rabbihim lakāfirūn

verses.eng: Have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in power, and they plowed the earth and built it up more than they have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear evidence. And Allah would not ever have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَانُوٓا۟ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةً وَأَثَارُوا۟ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَعَمَرُوهَآ أَكْثَرَ مِمَّا عَمَرُوهَا وَجَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ ۖ فَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيَظْلِمَهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yasīrū fī al-arḍi fa yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu alladhīna min qablihim, kānū ashadda minhum quwwatan wa athārū al-arḍa wa ʿamarūhā akthara mimmā ʿamarūhā wa jāʾathum rusuluhum bil-bayyināti, fa mā kāna Allahu liyaẓlimahum wa lākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

verses.eng: Then the end of those who did evil was the worst [consequence] because they denied the signs of Allah and used to ridicule them.
verses.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَـٰٓـُٔوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓأَىٰٓ أَن كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَكَانُوا۟ بِهَا يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thumma kāna ʿāqibata alladhīna asāʾū as-sūʾā an kadhdhabū bi-āyāti Allahi wa kānū bihā yastahziʾūn

verses.eng: Allah begins creation; then He will repeat it; then to Him you will be returned.
verses.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu yabdaʾu al-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhu thumma ilayhi turjaʿūn

verses.eng: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will be in despair.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ يُبْلِسُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma taqūmu as-sāʿatu yublisu al-mujrimūn

verses.eng: And there will not be for them among their [alleged] partners any intercessors, and they will [then] be disbelievers in their partners.
verses.arabic: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُم مِّن شُرَكَآئِهِمْ شُفَعَـٰٓؤُا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ كَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lam yakun lahum min shurakāʾihim shufaʿāʾu wa kānū bishurakāʾihim kāfirīn

verses.eng: And the Day the Hour appears - that Day they will become separated.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَفَرَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma taqūmu as-sāʿatu yawmaʾidhin yatafarraqūn

verses.eng: As for those who had believed and done righteous deeds, they will be in a garden [of Paradise], delighted.
verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَهُمْ فِى رَوْضَةٍ يُحْبَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa ammā alladhīna āmanū wa ʿamilū as-sāliḥāti fa hum fī rawḍatin yuḥbarūn

verses.eng: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, those will be brought into the punishment.
verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَلِقَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُحْضَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ammā alladhīna kafarū wa kadhabū bi-āyātinā wa liqā'i al-ākhirati fa-ulā'ika fī al-ʿadhābi muḥ'ḍarūn

verses.eng: So exalted is Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.
verses.arabic: فَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ حِينَ تُمْسُونَ وَحِينَ تُصْبِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fasubḥāna Allāhi ḥīna tumsūna wa ḥīna tuṣbiḥūn

verses.eng: And to Him is [due all] praise throughout the heavens and the earth. And [exalted is He] at night and when you are at noon.
verses.arabic: وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَعَشِيًّا وَحِينَ تُظْهِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lahu al-ḥamdu fī as-samāwāti wa al-arḍi wa ʿashiyyan wa ḥīna tuẓhirūn

verses.eng: He brings out the living from the dead and brings out the dead from the living and brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. And thus will you be brought out.
verses.arabic: يُخْرِجُ الْحَيَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ وَيُخْرِجُ الْمَيِّتَ مِنَ الْحَيِّ وَيُحْيِي الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ
verses.transliteration: Yukhriju al-ḥayya mina al-mayyiti wa yukhriju al-mayyita mina al-ḥayyi wa yuḥyī al-arḍa baʿda mawtihā wa kadhālika tukhrajūn

verses.eng: And of His signs is that He created you from dust; then, suddenly you were human beings dispersing [throughout the earth].
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ أَنْ خَلَقَكُمْ مِنْ تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ إِذَا أَنْتُمْ بَشَرٌ تَنْتَشِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi an khalaqakum min turābin thumma idhā antum basharun tantashirūn

verses.eng: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ أَنْ خَلَقَ لَكُمْ مِنْ أَنْفُسِكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا لِتَسْكُنُوا إِلَيْهَا وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَكُمْ مَوَدَّةً وَرَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi an khalaqa lakum min anfusikum azwājan litaskunū ilayhā wa jaʿala baynakum mawaddatan wa raḥmatan inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmin yatafakkarūn

verses.eng: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ خَلْقُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَاخْتِلَافُ أَلْسِنَتِكُمْ وَأَلْوَانِكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِلْعَالِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi khalqu as-samāwāti wa al-arḍi wa ikhtilāfu alsinatikum wa alwānikum inna fī dhālika la-āyātin lil-ʿālimīn

verses.eng: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ مَنَامُكُمْ بِاللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ وَابْتِغَاؤُكُمْ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِقَوْمٍ يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi manāmukum bi-al-layli wa an-nahāri wa ibtighā'ukum min faḍlihi inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmin yasmaʿūn

verses.eng: And of His signs is [that] He shows you the lightning [causing] fear and aspiration, and He sends down rain from the sky by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for a people who use reason.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ يُرِيكُمُ الْبَرْقَ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَيُحْيِي بِهِ الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi yurīkumu al-barqa khawfan wa ṭamaʿan wa yunazzilu mina as-samā'i mā'an fa yuḥyī bihi al-arḍa baʿda mawtihā inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmin yaʿqilūn

verses.eng: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth remain by His command. Then when He calls you with a [single] call from the earth, immediately you will come forth.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ أَنْ تَقُومَ السَّمَاءُ وَالْأَرْضُ بِأَمْرِهِ ۚ ثُمَّ إِذَا دَعَاكُمْ دَعْوَةً مِنَ الْأَرْضِ إِذَا أَنْتُمْ تَخْرُجُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi an taqūma as-samā'u wa al-arḍu bi-amrihi thumma idhā daʿākum daʿwatan mina al-arḍi idhā antum takhrujūn

verses.eng: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are to Him devoutly obedient.
verses.arabic: وَلَهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ كُلٌّ لَهُ قَانِتُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa lahu man fī as-samāwāti wa al-arḍi kullun lahu qānitūn

verses.eng: And it is He who begins creation; then He repeats it, and that is easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest attribute in the heavens and earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
verses.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي يَبْدَأُ الْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُ وَهُوَ أَهْوَنُ عَلَيْهِ ۚ وَلَهُ الْمَثَلُ الْأَعْلَىٰ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa huwa alladhī yabda'u al-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhu wa huwa ahwanu ʿalayhi wa lahu al-mathalu al-aʿlā fī as-samāwāti wa al-arḍi wa huwa al-ʿazīzu al-ḥakīm

verses.eng: He presents to you an example from yourselves. Do you have among those whom your right hands possess any partners in what We have provided for you so that you are equal therein [and] would fear them as your fear of one another [within a partnership]? Thus do We detail the signs for a people who use reason.
verses.arabic: ضَرَبَ لَكُمْ مَثَلًا مِنْ أَنْفُسِكُمْ ۖ هَلْ لَكُمْ مِنْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ مِنْ شُرَكَاءَ فِي مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ فَأَنْتُمْ فِيهِ سَوَاءٌ تَخَافُونَهُمْ كَخِيفَتِكُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الْآيَاتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ḍaraba lakum mathalan min anfusikum hal lakum mimmā malakat aymānukum min shurakā'a fīmā razaqnākum fa antum fīhi sawā'un takhāfūnahum ka-khīfatikum anfusakum kadhālika nufaṣṣilu al-āyāti liqawmin yaʿqilūn

verses.eng: But those who wrong follow their [own] desires without knowledge. Then who can guide one whom Allah has sent astray? And there will be for them no helpers.
verses.arabic: بَلِ اتَّبَعَ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۖ فَمَنْ يَهْدِي مَنْ أَضَلَّ اللَّهُ ۖ وَمَا لَهُمْ مِنْ نَاصِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Bali ittabaʿa alladhīna ẓalamū ahwā'ahum bighayri ʿilmin fa man yahdī man aḍalla Allāhu wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

verses.eng: So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the fitrah of Allah upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of Allah. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.
verses.arabic: فَأَقِمْ وَجْهَكَ لِلدِّينِ حَنِيفًا ۚ فِطْرَتَ اللَّهِ الَّتِي فَطَرَ النَّاسَ عَلَيْهَا ۚ لَا تَبْدِيلَ لِخَلْقِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الدِّينُ الْقَيِّمُ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa aqim wajhaka li-ad-dīni ḥanīfan fiṭrata Allāhi allatī faṭara an-nāsa ʿalayhā lā tabdīla likhalqi Allāhi dhālika ad-dīnu al-qayyimu wa lākinna akthara an-nāsi lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: Turn to Him [in repentance] and fear Him and establish prayer and do not be of those who associate others with Allah
verses.arabic: مُنِيبِينَ إِلَيْهِ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Muneebeena ilayhi waittaqoohu waaqeemoo assalata wala takoonoo mina almushrikeena

verses.eng: Of those who have divided their religion and become sects, every faction rejoicing in what it has.
verses.arabic: مِنَ الَّذِينَ فَرَّقُوا دِينَهُمْ وَكَانُوا شِيَعًا ۖ كُلُّ حِزْبٍ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Mina allatheena farraqoo deenahum wakanoo shiyaAAan kullu hizbin bima ladayhim farihoona

verses.eng: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّ النَّاسَ ضُرٌّ دَعَوْا رَبَّهُم مُّنِيبِينَ إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا أَذَاقَهُم مِّنْهُ رَحْمَةً إِذَا فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم بِرَبِّهِمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waitha massa annasa durrun daAAaw rabbahum muneebeena ilayhi thumma itha athaqahum minhu rahmatan itha fareequn minhum birabbihim yushrikoona

verses.eng: So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
verses.arabic: لِيَكْفُرُوا بِمَا آتَيْنَاهُمْ ۚ فَتَمَتَّعُوا فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Liyakfuroo bima ataynahum fatamattaAAoo fasawfa taAAlamoona

verses.eng: Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they were associating with Him?
verses.arabic: أَمْ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَانًا فَهُوَ يَتَكَلَّمُ بِمَا كَانُوا بِهِ يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Am anzalna AAalayhim sultanan fahuwa yatakallamu bima kanoo bihi yushrikoona

verses.eng: And when We let the people taste mercy, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, immediately they despair.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا أَذَقْنَا النَّاسَ رَحْمَةً فَرِحُوا بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ إِذَا هُمْ يَقْنَطُونَ
verses.transliteration: Waitha athaqna annasa rahmatan farihoo biha wa-in tusibhum sayyiatun bima qaddamat aydeehim itha hum yaqnatoon

verses.eng: Do they not see that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.
verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw anna Allaha yabsutu arrizqa liman yashao wayaqdiru inna fee thalika laayatin liqawmin yuminoona

verses.eng: So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of Allah, and it is they who will be the successful.
verses.arabic: فَآتِ ذَا الْقُرْبَىٰ حَقَّهُ وَالْمِسْكِينَ وَابْنَ السَّبِيلِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَ اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fati tha alqurba haqqahu waalmiskeena wabna assabeeli thalika khayrun lillatheena yureedoona wajha Allahi waolaika humu almuflihoona

verses.eng: And whatever you give for interest to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allah. But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of Allah - those are the multipliers.
verses.arabic: وَمَا آتَيْتُم مِّن رِّبًا لِّيَرْبُوَ فِي أَمْوَالِ النَّاسِ فَلَا يَرْبُو عِندَ اللَّهِ ۖ وَمَا آتَيْتُم مِّن زَكَاةٍ تُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَ اللَّهِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُضْعِفُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wama ataytum min riban liyarbuwa fee amwali annasi fala yarbu AAinda Allahi wama ataytum min zakatin tureedoona wajha Allahi faolaika humu almudAAifoona

verses.eng: Allah is the one who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, then will give you life. Are there any of your 'partners' who does anything of that? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ رَزَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ ۖ هَلْ مِن شُرَكَائِكُم مَّن يَفْعَلُ مِن ذَٰلِكُم مِّن شَيْءٍ ۚ سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allahu allathee khalaqakum thumma razaqakum thumma yumeetukum thumma yuhyeekum hal min shurakaikum man yafAAalu min thalikum min shayin subhanahu wataAAala AAamma yushrikoona

verses.eng: Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].
verses.arabic: ظَهَرَ الْفَسَادُ فِي الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ أَيْدِي النَّاسِ لِيُذِيقَهُم بَعْضَ الَّذِي عَمِلُوا لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Thahara alfasadu fee albarri waalbahri bima kasabat aydee annasi liyutheeqahum baAAda allathee AAamiloo laAAallahum yarjiAAoona

verses.eng: Say, [O Muhammad], 'Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were associators [of others with Allah].'
verses.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَانظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّشْرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qul seeroo fee alardi fanthuroo kayfa kana AAaqibatu allatheena min qablu kana aktharuhum mushrikeena

verses.eng: So direct your face toward the correct religion before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. That Day, they will be divided.
verses.arabic: فَأَقِمْ وَجْهَكَ لِلدِّينِ الْقَيِّمِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَ يَوْمٌ لَّا مَرَدَّ لَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۖ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصَّدَّعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faaqim wajhaka lilddeeni alqayyimi min qabli an yatiya yawmun la maradda lahu mina Allahi yawmaithin yassaddaAAoona

verses.eng: Whoever disbelieves - upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are for themselves preparing,
verses.arabic: مَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيْهِ كُفْرُهُ ۖ وَمَنْ عَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَلِأَنفُسِهِمْ يَمْهَدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Man kafara faAAalayhi kufruhu waman AAamila salihan falianfusihim yamhadoona

verses.eng: That He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.
verses.arabic: لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِن فَضْلِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Liyajziya allatheena amanoo waAAamiloo assalihati min fadlihi innahu la yuhibbu alkafireena

verses.eng: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy and so the ships may sail at His command and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.
verses.arabic: وَمِنْ آيَاتِهِ أَن يُرْسِلَ الرِّيَاحَ مُبَشِّرَاتٍ وَلِيُذِيقَكُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِهِ وَلِتَجْرِيَ الْفُلْكُ بِأَمْرِهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا مِن فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa min āyātihi an yursila r-riyāha mubashshirātin wa liyudhīqakum min raḥmatihi wa litajriya l-fulku bi-amrihi wa litabtaghū min faḍlihi wa laʿallakum tashkurūn

verses.eng: And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear evidences; then We took vengeance upon those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ رُسُلًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِمْ فَجَاءُوهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنَ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا ۖ وَكَانَ حَقًّا عَلَيْنَا نَصْرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnā min qablika rusulan ilā qawmihim fajā'ūhum bil-bayyināti fantaqamnā min alladhīna ajramū wa kāna ḥaqqan ʿalaynā naṣru l-mu'minīn

verses.eng: It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the rain emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذِي يُرْسِلُ الرِّيَاحَ فَتُثِيرُ سَحَابًا فَيَبْسُطُهُ فِي السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ يَشَاءُ وَيَجْعَلُهُ كِسَفًا فَتَرَى الْوَدْقَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ خِلَالِهِ ۖ فَإِذَا أَصَابَ بِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ إِذَا هُمْ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu alladhī yursilu r-riyāḥa fatuthīru saḥāban fayabsuṭuhu fī s-samā'i kayfa yashā'u wa yajʿaluhu kisafan fatarā l-wadqa yakhruju min khilālihi fa-idhā aṣāba bihi man yashā'u min ʿibādihi idhā hum yastabshirūn

verses.eng: Although they were, before it was sent down upon them - before that, in despair.
verses.arabic: وَإِن كَانُوا مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُنَزَّلَ عَلَيْهِم مِّن قَبْلِهِ لَمُبْلِسِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in kānū min qabli an yunazzala ʿalayhim min qablihi lamublisīn

verses.eng: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allah - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
verses.arabic: فَانظُرْ إِلَىٰ آثَارِ رَحْمَتِ اللَّهِ كَيْفَ يُحْيِي الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Fa-unẓur ilā āthāri raḥmati Llāhi kayfa yuḥyī l-arḍa baʿda mawtihā inna dhālika la-muḥyī l-mawtā wa huwa ʿalā kulli shay'in qadīr

verses.eng: But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disbelievers.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَرْسَلْنَا رِيحًا فَرَأَوْهُ مُصْفَرًّا لَّظَلُّوا مِن بَعْدِهِ يَكْفُرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la-in arsalnā rīḥan fara'awhu muṣfarran laẓallū min baʿdihi yakfurūn

verses.eng: So indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.
verses.arabic: فَإِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ الْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ الصُّمَّ الدُّعَاءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا مُدْبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-innaka lā tusmiʿu l-mawtā wa lā tusmiʿu �-ṡumma d-duʿā'a idhā wallaw mudbirīn

verses.eng: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [submitting to Allah].
verses.arabic: وَمَا أَنتَ بِهَادِ الْعُمْيِ عَن ضَلَالَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِآيَاتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa mā anta bihādi l-ʿumyi ʿan ḍalālatihim in tusmiʿu illā man yu'minu bi-āyātinā fa-hum muslimūn

verses.eng: Allah is the one who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.
verses.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُم مِّن ضَعْفٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِن بَعْدِ ضَعْفٍ قُوَّةً ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِن بَعْدِ قُوَّةٍ ضَعْفًا وَشَيْبَةً ۚ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيمُ الْقَدِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Allāhu alladhī khalaqakum min ḍaʿfin thumma jaʿala min baʿdi ḍaʿfin quwwatan thumma jaʿala min baʿdi quwwatin ḍaʿfan wa shaybatan yakhluqu mā yashā'u wa huwa l-ʿalīmu l-qadīr

verses.eng: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour. Thus they were deluded.
verses.arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ يُقْسِمُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ مَا لَبِثُوا غَيْرَ سَاعَةٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كَانُوا يُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yawma taqūmu s-sāʿatu yuqsimu l-mujrimūna mā labithū ghayra sāʿatin kadhālika kānū yu'fakūn

verses.eng: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "You remained the extent of Allah's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know."
verses.arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ وَالْإِيمَانَ لَقَدْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِي كِتَابِ اللَّهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْبَعْثِ ۖ فَهَٰذَا يَوْمُ الْبَعْثِ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qāla alladhīna ūtū l-ʿilma wa l-īmāna laqad labithtum fī kitābi Llāhi ilā yawmi l-baʿthi fa-hādhā yawmu l-baʿthi wa lākinnakum lā taʿlamūn

verses.eng: So that Day, their excuse will not benefit those who wronged, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
verses.arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يَنفَعُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مَعْذِرَتُهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-yawma'idhin lā yanfaʿu alladhīna ẓalamū maʿdhiratuhum wa lā hum yustaʿtabūn

verses.eng: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muhammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, "You [believers] are but falsifiers."
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ضَرَبْنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِي هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ ۚ وَلَئِن جِئْتَهُم بِآيَةٍ لَّيَقُولَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا مُبْطِلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ḍarabnā li-nnāsi fī hādhā l-qur'āni min kulli mathalin wa la-in ji'tahum bi-āyatin layaqūlanna alladhīna kafarū in antum illā mubṭilūn

verses.eng: Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who do not know.
verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ الَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Kadhālika yaṭbaʿu Llāhu ʿalā qulūbi alladhīna lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain [in faith].
verses.arabic: فَاصْبِرْ إِنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَخِفَّنَّكَ الَّذِينَ لَا يُوقِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fa-ṣbir inna waʿda Llāhi ḥaqqun wa lā yastakhiffannaka alladhīna lā yūqinūn

verses.eng: Alif, Lam, Meem.
verses.arabic: الٓمٓ
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lam-Meem

verses.eng: These are verses of the wise Book,
verses.arabic: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْحَكِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Tilka āyātu al-kitābi al-ḥakīm

verses.eng: As guidance and mercy for the doers of good
verses.arabic: هُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّلْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Hudan wa raḥmatan lil-muḥsinīn

verses.eng: Who establish prayer and give zakah and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].
verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yuqīmūna aṣ-ṣalāta wayu’tūna az-zakāta wahum bil-ākhirati hum yūqinūn

verses.eng: Those are upon guidance from their Lord, and it is those who will be successful.
verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَلَىٰ هُدًۭى مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.transliteration: Ulā’ika ‘alā hudan min rabbihim wa ulā’ika humul-mufliḥūn

verses.eng: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead from the way of Allah without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.
verses.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَشْتَرِى لَهْوَ ٱلْحَدِيثِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍۢ وَيَتَّخِذَهَا هُزُوًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa mina an-nāsi man yashtarī lahwa al-ḥadīthi liyuḍilla ‘an sabīli Allāhi bighayri ‘ilmin wa yattakhidhahā huzuwan, ulā’ika lahum ‘adhābun muhīn

verses.eng: And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا وَلَّىٰ مُسْتَكْبِرًۭا كَأَن لَّمْ يَسْمَعْهَا كَأَنَّ فِىٓ أُذُنَيْهِ وَقْرًۭا ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā tutlā ‘alayhi āyātunā wallā mustakbiran ka’an lam yasma‘hā ka’anna fī udhunayhi waqran, fabashshirhu bi‘adhābin alīm

verses.eng: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the Gardens of Pleasure,
verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna āmanū wa ‘amilu aṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum jannātu an-na‘īm

verses.eng: Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
verses.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقًّۭا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Khālidīna fīhā, wa‘da Allāhi ḥaqqan, wa huwa al-‘azīz al-ḥakīm

verses.eng: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.
verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍۢ تَرَوْنَهَا ۖ وَأَلْقَىٰ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَبَثَّ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ دَآبَّةٍۢ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۢ كَرِيمٍ
verses.transliteration: Khalaqa as-samāwāti bighayri ‘amadin tarawnahā wa alqā fī al-arḍi rawāsiya an tamīda bikum wa baththa fīhā min kulli dābbah, wa anzalnā min as-samā’i mā’an fa’anbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin karīm

verses.eng: This is the creation of Allah. So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.
verses.arabic: هَـٰذَا خَلْقُ ٱللَّهِ فَأَرُونِى مَاذَا خَلَقَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن دُونِهِۦ ۚ بَلِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
verses.transliteration: Hādhā khalqu Allāhi fa’arūnī mādhā khalaqa alladhīna min dūnih, bali aẓ-ẓālimūna fī ḍalālin mubīn

verses.eng: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to Allah." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا لُقْمَـٰنَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَشْكُرْ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad ātaynā Luqmāna al-ḥikmata ani ushkuru lillāh, wa man yashkur fa’innamā yashkuru linafsih, wa man kafara fa’inna Allāha ghaniyyun ḥamīd

verses.eng: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, "O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allah. Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice."
verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ لُقْمَـٰنُ لِٱبْنِهِۦ وَهُوَ يَعِظُهُۥ يَـٰبُنَىَّ لَا تُشْرِكْ بِٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلشِّرْكَ لَظُلْمٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
verses.transliteration: Wa idh qāla Luqmānu li’bnihi wa huwa ya‘iẓuhu yā bunayya lā tushrik billāh, inna ash-shirka laẓulmun ‘aẓīm

verses.eng: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.
verses.arabic: وَوَصَّيْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ حَمَلَتْهُ أُمُّهُۥ وَهْنًا عَلَىٰ وَهْنٍۢ وَفِصَـٰلُهُۥ فِى عَامَيْنِ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَيْكَ إِلَىَّ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Wa waṣṣaynā al-insāna biwālidayh, ḥamalat’hu ummuhu wahnan ‘alā wahnin wa fiṣāluhu fī ‘āmayn, ani ushkurlī wa liwālidayk, ilayya al-maṣīr

verses.eng: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
verses.arabic: وَإِن جَـٰهَدَاكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُشْرِكَ بِى مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌۭ فَلَا تُطِعْهُمَا ۖ وَصَاحِبْهُمَا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا مَعْرُوفًۭا ۖ وَٱتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ مَنْ أَنَابَ إِلَىَّ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa in jāhadāka ‘alā an tushrika bī mā laysa laka bihi ‘ilmun falā tuṭi‘humā wa ṣāḥibhumā fī ad-dunyā ma‘rūfan wattabi‘ sabīla man anāba ilayy, thumma ilayya marji‘ukum fa’unabbi’ukum bimā kuntum ta‘malūn

verses.eng: O my son, indeed if it should be the weight of a mustard seed and should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
verses.arabic: يَا بُنَيَّ إِنَّهَا إِن تَكُ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍ مِّنْ خَرْدَلٍ فَتَكُن فِي صَخْرَةٍ أَوْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ أَوْ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَأْتِ بِهَا اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَطِيفٌ خَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Yā bunayya innahā in taku mithqāla ḥabbatin min khardalin fatakun fī ṣakhratin aw fī as-samāwāti aw fī al-arḍi ya'ti bihā Allāh, inna Allāha laṭīfun khabīr

verses.eng: O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
verses.arabic: يَا بُنَيَّ أَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ وَأْمُرْ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَانْهَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا أَصَابَكَ ۖ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ الْأُمُورِ
verses.transliteration: Yā bunayya aqimi aṣ-ṣalāta wa'mur bil-maʿrūfi wanha ʿani al-munkari waṣbir ʿalā mā aṣābaka, inna dhālika min ʿazmi al-umūr

verses.eng: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.
verses.arabic: وَلَا تُصَعِّرْ خَدَّكَ لِلنَّاسِ وَلَا تَمْشِ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍ فَخُورٍ
verses.transliteration: Wa lā tuṣaʿʿir khaddaka lin-nāsi wa lā tamsi fī al-arḍi maraḥā, inna Allāha lā yuḥibbu kulla mukhtālin fakhūr

verses.eng: And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys.
verses.arabic: وَاقْصِدْ فِي مَشْيِكَ وَاغْضُضْ مِن صَوْتِكَ ۚ إِنَّ أَنكَرَ الْأَصْوَاتِ لَصَوْتُ الْحَمِيرِ
verses.transliteration: Waqṣid fī mashyika wa-ghḍuḍ min ṣawtik, inna ankara al-aṣwāti laṣawtu al-ḥamīr

verses.eng: Do you not see that Allah has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا أَنَّ اللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَأَسْبَغَ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعَمَهُ ظَاهِرَةً وَبَاطِنَةً ۗ وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يُجَادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَلَا هُدًى وَلَا كِتَابٍ مُّنِيرٍ
verses.transliteration: Alam taraw anna Allāha sakhkhara lakum mā fī as-samāwāti wa mā fī al-arḍi wa asbagha ʿalaykum niʿamahu ẓāhirah wa bāṭinah, wa min an-nāsi man yujādilu fī Allāhi bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa lā hudan wa lā kitābin munīr

verses.eng: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze?
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّبِعُوا مَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قَالُوا بَلْ نَتَّبِعُ مَا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهِ آبَاءَنَا ۚ أَوَلَوْ كَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ يَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ السَّعِيرِ
verses.transliteration: Wa idhā qīla lahumu ittabiʿū mā anzala Allāhu qālū bal nattabiʿu mā wajadnā ʿalayhi ābā'anā, a walaw kāna ash-shayṭānu yadʿūhum ilā ʿadhābi as-saʿīr

verses.eng: And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah will be the outcome of [all] matters.
verses.arabic: وَمَن يُسْلِمْ وَجْهَهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحْسِنٌ فَقَدِ اسْتَمْسَكَ بِالْعُرْوَةِ الْوُثْقَىٰ ۗ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ عَاقِبَةُ الْأُمُورِ
verses.transliteration: Wa man yuslim wajhahu ilā Allāhi wa huwa muḥsinun faqadi istamsaka bil-ʿurwati al-wuthqā, wa ilā Allāhi ʿāqibatu al-umūr

verses.eng: And whoever has disbelieved - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
verses.arabic: وَمَن كَفَرَ فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ كُفْرُهُ ۚ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ فَنُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
verses.transliteration: Wa man kafara falā yaḥzunka kufruh, ilaynā marjiʿuhum fa nunabbi'uhum bimā ʿamilū, inna Allāha ʿalīmun bi dhāti aṣ-ṣudūr

verses.eng: We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive punishment.
verses.arabic: نُمَتِّعُهُمْ قَلِيلًا ثُمَّ نَضْطَرُّهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابٍ غَلِيظٍ
verses.transliteration: Numattiʿuhum qalīlan thumma naḍṭarruhum ilā ʿadhābin ghalīẓ

verses.eng: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth?" they would surely say, "Allah." Say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah "; but most of them do not know.
verses.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa la'in sa'altahum man khalaqa as-samāwāti wal-arḍa la yaqūlunna Allāh, quli al-ḥamdu lillāh, bal aktharuhum lā yaʿlamūn

verses.eng: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
verses.arabic: لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ
verses.transliteration: Lillāhi mā fī as-samāwāti wal-arḍ, inna Allāha huwa al-ghaniyyu al-ḥamīd

verses.eng: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
verses.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ مِن شَجَرَةٍ أَقْلَامٌ وَالْبَحْرُ يَمُدُّهُ مِن بَعْدِهِ سَبْعَةُ أَبْحُرٍ مَّا نَفِدَتْ كَلِمَاتُ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.transliteration: Wa law annamā fī al-arḍi min shajaratin aqlām wa al-baḥru yamudduhu min baʿdihi sabʿatu abḥurin mā nafidat kalimātu Allāh, inna Allāha ʿazīzun ḥakīm

verses.eng: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
verses.arabic: مَّا خَلْقُكُمْ وَلَا بَعْثُكُمْ إِلَّا كَنَفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ بَصِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Mā khalqukum wa lā baʿthukum illā ka nafsin wāḥidah, inna Allāha samīʿun baṣīr

verses.eng: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that Allah, with whatever you do, is Acquainted?
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna Allāha yūliju al-layla fī an-nahāri wa yūliju an-nahāra fī al-layli wa sakhkhara ash-shamsa wa al-qamara kullun yajrī ilā ajalin musammā wa anna Allāha bimā taʿmalūna khabīr

verses.eng: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.
verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ الْبَاطِلُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْكَبِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Dhālika bi anna Allāha huwa al-ḥaqqu wa anna mā yadʿūna min dūnihi al-bāṭilu wa anna Allāha huwa al-ʿaliyyu al-kabīr

verses.eng: Do you not see that the ships sail through the sea by the favor of Allah that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ الْفُلْكَ تَجْرِي فِي الْبَحْرِ بِنِعْمَتِ اللَّهِ لِيُرِيَكُمْ مِنْ آيَاتِهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِكُلِّ صَبَّارٍ شَكُورٍ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna alfulka tajree fee albahri biniAAmati Allahi liyuriyakum min ayatihi inna fee thalika laayatin likulli sabbarin shakoorin

verses.eng: And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.
verses.arabic: وَإِذَا غَشِيَهُمْ مَوْجٌ كَالظُّلَلِ دَعَوُا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ فَلَمَّا نَجَّاهُمْ إِلَى الْبَرِّ فَمِنْهُمْ مُقْتَصِدٌ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِآيَاتِنَا إِلَّا كُلُّ خَتَّارٍ كَفُورٍ
verses.transliteration: Waitha ghashiyahum mawjun kaalththulali daAAaw Allaha mukhliseena lahu alddeena falamma najjahum ila albarri faminhum muqtasidun wama yajhadu biayatina illa kullu khattarin kafoorin

verses.eng: O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.
verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمْ وَاخْشَوْا يَوْمًا لَا يَجْزِي وَالِدٌ عَنْ وَلَدِهِ وَلَا مَوْلُودٌ هُوَ جَازٍ عَنْ وَالِدِهِ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ فَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُمْ بِاللَّهِ الْغَرُورُ
verses.transliteration: Ya ayyuha alnnasu ittaqoo rabbakum waikhshaw yawman la yajzee walidun AAan waladihi wala mawloodun huwa jazin AAan walidihi shayan inna waAAda Allahi haqqun fala taghurrannakumu alhayatu alddunya wala yaghurrannakum biAllahi algharooru

verses.eng: Indeed, Allah [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.
verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عِنْدَهُ عِلْمُ السَّاعَةِ وَيُنَزِّلُ الْغَيْثَ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِي الْأَرْحَامِ ۖ وَمَا تَدْرِي نَفْسٌ مَاذَا تَكْسِبُ غَدًا ۖ وَمَا تَدْرِي نَفْسٌ بِأَيِّ أَرْضٍ تَمُوتُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ
verses.transliteration: Inna Allaha AAindahu AAilmu alssaAAati wayunazzilu alghaytha wayaAAlamu ma fee alarhami wama tadree nafsun matha taksibu ghadan wama tadree nafsun biayyi ardin tamootu inna Allaha AAaleemun khabeerun
